reviews.review: Incredible Views with Fascinating Vegetation. This adventure was great. The views are startling from all sides and the fynbos vegetation is fascinating; all endemic plants. Intriguing rock formations got my husband's interest while I was photographing all the plants I could get to. The trails are well maintained. Highly recommended.

Views!!!. If you are lucky enough to go on a good day the views are unparalleled. Also the cable car to take you up won't work if it's too windy. So you might be able to go up but not down if weather conditions change.

Worth an early start. We left early in the morning for this trip and still had to join a huge queue. However, the hour spent queuing was soon fotgotten when we up the top in an amazing rotating cable car, which allowed everyone to get a complete view of the mountain and Capetown below it. We were very lucky in that the weather was fantastic - clear blue skies which meant that we could see for miles in every direction. About an hour after we came down, the famous tablecloth fog rolled in.

Absolutely a wonder. We could not help but sing our praises to our Lord when were at Table Mountain! The view was absolutely breathtaking, awesome, beautiful etc.. We went at about 4pm and didnt have to wait too long. Dont let any line stop you though coz the sight is worth it!Be sure to bring your coat coz it could get chilly!

WOOOW!. You have to be lucky for TABLE MOUNTAIN gondolas´ to be open, due to weather and wind conditions. We had to wait for more than 1 hour to get on the gondola to get up but, when up, it as TOTALLY WORTH IT, views are really amazing!! Be sure to take a jacket with you up, as wind can be really tough and cold up there. A MUST in Cape Town!
Must do in Cape Town. We climbed table mountain via Platteklip Gorge and then came down in the cable car. It was a great half day excursion. Amazing views from the top.

Loved it!. My plan was to use the cable car since I had read may warnings that it's dangerous for a solo traveller to climb the mountain, but the car was not closed on that day (and I was told that the forecast was not really promising), so after consulting an employee of the park, I decided to hike up the mountain. I hiked the Platteklip gorge track, and there were many other hikers, so I was not really solo :) I was lucky with the weather - the mountain had no cloth on that day, so the views were spectacular. Unfortunately, the hut was closed, so if you hike the mountain, check this and take enough water & snack with you.I also visited the botanical garden - on a nice, warm, sunny Sunday. It's a great spot to spend a day off.
Fab place to visit. We were visiting the gardens and decided to have lunch.waiter was v helpful in recommending dishes.very good value

Amazing views. Unfortunately when we visited the cable car was closed for repairs but we took the hop on hop off bus that drops you off high enough to get views around the area .Excellent views and great photo oppotunities.
You have to come here once in your life. Yes there are queues but what a view. Spectacular views on a clear day and there are refreshments and loos at the top

It's definitely a must do/see. We started at Kloof Corner and hiked the Platteklip gorge track. Make sure you are well trained or just take your time. Also make sure you have enough water with you on hot days. It cost me blood, sweat and tears but the view on top is amazing! If you want you van go up first with the cable car and then go down or you can go up and go down with the cable car :) A must do/see when you are in Capetown!

Lifetime Memory. There is a reason Table Mountain was name one of the 7 wonders of the Natural World. A must for anyone who travels to SA. Depending on what time of the year you go it could be very cold and windy so dress accordingly.

Nothing like this mountain anywhere else in SA!!. I live in Cape Town and I never get tired of going up our beautiful Table Mountain. If you are looking for something to do in Cape Town then a visit to this majestic mountain is a must! You will look hard to find such stunning views anywhere else. If you catch a Red bus at the Waterfront this will take you on a great tour through the city and will stop at the ticket counter at Table Mountain and you can then catch the bus back to the Waterfront (not sure of timetable). The views from the top of the mountain are simply amazing and you will see all the way to Robben Island as well as the southern suburbs in the other direction. You can take a scenic walk around the top as it has a few trails. There is a restaurant on top where you can get something to eat and drink. At certain times of the year you can go up the mountain after 6pm and you get tickets at half price. I do recommend you check the website for dates. It can get chilly up the mountain even if its a hot day so make sure you take something warm to wear.
Absolutely beautiful views in good weather. Sadly the queuing system is absolutely horrific and you cannot prebook a time. If you are limited to time in the area it can throw you plans completely.

Dylan's birthday up Table mountain. We had a wonderful time exploring Table mountain :) Table mountain have kindly offer all citizens to go up the cable car on their birthday for free, so we decided to take the offer and what an amazing adventure we had.The cable car was awesome the way it revolves, showing off the mother city of Cape Town, lion's head. Walking along the paths were clear and easy to stroll while taking photographs of our magical Mountain. The carrrot cake, hot chocolate and coffee were delicious at the Mountain cafe. The Dussies were very friendly animals and natural posers in-front of the camera. Thank you for a fun day out Table Mountain

Table Mountain . I took the sightseeing bus tours to visit the Table Mountain and I must say I had such an amazing experience. Once you get on top (by aerial cable ban) you have some spectacular views to Cape Town. You can even see the Robben Island. When nice weather you can stay on top for hours as there is a lot to be seen while walking around.
Awesome. Well worth the trip up. Cable car give fantastic 360 views. The staff are so helpful. And it's fairly priced aswell for what you get to see.

Restaurant. We had the worst experience at the restaurant. It was a chilly day and thought that coffee & hot chocolate would be perfect. After tasting both, it was like drinking warm water. No smell or taste of filter coffee. I took it back and told them. I was told they can replace it but it will taste the same. But I have to pay for it. R30 for cup of coffee. There's nothing they can do. Macdonalds coffee is way better than theirs.Maybe they should open a MacCafe. This is Table Mountain Restaurant, of which 90% of visitors are foreigners.They should have much better service.I won't go there again. Table Mountain itself is beautiful. Especially the hikes.

ITS CHILLY UP HERE. Its a must....though cannot relate why so much talk of this place...its just another gr8 mtn top with a view...but in cape town its a must...TAKE the red bust red route....it has a stop right at the ticket counter....
Over the sky. This should by on the list - thing´s to do before you die .. It is a amazing view and a perfect activity.

Mind blowing experience. It is a huge area covering the Table Mountain, Lion Head, 12 Apostles and such places... We could see enthusiastic people trekking all the way up to the mountain.We took the Cable car instead.... the mountain top is quite windly and chill.....has lots of spaces to move around.....has a coffee/beer restaurant........ take whatever you want and they bill at the counter.......nice place for a romantic time.
Trek up the mountain. A great experience. Recommend going up like this. Views are fantastic. Lovely day. We had a great guide who made it more fun.

Beautiful. Although we went in a very cold and foggy day, we had an amazing time with hot chocolate and those little animals (I don't remember they're names right now). This is the great "must-go" in Cape Town.

Must Do!. What an amazing peaceful place to see. If you are in Capetown you must go up the mountain. Even though there was lots of people when we went it was not crowded ( except at cable car line). We were there at sunset and it was beautiful to see.

Highlight of our Visit to Cape Town. Wow. The views are spectacular. We took the aerial cableway to the top. Purchased and printed the tickets the night before from Table Mountain web tickets. This shortened (only about 45 minutes) our wait to get on the car. Hiked on the top for about 1 1/2 hours. Lots of great pictures of city and the coast line on a perfect weather day. Lots of people but it is such a large area it did not seem crowded while hiking. Be sure also to look at the Dassies sunning themselves on the rocky ledges! Our highlight of Cape Town!

must see. When you are in Cape Town, you simply must visit Table Mountain. It is one of the things that makes Cape Town unique. Try to visit on a sunny, clear day. You will be rewarded with stunning views.

Short visit to table mountain. Booked a full day city tour of cape town through viator before we left UK. Don't bother! We only had 15 minutes tops at the summit not nearly long enough. You can arrange all of this yourself by taking the open top bus tours which allow you more than enough time to do everything. Stunning views of the city from all parts of the mountain, it's a must do. Cloud comes and goes and is very chilly up there, take something warm

nice to walk at table mountain. it´s a nice place to visite the view is one of the best when your on the top of the mountain, there is small shops in there for you to buy some staffs to remain you of the trip

Table Mountain National Park. A walk or ride up Table Mountain is a must. On a clear day the views are breathtaking, the sunsets spellbinding and the variety of Fynbos is really pretty.The birds and dassies are particularly charming too.

Stunning views from natural surroundings. Hiking in this beautiful environment situated on top of one of the most scenic mountains in the world is unmatched. Stunning Fynbos abounds here. Discover the now defunct dams that once supplied water to Cape Town and the surrounding areas.

Stunning experience with my nice. We had a great experience with my 12 year old nice from the US hiking Plattekloof Gorge -- the magnificent views/ Flaura and Fauna is just breath taking - and you have an amazing feeling of achievement making it all the way to the top -- an experience all of us will never forget.Tip - use the cable car for the way down.

i felt like i am on top of the world. Your get to see the view of the beauty of Cape Town. Very refreshing indeed . If you want to see the view of the City , you have to visit the table mountain , Amazing place to be
Great view. A great spot to see the world, take the short route as you will see the beast bits anyway. It has a good café with lots of variety.Try and pick a day without fog

On a clear day... The reason for taking the cable car. Well planned areas to walk, either hard ground, or wooden board walks. The natural flora and fauna along with the information boards provide a fascinating study of the mountain and all that lived and now live upon it. It provides inside to man's impact in this world , some species are unique to the mountain. Sit quietly enough and you will spot the rock hyrax ( dassie), nibbling on greenery, and cheeky birds looking for a bite. The coffee shop and souvenir shop provide the chance to buy local goods and boost economy. There is a wi fi cafe but this was closed due to industrial action the day we visited.

Fall inlove. An amazing experience for the whole family. Going there again end of October and have great deals for birthdays. There is a restaurant ontop and you can also take your own picnic basket along to chill and relax at the top. Great view for relaxing and sipping on that red wine. Even a perfect engagement area!!

Stunning visas and glorious flowers.. Despite booking a cable car ticket online we had to queue for approximately 1.5 hours. Thankfully on the return journey it was only 40 minutes as it was chilly queuing in the mountain top breeze. The revolving cable car let everyone have a great view on the way up and down. It was all worth while when we walked around the plateau. Stunning vistas, glorious fynbos in flower were everywhere we looked. Paths were uneven and steep in places depending on your route taken. This was certainly a highlight in our South African holiday and we'd recommend it, though doing a little homework beforehand such as prebooking cable car tickets, checking the weather, correct clothing and footwear made our special Table Mountain day positively memorable.

Breathtaking!!. Visiting this national park was one of the highlights on our trip to the cape and west coast. The most spectecular scenes of nature. Takes your breath away. The fauna and flora is also so very special. Lots of birds.

one of the most beautiful places in the world. You have to go and see for yourself! on a clear day, there is no better place to be in: walk, run, jog, mountain bike, or just sit and enjoy the beautiful mountain and views of sea all around. A ride up and down the cable car requires no effort but you can also walk up the mountain using numerous routes. There are numerous hikes and walks suitable to all levels of fitness that can take you to a spot where there will be not many people around you, so you can just enjoy and take in the ambience.
Awesome and breath taking . Countless indigenous flora species, hiking trails and breath taking views from multiple locations this wonderous natural marvel.
Breath Taking. Words cant describe the scenery by the table mountain. Ohhh it is just superb and you see the whole of Capetown from up there!!!!
Great walk on top. You can have a great walk on top of the Table Mountain. It has a great view of Cape Town. Although I liked the Lion's head a bit more which is next to it.

Beautiful Table Mountain National Park. For walkers no visit to Cape Town is complete without visiting Table Mountain National Park. It is very important to be prepared and to let someone know where you are going in advance.as with any mountain range unexpected weather conditions can occur. Take water.sunblock.a hat and a warm garment. The obvious start to a walk on TMNP is from the Cableway road and one can either ascend the mountain via the cableway or climb Platteklip Gorge to the top. The climb starts further along the road from the cablestation and is signposted. It is a spectacular climb with wonderful views across the city and across the water to Robben Island. If you decide to go up the mountain by cable car there is a beautiful and varied walk for hikers from the top via Maclears Beacon to Kirstenbosch. It is approximately 12 kms and the views of the entire Peninsula are spectacular. Good boots are advisable. Maps of trails on Table Mountain are available at all book stores in Cape Town and it is advisable to obtain one as it is easy to take a wrong path. The mountain is beautiful and wild and in Spring the flowers are especially beautiful. It is possible to walk from Constantia Nek and further. There are many trails and one can walk to Cape Point in the Park.Enjoy the Mountain it is one of the Worlds special places.

Hiked up Platterklip Gourge. From downtown Capetown we caught the #107 bus getting off at the top of Kloofneck rd. Crossing the road we caught the FREE bus#110 to the Table Mtn. lower cable-way house.NOTE: you can only take a bus(other than the free one) with a MyCity bus card bought in grocery stores(R30) and then maybe loaded with R30. The bus cost us R16-20 return and quite a few tourists could not get the bus for lack of a card. Bus # 110 dropped us off at the cable way station and we walked down the road 1-11/2 kms to the start of the Platterklip Gourge hike. (big sign post, dont take the smaller one that you come to first) If you are young you could make it to the summit in just over a hr. It took us 2hrs to get to the summit.Even if you aren't a avid hiker as I am you can hike up there by taking it easy and drinking a lot of water.The hike is somewhat strenuous(sore thighs from high steps) but a wonderful accomplishment. You can of course take the cable car up and down. It took us 11/2 hrs to get down.

Wow. I suggested to my wife before we went to Cape Town that we should climb Table Mountain. She thought I was crazy! Well we booked and met at the lower cable car at 06:30 on 4 October. We met up with others in the group and started walking. The first bit was strenuous as it was quite steep but after a few stops to catch your breath we headed up. When it came to the rocks there were some challenging parts especially the vertical stages where there were handles glued into the rock face. After many stops to photograph the splendid scenery and catch your breath we started to go around towards the back of the mountain. The last stretch to the top was quite tiring but we made it. It was a truly wonderful experience and my wife wants to do it again next year! After taking in the view we took the cable car down and watched others hiking up the mountain.

Battery A & B. Staying in Cape Town for more than 40 years and never knew about sites Battery A & B. A real gem hidden between big trees. The old defence force equipment give it even more value as a hidden treasure.
Amazing views of Cape Town. Must see and get on Table Mountain for beautiful views of Capetown and the horizon. You can get there by cable car or simply climb up (that takes good 2 hours)

Beautiful hike - breathtaking views!. My husband and I hiked up the mountain and took the cable car back down. The trail was more difficult than we had expected, but so worth it! We were here in July and there were many other people hiking, but not overly crowded. You had amazing views of the city along the hike up. And then the views at the top are just outstanding - gorgeous mountains all along the ocean. There is a great cafe at the top - serving food, hot beverages, beer, and wine. Being there in winter, it was certainly freezing at the top! Bring gloves!!! The weather changes quite a bit as you hike up, so be ready with layers. We started with short sleeve t-shirts and pants, then added on sweatshirts and down vest as we continued up. We took the cable car down which was a cool experience, but it made us very happy (and proud!) to have hiked it on the way up.
Amazing views!. Cool and windy but a fun experience going up on the tram and walking around to look at the view. We got great shots of Robbin Island.
A SIGHT TO SEE. Beautiful views of Cape Town and the harbour this is why it is one of the 7 wonders of the world.The shop at the top is reasonably priced.

Spend a day - walk up it and cable car down. We chose to forget other plans when we realised that there was going to be a beautiful day for climbing the mountain. We took the Platteklip Gorge Hike, a 15 minute walk from where the tourist bus drops you at the cable car station. The hike is quite difficult - it is a bit of a scramble up rock steps, some of which were bigger than my short legs would allow! The journey up took about two hours, depending on your fitness. There is then an hours walk to the true top of the mountain, which is a much more leisurely walk, and an hour back to the cable car station. The restaurant at the top was very busy, but gave us the water and ice cream we needed by that point! Most people cable car it up and down, but where is the challenge in that?! Don't fall for it, it is much more rewarding to climb up, cheaper and helps to work off all the brilliant South African food!

Overwhelming natural beauty. This is a spectacular and very special place to visit. We went in the morning to get the best views whewe were at the top and were speechless at the extent of the mountain range and coastal views at the top. We saw a few small brown animals who were very tame and curious. The view of the 12 apostles and Lions head was magnificent. It was very clean and the routes easy to follow.

Amazing viewa. Amazing views from beautiful lookouts. Many different views from the ocean to Capetown. Cable car was fine, but wish we would have had the time to hike up. We watched others do it, and it looked like a much more adventurous way to reach the top.

Table Mtn.. Table Mtn, is one of the 7 wonders of the World. A cable car takes you up, and the car revolves to give a 360 degree view. The view down is quite spectacular. You can't miss it if in Cape Town.
Fabulous views!. It's iconic so you have to do it but the views on a the sunny day we went, were just spectacular. The Portuguese missed a trick!
Loved Table Mountain!. Really enjoyed going to table mountain that hike was really fun and the views are simply beautiful and breathtaking!Will definitely visit again!

lovely views, plants and well laid out walks. Must go to destination every time in Cape Town. Make sure you pre book tickets or queues are long. Also make sure you take something warm with you to wear. It can get very cold up there regardless of the weather at the bottom. Plenty of parking but check not one of the free days for children which can be a nightmare for parking and queues.iconic visit.

Climbed up, cable car down!. Thinking of climbing? - I really recommend this! If this helps click 'like' to say so! Don't pay for an expensive tour to show you to the top, there are many routes where you will be with other walkers. First tip, if the weathers good take water, you will be grateful for it, if the weather looks like it's going to close in - don't climb, when the cloud 'tablecloth' descends on the mountain there is no view and climbing would be difficult. We decided to climb the mountain as it was a lovely sunny day and this started from Kloof Corner, above the bend in the road a few hundred metres before the cable car. As usual there will be 'parking attendants' here that claim to help park you and look after your car in exchange for a few rand. From the Kloof sign, follow the path up for perhaps 30 minutes until you get to the corner where the path goes left. You follow this horizontally in the main, past the path up from the cable car and further than you think you should be going - maybe 30 minutes (there are few signs!!). You will finally meet the route up from Plattekip gorge where there will be many more climbers/walkers and from that point it's perhaps another 1 hour-11/2 hours depending on how fit you are as it gets more challenging. It's a good mornings work out and an achievement well worthwhile when you get to the top for the truly wonderful views of Cape Town and the surrounding areas.. I would suggest you don't choose to cable car up and walk down unless you are used to Snowdon etc as I think it's more difficult this way, especially negotiating climbers - we did see some people doing so that really shouldn't have started. At the top there is a café, 100+ photo opportunities and you can buy a ticket for the cable car down which is slightly quicker at around 5 minutes...the only cable car I have been on that rotates as it moves to give everyone the same views! The one way trip was around £7.50 each and there can be a queue to board, especially at the weekends, took us around 30 mins. Enjoy!

Cape Town from high. Although it was a 30+ minute wait, the views from the top of Table Mountain are worth it. It is suggested buying the cable car tickets prior to going to the cable car station at the bottom of the hill. We save 30 minutes as we only had one queue to endure. We were fortunate at the clouds were minimal, offering grand views in all directions.

A must visit in Cape Town. Be sure to buy your ticket online so that you won't have queue. The view is amazing, it’s a must see attraction in Cape Town! Just be sure it’s not foggy when you get up there. There is a restaurant and a souvenir shop too.

One of the best hikes of my life!!!. What a fantastic Hike and Views as far as the eye can see! I loved Table mountain we did one of the longer hikes, starting at the back side of the mountain and finishing at the Cable car which makes a nice finish to the hike.

Absolutely stunning! A highlight of our visit.. Coming from Scotland we are used to beautiful scenery but wow! This did not disappoint! Wear some good strong shoes, take plenty of water, some sunscreen and a hat and go and explore this beautiful national park. The wild flowers (fynbos) are absolutely beautiful and the dassies are cute little creatures. The panoramic views are stunning! Go and enjoy!

Loved it. Loved the view. Very professional and helpful staff. Parking good
Restaurants on the top good value for money and the shops good products. Very safe and poeple all love the view

Big WOW in a sunny day . We were lucky enough to visit this beautiful location in a great day with top excellent view of Cape Town and around. Park and take the bus to the lower station of the cable car. Book online for tickets and prevent the long line. Tour around and enjoy. Eat in the beach.. Not at the restaurant of the table mountain.

Fab day out. Table mountain is a must when in Cape Town. We went in the afternoon and fortunately it wasn't too busy. Be prepared to queue for the cable car both going up and coming down. There are several different walks you can do at the top depending on mobility and cafes etc. Don't be deceived by the warm weather at the bottom it gets cold and windy at the top so take a jacket.
Stunning view. If you are on your lucky day and its not cloudy, you will have a chance to see the breathtaking view of Cape Town from above. Also the little trip with the cable car to go up is fun.
Spectacular . The place is amazing and worth a visit.The park is full of greenery.The lush green environment makes you feel so soothing and calm.

Fantastic place but check the weather. Went up here with a guide from Ridgway Ramblers, well worth paying for that as the paths aren't always clear. It was a flog up there but great views all along, quite a few birds, plants and creatures to see and amazing all round views from the top. be prepared to walk back down if cable car is not running
The views are amazing!. This is a must do when in Cape Town. You can walk around at the top to see some spectacular views. Get here as early as you can to avoid the longer lines. We arrived at 8am.

Fantastic views. Took one of the first cable cars up on a Sunday morning. A little cloudy going up and then on top the clouds cleared and we had stunning vistas. Saw dussie rodent-looking animals. A couple of decent gifts shops up top. Easy to walk around the top. Love the idea of the cable cars turning as you ride up and down.
Best mountain hike. Especially at this time of year (springtime September /October) the wild flowers and the fynbos are at their best.. wonderful views of Cape Town too...

Nice view but clody weather...uu. i went to table mountain twice
but when i went to there always bad weather....
but top of mountain is really gorgeous.
if i have a enough time , i`ll trekking again.

One of then gems of the City but approach with caution. The Mountain threads through Cape Town from Cape Point (southernmost end) to Table Mountain (above the city) and around to Twelve Apostles (above Camps Bay and Llandudno). Most of the Table Mountain is a national park controlled and operated by Sanparks. Views from almost anywhere are superb, but pick your way up carefully. There are many points of access into the park and onto the mountain but I will give you some of my favourites. Easiest of all is the cableway. For a long easy walk start at Constantia Nek, From Kirtsenbosch there is one of the toughest walks up Skeleton Gorge, but you can also keep it easy by traversing left or right on the Contour Path. From Silvermine above Tokai there are shortish walks that dont involve much climbing. I will cover Cape Point National Park separately Now the caveats. Sanparks mandate, to the fury of Cape Town residents, is to eradicate aliens. Most alien deer have been culled, what use to be lovely shady walks under pines or gumtrees have been destroyed. There are virtually no animals to be seen in the park (the ones that are left are small, hard to spot and nocturnal). Sure there are quite a few birds but mostly all there is to see in this 'national park" is fynbos, medium size bushes that only flower for a short period and then not too spectacularly. My point here - go the Park for the view in it and from it and not for fauna and flaura.And be warned, there are muggers on the mountain.

Tough getting to the top! . Do not be boring and take a cable car to the top. Hiking up table mountain is the most rewarding way to do it. Bring water and sunscreen and stretch a bit because although some websites say this Skeleton Gorge hike is easy it's pretty tough! It's almost a direct ascent for the first few hundred meters up before it gets a bit more flat and winding. You also have to watch your step a bit as the rocks and stones are quite slippery. Took us 3 hours to get up there so on our way down mid afternoon we saw people coming up in jeans and trendy clothes thinking you're in for a tough afternoon as well as how the hell are you getting down! Up there the views are absolutely fantastic. Complete panoramic views and quite a bit of freedom to walk around on the top of the mountain. There's also a restaurant up there to eat and chill out while you rest your legs and prepare for the descent down.

stunning views. with plenty of of walking trails, bike trails there is so much to do, from short easy walks to serious hikes and mountain climbing, either of the latter you should be prepared for all sorts of weather, and consult a local hiking guide.

A MUST SEE if you're in Cape Town. If you're anywhere near Cape Town you can't miss the views of Table Mountain. Don't miss the opportunity to go to the top and enjoy the breathtaking views. Incredible!
Great Hike. If your fit enough do this mountain on foot its a great experience. The round trip took abut 5 hours (that's allowing for an hour at the top.The views are amazing
Sunset. Stunning! And worth the cold wind that came from the sea. Has been a while seeing the sun going down there.

If you are short on time drive up to Lion's head for similar views!. Lovely views from the Table mountain, but after driving to Cape Point which has absolutely stunning views, we wished we did not waist so much time, even with pre-booked tickets, on Table Mountain. The views, as lovely as they were, did not justify 1/2 a day. By mistake, before driving up to Table Mountain, we drove to Lion's head - stunning views with no crowds, and a view of the table mountain to boot!

A beautiful walking area with many great views. It as a windy day like so many in Cape Town but thee views were beautiful and the walking excellent and bracing. There were lots of different Baronias and other wild flowers. There were deep ravines and a flat walking area. A good gift shop with reasonable priced gifts. There are walking paths.

Fantastic day out amazing views amazing experience . We were so lucky to have beautiful clear day so we had an amazing time courtesy of George Skaris and his Harley ToursAmazing scenery great climb to the top of cape point fantastic wildlife Ostrich baboons etc we had a great timeGreat value for money fantastic scenery would definitely go again

Amazing views of Cape Town and Peninsula. A must see in Cape Town. There are easy to walk trails at the top that enable you to see in all directions. Fabulous views of Cape Town, the western sea coast and south to the Cape Peninsula.

a 'must see' when you visit Cape Town. The National parl is extensive but a wonderful place to visit. Obviously the wether plays a great part in your level of enjoyment but just wait until the clouds clear and you can visit a wonder of the world.

A amazing experience. I went with my wife and two friends by taxi to the bottom of the mountain. I loved this hike. From the begin to the top, you have many opportunities to take wonderful pictures of the city. We took 1 hour and45 minutes to go up because we stopped many times to take pictures. You just need to know where to start hiking and after that just go up. You do not need to worry about getting lost (It depends on the route that you chose to hike), the way is easy, but very challenging. In the top, there are a lot of trails where you can spend many hours. Also because it is a touristic place, there are restaurants, souvenir shops and more. I do not have words to describe this experience, you need to see with your own eyes. I highly recommend this.
Loved Table Mountain. Spectacular views!!!! The area on top the mountain was a lot bigger than we thought. We spent 4 hrs walking around up there!
Spectacular . I visited in early September, weather was chilly up the mountain. Warm clothing recommended. The view of the city is just fabulous.
Travel to the clouds. This is a must see if you are in Cape Town. Although we went in February, we had to go to the table again.

Spectacular. Went up our first afternoon in town because it was sunny and weather can change quickly in C.T. Fabulous views of the city both at daytime and at sunset when all the lights are coming on.

wonderful. Excellent views over Capetown, fast efficient cablecar.Amust on a visit to Capetown. The weather wasn'tgreat but we were lucky enough to have some breaks in the cloud to reveal the panoramic viws.

A must do in Cape Town. The views are spectacular and you could spend many hours exploring. It is even good when the clouds role in as you could almost be on the english moors. Dont leave CT without going
Top of the world. Went in July while the cable cars are in maintenance so we hike our way up, it was a lovely hike but was very cold and windy when we got up there, well worth it!

Enchanted by the power of nature. I got up to Table Mountain and after having a walk around, I couldn't help myself from sitting down and admire the wonderful view. Climb some rocks on the Southern side of the park, sit down and enjoy the silence of nature, the sunshine and the colours of this beautiful country. Top experience.

This Place Will Take Your Breath Away. To simply state the views here are awesome doesn't even begin to justify what they really are. When you can literally see for miles on end, how can that be explained in a few words? It can't - just visit and see it for yourself.
MUST SEE. Amazing .... a must see on your holiday. The cableway is efficient and the views awesome. I loved the little souvenir shop at the top of the mountain

Not to be missed. Visiting Table Mountain is a must-do in Cape Town. The views (assuming you are on top on a clear day) are wonderful. There are also free 30 minutes guided walks on the top that offer a nice orientation and worth the short time. You have many options to visit the summit. There is an aerial tramway (if you choose this - book online to avoid incredibly long lines), or you can hike up (a guide is strongly recommended) and the climb is tough. You also need to plan related to the weather. We visited on a clear sunny day but several of our days in Cape Town were cloudy enough that the entire mountain was fogged in so plan as best you can.

Hiked up - loved it!. We hiked up Table Mountain twice during our stay. We first did the Platteklip Gorge which goes along the contour of the mountain before going up a steep "staircase" winding up the gorge. We did the India Venter hike the second time which is a much harder route and comes with warning signs at the bottom! It involves climbing up steep rock faces with no assistance and using handles and chains in certain places. After the hikes we enjoyed coffee in the cafe before cable car down. Cannot recommend this more!

Beautiful!!!. Going to table mountain was so worth it even though it was windy and cloudy. Once the clouds opened up you get a breathtaking view of Capetown. The site itself was great, we had a drink at the top.

A beautiful few hours. The cable car up is a little crowded but the driver is very entertaining. A short journey takes you to the summit. Most people stand in the same area and take photographs. I would suggest walking further and suddenly it seems that you have the mountain to yourself. There are little creatures called a Dassie which roam the area. They are very tame and very sweet. There is a bar and cafe and the best part is sitting with a bottle of wine and watching the sun go down.

Nice place for the whole family. - We spend one morning in the mountain. The line was very long even though we bought tickets in the web site before it still took us more than 1 hour to get up. If you come in the afternoon it probably be less crowded.

This is a Must Do. We were supposed to go up on the Saturday but the clouds and the wind meant it was closed. Luckily we had an open ticket and were able to get up on the Sunday. The queuing took an hour but it was worth it as the views were amazing and the ride up in the cable car was fun but short as it only last a few minutes.. There are good paths all round and you can explore and see different sides of Cape Town. There is a good café serving good food. If you can get up there do it, it is easy access for all.
Spectacular Views. If you are in Cape Town, you must go to Table mountain. You get panoramic views of Cape town and the ocean. It is breathtakingly beautiful!

Go up when the sky is clear. On the day we travelled up in cable, the clouds just begin to cover the mountain, hence, we could not see the city from above. It was cold and misty but we had a walk around the place. The trip up in cable was exciting and the staff very friendly.

A Awsome experience not to be missed in Cape Town. This is an experience NOT to be missed when visiting Cape Town - The View and nature is awesome and mind-blowing.You can either take the cable car up and down (Book Ticket in advance and expect a que to get onboard) or you can hike up and take the cable car down bot that requires good physics, water and a bit of preparation - The take the cable car down. You can even absail down fromt he clip if you want a shot of adrenaline.
A must see. My memory bank is full after seeing this magnificent aura that abounds us. All kinds of flora and fauna highlight the way to see where the oceans meet. I am so blessed to have been there.
Incredible!!!. Had an awesome time on the mountain! You could see for miles and miles. This is definitely a must-do for people coming to Cape Town.

Awesome. Do not miss this.We didn`t know what to expect.We thought maybe you got the cable car to the top,had a quick walk around a football pitch sized area,took a few photo`s then came down.Oh how we were wrong.The cable car ride is really quick and once at the top there is a vast area to walk around with truly stunning views.There is a good quality restaurant up top with lovely well priced food and a curio shop.Please wear suitable footwear like trainers and sunscreen as although breezy ideal for sunburn.If you are lucky you may also spot Dassie`s which are Rabbit like creatures that live on the mountain and are really cute.Try and make sure the weather is in your favour as on a misty day views will be restricted.The queues for the cable car can be quite lengthy especially in the mornings but we only waited 1 hour which I thought reasonable,plus we had bought tickets in advance.
A must see!. If you are in Capetown please do get over to Table Mountain and take the cable up to the top. Beautiful scenery and a nice experience that can be done easily.

Great Day at Table Mountain. Have been visiting South Africa for over 20 years and this was probably the best visit to Table Mountain we ever had. One of the best day on all counts. This is a must visit place and one must visit this on the first opportunity you get after reaching Cape Town because of unpredictable weather in Cape Town.

Magnificent. This is a must if you visit Cape Town!! The views are awesome and the cable car rotates as you ascend up the mountain. You can see Cape Town but also much of the coast and the towns around Cape Town!!

Stunning !!. Can't describe the amazing views , its a really must see place , a wonder place , each place you walk you will find amazing breathtaking views over the clouds and panoramic views for cape town A must seeTotally worth itThere is a nice restaurant and a souvenir shop there

Spectacular!. This was a priority on our 'things to do' list, especially since my OH had been 3 times before and the cableway had always been closed due to bad weather!The previous 2 days to our visit had also been bad, with high winds, but luckily for us the sun was shining on our first morning in Cape Town, so we headed up there to make the most of it.First tip - don't try and drive up the hill and hope to find a place to park; it was virtually gridlocked when we attempted to do this, so we turned around and parked for free on the car park at the bottom of the hill. From there, we caught the shuttle bus (also free) up to the cable station. There are toilets here too (also free!)Second tip - book tickets online before you go. This saves time.As it was such a nice day (and it had been closed the previous 2 days), the queues were horrendous. Two lines were formed; one line was for people who had bought tickets online, these seemed to get priority to join the queue for the cable car.the second line was for the ticket office and was at least 3 times longer than the other queue.Third tip - don't rush to get a spot by the open window in the cable car. Once the car sets off, the floor revolves so everybody gets a panoramic view.At the top, we were rewarded with the most spectacular views, right across the Cape. Absolutely breath-taking and well worth the hours we'd had to queue.
Spectacular. The most majestic place in the world! Travel on the rail car to the top of the mountain- the floor spins so you get a panoramic view of the city.

A Must Visit Attraction. Table Mountain in Capetown is a 'must' place to visit when the weather is good. It is one of the Seven Wonders of the World. There are three 'walks' up (one does require some climbing experience) so it is essential that you choose the one that matches your ability. You you have difficulty with walking then take the less energetic way up by means of the cable car! Do note that the cable car option is very popular and can mean that you have up to a two hour wait in a queue (this does depend when you go) before you reach the cable car. We decided to climb our way up to the top by climbing the Platteklip Gorge route. The route is 1.5 km long and rises approx 650 m. The average time to the top is around 2 hours, but the climb is strenuous if you aren't fit. Make sure that you take plenty of water with you, a sunhat and a camera. When you reach the top, the effort in getting there is well worth it! The views are amazing and when the weather is good you can see for miles. Robben Island (Nelson Mandela spent 18 years in captivity there) is clearly visible. Should you wish to visit the island you can do this as one of the options on the Red Bus Tourist routes.There is a cafe and tourist shop at the top where you can buy your mementos of your visit.

Excellent day hike. We had an excellent day. We started at Kirstenbosch botanical gardens (small admission required). From there we climbed to the back side of table mountain. Once one top it is an easy walk (1 hour, with good visibility easy to navigate) to the ropeway or the point where you can go down on foot yourself (which we did). Including the great stops for viewpoints and lunch this took us 7hours.Note that when you go up from Kirstenbosch you pass Skeleton gorge. On this hikepath, you need to climb over rocks, and use ladders. Mountain gear is not required. What you need are proper walking shoes, ok physical condition and common sence. Not recommended when it rains.
Breathtaking. Table Mountain was absolutely beautiful. We had a nice clear day and we just loved it. Taking it all in was wonderful. Worth the trip!

One of the most beautiful places in the world.. Hiked up Skeleton Gorge from Kristenbocsh Botanical Garden. Great hike, challenging, and rewarding. The views from the top of Table Mountain are so beautiful!

Unforgettable. This is one of the most magnificent places I have ever seen. I was lucky and it was a beautiful day, not at all busy, so I enjoyed walking around for hours, taking pictures and enjoying the stunning views.TM is definitely a must see!
Quite simply a must see. Impossible to describe other than breathtaking, simply a must see. Book your ticket in advance if you can, cuts down waiting time quite dramatically

a MUST see in Cape Town!. The mountain looks beautiful from anywhere in Cape Town but actually being on the top of the mountain is amazing! We took a hop on/hop off bus to the bottom of Table Mountain and was able to wait in line maybe 5 minutes to get a ticket for the cable car. After only a 10-15 minute wait we were at the top! (The base of the cable car rotates so everyone will get a great view on the way up/down!).There is a really nice restaurant at the top - we headed there first to get a bottle of wine to share while enjoying the views! We saw plenty of flowers and small wildlife! The trails/walkways are flat and very easy to navigate while there are also much larger routes to take as well. I would allow at least 2 hours up there at a minimum! While the place was very open for young children, there are not railings or anything to keep children away from the edge of the cliffs.

Great view at sunset. Table mountain is a must do in Cape town. The view at the top of mountain is unique. To have a great experience, it depends a lot on the weather which changes a lot in Cape town. I went there at sunset and it was great. At one side of the mountain, you see the sunset and at the other it is possible to see the city at night. This was totally cool. There are some pathways which you can go and look at very beautiful landscapes.
The view over Cape Town. For sure is the place to go if you want to have the perfect overview for Cape Town, it´s simply perfect.
Great views. Be sure to go.It was windy but worth the effort standing in line . It opened at 8:30 am. Try to go early. The cable car to get to the top is great.

Buy ticket online. Fantastic views but huge queues remember to book ticket online before you arrive at cable car station then you will not have to queue as long. We went on a Sunday an hour up with a ticket and at least half an hour back down.

Great at sunny day!. We were lucky (we visited Table Mountain at sunny day) and we were unlucky (we visited Mountain at Sunday). We waited for cableway up at about 2 hours and down at about 1 hour and we parked our car more than 1 km from cableway. Overcrauded was everthing. But view out of top down to Cape Town and surrounding and watchig to sunset - great. So he best time to visit thi "must to see" attraction could be working sunny day afternoon.
Absolutely Breathtaking Place. This was just lovely to visit with stunning views that help you get a perspective for Cape Town too.A definite if visiting CPT

Table Mountain. A flat top mountain forming a prominent landmark flanked by Devil,s peak and the Lion overlooking Cape Town. If you don,t manage to Park or want to wait for the wait don,t be disappointed there are plenty of other landmarks you can drive up to in the surrounding area that you can get a view of Cape Town and the surrounding area of. If you want to you can take a bus there or can park. If you want to you can walk to the top I haven,t done this but heard its take about 3 hrs to the top or if you want to walk one direction either way you can get a one way travel on the cable car. Don,t be disappointed if you don,t want to wait remember there are other views in the surrounding area you can go to.

Busy tourist destination - but well worth it.. Our friends really wanted to go up the mountain - something we hadn't done for many years. We initially drove up to see the long queues and decided to pre-book on-line for another day. We arrived before 8.30, and it took about an hour to get to the cable cars. It is a very busy attraction, and rightly so. The views are magnificent and I now have the T-shirt!
Stunning. Walked up... Stupid! Should have taken the cable car and walked down... What a view... Do it at dawn for the light

The view is fantastic. The plants and flowers alone are worth the trip. If your camera can take close-ups that would be a plus. I would advise you to wear rubber soled shoes and forget the flip flops.

Weather Pending. Note that the view is great as long the the table cloth is not present. great Wifi spot, nice hike on the top, it's not as flat as it looks and it has well marked paths and map markers.

Worth a visit. There are many hiking trails with spectacular views of the city. We were amazed that there were people who actually repelled down the slope from the top given how steep the mountain was.

Spectacular view - must see!. This is a must do if you go to Cape Town - the view is spectacular. It is a short cable car ride to the top and well worth it as it is one of (if not the) best view I've seen. Absolutely stunning!

Do you know why they called "Table Mountain". one of other place must visit in cape town. It is a place to every touorism want to go there. It's kind of the signature place for this city. However. when you go there at the evening. There are very crowned people who wan to go down which this place offer only 2 cables car to come down. Hence, you have to wait about 1hr if you stay till late.
Fabulous day. Well worth the money and the rotating cable car made it special; great photos from the top; the blue skies do help

Must see, best visited by using a cab. The views are astonishing when the sky is clear BUT THEN EVERYBODY IS HEADING FOR THE MOUNTAIN. You better go by cab, because parlking your car near to the lift is questionable. We had to walk more then 20 minutes. Buying tickets via internet does't necessarily give you an advantage. We had to stand in line for an hour; as much as folks who still had to buy tickets.The reward -however- is big: a must see.

A Must Visit. Simply Amazing views and a nice walk around the top of Table Mountain. Even with mist it was well worth the effort and the breeze kept the view changing. Take a jacket for it was quite cooler there than ocean side.

Spectacular!. There is not a lot more I can say, that hasn't already been said! This is Cape Town's most amazing attraction (and there are many of them). From the exciting cable car, to the nature trails at the top along with impressive views, you can spend an entire day at Table Mountain. The weather changes rapidly so as soon as it looks clear, go for it. Also, be prepared for things to change rapidly once you are up there. In November it's a good idea to take layers. My top tip is to book tickets in advance to avoid the long queues; it's quick and easy through webtickets.co.za (apps also available for smart phones).

A must!. The minute you see a day is clear, go up. The mountain can have a mind of his own. Give yourself time to enjoy the views and take the longer walk if you have time. If you are a hiker, you can find out how to hike down.

not to be missed. As soon as the weather is clear, and it's not windy, go there as a priority. The weather can quickly change in Capetown. If it's too windy cable cars won't run; if too hazy hard to appreciate majestic view. Budget at least 21/2 to 3 hours.

Great Views. Whatever anyone tells you; it takes at least one hour (if you are fit) to hike up to the top instead of taking the aerial cableway and that's if you start from the lower cable station so be sure to give yourself at least three hours of daylight to do this. It is exhiliarting and the views of Cape Town are stunning.
Dress warmly.. The views over Cape Town were fabulous on the day we visited, but very windy so make sure to have warm clothes with you even if it is warm below the mountain. A must do.
Table Mountain. the views are magnificent. You get to view the whole valley of Cape Town and its surrounding shore line. Do not miss this one.

Spectacular views of the entire region. What a fun experience. Accessed by an efficiently run cable car, the views from the top are truly spectacular in all directions, of course depending on the weather. This is a "must" sightseeing experience in Cape Town.

Only on a clear day. On about half the days fog and clouds shroud Table Mountain. On the rest of the days the view is fantastic. The rotating cable car allows everyone to have a terrific view of all directions. Dress warmly as the wind and temperature are very different from Cape Town. The walkways are well marked and let one explore the top.

Wouha !!!. Amazing view ! If you are in Cape Town, it's a place that you must go !! If you like hiking, you have many way to go up. If you don't you can take the Table Mountain Cableway. So just go up there & enjoy the amazing & wonderful view on every different side of the Mother City!

The best way to explore Table Mountain.. We did in the past go up the Table Mountain in a cable car and I have to admit it was a wonderful, unforgettable experience with ever-changing beautiful views and nice time spent on the top. This time we hiked up after buying a map in a V&A Waterfront store with tourist cloths and equipment. There are two approaches recommended. The main trail begins near Kirstenbosch Botanical Garden but we took the one starting behind the visitors center at the cable car station. It is at times steep and difficult if there is any wind and it takes perhaps a little longer than one would expect just by "looking up" but it is greatly rewarding - both the breathtaking views and the personal satisfaction.
Amazing Views . Table Mountain National park as some amazing views that stretches out over a long distance. We were lucky enough to get a clear day for going.

Breathtaking View. Just amazing views of the entire area. If it is clear you can see Cape Town to Cape Good Hope. It is much cooler than being in town and yes it is WINDY! There are lots of trails for hiking and to get super pictures.

Unbelievable views. No trip to Cape Town area is complete without a visit to Table Mountain National Park. A chance to see breathtaking views of both the Atlantic and Indian Oceans and then the culmination in the view from the lighthouse at the Cape of Good Hope is worth the time and the animals, flowers, and shrubs are a bonus!This was my second visit and will come back again.Many other things on the way to the park (especially the Penguins!) and many places to dine.Well worth a day of your visit to this region.

Beautiful place, fabulous views. Our day was clear, visibility all the way to Cape Point, and of the whole city. Spring was beginning so there were plenty of flowers, not too crowded in the early afternoon.
Spectacular.... Stunning views of the city and coast line. Remarkable café offers exceptional menu choices, or you can bring your own...Very enjoyable!

Amazing view of both oceans!. If you wonder what an ocean meeting another ocean looks like: this is it. Probably one of the most unique places in the world and yes, another checkmark off my bucket list!

A must see! Natural wonder of the World. There is not one person who has gone onto this mountain and come back saying...'meh, thats ok'...Because its more than good or ok, its ALWAYS BREATHTAKING. The view, the mountain itself, the nature. Try to get away from the hoards at the main entrance though, and walk around. you will easily feel as though there are only a few of you on this mountain. Its magical. It does get windy as all mountain tops do, so go prepared especially if you plan to go for sundowners.

what a view! what a restaurant! go after 1pm queue has vanished by then. best view ive seen and restaurant had home made ostrich pie which was divine with drink, wedges and salad x 2 = £8 gbp. youll never experience dining like this with a million dollar view!!! giftshop is fairly cheap too so well worth a look. try to book your tickets before you go otherwise you will be queuing for 2 hours

Our Bad Luck that It Was Shut For Repairs.. At the base of the 'One of the Seven Natural Wonders of the World' we were informed that Table Mountain Cable Car was shut for repairs and there was no other way possible for us to go there. But the beauty from the base itself was so encapsulating that we knew what we will miss. (although we managed to grab some beauty through a Helicopter ride)

Table Top Mountain - Great place to visit or hike. Amazing views from Table Top and a great place to day hike. The trip up is easy and simple - best bet get to the station about 20 minutes before it opens. This place is especially popular on sunny days ! At the top there are many short and long trails to choose from and walks are pleasant and interesting. It is quiet and enjoyable at the top. There is a nice cafe, restrooms and nice places to sit and relax at the top too. If I lived locally, I would visit this place at least once a month for some R&R.

Out door trip with a difference . Loved the fauna and flora that is abound on top of table mountain. The place was neat,clean and well looked after with a well develop foot paths for people to walk on. The restaurant caters for the thirsty and hungry person. There is a free wifi service center which was closed when I was there.the view from on top here is awesome.

Sept 2016. Wow! what a spectacular site. Definitly needs to be on your to-do list if you are interested in unusual natural sites. Do some planning. There are long lines and a limited amount of people get this experience. It was well worth the time. Beautiful sites from the top.

Table mountain afternoon. We spent 4 hrs on the top which is the min. one should spend there. Beautiful view to the city and I would recommend it to do first right after arrival to cape town because you can be more familiar with the city from the top and that can help a lot.
A Must Visit in Cape Town. A must visit if in Cape Town, the views are spectacular. If a keen walker, will take a number of hours to get the best out of the experience.

wonderful view. this is an absolute must do when in cape town , as recommended by several people we got there by 8.00 am as the sun was out and just as well as soon after the lines start to grow quickly ,once up there you get amazing views of not just the city but the whole surrounding area , you can spend as much time as you want up there and there is a shop and café , the cable car rotates 360 so you get great views when coming down

What a remarkable place!. No holiday trip to Cape Town would be complete without a visit to this iconic Natural Heritage site! It really ranks highly in the minds of locals as well as international visitors. With its spectacular vistas, its wide bio- diversity and its interesting fauna, it offers something for everyone. .. put it top on your list of "must do" when planning your trip to Cape Town!
superb views. Well worth a visit on a clear day for excellent views of the city and the sea beyond. The lovely winding road up gives a new sigh to see at every turn.

The Best View in all the trail. I´m Brazilian girl, i did the trail to down last year (2015), is completely amazing ,so high!!You definitely should go up or down, but be sure to do.Very good exercise as well.
Fantastic views. A must when travelling to Cape Town: a fantastic view over the city and the peninsula. Rather crowded, so go early!

Beautiful Place - Don't miss it. I was there last September. The way up in a cable car is awesome. One can look down and will see the beautiful coastline of Cape Town, or look up and see a stoning vertical wall of yellow to orange coloured sandstone. When you get up there you can walk on a top surface with nice landscape and cute animals and rock formations. Take with you a wind cutter and your camera, of course. I'll be back as soon as I can.
Foggy morning. The fog lifted intermittantly so we did get some views but not as good as if there had been no fog. This was early AM so maybe going at a later time would have been better.
Gorgeous mountain and amazing for hiking.. Gorgeous mountain and amazing for hiking. Had the best time hiking around and it was wonderful to have the facilities to use on top.

Up table mountain, the real rewarding way. One way of visiting Table Mountain is taking the cable car up ... but it is so much nicer to get physical and walk. One of the many routes / hikes is "Skeleton Gorce", starting in Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens en taking you up a steep path (including ladders, climbing through a waterfall and lots and lots of rocks), The path is clearly indicated, starting at the top of the gardens (just follow the signs) and takes about 3 hours of hiking (and a bit longer if you take time to enjoy the magnificent views). Not advisable when it is rainy / wet and we wouldn't do it the other way around (down from the top).From the top simply take the cable car down and take a taxi back to Kirstenbosch (aprox. 400 Rand),Good shoes and a fair condition are necessary to enjoy this fantastic hike to the fullest!

Couple of hours walking . The sun came out so we walked for a few hours in the national park. Great views across cape town. Easy walks as well as some hard ones....Would go again if time and weather permits
Amazing experience!!. Such glorious weather made it a worthwhile walk to the western part of Table Mountain. The wild flowers were beautiful.

Fantastic Views of Cape Town. If you are in cape town make sure you go up to table mountain. You can either go on foot or cable car (queues in the afternoon are shorter) the views are fantastic of the city, we did the full walk round with is quite long but well worth it.
Awesome place to vist. The unique landscape and vegetation make it a must see. Be prepared for all weather conditions and beware of the baboons and you'll have a wonderful day out.

fabulous views not to be missed. No trip to Cape Town is complete without a visit to this iconic spot, with it magnificent views of the city and sea beyond. The cable car provides a fantastic ride but for those who are queasy about heights it is possible to walk up to the top. One tip, always go straightaway if the weather is clear. The micro climate created by the mountain and the sea breezes makes for sudden changes to the weather which shrouds the mountain in its traditional "table cloth" of cloud. a bight cloudless day can be followed by one where the city remains under blue skies but the mountain is covered, when the cable cars do not run.

A memorable night on the Mountain. I was delighted to be part of a group that hiked up Nursery Ravine from Kirstenbosch Gardens on a Saturday afternoon to spend the night is one of the huts on the Mountain. It is truly a magical place and it was with great reluctance that I started the return hike via the Jeep track on the Sunday morning. If you are going for a day hike up the Mountain please take sunscreen,sun protection, enough water, a windbreaker jacket ( even on a warm day as the weather conditions can change very quickly)

Breathtaking . After reaching the top via the cablecar, which is an adventure in itself, words cannot describe the views that await you. Although there is not a lot on top of the mountain the walks are amazing and wherever you look there is an awesome view. To see both the Atlantic and Indian oceans at the same time us something else. If you ever visit Capetown and do not go up the mountain you are mad as you will miss one of the best experiences of a lifetime.

What an experience . My girlfriend and myself climbed table mountain then cable carted down. it was very challenging but rewarding once you got on top. We went up on a super clear day and the views were breathtaking!!It's a must do if you visit capetown wether you climb or use the cable cart get on top of the table :)

Breathtaking views. One of the highlights of our stay in Cape Town. Best to book your cable car ticket online (cheaper too) - which can be done on the day by your concierge - which is best to do as at least you know what the weather will be like. The cable cars stop without warning if the wind changes. Luckily for us, it was a clear early Spring morning and we loved walking the trails with the wild flowers in bloom and great views in all directions. Highly recommend.

Go For the Views. Went up to Table Mountain first thing on a Sunny morning, and was rewarded with spectacular views of Cape Town and the entire Cape. Really magnificent, but make sure you go only when the weather is cooperating. Hiked around the top for 2-3 hours and really enjoyed every minute. Take your camera!!

Spend a Half a Day. If you would like there is a hiking path up the mountain that will take you about two hours, depending on your hiking abilities. If not you can get up and down by cable car. Once on top you could explore the whole top and gaze out all 360 degrees views out each side. Some have coast line views, others have mountains views and other have city views.

views of Cape Town from the table top. Excellent views from the top, take the tramp up and hike down if you have the time (take 2-3 hrs). Easy hikes on the top to various view points of the whole city and surroundings

Amazing views and breathtaking scenery. Great place to see the whole of Cape Town. Seen it and done it even if you are a bit nervous of heights. Well worth it. Can't get a better picture that one even with your eyes closed! Make the trek up!!
Visit to Table Mountain. The views are breathtaking. The city is one of the most beautiful that I've ever visited and once the fog began to blow over the mountain it became other worldly.

We had a perfect bluebird day.. We took the tram to the top of Table Mountain on one of those perfect, bluebird days. The views are stunning from the tram and the top. Definitely a must do while in Cape Town!! It is a lot bigger on top than I was expecting. There are many paths to follow and photo op viewing platforms. The only negative is the idiots taking unnecessary risks and selfies out of bounds on the edge!! When someone gets killed doing that, it will ruin it for everyone else. Use your head!!

If it's a nice day, go!. Table mountain is a great place to hike. We did a trail named Platteklip, which is deemed the safest and easiest. Note, I said "safest and easiest", not "Safe and Easy". This trail is completely vertical and will take 2 hours for a person in good hiking shape. It took me about 2.5 hours of continual hiking. We were not completely prepared to hike, as we only had athletic shoes, but you can do fine with boots, or sneakers. You must bring water and I would recommend wearing light clothing and layers for the hike. We hiked in July, shorts, tank tops and a thin long sleeve worked great. If you see the weather is nice and clear, go for it! Weather changes quickly and winds can bring in visibility problems. We climbed to the top which you can then wander around the top of table mountain and take a short walk to the cable car to ride down. Views are incredible from the top. *Bring Layers*Bring water!*Be sure to have ample time to climb to the top and have a ticket purchased by 5pm. The cable car closes at 530pm. There is apparently ALWAYS a crazy long line, but it goes quickly, so don't be scared if it winds around the edge of the mountain top. Purchase your tickets in the gift shop at the cable car station before getting in line. *UBER picks up from the cable car.*Hike Up, don't be that person that only hikes down. It's worth it.
Beautiful view of the city of Cape Town. We didn't actually take the cable car all the way to the top. Just took in the vista from the parking area. The city and the bay lay at your feet! Awesome
Perfect day. Had to abandon a previous days trip due to weather, but well worth wait, went up on perfect day, np breeze, idyllic.
Nice park. An amazing maintained place very nature is kept at its best and unspoilt, having great view of the ocean also, must visit place

Gorgeous views from the top. If you are a hiker, the hike up the mountainside is well worth the effort. It is a strenuous hike, but the views are spectacular. After hiking up, my brother and I abseiled part of the way down the mountain, then took the cableway the remainder of the way down. We used Abseil Africa--highly recommended!

Amazing View. The view from atop Table Mountain was amazing! We took the cable car up and it only took about 30 minutes. We bought our tickets before hand online and it saved time in line. Be prepared to spend a few hours on top in order to see everything! We got a lot of great photos and the scenery was amazing!
Amazing views!. Best views of the city and great trails to walk and see the entire area around Cape Town. Plan to spend an hour at least up top.
lovely views. Went up in the cable car but had a good walk at the top--clearly marked paths with lovely view over Cape Town

Fantastic experience despite the waiting. When I saw the queue for the cable car it reminded me of Alton Towers and we nearly turned back. So glsd we didn't. The views are stunning and away from the crowds you can feel away from everyone in a beautiful setting. The cafe prices at the top are not extortionate like they are at visitor attractions in the UK which made the whole experience more pleasant

Essential part of the Cape Town experience. Choose a clear day with no wind - better in the morning though the sun is in an awkward position for some photo shots. Do take a jacket - it can be hot in the city but much much cooler at the top. There are great views but I wish I had more time so that I could walk across the top - if you are fit you can abseil down! there are also pathways up the mountain for the very fit.The hop-on hop-off bus calls at the cable car station, and there are Table Mountain metered taxis if you want to get back to town quickly. Do have small notes so that change is not a problem, and the cost is slightly more than I paid on the way up which was fixed price.

It really is a "table" up there!. After a day of winds and heavy clouds when we were scheduled to visit Table Mountain, the sky cleared the next day and we made a mad dash for Table Mountain mid afternoon. It was a Sunday, we had pre-paid tickets as part of our Gate 1 tour of South Africa but the wait to ride the cableway up was about 45 minutes. You can walk up, some do, a few more seem to walk down, but you should be in shape and not mind the incline and loose rocks. The cableway is worth the cost and the cable car rotates 360 degrees as you ride. Horizontally, in case you're worried.Although it's called Table Mountain I really didn't expect it to be as flat as it is. We're not talking billiard table flat but I was amazed at how flat such a large expanse so high up on top of a mountain it is.There are a series of marked pathways throughout the top expanse and it is suggested that visitors stay on them. Many of the paths go to the edge at spots where there are low walls and/or safe viewing areas. However, many people ignored the warning, left the trails and went to the rocky edges. Of course these daring folks were limited to only those that had smart phones.The view down to Cape Town was spectacular. But I was really taken by the views in other directions. From down in Cape Town I couldn't fully appreciate what the mountain hid behind it including other significant mountains.As a warning, the wait for a cable car to go down was, for us, even longer than coming up. Maybe it's better on a weekday but whenever you can go it is definitely worth that inconvenience.

WOW! WOW! WOW! WOW!. If you're lucky you can take a walk on top of a mountain, overseeing a beautiful city and a breathtaking coastline. And if you are really lucky you can do that while clouds are racing past you. Sometimes you are in the clouds and then again in the awesome south african sunshine.

Stunning!. We hiked up the mountain on the first day we arrived which was a little windy. It was hard in some places but overall very good. The view from the top is spectacular- you can't compare with anything. Must do in Cape Town for everyone.

One of the MOST BEAUTIFUL experience I've ever had!. Climbing The Table Mountain was a memorable experience in SA. It's definitely worth climbing it, all the effort will give you a wonderful and unique view of the city. I could have stayed there for hours admiring the city from all corners!

Gorgeous views, especially at sunset. My friend and I took the cable car up around 6pm so that we could be on top of the mountain for sunset. It was much colder and windier than anticipated but so worth it! Great vantage point to see the entire city of Cape Town
Worthwhile visit. This is one of many worthwhile places to visit in the Cape Town area. The variety of fynbos and other plants is amazing, and the views are also really worthwhile.

Hate heights but glad I went. You can hike around or take a 360 degree windowed cable car up to the top. It is not a steady ride, because of the winds. This was a little unpleasant for me since I really get uncomfortable at heights, especially when encased in glass and swinging in random directions. However, it is a beautiful site and the view from the top is worth it. There is a little restaurant that serves some foods and drinks.

Amazing views; friendly staff. Went early one morning and pre booked soavoided the long queues at the ticket office - would recommend pre-booking! Short queue - we were on the 2nd cable car and good experience with rotating base. Some amazing photos from the top and all the walks are easily managed in less time than quoted even with photo time. Has to be done on a Cape Town visit
Magnificent view. If the cable car is running don't miss this view. It was closed last time I went due to the wind but had great weather this time. Try to plan going on a clear day.

Be prepared to stand in a queue - but all worth the wait. Well organised cable car process, but to get to the cable car you need at least 60 minutes to stand in a long queue. All worthwhile to meet the most magnificent views from the north, east, south and west. The restaurant at the top also well stocked and organised catering for all your needs. That is when you realised it was all worth the wait in the long queue. This is one of the 7 wonders of the world.

Amazing view. Take the Gondole and go up on Table mountain is a must. The view is breathtaking. You can see different birds or animals, walk aroung, take incredible shots and also eat at the restaurant above. Great experience.

Keep your eyes open. You might be lucky enough to spot some animals like baboons, ostriches or zebras! You'll need to be there early to have enough time to take all the side roads or to go hiking. Cape of good hope was crowded when we visited and taking a picture with the popular sign (and without strangers in the picture) was nearly impossible.
Breathtaking but high up!. we had a great time exploring the mountain and freaking out over the cliff drops! you can see for miles all around up and down the coast, this is a must do for any tourist.

A most beautiful place. The views of Cape Town are amazing from Table Mountain. The cable car ride was very interesting. The bottom of the car turns as you go up to give everyone a 360 view. Once on top the views are breathtaking. This is worth the trip!

One of the 7 wonders of the world. This is a must. This is wonderful and you can't miss it. The mountain is impressive, and you can see Cape Town from the top. I would suggest to go there if the weather is good and if possible plan to stay there at least 2 hours.
Book on line. Book on line to save yourself time. Ticket is open for 5 days just in case the weather is bad on the day you planned to go.

Nice views, but depends on weather. When reading about Cape Town, everyone said to go to Table Top Mountain as it supposed to provide some amazing views of the city and beyond. When we went there, there was not a clear day so even though we went to the top of the mountain, we werent able to see anything. It was a nice walk/hike around the 'table top' and many people hiking up.What we did see of the views were decent but I'm not sure I would go out of my way to see this. If I had time, and an extra day, then this would be on my list but its definitely not a top 10.

Beautiful Hike in August!. My wife and I visited Table Mountain in late August. I even got her to hike over to MacLear's Beacon (the highest point). It took about 50 mins each way. The best part is that there was hardly anyone there as compared with the area around the Aerial Cableway, which was a little crowded. The weather was perfect for it. We saw a wide variety of flowers, birds, frogs and of course a bunch of Rock Hyrax (Dassies). We also had a light snack at the cafeteria and it was good.Table Mountain is definitely worth the visit, weather permitting.
A must. Take the hop on hop off bus tour from V & A harbour as there is no public transport that goes up to the cable car, and well worth the money.

Worth it but challenging. I did this by accident as when I arrived at the cable car the queue was humongous. I asked a local couple who were walking up about it and they invited me to join them. We went via the Indian Fenster route - it's quite technical in places and you should never do on your own. But the views are incredible and the effort well rewarded. Thanks so much to the friendly local couple who acted as my guide.

Great Views of Cape Town. A trip to Cape Town would not be a trip to Cape Town without a visit to the top of Table Mountain. The views are amazing and the Aerial Cableway is the only way to go. The floor rotates as you ascend to the top so that everyone has a view.

Beautiful view but FREEZING in July!. We were lucky to get to go up Table Mountain the very last day of service in July. We had clear skies and beautiful view, but it was FREEZING at the top. Be sure to pack a coat, hat, and gloves. Don't be fooled by the balmy weather at the base.
no litter, just lizards!. Breathtaking views and plenty of walks and hikes from all different angles! Very cute wildlife and even free WiFi at the top! There is a cafe too for refreshments
Must see in Capetown. Must see in Cape town. We went up mid day and spent a few hours. Clouds rolled in and it was amazing.
LOVED Table Mountain. This place you must go to and visit the top of Table Mountain when in Capetown. The views are outstanding!

Highly recommended. Table Mountain it is another place highly recommended to visit as long as there is sunshine you'll get a magnificent view of Cape Town. The price is not too expensive to take the cable car.

Hiking Trail up Constantia Neck to Overseers Cottage in Table Mountain National Park. We were 12 friends that were hiking up Table Mountain National Park via Constantia Neck to the Sanparks Overseers Cottages.The scenery was breath taking, but we warned...the short trail is steep and the 3,5 km walk is not a walk in the park, if you are unfit. There is a longer, 5 km, Jeep Track that follow the contour of the mountain and is just as spectacular, but less strenuous. Walking at a leisure pace the long route will take just under 2 hours.The cottages have bedding and towels, but no electricity.They do provide lanterns (kerosene type) and solar led lighting.
