Warm water is supplied via a gas geyser. The main house have 2 inside showers and toilets and 1 outside shower and toilet. The smaller cottage only have an inside toilet and outside shower.You can take all you want (fire wood, food, drinks etc.) as long as you have booked well in advance with Sanparks and they will drive up the Jeep track and deliver your stuff at the cottages.You need to walk the whole route but the reward is sweet. You will overlook Cape Town and False Bay. When we visited, is was full moon...simply awesome if you are a natures lover.There are a couple of dams on the mountain that can be used to cool down. This is a must do if you like hiking and nature.

Platterklip Gorge. This is one of the easiest hiking routes up Table Mountain to access. The path is very clear and the views are fantastic! I walked up with two boys 8 and 12 and it took us about 1 hour 45 with quite a few stops. It is a steep climb bit well maintained and a good morning out. Once at the top the restaurant and cable car was 10 minutes walk and we were able to relax and have a drink and them catch the cable car down. Make sure you take at least 750ml water per person as you will need it ! And more if it is a hot day

One of the best half-day walk with magnificent view.. I spent one Sunday afternoon walk on the top of the Table Mountain. It was bright and sunny. I took a lot of photos and learned a lot of new thing, especially on geology of the Table Mountain. I also had a chance to see folded sandstone bed that caused by glaciation, possibly during the sedimentation (???). Yes, there are a lot to see up there. You can't miss it if you happened to be in Cape Town.

The best way to enjoy the beauty of the mountain.. Hiking is the best way to experience the Table Mountain. We went up and down but more practical approach is to utilize the cable car one way depending what is easier or more pleasurable for you - going up or descending down. The views are amazing of course. We did our hike on a relatively windy day and it made it really tough at times. The cable car did not work that day.
Worth the hike. Enjoyed every bit of it, the view gets better with every corner. We did not realise it would be so long, so we did not prepare well. Make sure you bring water and a har
So different from how I imagined. Definitely one of the highlights of our trip - would recommend as a must visit for anyone visiting Capetown

Still as magnificent. Been up before , however , its still as magnificent as the the first time. Take along a jacket and closed shoes if you are adventurous. Quite a few rock paths to follow on top of the mountain. Allocate at-least have a day to explore the top of the mountain and the different view all around the mountain. You may also spot the Dassie's which live on the mountain. Be sure to check their website to see if the cable way is open or closed. Carry along a snack and a bottle of water.Table Mountain is listed as one of the new 7 wonders if the world... Enjoy!

Above the Clouds. it was a foggy, somewhat cool morning but when the staff did all the safety checks and determined we could go, it was stunning. The cable car actually rotates and does not take long at all to ascend. we had about an hour on top and the scenery was truly OZSOME

Phenomenal! . This was by far one of the highlights of our trip. Table Mountain was so impressive and dominates the Capetown skyline. The views from our villa was absolutely spectacular especially at sunset. I highly recommend purchasing your tickets in advance as the line gets really long. A must do while in Capetown!

Stunning views, craggy landscapes. The hike up Plattekill Gorge was tougher than expected but the stunning views of Cape Town and the ocean are well worth it. The top is relatively flat but quite rocky, be sure to bring good shoes. There is a restaurant and bathrooms by the cable cars, where the lines are LONG, but be prepared for mostly wilderness.
Amazing views. Great place to visit. From the revolving cableway to the fantastic views on a clear day. Great walks at the top and a restaurant and shop to visit.
Mesmerising!!!. check the Capetown weather before visiting this place. its mostly cloudy. also check the service of cable car on that day. you get a aerial view of Capetown from this place. too good
High priority on your list of things to visit. Out of this world sights! Absolutely beautiful! Very crowded in the afternoon. A photographer's dream place.....
Great walking trail & view.. Variety of walk to suit everyone, we did circuit on the top, relatively easy could be done by unfit & children.

Awesome view from the top. We like hiking at table mountain.It wasso easy,not difficult.we take great pjhotos from the top.we saw robbin's island,lion's head,signal hill from the top.
Great experince.
LOVELY!. Not to be missed. The highlight of every trip to Cape Town. We can spend hours just taking in the scenery. If you like taking photos, it is a photographer's paradise.

Amazing BUT...... We thoroughly enjoyed Table Mountain BUT be very aware on our way back down we had to wait over an HOUR in the cold while it was getting dark to get the cable car down and the line was so long I daresay that some people did not make it down until 7pm, it was ridiculous and they need to make people aware this can happen.

Epic Views! Must DO!. The views from the mountain are amazing. Even if you are afraid of heights I urge you to travel up the mountain just for the best profile picture on earth! Best way to the mountain entrance is to use the hop on hop off buses as they take you around Cape Town with this being one of the stops. You then pay for the ticket and have to get a cable car to the top of the mountain. The worst part is the cable car as you do feel suspended on nothing, but it is perfectly safe and lots of staff around to help less mobile customers. Views are like no other. DO IT!

Stunning Views!. Stunning views from the top of the mountain of Cape Town and the surrounding area. I'd highly recommend the cable car which gives everyone a 360 degree view of the mountain side, the ocean and the city below. It's a must in Cape Town!

Excellent. This was by far a high light of our trip to Cape Town. What a fantastic Jewell for the city. I was blown away by the vista and spectacular views. Number one thing to do in Cape Town by far.

A must in Cape Town. Table Mountain stands over the city of Cape Town. It's a beautiful view on a nice day. Buy your tickets in advance and check to make sure it's open if you see any clouds around it.
Terric view of the city. Sunny day and brilliant view of the surroundings. Loved the curricular ride to the top. The floor moved in a circle.
Must do!. An experience one cannot put a price on! Took a little longer to get to the top on account of my 8 year old tagging along. Definitely worth the the effort.
Climbed to the top!. What a beautiful and scenic workout. Hot in the sun and refreshing in the shade. The path was well marked and well maintained.
Stunning. Table mountain is just breathtaking and the views from the top are mind blowing. Well worth the visit. The area is clean and it's a must when visiting Cape Town.

great views of the city. Took the tram to the top and had a nice time. Went up later in the afternoon after the clouds started to roll in and it made a challenge to see Camps Bay but able to see Capetown harbor.

What A View. Understand it is hit and miss to get to Table Mountain Park due to clouds and weather. We lucked out and had a great morning at the park. The cable ride up was fantastic, and the views were spectacular. Good information and lots of areas to get great shots on your camera.

Worth the queuing time. It was a beautiful sunny Sunday so the queuing time was 3 hours without a prescription purchased ticket. There had been shut days in the week prior. Once at the front of the queue, processing was very quick. There wasca steady turnover at the restaurant and it wasn't crowded on the walks at the top.

Great Views, Must visit!. We visited Table Mountain in July 2016 and all i have to say is that it is a must! The "aerial" view of Cape Town and surroundings, matches perfect with the horizon you can see from up there!Warning. It can be cold (and windy) enough up there so get dressed well.Best time to visit is -for me- early in the morning so you have the opportunity (and enough time) to go up hiking or go down hiking (the best option is combining Aerial Cableway for one-way and your foot for the other). The path is a bit steep but it is accesible and ok. If you walk all the way from top to the bottom is around 1.30 hour but be careful. DONT do this in the afternoon because it can be really dark, cold and windy when the sun goes down.Helpful staff. On the top there is a cafe, you can also eat and there is also a souvenir shop. There is wifi up there.

Amazing Views!. There was more to Table Mountain than I expected. The views are just amazing and there are lots of trails you can walk on. There are maps that give you an estimated walk time for each of them, so you know how long you will need for each route. Make sure to see the views from all angles. The ride up on the cable car to the observation area is really neat, and is fairly quick (that is when you are done standing in line!) At the top is a small cafe with some hot foods, pizza, sandwiches, lots of desserts, beer & cider on tap, wines by the bottle too!

Awesome views of Cape Town . The quickest way to get to the top of Table Mountain is to take the cable car. A return journey costs 240 Rand and it takes about 5-6 minutes each way.The top of the mountain is not what you would expect. Its very rocky with bushes and some wild flowers. The views it provides make it well worth the visit. You can see the whole of Cape Town and beyond, Robben Island and the mountains leading down to the Cape of Good Hope.There is a cafe and toilets up there plus the obligatory gift shop.
An amazing wonder of the world. I went by bike and took the aerial cableway to the table mountain. what an amazing breathtaking site. not to miss

Still NUmber One for a good reason. After five days of indifferent weather and wind we woke up to sun and clear sky on the peak. In the line at 0820 and on the cable car by 0900. Perfect weather and vision for miles on all fronts. Cable car knows how to handle crowds and the mountain does the rest if the weather gods cooperate. An on line reservation saves time and is valid for 7 days if you happen to strike windy days.

Excellent Scenic Beauty. The Table Mountain is one of the 7 natural wonders of the World. The Mountain offers a great view of Cape Town. Make sure to visit is on a SUnny Day. The mountain is closed on WIndy Days

Not to ne missed. To go to Cape Town and not take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain would be something we would have regretted for the rest of our lives. The views, the clean air, and even the ostrich pie were all amazing.We hope to go back to Cape Town again next year and will certainly take the trip to the top again.
Must-visit. We were so lucky to visit during superb visibility in the weeks after the annual closure for maintenance. Arrive early to avoid queueing.

A Cape Town 'must do'. When we visited the cable car was being devices so could not go to the top of the mountain. Howeverveven from the powers level of the cable car station the views across Cape Town are still amazing & didn't have to compete for camera space. Well worth the drive up.
This is a must do in Cape Town. The trip up the mountain by cable car and the views are simply amazing. There are 360 degrees views that will take your breath away.

Fabulous views. We were lucky to have beautiful sunshine but it was very windy. Pack something warm - just in case. Waited only 5 mins for cable car and got some great photos on the way up and down. Spent an hour or so at the top looking at the magnificent views then had a coffee and pizza from the cafe.

My, myself and Mother Nature. Besides the fact that it is the 7th wonder of the world, I was absolutely amazed at the beauty of mother nature. You feel so far away from civilization, yet you are so close. We did the Platteklip Gorge. Although one of the shortest trails, be warned that there are almost no flat/level parts on it. Only one way - up!A definite must if you are visiting Table Mountain, and then you take the cable car down after enjoying an ice cold beer at the restaurant at the top.

Hikes. We have been walking around the world for about 20 years.So we often come to our own beautiful country. The best is the hike to table mountain.The view amazing and the hike durable. Cape Town lots to offer.

Views. Park is very busy. If you go in your own auto parking is a little crazy. It is customary to pay a small fee to the parking attendant, such as 10 or 20 rand. Park is very clean and safe. You need to be in good shape to walk the hilly and mountainous trails.

Pick your trails wisely. Firstly, don't believe the hype of people being robbed on the trail - it happened before yeah, but the airplanes crash as well. The most recommended route the ridge straight up, but personally for me this is the LEAST enjoyable - yes it is the shortest, and some say the easiest because there is no actual climbing, but the continually stepping on boulders is so exhausting that it took the enjoyment out of it. The ridge takes 1.5-3 hours depending on your fitness lever, but in my opinion, I don't want to run up, or compete to be there in that, I WANT TO ENJOY THE HIKE. You can't enjoy this route because it is dirty and it has sooo many people. Much more enjoyable, although much longer route is the "pipe" route, that first goes around the mountain, and then up, and then you have hiking on top of the mountain with some great views. MUCH longer, but for me more enjoyable with different views. So if its just a matter of climbing the mountain then Ridge will do, but if you want to enjoy the hike and spend the day on table mountain, "pipe route" anytime.

Table Mountain For Everyone. I've been running, walking and hiking on Table Mountain and in the rest of Table Mountain National Park for over 35 years. There's something for everyone, from the seasoned hiker to the person who enjoys a gentle stroll along the beach or in the woods. Occasionally security concerns are raised in the local press. I've never had an incident, but having been involved with Table Mountain security I can say that there are only a few "hot spots", and incidents are rare. Basically, exercise caution when on the urban fringe. I exercise caution at Noordhoek beach, Sandy Bay (avoid), Signal Hill, The Blockhouse, and Lion's Head. For the rest (95% of the National Park), it's more important to consider warm clothing, sufficient water, and avoidance of steep cliffs.For serious hikers there are various routes that allow one to walk up Table Mountain. All are pretty strenuous and require a reasonable level of fitness. My favourite route is up the "back" of the Mountain from Constantia Nek to the Cable Car. If the Cable Car is operating, you can take it down. A good idea because coming down the Mountain is harder (and more painful) than going up. The weather can be atrocious at the top of Table Mountain - like being in a freezing washing machine - but gentle and sunny at the bottom. So be prepared. Always take warm clothing, snacks, water, and rain gear. Shelter in a cave/overhang if necessary. The weather can change from mild to horrific very quickly. There are programs on social media that allow one to log one's hike with the Table Mountain Safety/Rescue people so that they can keep an eye on you. Nonetheless they rescue people from the Mountain practically every week. I usually hike by myself but it's apparently highly recommended to hike in a group.For those who want a more gentle experience I recommend Newlands Forest. Beautiful, shady, and safe. Difficult to get lost as "downhill" always takes you safely to a main road. Good for children.For beach strolls and great views try Cape Point reserve - expensive but superb beaches, some large mammals (Eland, Ostrich, Baboon etc), and safe. Take lots of water and sunblock! Noordhoek Beach is stunning but exercise caution unless in a large group. There have been a number of attacks down the beach towards the wreck. Exercise caution in swimming at any of the Table Mountain National Park beaches. The water is cold and the currents are strong.We are privileged to have this magnificent park in the middle of our city. I am grateful for it every day.

Natural wonder of the world. The Table Mountain National Park includes the iconic Mountain which is one of the new Natural 7 wonders of the world and also a world heritage site. Although the Iconic mountain is off course a "Must see" for all visitors to the mother city, the penguin colony at Boulders, the views from Signal Hill and Lions Head and the Cape of Good Hope are parts of the park which should not be missed out. Being part of the city, access is easy to the many different attractions which are part of the park as a day or half day excursion, and can be spread over a number of days.The views around the coast, or of the city itself are all part of this great national park and part of the allure of Cape Town.

Spectacular natural beauty . A wonderful experience offering panoramic views of this beautiful city. Check the weather early and book tickets online if you're going up in the cable car to avoid the queues. If you're a local, consider buying a cable card, which allows you a free return trip every day for a year (it is worth it financially after 2 trips, and discounted if you also have a green card). There are also a variety of routes to hike up the mountain, the most accessible being Platteklip Gorge. Take warm clothes, a rain jacket and plenty of water, as the weather can be deceptive from the bottom. Spend some time exploring the top (which is vast), to escape the crowds and appreciate the views!
Another bucket list must do experience.. The best and breathtaking view during the day and evenings. lots of amenities and walking/hiking trials.

An amazing place. we visited table top mountain last year and it was an amazing experience. the views from the top are absolutely amazing. you can see the whole beautiful city of Cape Town. its very organized and easy to go up. we enjoyed it very much,not to be missed.

Beautifull view, well worth the trip. Do not go up when cloudy. On clear days, the views are spectacular. Go early to avoid cues or later in the afternoon. Make sure you have at least 2 hours on top. There are great walks to do there. O and pre buy your tickets online, it saves at least 1 que!

TABLE MOUNTAIN. If you see table mountain without its table cloth on ( cloud cover) go for it because it can change very quick.A great place to visit probably one of those unique places.If you can book online do so it's cheaper and you can queue jump.

In the Clouds. We took the double-decker tour bus from a departure point near the Aquarium on a Friday morning and enjoyed the recorded commentary in the language of our choice to Table Mountain. We did not have to wait to take the gondola and soon, were up in the clouds passing over the mountain. Unfortunately, the restaurant was closed for renovations but the smaller snack bar was doing a booming business. Bring a sweater or windbreaker as the temperature is much cooler at the top but, what a view!! Simply glorious!
Not ToBe Missed. Wonderful experience. Take at least 60-90 minutes to walk on the nice paths to see the 360 deg views.

Spectacular Views!!!. By far the absolute most beautiful sites in all the world! From atop Table Mountain I saw the entire waterfront on one side and the Ocean on the other, there were splendid views of Robben Island and the landscape of Cape Town.The rock/mountain was formation simply incredible.Beauty, Awesome. Fantastic. I simply ran out of words to describe the breathtaking views from Table Mountain.

Various places to visit as part of this park . The park does not consist of the Table Mountain only, but many other places to visit. I visited Table Mountain and went to another side, place called Table View where you can see the most famous view on the Table Mountain. Apparently, Cape of Good Hope is part of the park, however I did not have time to visit it this time.
Worth the wait. After waiting 4 days for the "tablecloth" to come off we were able to hike up and see the amazing view!

Take the gondola to the top of the table. If Mother Nature does not spread a tablecoth over the mountain and if the winds are not too brisk, you can enjoy a nice day at the top of Table Mountain. Take a walk around the paths for 360 degree views of Capetown. Enjoy a bite to eat in the cafe, but keep an ear peeled for the siren. That means you must hurry to the gondola for the trip down because the weather is about to get spicy.

A slurry stunning. After going up on the cable car on a sunny day the views were exceptional. The place is well laid out with good footpaths and informative signboards well spread out, covering the Natural history as well as local history. Surprised at the amount of wildlife, with a lot of hyrax sunbathing on the rocks.

Soaring above it all at Table Mountain. On our recent visit to Cape Town, we took the Red Line bus right up to the foot of the tram that ascends Table Mountain. We were lucky to have a relatively cloud-free day, and no queue at the tram. The steep ride up was great, as the gondola rotated so all visitors could share the view. At the top, we enjoyed the forever vistas, and the clouds creeping over adjacent peaks. Our walk amidst the flora and fauna was enjoyable as well. Well worth the time, weather permitting.
a must see in Cape Town. Probably the best thing to do in Cape Town. If the weather is good, don't miss it. I highly recommend. I am sure you won't be disappointed.
Must place to visit.. You cannot go to Cape Town withought visiting Table Mountain. If the weather is good you will love the view.

Stunning Views on the Mountain Top. Getting a cable car to the top of Table Mountain can sometimes be hit or miss because of the weather but the views with a clear sky are amazing. Also, the top has a relatively flat area that seems to extend for a few kilometers so you spend a couples hours walking in a loop from the cable car station and back enjoying the views below from different angles. Be sure the check the weather, order tickets in advance and check Table Mountains website for the best experience.
Must do in Cape Town. Catching the cable car to the top of Table Mountain is one of the must do's when in Cape Town. At the top you can walk around and get the best views over Cape Town.
treasure. a amazing view of cape town but the weather got in our way meaning we had to leave quickly due to fog.

Great view, beautiful nature reserve.. We were lucky to have a window where the clouds lifted allowing clear views out across Cape Town. We also spent some time wandering around on top which was a surprisingly large area with unique wild flowers and plants. We were also blessed with the sighting of a number of Rock Dassi, such cute little guys who inhabit the area.This is a must do trip but don't just go for the view take the time to walk around and soak up the unique environment.

Terrific Table Mountain. Spectacular mountain top that is an iconic backdrop of the beautiful city of capetown. This magnificent mountain is both awe inspiring and a must see if one is in Capetown. You can climb it, trek it or go the scenic way by cable car. The cable car is a revolving one that guarantees one spectacular 360 degrees of the mountains both ways, while going up and coming down. Once on top you can leisurely soak in the views all around of the beautiful city below.There are a couple of sjops and restaurants that one can enjoy, with local wines, cuisine or picnic lunches. Something for all ages and tastes. Pizza and coffee too. Be mindful that it can get cool and windy at the top and the weather can change drastically so ensure plenty of warm or wind proof weather wear. An amazing experience for all ages. Thoroughly enjoyable a must see for nature lovers.

The highlight of Cape Town. Weather was fantastic and went up by 360 degree Rotair cable car. Reached the top in short time. Wind are blowing strong. The view up there is spectacular. You can see Signal Hill, Lion's Head, Table Bay Harbour and almost the entire scenic part of Cape Town. Spend longer time up here, walk the whole track, sit at some spots and enjoy the serenity of the peak. If going up by cable car, put this itinerary 1st and as weather and speed of wind will affect operation.
Amazing view. Amazing view - cable car out of service when we were there but you could see it from everywhere in town
You can survice without seeing Table Mountain. You can live without seeing it and die in peace. Long queues if you do not reserve beforehand. Nice view only if the wheather is clear.

Poor visibility . Went up table mountain 8/9 early in the morning nice day but as we ascended in the cable car the clouds came and formed a table cloth on the mountain visibility was poor and you could not see any thing at all the temperature dropped and it was very cold so be warned cape town weather unpredictable but enjoyed the cable car ride which rotates 360 degress fleeces can be bought a the top of the mountain if come unprepared

Cape Town Treasure. We climbed UP and took the cable car down - but do go even if you take the cable car up.It is a very popular attraction - buy your tickets in advance and plan to get on the first cable car up.Restaurant and shop at the top plus killer views.

Spectacular Views. Table Top Mountain is often closed when the cloud drops but however long your in Cape Town it is well worth the effort getting to the top to see the views. We only had one opportunity lasting 45 minutes but it was well worth it.

Fantastic views and wildlife!. Went up twice on our Cape Town Visit as loved it so much! Amazing views everywhere, good paths to follow, interesting birds and wildlife. The hourly free guided tour is excellent as an introduction, if only to tell you which prickly bushes not to touch!

Real Miracle of nature. My visit on table mountain was one of the best experiences in my life. We booked our tickets for the lift online and in a few minutes we were on the top. The view is breathtaking!!!!! Perfect place to take photos!

Incredible view!. Don't miss the Table Mountain experience. Hard to describe. We spent 4 hours on the Mountain top, enough time for a guided tour, walking on our own, a delicious hot lunch in the cafe and time for the clouds to come and go. We actually had our head in the clouds, when they lifted a 360 degree view. Bring a jacket, it can be cool.

a must do while in cape town. a nice ride to the top with a cablecar,the views are stunning,while so close to town still you are at 1061 m above sea level.one of the new 7 wonders of the world of the future

Lives up to its expectations. If you visit Table Mountain and are able-bodied, you must do one of the hikes up. A group of friends and I hiked up and ran out of water, but by the time we made it to the top, we totally forgot about our thirst and took in the views. Table Mountain itself has wonderful views of Cape Town and other parts of the park (that sprawls for miles) and something to offer as well. A must visit if you are in South Africa.

Hike around Table Mountain Top with Fascinating Views of Cape Town. Weather permitting, access Table Top by Aerial Cable Car and be sure to enjoy this Natural Wonder and hike with magnificent Bird's eye views of Cape Town and surrounding scenery. Visitors can choose very easy hiking on top of Table Mountain or more strenuous across to the nearby peaks. Not the be missed.

Half a day amazing experience. First you'll have to make sure that the park is opened that day. The clouds may be low and they will close the park. Considering this plan to visit this place first while you are in Cape Town. To avoid standing in line (can be up to one hour) get your tickets online. This will save you a lot of time. Plan to be there for at least 3-4 hours. If you want to follow up with a trip to nearby Lions Head Mountain to watch the sunset (which is a must) allow yourself at least 1 hour to get there even though it's very close, but you'll have to get down from the Table Mountain, find your car and drive in heavy traffic to Lions Head. Check our the sunset time. So if it's 6:30 I would start getting off the Table Mountain at 5pm. The views are spectacular. The whole place is totally amazing.
Table Mountain National Park. Hiking/walking in various parts of the park. Nice activity for a family,couple/s and or friends. Difficulty levels varies so do your homework before you start walking.
Abseiling. A group of friends and I abseiling off Table Mountain. A great way to see Cape Town from high above.

What an amazing view . Fantastic experience, I thought at first that it was expensive but once we got to the top the money spent was long forgotten. Unforgettable view of cape town and the cape peninsula and lots of information on little boards all over the place. A must do when in Cape Town
Breath taking!!!. You cannot visit this area and not visit this Park. The most beautiful views I have ever seen. Make sure you bring a camera...

Well worth a visit. This is a must. The views are great and you could spend a whole day up the mountain hiking. Be sure to take warm clothing even if sunny down below as the weather can turn quickly up on top and have good footwear for walking.Queues can be long so buy your ticket beforehand, it's valid for a week, you will still need to queue but it's a faster Bing one. There is a shop and cafe up top and the Red bus tour stops right at the door. A taxi from the waterfront is just over 100 Rand. Be sure and take a metered taxi.Do not forget your camera.

Not difficult BUT carry plenty of water!. we are a fairly fit family who enjoy hiking and this took us 90 minutes from the base of the cableway to the top of the mountain. Its essentially a " motorway" so very difficult to get lost and generally plenty of others walking up it. it is a series of uneven steps that just goes on and on, so be prepared to cary plenty of water and a hat, since there is little shade with the sun beating down on your back until near the top. Make sure you have decent walking shoes or trainers with grip. Even in winter time the walk breaks you into a sweat! The views from the top are worth it and quite honestly, no abled bodied person should be taking the cableway unless the conditions are bad. It was a wonderfully satisfying family hike.
Such a view. Worth the 3 hour hike up. Be careful though as at times the steps are rather steep. The view at the top was incredible though. We saw the sunset at the top and it was so incredible!
No cable car - a long walk up. We went to Table Mountain in early August, which is when the cable car is being serviced so is closed. That was a walk/scramble up but well worth the view.

Must do!. This is an absolute must. Even for the person that is afraid of heights, it's not that bad. Absolute breath taking views and a once in a lifetime experience. The cable car is standing room only and if you don't want to see the bottom, you don't have to look.
WOW. Great place for a view not to mention the hiking. We spent 2-1/2 hours there. Didn't want to leave but we had other places we wanted to see.
Worth the walk. We walked up and took about 1 and half hours, was hard work as large steps. The views from the top are stunning, caught the cable car back down - worth pre booking your ticket.

"SENSATIONAL SCENERY". We visited here in april.The weather was good on this particular day,so we went up cable car to table mountain.When you get to the top the views are amazing,there are walks all around the top,and great photo opportunities.A must do attraction when in Cape Town

Platteklip to Upper Cableway Station. This is our favorite hike in South Africa. It starts down the road from the lower cable way station in Cape Town and climbs there a rocky gorge until you summit table mountain and walk about 15 minutes to the upper cable station, it takes about 2 1/2 hours and a liter of water. The views are stunning and will leave you breathless.

Great view from this amazing mountain. We were lucky enough to have a beautiful clear day for our trip to Table Mountain National Park. The cable car run is amazing and gives great views with the rotating floor. The views from the mountain were spectacular and amazing.

STUNNING VIEWS OF CAPE TOWN, NICE TRAM!. We were lucky to go on the tram right before it started raining. It was mobbed but we skipped the ticket line by buying tickets online. The tram ride was short and beautiful. The views from the top are stunning. Make sure you don't stay until the end of the day because the lines to go back on the tram are long.
Beautiful views. Table mountain is a must when you visit Cape Town. 360˚ views over Cape Town. Buy your ticket online to save some time in the queue.

Breath Taking. Table Mountain is rightly now one of the 7 wonders of the natural world as it is truly a magnificent place and the views are out of this world.....if you only have time to do 1 thing in Cape Town then Table Mountain is it!!

Beautiful views. The Table Mountain National Park is located on top of the famous Table Mountain in Cape Town. You can either walk to the top or go up by cable car. The views from the top are really amazing covering most of Cape Town, the Atlantic Ocean and part of the Cape Pennisula. The waiting times for the cable car might be long. Beware of thieves.

An absolute MUST. If you are in Cape Town, don't miss visiting the Table Mountain national park. Access is via a cable car, or you can choose to walk (climb..) all the way up. We chose the cable car and then went for a walk in the park, taking in all the spectacular views. Don't forget to take water (although there is a restaurant/shop at the top).

Beautiful. Because it was cloudy the day before the lifts were very busy on the day we went up. The gongola turns on the way so everyone can see the views. At the top there are some paths and different view areas. Had to queue to get down but really enjoyed the top.
Amazing Views!. Cool experience to make it to the top of the huge monolith that is visible from all points of town! Easy to walk or tram, bar at the top!

Don't miss it!. This is one of those experiences you just can't miss, and you don't want to! I went up with a group of students to watch the sunset and they have consistently referred to this as one of their favorite adventures! Easy to get tickets, well organized experience.

Absolutely amazing. This was the best part of our visit. Not only are the views just totally amazing but the free WiFi at the top, amazing facilities and walks were top class. Loved it. Make sure you have good walking shoes, a camera, sun screen etc.
Nice view of whole city. Very nice to come up on mountain, but important to have nice weather. and good cloths. Book before visit on internet. The hop on off buses can also book for you.

Views like nowhere else. If you are going to Cape Town you MUST do Table Mountain. If you are up for it, the hike to the top took us 90 mins (although the route guide says it can take 2.5hours). It is absolutely worth the effort of hiking, although it's not a walk in the park, I would only suggest attempting if you are physically fit. Picking a day without cloud is crucial - I would not want to get stuck halfway up, and make sure you take the usual sun screen, water, jacket etc with you. The path itself is clearly marked and you arrive at the top of the mountain in the middle, away from the mass arrivals on the cable car. It's worth heading along to Maclear's Beacon for spectacular views with fewer people, before walking the length of the top to reach the cafe and the cable car back down. The queues at the end of August 2016 for the cable car were apparently almost an hour to get up, and about 30 mins back down, so get there early if you are taking the car up!

Lovely views and walk. Would recommend you buy ticket in advance. It took us 1 hour to get ticket and get to cable car.On a clear day the views are amazing and the walks at the top are fun. Look out for the dassies they are so sweet, lying on the rocks enjoying the sunshine.

Fancy a hike over Cape Town!. Be local and sporty: don't use the cable car up but do hike! The view will reward you. It is not such an easy city hike: it is a mountain and quite chilly up there so don't go there in only short sleeves and flipflops as I saw some people do.

Great views plus flora & fauna. Take the cablecar or if you feel fit, walk up - Table Mountain is a must. At the top you have fantastic views and you can spend an hour or two on easy, level walks where you can see magnificient flora and fauna including dassies, birds & lizards.

Cold but very worth while.. After a very exciting ride up to the top in a cable car, the view from the top is magnificent. They say there are so many different varieties of plants in this national Park. More in fact than in the whole of the UK. There are good walking trails around the top for either the those who just want to have a short stroll or longer walks for those who really want to discover the natural beauty of this place. I highly recommend that this be put on the list of things to do in Cape Town.

Walk up the skeleton route. Very challenging and beautiful . We ran across the top of table mountain . And came back down pretty quick . Fantastic views . A much better route to go up especially on foot
Truly iconic. It is true that Cape Town is one of the most iconic cities in the world. The Table Mountain National Park is just spectaclar: vegetation, fauna and views!

Spectacular Views of the Cape Town.. This is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town. It's a stop on the Red Bus which is how we accessed it. Take the cable car to the top and for the breath taking 360 views. We bought tickets when we arrived. Best to buy in advance either on line, through your hotel or when you sign-up for the Red Bus. Be prepared to wait in line to take the cable car up and to take it back down. Waits vary but coming down I waited about 45 min. Worth it though.
nice but hard. very nice but a bit hard, took us 3 hours! gorgeous the view with sunny days! and if you prefer you can take the cable.
Stunning. The most famous and iconic Cape mountain may not rise like Olympus but it is a wonderful day out. The views are incredible, the revolving cable car exciting and access is good for all

Breathtaking Views. Just go. Words cannot express how beautiful this view is. But unlike our tour group, you should set aside at least a couple of hours to just relax and bare witness to the surroundings.
Good experience . Went there today. Check online the waiting time and if it is open before going. But expensive but must in Cape Town. Recommended

A must!. So many people visiting this place couldn't be wrong, but still, you don't expect the beauty of the views! I 'heard that one must not go when cloudy...not right.We were lucky to see both, clear views and cloudy...well we thought we were walking on the sky!

Hiked up. If you want to see Cape Town and its beauty and you are an adventurous being like me, hiking up this gorgeous mountain is one of the best treat you cab do for yourself, with a group of friends its even better.

Walked up TM via Platterkloof and took the cable car down. travel past the lower cable car station and come to Platterkloof Gorge parking area, leave car here and walk up
It took us 90 plus a few minutes to arrive - not too difficult, take water with u
By sharing your experiences, you're helping travellers make better choices and plan their dream trips. Thank you!
Beautiful flora. For any tourest or local who travels here a must see. Fauna and flora galore and very well kept, neat and lovely scenery.
fantastic. Amazing view!!! my son and I had a few spare hours and we were suggested to visit the table mountain....and it was phenomenal!! it worth any minute there!!

Like on Top of the World. We enjoyed great weather when taking the cable car up to table mountain. What a fantastic 360 degrees view from top of this impressive mountain! You can easily spend an hour walking around without getting bored. The only thing I regret is the fact that I was not prepared to hike down the slopes back to the car park. That looks like be a great tour with outstanding views all along the way - definitely a MUST on my next trip to Table Mountain!
Stunning views!. A must-see destination while in Cape Town. Several ways to get there, either by car, hiking or by bike. Whichever way you do it, it's well worth it!

ACCESS IS EASY FOR WHEELCHAIR USERS. When traveling with someone who uses a wheelchair, the access to Table Mountain Aerial cableway is very easy. You need to buy your tickets on-line with Webtickets if not going with an operator. You go in through the exit and take the elevator to 5th floor. there the staff are helpful and get you aboard the cable car quickly. On the mountain, some of the paths are rather awkward to get over - rough for chairs and bouncy, a push up the steep incline is manageable with a rest in between. The views are stunning and the atmosphere up there is magical. You cannot do a circular route due to steps at the cable station area blocking the way, but return via the same route. Spend at least 2 hours there to make it well worth your effort. New accessible loo in main cable station building is good. Parking though at lower cable station can be problematic with wheelchair users due to a step at disabled parking so disembark wheelchair users before you park. But enjoy this new "7 natural wonders of the world" and heritage site.
Tough climb up the gorge trail! But fun and beautiful. A must,, bring two bottles of water. Be in good shape for this gorge route. It's like stair master for two 1/2 hours. Super fun experience.

A must do when in Cape Town. Make sure to book this on a non-cloudy day (also note that sometimes the Table Mountain is closed due to heavy winds so make sure to verify they are open (via the internet) before driving up there).
Fantastic views. Well worth the visit, brilliant ride on the cable car, excellent information during the visit , brilliant walks and a relaxing drink at the cafe. Little shops worth a visit.

Loved the view. We visited the park twice, once during the day and once at sunset; the latter was an exceptionally beautiful visit that offered fantastic view of the city. Not easy to get there later in the day due to heavy traffic, but worth every bit of effort. Magnificent!
Fantastic. The park is really big - from Cape Town to cape of good hope. There are many trekkings but you can also go buy car. You can download the map with things interesting to visit.

Beautiful mountain . We hiked for 2 hours on this beautiful mountain then took the cable cars down. It has so many beautiful plants we were lucky the weather was nice on that day . If we come back to Cape Town again we might take a different route climbing .

Spectacular view.. You can cut the time of waiting in line by purchasing your ticket online. It is the same price as on the spot, but it can cut your time in line, if there are a lot of people going up. The view is spectacular.

Great experience. Table moutain is a must see if you in the city. Awesome experience with breath taking views.. The cofee shop at the top offers a fantastic selection for you to enjoy while taking in the spectacular views..

Better Than Expected. This was much better than I expected. The view from the top was amazing. Prepare to hike on top of the mountain for an hour or two. There is a ton to do when you get to the top. Restaurant is also pretty good.

Great place to get views of Cape Town. This is a great place to go to see the wonder of Cape Town. The views are amazing. You can see the lion's head as well. going in the evening and seeing the sunset was a highlight of the trip
plenty to do. We have had a few visits in this area and truly enjoyed,just entrance for some sites quite expensive considering the wages in South Africa.
The views are out of this world.... If you like hiking or don't (take the aerial cablecar) this is worth the trip just for the views......
Cable lift is for pussies. More than we expected it to be! What a view over the Cape Town Harbour as well as over the whole peninsula. Worth the hike up the mountain!

Amazing view. Wonderful place you can see all the city from the top helpful staff and they keep smiling what I really like how they organiza the place whatever it was crowed it but u didn't feel it good job!you must go there never miss this opportunity
A wonderful experience.. Table Mountain is amazing, the views and walks are spectacular. Do the sun downer ride up, relax, see the sun set and then the whole of Cape Town lit up. Not to be missed.

A must do in Cape Town. I have always wanted to visit Cape Town and the top of Table Mountain. The weather was amazing and the view was breathtaking. The top of the mountain is wheelchair accessable for my friend which was great, she could enjoy the views too.

A challenge for hikers . We went there on August 10th 2016, it was the end of winter but was still cold. We decided to trek to the top, and there are some trekking routes. When we were half way, we saw a sign pointing to our left side saying "to the top 2 hours more or less" and one of us decided that we will not take the normal route, from that sign we climbed up, so we struggled 3 hours in the rocky area and we found ourselves in the middle of nowhere and the higher we got, the more freezing it was. So we decided to go down. It was rocky and I would suggest it for those who love rock climbing. We met some locals in the evening and they said the locals enjoy trekking the mountain in other seasons not winter. They said we are mad. Besides the weird experience, the view that you get while climbing is thrilling. The other option which is much easier is the cable.

a must do!. We booked on line and as it was a good day for weather there was as expected a long Q but as already booked there was a separate Q and took about 20 mins to get to the cable car. Views as expected wonderful and shouldn't be missed. You have to take camera. Our teenagers did the Africa Abseil which left me a little worried but they loved it! The walk back up they said was the worst part as stones very wet and sloppy. Allow 1/2 a day for this one.

Absolutely brilliant views!!. I couldn't have hoped for a better experience. The staff are very professional, the Gondola ride is smooth and fast. The complex at the top of the mountain is first class, even have free WiFi and a restaurant and a cafe. The views are breathtaking and spectacular. You can even see the Cape of Good Hope. Wear comfortable walking shoes and be ready for strong gusts of wind. Don't forget your camera and an extra memory card.
Great views. Table Mountain sports great panoramic views and some nice hikes, as promised! It's a great way to spend most of a day, while enjoying lunch at the café on the top of the mountain.

Spectacular!. To begin with, I did not have the words to express how beautiful this place is! We (my husband, 6 year old daughter and I) made our way up on a sunny morning, and the cable ride was breathtaking. We started off with a warm breakfast, and moved on to exploring. The view from every angle and every space is simply beautiful. From views across the Waterfront to the little beaches to the hills beyond, it is just a tribute to the majesty of Mother Nature. I cannot wait to go back in two years, as my husband and I will be celebrating 10 years of wedded bliss, and where better to celebrate than the beautiful Cape!
Perfect hike! . We chose to hike all the way up. Took us approx. 2,5 h with beautiful surroundings and when you got to the top it was so worth it. Amazing view. Would definately do it again!

Go for a sundowner. My sister and I took my 7 month old neice up in the cable car an hour before sunset. We walked around at the top, had a coffee and watched the sunset!! So very beautiful. Views are incredible!!

Great for a clear day. Make sure you go there when it is clear up there. And if you are visiting Capetown for 4-5 days then mark it as a top priority, because you might not even get a chance to go up there.When we went to the top (the only day it was open), it was all covered with clouds, so really couldn't see the view. Overall experience was great - from parking to cable car to roaming around at the top to the refreshments at the cafe.In winters, it gets really cold up there.Visited in July 2013.

Great views. One of the best things to do on a clear day in Cape Town. The views are awesome. Bring good shoes if you plan to hike the trail on top. It takes about 1.5 hours if you walk the whole trail.

A definite must do!. Absolutely stunning views from this natural wonder of the world. Make sure you do it as soon as you have a clear day because the clouds are unpredictable. Also make sure you buy your tickets beforehand so you do not have to line up in the ridiculous queue. Maybe try and go in the morning as the line to get back down the mountain was an hour wait for us, in winter! Absolutely worth it though!

Incredible Hiking but can be Challenging. Though I have been to Table Mountain numerous times, I only hiked it the most recent trip. While the view from the stop is breathtaking, the journey up (easier than down) puts the majesty of this landmark and the wonderful city in better perspective and forces the participant to savor the experience.
Stunning Views of Capetown and Beyond. Table Mountain is not be be missed by any visitors to the Western Cape. Views are stunning and flora are amazing.
Amazing views. Travelled with family, cable car was really quick and efficient- we pre-booked which saved time queueing

You need to be fit. You need to be fit in order to hike Table Mountain.
Bring minimum two litres of water with you and walk/hike slowlly.
The path is not so easy how people could think. Be aware about the fatigue and the hot weather.
The hike will be 2-3 hours long.

Magnificent. WOW. Table Mountain National Park is terrific.The view that you can enjoy from its top is breathtaking. One of the best thing that I have even seen in my life.Personally, I walked up and it was quite tough.It is not like a normal walk but you have to hike, sweat a lot, drink a lot and be awake that you have to " do your best" for two hours and half in order to reach the top.I DO NOT SUGGEST THIS ACTIVITY TO OLD OR FAT PEOPLE. Believe me, this activity is quite hard.Infact to go down, I took the cable that it was very expensive. 125 R one way and 5 minutes of journey. Unbeliavable.Anyway, the view from the top is beautiful and it will be one of the best memories of your life.

Wow. It's a little bit hard to hike this mountain at the beginning, but you'll manage as I did it. Enjoy the views while hiking and when you'll arrive at the summit, enjoy a nice walk around as a sightseeing.
Picturesque Cape Town. Table mountain as definitely one the places to visit in Cape Town. The stretched view of never ending beauty cape town is seen here.

Must do!. Absolutely beautiful. We took the cable car up because my fiancé is afraid of heights and it was great. Amazing views, we got some beautiful pictures. It's just incredible. Make sure to check the website for weather because you don't want to go on a cloudy day. We waited until the afternoon when the clouds cleared so our views were amazing!

Wuthering heights, sweeping views of Cape Town and Table Bay, stunning beauty. A well organized system of queuing, albeit a long wait because of the many visitors, but count 30-40 minutes in line. A cable car that seems to be well looked after and safe and up on the top the possibility of a view that is remarkable. The gift-shop is a place of refuge while waiting for the trip down or to seek protection from icy winds.

A visit to Table Mountain is essential. Table Mountain is one of the highlights in Cale Town and not to be missed. Queues at the bottom are sizeable but the cable car takes 65 people so it moves at a reasonable pace. We waited 1 hour which looked fairly constant during the visit. I'd recommend buying tickets online to minimise the wait as you're likely to be on board within 20 minutes. At the top you are free to wander some considerable distance. The views are spectacular and we were fortunate enough to see several dassies. I'd suggest allowing 3 hours for your visit.
Do not skip!. Splendid views and walks around. Do not foget some warm clothes in winter, it's quite high and chilling sometimes.
Lovely. Lovely area, great views. We visited in late August which was the perfect time. Not too crowded, perfect weather.

Unforgettable experience!. It's one thing to see Table Mountain from below. It's another to go up the mountain with the cable car and look down on the city, the oceans and surrounding area. It's an altogether different experience hiking Table Mountain. If you're not up for hiking up AND down, take the cable car one way and hike the other. But take the hike, if you dare. You won't regret it.

Absolutely breathtaking. This is a view and a mountain that you will never get tired of. Walk up and take the cable car down, or take the car up and walk down. Walk on one of the many guided tours, overnight in the park with guides, just go there!

wonderful views. Magnificent , frequent cable car. Spectacular experience.. The view of the city of Cape Town and surrounds from the top of Table MOuntain is unforgettable. Easy to travel up the mountain in a modern cable car with excellent views. A must !

Great hikes and views. Do a bit of research to find out alternate hiking routes besides Platteklip up Table Mountain. Skeleton Gorge was great! Hiking up and maybe taking the cable car down is a must when in CT

Interesting and beautiful but bloody hell... the queues. Excellent experience and thoroughly worthwhile however the queues were horrendous. Make sure you pre-book your ticket in advance online or prepare for a royal rumble!

OMG its so big up there. Take hiking shoes!!. Views were the best i've ever seen, we walked for 2 hours solid and still didnt cover all of it (i've still got a huge blister actually). Watch out for the mist, it can close in pretty quick and whilst there are defined paths, you will feel cold and alone :). Such a fab experience but dress appropriately.

Stunning especially in good weather. Take the open top bus and get off at the cable car for the Tabke Mountain National Park. Expect to queue but it's well worth it. Spent 3 hours walking around the park, looking at the sights and just taking in the beauty of it all. Icon views from it and to it from below - don't miss
The best views of Cape Town.. The best views of Cape Town. The weather is really unpredictable so it is really a question of luck.

Nice stroll with good view. Wouldn't exactly call this a hike. The ride up is fun, as the gondola rotates. Once there, its very flat. a few cute rat-like mammals, the option to rappel plus a cafe with slow service and cafeteria food.

Be sure to go on a clear day. The day we went the skies were clear. This made our experience absolutely wonderful. We could see the coastline for miles. The mountain gives you spectacular views from all directions. Be sure to bring a jacket and WATER! You can get dehydrated with the wind and sun and not realize it. The weather can change quickly. If recommend leaving enough time to walk to all points of the mountain top. Our time was limited so we did not get to go to the outlying areas.Comfortable shoes are a must!!!Great venue.

Spectacular views. Great views from the top on what was a nice clear day. First thing in the morning the crowds weren't too bad but by lunchtime they had built up a lot. est to buy your tickets before going to the cableway to avoid the queue. the red "hop on hop off" bus is an ideal way to get to the cableway from the city.

a must see. the views from table mountain are spectacular even when the weather is not at its best.
however he does get very cold at the top so do go prepared - there is one small coffee shop if you need to warm up
Waoh!. We walked up (and down) Table Mountain, as the cable car was closed for maintenance! Steep walk, but well worth it to see those amazing views!!!
Not to be missed. Great views but chose a day which is not misty -so just in case - if it is sunny take the trip. Don't leave it till the last day of your visit in case you miss out
A wonder of the world which is easy to visit.. A spectacular view and an easy place to visit if using the cable car facility. Buitifuly maintained a real treasure.

Very Cool. Just beware of the mist. Also, hang on to your belongings as some guy dropped his camera off the mountain by accident. Very funny.
Book in advance is also the key. Bring and umbrella for the sun and bring lots of water.

Daytrip of a lifetime. Its a good idea to watch Table Mountain website for the weather updates!! AND buy your tickets there online. Cheaper and one que less when you get there. Remember to pack warm clothes as its colder up there! AND good walking shoes even if youre not hiking. Go early and have breakfast and lunch up there. Good place to eat.

Seven wonders of the world will make you wander.. It is indeed a spectacular place to be, on top of the world. The Ariel view is amazing. Take comfy walking shoes to explore the flora and faun on top of the mountain as there is big space to walk and explore. Summer take sunscreen, hats and sun glasses. Winter carry your jackets. There are shops on top of the mountain for a snack or drinks but you could take your own up. The beautiful mountain allows you to have spectacular views of the entire Cape Town. A real magnificent splendour

This MUST be on your bucket list. What an amazing icon. If you don't have this place on your bucket list. Add it NOW!!! The view is out of this world. The National Park is clean. The cable car is a MUST or take a walk up the mountain on one of many foot paths. spend at least 4 to 5 hours on top

A must do in Cape Town. Hiking up Table Mountain or taking a cable car ride up to the top is a must. Easiest route to hike up is Platteklip Gorge, which is the obvious crack running diagonally up the centre of the mountain. Follow the well posted signs. Table Mountain is hiked by everyone, tourists, visitors and Capetoinians with friends and family, adventure athletes etc.

Excellent infrastructure. The pathways on virtually any part of the greater Table Mountain, which covers a great distance, thru forest or fynbos, are in generally great condition. You could be on Kalk Bay mountain on the False Bay coast, or in the upper reaches of Newlands forest, heading towards Kirstenbosch (Botanical Gardens)...and there will be boardwalks, even chains when necessary for climbing. Paths in the most remote spots, like approaching Silvermine peak as an example, will have been created with rocks etc.

Stunning views. A must visit whilst in Cape Town. Book your ticket beforehand to avoid queues and choose a fine day. Cable car whisks you up the mountain in no time for the most spectacular views. Good walk around the top of the mountain takes roughly an hour with photo stops.

Visiting Cape Town must include a Hike. All the hikes on Table Mountain are awesome. You need to select the one most suitable for your group and level of fitness and make sure you are properly prepared as weather and circumstances can change. The different seasons each have their own magic in the fynbos. Winter can be too wet in places. Research your route beforehand.

Worthwhile outing even for south-africans. Was always meaning to visit the park but never got round to it. Finally with a trip to Simons Town we did a half-day trip. I was pleasantly surprised! Once again a very well run operation by san parks. Guests & look forward to a funicular lift which is rather unique in this parts of the world. The views are spectacular & has plenty of picnic spots which we will make use of next time round.

Misty Hike. I've done Table Mountain only twice, with two different groups. It was cold as hell, and raining very lighty. In some way I preferred that. I think you will die of heat if it's too hot. The only sad thing is we could not swim at the reservoirs because of the cold (well some did). We entered just on the other side of Kirtstenbosch to avoid entrance money and then hiked through it to get to Skeleton Gorge. It is not as bad as people say, but take your fit friends. Fit friends did the hike up in 2 hours and the hike down in 1 hour 30min. Unfit friends did the hike up in 3 hours and the hike down in another 3 hours. Take enough water, snacks, towels, swimgear and your first aid kit.
Wonderful Views. Wonderful views then the clouds come in and you can only hear people and not see anyone or anything. Best to go on a clear day

A highlight in Capetown. A must do if you are in Cape Town one of the best thing we have ever done. Just make sure you book the cable car tickets in advance if you don't want to hike it! we went up with the cable car and came doen by foot, what a wonderful experience.
Beautiful. Lovely experience though when we went up there it was foggy and we could not get a proper view from the top.
Spectacular hike and cable car day. A world class experience for whole families.Great views and an elevated view of Cape Town and 2 oceans.

A must do! . My husband and I had four days in Cape Town and on the first clear sunny day we opted to see table mountain. We had the intention of getting the cable car up, however with the weather been so sunny the queue was very very long!! We opted to hike it instead...even though a challenging and hot walk when you get to the top none of that matters, as the panoramic views over Cape Town are just magnificent! With walking up you kind of get an added thrill of a sense of achievement. We did get the cable car back down (you can purchase tickets to get down from the top and the queue wasn't that long). A must do if you are in Cape Town one of the best things I've ever done. Just make sure you book the cable car tickets in advance if you don't want to hike it!

Best Hike Ever. If you can swing 4.5 hours, hike to the top of Table Mountain (a little under 3 hours with stops) and enjoy the thrill of a tough climb followed by amazing views and a cable car ride down. One of our top highlights in Capetown. Not an easy hike so make sure you are prepared for stair climbs for 2.5 hours.

An iconic global spot. One of the most famous spots in the world for centuries now. Great walking which can be approached from various directions. A world heritage site. Two suggestions for visitors. Wear multiple layers of clothing and even when weather looks great take some protective clothing. The weather can change in minutes. Second is to be aware of personal security. Try not to take valuables. There have been many muggings over the years. Please enjoy and try not to walk alone. Walk in groups.

Nice walk. Very windy up there but nice view and would be good if you have time to hike a bit. I spent an hour up there and was able to see views from both sides, took some picture simulating standing or sitting on a cliff. Buy tickets online to avoid long lineup and go early in the morning. Be ware of maintenance close off every year in last part of July and early August.

Incredible views. Two families of four (kids 14 and 16) travelling. Took the hop on hop off bus (great value!) to Table Mountain. Amazing views of Cape Town. While it was warm while waiting in the line to enter, it's colder and windier than you think when you get to the top of the mountain, so dress in layers. Order your tickets on-line prior to arriving so that you can wait in the shorter line to enter. Don't forget to hike on both sides of Table Mountain, as the views are incredible all the way around. Bring some snacks of your own as the restaurant at the top of the Table Mountain is VERY slow. Should have walked down on the descent, but that's not for everyone.
A must do!. Great views of Cape Town and overall fun experience riding the cable car. Definitely book your tickets online to save time.

An absolute must do!. Unique experience. #1 thing you should do in Cape Town. Amazing views and lots of interesting trails to follow. As an American was amazed that there were no railings or warning signs along the trails that if you misstepped there were sheer drops of thousands of feet -- scary but breathtaking.

Excellent views. Finally the cloth cleared from the table and we were able to ascend via the cable car. The queues were modest so we got to the top quickly. The wildlife there was fascinating and the views breathtaking.

Beautiful views from Table Mountain. We took the cable car up to Table Mountain. It's a swift ride but the inside rotates ensuring everyone gets the same views. Once we arrived at the top, it was not over crowded and we were able to wander around and take in all of the amazing views. We saw people hiking up during our cable car ride. Since we were with a tour group, we did not have this option but we recommend it if you can do it - should be about a couple hours hike up. We highly recommend arriving with pre-purchased tickets before it even opens because the lines are massive all day every day.

Fantastic views, queues could move faster. A trip up Table Mountain is absolutely recommended! The views are stunning!! Go prepared for strong winds, it is pretty chilly up there! Buy your tickets in advance, something we weren't aware of which consequently meant we waited an extra 30 minutes before we were allowed to the ticket office. We also noted that although the cable cars can hold 60 people, there were only 40 or so in each one, which with the huge queues seemed a bit odd as it could have moved a bit quicker!

Awesome Views!. The views from the top of Table Mountain are just incredible! Highly recommend getting up there. Can be windy and cold though so bring layers (or maybe because we were there during their winter months). There are places to get a hot drink and food if you need some time out from the cold. And a very nice gift store that had a fireplace with a much appreciated fire going when we were there!

amazinggggggggggggg. best place to be when you visit capetown...amazing view you can see the whole cape town from table mountain.cape car is a must go...awesome experience...worth every minute spend over there

Spectacular View of Cape Town. Excellent destination for adults and children where you can have a full view of the city. There are cable cars to take you from the bottom to the top. You also have the option of hiking up the mountain and climbing down (pretty frightening if you ask me). Make sure to book online as the line for the ticket office is unreal and there's a separate line for those who've purchased tickets online that moves a lot quicker. Also make sure to check the weather beforehand as there are a lot of cloudy days so the vision could be poor or the cable cars might be closed. There's a cafe and souvenir shop at the top where you can relax and enjoy the view.

The Best. You cannot visit South African (and Cape Town) without visiting Table Mountain. This is a truly spectacular way of spending a day. The trip up and down and the time on top of the mountain with breathless views and nature in abundance is a must for all visitors.The operation of the aerial cable way is weather dependant. It gets incredibly busy and I would strongly recommend you do it early in the day or risk long queues.

Heaven and back. We went on a foggy day with Zero visibility.. though we could not see much of anything.. the experience of going high up in the cable car felt amazing.. We hardly got any wait as we had bought our tickets online..and maybe most people just didn't come due to the weather.. We got up to the top.. took loads of pics and settled for a warm cup of hot chocolate at the restaurant. this is a must do for everyone..

Simply Amazing!!. What a beautiful experience!! Visiting the top of Table Mountain National Park provided a great view of Capetown (land and see). It was a great day to travel... Thankfully perfect weather and the cable car was a fun way to travel there. This landmark is a must see... Phenomenal Time!!

Spectacular Views. I took the cable car to Table Mountain and after just observing the trail, I'm glad I did. The views from here are spectacular and one could spend hours here just relaxing and taking in nature's beauty.
Reality. What we saw on TV and in photos, was before us. Unfortunately, the cable car was under maintenance and so we could not go to the top

Spectacular View of Capetown. The cable car takes you from the lower cable station and drops you onto the Table Mountain. You can view the entire Cape Town from the table top and it is amazing. There is a restaurant at the top where you can sit and have a good time.
Natural world wonder. Excellent destination for couples or families. Be sure to check the weather and make sure that the cable car is open.

Beautiful place in South Africa. One of the seven wonders of nature, amazing view, very safe to get to the top of the mountain. Very helpful staff, lounge with free wi-fi, cakes and hot beverages, shop to get some souvenirs and marked trails to do. Just perfect!

Best view of Capetown. Well organised entry into the cable car area, although a fairly long wait if you haven't pre purchased your tickets - highly recommend you do this. The cable car itself is very modern and it's a smooth ride up. The views are spectacular, a different vista at each corner. There is a well stocked cafe if you fancy lunch or a cool drink.

A must view and must di. What not to rave about in this national park! Outstanding setup with trails and description of the areas to be seen, excellent amenities at the top with the wifi lounge and easy access for people in wheelchairs. Take the time to walk on the trails, this can take up to a few hours if you do them all. Expect some mountain terrain so get some light hiking shoes or rugged sneakers (most of path is on flat rocks but it can get slippery in wet conditions). Beautiful views, enjoy the nature. Be quiet and do not speak too loud to enjoy without disrupting wildlife.
fantastic visite. one of the best places i have been breathtaking i enjoyed every minute of ita must visit for everyone

Climbing Table Mountain. We always love taking visitors up Table Mountain and walking up Platteklip is a good work out! Obviously our mountain boasts beautiful views at the top so the walk is always worth it!

Truly one of the new Natural Wonders. We spent a couple of hours up on Table Mountain watching the Dassies and walking through the Fynbos. It really is worth the trip - the view over the City Bowl make it worth it. Try the wifi lounge for a decent espresso with amazing views.
A park for views. You can get amazing views from both sides of Table Mountain, so not only Cape Town. Mind your step though, since the wall that guards the precipice can be very low at some points.

Hiked up Skeleton Gourge. Have to say if you go to Cape Town, you need to go to Table Mountain, whether you hike or take the cable car (cheat), the views from up top are amazing. Though a few words of warning about hiking, make sure you take more water then you think on hotter days and take something to snake on, as all the trails will take you longer then you think.

Visit to Table Mountain on the Cable Car. This was an amazing experience. The weather was superb, not a cloud in the sky and very good visibility. The cable car had been shut for maintenance but was re-opened on the day we went. It was very crowded but we got up after waiting about an hour. The queue moved quite quickly. Wonderful cable car which rotates enabling everyone to get an excellent view. On arrival at the top it was hard to know which way to look first. We immediately saw a number of dassies. There were also quite a few flowers despite it being winter. I'd been told it would be cold up there, but itwas actually quite warm. View amazing.

Birds eye view . Simply the best city in the world. Effective transportation and plenty walking areas available. Table mountain a must, by cable car or hiking. The view from the top is just awesome. Beautiful hiking along the prominade and beaches. The waterfront very nice for chopping and dining.

Amazing!!. The view at Table Mountain is breathtaking! You can either hike or take a cable car there. It's about a 2-hour hike. The cable car line forms early. So I'd recommend arriving early. You can take pictures at any angle. I only wish I had more time there!
Many steps to climb. This is a nice exercise but very touristy and you have to climb many steps to the top. The view is beautiful though and you can take your time to the top!
Can't beat the views and wonderful sighs. A must for Cape Town. You have to go, you can't come to Cape Town and not go up, the views are simply A1.

Excllent. A must See when in south Africa. Anyone who travels to south Africa must go on this attraction. It is very refreshing and breathtaking to get a view high above sea level. I do recommend spending sometime at the shops and cafe that are available once you arrive on the 10 min ride up the mountain.
Great views of Cape Town. Great views of cape town ! We had gone on a clear day in winter and the queue was long. A tip is to buy tickets online beforehand.

Stunning vistas.. I highly recommend the tram up and walk around Table Mountain. You get an up close view of the veld, and a spectacular view of Cape Town, the ocean, and Robben Island in the distance. Definitely worth the trip.

Steep mountain climb. The climb was spectacular but filled with some challenges . The climb up was steep and filled with rocks . There were beautiful small waterfalls . It was slippery in sections so I would suggest hiking books or good tennis shoes .
Wow. Amazing views and...baboons!. Take the drive all the way around. Cape point, the cape of good hope, and the sweet little towns along the way make this a must see when in Cape Town.

Incredibly worth it!. Hiking up the Table Mountain was one of the coolest experiences I had in South Africa. It took me roughly 2h to get to the top, and it does get pretty hot on the way up sometimes, but it's definitely worth it, since you get rewarded with an amazing view from the Table Mountain, aaand also it's free. Just go for it!
Stunning view!. The view from the top of the Table Mountain was also incredible! The mountains, the sea, the city, they all together create an amazing landscape. It's a must do in Cape Town.

waste of time and no access due to services.. We especially wanted to experience this adventure whilst in the mother city. No communication at all not even on the website saying when they will be out of bussiness. We wasted our limited time arriving to nothing.

Fantastic First in the morning. If you come by cruise ship don't do the ship tour here. Leave the ship no latter than 8am if possible & catch a taxi straight to the cable car to go to the top of Table Mountain.On the way there negotiate a price between $80 US & $100 for the day.The driver will wait for you while you go up to the top. Spend a fair time up there for some fantastic photo opertunities. As you come down you will see all the tours from the ship lined up sometimes until 1330 hrs. Back in the cab & go to the cape where the two oceans meet,then back to the city for a walk around & shopping.You will have done 3 ship tours in one day all for $25 each with another couple sharing.Being up the mountain first thing in the morning is normally the clearest view.We found by lunch time the tours couldn't see much @ all & we're not happy.
Great Views. We really enjoyed our trip to Table Mountain and will be back. We could have spent all day up there. As always with South Africa, very clean facilities and great people.

great day out for the family. fabulous day out with the kids. i recommend booking tickets early, online to avoid the queue. parking is a big hassle. take the public transport or a taxi instead. the views were breathtaking. the entire beauty of Capetown can be seen from up above the mountain. check the weather before going as the mountain access is normally closed if its cloudy. wear appropriate clothing and shoes.

Do not miss!. We went up and spent about 1+ hours, walking around, enjoying the views....totally a must see in Cape Town! The ride up in the gondola was also a delight. We lucked out and there was no line, you can also check online for the wait times to plan your visit.
AMazing. This is the best spot ever in the world, Amazing nature, landscape and environments! Good energies good vibes
Day outing. Took my daughter, who is on a visit from Spain, on a day trip to Cape Point.The weather was perfect - not a breath of wind - and we had a wonderful time.

Amazing, quite rightly one of the 7 wonders on the world. We walked the India venster trail and it was stunning. The plants, animals, views are all incredible. It was challenging too including scrambling and climbing. Don't take the much walked platteklip gorge. We walked down it as the cable car was closed for maintenance and it was dull.

Cape of Good Hope. We toured the Cape of Good Hope, which is part of the National Park. We took the Funicular to Cape Point. Although this isn't the southernmost point in Africa, it is the one I read about as a child. We took some great photos and got a real feel for the wind and ocean currents (zesty!).

The highlight of a trip to Cape Town. We were a family group of 11. Four of us walked up which took just under 2 hours. The rest of us took the cable car and we arrived just before the others. It is a fairly strenuous climb so only for fit people. The views from the top of Table Mountain are truly spectacular so if you have binoculars or telephoto lenses take them with you. There is a cafe at the top which opens at 10.30. Queues for the cable car can be long but it was easier coming down. Although the park is free the cable car is not.
Beautiful. We took the bus tour and were not disappointed. The view is spectacular! It was a day trip and this was one of the stops.
a view from the gods. outstanding, world class experience. Go there on a clear day and you can see it all. strongly recommend nice weather as it can be challenging in windy weather

At World's End!!. Awesome experience. Visited during winter so there wasn't a large crowd. Bring a jacket if visiting during Winter! The view from the top is amazeballs! There is a gift shop and a restaurant at the top of the mountain once you use the cable cars to the top spent hours there without getting bored. Saw some rock climbers there too (scary), some rare animals (dassies) and birds too. It has something for everyone whether Adults or Kids.

An outstanding panorama. From Cable Mountain, you can see the southern tip of Africa, Cape Aquila, where the Indian and Atlantic oceans meet. An outstanding view from which you can also see Cape of Good Hope, the most SW point of Africa. If you've been so fortunate to cruise around the Cape Horn of South America, you will appreciate this view even more. Much to see all around this area. The ride up is breathtaking.
