Fantastic Views. This is the place to go for fantastic views over the whole of the Cape. It is an absolute MUST if you are in CT. Either ride up, but prepared for a long wait at peak times, or walk up - very hot in the valley up the face of the mountain. Just make sure you have plenty of water to drink and a good hat if you are walking.

Different ways to the top. U don't have to take the cable car. U can climb but be prepared for a challenge! U need a reasonable level of fitness, take plenty of water too. Views at the top are stunning. Give yourself about 2-2.5 hours to climb up. If u r super fit it may be quicker. I walked up and took the cable car down (125 Zar). U can buy ticket in the shop at the top but take cash as CC machines don't always work.
Table Mountain Cable Car. We headed up the mountain by cable car as a family and thoroughly enjoyed the scenery. The ticket lines where long, but moved fast.
Visiting table mountain. City tours offer you an all day ticket for c 11 English pounds - takes you all over Cape-Town and to the top of Table Mountain. Fantastic. You can also hop on and hop off bus

Truly wonderful. There are amazing views from this location ... even starting from where you queue up for the cable car. At the top it's best to wander around and have a good look at all the views on offer. There's a few options available in terms of walks at the top - not too long so do have a go !!
Must Do. We took the cable car after hearing nightmares about the hike up the mountain. Do a little research, as there are a number of paths to the top.

Beautiful- Just Make sure to go early enough!. This was a MUST on my Cape Town "To Do" list, so when it was 4:00 on the last day we were in Cape Town, we decided to climb the mountain, against the advice of our hotel. It was a beautiful hike, more advanced than we had anticipated, but there is virtually no light or cabs waiting if you are coming back down around dusk. Just make sure to plan accordingly!
Fun Walk with the Boys today. What a fantastic day on this amazing mountain. Even though we could have taken the cable car we walked up instead. Totally worth it but will go up earlier next time.

Nice Drive, Nice Climb, Nice Cableway. This Park overlooks Cape Town and the Atlantic seaboard. It is the home to a very scenic drive, but one that will end with you having to turn around at present. It also includes the Table Mountain Aerial Cableway, which is the subject of its own Trip Advisor review page. Beyond driving the scenic road or taking the cableway, you can also climb up Table Mountain from within the Park. It is a nice climb up on a good day.

Amazing View!!. There were a lot of people there too on the day as the weather had been bad for a few days prior and that it was the last day to visit before the cable car up the Table Mountain is closed for 2 weeks for its annual maintenance/inspection. So everyone tried to grape on to the last opportunity to see the mountain. We rushed to go up the Table Mountain 9 minutes before gate closes for the day - we got there in time and was lucky to therefore see the day view, dust view and night view of the city and Camps Bay area from the top of Table Mountain. The view was stunningly beautiful.

the view is worth it. Would advise to purchase your tickets online from your hotel from a stable wifi. We went on our first day in Cape Town but the line was extremely long and the wifi in the surrounding area was down so you weren't able to purchase it online. We ended up coming back later in the week and experienced Table Mountain on a clear day. If you purchase your ticket online you can use it within 7 days I believe. its a great view and was impressed how much room there was to walk around when at the top of the mountain. There also were no barriers protecting from a fall so tourists are quite free to roam and get their perfect advantageous photo.

Jewel in the Crown. The number 1 place to visit in my book - stunning views of Cape Town and the whole coastal area. But don't take the easy way up in the cable car - instead, hike up slowly and enjoy the process.
Great climb!. Climbed up and got the cable car down. Fantastic experience! Climb is very manageable. Stunning views on climb up. A must see!
Visit to Table Mountain. We went on cloudy, it was very cold and windy and hardly to see anything from top, we advise to go on clear/ sunny day to enjoy the view.

Spectacular views but crowded at the viewpoints. We arrived there early for the first cable car of the day but already there was a significant queue forming. On top of the mountain the views were specatcular as we were lucky enough to fluke a clear day. Walking tracks abound and I was impressed by walkers doing the arduous trek both up and down the mountain. Also abseiling from some of the high points. Well worth the visit - an easy half day round trip from the centre of Cape Town.

Amazing view and easy walk at the summit. We took the cable car up to the top and walk over the table top. At the beginning the mountain was covered by clouds. It was an amazing view as we watched the clouds fall over the side of the mountain and disappear. As we walked through, we felt like the only two people in the vast, unexplored area. The cloud cover made the experience quite eerie yet romantic. As we reached the highest point, the cloud cover disappeared and opened the city below. It was truly magnificent and breath-taking.

Beautiful View of the Cape. This is a must do activity while in Cape Town! The views are breathtaking. It won't take long too take in this activity, but it will show you how close Cape Town is to heaven.
beautiful. if you love nature make sure to see the table mountain - breath taking views, great hikes and perfect to recharge your batteries

Cableway was out of order due to maintenance. So we had to walk up the mountain and back again. Which was a very exhausting hike, heavier than expected. Up took about 2,5 hours, and down not much less. Because the cableway was out of order, all the restaurants and bathrooms were closed as well, so if you decide to go up during this period you have to bring your own food and drink.

Amazing! . We walked up Table Mountain as we visited when the cable car was closed for maintenance. It took us just under 2 hours to reach the top and the same to get back down. The views from the top were sensational and well worth the hike. We went with a guide and he gave us lots of information about the mountain and park. He also made sure we took the walk steady and he knew the best path to take. We set off at 7.30am and were pretty much the first ones on the mountain. By the time we headed back down the mountain, the temperature had risen significantly and we met a lot of sweaty people going in the opposite direction. I would recommend setting off early, using a guide and wearing a good pair of shoes. Do not attempt to climb the mountain if you are not fit! It is also just as hard, if not a bit harder, coming back down the mountain than going up, but the feeling of accomplishment and the views are amazing and well worth the shaking legs.

Beautiful site. During our visit to Capetown the weather was mostly rainy, so we seized the opportunity to go on our last day. The lines for the cable car were an hour wait and another 1.5 hours to get back on the car to go down. It was quite cold, so advise to wear winter wear and be prepared for cold winds. The site is stunning and worth the wait, but come prepared for the low temps if going during winter!

Breath-takingly beautiful. Excellent views all around.. ticket prices are cheaper closer to sunset - I would suggest viewing the sunset and heading down as the queues start to really get long towards the final trips down the mountain. Lots of areas to explore and to relax and enjoy the magnificent scenery

GREAT VIEWING SPOT. I took the cable car up to the top of the mountain. there was a very long queue for the tickets as there appeared to be only two cars, one going up and one coming down. though it was winter and off season, it took me more than 30 minutes to get a ticket and more than an hour to get into the car. but it was worthwhile, once you get to the top and are able to get a 360 degree view of the mesmerizing Cape Town. one can hike it up also- medium difficulty and about 3 to 4 hours of hiking.

Not for the faint hearted. Firstly the cable car was being serviced so we walked up and down.This is a tough hike, there are a lot of large rocks to climb up and it can get very steep. It took us 2 hours 15 minutes to go up and 2 hours to come down, It's almost a hard descending. Let me say though the view at the top makes the hard work worth it! Absolutely beautiful and worth the effort.

Hiking vs. Cable Car. The Cable Car was being serviced when we visited so we took the Platteklip Gorge route. It's estimated to take 2 hours to climb, but it took us 3 hours. This is not an easy hike. It's very steep, with large rocks to climb. It felt great to reach the top and take in the views, but the climb down this route was almost harder than going up. If you're fit and experienced with climbing, go for it. If not, take the cable car and do some of the hiking routes at the top of the mountain.

Most Beautiful Hike of My Life!. I am so glad I hiked up Table Mountain. I went with 3 friends up directly behind the cable car station. It took about 4-5 hours all in direct sunlight. We all brought 1 L water, and we ran out before we reached the top. The route we took was very physically challenging, mostly due to the need for flexibility and good footing and climbing up over rock faces. The first hour or two were quite strenuous, while the remainder of the time was slow-going and focused. There were yellow marks that helped guide us, although sometimes it seemed too long in between and we would get worried. We took the cable car down due to being exhausted and dehydrated.

Even when foggy this height and place was amazing. Take the cable are up, almost straight up, and land on a beautiful place of heaven. Rock Hyrax will great you and you can get really close. There is a circular walk on top and the vies all round are lovely.

Well worth the money spent. I was so impressed when I took my wife up Table mountain, that I took my son the very next week. the view is stunning and the restaurant is well priced with a variety to suit all palates. Luuuuved it.
Stunning views. The trip up the cable is quick and soon you are at the top overlooking Cape Town and its beautiful views

Spectacular Views. Table mountain can be reached by cable car or by walking (about 2/3 hours) Once there the view over Cape Town is spectacular. On the top there are several walks of various lengths taking in more views and the natural flora of the area. At the top of the cable car is a shop, restaurant and a viewing area.

Just a fantastic experience.. We booked our tickets for the cable car along with our Hop on Hop Off bus tour, really good idea as you avoid the queues at the entrance to the cable car. The views are stunning, but you do have to have the right weather, we were very lucky. There are numerous walks that can be done at the summit and the flora and fauna as well as the rock formations make it a memorable experience.

Cannot miss this Capetown Landmark. it is impossible to count the number of advertisements of Capetown which show the Table Mountain in the background. Same was it is impossible to not visit this place. However you have to be lucky with the weather to get the chance to visit the place. A beautiful Aerial Cable way takes you to the top of Table Mountain, and the views of Capetown from the top are breath taking. Lots of picture opportunities. A warm cup of coffee at the cafe adds to the pleasure of such a wonderful place. Due to weather restrictions try to finish this place first and not keep for the next days as you don't know if the cable way is open or not. Book your ticket online to skip the queues.

Tough climb. We climbed table mountain via the gorge trail as the cable car was being serviced. This trail is a large stone trail all the way up. It is not an easy hike. The views from the top are sweeping and incredible. A must see in Cape Town! I would have preferred to take the cable car up and down and expend my energy hiking all over the top of table mountain. Still a must see in Cape Town.

Amazing views. Take some time out of your afternoon and catch a lift to the top of Table Mountain. There is also a cafe/restaurant at the top where you can get food, coffee, beer, wine etc. I easily spent a couple hours up there - amazing part of the trip.
It's very good with beautiful scenery. Going to the top f table mountain s an experience and the views are wonderful not good if the tablecloth cloud is over the mountain.

Very good views!!. If you are in Capetown or south in South Africa, it is worth to visit this Park; interesting conformation, great views and easy to walk. Very appropriate to walk with children and dogs, due to the extensions on which they can safely run and play.
Breathtaking!!. Must visit this place.. We nearly missed it due to the weather. Click lots of pictures. Best time to visit is during the SA winter. Also has very nice cafe.

Excellent 360 view of Cape Town and surrounding area!. If the weather is bad or very windy, Table Mountain shuts down. So prepare that if you can't see it one day then try another day. Recommend going at the opening of the day otherwise it will be a long lines for waiting. Beautiful view.
Spectacular Cape Town view!. A must Cable Car trip up Table Mountain. Spectacular view in all directions once on top of The Mountain!

Beautiful view of Cape Town. The last thing we did before leaving Cape Town to return home, and I'm glad we were able to fit it in. It is a beautiful view of the city, and a fun experience to ride the cable car(floor rotates as you go).
outstanding. The place is amazing.. I was impressed with the intricate details of the place, and the way everything was organized despite huge crowds making use of a sunny day.

Great views. You can't visit Cape Town and not visit Table Mountain.
We took the cable car which in itself is an experience. The views, the sunset and the dassies all makes the trip worth the cost.
And the walks, you can actually go for walks once you're up there.
Nothing but amazing!

Weekend in Cape Town. A must visit when in Cape Town. Occupies the Centre of Cape Town and visible from different parts of the city. There are two ways of getting up the mountain, by cable car and for the more adventurous hiking up the mountain. I would recommend a visit when in Cape Town.

The view!. The park covers most of the higher areas of Cape Town - from signal hill around Table Mountain. Great and easily accessible by car to take someone that just arrived in Cape Town to show him/her your favorite city.

An Endless Variety of Magical Hikes. Table Mountain National Park has Four main attractions that one must pay for to gain access:Table Mountain Cable CarKirstenbosch Botanical GardensThe Penguin Boardwalk at BouldersCape Point National ParkApart from these, there are countless walks and hikes that can take as little as a half hour to as much as a day or longer. Most are suitable for single hikers, couples, and Families with younger or older children - Not really suitable for babies unless they are being carried.Massive 221 Square KmTable Mountain National Park stretches from north of Cape Town down the Cape Peninsula to Africa’s southwestern extremity, the Cape of Good Hope. Iconic, flat-topped Table Mountain is its centerpiece. in sizeThe mountain’s 1,086m summit affords sweeping views of Cape Town and Table Bay, and is reachable by cableway, bicycle, automobile or on foot. The park is also among the world’s richest floral regions.It is also the country’s most photographed attraction and its famous cable car has taken millions of people to its top.Table Mountain has become the single most welcoming icon to South Africans, and travellers from all over the world.There are about 2,200 species of plants found on Table Mountain and 1470 floral species. The Cape Floral region of the national park is one of the richest floral regions in the world. Over 70% of the flowers are endemic to the Table Mountain. It is no wonder that the mountain was chosen as one of the new seven world wonders.Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens found on the eastern foot of the mountain. Founded in 1913, the garden that spans an area of 1300 acres includes a unique conservatory with plants from different parts of the world.Besides the parks, the whole area has a biodiversity that is rare to find in other places on earth. Its many valleys and streams make it an idyllic getaway from Cape Town. The national park’s most unique feature is its fynbos vegetation that is displayed here better than anywhere in the world.Its fauna is no less thrilling either. Although animals such as the cape lion, mountain zebra or the leopard are no longer found here, the park is still home to caracals, rock hyraxes or chacma baboons.At the Boulders, penguins flock all over the place, a unique sight in Africa.The flat top peak of the mountain reaches 1,086 m above sea level, but being so close to the sea and to the city its features look more imposing.Besides the mountain, the national park contains another one of South Africa’s attractions, the Cape of Good Hope, Where the Indian Ocean and the Atlantic ocean meet.

Must-do in Cape Town. We arrived in Cape Town after an 11 hour flight, and decided to climb Table Mountain. This was a perfect choice. The weather was excellent, so the views over Cape Town were spectacular. The route we took led us from the Platteklip visitor centre to Fountain Peak, from where we headed across to the peak of Table Mountain itself. The climb was steep and challenging, but the paths were well kept and it was absolutely worth it once we reached the top. The views over Cape Town and beyond were magnificent! If the day is clear, do it! One note of caution though: those who are less adept climbers would probably find it more pleasant to take the cable car...
table mountain national park. spectacular sights of nature, sea and wind, sun and fun, fauna and flora. the fynbos blooming is really a precious sight

The views!!! . Myself and my partner hiked up and down this mountain. Although it was hard it was so worth it once up. The views from the top were breathtaking, especially as there wasn't a cloud in the sky!Such an incredible day. The cable car was under maintenance when we were there and probably would have chosen to get the cable car down as our legs were quite tired.

One of the most impressive mountains I've ever seen. It's really impresive seen from any place: from Cape Town, from the sea, from the east coast. A the top views are completely amazing. This is really a must.
great views. We ended up going up the mountain twice. Everything was well organized, and trails were clear. Great views in every direction.
Table Mountain Top is beautiful. Table Mountain Top is beautiful. The view of Cape Town is spectacular and unforgettable. Great place to take photo of the city.

that iconic mountain. breathtaking views, none comparable. Wear something warm at the top .Take a good camera to get panoramic shots . Its a one of a kind experience South Africa's world famous site . If you like natural beauty then this is a must see destination. The National Flower grows all along the route.

Fascinating cable ride. reached there around sunset. Was able to experience both day and night views.
Has excelllent vies of the city. Get vey windy and chilly after dark.
You can carry food+wine and have a good time at the top. has a few restaurants too.

Breathtaking. Must Do! Take comfortable walking shoes. You can hike it or take the aerial cablecar. We took an Uber to get there and there is WIFI at the top so you can call an Uber to pick you up. Plan 2 hours minimum to be there. It was winter so it was cold and windy.
Amazing views despite the rain. Amazing views! Wished the weather was better so that I could have done more exploring. Absolute must when South Africa.

I live here!. This magnificent National Park is literally 5 minutes walk from my front door. I try to do a 3 to 5 hour hike somewhere in the park at least once a month. The recovery of the indigenous fynbos after the huge fires in March 2015 is very encouraging and the rehabilitation of the footpaths makes it a pleasure to get out and about in this world class natural recreational area.

the most awesome scenery and views ever..!!!. awesome experience..gets very very busy, try going early morning and spend he day there. lovely walks on top. bring comfy walking shoes. take a jacket can get cold with strong winds. its a must visit.
Wonderful view. The place leaves me breathless. Despite the long queues and the vertiginous ascent, the view and the guided walk on the top worth it
Table Mountain. You can see the amazing view of the Cape Town and the ocean where the Indian and Pasific Oceans joing together.
Great visit. Go on a clear day and book online for cable car before you go. Nice cafe at top. Take your bios. If you fancy a bit of abseiling, you can do that.
Top of the world. We were lucky to be there on a nice day/off season. Straight up in the cable car. Above the clouds!! And when they part you can see the Atlantic coast. Say hello to the dassies.

Hike to Maclears Beacon and views Brilliant. I visited Table Mountain on my first day in Cape Town as it was quite a clear day and had been told the weather can change very quickly. This was to be a good decision as we heard (not confirmed) when we checked out of our apartment that Table Mountain was closed for 2/3 days after we went up so would recommend going up the mountain as soon as possible when there is a clear day. The mountain itself has beautiful views of Cape Town and the surrounding areas and we decided to hike to the highest point of the mountain which was Maclears Beacon. This was not a strenuous walk for anyone with a reasonable level of fitness and is well worth while. The Rock Hyrax 'Dassies' are also very entertaining. When visiting Cape Town, I would fully recommend going to the top of Table Mountain.
Great walk with nice view!. Great walk with nice view! Avoid staying after the sunset it gets really windy and cold (visited at November). A must if you are visiting Cape Town
See our review for the cableway. view, fynbos, rocks, dams, cabins, hiking trails, walks, diversity, the Crazy Table Mountain Challenge..and and and.mother nature outdid herself.

everything that was promised. the first day in Cape town that you get good weather you go up the mountain, dont wait for another good day, it may not happen, the cities weather changes continuously. allow an hour or so at the top, and probably the same for queuing at the bottom, but do go!

exhilerating view and unusual flora. we took the klipspringer trail and viewed the highlights. It was cool and sunny. We followed advice of a local who said if you can see the top of table mountain go.

Magnificent. The cool breeze, the view, the cleanliness, the different information stops with art and a huge compass make this place one of the best national parks I've been to. Very organized, clearly marked signboards and the restaurant with hot food and a view that adds the right amount of spice!
A must do. Every minute spent on Table Mountain, is worth it. The views are breathtaking and stunning, to say the least. A pair of binoculars is beneficial. The Park is very well maintained.

Very Weather Dependent. We could see the top of Table Top Mountain from the V & A Waterfront on the first day we arrived - sunny day and very clear. When we went there the next day, a huge cloud had formed over the mountain and did not move for the next 2 days. The result - cloudy and cold on Table Top Mountain with whatever the views there were completely fogged out but clear, warm and sunny in the rest of Cape Town.

Early Views Bes. Arrived first in line early in the day with tour guide. Although cloudy in morning by the time we took ride to top of the mountain above the clouds - we were able to walk around and have the space practically to ourselves. Amazing views. Take lots of pictures and enjoy the moment. I actually shed a few tears here overcome by the beauty and experience of it all.

Top activity for Capetown . Probably the best thing to do in Cape Town, have a great view from the cape penninsula, do a hike (45min/1hr/2hr) through the national park and enjoy! Make sure you check with the local authorities for the cableway may be closed for maintenance (last week of July/first week of August) or bad weather (fog or rain).
My favorite place to relax on a week end. Table Mountain National Park has breathtaking viewsHighly recommended for the tranquil surroundings and beach.

Table Mountain - The Icon of the Fairest Cape of all. It has been many years since I first went up Table Mountain - an event of which itself I hold no memories as I was too small to recall it! But on one's first approach to the Lower Station, one is greeted by the cable cars of years gone by, and the dates of usage on them, shocked my about my own age, but also the fact that I traveled up that magnificent mountain in two of them. I fondly recall those childhood memories, secure in my Father's arms, and how the absolute magnificence of the Mountain grabbed my attention.Most importantly, it still does. Everything is still perfectly maintained, and as natural as could possibly be while taking the vat numbers of visitors into consideration! The vistas have become quite that of urban sprawl, but the overall Park has thus far succeeded in keeping a bit of the Fairest Cape of All intact for all the world to enjoy and bask in its glory! No matter what the purpose of your stay in Cape Town is, it will be sacrilege to not spend a bit of time here!

Delightful. Plan to get there early as the lines stacks up. Also keep in mind you need to go when Table Mountain does not have its "Table Clothe" on. If you plan on hiking, give yourself three hours. Look for those cute little Dassie's!
Table Mountain. We had an amazing hike into the clouds! the views were stunning and the cold Castle beer, well earned!

Tablecloth on the Mountain. We arrived with the small ship and viewed the mountain with a thick cloud covering. Within minutes it became clear again. Amazing. Our tour led us there and we experienced many birds, plants and trees, some of them imported and pretty but depleting the water which is so sparse. Amazing and educational. I suggest strongly for one to experience this town and mountain.

To of the world. You must choose your time to take the cable car carefully so as to avoid the crowds. Book a ticket before you go (from your hotel concierge). The views are great and the cafe is surprisingly good

Table Mountain National park walks. I live here, so I've done many walks. There are walks for everyone from easy to difficult. For visitors, it's very important to carefully select the route and make sure of conditions. Up on top of the mountain it can be very cold and cloud can come down quickly, making it dangerous to find your way down without getting lost or having an accident. There are rescue missions needed weekly. If you plan to walk up and catch the cablecar down, beware if the wind is blowing, the cableway might be closed. Also, be aware of crime on the mountain - this is a sad but true factor, so don't take valuables with you. Don't walk alone and let people know your route beforehand.

One of the most beautiful views in the world!. I went with my family a couple of days ago. I read online that the cable car would be down for routine servicing from 7/25-8/8 so I wanted to have the experience before it closed. Table Mountain is a National Park and it is open. The weather was beautiful so we decided to head up after lunch....with the rest of Cape Town!! The lines were so long, tourists and locals because it was the last day prior to maintenance. We waited in line about 90 min to buy a ticket and go up. Tickets are available on line but you must use them the day you purchase them so we opted to just get them at the ticket office. There are two separate lines (pre-paid and need a ticket). It's much faster if you have a ticket. You can also purchase a ticket while standing in line. There is Wi-Fi but it was difficult to get onto it - tons of people- and I'm not keen on purchasing things with my credit card on line with my phone. The cable car ride is quick but the view is breath taking. You will notice that there is an open area on the cable car that allows you to look out with an un-obstructed view, great for photos. People were trying to bum-rush their way to that spot - full disclosure, me too- however there is no need to. The floor rotates so everyone will have an opportunity to see out of the open space. :-)We were not at all prepared when we got to the top. We brought our jackets and hats because I knew it would be chilly at the summit but wow!! It was freezing up there. Keep in mind it is winter here but it felt like winter in Vermont up top! There is a very small gift shop right when you get off the cable car. We all bought hoodies and I bought gloves for everyone. We were still cold but it was much better. There were kids up there with shorts sleeves and short pants. They were miserable. There is a snack shop at the top where you can get warm drinks. So... what do you do when you get up there? Well, there are three walking trails. Very lovely. You can walk all around the perimeter and see the most spectacular views. If you go in the evening you can see an awesome sunset. Take a good camera, lots of photo ops. Please respect the trails. They have clearly demarked areas to walk on and still people and their rowdy kids were trampling through the plants. The plants are rare and beautiful. It's not hard to respect things. We spent about 3 hours up there including the wait to get down. It was worth every minute. Once again, if you have mobility issues you can go but may want to sit in the café or on a nice rock. There are also picnic tables to sit on. Not wheel chair accessible at all. Not a place for infant strollers. Not a place for infants in winter - people where there with young babies.. crazy! it was just too cold. Perhaps the temperature in the summer might be better but I wouldn't take my infants up. Also, no pets allowed. I hope this helps!

Must visit Capetown. Buy your ticket online, it's worth the effort. I had to wait an hour and half for a 5min cable car lift. Recommend hiking for travelers with more time, the view is unarguably stunning. Even if you decide to get on the top with tje cable car, please be advised that you want ro spend at least an hour to explore the vegetation, birds and views feom the top, the table part of the mountain.
Fabulas. A must for everyone, One of the 7 wonders of the world. The scenery is to die for.Chose your way down, absail cable car or hiking

Tell the world!. Have done this several times, every experience seems different. Meet people from different parts of the world. Everyone is supportive,and encouraging. You laugh, moan, but the end is always MAGNIFICO.. You feel like telling the world each time!

MY HAPPY PLACE. BEST ever to climb the "lady" but check weather and stick to the popular routes or go with a guide who knows the mountain. Even a trip up the cable car and a walk to Maclear Beacon and back is awesome. Takes about an hour one way and goes all along the top of the mountain. So children can do this one as well. REMEMBER if you hike up that cable car is weather dependent so always make sure you can get down again in daylight hours should the weather turn for the worse. Going down tougher on the legs and knees than going up. Take money or credit card to pay for ticket down should that be the option.ALWAYS carry warm jacket and water with you.Just love this place.

Hike up Platteklip Gorge. Quite a tough walk - but very worth it. Well marked path and quite safe. Highly recommend . Would strongly suggest you take at least a liter of water per person. Once on top of mountain - paths are clearly marked so you can have a good explore on top of this natural wonder of our world
7 wonders of the world. A must visit for the tourist in Cape Town. Very good and safe trip and good value for money. To experience one of the 7 wonders of the world it is amazing.

Beautiful Cape Town. Great for a Picnic or just the breath taking views of the peninsular . The restaurant was upgraded with a different variety of quick meals also offering seating since I visited years ago . The cable car gave 360 views as you ascend which adds to the overall experience . This is a must for anyone visiting or living in Cape Town.

Mom an Sons Day Out. We had a perfectly clear day and could see forever. I highly recommend this for anyone visiting Cape Town, its a MUST SEE. We bought our tickets on line the day before and went early , thankfully avoided the queues. The views were breathtaking and we got the most awesome photo's.

Table mountain top view. had great time at Table mountain. but i arrived later than 11:00 pm and the Line was Long had waited 1 hour to get to cablecar and nw i know if i plan to go there again will go earlier than that.and the weather was good on that day but when we get on top it was very cold LOL wished i had Jacked with.. :) But the Restaurant have amazing food and Good Coffee and outside have perfect view to see the whole beauty of Cape Town City.
Unbelieavable views over the Atlantic ocean and Campsbay. Incredible vistas of sea, mountains, indigeous plants and some small animals as well. A must see on a trip to Cape Town

Beautiful Views. The entry to the park is well organized and easy.
The ride to the park on the cable cars was quick and enjoyable.
If you plan to be here in the winter, you need to ensure that you are dressed for a colder climate than on the ground.
This is surely a must visit while in Cape Town

Best thing to do in Cape Town. Platteklipp Gorge. Do not miss this amazing experience but remember to bring water, wear good shoes and take your time. This hike goes in easy terrain but is more physically demanding than some expects. The reward is high. Love this hike!

Unique in the world. What other city in the world is built around a 220 square km nature reserve? A city of 4.5 million people with a park that size determining its layout and geography? The central city nestles in the bowl created by Devil's Peak, Table Mountain, Lion's Head and Signal Hill. But that is only the northern tip of the Park, and it is exciting in itself. There is the cable car, a pretty shattering experience for first-timers, as the views grow and grow. Don't forget, this is a Real Mountain, over 1 000m high, so it will be on average 6 deg C (11deg F) cooler, and probably quite windy. The fit can climb Platteklip Gorge, the great slash across the face of Table Mountain. There are walks all over the Park, and it is so huge that a guide to the walks is absolutely essential, and you must tell people where you are going unless you have guide person rather than a guidebook.On the western side of the Park, you pass from the City over Kloof Nek, the gap between Table Mountain and Lion's Head.The peaks of the Twelve Apostles fall steeply to the sea, and there are picturesque communities along the coast.The road rises until you can look down on Llandudno, then plunges down into Hout Bay, which has a charming fishing harbour. Travelling further south you approach Chapman's Peak, with a spectacular road carved into the rock face that plunges into the sea. Looking across Hout Bay from the road, the proud Sentinel, 500m high, guards the entrance. After Chapman's Peak, the Park drops closer to sea level and you pass through Sun Valley and a series of small communities separated by long stretches of wilderness. At Misty Cliffs, the waves crash constantly at its foot and the spray rises up as a year-round mist. At Scarborough, you reach the northern edge of the Cape Point Nature Reserve, a 77sq.km wilderness that forms the southern part of the Park. The entrance to the Park is about 12km further.Travelling down the East side of the Park from the City, first you have to circumnavigate the slopes of Devil's Peak before turning South. The Eastern Face of Table Mountain has even larger cliffs then the front face, and as these end you reach Kirstenbosch, named one of the seven greatest gardens in the world. Its 500 hectares are packed with botanical riches, many of which are endemic to the area. Further south are the great vineyards of Constantia and Tokai before the Park's mountains return to the False Bay coast at the surfing paradise of Muizenberg. Then the edge of the Park is characterized by little communities stretching up the hillside or up narrow valleys. There is a gap at Fish Hoek, where one can cross the Park from False Bay to the Atlantic on the west, but otherwise the ridge which forms the spine of the Park is solid. Even at Simonstown, the naval base, the land plunges steeply to the sea. Further south, there are more tiny communities nestling under the mountains, some of which cannot be reached by car, before you climb up the the entrance gate of the Nature Reserve.But for the real National Park experience, a 74km stroll down the Hoerikwaggo trail is essential. It is a five-day, four night walk, starting at Cape Point and ending in the centre of Cape Town. The views along the way, with the oceans on both sides, the peace, the wild flowers, the animals, birds and insects combine to make this one of the greatest walks in one of the greatest parks in one of the greatest cities in the world.

Table Mountain - Hiking - India Venster. One of the top routes to hike up Table Mountain. This hike is best done with a guide if you have not done it before. Also you need a good head for some height exposure and basic scrambling. There are great spots to stop and to enjoy the views over the city, Lions Head, Clifton, Camps Bay. Always be prepared when you hike the mountain as the weather can change very fast, from a great sunny day to chilly, misty and ice cold wind.This hike can be done by most visitors if you are a regular hiker, have a head for height exposure and a mountain guide

Beautiful sites while gaining fitness. Taking the hiking route up Skeleton Gorge is a must do, whether you are visiting Cape Town or are already a permanent resident.You can gain access to the hiking route/path when you access Kirstenbosch Gardens, which is also another site to behold.The route provides you an easy to moderate challenge with a variety of ecosystems as you make your way to the summit of table mountain.Be sure to make a pit stop at the reservoir on route.

Trip up Iconic Table Mountain. I love the mountain come summer or winter it always has it moods and can be both beautiful and testy at the same time. Come summer pack a picnic basket and go up at night. Come Spring go for a hike and marvel at the beauty. In winter or should I say always have a knit as the clouds could roll over and the wind could whisper sweat cold nothings on your exposed skin. There is an option of a resturaunt so best check out the menu if you a picky eater. Else have delightfully warming coffee and an offering from the deli to warm up in winter. Residents go up free on their birthday provided proof of identity. Should you want to walk away with a memory theres a gift/curio shop.Best bring comfortable shoes, a jacket, water, a snack trail bars and a camera for the numerous photo ops

Breathtaking. The views from the "top of the world" are amazing, you have a 360degree view of the entire city and everything seems so small in comparison to "real life". I love my city, I love my Table Mountain. Cape Town is a fabulous destination and genuinely caters to people from all walks of life...

Top of th world!. A trip on the cable car up Table Mountain is imperative, and the newer cars are so vastly superior to the old models.The views,including Robben Island and the rest of the area, have to be seen to be believed. The walking paths and flora and fauna are also something that has to be experienced. Then there is also good food and refreshment at the top.

Table Mountain - SA's National Treasure. Mountain is exquisite! From the amazing professionalism of the staff, to the stunning views going up the Cable car, it is an experience in Cape Town NOT to be missed. The 360 degree view alone is like Paradise to any photographer! The yummy food and gorgeous selections of wines at the top off the mountain in the coffee shop, just completes the experience.Sip gently on a lovely glass of wine whilst watching the sunrise or set over the harbour, or contemplate the beauty off Mother Nature as you watch the Rock Rabbits sunning themselves lazily on the rocks. Either way, from the birdseye view of Robben Island to the vast expanse off the ocean, you will not want to leave the tranquillity off this stunning mountain. There is something for everyone!
Table Mountain - Special Place. The mountain never disappoints.... from glorious sunny days to moody and sometimes there has even been snow

A must see when visiting Cape Town. If traveling to Cape Town you must take a trip here. Excellent views of the city and surrounding area. You can spend a good few hours walking around taking in the scenery. Try to go on a clear day if possible.

Magnificent Views, from well maintained paths. TMNP offers a variety of hikes, for the novice hiker through to the experienced hiker wanting scrambling, Echo Forest in Muizenberg offers a lovely trail for the less experienced less fit hiker, a walk along the contour path from Constantia new through to Rhodes memorial is beautiful, or along the contour path from the water filtration plant under the cable car to Rhodes Memory is fantastic, Platter lip is beautiful, but gruelling, climbing the saddle from Tafel berg Road down Newland Ravine is wonderful, climbing up Disa Gorge down Llandudno corner is hard work but exquisite, Silverman offers many safe gentle walks

World class. This is the best hike you can do with magnificent views of the oat beautiful city in the world. Just make sure you stick to the paths and don't wander off as one can get lost easily. Weather also changes a lot and it's bit cold towards the top of the mountain
amazing table mountain. Very beautiful and well worth a visitBooking early, preferably via the Internet at the top of the mountain cool jacket must be taken
Perfect View. We went in June and it was windy and cold. Line to get down gets long at the end of the day. Gift shop and coffee shop on top. Great views - bought tickets ahead of time to avoid line

Unsurpassed views from the top of Table Mountain. Despite my slight adversity of heights, a ride in the Table Mountain cable car to the top of the mountain is a must. Every once in a while, we all need to be awe-strucked. The views from above is inspiring. Don't miss this.
Good day out. Drove down via Muizenberg and Simons Town (Boulders Beach). Went up on the funicular railway. Viewed Cape Point and Cape of Good Hope. Sadly didn't see any baboons.
Not to miss if the weather is good. We visited Table Mountain on a very clear and sunny day and it was wonderful. It is probably the number one attraction in the city.
Breathtaking. Make sure you buy your tickets online before you plan your visit to Table Mountain. Bring along a good wide angle lens and once you're on the top you'll understand why.

beautiful city.. Loved Table Mountain National Park. We did a day tour around the park and enjoyed every aspect of the beautiful scenery at every turn. Very windy and cold the day we went. So much so that the cable car had to close and we couldn't get to the top. This didn't really matter so much because there is so much more to see everywhere else. If we were a bit younger and fitter, we would have been able to walk to the top along many of the designated trails but were happy to see what we did. We don't feel we missed out too much because the cable care was closed.
A must!!. The views are fantastics!! The wildlife too. If you have time is a perfect place for walking around and lose yourself. You will see cape town how you have never seen before

What a view!!. I visited Table Mountain for the second time and it was still surreal. A fantastic view is afforded right around the city and beach areas. The cable car is quick and smooth to the top. Previously I have walked up and although not easy it is excellent to experience the ascent and get different viewing perspectives from various heights.

We loved it. The 2 hours of waiting in the line to get our tickets was worth it....the staff were friendly and informed. The cable car and the facilities on the mountain were spotless. We had a nice lunch in the restuarant and we enjoyed the breathtaking views and the long stroll on the mountain. Definately a must to do when you are in Cape Town
Must do but.... I guess you have to go up Table Mountain but it wasn't our tour highlight. Very busy, long queues to get down.

Worth the walk up, not so much down. We wanted to take the aerial cableway up the mountain, but it was closed due to high winds. We decided to walk to the top. The walk up was great, but our legs took a pounding going down. we were very disappointed that the bathrooms were locked at the top!

An amazing view of an amazing city. We didn't have enough time to walk up, but the tram is fun, and the interior of the car rotates as the tram car ascends, so everyone gets a good view over the course of the trip up to the top.We walked a trail that runs around the perimeter of the park, spent several hours up there, and would have gladly spent several more had we the time. Definitely a highlight of any visit to this charming city.

Its a box to tick. We walked up the main gorge to the top. Took about 2 1/2 hours hard slog. Started off blue skies, but cloudy and raining by the top, so pay attention to the weather. The views from the top are spectacular, and there are a few walk ways around the mountain for people to explore. A shop a restaurant for supplies and the you can either walk back down or take the cable car.

Cape Town is all about Table Mountain!. We had to wait for 3 days to find the perfect weather and time to visit table mountain. The online tickets are valid for 7 days. The best time to visit table mountain on a normal sunny day would be at around 8:30 am as there was hardly any crowd. we were able to catch the first cable car that arrived. Its a 30 to 45 minute wait if you reach there by 11 am. The trip was just 5 minutes long and as the cable car offered 360 degrees rotation, we were able to see better. The top of the mountain has a beautiful cafe (with WIFI). Every hour there is a free walking tour. We did the shortest which lasted for 15 mins. we spent around 4 hours on top of the mountain. Got to saw some poisonous shrubs & dassie- the rabbit like badger inhabiting the mountains. The mountains offer fantastic views of western and eastern cape. It is recomended to buy tickets online and check the website to know if the cable car is operating. In winter, if its windy and offers poor vision, the facility is closed.

Beautiful. You can't go to Capetown without going to Table Mountain. We had a beautiful day despite the crowds getting to the top via the cable car. In the winter with more rains and wind the beautiful days are further apart. We had 4 gorgeous days to see the cape and the mountain.

The Top of the mountain is beautiful and so is the view down to Cape Town. When we went to the top of Table Mountain, I assumed that it was going to be great for the view of Cape Town, but I hadn't anticipated how beautiful the mountain itself would be. The geology and the plant life are very different from the area down around the harbor, and the air is so fresh with the breezes from the ocean. There is a trail that encircles the top of the mountain which allows you to look out in all directions from the harbor to the ocean, from the city center to the wealthy residential areas along the Atlantic Coast and on down toward the Cape. It is definitely worth a visit, but plan your visit when the mountain is not enshrouded by fog. While the mountain would still be great, you would miss the view!

Table Mountain National Park Not To Miss!!. Table Mountain National Park Not To Miss!! No matter what you do, you must go to the top of this fabulous mountain and catch the view of Capetown. Be sure to go up for sunset and stay till it sets, you won't be sorry.

Stunning - allow plenty of time. While I would have liked to climb the mountain, I'm pleased I at least took the tram up to take in the view. Give yourself lots of time at the top to really enjoy walking about.
don't miss this wonderful nature trip. great expreience, wonderful views. This mountian is older than the Himalayas! Take the trip, you won't be disappointed.

Top of the Cape. Table Mountain national Park is amazing place to visit and it allows perfect 360 degree view of Cape Town.The trip starts by taking a cable card to the top of the Table Mountain. You can save a lot of time buying tickets in any of the City Sightseeing Bus selling points. Otherwise you will have to wait a long queue for a ticket and then another long queue for the cable card.Cable Card is perfectly safe and icily nice experience as the town opens up in front of you as the cabin rotates on its way up the mountain.It is important to chose a sunny day with high visibility to get the most of the view.Any point you stop for a picture offers amazing view. We just couldn't stop taking pictures from every possible view point. There is a restaurant with terrace, souvenir shops and public toilets that allows you to spend even a whole day at the top of the mountain.
360 view of Cape Town. Beautiful views from top for great photos. A definite stop if you're in Cape Town. We used the Hop on/off Bus which works great in Cape Town.

A Clear View and a Magnificent Vista. We were so lucky that the whole time we were in Cape Town we had a clear view of Table Mountain. On the day we visited it was also clear and the views are just incredible. Having already travelled around the Peninsula, we were able to point out the places we has seen with ease. This truly is an amazing spot - well worth going ans so easy to get to using a hop on hop off bus. A must experience!
Table Mountain. Go early to avoid queues.Fantastic viewsOnly cable car which resolves so everyone gets a good view

The best thing I did in Cape Town. Going up in the cable car was a fabulous experience with amazing views, and great fun. At the top we walked along several of the smaller paths for even more views in all directions and met some interesting visitors along the way.

Reaching Higher Heights. We climbed to the top of Table Mountain. What an incredible experience. This is a must do. There are two trails. We took the easier of the two and it wore us out but it was well worth the sweat, aches, and pains. I would not exchange that experience for anything. That was one of the highlights of my vacation. I will be making a repeat visit to Table Mountain in 2018.
Vacation in South Africa. View around the top, overlooking the city of Cape town is very thrilling. We did abseiling down the mountain and the experience was one of a kind

Amazing view. First visit, we were amazed what a beautiful view, never seen anything like it .
Will go back, it's breath taking, a must when in Cape Town

the day its not cloudy - GO. We honestly found the lines so tiring to be in but you can't go to cape town and not do this. the line coming down was long and hot. when you get to the top, its another paradise of a view here. I don't suggest eating as the lines are so long. enjoy the view get your pictures and leave before the one gets too long on a hot day.
Must visit. The views are incredible and the sunset views from up there is to die for, you didn't come to Cape Town if you don't go there!

Incredible views of Cape Town. You can either hike to the top of Table Mountain or take a cool cable car ride up there. There are also a lot of trails you can take on top of the mountain to get different viewpoints. If it is a clear day in Cape Town then your first priority should be visiting Table Mountain.
Sight to see. Spectacular views are not to be missed. Be sure to find the dassies (small furry brown animals). Be sure to go on a clear day.

Breathtaking views. We were lucky that it was a clear day. Could see for miles. Enjoyed the ride up and down in the cable car and also the walk all around the top. There were quite a few stations where one could stop and look out and take pictures

Make this a priority!. We had to wait out two windy days before we could finally make it to the top of Table Mountain. So if you have a nice day and the cable car is open-don't wait--GO! It is just so beautiful up there. We spent an hour and a half (you could spend much, much longer) and I couldn't stop smiling. The views are spectacular. We did have to wait about an hour (and we had already bought tickets) to go up--so be prepared.

Great view of Cape Town. We wandered up to the Top of Table Mountain as the first thing we did after landing and the view was great. It didn't seem very busy with tourist as we were later in the day but we did see a bunch of locals who were biking, hiking and running. Parking could be an issue as it gets busy, just remember to throw the parking attendant a few rand to watch your car.

A strenuous climb but definetly worth it.. My daughter and I chose to climb this mountain at about 7.30 in the morning which was definitely the right time to do it so it wasn't to hot. The walk up was quite quite tiring as it was a short but steep climb so we decided, after viewing the spectacular sight from the top of the mountain, to buy a cable car ticket from the shop nearby for the way down. This was definitely the right decision for us as the cable car rotated all the way down so you got a 360 degree view of Cape town. A good pair of walking boots are a must. The cable car is also available on the way up.

You have to go to Table Mountain. One of the many wonders of the world - cable car up about 15 euro and on top its amazingly flat and you can walk around and take in stunning views of cape town and even have food at the top check out my pics
Beautiful. We were so happy that it cleared up on our last day in Cape Town so that we could visit this incredible mountain. It was breathtaking! A definite must see if the weather permits!

Cloudy day. This was a stop on our tour and the tour director had warned us not to expect much due to the low lying clouds.
The view at the station was still worth seeing and the ride to the top was good.
Nothing but clouds at the top but the vegetation was interesting.

A wonderful experience. A thrilling experience to be on the table mountain and get a birds eye view of the Cape Town city and the lush green park around. It was freezing and windy up on the top and the trip on the cable car was thrilling.
We would love to visit this lovely place again.

A strenuous climb up and down Table Mountain. A group of seven of us climbed Table Mountain via the Platteklip Gorge route on a sunny Saturday in July. The path is rocky steps and well maintained. Views from the top are spectacular but be prepared to walk down if windy, as they will close the gondola. We hiked up and down from the road in four hours including half an hour up top, which was very cold. Hoodies, windbreakers, and gloves recommended! The rest of the park is gorgeous and a wonderful day trip by car from Cape Town. Beautiful rugged scenery, some wildlife, beaches, and memorable coastal roads. Be sure to see the Penguins at Boulders Beach and baboons and ostriches at Cape of Good Hope.

Go exploring. Stray from the path. Breathtakingly spectacular even with clouds and mist. Taking a camera is a must, but hold on tight; the wind is unpredictable and nobody wants to watch their camera device floating off down a mountain40 rand per adult gets you up the cable car and out into the visitor areaI'd suggest taking gloves as the temperature is much lower than at ground level. ..especially if it isn't a particularly sunny dayIf you fancy a drink whilst you're at the top, expect to pay 90 rand for 2. The local Castle Lager is marginally cheaper than Peroni. Top Tip would be to ask for an extra plastic cup for your drink otherwise your fingers will be freeeezing when you go back outsideThe mountain top itself is flat and there are paths laid out to walk, but there are so many beautiful spots to be found when you cut out into the spaces with just rocky pebbles underfoot you'd miss out on a lot if you stick to the trail.Go explore and enjoy
Great hike!. The hike up to the top is much more well marked than expected. Loved this tough hike after eating my way through Cape Town!:)
great views. Been here a number of times. If it is sunny it is amazing if it's cold and rainy skip it. Table Mtn is beautiful when the table cloth comes in to cover it.

Breath Taking Views!. The drive up to this gorgeous location was beautiful but it was nothing compared to the stunning views we enjoyed while waiting to get on the cable car ride up the mountain. The ride up the mountain was awesome. At the top of the mountain, the views of Capetown and environs were stunning! Well worth the long queues encountered at the bottom.

Hard hike but amazing view.. We took the Skeleton's Gorge trail up to Maclear's Beacon, and you could say we were very much not in shape for it. It was pretty tough even though we're all young and spry individuals. Two hours up and two hours down - cable car was closed due to high winds.
Amazingly Beautiful. A must see place on your trip to Cape Town. Easy to get to from the Hop On Hop Off City Sightseeing tours bus.

Worth a visit. Super panoramic views across the whoe area.
Very unusual alpine like fauna. Well worth a visit but go early.

Stunning views . We bought our tickets online in advance and avoided the ticket lines. We were at the top of the mountain in less than 20 minutes from arrival ($4 uber ride from our hotel). We opted for the middle-road (30 minutes) and got some great pictures along the way. Actually, we got about 200 pictures along the way.Once done, we got a snack and cappuccino in the cafe on top and we were back down in another 20 minutes. A great way to spend 2 hours of the day assuming the weather cooperates and everything is open and the lines aren't too long.
Unparalleled views. Magnificent views to Cape Town and area- interesting birds and fauna-- there are multiple paths of different lengths-- not as easy to navigate as maps indicated
Gorgeous!. What a stunning part of the world. Huge park with a variety of scenery. Need to be fit for most of the walks!
Unforgettable view. Majestic and astounding, Table Mountain deserves to be in the list of 7 New Natural Wonders of the World

A must-do in Cape Town.. The ride to the top has phenomenal views, but don't plan it on your last day, because in the winter it frequently clouds over or is closed due to weather. If you're more adventurous, you can hike to the top. Great way to see Cape Town before you investigate it close-up!

Nice ride. Good price value. Went there with our daughter. Check the website before You Head off. Park on the bottom of the mountain and take the free shuttle bus. Restaurants in bottom and topbof mountain.

Perfect views. Extremely lucky with the weather. Perfect sunshine, no wind and ambient temperatures considering its winter. This is a must do when you are in Cape Town. It gives you a great view out to Robben Island and over the whole coast line. The walks on the top are interesting with plants and animals competing with the views. Make sure you pre-purchase a ticket for the cable car as the lines were crazy, but it was Sunday so that's understandable.

Hike up and take the cable car down. You can't take Table Mountain off your bucket list if you didn't hike up it. That's the best way, go Plattekill route. Don't be insane and go down the mountain. It looks daunting, but believe me, geriatric people like me can do it, you can do it. Just take a bottle of water. Should not be more than 2 hours, even if you stop every 5 metres to catch your breath! Take a taxi there, so that you will be brought to the entrance of the trail...which is farther away from the cable car drop-off. Also look at the Table Mountain website to check if the cable car is operating, otherwise you will have to walk down, and that's another 2 hours, and murder on your knees.
Excellent. A must visit when you are in Cape Town. Very Windy at the Top. Get the Hop On Hop Off Bus to the bottom of Table Mountain and then go up to the top.

Drop Dead views, challenging hike. We climbed up the Platteklip Gorge trail. Took us 3 hours, but we made it! Quite steep and rocky. Glad we did it but it was challenging. Views were spectacular as we climbed and once we reached the top. Coffee and treats at the top were good too! The view, as you descend in the cable car, is amazing.
A must see. A must see when in Cape Town. It can be difficult sometimes to get the cable car on a nice day, so always keep an eye out for the weather and jump on an opening in the clouds.

what a nature. For those who are looking to see a real nature this is the place , where the ocean comes to the land of Africa , the mountain is unbelievably beautiful , a real creation of God who has created every thing ....
A steep hike up. Worth getting the cable car, it's a steep hike up, great views and quite an expansive area at the top. Can be windy, go on a fine clear day

Mighty fine coffee and great views.. We waited 2 days for the weather to clear, too cloudy or too windy and you can't use the cable car. It was well worth the wait. The views are stunning, and the flora and fauna amazing.The walks are well signed and path ways well surfaced.

A must. Such great views and a great experience you'd be silly not to go!
Buy tickets in advance to avoid big queues
Cable car rotates so you get 360 view on way
There are 3 different walks from 20-45 mins up the top
Also the brave can walk up & or down
Wonderful Place!. A must visit place when you are in Cape Town!! Gives you an awesome feeling of being in another world!

Amazing place to visit. We had a great day for the trip up in the Cable car, we'll organised at the top with well made paths and signs highlighting the bot ant and geology of Table Mountain. Absolutely worth a visit.

Stunning Vista. Either a stunning trek or an easy cable car journey to the top of Table Mountain, leaves you with a vast expanse of walking trails allowing you to experience the full vista of the Cape Town area.

A must do when in Capetown, a clear day is advisable though.. Having limited time in Capetown we were advised that the cable car doesn't run in bad weather, so took the chance anyway, it was pretty windy the day we were there but were able to appreciate the ride although it was a white out when we reached the top of the mountain. Interesting to see the difference in the cars used, since people began travelling to the top.

Spectacular hike and view. I climbed the Kasteelsport trail which I was told was one of the easier trails to climb. Along with the hike came a lot of temperature changes so be sure to dress in layers, brings snacks and water. Also, get ready for some breathtaking views of Camps' bay from this trail. There's really nothing quite like it.

Spectacular!. Beatiful scenery... well organized and (almost) no litter. Well worth the visit. We added it to a drive through Chapman Peak... what a spectacle! Take an extra memory card for your camera!
Breathtaking. Gazing down onto the spectacular views below makes you feel as if you are on top of the world. Reasonable access at the top for those with walking difficulties.

SouthAfrican Diaries. One of the most important place in Cape town. A must to visit.Cable way connectivity to go up and down.Also attracts alot of trekkers, mountainiers climbers for the mountain. Tough terrian.Cold and windy weather generally at the top. Mesmerizing view of the cape.town city from tje table top mountain

The Famous Table Mountain. You can't go to Cape Town and not take a trip up Table Mountain. The lines can be long but the view is so worth it. Plan a few hours so that you can hike around and see the incredible views. You can hike it but unless you are pretty fit, take the aerial cableway.
Beautiful view on a clear day. We got to the cableway early in the day. It wasn't very crowded, we enjoyed a glass of wine before wandering around the mountain top --

It's FREE on your BIRTHDAY!. Lovely way to celebrate all the nature of Cape Town and orientate yourself with all the landmarks and wind-directions. Go early before the tourist buses arrive and take your own snacks and water.
Incredible views from Table Mountain. We took the cable car to the top on a clear day, and we were rewarded with spectacular views of the city and ocean. We would highly recommend to others.

Great views and great day out. Some amazing views to be had at the summit. Just be aware that on cloudy days visibility may be poor. We took the cable car up and down, and still managed to spend a good few hours walking around the summit and taking photos. It can be cold and windy so be prepared!
Traveler's in earth. Nice mountain and good experience in south Africa cape town put the weather was very cold need jacket
Beautiful. A must see of CPT. Would recommend the climb on foot if possible. Though cable car as well provides adequate satisfaction.

Definitely a must do!. You haven't been to Cape Town if you didn't go up to Table Mountain. Allright, it is crowded and touristy, but what a view! The cable car turns around, so you get a 360° view while going up. There are different walks you can choose from on top and there is a restaurant and gift shop. Say hello to the Dassies up there!

Absolutely breath-taking views and pretty well organised. Loved our trip here - even though it was July (did it today - 12th July) the weather was perfect...cool with a gentle breeze. Definitely buy your tickets online as it was great to beat the queues.PS - They have a promo at the moment where one adult ticket can be accompanied by two children under 18 for free!!! Unfortunately we didn't know about that and so paid for our two kids.

Beyond words. When the mountain is clear go go go. The weather in Cape Town and particularly over the mountain changes rapidly so take any opportunity that comes along. I was very lucky and had amazing visibility for miles in every direction. I visited at the end of my trip and I loved being able to see all the places I been to during my holiday. It's a long way up so if your short on time the red sightseeing bus & cable car are very useful. Leave yourself 2-3hrs at the top, it's a very tough view to leave behind. Enjoy your trip!

Beautiful and immense. Table Mountain, visible as a landmark from anywhere in Cape Town, is just the beginning of this enormous park which stretches down to Cape Point. As we visited in winter, the cable to the mountain and the funicular were frequently closed. Early morning hiking was available though we didn't have the time. Fynbos and wildlife viewing abounds. The mountain is beautiful even on misty cloudy days. Something for everyone, but not necessarily your main event if you visit in Winter.
Fabulous. This is a fantastic place to visit - wonderful - the view is spectacular from the mountain and cable car is great
table top. A must for all visitors to Cape town. My recommendation is to buy your tickets online to avoid the long waiting time for the cable-car
Wow! Wow! Wow!. Amazing trip up to the top of Table Mountain. Great views and a relaxing visit! It helped that we had awesome weather! Wonderful place and loved our visit!

Breathtaking view and unique terrain. The long queues for the ticket made us turn back in the morning but in the evening when we returned there was no line and we were glad we made it to the top . Inspite of the cold weather and the chilling breeze, the experience was truly worth it - the views of Cape Town from the top are amazing and it was interesting to pick out all the spots we knew . Inspite of the impression from the ground, the top is not totally flat - it is an interesting, gently rolling topography. The natural bonsais - forced by the strong winds were beautiful . Interesting birds added to the beauty of the picture .

Amazing views - seriously strenuous hike. We hiked to the top of Table Mountain and then rode the cable car down. It was beautiful and we saw a great variety of eco-systems and even a Rock Hyrax. Be prepared - this is a seriously steep hike - bring plenty of water, a snack, and good shoes. You will be rewarded for your efforts with beautiful views!
Beautiful!!. A very beautiful view of Capetown from the table top! Recommend any traveler to try and visit in the 1st day itself since the cable car ride is subjected to weather conditions.

stunning views from above the table mountain!. A must do during your visit, in particular by clear sky (no avoid when cloudy).
Although it can be very windy, the panorama is outstanding from there.
You should also see some marmots on the top.
For the fit option, you can also climb to the top, but it is very steep.

A Must do in Capetown! . Go only on a sunny day to get best views of the Bay and Peninsular from the top.
Cable car runs up to the top and cute Dassies
( looks like African hamsters ) sunbathing up on the mountainside.

beautiful veiws. World heritage site need I say more
Fantastic views and a must see in cape town
this the only place in the world where you can stand in one world heritage site and see another Robyn Island

Spectacular views. Although we went up table mountain on a cloudy day it was still amazing. We found ourselves amongst the clouds and there was a small window where the clouds cleared and the view was spectacular. The cable car ride up was thrilling as it rotated as you went up so that could view different vantage points. Parking was difficult but definitely worth a trip up.
No other view like this on Earth. We went up Table Mountain on sunny day in winter (July). Not too crowded, and wonderful, wonderful views
Go on a sunny day. This is probably one of the top attractions in CP. Like the Table Mountain Cableway best seen on a clear sunny day with no wind.
Breathtaking. We live in Arizona and caught Table Mountain on a sunny day. My friend compared it to the first time he saw the Grand Canyon - that's how amazing it is!

Beautiful view from the top on a perfect day .. It was a perfect viewing weather day . 4 of our party claimed to the top of the mountain , 2 of us queued to go up on the cable car ,it took us 11/2 hours to get onto the cable , it was a nightmare .

Go and see cape town in all its beauty.. Go in the morning. See the clouds roll in. There is a Great view of signal hill and devil's peak too.
Do try and read up the story behind devil's peak. Take a light jacket. Get windy at times.
Great views. Visit early in day before fog rolls in to get best views. Be prepared for lots of wind. Dress warmly if going in winter months in Cape Town

The massive vistas with an incredible view is stunning. Plan on a day of vigorous walking and viewing. I Used my binoculars and saw interesting wild life and would suggest a a local guide book as signage is great but I needed more detail

Best view of Cape Town. This is an incredible place to see. A revolving gondola on the way up and down and the most scenic views of Rodden Island, Albert and Victoria Waterfront, and the whole city of Cape Town.
Spectacular. Sure, you couldn't go to Cape Town without going up to the top of Table Mountain. It is Spectacular! Should be on everyone's bucket list

Don't Leave Cape Town without Going Up To Table Mountain!. South Africans always affectionately referred Cape Town as The Mother City. I prefer to believe that it is due to the Table Mountain. Table Mountain is like a mother, standing in the center of Cape Town, overlooking this piece of land and shelter them from the storm. If you come to Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain, you will certainly regret! Do make sure you check the weather forecast frequently as the cable car schedule will be impact by the strong wind, frequently. Of course, you can always hike your way up and down Table Mountain when the cable car service is being interrupted. The flora and fauna at Table Mountain are very special, especially for us that grew up in tropical countries. Hiking should be a good choice. Otherwise, you can buy a single ticket (R125) up the mountain, enjoy the view, have brunch and then walk down the mountain. We are lazy so we choose two-way cable car. (it is best to buy ticket online so you can avoid the queue). We arrived around 8:30am at the cable car station. Tourists not yet flooded the place so the process was pretty smooth. The cable car can rotate 360 ​​degrees, so do not race to the window for photograph opportunity. Your chance will come.I planned to join a few free walking tours to learn about the plants and animals. However, the scenery was so breathtaking that we totally forgot the time and missed the tours. We bought coffee and muffins from the cafe, and enjoy them at the picnic tables outside. Nothing beat the best view!

Amazing view of the entire cape town. We were on our honeymoon and visited table mountain during evening time. The view is just fantastic. You can see the entire cape town from this place and view the pacific ocean as far as you can. The tickets were priced at 1600 INR but they run 50% discount on friday I guess

A must do in Cape Town. Spectacular views across Cape Town, the Cape Peninsula and False Bay. The only way to fully appreciate Cape Town.A great cable car ride complete with a rotating floor so that it doesn't matter where you stand you will get to see the view.Once on top it lives up to its name and is almost as flat as a table and great walking.Tips:1 Reduce the time in queues by buying your ticket on line.2 No matter what time of year take warm clothes as it has it own climate that can change very quickly.
Incredible Views. This is a must see and rated in top 10 travel sites. Always check with tour reps to check if open as the clouds and rain will close site or shorten tours hours.

Great views!. If you are not a fan of heights, the ride up might be a bit intimidating, but it's worth it once you reach the top and can enjoy the city and water views below. Depending on the time of year, bring layers so that possible wind and cold doesn't dampen the fun. Table Mountain seems to loom over every part of the city, so it's fun to be up there looking down for a change.

Breathtaking views. One cannot visit Cape Town and miss Table Mountain. The views at the top are just breathtaking. The winds were strong so it gets pretty cold while we were there (late June). Budget at least an hour so that you can enjoy the trails and not rush to go up and get down from the top.

Table Mountain. excellent views of the harbour and Cape of Good Hope, and more. If you are lucky, as we were, the wind wasn't bad, but it can blow a gale and there is no protection from it. Also the clouds can be a bit low to allow for the quality of the view.i first heard about it over 60 years ago, and it is definitely a must do.

One of the new 7 wonders of nature!. 1st Tip: There is a free MyCiTi shuttle service from the Lower Tafelberg Road stop, just off Kloof Nek Road, to the Upper Tafelberg Road stop at the Lower Cable station :-) 2nd Tip: Do not miss to take the cable way! You will be surprised with its 360 degrees rotating floor along with the most amazing views of Cape Town 3rd Tip: Since we went on winter, the temperature at the top is quite cold and windy, so DO NOT forget to take warm clothes with you!4th Tip: We bought the tickets to the cable car online well in advance, however, I have to admit that there was no queue at all...It was a very simple and hassle-free process.5th Tip: Be ready to explore the Table Mountain following the pathways and walking trails! Get ready your camera and enjoy to find little cute dassies everywhere :-)

Outstanding Afternoon. Loved the walk up on top, great views. Saw some interesting birds and a little furry hamster like animal. Wanted to have a beer at their pub but had to get back. There is food and a gift shop. Be prepared for wind, layer clothes and bring a camera!

Obligatory and Breathtaking. No trip to Cape Town is complete without a trip to Table Mountain. Readily accessible from any part of the city, I would recommend pre-bookig tickets online to avoid the lines once you get there.Once you take the cable car up to the top, most people seem to just walk in the designated areas right around the cable car and restaurants/shops. HOWEVER, there are incredible hiking trails, all pretty easy for even a novice hiker, that allow you to explore the mountain even more and provide breathtaking views of the city as well as towards Cape Point. If you do like to hike, give yourself a few extra hours on the mountain top to explore. You won't regret it.

Worth the hype. We went on a day when the table cloth had only just parted; it promptly returned. However, don't be put off if you cannot get a clear day. The glimpses through the cloud were spectacular.

Surely one of the world's greatest urban vistas. The view from Table Mountain of Cape Town and the Cape Peninsula is stunning. No other word would do it justice. I've never seen an urban view like it (although photos lead me to think Rio might be Cape Town's one rival in this regard).

Climbing Table Mountain from Krstenbosch. Many ways of climbing it; we did it by trekking up Skeleton Gorge from Kirstenbosch botanical gardens. Note: stay on the right when in doubt. Possible to climb down via another gorge near the cable car station (Plattekloof?), but we went down by cable car instead.

Beautiful Vista. No matter the weather, if the cable car is running, don't miss this experience. We happened to go on an overcast day and I was very doubtful that we would see much when we reached the top. But to our surprise we were above the clouds, it was bright and sunny, and while we couldn't see much of the city below us, it was a fun and surreal experience.
freezing in summer. it's a must. we have been there there in cape town's summer and it was freezing. but it had to be done.

Great views when it is clear!. I hiked up Devil's Peak and Table Mountain and took the cableway down the mountain after eating lunch and shopping at the top. The views are great but you had better be in pretty good shape and bring lots of water if you are attempting the hike both or either one of the hills. Food at the top wasn't that great.

No wonder its one of the 7 wonders of the world.. Majestic to behold and oh so magical. To go up with the cable cart just starts the trip of right. Wonderful and stunning views to behold. But myself and friends normally experience Table mountain and the national park through hiking. Its magical, serine and peaceful if you want to take a break from the hustle and bustle. I hike over the mountain trails alot and its a new experience every single time.
Stuning views. A perfect place for see all the Cape town environment, if you come to Cape Town you must visit it. The views are incredible.
