Absolutely beautiful. Worth the crowds and waiting time. The views and scenery are amazing. The cloud coming over at dusk is just beautiful. If you're feeling fit, walk up the mountain instead of the cable car

Wonderful creation of nature. It was a bit cold but after reaching on top of the table mountain, we got all around magnificent views of Cape Town. We were lucky as the weather was good and we could use the cable car service. A must visit when in Capetown.

Table Mountain. The Table Mountain is a must-see scenery spot in Cape Town. Depending on one's luck, the mountain top could be free from cloud coverage. According to our guide, the top is haunted by cloud most of the time, which was evidenced as we saw it on the several days we stayed there. On a clear day, the view from the top is breathtaking, as seen from numerous photos of the scene taken therefrom. We were not so lucky on the morning we visited resulting in a visibility of about 5 meters thereat. To reach the top, one may run, walk or take a short ride in a cable car. It is really convenient. In any event, this spot should not be missed upon visiting Cape Town.

Stunning! Not to be missed. We loved Table Mountain. Very well organised & although a queue to get on the cable car it moved really quickly. We spent an hour at the top following a well walked route & really enjoyed the views
Great View. We went early in the morning and really enjoyed the spectacular views. Later in the day you would have to wait an hour for the gondola.

"Hike Table Mountain", what a great company to hire a guide!!. Riaan Voster was our contact and Liesl was our guide leading us on a 4.5 hour hike from Camps Bay to the top of Table Mountain.The route was via Kasteelspoort and it was magnificent. We are in the fifties so we were not running up there, but Liesl adjusted to our pace and she was a wealth of knowledge about the area, plants and animals. The climb is worth every penny and more. My wife lost her glasses and Liesl went up there the next day, found them and brought them to our hotel. Cape Town should have people like her on the front page of "Visit CapeTown " guide.THANK YOU!!!

Fantastic view. A nice experince, good service, count on that there is a lot of people, But it was no problem. We did not eat at the bar, but it looked fresh. We had a beer and enjoyed the view a lot. You have views in a directions overlooking the Cape.
Amazing view. Cape Town was simply beautiful - eclectic, fun and interesting, took hop on/off bus to Table Mountain and glad I did.

Great views. You can get to the table top either using the cable car port walk. Most people take the cable car. The views from the top are amazing. It should be noted that this is very weather dependent so as you hit cape town go to the table mountain at the first instance of good weather. The path ways are clearly marked and you can do some rappelling. Otherwise it is about the views and therefore going on a clear day is very important. It is a good idea to carry a picnic and enjoy yourself.

Most beautiful mountain. This is really a special experience in my life to see a mountain like the table mountain. It is completely what you wouldnt expect on top! It is cold up there, so bring some extra clothes. There is a small restaurant up there. But that is really a crappy place, better bring some snacks, or lunchboxes.Not worth your time to wait in the line or wait 20 minutes for a coffee, after waiting 15min in the queue. Beside that, the view is great!!!

Fantastic experience - unrivalled views. It was cool in Cape Town but very cold on top. We waited a few minutes to board the cable car and had pre bought our tickets (there was quite a long queue of people who needed to buy tickets). Views from the top are spectacular. We visited the cafe but after a long queue had to wait 15 minutes for four hot drinks (they give you buzzer like they do in some busy restaurants).
Great views. Be sure that it's a clear day, and wow what an experience. From sun up to sun down, this is worth it.
Amazing views!. What a quick trip to the top! Amazing views! Good cuppa coffee and huge piece of cake in the coffee shop!

Extravagant Stunning Sights of CapeTown! . Your Cape Town visit is never complete without visiting Table Mountain. Choose a hike with various difficulties, or drive/bus to the lower cable car aerial station and start your journey from there. One person return tickets can be bought at R240. My advise is to only buy ticket online when you are there to see the queue length. I had a queue that went more than 1 hour long, and I took the other Lane that sent me immediately to the cable car waiting point since I had an online ticket. But you can also buy it days ahead to be assured a place.Go in the afternoon from 11:30 onwards, and prepare to spend 2-3 hours at the top. There's so much to be seen by walking and taking photos, we almost couldn't come down.Morning guys can do a lunch as there's a nice cafe and tourist shop at the top. The prices are not ripped off like what we seen in other parts of the world, it's fairly priced like any parts of Cape Town. Now, enjoy your stay and don't forget to visit the New African 7 Wonders of Nature. See you there.

Gorgeous views!. We took the cable car up the mountain and planned to hike down. The views were spectacular! Visit this park any day the weather will accommodate so you can see everything. The hiking is quite good even if you don't hike all the way down. I saw people trying to hike in regular clothes and shoes and I highly recommend you wear layers and hiking boots. We didn't realize it would take about 2 hours to hike down and ended up having to take the cable car back down because it would have been too dark by the time we reached the bottom. However, we really enjoyed hiking around the top of the mountain and making some short excursions down the sides of the mountain. It's a massive place where you can hike as little or as much as you'd like.
A must . A must while in Cape TownTake a day to drive there, by the sea. Stop by the penguin park on your way back

breathtaking. This is truly worth seeing. I suggest get up early and the clouds are less likely to be there. You can buy tickets in advance, but you run the risk of missing out on specials. Our children were free with the purchase of an adult only on site.

AWESOME VIEWS & SCENERY. Table mountain is breathtakingly beautiful. It is awesome. Scenery 360 degrees. One of the wonders when God created the world. Wear walking shoes and bring your camera along. If the weather is good you're are going to spend all day on the mountain to enjoy the views.

wonderful nature. It's a place in Sa must see. Visit it when it's not clowded or windy as than the cable car is closed. Walk around the mountain to see views on all ways, meet nice Dassies, who loves to eat and pose for cameras. Enjoy the coffe in restaurant and wonderful ride with circuling cable car.

Beautiful Scenery. Yes it is cold, but what a sight to see to see the cape town below and over viewing the gorgeous ocean was amazing. Would recommend anyone that is visiting cape town to go see Table Mountain a nice drive from the city and a breathtaking view. Treat yourself to this Viewing of cape town.

A park with a view. This national park must have the best view in the world.
You can access it via cableway or hiking to the top... why hike?
Check the weather before you go.

Loved the Table. We rushed thereupon arriving in CT with terrible weather forecast for the ne t few days.theonly cloud in CT was hovering over the mountain but we decided torisk it. It was cold, not too windy. I can't compare the views we saw with full visibility but we are do glad we did it anyway. The views were amazing and it reminded me very much of Scotland. Breathtaking rugged scenery. But by no mistake, it is hugely commercialized! Quite pricey, but a "must do" when visiting Cape Town

A must!. Being in Cape Town, you just MUST take the trip up to Table Mountain! Choose a clear day of course, walk up in 2,5 hours if you are fit, or take the cable for i beautiful ride. Up there you can see "the whole world", and you can go for a short walk or a long one up to the highest top. Magic views to Cape Town and the Atlantic Ocean. Fantastic sunsets.

Breathtaking views. Highly recommend this attraction. Buy your tickets online before you visit. Use hoho bus to get their, if you can. The line to get on the cable car can be long, but moves relatively quickly.

Trip to South Africa. We started our trip in Cape Town and this was a priority place to visit, we were not disappointed it was very pleasant and worthwhile. There is much more to see at the top than expected and the views were fantastic.

Pinnacle of the mother city. While it has become very crowded due to its immense popularity amongst tourists and locals alike, Table Mountain remains one of the most impressive natural attractions in the world. Also, DON'T CHEAT! Forego the cable car, and walk up (ideally in a group to avoid the occasional risk of theft).

Disappointed. We were unable to see Table Mountain as there was a 2 hour queue to get a ticket then another wait which the staff could not say how long. There were lots and lots of people waiting and the staff seemed overwhelmed. Not impressed with the organisation.

On top of the world. Getting on top of Table Mountain takes a while, depending when you start off, best to go early: fewer people in the queue at the cable car and less tourists stumbling around and making selfies on "the table" of the mountain which is laid out in pathways you have to follow. The farther you go the better and wilder. Of course, climbing up/down is an option for the fit ones. The 360 degree view is massively impressive. The flora is diverse and lizards and birds are all around, as well as cute dassis crossing your way. If you're looking to take a pebble as souvenir you'll have a hard time ! You'll get back to sea level happy to have conquered one of the new official 7 world wonders !

What views. Climbing the mountain was one of the things i really wanted to do whilst here. We booked a guide, Xolandi, through Gavin at Extreme Scene, we highly recommend using them if planning any trips. It took just over 2 hours, it was tough going but the views are amazing all the way up and spectacular from the top.
Highly recomanded. Fantastic view. Hard, but fantastic to hike to the top for our young people. The cable way up there went nice and smoothie. Nice to walk around on your own. It must see place.

Breathtaking!. If you are lazy like myself, grab the cable car! Its worth the view! The scenery is beyond gorgeous! Remember to bring a cap and use lots of sunblock! Do come around 2pm. The crowd is lesser!

Amazing veiws. Its a must visit while you are in Cape town. Wear your comfortable shoes, check if the weather is good - no strong winds and no clousd on the mountain, take some sun protection and go there! It's amazing!!!

Beautiful views.... Weather dependant!! . Great experience to visit one of the new wonders of the world but watch the weather! If the clouds settle on top of the mountain, the chances are you wont be able to see anything from the top! Unfortunately that's what happened to us... Great views from the cable car up to when we got to very top and the clouds took over!!
Amazing wonders. From the bottom of the mountain, watching the cloud covering the mountain like a table cloth was spectacular. The top view from the mountain was a nine stopped camera moments
Superb views. This is a must when visiting Cape Town. You arrive at the top and your breath is taken away with all the different views especially looking down on the city.

awesome hike. The hike to the top of table mountain is brilliant. Very steep though and mostly in the sun, it provides the most amazing views on Capetown. The top is unfortunately and obviously full of tourists who walk around in their fance clothes and makeup while you're most certainly covered in sweat!

Went mountain climbing. Awesome tour guide. I haven met another human being who is more cheery than Hendre! OMG, talk about a ball of energy! She's a must-book for information/thrill seekers. Also be sure to go the Kasteelspoort route on your way up, as this is more so picturesque than the alternatives.

Table Mountain in Capetown City South Africa. Table mountain it is an amazing place to visit if you are going to Cape Town in South Africa. I really recommend this place, in there you are able to see the whole cape town city

Amazing view !. Worth a visit ! Amazing view of Cape Town. But be careful before buying your tickets. Check if it's too cloudy before going up or you won't be able to see anything and you'll not have your money back. Restaurant is OK but pricey and coffee is terrible, avoid if you can.

A MUST DO on your itinerary. Whether you climb to the top or take the Cableway, you won't be disappointed. The views are spectacular and especially if you have the chance to catch sunset from the top. Worth every bit of energy spent on getting there. JUST DO IT!

Heart & soul of the city. Hike it, ride it, climb it, chill in it & reflect on it, anyway you want it, TMNP both overlooks and underlies Cape Town and makes a truly unique symbiosis of urban wilderness. Go find yourself in it but don't get lost in it, it can bite - watch the weather and treat it with the respect it deserves.

Wow... A Must do at Sunset. Plenty of info on here so a brief review from me this time. The best advice we were given was to visit Table Mountain at SUNSET... We went up around 7pm and frankly the views were stunning. We had no problem getting a late car up, no queue and it was half the normal price. Take a bottle of wine with you and enjoy...simply enjoy...

What a view! - A must see. A must see CT attraction! Due to the wind in CT, sometimes the cable car might not work for the entire day. So, if it is clear in the morning, and there is no wind, go up the mountain! Do not think that tomorrow might be a good day too. 2h later and the weather might take a turn for the worst. Booking a ticket online is advisable, but keep in mind you might still need to queue. And once you are at the top, you will not regret all the queuing and the early wake up call. This time, we took the cable car; next time, we will join the hiking tour!

Stunning!!!. An amazing place to goMake sure you have sun block before going up thereand ensure that you've checked the weather forecast because sometimes they close down the cable car because of strong winds

You just have to visit!!. Amazing views of Cape Town. Lovely walks across the plateau with views in all directions, wild flowers and wildlife. Easy to get to - the hop-on hop-off bus stops at the base station of the cable car and it is then a few minute ride to the top with great revolving views as you go up and down.

Cloudy, windy, quite often closed. It was a $20 roundtrip cab ride from the hotel. You can call to check out conditions, however, they can and do change by the time you get there. Our group tried unsuccessfully one day and several of us tried again the following day only to be frustrated at having paid for a cab an no trip to the top.
Excellent viewpoint.. You can walk as far, or as little as you want once up the top. Brilliant views on a clear day. Shop, toilets, restaurant etc so all available.

Mother Nature at its finest. If you could visit only one sight in Cape Town than this would be it. Table Mountain is by far the city's number one attraction, a must see for all those visiting. As soon as you arrive in Cape Town you can spot the 3 kilometers (2 miles) long plateau dominating the landscape, a beautiful sight visible from almost every corner of the city. Table Mountain is often engulfed in clouds which the locals refer to as the "tablecloth", so the advice you get is to head for the mountain on the first clear day of your visit. To get to the top you can either hike up or take the cable car. If you decide to take the cable car know that the lines can be long in the morning but seem to dwindle in the afternoon. On a clear day everyone heads for the mountain first thing in the morning because the cable car stops running if the fog rolls in or the wind starts to blow. Conditions at the top can change quickly and if that happens you may have no choice but to return on foot.The cable car first opened in 1929 and the one that is in use today has a 360 degrees rotating floor so by the time you finish the ride you have seen the views all around. If there's a long line at the cable car you can skip a part of it by buying your ticket online (you can do it beforehand or on the spot using their WiFi). At the top one is rewarded with breathtaking views of Cape Town and the surrounding area, of the coastline and the Atlantic ocean. There are plenty of vista points and a network of walking trails. Also at the top there's a cafeteria and souvenir shop. The highest point on Table Mountain measures 1,086 meters (3,563 ft) above sea level. António de Saldanha, a Portuguese ship captain, made the first recorded ascent of Table Mountain in 1503. He is the one responsible for naming the mountain Taboa do Cabo (Table of the Cape)The mountain was picked as one of the "New Seven Wonders of Nature" a fact that is being heavily advertised around the cable car stations. We got to the cable car station on the red hop on hop off bus. Alternatively you can drive there or take a taxi.

Awesome Summer Fun and Breath-taking Views. I visited this Park and attraction on 2 occasions over our busy December holiday season. I had a friend from India visiting and I showed him around, while on a separate occasion it was a family outing in beautiful summer weather.We visited the Park on the Boulders Beach side (Simon’s Town) and saw the beautiful penguin colony, with the penguins a little shy and you view them from the walking bridge side.We also enjoyed walking on the beach and take in the spectacular views of the Mountain and Cape flowers on the one side, while the splendid view of False Bay dazzled us on the other side. It was awesome to end the day with traditional fish and chips from a local restaurant.I suggest you make this an annual ritual!

Did not disappoint!. Check the mountain is clear and not covered with the 'Tablecloth!' Get up there early so you don't have a long cue and before it gets too hot! Views are fantastic. You need at least an hour or two to really enjoy the views once you get up there.

Awesome!. Some of the best views in my whole life. A lot of amazing trekkings. If you have some days to stay at Cape Town, i strongly recommend you to visit there in your first sunny day staying. Unforgettable!

Great views and lovely place to walk. Table Mountain is definitely a "do not miss" stop in Cape Town. You get beautiful views of the area and it's just lovely to walk the expanse of the mountain to enjoy views in different directions and the unique "fynbos" vegetation.
Great experience. Fantastic views and running scenery. Good facilities and nice little shop and cafe. Would thoroughly recommend walking all round the top
Amazingly breathtaking views. Try to get on top of the mountain by 9:00 am on a Sunny clear morning for the best experience. We were fortunate enough to experience it like this.
Amazing!. Anyone visiting Cape Town would come here. It is beautiful and you get all the views of the area. The cable ride is great.

Breathtaking. It was absolutely breathtaking. If you are into nature then this is definitely a location that you want to see. Make sure to have a good camera. It isn't too far from the airport if you want to make it one of the first places to see.

Spectacular view from up there. Heard a lot about Table Mountain before coming to Cape Town. Well let me tell you, it is a must to go up there. Be it hiking or through the easier way, cable car. Spectacular view from up there. Take tons of pictures. Buy an ice cream and enjoy the view. Life is beautiful. Everything is awesome with the mountains.
Great experience.. Got to be done and very worthwhile. Spend at least 2 hours on the top to walk around and sit and have a drink looking out across Cape Town and the surrounding countryside.
amazing attraction. table mountain and the views are awe inspiring ...what a brilliant natural landmark....the revolving cable car ascent and decent is amazing.

Get there early. A must do if visiting Cape Town. Great views over the peninsula helps you get your bearings!
Cable car ride very efficient but get there as it opens. Long queues form quickly
There is a restaurant at the top for snacks and drinks.

Fantastic views/well orgsnised. Our tickets for Tsble Mountsin were bought when we got tickets for the red bus tour. It is best this way, as it gets very busy and big queues. If you have tickets, you can go straight through to the cable car.It is all very well orgsnised and if you are brave, you can abseil down.The views are stunning and if in Cape Atown this is a must see.

A MUST DO. Don't just go up the cable car spend half a day wandering around the many pathways on top of the mountain plus you'll get away from all the crowds of people. Wear some sensible shoes and take a jacket as the weather can change pretty quickly. It's not just that cafe and souvenir shop.

Amazing view!. This is a must-visit when in Capetown, as the view from above is hard to beat! Make sure to check the weather forecast before you leave...you'll want a sunny/cloud-free day to take advantage of the view.
Beautiful. Fantastic cable car ride. Stunning views. Sunset must be experienced. The restaurant could be cleaner though.

Worth visiting. Very large park (payment) better to arrive there early otherwise you risk a cue to buy the ticket. The Cape is a must see. Climb on feet, if you can, because the 20 minutes walk offers nice view of the sea around the Cape of Good Hope.
Great views. 360 degrees revolving cable car ride up and beautiful views once up there. We went up in February and was cold once up there but still nice and sunny.
World class park. The variety of flora here is incredible. as are the birds and the "dassies" (rock hydrax), are a joy to watch.
Beautiful view on Capetown. This is a must do excursion. You climb by foot or go with the cable car. You can afterwards have a walk in the botanical gardens.

Amazing! 100% recommended!. My family and I were visiting South Africa from England for a holiday of a life time. The ticketing system to get up the mountain was quick and painless. The rotating cable car is a great touch as it gives everyone an equal chance to see the sights and was plenty big enough for all of the passengers.Up on reaching the top of the mountain, you cant explain the view without visiting. It is absolutely amazing, you have an unobstructed view for as far as the eye can see. You're able to see all of the main landmarks and get some incredible pictures from here. The cafe serves good food and drink, its great that they have such good toilet facilities and they really have spent a lot of time and eff
Best place. Amazing experience to climb this mountain, there is small restaurant on top of the mountain. beautiful views around the mountain. If you are nature lover this is the place to be in.

Must see. As one of the new seven wonders of the natural world, a trip to Cape Town wouldn't be complete without going to Table Mountain. The mountain dominates the landscape in Capetown, and provides great views over the city. Have time to do some walks up the top. It is very quiet and peaceful if you wander over the Springbok path.

THE VIEW.... The reference to the "City Bowl" is clearly understood when you see Cape Town from the top of Table Mountain. Allow time, on a warm sunny day, to take the cableway to the top and be amazed. You can see the entire region: Robben Island, the waterfront, Camps Bay Beach, and much more.

Absolute must do...... There are no words to describe the views from the top of Table Mountain!!! You have to see them for yourself and take in the whole experience!!!If you can see the top of the mountain from Cape Town, then go! We were delayed going to the top because of the weather. Even if it's beautiful weather in the city, pack a light sweater or jacket. The wind can change very quickly and it can be chilly at the top. I was snapping pictures left and right trying to capture it all and I had to stop myself....then I just sat here and there and took it all in!!! Highlight of our trip!!! Bucket list item checked off!!!

What a beauty!. A fantastic place to hike and relax and chase the clouds and view the city from above. Table Mountain is just majestic. We spent a few hours at the top hiking and then enjoying ice cream at the restaurant and looking at the shops. It was a great first-day activity that we did as soon as we dropped our bags.

A wonder of nature, above your head!. I visisted the park a few days ago with family. Quite busy, but well organised. The view to and from the Table Mountain is fantastic. We were there for the sunset, which was wonderful. Most visitors stay within the first 100-150 m from the entrance, so even if it looks very busy, if you are prepared to walk for 5-10 minutes, you will find an isolated point to enjoy the landscape and let the fresh air clean your head and soul. I did, and I only had 20 minutes available for that. Can't think of a visit to Cape Town without going up there. Tip: if you have pre-booked and paid for the funicular, you will avoid long queues and won't wait long to get into it. Take something warm up there, it can be very cold, at 1000+ of altitude. Make sure you check timetable, it closes early.
Must do in Cape Town. I've traveled to Cape Town often, and never had a chance to go up Table Mountain. Finally did, and very well worth it. Nice and easy in the heart of the Cape.

A great nature experience. This was one of those almost magic moments of nature experience. Be early as we were and avoid the cableway queues and have the place more to yourself. We were extremely lucky in having sun and no wind. The views are of course magnificent and we walked around the area nearest to the cableway in an hour or so. There is wildlife in the form of birds and dassies. The top is not flat but full of rocks so you have to stick to the paths.

Beautiful!. Got the hotel travel desk to check the weather forecast and book cable car tickets on the day to avoid ticket queues. Arrived early 9.30am no queues. Efficient cable car system. Fantastic views on a clear day. Suggest allow 3 hours at least. Cafe and shop on top. Can be breezy or very hot (little shade). Stunning views.

Table Mountain is well worth a visit. Time your visit for a clear day - this will guarantee you the greatest views of CapeTown and area, pretty much on a 360 degree basis. On the best of days, one can see as far as Cape of Good Hope.At an altitude of approx. 1,000 metres, Table Mountain appears from the city as a "flat top tableau". Once you are there, and take the cable car to the top, you will be amazed at how rugged it is. You will have a choice of 3 walks (short, medium - 15 minutes, and long). Rodent type creatures and birds are also within range of a typical camera.

Bad Luck Hiking. we manage our program to visit table mountain, and this day was very windy and the mountain was covered with clouds and was closed.we re schedule our plan and mange this visit to another day, but we have a very bad luck , that this day was very windy too and the mountain was closed and unfortunately it was our last day at Cape Town !

Unmissable beauty, just pack water. This is the number one stop in cape town, accessible to back packers via the Myciti (free shuttle) or a red bus tour. If you are fit you can take a jog or bide ride from kloof street! Definitely suggested if you want to fell your calf muscles burn after.The hike up Table Mountain should take no more than 2 hours. You can grab something to eat at the restaurant however do not share your food with the local dassies. No matter how cute they may be.when taking photos, set it to panoramic. you get to see a 360 degree view of our beatiful city!!!

Romantic Sunset Views. I have found there is nothing more romantic than sitting beside your loved one and enjoying the sunset with an amazing view, this applies all over the world. This was one of the most beautiful sunset views I have experienced.
A must . Who goes to CT and DOESN'T go to Table Mountain?You must! I don't think I need to say anything else!!
Great views over the Mother City!. A must if you're ever in Cape Town! Go up by cable car or by foot (quite the walk) and enjoy the stunning views.

Tourists and locals should not miss this absolutely fabulous place. Watch the weather and, when the mountain is clear, head on up to the cable station. The queue moved swiftly and we did not wait long to board. Fabulous and incomparable views as the car moves smoothly upwards, rotating 360 degrees during the ascent. Once at the top you are free to stroll (on marked pathways) for quite some distance. The views are spectacular and binoculars are worth carrying if you have them. If not, take time to pick out landmarks from the city and beyond. Can't comment on the food offerings but people were sitting happily at tables and did not appear irritated at all. Weather very changeable so take a jacket, sun screen and a hat! Take your time and savour the experience.

Picturesque Views Like No Other. Rarely are we presented with such panoramic views in such a varied way.To one side you have uninterrupted views of the sea, another fabulous mountain views and another is Cape Town itself.This has to be on your bucket list, is easily accessible and relatively cheap.Be aware that you should plan in advance and buy your tickets in advance. The tickets will allow you to jump to the front of the line rather than wait to buy which as I understand it shaves significant time off. Planning in advance will ensure that if you get a windy day (where they close the cable car) you can easily pick another date to return whilst on your trip.Definitely don't miss out on this...

Top of the world!!!. A definite must if visiting Cape Town. The views from the top are stunning in every direction.Comfy shoes are recommended if you like walking,plenty of walks to do in varying degrees.

Not to be missed. This is excellent - you can pre-book tickets for the cable car which will not only give you a discount but also help with the queue. As soon as you see a clear day then go, not everyone gets to visit due to poor weather.

WOW. Probably some of the most stunning views you will ever see. We spent an afternoon on top of the mountain and found it exhilerating. We enjoyed lunch and and drinks whaih were reasonably priced and of good quality.

An excellent, varied natural attraction. The highlight of this National Park is Table Mountain itself, 3,000 feet of spectacular scenery. The cable car to the top is an experience in itself - a five minute journey in a gondola that rotates. On top there are shops and a cafe, but people wanting solitude can escape from the developed area easily. The view is spectacular, looking over the city of Cape Town, and as far as Robben Island.
GREAT VIEW!. Nice view from the top! you can either go by funicular or walking, but anyways is worthy. Up in the top you can have a nice walk and also find restaurants!

Spectacular views. A must see when visiting Cape Town. The wait to get to the top can be long and hot as there is very little shade but it is worth the wait. The cable car ride does not take very long although can be a bit cramped.

Amazing, Must Do!!. If you visit Cape Town you have to go to Table Mountain. If you don't want to actually hike it there is a cable car that can take you to the top. An Absolutely amazing view, definitely take a look around and walk around the trail along the top of the mountain, amazing views overlooking the city and the ocean side

Stunning views. We booked tickets online so skipped the queues on the way up. Views from the top are simply spectacular. We were fortunate that it wasn't too cold at the top but had brought cardigans. Lovely walks that are well marked out. The weather started to close in which meant quite a queue for the cable car to get down.

Out of the world views!!. If you have limited time in Cape Town, this is the best place to be. Take a cable car up or trek up (be prepared for a long and tiresome one!!). Best time to be there is in the evening to watch the sun set. We went in the morning though as that was the only time available to us but the experience was equally rewarding. There are several places to enjoy a 360 view of the city and a very nice restaurant which serves good coffee and quick bites. Worth spending 1-2 hours up there.
On the top of the world. The place is excellent to visit as it makes you feel on top of the world and lovely scenic beauty The guidance was excellent and the arrangements were excellent

Great place to see. Very well run reasonably priced attraction, nice cafe at the top and as you might expect fantastic views of Cape Town, its suburbs, winefields and mountains beyond. If the weather is fine and there is no or little wind take the opportunity to go immediately if you can, don't leave it for another day as if the Cape Doctor wind blows the cable car will be shut and the top of the mountain will be cloudy anyway.

Tourism Cape Town. Visually such a beauty from as far as 200km on sea and a true icon.
Nature lovers dream.
Hikes from different angle
Indigenous fynbos
Covered in a white cloud cloth often with many fables...
Scenery
A MUST visit for every South Africa and international visitor

Well worth a visit. Check in advance if it is open as it is very weather dependent
Book your tickets online in advance, you will still need to Queue but it should move faster
Bring a sweater - it's chilly at the top, no matter how hot it is below!
Anyone with reasonable fitness should be able to hike up instead of cable car

Fantastic views. Please carry lots of warm clothing and don't forget ear muffs or a scarf to cover your ears. It is quite cold up there and there is a wind blowing most of the time.The ride up in a 360 degree rotating cable car sets up your expectations. At the top, you are amazed by the view of Cape Town. There are plenty of viewing / photo taking spots on the top. And it is a huge area to walk on the top - different views from various points. Please factor in at least a couple of hours at the top, if not more.

We went up in the cable cart, walked around the pathways, had lunch and returned by cable cart.. I took my staff from Kingsbury Hospital for an outing. It was a beautiful experience and good team building.

Worth the wait. Yes you will have to wait in the queue to go up and to come down but it's so worth it .The views are truly awesome..the rolling mist spooky and the whole of Cape Town's layout is so interesting to behold. It's COLD and WINDY so take adequate clothing.

Fantastic Views!!!. 5 of us decided to take on Table Mountain a couple of weeks ago and we weren't left disappointed. We decided to get taxi to the bottom of the hiking area which is about a 3-5 minute drive beyond the cable car. We were hiking with my 64 year old father so we were quite nervous about the difficulty of the walk. It is certainly a testing hike for anyone without a base level of fitness and is quite steep in parts. I would also recommend doing this early morning before the mid-morning heat kicks in which definitely makes it more challenging. Also do ensure you have plenty of water and appropriate footwear. Once you get to the top of the the mountain though, all your efforts are rewarded with stellar views of Cape Town. Definitely one of the highlights of an excellent trip and would recommend the hike if you feel able to.
Table Mountain IS Cape Town. The Table Mountain is Cape Town. The weather circumstances permitting, Table Mountain and the view from there is a must!

Must do!. Well this is just the most amazing place in Cape Town! I went up with the cable car and here is the trick: it spins around one time while going up. So when you get in, take a spot in the worst place of the gondola, because when your up you've had the best view. We went up on a cloudy day, but it was still amazing being up there and enjoying the view when the clouds broke up.
Definitely no.1 attraction in Cape town. Must do. Breathtaking views ! Took cable car that rotates360 degrees to see views of the mountain and the cityShould consider hiking up next time.

Walk or ride with nature with a Mother City view. The best way to experience Table Mountain is by hiking, Walking or cycling. Each activity will indeed give you a different experience and perspective of nature in the area and extraordinary views that will wish you had lived in this city filled with splendor & beauty. Views are in comparible with many parts of the world. Else take the short route via the cable car. Gaurentee both will be equally rewarding.

On Top of the World. Off we went to Town. There is free parking near lions head entrance.Then take the free bus to the entrance of table mountain. Lots of booths for payment - quick and painless. There are many offers throughout the year and you either print coupon or give code.There is a maximum per cable car I think 65 which felt a little crammped. The bottom rotates which is great so everyone can take pictures/selfies.At the top its absolutely free. There are cafes and restaurants which are a little expensive so take your own food. Very windy so be prepared. Long queue back. Need to be reasonably fit.Loved the feeling and awesome view.

Must see. Just go. The views are stunning from Table Mountain through to Cape Point. Allow yourself, with the help of transport, a day or two to travel round. For Table Mountain, be flexible if you can, keep an eye on the weather to avoid a cloudy day. On a clear blue day watch out for the view to see where the sky meets the sea, stunning.As far as Cape Point and the cape of Good Hope. They are, depending on your health and fitness challenging walking. If you have kids or are not so fit take the transport on offer. As for walking to Cape of Good Hope, I think it is for healthy adults. If I had kids under 10 I would not take them. There are, rightly, no safety barriers however a lot of ground is over rocks not far from substantial falls.But overall don't be put off, I loved the park and enjoyed walking round parts of it.

Spectacular views and a wonderful hike. Table Mountain National Park starts with either a vigorous hike up the mountain, or a spectacular ride on a cable car. Either way, once reaching the top, the journey has just begun.After reviving at the Mountain Cafe, start on the well marked trail around the top of the mountain. This trail provides spectacular views of all sides of the peninsula an information plaques supply a history of the unique wildlife and plants in the area. Be prepared for a lengthy walk with good shoes and sunscreen.There are many opportunities for stunning panoramas along the route so plan on taking a little more time than that suggested by the trail guides. There are also opportunities to take a "shortcut" if time becomes critical but remember that there may be a long lineup at the descending cable car.Table Mountain plays an important part in the well being and prosperity of Cape Town. Take the time to visit and enjoy this unique park.

Lovely walks & scenic drive. We saw a few animals, & lots of different flowers. The sea & rocks & old world war 2 radar & guns were also great to see. I especially enjoyed the less touristy parts, & was fascinated to see how the burned areas were recovering. The flashes of red and white flowers amongst the burned branches was very striking!The children found some of the walks a little hard, but managed on their own with just a few extra rest stops.
Awesome experience!. Great view from the entire city! Lots of tourists. A little scare when going up with the cable car but in the end the view is breath taking!

Pleasant roam around the top of the mountain. We spent a couple of hours up here on a good sunny day and so were able to see the spectacular views. We did see some wildlife (birds and a couple of dessies) on our walk around the top, which is an easy walk and not very far unless you start to walk down the mountain.

Great view & Great Cable cars. Definitely worth a visit. The queue is pretty quick as you can fit about 60 people in 1 cable car. If your driving make sure you go early as it can be a nightmare to find parking.

Must do in Cape Town. This is a must do when in Cape Town. From the top, you will enjoy the amazing views of Cape Town which is breathtaking. Make sure you get there in the morning as it gets really crowded in the afternoon.

table Mountain. Well worth the visit, you can spend as much or little time as you like, plenty of space so does not fill cramped at any time, the views are out of this world, plenty of photo opportunities. If table mountain is covered in cloud called Its Table Cloth its not worth the visit but you can see this from miles away.

Iconic Place. Stunning views across the Cape. The walk around the top affords different aspects of the beauty of the hills and coastline all the way down to Cape Point. The cable car is worth the wait. Not to be missed if you visit Capetown.
Amazing, you have to visit in Cape Town. We managed to sneak up on cloudy afternoon, it was simply magical, the clouds swirled around us, it was so beautiful and the view was breathtaking. Go go go!
hiking activity or also popular for runners and nature lovers. Activity for everyone. Cable car, hike up or running. Stunning view and gorgous nature. Beautiful surroundview.

Stunning views. As everyone else here says, this is an absolute must trip if you are staying in Cape Town. Be warned that you may not make it as it is very dependent on the weather and the wind in particular.We took the Red Bus Route and got off at the lower station. We had been advised to buy the tickets either before hand or on the bus which we did. As it happened the queue was very short but, in high season, you may well be advised to book before you get there.The cable car ride is about 8 minutes long and, if you are afraid of heights, you can stand in the middle of the 60 person cable car. Once up there you get the most stunning views of Cape Town, Robben Island, Lion's Head and the beaches and towns on the Eastern side. We even saw people abseiling off the top including a 10 year old child plus paragliders circling Lion's Head.There is a cafe, shop and toilets at the top plus many Dassies (Rock Hyrax). If you so inclined you can walk up to the top and it takes about 2 hours each way.My cousins tried 4 times to go up while we were there without any luck. We got up first time.

Breathtaking!. At the first glimpse of clear weather we headed straight up to the gondola to take us to one of the the most incredible places on earth. I am absolutely terrified of heights and basically had to close my eyes for the entire ride up but once there was gobsmacked by the view (I did stand well back from the edges!) We walked the full length of the plateau and it was glorious. We had perfect weather, clear sunny skies and not a breath of wind - the perfect way to experience this natural wonder

Views!. Amazing cable car ride and views of Capetown and surrounding areas were stunning . Better to go early as gets crowded and also wind can pick up and they close the cable car. You can also hike to the top.

Amazing views of Cape Town. This is a must-do when visiting Cape Town which you can either walk up or take cable way to get to the top.Once at the top, you get to walk around and enjoy the breathtaking views of beautiful Cape Town. Cost of Cableway was approx. 250 Rand for adults and 160 Rand for children. Highly recommended, pick a clear day to visit Table Mountain as can be closed if it's either raining or windy.
Splendid views. Beautiful park which dominates the area. Excellent hiking trails. flora is lovely in the area, too. Breathe in the beauty and take your time! Watch the weather, though.
Nice Hiking!. Hike up and take the cablecar down - that's how I did it and what I would recommend. Really beautiful views all around.

Astonishing views. It is really nice to get on the top of the Table Mountain. You can get there by the monorail or just hiking.In a sunny day you can see all the surrounding mountains and how green is this city. You can also enjoy the different animals and a moment of peace. I loved it!

Bad choice of day to visit, but still worth it. There was zero visibiity when we got up there, but the views from the lower cable car, despite being slightly misty, were still spectacular. We opted to go for a short walk along the top, but had to turn back because we couldn't see 10m in front of our faces!

Pure nature. There are a lot of wild animals in the area. The hikingways are good, mostly not circular. You have to pay a little entrance fee. It's possible to drive with the car in the park to startpoints of hiking trails.

Highly recommend doing a hike when you are in Cape Town. I would highly recommend you do a hike or walk when you are in Cape Town as you see the beauty of the place in a different way and are able to get views that you could not get from any car or at ground level. The best area to walk are in the Table Mountain National Park area which is vast and covers most of the Cape Peninsula. We did 3 walks that really stood out : to Chapmans Peak, the Pipetrack above Camps Bay and the Two Oceans walk from Cape Point. We also did Lions Head which has sensational views but certainly in Feb was quite crowded with walkersIt is not advisable to walk alone.

Breathtaking!. Once you are up there the air feels so much cleaner and the views are spectacular, try to do the circular walk as you see the aspects from all sides plus the further away you are from the cable car port the quieter it gets.
Walk around the top. Great views from the top and you can walk around using the passages. There is a shop and bar at the top, well worth a visir

Climbing up in the morning, beautiful!. We climbed up and took the cable down. Taxi took us to the base (driver knew the place) at 5ish in the morning. It was good time to start. So we walked up and took enough breaks - take water with you and a snack. It is relatively heavy but worth it. The view and sun rising over Cape Town was breath taking! On the top we took about 1 km walk at the far end of the park. Beautiful spot for breakfas and we didnt see anyone else during the whole breakfast. I would recommend to leave the cable area and see the emptines and view a bit further away. Atmosphere is very different.

So beautiful walking on this ancient mountain. Stunning views and vistas. My favourite way to go up is from Kirstenbosch along either Nursery Ravine or Skeleton Gorge. Beautiful shade through ancient forests ensure you keep cool with plenty of natural spring water
Fantastic views of CapeTown. Once at the top, a lot of pathways are easily accessible to see the panoramas and abundance of wild alpine-type plants and flowers

If it is a clear day - GO!. After traveling 24+ hours to get to Cape Town, we checked into our hotel and our guide said "Let's go to Table Mountain". We had planned on showering and relaxing - but she persisted. We managed to rally ourselves up to go - and we were definitely rewarded for it. The views from Table Mountain were spectacular! The mountain was closed for much of the next two days due to high winds. One of our trip highlights for sure!

Beautiful parc. Table Mountain National Parc is a beautiful parc with astonishing views. You can get up the mountain by cable and have spectacular views. You can even see Robbenisland when the weather is clear. You can also view both oceans when you are on the table mountain .

Stunning views, numerous activities and excellent value for money!. The Table Mountain National Park is a vast park covering various areas surrounding the Table Mountain - from Cape Point to Signal Hill, through to Rhodes Memorial etc. There are numerous places to visit spanning various towns surrounding Cape Town. There is something for everyone and at a reasonable price. I live in Cape Town and I love to explore different parts of the park. There are also parts of the park that one can access for free e.g. Signal Hill, Lion's Head (excellent for hiking) etc.

Awesome views!!. I was a bit sceptical, due to the huge size of the queues on the day we drove there.So we decided to come back the following day, early start to be there 8am approx. when it opened.There was a bit of cloud so there was no queue, but the forecast was good, so we went to the top and had a coffee in the café.The clouds cleared as expected, and due to the limited number of tourists up there, the experience was awesome!Great views of Cape Town etc, walked the trails for a few hours then came down before lunch.

Great views!!. As the locals advise tourists. Go up as soon as its clear as the weather is so quick to turn!! Get there first thing in the morning, otherwise you will have to que in the heat and there isn't much in the way of shade.
A great hike. Park near the cable car and hike up the mountain on a good clear day, not recommended in high winds.
Hiked with Hike Table Mountain. Hiking is the best way to experience the mountain. I thoroughly enjoyed the hike more than the brief photo op at the top.

Sunset Special for Valentine's Day. The sunset special is a great way to see Table Mountain & the city lights at a fraction of the cost. This is a great option for a couples date night. You can grab a coffee & slice of pizza and watch the sun set over Cape Town. The process from buying your tickets, boarding the cable car and making your way is really swift even when jam packed. Great evening out!
BEAUTIFUL. WOW!!! I don't have enough words to describe the experience my family and I had at Table Mountain! HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS ATTRACTION! Will definitely visit again if ever in Cape Town.

Perfect start to your first morning in Cape Town. I lived here for years; never did more than take cable car. Hadn't been back in 20 years, and decided to hike. The hike up is def. more fun. Start early, take main route near cable station, and you are there in 2hrs. Heavily trafficked in peak season, and rain and mist common, but well-designed stone steps and it is not a difficult one. Light sweater or fleece for top as it is colder there. Good views and restaurant on top. We used a guide but this is not necessary at all.
I did it!!. Conquered my fear and I did the trip ! -and wow was it worth it-great views all round -wonderful morning. Best to chose a bright morning for the trip as cloud can appear in pm.,
Beautiful. It's a hard climb but with the right guide (Hike Table Mountain are the best) you immediately feel far away from the big city. Beautiful nature and a lovely, challenging exercise.
Beautiful. The views are simply stunning. When in Cape Town on holiday, go up Table Mountain - It really couldn't be simpler...

Breathtaking views! . Oh wow, I have to admit that the mountain actually beat me! We headed up early morning, around 6.30, & it was really a bit chilly! But after climbing for an hour, and hearing that the cable car was clsed I decided to make my way back down. I was disappointed not to take the cable car, but still saw some stunning views.

Go early. Get up early and miss the huge Q for the ticket office or book beforehand also it gets so hot up there its better early doors,Fantastic views from the top and a lovely walk around,lots of places for cool photo's with great back drops.
Spiritual. Incredible views and great for a mini hike. Stunning natural location and not too busy. There is free water on the top. Would recommend the cable car!
The view is worth the wait. Book an online ticket and hope that the queue favours you. The view is spectacular. Plan at least a half day depending upon the queues.
Amazing place. Just an amazing wonder of nature! I recommend it to everyone visiting Cape Town. The view is outstanding and sunset is very beautiful.

Great on a clear day. We caught the cable car up which takes under 5 minutes and were lucky enough to visit on a clear day where the views "went forever".Once up the top, there is a shop and a café (including toilets).There are many paths and walkways you can take. One goes in a full circle - others are hiking trails which can take hours to complete.The scenery of Cape Town and the surrounding landscape was absolutely impressive!

Must go if you are in Cape Town. Definitely a must go when you are in Cape Town, You can take a cable car up and there are practically big and flat on the top Excellent scenery! But it is very weather depended, easily get clouded on the mountain top. So just go up without waiting if the visibility is good

Impressive nature!. We visited this park already for the third time over the years and always saw new parts. This time we went to the Cape Point lighthouse which is run over by tourists and did the Hoek van Bobbejaan trail, where we met only two surfers. Nature is impressive there, did the trail with our almost four year old daughter, was no issue for her...a little adventur for everyone including antelopes! Clear recommendation. PS: Entering the park costs ZAR 125,-- per person, ZAR for children.
Skeleton gorge . Fantastic hike up skeleton gorge to the aquaduct to see the disas. Then on to maclears beacon and down nursery ravine. 7.5 hour hike
Beautiful scenery and great nature info. Loved this place so gorgeous to see all of Cape Town. It was a little foggy but still worth the trip up to hear all the info on the walks

Table Top Mountain. It's just one of those places you have to go. You will be rewarded by awesome breathtaking views which are spectacular. Would have loved more time at the top but it was not to be, as the siren went of and we had to make our way to the the cable car, as it became extremely windy and misty and not advisable to be up there. Just glad we actually got to the top.

Got to do this. . We have been to SA three times and this is the first we have made it to table mountain. Our friends wanted to walk up and convinced us to do it also. This one of the toughest things we could do as while not completely unfit we had not done this type of hike for years. It is not for the faint hearted or those expecting to be 'rescued' so please catch the cable car if steep climbs are not your thing in the heat of the day. Took us 3.5 hours with many frequent stops due to the steepness. For us it was worth it and I am so pleased to have done it. Thank goodness for the cable car down.

Wonderful visits, well organised. The journey up by cable car with rotating view is offering great views already, but nothing beats the views on top of table mountain. Pick a sunny day with no wind and you can spend 2-4 hours hiking the top enjoying the scenery of the many fijnbossies. Ideal start of your stay in Cape Town, as it helps you to orient and understand the city layout.
Amazing 360 views. Go early in the morning and purchase your tram ticket at the hop on hop off office to avoid the long line ups when you get there.

Unimaginably scenic. Unimaginably scenic. At times in the day, a bit of cloud drapes itself over the top and looks like a fluffy tablecloth, it's ridiculous. When the sun sets and you're at the bottom, try spotting the lion of Lion's Head :). Look for it's muzzle, it's face, nose and mouth.

Beautiful. A must experience. Wear trainers and take a jacket even in the summer. When you purchase your ticket online you have 7 days to use it. The view is amazing when there aren't clouds to block it.

On the top of the world!. A very impressive place that makes you feel like being on the top of the world!Be careful while taking pictures on the rocks - it's steep and really high!There is plenty to do and see - I would recommend 4-5 hours even for those who do not plan any serious climbing.
The view!!. We went up Table Mountain via the cableway, what a breath taking experience it does get pretty windy up there, unfortunately the food wasn't that great at the restaurant on Table Mountain
Table Mountain National Park. Table Mountain National Park! we did and hike from the other side of Table Mountain National Park! and it was amazing...
Ride and View. We got lucky - a beautiful day and no lines. The ride up and down is a great part of the experience. Walk around the top for views in all directions.

Do not miss this venue. However little time you have in Cape Town this is a "must do" opportunity and well worth the time and if you really feel fit the effort of climbing instead of taking the cablecar.
The views are simply outstanding and the personnel do their best to make it a great experience.

Not to be missed. "If you arrive on a clear day and can see the top of the mountain, go up immediately!" was the advice we were given, so we did just that, and I'm so glad we did. Simply stunning views all around. Definitely a "must" if you are visiting Cape Town.

Views that are priceless. Always keep a warm jacket with you and good walking shoes.
You will encounter some wild animals, keep away especially from baboons as they can become aggressive.

A must see in Cape town. This is well worth your while and wait. Book on line which makes waiting less. The views are spectacular on the way up and once up there are many different routes to take offering spendid views.
Fabulous holiday.. Breathtaking views from the top lots of treks on various routes once your up there. Was an awesome experience.

Achmat Jackson Adventures. Hi - I am now a Qualified Adventure Guide for Table Mountain and surrounds. Please contact me for any Hiking adventure. I have more than 20 years of hiking experience in South Africa; most of the 5 day and Weekend Trails and Namibia. I also summited some International High Altitude Mountains...Kilimanjaro (3 Summits), Aconcagua (South America), Elbrus (Russia), Mount Kenya, Base Camp Island Peak in Nepal.
Okay. A big mountain with great views. What else can I say. It is more stunning from ground level when the table cloth covers it.

You feel on top of the world.. Table mountain is unique, it is a mountain peak that goes on for ever. On a clear day there are views that keep on getting better. The cable car is the easiest way to the top. Once there just keep walking and see as much as y oh can.

Seize the Hour -- if the Weather is Clear then Go For It..... We visited Cable Mountain but unfortunately did not get to go to the top...on the day we were there the clouds had descended and there was zero visibility -- which meant we were advised not to take the Cable Car up. Still it was an interesting location and we did notice in the three days in Cape Town that the Mountain could be clear one minute and hidden in the clouds the next.Is definitely worth checking out the weather and trying to get a look when the cloud is on holiday.

Wonderful. No trip to Cape Town is complete without a trip to Table Mountain. The day that we went there were no long lines. The staff were friendly and helpful. But the view is amazing. You have to experience it.

Great views. Both the local fauna and flora and the views around here generally make this a must-do visit. I would like to do it again and try the walk up.
Watty

Amazing views!!. Table mountain is the iconic skyline of Cape Town and is worth a trip up there. Apparently it closes often due to wind, but if you can make it, definitely do! Awesome views of the city and Robben Island (where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned). On top of the mountain there is a gift shop and a small bar for drinks. There is a walking path that goes all the way around the top.

Go for the View!. What a wondrous view! Surprisingly we spent a couple hours at the top of Table Mountain hiking around, ducking into the facilities and enjoying a relaxing cup of tea before heading down. Do buy your tickets online so you can save yourself queuing twice. Give yourself time to enjoy the view from all angles.

Breath taking . Outstanding landscape. One of my favorite place in the world. Beautifull view on the océan, blue sky...cable car above Cape Town can not be described with words. We went up using the cable car and walked down.

great experience. we hiked table mountain and it is very doable. I couldnt believe how many others were also walking. it was early on a saturday morning about 9 am so I suppose it was peak time. I was glad I wasnt in the queue for the cable car which was v long. It took us about 1 h 45 I think to get to top. Then we got cable car down. It was quite crowded up there - well worth climb though

Amazing view be lucky with the cloud. A stunning view like no other of Cape Town but you will need to plan carefully to avoid cloud cover. The trip in the cable car is fun in itself and the little cottage gift shop brilliant. Try sending a postcard from the top! Pens and stamps are provided.

Do not miss a visit up table Mountain!. The views from the top of the Table Mountain are insane! Beware the winds though.... It might get a little chilly even on really hot summer days. But, still - it's worth a visit just to gaze out over the magic city...
Fabulous views. Wonderful views from top of Table mountain, did not have to queue, advise if going to get your hotel to pre- book so no queuing. Great experience.
Stunning scenery. We were lucky with the weather, being able to go up table mountain, but unfortunately the cloud was not completely clear so we didn't get the full view.

Stunning views <3. We have been up to table mountain twice and the view always surprise me, whether you go by sunset or morning, always incredible, besides there are tables up there in case you want to bring a picnic with you, I totally recommend it!

One of the top attractions in Cape Town!. I could spend hours and hours fascinated and relaxed watching nature while enjoying some local wine at the restaurant at the top. One has full views of Cape Town, the beaches, and surrounding areas. The mountain is bigger than expected and what it looks from the bottom around the city area, The surrounding attractions look well preserved and clean. Also try the ice cream they sell at one of the kiosks is so smooth and silky and the best we had while in South Africa!

A MUST DO!!!!. Table Mountain is beautiful! My husband and I took the cable car up around 6 PM to make it for the sunset and it was one of our favorite nights in South Africa. It was beautiful. I HIGHLY recommend buying your tickets ahead of time so you don't have to wait in line for the cable car ride, and buy a wine bottle when you get to the top- they give you cute little plastic wine glasses with it. You won't regret it!
Well worth the visit . Ascended the cable car to the top of Table Mountain... Lovely walkways, great views, learnt a lot. Something you have to explore when in Cape Town
A view not to be missed. Go regardless of whether you want to or not ... you will be sorry if you miss it.The views are amazing.
a Must visit place. Take a cable car and enjoy your journey up and down the hill . Amazing views .the restaurant at the foot hills is great as well !

Amazing views. We took our family of kids and grandkids(some a bit apprehensive re heights) and everyone voted this the favourite of all the places we visited. They were in awe of the fantastic views!!

Amazing place. Took a private tour through the park to get to Cape of Good Hope and bald we did this rather than scheduled tour. Saw a baboons, zebra, ostrich. Had to walk the steps to the top of the Cape lighthouse as fenicular was not working- be careful as this was quite hard work. Use the bus service ! Views are outstanding.

Tricky timing but worth the effort. Wind and/or clouds can prevent you from getting the cable car up to the top, but if you luck out with a clear and relatively still day, get up there and hike. Some in our group hiked up and took the cable car down. One of the oldest mountains in the world and it's great to see the city from the mountain after having seen the mountain from the city basically everywhere you walk.

Incredible experience. The park covers a lot more than just Table Mountain, but Table Mountain is the center of attraction. The cable car to the top is a must during your visit, but spend a good deal of time at the top and see the beauty that is Cape Town and its surrounding areas.

Fabulous view of CapeTown and interesting vegetation. Apparently we were lucky since the "tabletop" is often covered in fog and then is not accessible - loved the view. Some people hiked up but we took the rotating cable car and although I'm a bit afraid, I surprised myself by enjoying it.

Walk among the clouds . We bought online tickets for this, however on the day itself in the morning, the cable car was not in operation. Do check their website before going down or call in to ensure they are open.. As it's very dependent on the weather. We went back in the afternoon ard 4pm. There's a cafe upstairs for refreshments. The views are awesome and near the clouds! It's like machu picchu combined with sugar loaf mountain. In the evening, it can get chilly. Bring a jacket.

Cape Hope. We have been at the Cape Hope Point part of the Table Mountain National Park. Already the road to go there is very impressive. Amazing landscape, perfect curves for a motorbike. The park itself it beautiful and very suitable for biker. Make sure you check the availability of the Funicular (train) before you go there. Otherwise the move up the peak point will become an intense hike uphill.
Stunning scenery . I loved my trip to the top of Table Mountain. Absolutely spectacular views from the top. We took champagne and glasses and looked out over the city below. It was lush!
On top of the world. Great experience gazing down over Cape Town the bay and the surrounding area. Remember to take sweater as it can be chilly.
beautiful views!!!. must have loads of time as queues can be long and it is weather permitting so chose a nice clam day with little or no wind to visit.
great for the family. we got there early to avoid the queues and had an amazing morning up on table mountain. the staff were all great and the views were unbelievable.
Beautiful Panoramic View. The views are spectacular! All of Southern Africa stretched out on either side. Wear your hiking shoes and take lots of photos. A beautiful place to spend an hour or so.
Magnificent. When the weather is clear you can make your way up to the Park either by cable car or by hiking up. The view is unbelievable. I would recommend this event to everyone
Fabulous views of Cape Town. The car took us up from the Mt Nelson hotel and pre booked tickets meant no queuing. It was cloudless and beautiful.

Breathtaking-Undescribable!. This is a must-do if you are going to be in the Cape Town area of South Africa. The views from above are absolutely breathtaking. You get to the top via cable car and can stay as long as you wish-plan for at least an hour-preferably two or three. There is a little cafe up there along with a gift shop. If you going from the U.S. you will love the exchange rate-you can get nice souvenirs for less than $5. Definitely take your camera...!
Great. A must when visiting Cape Town, better to buy ticket online saves you time when big queues, take wine for sundowners.
Lovely visit. Our visit to Table Mountain National Park was part of an all day tour to Cape Peninsula. It was most enjoyable.

Superb views. Cable car works very efficiently, unusual revolving floor. Views from the top were stunning. Paths around the top to walk different distances to see views from all sides. Café at the top serving a range of self service food.

Stunning. I first went up Table Mountain about 20 years ago, and I remember it as being OK, but not as good as it is now. I think the thing that has made the difference is the building of a network of wide stone paths and observation points. I was knocked out by the 360 degree views and the overall experience. Congratulations Cape Town on doing a greay job!

Must do in Cape Town. Great views over the city and ocean. Go there for sunset and bring your own food and wine. Take the sunset special of the cable way at half price and bring a jacket, even it still has 30 degrees when you start your trip. It might be very windy on top.

Birthday on the mountain. I spent a wonderful birthday on the mountain. The cherry on top- if you're a South African citizen you get a free ticket on your birthday. Thanks TMNP! The queues were long but that was expected. But once we got to the upper station and onto the mountain the vistas made up for it. Views for days! A must-do when in Cape Town. Be sure to take along a jacket as the weather can be unpredictable. And do not go in the school holidays if you can help it. Queues will be longer with loads of kids and their parents.
Must see. Thsi is a must see stop when in Cape Town, take the gondola to the top for magnificent views and nice trails for walking.

Beautiful views. My cousin and I went to Table mountain on a very hot day which is lovely for a Brit like myself. We got some lovely views even though it was a bit smoky and hazy from a fire not too far away.

We did it in 2h30. We decided to hike Table Mountain one way and come down by cable car. Apparently there are 3 ways possible (including one for those who want to actually climb it), and we took the longest way with less steep parts. My husband loved it but for me it was more going up steep stairs than hiking the mountain. You are supposed to go to Table Mountain in a clear sunny windless day to enjoy the view, and in these kinds of days, there is almost no shade to rest on you way up there.Don't forget to take a lot of water with you. That's the most important element. The view is pretty nice too everywhere you look. It took us 2h30 to get there, I arrived there very tired but could make it up by taking beer in the bar on top of the mountain. After getting on top, I was pretty happy I'd done it. I was pretty happy to have the tickets of the cable car to go back down too.PS: there is no entrance fee to the Table Mountain. You just have to pay for the cable car if you use it.

This is one of the world 7 wonders, must see! . If nature is your thing then you must visit table montain, offers a 360 view of the mother city, Visa Cafe is expensive for locals not when your currency is $,€,or £, good coffee but could be improved, I recommend hike for those healthy / fit rather than the cable car as it can be difficult to secure a booking during season time.

A must. We reserved our tickets for the cable car on line and just as well we did because it was c?loses for three days prior. We bypassed long queues. Great going up as it turns around giving everyone a view. Once on top the views are amazing.
Amazing views. The view is amazing, well worth the climb, if done by foot (apx 3+ hours round trip for fit person).
Beautiful view. Everything we thought it would be & more. The cable cars make it easy to get up there quickly with views on the way up. A must see.
What Views. We were lucky to pick a day when there was no mist about. There are several good trails to walk ,but wear reasonable footwear as some of them are a bit rocky.

Just go here and walk around....stunning views. It's a must do. Take the cable car and walk around the top of the mountain. You'll cover the lot in around three hours, and the views are breathtaking. You'll need to be able to walk on stony areas, it's not all laid paths, but well worth the effort.

Watch for the cloud leaving. Great views, a real "Must Do" but wait until the table cloth is off the table, not much use going up there to see clouds. Cheaper after 6pm, and can be good weather then. Don't bother with the photo's they take, overpriced and not very good imho.
Nice views. Long wait for cable car. Nice views. Cloud spoils views at end and of 12 apostles. Worth a visit. Yy

Beautiful Walk or tek :-). 500 meters before the funicular you will find a small path going under the funicular cables and then around the summit.2 hours walk and be careful a little bit of climbing (the full walk is approx. 8km)Then you go back by the other way with a lot of stairs be careful of your knees.Up and down : 13km and 3 hoursStart early to avoid hot temperature
very hard climb; great views!. a little more signage and warning about just how steep the climb is would have been appreciated.BUT, the views at the top were tremendous!

Almost unreal. Though quite often covered with fog (or Tablecloth, as locals call it), it is worth going even then, though it will be quite moist inside the Tablecloth. When I visited, parts were sunny and parts were in rather deep fog, but this only added eerie feeling to the extreme natural beauty of the place. The astounding vegetation of the table mountain top makes one thing that no gardener should be allowed onto the Table mountain top for the fear that they may commit suicide, for no human hands would be able to create such plant compositions as can be seen here – planted by Mother Nature.

Great visit!. Great trip up the mountain. The easiest way is to take the hop on hop off bus to the cable car point. It is cheaper to book tickets for the cable car online. Lots of nice walks on the top, and a good restaurant. Don't miss a visit up to Table Mountain! Take a jacket, it can be cold on top.
On the Top. We went in afternoon as the mountain was clear and the cable car was out of this world. Fantastic views. Only go when no clouds and take a bus if you have no car
A must Go!!!!!. Really go up the mountain on your first fair weather day, don't miss out a fantastic trip.It might get windy or cloudy!!! Good shoes help lots of great views and walks up there!!
Beautiful place. Enjoyed it tremendously. One of the highlights of our visit. Highly recommend it if you visit this area and have time.
Amazing View "On top of the World"!!!. Great experience with lots of photos to take. Been there on a almost windless day. Had brunch at their cafe, and enjoyed every moment!

One of the 7 natural wonder. Defineatly a must go place while u are in cape town. U can hike to the top from different routes or just take a cable car but i prefer hiking as u can appreciate the beauty of the mountain. U can view the whole cape town from the top and the lion's head and signal hill seems very small!! But the view of the atlantic ocean from the top is mesmerizing!!
Truly spectacular. It's so hot in Cape Town at the moment we arrived at 7.40am to avoid queuing. The view is spectacular, made all the more incredible by a birds eye view of whales in the bay
Beautiful sights. What an absolute wonder! The sights are out of this world and refreshing! The restaurant is great as well. Would not mind going there again

A worthy Wonder of the World. This is a MUST if you're in Cape Town. It's listed as one of the 7 Wonders of the Modern World - and deservedly so! The views of the city are spectacular and, with a little walking, almost 360 degrees. Well paved paths made it suitable for our friend in a wheelchair with only a little help. Restaurant and gift shop at reasonable prices.

A World site. A fantastic experience at a World venue.Great views and a must if you get to Cape Town.Plan how long you wish to be there and what you will do.If here fr a few days visit at the first opportunity, the cloud may descend and you may not have the chance again!

Must do in Cape Town. As "first-timers" we hiked up Table Mountain along the popular Pataklip Gorge route. This "easy" route is challenging enough, particularly in the heat. Make sure to wear good walking shoes and bring lots of water with you. It's really worth the effort and the view from the top is so satisfying when you've done the hike.

A unique and world class view over Cape Town. We went there especially to see the sunset from the peak. It is well organised but pre booking and payment is advised. Take warm clothes too. Weather changeable.
Superb sea, mountain and town views that will impress one and all. The well laid out park has unique flora and fauna of interest. A must for any CT vistor.

This is a must see in Cape Town. This is a must see in Cape Town, go in the afternoon when the crowds have settled down and you don't wait 3 hours in lines. Views are the best in the world. So make sure you make time to go up. Take food with you as the restaurant is very expensive.

Thrilling Experience. Hiking up Table mountain is the most exhilarating thing I did last year. It's taxing but so much fun. So surprisingly beautiful the views, the flora and how detached from the the city it feels. I can't wait to go back, may be do the Skeleton Gorge trail next.
Quite oase in the large city. If you are on top of the table mountain and you go for a hike you will have beautiful scenes and it will hear nothing but the wind

Walking to the summit was incredible. We walked to the top at about 11am so it was hot but we carried plenty of water and its only about 1 hr and 15 mins to get to the top. The hard work is so definitely worth it........get the cable car down not up!

Mesmerising Table Mountain National Park. The Iconic landmark in Cape Town is breathtaking, the country’s most photographed attraction & its cable car ride, scenic photograph background, place from where you can take a breathtaking photo of Cape Town, about 2,200 species of plants found on Table Mountain & 1470 floral species endemic to this mountain, you will fall in love with Cape Town

Cable Car up and had a beer at the top!. What can I say this place is spectacular. I'm heading back in a few months and will be walking it up rather than taking the cable car, but the car itself is fine! Highly recommend you go towards the end of the day, the setting sun over lions head... magical!

Views over Cape Town wonderful.. The cable car ride to the top is worth it without the views from the top. The view down to Cape Town and the surrounding countryside is awesome. There is much to explore up there on the many tracks, birds, flowers and plants as well as the wild life.
Amazing Table Mountain. Love Table Mountain most amazing views and hikes absolutely awesome. Sunset is the most amazing time to go.
Must see. You cannot leave Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain. Yes it's a touristy place, but it is still a must see. The views are spectacular.
Don't miss. Amazing views over Cape Town and the Atlantic. Interesting walks and wild life at top - dassies, lizards, etc.

A must if you can. Shrouded with fog- (it's 'tablecloth'), we thought we might not be able to go up particularly as we were only in Cape Town for 3nights.After an interesting morning historical city walking tour with Buzz Tours, we took the open bus to Table Mountain hoping for the best. We were lucky, the cable car was working and what a great view of the city from the top. Not to be missed if you can do it. Met a little Dassie.

Stunning views across Cape Town and beyond. When the skies over Table Mountain are clear, book your ticket for the cable car online and skip the queues. You can get to the cable car departure point on the Hop-On, Hop-Off bus. If you drive, be prepared to park some distance from the cable car station and walk as there is very little parking onsite. The cable car slowly rotates 360 degrees as it travels up/down the mountain so where ever you stand you will get to see everything.
