On top of the mountain there are various walks you can do - from flat, paved, short walks taking in the sights of the city, the beaches and beyond - to longer, more strenuous walks. Fit walkers can choose to hike up and/or down the mountain.There is a cafe on top of the mountain where you can refuel and enjoy the views.

Absolutely stunning!. Amazing views of Cape Town as well as beautiful wildlife - you can either take a short walk and grab a coffee in the cafe, or go for a longer hike to the highest point. We went in the middle of summer and it was very hot so I highly recommend wearing a hat!
A MUST visit. On a clear day the views are stunning. There are good facilities available and some easy walks on the top. The more adventurous can walk to the summit.

Eighth wonder of the world. The national park is more than just the well-known flat topped peak which towers over Cape Town. It stretches from the central bowl to Cape Point taking in magnificent mountain drives like Chapman's Peak, the 12 Apostles, huge areas of fynbos which carry a biodiversity of plant life greater than the British Isles. Add to this the stark splendour; shipwreck coves; early discoveries; birdlife and animals and first class explanation centres and you have a fantastic environmental experience.

Most scenic short run. The run from Kloof Neck till well pass the Cable Way station is a nice little workout but has the most amazing views of the city and Table Bay. One feels alive and blessed to see it all. From after seven in the morning there are usually runners and cyclists as Cape Town is a very active city.

TOP CLASS!. Definitely a 'must' visit. If the weather is clear when you arrive don't postpone a visit to Table Mountain, as the weather can change quickly.To avoid queues. try and go in the first part of the morning, alternatively watching the sunset from the top of the Mountain is very special.

Wow, what a journey.. We went up for a cup of tea and we were blessed with a gorgeous subset of the magnificent city of cape town. It's worth taking your time and walking the pathways at the top. Take somethingbwarm.becayse no matter how warmnot is in the city it can be cold in the blanket of clouds on the top of the mountain. And if you have it in you I can't recommend enough how wonderful the walk up is from the cable car road.
Awsome!. It is absolutely beautiful, anytime of the year! The park is well guarded and maintained. The views are spectacular from anywhere you stop.
Must do attraction in Cape Town. This is one of the best things to do in Cape Town. The views are amazing and you could easy spend a couple of hours walking around at the top.
Don't leave Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain. Whether you stay 30 minutes or two hours, a visit and walk around the top of this 1,000 meter natural wonder over Cape Town is a must.
Amazing. A great day trip from CT either by car or escorted, some amazing views with the highlight being Cape Point give it a try you won't be disappointed

Table Mountain. Absolutely spectacular. From the half way point up the mountain the views are amazing. We had to wait about a week before we could go due to to the cape doctor blowing at gale force, so if you don't have long in Cape Town, make it your first stop if the wind allows. Also the crowds are much smaller, ie no line at all, mid afternoon. Sunset is very busy.

Our Table Top hike was a highlight of our SA trip! (Bring plenty of water!). We loved our visit to Table Top. We ended up picking a day with almost no clouds which was lovely (albeit a bit hot) to take the cable car up to the top and explore. As a matter of fact, the only clouds were BELOW us which made for some amazing vistas. We did a great 5K hike all around the top over to Maclear's Beacon. We were fortunate enough to meet an experienced hiker along the way who pointed out several indigenous plant to the Table Top region. It was a good hike, fairly flat, with just a few steeper climbs (which has a chain for support). I highly recommend this hike. We did come across several folks asking after water. There is NO water once you leave the populated area at the top of the cable car. Be sure to carry your own and wear comfortable shoes. It is so worth it!
Table Mountain. Beautiful views. Make sure you get your ticket ahead of time and note that you can't get the ticket from the Hop On Hop Off driver at that stop.

Impressive and Amazing Hike. I hiked up an took the cable car down and was really fine with that decision. The hike had been a bit tough (especially as I started at midday... so really hot!), but I think for the knees it´s tougher to hike down! So, I think this choice was good! (beside the time). The view after the hike is rewarding and really stunning! Must-Do, when visiting cape town! really! :)

morning trip. lovely views. we were very lucky with the weather when we arrived in cape town. I had pre purchased the cable car tickets for the morning we arrived which saved queuing as it had been closed the previous day and was very busy.
Definitely worth it. Amazing views and the terrain is really cool. Very different from some of the other hills in Cape Town and worth the visit.

Great when the weather is clear. We had to wait for a few days to visit. it was either too windy or cloud covered the mountain (even on a cloudless day on the waterfront).
Well worth the trip. The cable car ride is superb with its revolving cabin, giving everyone a panoramic view.
When you get to the top the views are stunning.

Cape Town from the Table. Amazing the visit to Table Mountain. It was beautiful day, without any wind. We went early but had to wait 1.30 h in the queue for the cable car :( . Okay, once we reach the top the views were amazing and we could hike all around table mountain. We were surprise by a guy doing base-jumper... what an adrenaline for the ones watching! The only remark is the signage is weak. Don't forget your sun screen is it essential...
On A Clear Day You CAn See Forever. Do not waste your time going up there when the clouds are laying across Table Mountain. You won't see much.
Awesome views!. one of UNESCO'S new seven wonders of nature. a 360 angle panoramic view of Cape Town, its surrounding and the magnificent Atlantic ocean. A must see while in Cape Town

Magnificent.. A wonder of the world and we could see why. Did not have to queue more than a few minutes and the trip on the cable car was exciting. From the Mountain top the views were magnificent of Cape Town and on the other side of the Mountain the buzzing coastal areas.. But oh it was so hot with little shelter. A magic visit.

cape town visit. This is a must, when you in C T, Go up tot the table mountain and stroll around in the park with stunning views all around. You need a lot of time, weather permitting. When lots of clouds return, the alarm will ring and you have to make your way back to the cable car

Baeutiful views of all Capetown, Waterfonrt and also other 2 Mountains beside it.. Would recommend this visit in order for people to have an overview of Both Oceans Pacific/Atlantic and the City of Capetown

No trip is complete without a visit..... Visit Cape Town for the first time and miss the opportunity to stand atop Table Mountain is something no-one should consider. Notwithstanding the panorama that it provides, especially on a clear and sunny day, the ride on a rather unique cable car allows photographers the chance to capture the views from a 'car' that rotates 360 degrees both ascending and descending through open windows that eliminate irritating glass reflections. As a tip I would suggest standing close to the entrance door when boarding. In this position the car is some distance from the start and finish when you rotate to the open windows that are at both front and rear of the cable car. I would also advise that travellers arrive early since queues can be extremely long later in the day

Amazing!!. Hiking up the mountain is best to start before sun rise, as its not as hot and more manageable.Started the hike around 6am and managed to see the start of the sunrise which was really pretty, the hike itself wasn't too bad but made it to the top which was amazing! Stopped at some places along the way up and had fantastic views all the way which was incredible.Would definitely do this again! :)

A Sight To Behold. Like most amazing sites, until you actually see and experience them for yourselves you really never appreciate how amazing they really are. We walk the full length of Table Mountain in 36 degrees of heat.
Excellent. Questioned whether we would go but well worth it. Stunning views of Cape Town and surrounding areas. Queues to get there were not too bad and well organised.

Excellent Do not miss!. If you have an opportunity to visit Cape Town do not miss Table Mountain the views are outstanding!
A piece of advance we were given if it is a clear day just go for it! As if it's windy or cloudy the lift to the top may close.
Wonderful views. Going up in the cable car gives you spectacular views as the floor goes round so that everone has a good view

Must. Amazing view - I recommend to hike up - start at cable car station.
And do not forget your camera ...

Everyone should hike to the top of Table Mountain at least once. We were in Cape Town in November and hiked to the top of Table Mountain from the bottom one morning. It takes about 2 hours, is very steep but well worth it. The changing views on the way up are spectacular...and the locals, one of them barefooted bounding past us on their way to the top, was also entertaining.
A bit cloudy during our visit. You can't visit Cape Town without a ride to the top of Table Mountain. Even though it was cloudy at the top, the views were spectacular on the way up.
simply "must to see". The dominant of the Cape Town, very nice park, nice view's - if you are in Cape Town for more than 1 day, you must to see it.
Amazing place and absolutely a must.. We had a private tour guide on this trip and didn't know what to expect. Standing at the top of Table Mountain was a completely life altering experience.

Average. The mountain is stunning as always, but the logistics in peak times such as December horrible. The lines were too long and people who had online tickets were given priority than the cash ones, not sure how different is the value when it comes to cash.I believe they should improve how they handle the peak times traffic, especially having to stand in the sun with kids
Breathtaking views. You could climb to the top (experience rated routes) or ride to the top and enjoy the views. A true bucket list item.

A must do. Cannot be missed. If possible, try to visit the park early in the morning. My favourite months are March to June, and October to November.
Weather in Cape Town changes fast, so always make sure you have a warm top and suitable clothing with you, as well as enough water.

Beautiful views from the top of the Mountain. Beautiful trip in the cable car where you will see wild flowers, silver tree, view of the city, and its beaches. Maybe Robben island, and Cape Point....the Lighthouse....

Fantastic views. We hiked up and took the cableway down. What a fantastic place this is. The views on the city are great and it is very relaxing to be on top of table mountain. Have a drink there, walk around a bit and enjoy the view from up there. Must-do in Cape Town!
Huge. What an amazing place. So much more extensive than you imagine and easy to get away from the crowds. Views fabulous

Wonderful. It is very easy to spend a whole day here. Entrance to the park means that it is possible to see many different locations. Visit the Cape of Good Hope and possibly see ostriches on the beach and also dassies. A must is to have your photo taken at the sign. The Cape Point can be accessed by use of the funicular or by walking up the slope and steps. The summit gives wonderful views. The Two Oceans Restaurant is also well worth a stop for lunch. On the way out from the Point there are many roads down to the coast - all of which we found worth visiting. On our way we saw ostrich, bontebok, kudu, tortoises and steinbok. An excellent day out.

Does what it says on the tin. We got to the cable station on the City Tour bus, which actually worked really well. There is a lot of hype about the queues and certainly the areas is all laid out to cope with them, it may be that we arrived just after it had re-opened after closure because of the winds? The floor of the cable car revolves - so don't worry about where you stand, but not everyone was comfortable with a moving floor! The views are spectacular - so it's one of those "must do" things in Cape Town.
Beautiful, well-maintained park. Truly a beautiful place - lots to see and explore, not to mention a great view from the top! We hiked via the Kasteelsport route and it was fantastic.

we were lucky. and planned our visit for a very sunny day; we bought our tickets online, and it turned out to be a very wise decision, as the queue for buying tickets was very long, and then there was another one for getting on the cable car. The weather was perfect, so we enjoyed a great view from the top, including the sunset. It is really breathtaking and humbling to see mother nature at its best

Amazing outdoorsy wilderness at the edge of a city. Way bigger than just Table Mountain, the park was far more than I imagined. Big enough to find yourself alone among caves and gorges, yet popular enough that you never felt you could get into too much trouble and there's even a place to get a beer on Table Mountain itself! Terrain reminded me of the Scottish Highlands in a way and the views of the city and ocean below and around were peerless. Lions Head was especially impressive and a wonderful climb. Will be back again and again.

WALK up the mountain. Margaret is an excellent guide who knows everything about its ecology and makes sure the less fit are not left behind. Skeleton Gorge route is fabulous with shade for much of the ascent. Flowers in the finbos are amazing

Beautiful!. Riding the cable car was fantastic and a once in a lifetime experience. The view of the cape as you head up is amazing. We couldn't really see much at the top but it was definitely a great experience!

Spectacular views. If you are going to Cape Town you must plan to go to Table Mountain. It is like the Eiffel Tower in Paris - an icon. But plan for it. Unlike the Eiffel tower which gives you a specific time for your reservation, getting a ticket in advance does not prevent you from standing in line for hours in the hot sun. It was very disappointing to have such a long wait and since we had set a pick up time with our tour guide, we did not have much time at the top. The ride up is on a cable car that rotates. The views from the top are spectacular as promised. But since it was a beautiful day, it was crowded. Everyone will warn you about the winds. If it becomes too windy they easily shut down the cable cars. Beware.

superb views. What an experience. The views at the top on a clear day are tremendous. You can either walk up or take the cable car, we took the cable car, it rotates 360 degrees so no matter where you sand you get a good view. A must visit for your holiday.

Fantastic views - a must when visiting Cape Town. We visited during the day but tickets are much cheaper if you choose the evening and have the pleasure of watching sundown. We took the cable car to the summit, which was great with its revolving floor. At the summit there are lots of walk options and stunning views. Restaurant is good value.Walking up is also an option for those who are fit!Tips- take the opportunity to visit when there is a clear, sunny day. The cable car does not operate in high winds and views are obscured once cloud starts to descend. There is little shelter at the summit so take plenty of water.

the high point. this is truly one of the wonders of the natural world, and a must if you are ever near, did plan on walking up but hey I was on holiday to took the cable car, much less sweaty and better views. beautiful fauna and wildlife too.
Excellent!!. excellent.the views.beautiful place.loved it!slights queues to get down using the cable car but overall it was my best experience in Capetown
Long hike but worth it. If you're in good physical shape I strongly suggest taking one of the hiking routes. Then take the cable car back down. Enjoy!

Great experience on the India Venster track on our own. We decided to hike up to Table Mountain via the India Venster route with our local friend as a guide. The hike was a complete highlight of our stay in Cape Town with most amazing views and adventurous climbs. Although the route was physically demanding and we were not very fit, we managed to make it to the top in ca 2 hours and enjoyed the whole climb a lot.

Highlight in more ways than one!. Tremendous attraction giving panoramic picture perfect views over Capetown. A must do - make sure you go when the weather is good because the wind closes it down a lot!

One of the 7 wonders of nature. What an experience! The view from the top was absolutely breathtaking. Some folks opt to hike up the mountain, we decided on the ride in the cable car and what a treat.

A spectacular hike. We hiked from the base station of the gondula to the top of table mountain. Despite the fact that many tourist collect on the mountain, the vast majority will use the gondula and as a hiker one is almost alone on the trail to the top. The ascend is quite steep at times but the spectacular views over Cape Town are ample reward. A great hike for anyone who is fit enough.

Memorable views and nice walking paths. It is a must to go here, if the weather conditions are good. Fantastic and memorable views over Cape Town and the national park. Don't forget to buy tickets online and try to be here in the morning.

A must do!. Visiting the top of Table mountain is a must while in CT. Its really not that expensive to take the gondola and you will have million dollar views from the top. If you do want to hike up, I would suggest you start your hike early in the day.before Sun rise as the sun shines down on you for most of the hike...and the sun is HOT! very little shade once you are on route and no shade on top.
Amazing. This place is very beautiful. You can explore Table Mountain and it's amazing views from Cape Town. Also you can go to Boulders Beach, Cape of Good Hope and Cape Point.

A very pleasant way to spend a couple hours.. The cable car ride to the top is just the start of a pleasant excursion with spectacular views of the mountain and city below. We arrived on a foggy morning and were afraid it would make the view less than accessible. We found that the fog added to the view and made for some great photos

A must do in Cape Town. Stunning views and retains some of its wildness despite the tourism. Lucky to go when quiet and glorious weather which produced the most amazing sunset while sitting enjoying a glass of wine!!

Gorgeous view. We took the cable car up Table Mountain and had gorgeous views of Cape Town. Highly recommend you take an uber there! We bought the tickets on the app because the line is sectioned into with and without tickets. I'm not sure it's faster because you are separated on entry.

As gorgeous as everyone tells you it is. Magical. Looking down on the coast of this lovely city, watching the "table cloth" of clouds cover and uncover the mountain was such a joy. The cable car was safe and fast, and magnificent. The people--mostly foreigners like ourselves--were as happy and thrilled as were weA!

Breathtaking . Worth every single moment spent queueing.Yes is busy but there is always space to find a secluded patch and sit and feel at peace with the world.The views are phenomenal and the mountain brings a sense of calm.We will revisit time and time again Tip - there's as fab and flat pathed 45 minute walk which you should not miss. We saw stunning views, escaped the tourists who just seem to hang about the cable car station and café and saw lots of wildlife including dassies, numerous birds and colourful plants.
Why it is not among the seven wonders of the world?. According to my husband, Table Mountin in Cape Town is that right place where hr want to die :-) For me it is Boa Vista (Cabo Verde) :-).

One of the best things we did in Cape Town!. I have a fear of height so the tram to the top was a bit unnerving for me, but I would have to say that the initial anxiety was worth it. There's a reason this is the number one thing to do in Cape Town. The views from up here can not be beat. We got to the base of the mountain to get in line at about 8:30 Am and there was already quite a line. I would suggest that you buy your tickets online before you visit to save yourself from having to line up for the tickets. We easily spent half the day exploring the mountain and could have spent even longer if we didn't have other things to see. Would also recommend trying the egg tart at the cafe which was super tasty!

Unbelievable Awe Inspiring Beauty!. The view makes your heart beat faster just before it takes your breath away. There will be no place on earth that I love with the passion of Cape Town. The view from Table Mountain is truly magnificent. Go see for yourself!

Breathtaking. A must see when in cape town. Either take the cable car, but pre-purchase so that you don't wait in line, and arrive early on a clear day, or hike up if you are in good shape, about 2 hours to the top. Once on top, the mountain provides stunning views of cape town and the surrounding areas. If you're into photography then rejoice, great photo opportunities. You can do Table mountain in the morning and Robben island in the afternoon if planned right, do both.

What an experience - whatever the weather!. Great time on Table Mountain. We arrived an hour before the cable car started and were one of the first up (after the online booking who get preferential treatment and I would do this next time).The weather was clear at first but soon clouded over. Even with the clouds this place has an incredible atmosphere to it; definitely worth the journey.Take a camera and play spot the dassies! They are so cute.Unfortunately we saw more than one of them eating cigarette butts due to people smoking in areas that they shouldn't have been. Quite sad.Great place though!
A must visit N.P.. This must be one of the most iconic National Parks. We where warned about pick pockets and muggers but we never had any problems. It is well worth a visit.
Fabulous. Amazing views lots to see . Penguins. Seals, view points not to be missedWe took a day tour the peninsular tour which is a good way to start a holiday and get your bearings

Excellent view. We hopped off the bus and went up the cable car. Had great views from the top. Pick a clear day. There is a small cafe at the top so you are able to have a quiet beer and something to eat at the top.

Amazing place. We visited this awesome place and was just simply amazed how beautiful this place is. The ride to the top of the mountain is breathtaking with views to die for. It is a must to see. It is a natural wonder. I would definitely visit here again. You have got to see for your self. Words can't describe it.

Mind the Weather! . The weather in Cape Town changes all through the day. Clouds or wind can pop up and ruin your trip!We hit the perfect window. The hike around the top was not too difficult, and the views were spectacular.
best attraction. wonderful views . I hate heights but enjoyed the rotating cable car up and back, Shop at top was very good. Well worth the visit.

Wonderful views. A must of course in Cape Town, handsome complex at top and lots to view. There are hiking trails for the robust which must be wonderful. Take the cable car which rotates then there are many views from the top of the ocean, Fifa stadium and the town central.
Amazing !. So thrilled when on our third a temp the cable cars were working and we made it to the top ,well worth the hassle . Views are fantastic and a lot more flora and fauna than we expected .

What a view of Cape Town. A ship tour of Cape Town included a visit to Table Mountain which was fogged in when we began our city tour and was still shrouded in mist when we reached the rotating cable car for our ride to the summit. It cleared as we wandered on the summit. the sun broke out so I had the advantage of mist and sunny views of the city. Wonderful experience!

A 'Must See' if you're in Cape Town. The Table Mountain towers over the docks in Cape Town and a visit is sort of inevitable. It didn't disappoint us. It's managed to stay quite adventurous but at the same time appropriately safe ... Providing of course you don't decide to wander off the main tracks. There's a main track but lots of little ones you can disappear down and explore without being irresponsible. It was cloudy for a bit while we were there but standing in the mist and not seeing anything below is quite surreal as if you're floating on a cloud. When the sun came out it was quite beautiful because then of course you could see for miles around. It's well worth a visit.

Magical experience. We have visited several years ago, and this time went up in the early evening to see the most impressive sunset ever. It was truly magical and as the evening wore on the spectacular views took a different perspective as the city turned on its lights. The one slight disadvantage was the long wait for the return cable car, but it was well worth it.

Take your chance when there are no clouds.... ...otherwise you miss the most spetacular view over Cape Town from all sides. Even the tour with the cable car is a pleasure. Book your ticketts in the bus or in town which saves you queing at the mountain.

Views and an experience that will simply take your breath away. Wow and I mean wow!!! The sheer panoramic views of Cape Town, the Atlantic, and the mountains will leave you stuns. At times you are above the low lying cloud and that just adds to the majesty of this place. The experience is very streamlined to but I would suggest booking your tickets in advance as the ques can get quite long and in the heat of the day you dont want to standing around. There is also a little issue with parking, it's along the road and not a car park so a taxi or getting there early is advised. After that however everything else I wow. You start by taking a cable car to the top which is an experience in it's own right. The floor of the cable car spins slowly round so no matter what point you are at you will get 360 views of your ascent abd decent. You can choose to hike up and take a cable car down or vice versa but that will be an all day excursion. Once at the top you are free to walk around the paths and off them to and your are only limited to where you can go by the mountains edge. There is a lovely cafe/restaurant and gift shop as well as toilets but be warned the price is quite expensive and once at the top there is no where else to buy food and drink so I would again advise that you take your own. On your decent you can again get caught in ques due to there only being two cable cars but this ti e you are in doors and you still have all the views to take in whilst you wait. An amazing sight to behold and I would 100% recommend.

WOW view!. the cable car is an adventure itself, the views are breathtaking. Then on the top it gets even better. A must do when in Cape Twon. Only one remark: plan the timming. in the rush hours there are looong queues...

The Best View In Town !. We got tickets for the cable car at the hop-on hop-off bus office and got the cable car to the top of the mountain.The view over Cape Town is spectacular,but also the view of the craggy coastal mountains and coastline is worth the trip in itself !Take a good camera and go early to avoid the lengthy queues.

We loved the wildlife!. Of course you get stunning views from Table Mountain! But the best part was watching the little hyrax's run around in search of food. You are not supposed to feed them but we saw many people doing that. They are really cute beggars but I wouldn't feed them. Lots of birdlife, insects, and plant species. Amazing and a must do for sure!

Don't miss view of the city landscape from the top.. The trip to the oldest mountain in the world starts with a revolving cable ride from ground level.The trails for walking are tourist friendly and offers good views of the city and the surrounding ocean.You can also see the Robben Island from a distance.A must visit!
Great View of the City, Ocean and lands around Cape Town.. Great View of the City, Ocean and lands around Cape Town. Rotating Cable Car. A must do if your in Cape Town.

Fantastic country. Wow what a beautiful place SA is , table mountain has fantasic 180% views although best to ouck a clear day , take a jumper / coat up with you as the clouds can come from nowhere and ut gets cold Only need a few hours up there , cafe / restaurant is worth a visit too , reasonable prices . Can get busy at TM best to go early , if driving go all the way up , turn and pick your patking space on going down or its quite a walk up and you may pass many spaces , disabled parking aval and you use your blue badges as you would at home in street parking , just still use disabled bays but need to pay in shopping mall car parks same as others .

Breath taking... Worth a visit. Definitely a visit if you are in Cape Town. The view is worth the trip. It Cost around 150 by taxi to get there from downtown but really nice once you are there. Once there it cost around 240 per person, but since I went around 6pm it was half the price 120. I got to see the sunset and it wasn't as hot. loved it.

Scary ride but great view. This is a must visit place in Cape Town visible from most of the city sites. Its windy there so proper clothing is necessary ! there is long queue for the cable car ! due to winds the cable car swings at time. Those scared of heights should stand in the center of cable car to avoid outside view.

View from above. Its always lovely to visit a National Treasure, to be a tourist in your own country. Although it was a bit pricey, and the queue took over an hour (even with prepaid ticket purchases) it was well worth the wait. The view is spectacular and it makes you proud to live in such a beautiful city, and blessed to be on top of the world. The only thing to do really is to do the nature walks,take pictures or eat. The main attraction is the mountain itself, which is how it should be :) Do it!

Thrill of Table Mountain. One of the wonders of the Modern World and truly a Gem of Cape Town. It is well worth the hike up the mountain, although it is challenging. We did not do it on this trip but hope to do it again in the future. If you decide to do the hike, PLEASE remember to start early before the heat strikes, take water and sun protection. Also let someone know of your intentions to hike up the mountain and contact them once you are at the top. It is worth it to hike up and cable car down. A must for every visitor to Cape Town.

Finally seeing the Table mountain was the highlight of our visit.. The view of the city from the mountain was breathtaking. However the queue to the cable way was very long hence we returned to the city without having gone up the mountain.

Beautiful. We were in Cape town on holiday and tried to pick the clearest day possible to head to the top. We took the cable car and were very thankful there wasn't much wind. The views from the top are spectacular. You can hike around at the top for a long time with out having to hike up or down if you do not want to. If you are worried about the line for the cable car, skip some of the wait by booking your tickets on line ahead of time. Doing so cuts down about half of the wait time. As mentioned in several reviews, if you drive to the cable car station, expect a long walk to your car as there is very little parking close to the station.
A MUST SEE if you are in Cape Town. Breathtaking views, a wonderful nature path to walk all around the top. We saw 3 seasons in 2 hours on the top. Touristy so expect that part
brilliant. If there is one thing you have to do when you visit cape town it's go up table mountain.The views are amazing and it is not as crowded as i thought it would be,
EXCELLENT!. I hiked Table Mountain which is both challenging and amazing! At the top, the view of Cape Town is breathtaking. A must go!

Stunning Views !. The mountain is a must for any Cape Town visit. Views of the Cape and peninsula are spectacular and especially enjoyable around sunset. The cableway is the best and quickest way to reach the top but a hike up one of the many trails is an outstanding way to go if one is fit.

Its a must. Its my 5th time in Cape Town and 1st with no clouds so at last I managed to get to the top of Table Mountain and it is certainly worth the ride. Amazing views and excellent vale with local guides who will give you the full history, excellent
Amazing views. We hiked up with a guide which i recommend as we did india venster route. Its not an easy hike so you do need to be fit. but the views are amazing and its totally worth it

best hike!!. I took a hike up the mountain with my husband and it was challanging but soo rewarding!! make sure that you pack plenty of sunscreen and have enough water when going up there. Their soft serve ice-creams were the best thing after the hike.
Beautiful views, challenging hike. Great and challenging hike up the mountain - but make sure you go early to avoid the heat. Some hiking experience recommended!

Great day hiking Table Mountain. Worth it to hike up and cable down! View is outstanding. DO NOT FORGET LOTS OF WATER. Stop for a beer and an amazing view at the top :) Great day. It took us 1.5 hours to hike up. We stayed up there for about 2 hours.

Stunning vistas overlooking Capetown. Not to be missed! Ride the Cable car to the top of Table Mountain and take the time to hike the entire top. It is absolutely awe inspiring. You can walk up but it is only for the very fit.
Unforgettable experience . The view from the top is amazing!!! An experience of a lifetime. Anyone visiting Cape Town for the first time has to make a stop here. It's wonderfully wonderful.
Breath-taking views. Spent a few hours on top of Table Mountain and enjoyed every Minute up there. Weather was extremely nice so the view into all directions was simply stunning.

Way too busy and crowded. Huge rip off to get in to the reserve - definitely caters to the international tourist. Also too many busses and people in at once.
Not a trip to be repeated as once you've been there give done it

Incredible. We were in Cape Town for 5 days and this was on the only day out of 5 that the cable car was open due to high winds throughout the week.We arrived around 10am in the morning and the queue waiting time was around an hour (not sure because it had been closed for a while or because it is very popular) either way i suggest buying and booking tickets online. When yo do get your ticket make sure you keep it for going back down unless you want to walk.The queue kinds of twists and winds its way upwards towards to foot of the cable car. On the way up in the queue there is a vendor selling cold drinks, someone to take your photo as a momento and toilets. At one part of the queue you have to get into a lift and when you exit the lift the queue that had been so well up until know goes completely out the window and its a bit of a free for all, and the staff keep sending groups of people up in the lift so the area toward the bottom of the cable car is unorganized and crowded.Once ready to get into the cable car (there are 2) they fit around 60 people. The is a member of staff in the centre who gives some history about the cable car and the mountain. The floor rotates round and round until the top so everyone can see everything. The whole journey to the top is around 3 minutes.When you get to the top you can walk around and around and the view never gets old. You can see for miles! There are wild animals at the top, just leave them be and dont feed them. Also at the top there are shops, toilets and cafes. You can spend as long as you want at the top, I think the last cable car down is around 7pm.To exit is very simple, there is no queue just show the ticket, get into the cable car, the floor will rotate again and within a few minutes youre back at the bottom.By far this is one of the best things to do in Cape Town as you can say you have been to 1 of the New 7 Wonders of the World and the view from the top is magical.

You MUST see this view from all directions.. Go early so that you do not have to wait. The views of the harbor and city of Cape Town are lovely with Robben Island in Table Bay. Views from all directions are stunning. The tram ride up the mountain will save you time and fatigue. There is plenty of walking to do.

choose your guide wisely. An absolute must for anyone visiting Cape Town. We took the scenic route and would have enjoyed learning more about the mountain, its fauna and flora then the encyclopaedic history of our guide. Spectacular views on the way up and from the top. Riding down in the cable car completed the tour

Dutch tourists up on the back table of Table Mountain to visit the Cape Town City water dams. trip to the back table dams to see the historical development of the City of Cape Town water supply infrastructure.
best thing to do in Cape Town. We went there on a Sunday in January 2016, no wainting queue at all the the cashiers around 1500 h. It was simply awesome: WHAT A VIEW, it si unforgettable.

Worth the Walk. Walked up Platterklip Gorge with my cousin in December. Really fun climb. Lots of people on the route so definitely go early in Summer. Quite easy if you fit but if you not be so kind to let people behind you get past. Can get a bit noisy at times so if you looking for a quieter route go somewhere else. In summer start walking before 6:30 to miss the sun. If you not in the crack by the time the sun comes up it gonna get very hot. Carry lots of water as it is tiring. Please keep all your bottles with you though till you get down- carry a plastic bag to throw dirt into. Found so many plastic bottles and packets from ignorant holiday makers.When you get up to the beacon only a 15min walk to the cable car but try and find the route to Echo Valley and Kasteelpoort much more quieter and great views of the Atlantic Seaboard (Camps bay, Llandudno and even Houtbay). Only a 45min round about.In total if you in a good condition walk should take you 1:30 up and the another 45min on the Echo valley route. Cable car fun to go down, get tickets online easier. Don't waste your time at the restaurant super expensive. Alternatively walk down takes about 50min fitness dependent.Trail is fairly easy so young kids can manage worth lots of breaks.

A must to visit. Even if the cable car might put you off, the visit to the top is well worth it. The views from all angles are very impressive. If the cable car is not for you, you can hike down or rappel down!@

Stunning!. Give the cable car a miss and stretch your legs if you can. The views feel so much better when you've earned them and you see more of the local flora and fauna. I would recommend going right up to Maclear point - many stop at the top of Skeleton Gorge because they think they've got to the top. Watch out for the beautiful Cape Cobras sunning themselves along the paths - gorgeous but will bite!

Breathtaking!. Excellent trip up to Table Mountain. We had pre-booked the morning tickets back home in the UK but we were worried after reading the reviews that we could be queuing for several hours. We arrived by taxi up at the cable station around 8:00, the queue was across the road around 50m but moved steadily along. It's very efficient. We were up the top by 8:50 so much quicker than we thought. It is absolutely spectacular and we were there for about 4 hours. Sensible footwear essential if you want to walk around. Loved it! So glad we chose that day as it was either too windy or cloudy to go up for the rest of our trip!
Great view. Table mountain is the must visit place in Cape Town. It gives an excellent view of the town and ocean.
Table Mountain. The Table Mountain National park consists of the Table Mountain itself the Cape of Good Hope. Our master Tour will combine the 2 in a single day, what an adventure.

must do-see. Not much to add, we decided to do the hike upwards. Yes, it is a bit steep/challenging for people. But really rewarding once you are up. We only saw a few people on the path and up the mountain, which made it even more special to have such a place for yourself (almost). Take some water (and a bit of food) with you and enjoy the great panoramic view up the mountain! Must do if you are in Cape Town

Best Views of Capetown. Fantastic views. Make sure you pick a clear day and get their early. You can book on line and just show reference on your phone. We pre booked and were there for 8 am and still queued an hour. Also very busy for parking and you might have a long walk up.There is now a cafe and gift shop at the top. you can spend as long as you wish at there. Definitely a "must do" when in Capetown.

A must do in Cape Town. We took a taxi to get there from out B&B, parking can be an issue, loved the views on the clear beautiful day we went. Go went is is clear even if u have to alter some plans. The mountains looks beautiful when it has is table cloth on however you miss out on the stunning views.

Someone who has recently developed a fear of heights I thoroughly enjoyed this!. Stunning views from here and what a cable car trip. Not great with heights recently but this was great. The Cable car floor rotates so that the visitors can get a full view as you travel up in the car to the top.
One of the wonders!. The view from top of the table mountain is breathtaking! Beautifully kept garden too! Loved the experience.

On top of the world.... Let me begin by saying that standing in a queue line for 2+ hours makes one rethink the decision to take the cable car to the top of the mountain over the holidays…so be advised to bring a hat, sunscreen, and a light coverup if you've recently arrived from winter in the northern hemisphere. However the view from the top on a clear day is breathtaking and the return queue is quite short unless staying to view the sunset. There are pathways all over the mountain top with overlooks and signage which provide photo ops in every direction. Unfortunately we only had an hour on the mountain as we had to catch the Robben Island ferry, so schedule yourself time to enjoy a glass of wine or even a full meal at the top.

Don't miss table mountain. Go as soon as you can on a clear day the views are stunning and it's such a peaceful place lovely location to sit for a while with a glass of wine take in the beauty around you and appreciate your time here.
Stunning. Absolutely incredible views from the top. A must visit place when in Cape Town. Nice cable car ride to top & then breathtaking views.
Great opportunity to see the gorgeous view from Table Mtn. Going up in te gondola was breathtaking. Te nature trails up there are wonderful .this was a really pleasant day out.
Beautiful. Wonderful and beautiful place to walk around on the mountain. Nice view of Cape Town. When you are hungry, there is a small restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner.

The BEST view in all of SA. Visiting Table Mountain is an experience I will never forget. It provided one of most stunning views I have ever seen with my own eyes. If you're visiting Cape Town, you owe it to yourself to visit.
beautiful. very neat and tidy and clean. very organized. amazing views and beautiful flowers. a must do when in cape town.

A wonderful 6 hour hike. We went up the Skeleton route. It was a lovely, albeit long day. We enjoyed the dam at the top and all the beautiful flowers. The front part of Table Mountain with the views and cable car were crammed with people. We stood in line for quite some time to take the cable car down.

Incredible view - stay for sunset!. Table Mountain is a Cape Town icon for good reason. The gondola ride up is very nice - a little scary if you're afraid of heights. The views are impressive, even for me, a girl who has lived next to the Rocky Mountains for 20 years. There are many areas to explore once you're at the top. I would love to have had time to hike up the mountain. The gorge is beautiful. The shop/restaurant was very nice and I enjoyed a glass of wine there. The dessies are fun to watch. We stayed for sunset and it was breathtaking. Be sure to take a coat. I went in spring (November) and a sweater was not enough.
Incredible View. The view from the city is the best. The only problem is the cable car that closes frequently due to the wind. However ,it's really nice to go hiking up to the mountain.

A must visit. A truly spectacular view of Cape Town and surrounding areas . well worth the time to get up and down in the cable car . If you are in good physical shape you can even walk up the mountain - approx. 3.0 hour hike both ways . We were there during the very busy December Christmas period . It was chaos getting off the mountain - we waited in line for 1 1/2 hours .Apparently this is the exception rather than the rule . They do have a decent restaurant on the mountain but it only takes local currency or Visa card .
Must go. It's a no brainer: you go to Cape Town, you go to Table Mountain. To the main mountain but also to every other place the national park has to offer.
Amazing view!!. Really nice to do, the view is stunning (if there are no clouds). It's really really woth a visit and there are also dassies and they are cute :-)

Can't beat the view or the services. For a national park, this is Very well done. Go after 6 PM and you get a big discount (at least, we did), plus you can view the sunset from the top. If you don't like heights, skip this one because it comes with vertiginous dropoffs and scary bridges over open space. Even the car ride up is exciting once you're close to the cliffs. Fun place with good eats.

Sunset over Cape Town and surroundings. Went up by cablecar at 630 and stayed for sunset, amazing views and well worth a visit. Bring warm clothes as it might get a bit chilly, and bring your camera as you will have some amazing photos
Spectacular. Spectacular views, special wildlife, good organisation but queues are very long so get a timed ticket.

Wonderful views all around the peninsular. We visited Table Mountain by cable car, an experience in itself! The trip is amazingly fast in a cable car that turns through 360 degrees on its way up the mountain. The views from the top are incredible in all directions using a good footpath through the gardens at the top. The queues can be very long but they do move quite quickly

Great views over Cape Town. Booked online to avoid the ticket queue and they do a cheaper special after 6pm. Staff very friendly and helpful. On the top lots of walk ways to see different views. We stayed and watched the sunset although beware queues back down. One not to miss.

Worth Every Minute. The day we went to Table Mountain was extremely busy and extremely hot! Even though we had purchased our tickets online beforehand, the queue was still 90 minutes (although the sign said 3 hours, so we were happy with 1 1/2!). It was over 100 degrees (F), but there was shade provided, along with places to buy water and sunscreen. The system going up the cable car was efficient and well-managed. The views from the top of Table Mountain are hard to explain. It's just beautiful everywhere you look! There are nice walking paths around the top, and none of them are very long. There is a cafe, bathrooms, and a gift shop at the top as well.We had another 90-minute wait to go back down, and this queue wasn't managed as well. It was fine until we got inside the building past where they scan your tickets. After that people were pushing and shoving trying to get into the cable cars, and the whole scene was just obnoxious--not nearly as well-managed as the ride up had been. That was really the only downfall though. This is a must-do activity on a visit to Cape Town!
View is great if the "tablecloth" is off the mountain. It's a lovely place from which to view the Waterfront area of Cape Town - if the weather is not windy and is clear.
Every bit as good as you'd imagine. Truly spectacular from both the bottom and the top - make sure you explore the top plateau though as the views are sensational in all directions

Hiking Table Mountain - Fantastic experience. My husband’s biggest wish was to climb Table Mountain. I didn't share the sentiment only because I thought I was not capable. We also thought there was just one way up and down. Three years ago we moved to Cape Town from Gauteng and our first hike was up Platteklip Gorge. I didn't sleep the previous night, was scared to death, but we made it to the top, had a slice of milk tart and coffee on top and hiked back down again. It was a good start, as it is an easy route, but now it became a bit boring and over crowd.After that, we bought a Table Mountain guide book and already did about 35 different routes on Table Mountain. We joined a small group of very experienced hikers and they share their knowledge of plants and history freely. We have grown to love some adventurous scrambles and enjoy hiking off the beaten track. The most beautiful old trees, moss and ferns can be seen in the more desolated places. We have seen all kinds of fynbos and flowers, every time we go there is something else to see. The Disa flowers from December to February and can only be found in a few places, usually in or near streams. We saw caves that go deep into the ground, waterfalls big and small and rock formations which looks like animals, and that is usually interesting, because everyone in the group has another perception of what it is supposed to be.For me a walk up Table Mountain feels like a journey into myself. Although you need to be fit, have a head for heights, you also need to be able to stay calm when things don't go according to plan. Sometimes you lose the track or come to a point where it seems impossible to go over, but if you focus and tackle it gradually, you always manage to find a way. I enjoy the team efforts and we really came to trust each other in the group. It can be dangerous if someone let some rocks loose on you. Table Mountain is a lot like life, an uphill journey with disappointments, obstacles and surprises, but the view and achievement of reaching the top, is worth the effort.
Amazing views. Great views, but you should be aware that they often close the cable car due to high winds. Check the website before going up there
This National Park is great Nature. The Park is Nice hiking to the Lighthouse, Being real a the Capepoint gives a cool experience after a long trip thru the continent!

Amazing reserve in the middle of Cape Town. We took the cable car to this beautiful nature reserve. The views are spectacular as is the low vegetation unique to the mountains. Great walkways and an okay cafe make it easy to spend a bit of time on the mountain.

Time Your Run.. No one enjoys queueing especially in hot weather, the difficulty here is when the wind blows the cable car shuts down, then when it is open a rush of people come. So if like us you have no real choice but to take your opportunity when you can then you need to monitor the website 'tablemountaincablecar' it will tell you the current status of the cable car. When it turns to open jump a cab and get there soon as you can, makes the difference between a 30 min wait and 3 hours!! It is a great trip and certainly worth some effort.

Effort has been made!. This is a very "user friendly" attraction and the visitors are organised very efficiently. I think it is wonderful that special offers actually run during holidays. When you visit the mountain, do remember a decent warm jacket - it is cold up there!! Plan to have at least 2 hours to spend at the top so that the walking trails and information can be enjoyed.

Stunning view. We booked the Hop On Hop Off / Red City Tour bus which one of it's stops was Table Mountain. The cable car ride up (and down) was fantastic, the views are stunning as you go. For those of you who are afraid of heights, be aware of the revolving floor which allows a panoramic view so there is nowhere to hide ... I'm not afraid of heights so I loved the whole experience. The top has information on the views with well laid out paths. There is a cafe which isn't overpriced, we had coffee and cake which was very nice. The souvenir shop isn't too expensive.A must when in Cape Town.(we bought all our attraction tickets on line before the holiday so saved a little in cost and in Q'ing)
On Top of the World!. We traveled to the top of Table Mountain in a cable car. This was during our holiday visit to South Africa in late December 2015 and early January 2016.

Its a must when in cape town. We went up here to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. Nope we didnt booked or dine in a restaurant we brought our two champagne flute (from hotel) and a bottle of south african brut we bought earlier in franshoek village. Its a breathtaking experience. Its like walking on the clouds. Just make sure you wear sneakers or hiking shoes as it is not suitable to walk around in wedges,heels and , plenty of photo moments and great aerial view of cape town.
Amazing. This a must do trip if you are in Cape Town, it's really accessible in a wheelchair and the views are amazing , go as a early as you can to avoid the crowds.

Great for hiking and climbing, don't take the cable car. The views you will enjoy from the hike up are priceless, and cannot compare with just taking the cable car up to the terrace next to the upper station. Hiring a travel guide for the harder routes, and hiking in groups is strongly suggested for safety reasons. Check the weather forecasts before embarking in any hike because the rapidly changing weather can easily strand unprepared hikers.
AWE-INSPIRING BREATHTAKING, STUNNING. Absolute must do if you don't see the clouds coming over the mountain and its not windy get there early
Its a table. Pleasant enough but there's not really a sense that you're on a mountain (its flat, like a table1). There are just some nice trails, an average café & touristy souvenirs

Honeymoon . Excellent views
Peaceful. Beautiful city, safe, comfortable and a very relaxing place to visit on holiday.

Impressing and memorable hike. Make sure you walk up there and set off early. The hike can push you to your limits if you do it in the heat of the day. Don't forget to take enough water. At the top you will be awarded with a spectacular view, beautiful fauna and an excellent self-service restaurant. Must do!!!
Not to be missed. Buy your tickets ahead of time. Lines can be long. You get an advance line if you have tickets. Well worth it. Use the Hop on Hop Off bus to get there.

Well worth a visit. We were lucky to have good clear weather and fantastic views from the top of Table Mountain National Park. The weather is unpredictable in winter. But we happened to be there on a Sunday and had to wait in line for almost two hours to get to the elevators for the cable cars and then another two hours to come back down. The botanic garden and the trails on the top is wonderful.
Amazing Experience. Table Top is AMAZING and certainly not something you want to miss in South Africa. We were there in winter and visited in the afternoon around 2pm which had fantastic lighting.

World Heritage Site, - and with good reason. The queue can be off-putting, but persevere. It is so well done, it is well worth the wait. Incredible vistas, and amazing biosphere, and did I mention incredible vistas? Just go. Really
Not to be missed. Had to queue in the morning but worth it, book online if you can before or while in the queue. The afternoon there was no queue.

An Amazing Experience. Please do not leave Cape Town without taking in this experience.The views are fantastic, if like me you are a Senior Citizen you would be advised to stick to pathways,the even ground allows you look up rather than down at the uneven stones.

truely amazing. Once on top of table mountain .......there are various walk ways.....and lots of shaded seats!The view from the top is awesome.
Nice cafe up there and shop and a mail box!The whole experience is wonderful.

Go early. Hike up the platteklip and take the tram down. Great views of all of Durban. We hiked up the platteklip gorge and took the tram down. It was much more rewarding than taking the tram both ways. Note: Start very early in the morning. We were on trail at 8 am- and it was too late- the baking summer sun was killing us. We drank 1 gallon of water before reaching the top between the two of us and were still dehydrated. The hike was moderate to strenuous but I saw fitness levels of all types doing it. It's certainly not for the faint of heart.

Jaw dropping views. Went up at sunset. Views of the tablecloth covering the mountain are like nothing I've seen before. Is mega busy so probably best to go early or ensure you bought your tickets online as there is a separate queue for online ticket holders.
Essential to book the early departure!!. New Year's Eve. Arrived 6.45am to already large crowds BUT the early 7.30am tickets whisk you to the front and we were up on TM by 7.40!! Beat the crowds!

Beautiful!. I expected massive queues as the Cableway had been closed for a couple of days but from getting there to getting to the top of Table Mountain was just over an hour. It's a wonderful way to spend a few hours with stunning scenery and even though there were A LOT of other people up there, it didn't feel crowded or noisy. Just perfect!
views to remember. best views to Table Bay, lovely scenery, very well managed and organised.Must do when in Cape Town - highly recommended

Spectacular!!!. What a beautiful hike up the mountain and then an awesome hike all around the table top. The views were absolutely stunning. This is a MUST do while in Capetown and if you are not up for the hike(s) then you can take the cable car up which is also fantastic--get there early if you are taking that option is my suggestion! Nothing better than a couple hour hike up the mountain and quenching your thirst with a Castle Lite and some Ostrich jerky!

book tickets in advance to avoid queues. Even by booking tickets in advance we had to queue, queue, queue. Glad we held out in the searing heat as the views were amazing. Restaurant up there was ok too.

Visit as soon as the weather will allow!. My wife and I made a point of visiting Table Mountain on our first full day in Cape Town as we had read that the weather is very changeable. There was a fair queue for those without a ticket (much shorter queue for those picking up tickets) but its worth the wait once you are at the top. Amazing views over the whole area. Don't be fooled by the relatively cool temp at the top, sun cream is a essential!

Listed as one of the 7 Natural Wonders of the Modern World. Cape Town is directly associated with Table Mountain. It is a must see for any tourist. We took the Sight-Seeing Bus to the main station of the mountain where we had pre-paid tickets to ride the cable car up to the top of the flat mountain. Even with the tickets, we waited 1.5 hours in line to get on the cable. I believe this is because we were there at the busiest vacation time of the year. Hopefully, this will not be the case for other seasons. Once arriving, you have free access to roam the mountain top on trails and vista points. Great views! There is also a restaurant and gift shop at the top. Definitely recommended during your stay in Cape Town.
Great Hikes, Great Views, Great Fun. Many different hikes, beautiful views, and an unparalleled nature retreat in the heart of a beautiful world city.

one of the most amazing places in the world. Beautiful,great place to walk around.
The air is fresh, peaceful,quiet
Truly recommend visiting.
The cable car going up is fun too.
not to be missed. Tram lines can be long but the hike to top even longer. But worth the wait. The views to capture the city of Capetown and the ocean from different spots are just drop dead gorgeous.

A real wonder of the world. The ride in the cable car, the views from the mountain and the easy to follow walks, made this place an absolute must. The shop and cafe were well laid out. The park is very well maintained and a real gem.

A challenging free climb on Indian Venster. Table Mountain. The start is at the lower cable car station and is reasonably well marked ( signs and yellow footsteps) and is considered a challenge for hikers.In recent years chains and steel handholds have been installed on the difficult sections . Several fatal falls took place before the route was made safer with better marking ( carefully you do not loose the path) .It is normally a 2/3 hour hike to the top and on to the top Cable Car station . Many signs will warn you NOT to descend the up route .Most hikers come down via the Cable Car . Alternatively you can descend Kasteelspoort which is clearly signposted and brings you down near to the lower Cable Car station.
main attraction of the city. On a clear day the view of the whole city is very good. The cable car can carry around 60 passengers at one time.

Good but trails are not marked well. The table mountain Park is beautiful and has great views. However the restaurant is super crowded and plus the trails are not well marked. Plus the free tour was conducted only for the short 15 mins. It was well done but I think the visitor centre should be better equipped with more advice and information for tourists. That was missing. The volunteer rangers were super awesome and helpful and we enjoyed our walk down the mountains thanks to them.

A must see!. This is an amazing experience, whether your first or umpteenth time in Cape Town! The beauty created by Mother Nature never ceases to amaze me and even though I am afraid of heights, this is soon forgotten once up there staring at the beauty all around, from the ocean to the flora and fauna!

Spectacular. It was a clear day, so the views went on forever. My kids loved it especially the cable car ride. The refreshment were also good. There are guided tours of the mountain, although I did not opt for that I still felt the wonder that is table mountain. It can easily become a spiritual experience, no matter your background.

Astonishing Table Mountain. Magnificent must do attraction, to be missed on a clear day. Take your friends, take your family and enjoy one of the wonders of the world. The cable car ride and views from the top are astonishing. Check the weather report and arrive early to avoid queuing or buy your tickets before you arrive.

Amazing view from Table Mountain. Take time to spend on top of Table Mountain. You can take the cable car for a return journey or use it as a one way trip down after you walked up. It is an experience of a live time. Take some picknic goodies and stay for the sunset AMAZING... We were told that a couple of hours are enough, luckely we did not listen, we were up there for over 5 hours and could have stayed longer, it was fantastic to watch the Dassies and other wild life and look at the view from different sides of the top.

Beautiful sight!. We took cable way up to the Table mountain. The view on the way up towards the mountain is breathtaking. On the mountain there are several walking routes with beautiful sights. There is also a little restaurant/gift shop.

Fantastic views over the area. Excellent view. Due to the strong wind at the moment in Cape Town, I advise travellers to control in advance if they have closed the setting. The week I visited the town it was closed for 3-4 days.
Absolutely surreal. Amazing experience going up here. I always heard about it but had no idea how spectacular the view is from up there. A MUST DO IN CAPETOWN

From the top. Long lines for tickets. To avoid delays, buy tickets online. I recommend the sunset ride, less crowded and stunning views. Smooth ride to the top via Cable Top. Good service at the Cafe at the top.
One of the Best Sites in Cape Town. We loved the cable car ride to and from the mountain top. The mountain top had very interesting walks and amazing views of the coasts and city of Cape Town.

You don't need me to tell you that Table Mt. is a must do if you're in Cape Town.. Table Mt. towers over the city. If you don't fit it into your visit you're a fool. The tour guides on the top are great and a fill in all the details of all the things you've ever wanted to know about Table Mt.

Amazing. . We visited in winter and chose a day with minimal amount of clouds (for obvious reasons). Got the cableway up to the top. They move very quickly, it was a great experience Spent a long time up at the top, you are not restricted to coming back down within a certain space of time which I liked. Many photograph opportunities. Fantastic views.

Hands down BEST view of Cape Town!. Because of bad weather, winds, etc.. I almost didn't manage to go up Table Mountain. I even said to myself, it's not a big deal, I'm sure the view is the same half way down. I WAS WRONG!! The view and atmosphere is incredible, we had a lovely walk and hung out for about 2 hours at the top. I would definitely go again and again if I lived in Cape Town!! Loved it!
Fantastic. From the cable car ride up from Cape Town to the magnificient views, this is a fabulous place to visit. It will probably occupy you for several hours.

a must.... one of the most important attractions in Cape Town. If you are travelling to Cape Town during the high season it's recommended to book the tickets in advance. We had to wait 2 days as everything was fully booked during New Years...
GO. It is what every SA person is proud of and rightly so. We were going to hike up, but it was so hot we took the tram and then hiked several miles/kilometers around the top. Great views everywhere.

A must do !!. A wonderful experience from the top of Table Mountain. We had choice between climbing and taking cable cars, we choose the second option which was the easiest !
Once you're up high, just walk ... you will discover different faces of Cape Town from up!

Wow!. We walked up from Signal Hill after our paragliding trip. We had bought tickets at our hotel, so we hopped in the line for the cable car. It was about a 20 min wait. The views once at the top were INCREDIBLE! The staff was super friendly and accommodating. Even walking down to the tour bus to get a question answered for me. The car rotates so you will have a great view no matter where you stand.

Walk up, go VERY early, bring water.. This is a fairly strenuous hike - we took the PlatteklipGorge route and we started to the right of the cable car. It took us about an hour and forty minutes to reach the top. The route is easy to follow. It starts steeply, then winds around the mountain and climbs again. The main difficulty for us was the heat. We started at 7am but wished we had started an hour earlier so that we could have walked in some shade. We could see the path shaded up ahead of us but by the time we reached it, it was in full sun.But the views from the top were glorious - worth every drop of sweat and ache.We felt that we had earned this glimpse of paradise.We descended by the same route and really pitied the poor people struggling up in the even more intense heat of mid morning.So walk up BUT go early to avoid the crowds and the heat.

Seeing life from the TOP. stunning views, lovely colors. Plan to stay there for as many hours as you can and make sure you take work clothes with you as it gets a bit could.We took the cable cars while the kids elected to take the challenge and climb to the Top. Breat taking place must see and experience

Fabulous views. We arrived early and pre-booked as advised, queues went very quickly and moved efficiently. Staff were all friendly too. Cable car was fast and gives a rotating 360 degree view both going up and down. Views are spectacular, would advise to go early as cable car closes if winds pick up later in the day. A must do in Cape town

Great hiking. Walked up this time via Skeleton Gorge (have previously walked up via Platteklip Gorge, of the two I preferred Skeleton Gorge). Wonderful walk up. I didn't find it too bad, but I've done quite a lot of trekking in the past. Took me about 2.5 hours from starting out at entrance to Kirstenbosch Gardens to Maclear's Beacon though I tend to go at a fairly rapid pace (most seemed to be taking 3- 3.5 hrs). If you've done any good full day uphill treks before you shouldn't find it beyond you, and I have to say the experience of walking up Table Mountain is vastly more enjoyable and rewarding than going up in a Cable Car - so if you can walk it, do it!Great views once more both all the way up and then at the summit.For those just getting the Cable Car up - walk across Table Mountain!!!! I was staggered when I got to the Cable Car end to hear moaning that it was a bit cloudy and so the views were not great. Weather and cloud conditions vary greatly across the summit (at the other end, towards Skeleton Gorge, it has been practically clear skies) so walk about and you will get more (and different) views. Plus as you walk further away from the Cable Car end the crowds dissipate and you soon have tranquility to enjoy the stunning views.

Top of The Mountain. The cable car ride which starts the journey is memorable and the views and the wildlife when you get to the top are stunning. This is a must visit destination when you visit Cape Town and my 2 top tips are; book online (tickets valid for 7 days) and keep checking the weather and go as soon as the forecast is clear and no wind. We spent 3 days in Cape Town and the cable car didn't run on 1 day due to the wind.

On Top of the World. Such an experience and you can never tell what the weather is going to do, so each time you go up it is different. The view is breath-taking and the photos you can take are amazing

Amazing. Was a perfect day when we were up there.
There are a few walks to choose from ,10,30 or 45 minute and such stunning views

Excellent hike, beautiful views. We were under prepared for the difficulty of the hike. We are all mid 30s and in shape and did fine but we were not expecting this level of difficult hike. Bring plenty of water (we did not), don't start in the afternoon heat like we did and bring sunscreen. That being said, the hike was awesome and the views at the top were incredible! Don't take the cable car up if you are able to hike it and see the incredible views!!! This is a MUST see in Cape Town!!

Gorgeous views of Cape Town. You can't go to Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain. I took the cable car to the top, though the line was very long. We purchased our ticket online the night before, which I would recommend doing. Even at 10am the line was very long and we probably waited about an hour and a half. It was an extremely hot day, so bring a water bottle and sunscreen. If you forget though, they have some for purchase. There are shops and a cafe (reasonable prices and lots of choices) up at the top. It's truly a beautiful place and you can make your stay as long or as short as you'd like. I was happy to see that it was wheelchair friendly; there were at least three folks in wheel chairs up there. Wear comfortable shoes to walk around, clothing appropriate for the weather, and your camera. Also, know that there will be a line to get the cable car to get back down too. That line was not as organized as the first one and we were very squished in the hallway- my only complaint about the attraction.
Must do experience when in Cape Town. Great trip well worth the 1 hour wait for the cable car.Not a lot to do when on top there is a shop and restaurant, but the views are spectacular.

Take the "Indian Venster" route. Of course the only real way to get on top of Table Mountain is to walk it ;) For going up, I can highly recommend the "Indian Venster" route. Don't be scared, the warning signs can be easily ignored if you don't have kids under 10 or are somehow not able to do a few big steps. The route is very scenic and not as busy as the Gorge route. Ontop, it does not only consist of steps but varies a lot more.VERY IMPORTANT: take AT LEAST 1.5 l of water with you, as you cannot hope for the cablecar to be opened which also means that there are no opened shops up there. But luckily there is a small drinking fountain at the cable way station up there, so you can refill your bottles (still 1.5 l are quickly gone on the way up).For the way down, I guess the Gorge is alright, still you get tired quickly from all that steps.
Fabulous but dont go in the xmas holiday period. Fabulous but dont go in the xmas holiday period unless you dont mind a queue of over an hour both up and down!

Must go the first clear day you get! Totally worth it!!. The mountain closes any day there's fog or bad weather, so we were so happy our hotel (shout out to the Hilton) suggested we "get it out of the way" because many people put it off or save it for another day, then the weather is unpredictable, and then their trip is over before they know it and they didn't get to see it. It was one of the most beautiful if the THE most beautiful views I have ever seen!! My hubby and I stayed almost the whole day there! Its huge, we took the cable car up, and then hiked all around, up and down for hours and didn't even know we were going to make a whole day out of it. We also ate at the restaurant there and it was really good and we thought reasonably priced. The gift shop is over priced though. GO and make sure to take a ton of pics!!
beautiful. an experience that cant be missed. stunning views to die for, and a nice little gift shop to do a little bit of gift buying

Magical. This is a must see to understand fully why it is one of the world's seven natural wonders. It is spectacular. Sunset is a highly recommended time to go. We had no queues and got the benefit of daylight on the way up and a night view of Cape Town city on the way down. A must do.
Amazing - don't miss. Book online or ask your hotel to skip the lines - beautiful views don't miss this - you can do it in an hour or take a few hours - up to you

Spectacular-not to be missed. We visited during Christmas week so it was extremely crowded. Best advice - spend the extra to do the early morning access, it made all the difference! It was truly stunning!
Breath taking view!. Went there on hop on/hop off bus and what a view of the city! Should definitely try cable car if you have never been on one before.

Amazing Experience. We waited for the lift in a warm and windy climate wondering what wind to expect at the top but to our amazement it was completely still and the views fantastic, we had refreshments at the café and just enjoyed the whole experience. Wish we had had more time as we would have walked much further. Definitely recommend a visit to Table Mountain without a doubt!
Stunningly Beuatiful. Definitely worth the drive out. If you can hike up even better! One of the most gorgeous views from CPT and free!

Most Amazing Views - Highly Recommended. The View is spectacular, I would recommend this to anyone from South Africa to the rest of the World.You can either hike up to Table Mountain or you can take the Cable Car.Both is an amazing experience.
On top of Table Mountain. Here you have a fantastic view of Cape Town. But remember to check the weather before your visit. It would be cloudy so there is no reason to go there.

NOT a tourist trap. It is a World Heritage site for valid reasons. The view is breathtaking, and the flora diversity is astonishing. Beautiful place! IMPORTANT: buy your tickets in advance thru internet and print them (wherever you are in the world) and arrive early. This will make a huge difference!
Too long a line for the cable car.. Lovely attraction that you need to do to say you've done it but very long to get up and down as you see Table Mountain all over Cape Town. Glad we did it.

Hike the India Venster route. Strenuous but superb route up Table Mountain. Start point just to the right of the cable car start. Varied views, ending at the top of the Table. There are some chains but the trail is well maintained and it makes for a very special experience. Take water, sun protection warm jacket and your camera for all the incredible photo opportunities. Cable car takes you back down. Beware of the blister bush close to the top in the west side. It looks like celery leaves. Creates a nasty blister if rubbed.

Great cable-car service. The cable car ride offers fantastic views of the Cape peninsula. The range of views, in all directions,from the top of the ride is spectactular. Obviously -- choose to go when the weather is fine. Although, even on slightly cloudy days, it's a worthwhile expeience.
Worth it!. Go on a clear day, get your tickets ahead of time....fantastic! You may face line ups on the way up and down but hopefully not too long.

Varied. Most visitors identify this national park with the iconic mountain immediately outside Capetown, and they're right. Parts of the park, however, extend all the way down the coast to the Cape of Good Hope, beaches and include the penguins at the Boulders. It's a huge and varied park. Lots of wildlife and things to do, depending on which section being visited.
Don't miss. Wonderful views on the way to the top and at the top! A MUST see. It's worth any line, you will love it.

Stunning views but the queues were enormous!. Great views and a must-do but, if you've got the time, then climb up and down, avoiding the cable car. If you haven't got time then book afternoon tickets ahead of time (which avoids the huge morning queues at the bottom), get an afternoon cable car up, look around and then walk down. The reason is the queue to get down afterwards can be a two hour wait and you can walk down in less than that. If you can't walk down then make sure you get a return queue ticket as soon as you step out of the car at the top. But don't let this put you off. The views are incredible.

A must do. No trip to Cape Town would be complete without ascending the mountain , make it your first priority as cloud or high winds can cause it to be closed . Avoid some of the queues by purchasing a lift ticket in advance. Dont expect to eat up there in a hurry , massive queues for cafe.

Must do but check the weather forecast (wind and fog) and be early in the morning!. We booked a ticket via internet which is highly recommended. When arriving at noon, we realized that there was a 300m queue for both, those having a ticket and those who didn't. We went another day and were there at 08:00 with minimal queue and easy to return. There is a risk of fog and wind, hence prepare yourself, the ticket is valid some 5 days. Also, during peak-hours, you may wait up to 3 hours to return and queue under the heat up there. Again, just be early. You can plan for extensive walks up there and it's really worth the investment to get a bird view on the Cape set-up.

Cable Car to Table Mountain. The most exceptional views from Table Mountain! I recommend purchasing tickets for the cable car in advance to avoid long waits in line. Even with the advance tickets, we waited for 30 minutes, but this was in prime season.
