Hot as hell but Amazing view!!. this was my first stop in Cape Town, and i had to queue up for a bit under the scorching sun, but it was worth the wait. managed to take the cable car up, then shot some awesome pics of the site and vegetation. it's one place not to be missed!!!

Must see when in Cape Town. I don't normally enjoy going on top of view decks of buildings, towers or the like. Coming into this, I thought I was to expect that sort of experience...tourist trap with views of the city you can probably see elsewhere. Fortunately I was mistaken. Apart from the view, the environment on top of the Table Mountain was very interesting. From the climate to the rock formations and landscape, it was most definitely a pleasant surprise. I now continue to recommend this to people visiting Cape Town for the first time. Worth your time.

Breath taking scenario. This is a great experience just being at the top of this mountain takes your breath away its got so many beautiful scenic view of the city and the ocean. Loved and enjoyed the experience....simply awesome.

It lives up to the type - breathtaking views, just do it!. Although a popular tourist attraction Table Mountain was actually only in the middle of my list in terms of priority, I expected just another high viewpoint with quite nice views. My boyfriend was very keen though and once we got to the top I saw what the fuss was about. The views here are incredible, and on a clear day you can see so far from so many different angles. Even though there are lots of tourists up there it's managed to a point that it never feels overcrowded. I didn't spot a dassie or baboon though which was disappointing!
Table Mountain. Early morning walks on Table Mountain were an absolute delight and very reassuring to see a Police patrol often.

Spectacular views. This is a Must Do when in Cape Town. We had a car and you need to go early to get a parking space close to the cable car. You have to deal with the "parking attendants", but that's OK. Probably easier to get there by the tourist bus. Revolving cable car excellent. The weather can be changeable so the cable car is closed more often than you might think because of cloud on the top or high winds around the top even when you are in brilliant sunshine on a calm day in the city. Therefore need to set aside alternative days or simply have flexibility in your itinerary. You can of course walk up, or perhaps more easily, down. Once up there it is well worth walking around on the plateau on the top because there are views in all directions.

A superb ride from Cape Town to Cape point. Beautiful view. Very pristine. Have seen many nature views throughout the years. I believe the view here is great since it has beautiful ocean on one side and nice green area on the other side. Very little or non commercial development make the area much greater

Beuatiful view - a nice exercise for a brisk walk - can be shut down because of weather. Cape Town is amazing and to see if from the eagle eyes point of view is nice. Be aware that weather can cancel the opportunity weather rain, fog or wind. Chilly so bring a jacket as the change in temperature is severe - even in the summer.

What a view. We got up early to go to Table Mountain and I am glad we did, you beat the crowds. I also found out that we were lucky they close the mountain when it is windy and if it is cloudy then you can's see. We had the perfect day. No wind, no clouds. When you know the day is going to be clear, go. We were in Cape Town for 4 days and the mountain was closed 2 of the day.
Must do in cape town. Pre-book tickets, get there early to beat the crowds, take a jacket (mostly windy and high up). As an easy way to get there use the hop on, hop off buses
Must do. Visited TM for half day. Used free guide - excellent trip. Awesome views, useful cafe and very good souvenir shop on top of mountain.

Nice views...but best part was the walk to Maclear's Beacon and the sunset!. Went twice - once in the morning (730-8 types)...good weather to explore... views are neat...birdseye view...but its not spectacular for the view in morning per se....went again at 7pm for the eve sunset and that was a great sight!Best part ....Dont miss the walk to Maclear's Beacon, the highest point on Table Mountain...!

STUNNING VIEWS FROM THE TOP. Absolutely stunning views on the day we went which was clear and the amazing to see so much. we had pre booked tickets online and i strongly recommend this as the ques even for this are large and long and we waited about 45 minutes to get a cable car up. so more than double this if you dont have tickets. but at least you can book your time to come down and this is better when you are at t the top. definately worth a visit i did this 10 years ago and was equally was enthralled this time

Wowza!. We went to Table Mountain shortly before sunset and it was phenomenal! I will say bring a jacket or coat because it gets very cold up there. Almost everyone was complaining about how cold it was, and I am from Wyoming, so I know cold! If you have a coat you will be fine. None the less, the scenery was breathtaking making this trip so memorable. I've never seen sites like the ones on Table Mountain, with the clouds rolling of the mountain crest. If you are in Cape Town visiting, Table Mountain is an absolute MUST SEE. It truly will take your breath away.

Beautiful View. Besides Cape Town being freezing cold in winter, the views remain spectacular! The skies were the perfect blue during my visit to Table Mountain which made it a great trip. I would advise that one goes there in the morning rather than later in the day.

Table Top New Year Day. We arranged to go to the mountain on New years day. We pre booked the tickets at our hotel as the queues at this time of year are +45 mins for pay on arrival. I have visited here before and the place is a wonderful opportunity to see the extend of Cape Town with exceptional views.
outstanding views. a must see, it was very windy which we had been warned about, incredible views, did not want to leave!

No words to describe pure beauty. Be prepared to be gob smacked by the sheer beauty of this gorgeous place. My advice to anyone travelling to table mountain is to make sure they stay for the sunset. If you love the quiet, the peacefulness, the scenery, then this is the place for you. You can spend easily 4-5 hours at the top. I miss this place so much. If money was no object, i would be back there tomorrow. For any muslim travellers, there is halal food in the restaurant at the top.
Breathtaking Scenery!. Words cannot do justice to the views from the top of Table mountain, The beautiful hues in the water, rocky face, Robben island, all just bring a smile to my face.
Quick Trip Up is Worth the View. Definitely a touristy thing to do in CT but well worth the view of CT and the surrounding area that it offers

Those who get to experience it : will never forget it. Table Mountain National Park is the crémé de la crémé of a visit to Cape Town. And even if one lives in Cape Town - you will never cease to be amazed at the beauty of this park.
Table Mountain. The views from this mountain top are unparalleled! On a clear day you can see for miles.Do not miss this one. The first clear day go up table mountain!
Wonderful walking park. We had wonderful views of Cape Town and the beaches in the area. Robben Island can be seen from the top.

A for as far as the eye can see!. Unfortunately we picked the wrong time and day for our Table Mountain Experience. It was a glorious day in Cape Town but by the time we got up to the top the weather had changed. Even with the storm clouds brewing, coming up through the clouds in the rotating cable car was sublime. We spent a good two hours walking around the top, along well signed pathways. take a jumper or a coat as we were caught out with the rapidly changing weather. Although the lovely cafe/gift shop kept us warm whilst we waited to go back down. This was at the top of our list and it did not disappoint.

Got engaged here. Simply amazing. We walked up which was a 3 hour walk of hot pain. However it was worth it at the top and happy that we did it. Got engaged at the top, like you do. Food and drinks available at the peak too. Go in morning

Overseer's Cottage - superb location for overnight stay. The cottage (actually two cottages in their own fenced off grounds - sleep up to 16 but only bookable by one group at a time) are located right next to the "Jeep Track", the concrete path that leads from Constantia Nek up to the top of the mountain, on the far end from the top cable station. Driving up is only permitted for National Parks vehicles, but if you don't fancy or can't manage a strenuous walk then its possible to meander up the Jeep Track in an hour or two, while it is a little steep its relatively easy and safe even for groups with small children. The National Parks staff drive your kit up before your stay and down when you finish, so you can take plenty to eat and drink - there is a fully equipped kitchen and an outdoor braai (barbeque) area. Near the cottage are several reservoirs and a small but interesting historical museum. The cottages are not luxurious but are spacious and the decoration has some nice touches compared with some of the more basic National Parks accommodation - including very comfy beds. The views at night (if the clouds clear !) are superb, over the Cape Flats to the Hottentots Holland range. If you want to do more challenging walks, then after leaving your kit at Constantia Nek you can come up from Kirstenbosch (Skeleton Gorge or Nursery Ravine) in 2-3 hours, or in a similar walk across the top of the mountain (several ladders and steep drops) to the cable car. Special mention to Sabrina Adams and Mxolisi Magwaxaza of National Parks for their efficient and friendly assistance.
Walked the easiest trail. Totally worth it, fysiek is not my cup of tea and I thought many times why I didn't the cable car but at the end the feeling was awesome, view awesome and happy I walked it!
amazing. pls plan a trip in advance, long queues, if possible hire a car and drive there yourself to avoid extra money for cabs. buy tickets online for the table mountain.. very very long lines

Amazing place. If you only have time to do one thing in Cape Town, this should be it. If you are in a decent condition I would reccomend to walk up the mountain with one of the many tracks that lead up to the top. Be carefull to bring enough water though, since the days can be very hot in Cape Town and there will not be that many spots with shade! Although the place is very crowded there is still enough room to make awesome pictures of the view you have over Cape Town and the ocean. And meet the local small lizards which a crawling over the paths.

Wonderful. We were fortunate to have a clear and sunny day to enjoy the mountain. The views are spectacular and paths are well laid out for a stroll. Unmissable for first timers to Cape Town, such as ourselves

Fantastic views!. Don´t miss it! There is so much to see from different perspectives - False Bay, Cape of GoodH ope, Camps Bay and of course Cape Town centre... We were lucky and visited during a clear and sunny day. It often gets cloudy on top so plan a visit as soon as you have a sunny morning.

A must do!. I hike up the mountain every time I visit the city - it never disappoints. Platteklip Gorge is the easiest route but it is strenuous. Take at least a liter of water per person with you. I would also recommend that you begin your ascent by no later than 8am - you will benefit from quite a bit of shade going up until around 930/10am. The views going up and once on top are magnificent. Many people were also hiking back down - you can also take the cableway down. Tickets are on sale in the Shop On The Top.
SA tour incomplete without this.... must watch.. but plan atleast 4-5 hours if you are going to trek unlike 1 hour that is alloted by the tour operators.

Big ques but otherwise great experience. There were big ques but this is expected this time of the year. The Mountain and what they have done up there to make it more comfortable and to help the environment is admirable.

Breathtaking Views of Cape Town. This is a must for all and been prepared for a hike if your into that. Pack a good pair of runners and a warm jacket (just in case) and enjoy. There is 3 different routes of walking/hiking you can do up on Table Mountain, longest one goes for more then an hour. Well worth it. There is a cafe up there for a bite to eat and a drink. Just hope for a clear blue day without the clouds :)

View at the Top. The day that I visited Table Montain happened to be a holiday. In the morning the line was so long that the guide suggested returning at the end of the day. Great suggestion! The short line and the view at the top was worth the second trip.
Views all around. Riding up in the turning cable car, looking at the city below, watching the fog, and examining the plants and animals. All super worth the trip.

No wonder is one of the 7 Natural Wonders of the World. If you don't do anything else when you go to Cape Town, make sure you make this stop on the top of your list. My only warning would be to book your ticket ahead of time or go early in the morning. The lines in the afternoon are huge, sometimes it takes 2-3 hours to take the tramp and the same amount of time to take it down, which doesn't give you any time on top.Or you can hike it, which is super fun, but takes a while. Do bring a jacket, because it get cold up there. But the wait on line, the cold, and the hike are all worth doing, you won't believe your eyes, once you see the clouds moving, sooooo cool
Wow. Go in the afternoon to avoid the queues. Buy a ticket on line before you go, otherwise you have to queue twice. Don't go if its cloudy at the top as the views will be spoiled.

Amazing views and worth the wait!. We queued for some time to get on the cable car but once at the top we were not disappointed. The views over Cape Town out to Robbin Island and further are amazing. Lots of little viewing platforms and interesting story boards make the relatively small area interesting and if you want to walk further there is lots to see.
Sunset Magic. Excellent facilities, great pathways, well designed and set out - Eco and environment friendly - we are on the right track

Awesome views!!. Advisable to buy tickets online rather than waiting in the long queue. The cable car revolves 360 deg on the ride up & down, so each one can view the entire panorama. Hot in December but best if no winds!! You can hike up if you can fight the heat!!
Should be on everybody's bucket list. Cannot come to Cape Town without this experience since it is on most tourist's list. Great ride up and superb views like nowhere else

Beautiful sites. Get your tickets online in advance, and show up early to avoid a long queue and crowds at the top!
Check the website to ensure that the cable car is operating before heading out!

Exhilirating. Firstly, you must book you tickets in advance if you want to visit the table mountain to avoid standing in a long queue.A quick tip to save few bucks:If you visit it after 6pm, you will get 50% discount. So plan accordingly.The floor of the cable car rotates within the cable, you will get a 360° view of the city on your way up. Once you reach there, read all safety instructions carefully. This will help you, should there be any harsh weather condition which require the visitors the leave the place. Make sure to visit all sides of the table mountain, once you are on the top. You will get a panoramic view of the entire city.If you are driving, it is advisable to park your car at the free table mountain parking at lower table mountain car park, next to the information centre. From there, you can take a free ride in a MyCiti bus, which takes you to lost cable station.

Go for the sunset!. Table Mountain is impossible to miss if you're in Cape Town. The view of the mountain from the city is spectacular, but it's even more breathtaking when you're on top of it. Went there for sunset with my boyfriend and I would definitely recommend you to go at sunset times! Sitting on the mountain and watching the sun go down with all the colors and light over the city, ocean and mountains is just amazing. HOWEVER, a few things i would recommend if you're going for the sunset: 1. Bring warm clothes!! It gets windy on the mountain and after sunset it gets freezing cold. 2. Be aware that if you go for sunset you'll not be the only one leaving the mountain right after. Therefore, the line to the cable car gets really long. We didn't get down until 2hours after sunset. But after all, you don't wanna miss Table Mountain!

A memorable experience. Although we visited in the peak of the holiday season the going up trip was efficient & orderly & the ques moved quickly, the coming back down trip needs attention it was a push & shove with no order. We where asked to fill gaps & people where just pushing, not good for people with kids.

So much to take in. We took the tram to the top and hiked a loop over to Maclean’s Beacon then back via a second trail that went along the western edge of the mountain. The trip was astonishing for it's views, the variety of plants, and the mix of birds. We took our 6 & 9 year old and they had no problems with the ~6k loop. I highly recommend packing a breakfast and catching the first tram up (buy tickets ahead) and having a snack as you look down on to Cape Town.
Great experience. Lovely trip up the mountain, beautiful views from the cable car. Remember to wear sunscreen and a hat. Restaurant available at the top of the mountain.

Must while in Cape Town. As everyone will tell you, Table Mountain is obviously a must do while in Cape Town. We visited on the Sunday between Christmas and NY and it was super crowded. The queue to buy tickets was more than an hourlong wait. We actually thought about leaving Table Mountain for what it was, but were very happy that we did the queue (although we would highly recommend ordering your tickets online). Once we were on Table Mountain, we couldn't be happier. We did a long hike around the mountain, which offered some great views.

book online in advance. Stunning views from the top of table mountain as well as from the cable cars. We booked in advance and brought our online tickets. We went there on 30 December so during the most busy season and when we arrived at around 9:30 they wouldn't let people without tickets go up. So it's probably better to be there early. Still, don't let the staff scare you with horrific times for queuing. We were told we would have to wait three hours to get up and two to get down again - it turned out it was 1.5 hours to get up and some 25minutes to get down. The organisation of the cable cars works quite well so as terrible as the queue might look it's not that bad (if you have online tickets already!)Unfortuanately we had more plans that day and therefore had way too little time. So I recommend to bring a lot of time to enjoy all the different views from up there.Bring a hat and sunscreen! If you're unlucky you might have to wait in the sun which is really unpleasant without a hat

An Iconic Hike!. This is a challenging hike, with great views all the way up, looking over Cape Town, the bay and Lions Head all at different point, you need to have good footwear, plenty of water and a decent level of fitness, otherwise it could be disastrous as it has been for quite a few. This hike is not for the feint hearted. It is truly an Iconic hike and a great achievement and great experience for all that do it.
breath taking. Each time I go up the mountain, it just seems to get better and better - Maria - the cable car lady was just brilliant - calming our nerves on the odious trip up!

Spectacular. We attempted a walking trail but unfortunately it was an extremely hot day and our level of fitness was not sufficient but we managed a fair distance up the mountain so had the privilege of beautiful views before returning to go up the mountain via the cable car. The restaurant at the top of the mountain was very efficient and well stocked. Although there were long queues for the cable cars due to the peak holiday season everything was well run and organised. Definitely 'a must see' experience.

Long queues, scary cable car, but fantastic experience. In hind sight we would have booked our trip up Table Mountain in advance to avoid long, hot wait. They do provide shade and spray water to cool you down though. I found the cable car quite scary, but I'm a bit of a wimp, most would probably find the views exhilarating. The views from the top of the mountain are breath taking - this is a must when visiting Cape Town. Nice little cafe up top and plenty of walks and viewing points. Great afternoon out!!

Breathtaking. Although Table Mountain looks flat from the ground - up at the top it really is beautiful. Many cervices and the plant life is specatular. You could spend a lot of time up there but its good to get tickets early and go early around 8am to beat the super long queues that start soon after.

amazing views!. one of the best things to do in Cape Town, and no trip in complete without it. Be aware of the big crowds lining up for the cable car, and make sure you go on a clear day. fantastic views of the whole city!
Great views. Fantastic views but if you are in a tight schedule, allow for lots of time due to long wait for tickets both ways, if you are net opting for walking.

Stunning. Brilliant place to visit. The views are breath taking. Could easily spend a couple of hours up there walking around. A must visit for tourists with lots of great photo opportunities, but be prepared to queue for a while for the cable car. Restaurant is quite good up there for food and refreshments.

Definitely worth it to hike up! (Cable car down). We had an absolutely amazing time hiking up Platteklip Gorge. One of my favorite hikes ever, with GORGEOUS views from the top. Plan to spend at least 3 hours or so (Hike up took about 1.5 hours, average pace, pictures and relaxing up above 45 to an hour, line for cable car down was about 20 min) Highly recommend for anyone visiting Cape Town!

HIKE UP!! Well worth the effort!!. Went with a group of couples and decided to hike up table mountain which was well worth the effort! You can get the cable cars back down for about 120 rand one way.A few things to note if you're considering doing the same:- It was definitely not easy for some of us and I would recommend being of average fitness level. - go early!! If you do it in summer go at 7am, we did it this early and still was 28° by 9am.- totally fine to wear runners!- take at least 2L of water in your back pack, plenty of sunscreen and a light snack like a banana!- Don't take any valuables and minimal money.*Warning!* The option of taking the cable car back down is good a one.. however..if the conditions are not suitable the cable cars won't run so be prepared for this!Unfortunately this happened to our group due to windy conditions, but it definitely didn't take away the AMAZING views from the top, and it was an awesome achievement.I would do it again and I wouldn't miss it if you come to cape town!
Lovely. Went up by cable car, rotating floor so could see all views Beautiful views up top well worth it. Could do with a couple more toilets up their to help minimise queues.

GET THERE EARLY. Also, buy tickets in advance. In the summer months, it starts to get hot really early and it seems to be one of the most popular times of the year, so it's best to get there around 7/7:30 LATEST to ensure you're one of the first people on the cable cars and up the mountain. Once it gets started at 8:00AM the line moves pretty quickly. Also, bring your own food, not because the food is expensive, but because the lines become outrageously long for the restaurant area and you're stuck spending most of your time in line buying a water when you could be doing other things.

Long wait was worth It. Although we waited for about an hour to take the cable car to the top of the mountain it was worth it. The revolving cable car was a novelty.We were fortunate to visit on a day when the sky was blue and clear and were rewarded with stunning vistas of the beautiful city of Cape Town. The paths were a little rough in places but were easy to navigate. There were plenty of vantage points where one could linger and look.The facilities on the mountain were good with clean toilets. We visited as part of a tour group so had a limited time on the mountain. I would suggest making a private visit so that you can spend more time drinking in the views.

Enormous que!. Cable to go up often gets cancelled due to wond, so check just before you go up there. The day we went was the after the cancelled day and also big cruise ship just docked so loads of people. We purchased tickets online, so going up wasn't too bad, but we saw que at the top and it was a que of people waiting to go down, so I let kids to look around and started queuing immediately. It took one hour to reach the down cable car, and due to the mist, the view from the top was not great. Overall, you don't miss much even if you just look down from the car park. View is still breathtaking. So if the wait looks bad, just enjoy the view from car park and go down.

Hike up Platteklip Gorge. This is a tough walk, but it is a wonderful experience with a great sense of achievement afterwards for three inexperienced ladies! (This time last year we walked from Constantia Nek to the cable station, which was just as difficult and just too long....)But I really want to pass on compliments for:1) All the people we met on the way (and it WAS a very busy day). The camaraderie and encouragement - from the super-fit running up and down again in less time that it took us to "crawl" to the top to our fellow first-timers and "crawlers" - was absolutely wonderful and really helped.2) The state of the path, which is absolutely immaculate. We pass on profuse thanks and compliments to those who maintain the fences, steps and gabions that make this path feel safe and secure all the way up.

Go late in the day!. Every review will tell you to go up when it is clear and go first thing in the morning. We did that, got up early and arrived at the Cable Car station just after 8am to find a 4 hour wait!! We decided not to and return another day, later in the day. It is well worth a visit, so top tips are: - buy an early access pass (giving you access at 7:30 - there are limited tickets and cost ~ 90 Rand extra)- Buy a ticket on-line, do not leave it to buy a ticket at the station- Buy an afternoon ticket when you first arrive (they are valid for 7 days) - Keep an eye on the weather and if looking good, make a decision to get there around 4pm (we did and waited no more than 45 minutes and the queue moved quickly) - With your pre-purchased tickets join the green queue Take your camera, walk around the pathways and enjoy the splendid views.
When the clouds clear just GO!. A surprising highlight of the Capetown visit. Fast cable car that turns so everyone gets the good view. Great long rambles on trails.

Must Go to the Top, whether by foot or aerial tram. No matter how you choose to go to the top of Table Mountain - go. Beautiful views of the city and the ocean. We chose to hike up and take the gondola down. The hike up is strenuous. You need be in decent shape. It will take a couple of hours and is straight up. Bring water. Otherwise the aerial tram is a great way to get up and down. Get tickets ahead of time if you can because the lines can be quite long. Once you get to the top, I suggest you reserve the time slot when you would like to go back down. By reserving a time you will avoid standing in a long line waiting for space on the next tram. Be sure to give yourself at least a couple of hours to enjoy the top of the mountain. Food service at the top is crowded and even though it is feeding the masses it has better than average selections. The outdoor patio is the best place to take your food.

Brilliant view . I went here in January 2014 with my two children. We were visiting my family who live in port Elizabeth . We came to Cape Town for a weeks stay. The cable car up and down the mountain was so fun! Once you are up there it is beautiful. There is a restaurant up there too which was lovely. Really nice day out , would definitely go again.

Queues can ruin the experience. During the Summer months (we visited in December 2015), the queues going up and down can be extremely long during the peak hours (10am to 3pm). The lines took us 2 hours in each direction, and we had to stand in the scorching heat with our 3-yr old.It would be advisable to make the journey up during 4pm slot when the crowds reduce.There is no special queueing, if you are a tourist, which is bad because people cannot be spending a whole day (or atleast a major part) just to visit the Table Mountain.

Exactly as expected. Amazing view from the top, but awful waiting in the hot sun for an hour for that view. Even getting there at 08:00 is not early enough! I recommend getting there at 07:30 if you don't want to roast in the sun too long.. expect waiting time, but its worth it. **Also; save yourself a PROBLEM and get a driver/taxi to drop you off there! Huge que and traffic jam to get there & park.All locals use 'Uber' as its a safe/cheap option. ;-)
Amazing view. We were at Table Mointain Nation Park, it was a amazing expirience, amazing view.Certain this trip will be in the history for me, fixed in my mind.

a wonder of the world. I def recommend hiking up, as you will avoid waiting in line for hours to go on cable car. the early you hike the better. the top near the cable car is tourist central but if you walk from there you will get more privacy and quiet and views.

Bring the Sunscreen!. We visited Table Mountain on a clear, sunny day and found the queue quite long. We did not pre-book our tickets and found that the wifi onsite was a little slow so we could not book online while we waited. The trip up to the top in the cable car was spectacular and gave us great views of the city below as it rotated 360 degrees on the way. At the top we took a few of the walking trails around the top of the mountain. There is little to no shelter across the top, so bring the sunscreen and be prepared for all kinds of weather. Wear comfortable shoes for the walking, bring some water and stay on the pathways - it's very rocky.
Amazing!. Well worth the walk up for the view.Just remember to have a lot of water if you hike up.It's about a 2 hours walk and steep in some places.

Excellent. Breathtakingly beautiful. Amazing view, any nature lover's dream. Great place to go for a hike or just relax and enjoy the nature and view. Very nice shop and cafe, just terribly expensive. Will visit again.

Hike around, don't get the lift. We hiked up the around the mountain instead of getting the cable car up. The hike starts just to the right of the cable car, winds around the mountain and then up through a gully to the top. It's a reasonably tough hike but definitely worth it. It took about two hours but given the queues at the cable car station I think we got up quicker than some of the people queuing. Once you get to the top there are some really good views across Cape Town.The last few hundred meters are quite steep so I'd bring proper walking/hiking shoes and 2-3 litres of water at least.
Great view. We were lucky that the clouds didn't cover the view. Impressive visit, makes Cape Town special. A better understanding of the area.

Wonderful Place. A must place to visit while in Cape Town. Start before six in the morning and hike up one of the many trails to the plateau. Either alone or with a certified guide. Which is recommendable.
must see when in cape town. Fabulous way to spend a few hours and a nice restaurant at the top.......great views of the city and the cable car rotates on ascent and descent
great view. Was her win the South African winter, nice view, nice hike. Walked up and down, it was a nice walk, cool in areas

Worth!. In spite of the huge cue due to the holydays, even waiting for 2 hours under the sun, the astonishing view from the top is worth. The way the cable car keep turning while going up and down, giving everyone opportunity to have a good view is something.Go in a sunny day to get a good view but don't forget sunglasses, sunscreen and a hat or cap.Buy the ticket in advance from Internet so you avoid at least one cue.Go!! don't miss the opportunity

A must do. To some it might look too touristy, but it really is a must do for a trip to Cape Town. A few tips: Buy your tickets online before your trip. The tickets are good for one week from the date you pick. This will give you options of going on different days if the weather is not great.Definitely pick the morning option. And you will thank yourself if you make sure you are there right at the gondola opens. No line and you pretty much have the top of the mountain and views to yourself.

Pre Book! Beautiful scenery. I booked our tickets online prior to travel. Effortless website. Printed out tickets (but saw others using barcodes on their mobile phones which permitted entry with ease). Day 1 in South Africa for us. The tickets had a 3 day window, and we needed to book either am tickets (up till 1pm), or pm tickets (after 1pm). We chose am tickets and got there at 12.30. Directions around the city were very clear, as we were in a hire car. There are a lot of chaps wearing orange vests around the parking. These guys are not official - but trying to assist for a tip. I was a bit suspicious at first, but got used to this all around SA. They don't ask for a lot, and are usually very helpful and courteous - better than begging. There was a lot of traffic parking a long way from the cable car, which looked like parking was a problem. It wasn't. Keep going up the mountain to the cable car, and out the other side where there is more parking much closer to where you need to be. There are two queues. Trust me, you want to be in the PREPAID one! Seemed long, but got on the cable car fairly quickly. When aboard, the floor rotates so everyone gets a view on the outside edge. Then take your time. Big space which soaks up the crowds, and makes the place seem serene. Amazing views particularly to the south towards Camp Bay. Our view towards the city was hazy which didn't look great on the photos. The cafe has everything from a quick sandwich, beer, or a full sit down three course meal with wine - the first point in our holiday and the realisation that our English pound goes a long way i.e. cheap! Gets busy but worth the wait. Souvenir shop is tiny. A must do when in Cape Town.Saw many walking up and down. If you've got the time, well worth doing. Proper stone steps on the path. Wouldn't like to do it in the midday heat. Next time...If you can see the table (not the cloth of cloud) from town, go quick. The weather up there changes real fast and might not clear again for days.

Highly recommended - best to-do in Cape town!. We climbed Table mountain using platteklip gorge route and let me tell you that the trek is not easy at all even for fit folks - it is mainly a vertical climb of 1000 meters over many rocks and even young folks who looked very fit were exhausted and stopping fo rest many times. Some times this is not clearly explained on sites talking about hiking to table mountain. We were there on Dec 29th and because it is holiday time, our cab dropped us to the lower taffleberg shuttle stop and took forever to even get there. The shuttle takes you to the cable car station. From this stop, you have to walk 15 minutes to get to the platteklip gorge point to start your trek. It takes easily more than 2 hours unless you are super fit to climb and the climb is not easy. Once you are up there though, it is the most beautiful feeling with best views and the table cloth (clouds on top of the table mountain) and sights that are unparalleled of lions peak, devil peak, the quay, etc. The cafe there is good but please do not order Veg pita and instead go for salads, pizzas, other items. The cable car ride back was also fantastic as it rotates and gets you all the views. If there was only one thing I could do in cape town, I would do this one.

Nature's perfection! . Table Mountain has recently been declared one of the new 7 wonders of nature. Visiting the site proves that title. The views of the city, the seaboard and the other peaks is wonderful. The flora is unusual and mostly indigenous to the Cape region. The cute dassies are indigenous rabit-like mammals present on the mountain. The area is well-maintained, clean, and trails are well planned and demarcated with a designated smoking area on the terrace. There is a vendor selling water as you exit the cable station, and a shop serving light meals and drinks (not halaal). Definitely worth visiting, even with the long cableway queues. Repeat visits will amaze each time.

Enjoy the view from the top!. We noticed after lunch that Table Mountain was clear and the lift working, so we took advantage to ride to the top on the revolving car and enjoy the views and hiking at the top of the mountain. There are extensive trails, so hikers can enjoy may different options. For those who only wish to see the stunning views from the peak, it's worth the trip.

On a beautiful clear day who wouldn't want to traipse over this incredible plateau.. Here you can meet some interesting people from all over the globe. The cable car, and walks make this a must see destination.

One for the bucket list. A must for panoramic views over the city and beyond. A few walks up there but bring sunscreen as there's no shelter. A nice cafe restaurant ad coffee bar. We queued for nearly 2 hrs from 8.30am to go up on cable car but only 30 mins to come down...worth it as it was a clear day.

A must do!. A must do in Cape Town. Magnificent views, although the view from Signal Hill (seeing Table Mountain itself) is nicer. Some tips:- buy tickets online in advance. We had bought tickets and yet had to wait for almost one hour. Those without ticket waited for almost 3 hours!- it can be VERY hot at the top, so come prepared. Don't forget sunscreen.- traffic to get there is really bad, so try to get there early. And leave your car/taxi at the bottom and take the free shuttle to the cable car.

Add this to your bucket list. If you only have time to do one thing when you're in Cape Town, this is it. The view is phenomenal. A few hours was more than adequate to see everything, but I have to admit that I was tired from having climbed Lion's Head beforehand. I might have spent more time if I wasn't wiped.

Amazing. We hiked to the top, but didn't take the common route, next to the cable. We came from the south western side, and climbed up via the 12 Apostles (I think we went up the 6th one…not too sure though). It was a 2hr hike/ climb to the top, and then 1h15 over the Table plateau itself. We started at 7:15am, which was an ideal time (we had quite a fast pace, as the table plateau walk was noted as 2h). The view is amazing, and we were so lucky to have a clear and blue sky. The weather is peculiar when it comes to the Table, because the clouds usually cling to the peak, and sit there for a few days. So if it's sunny, go for it. It can be dangerous if you go when cloudy (the peak of the table is 1100m).If you want to take the cable, get there as early as possible, and get your tickets online because otherwise you're going to queue for at least 2hours. (early is 6-7am). It's a great experience, and I really recommend you hike it, the feeling of satisfaction is great.

Amazing. Quicker to hike up than to wait in a queue for the cable cars in high season. Spectacular view. Amazing experience. Take lots of water. And camera. Start early in the morning as majority of your time you will be in direct sun

A breath taking experience. December being a peak month, longs queues and hours of waiting to eventually get into the cable car are the norm of the day. However, it is worth it the wait. Climbing and descending with the cable car is pretty quick and unlike most cable car usually travelling in horizontal position, carrying fewer people, the Table Mountain Cable Cars can carry 60 ppl and the floor rotates to give you a better areal view of the city.Once on the mountain, there isn't a better experience than this. A 360 degrees view of Cape Town from about 3500 feet above sea was surely a breathtaking experience.It is ideal to plan to spend at least over an hour on the mountain, as there is a lot to see and explore.

Not to be missed.. The scenery and views from the trip were amazing. The walk up to the point is tough but manageable and the view reward is amazing.Unlike our Japanese co - travellers who slept through 80% of the trip , we were amazed and awe struck at the whole trip.
Incredible!. Lions head is a fantastic climb, it has certain challenging areas but its worth it if you can make it!

visit the highest point at the top of Table Mountain. when you reach the top, don't just stay in the café area, but take a walk to the highest point which is marked by a cairn of stones. Try to throw your own stone on the top! Allow at least 90 minutes for this activity, it's a long walk!

Breath taking views in an ecological marvel. This was one of my many visits up table mountain. Just relaxing and enjoying the beauty of nature is therapeutic.There is so much to see and do up table mountain. There is lovely restaurant to unwind with a few drinks. You can get great photos on the top of table mountain. If you love hiking and fit for the challenge , there are some scenic hikes.
Excellent view. Highlight of cape town...this one you should surely not miss as its the highlight of he city, much like the sugar loaf mountain in Rio

Amazing breathtaking views- MUST SEE STOP. I absolutely loved the visit here. They had an adorable cafe, a beautiful tram up with gorgeous views that rotated so everyone could have the best view at some point. I think every hour they also have a tour guide that shows you around. It was great, and I'm glad we stopped. I suggest that you do it the FIRST day you are there (if it is a clear day) since there is no guarantee that other days will be as clear.

Spectacular sunset on a clear evening. This place is a must visit in CapeTown. The ride on cable car is specular. Don't worry of you are pushed to the back as the floor rotates. My advise is pre-buy your tickets from their web site and go there about 2h before sunset and try and leave right after sunset as the cable car lines are long. But if you are social, you will make lots of friends on the wait line ;)

Great Views and one of the 7 natural wonders of the world. Wonderful views from the top and one of those places that you just have to go to if you are in Cape Town. Wear comfortable walking shoes there are a lot of walking paths and some are uneven. I was told to be aware also that the site does not open if the weather is too foggy or windy and the cable cars stop running so you may have to walk down if the weather changes after you have already gotten to the top. However you don't have to use the cable cars if you want to hike there are paths that you can take. Good for all ages. If you want to avoid the ticket lines and you are going to take advantage of the city sightseeing hop on hop off bus then you can buy your ticket from them at the time you purchase your bus ticket. There still may be lines for the cableway though.

Most amazing views you'll ever see!. Make sure to go on a nice warm day, as it can get extremely windy and cold as you near the top of the mountain. Also, its best to go in the morning! We hiked up the long trail and road the cart down. There's also a visitors shop once you reach the top to get warm beverages, food, and souvenirs.
Table Mountain. the mountain is great - you can see for miles and miles - Lionshead is very visible. Wait to get up to the mountain is long even in he morning so go early
Stunning views. Stunning Views and an experience going up in the cable car. Go early as the queues can get quite big.

Amazing and Awesome. Took the aerial cableway to reach top of Table mountain. The view was awesome and taking the walking tours explored the table mountain. There was food, shopping and clean toilets on top of the mountain. It is cold and chilly on the top so do carry warm clothes. We saw many birds, flowers and even dassies-the mountain guinea pigs.

Worth the wait. We visited on a hot day and didn't get there early enough to beat the queues, still it was worth the 90 minute wait for the cable car to take us to the top. The views were stunning and it was a perfect day. It was busy but booking a time slot for the descent was worth doing as we were straight onto a car. Parking was incredibly tough and luckily we had two cars to shuttle our group to the drop off zone. They literally had to park at the bottom and get a taxi back up! Might be worth taking a taxi or the bus?

Outstanding view. The view from the top is outstanding. Remember that up there is cold and windy. The sun is very strong,so be sure to have sunscreen and huts. The day when we visit was clear sunny day,so we had a breathtaking views and able to do grate photos. There is cafeteria and souvenir shops up. Cute animals,called daisies can be spotted going around. Its a must visit place in Cape town. We reach there by Hop-on-and-off bus. The pre-paid tickets for cable car didn't help too much,because we still had to queue. The table car cabin is rotating,giving another chance for 360 degree view. Don't forget your cameras.

A 'MUST' visit in Cape Town, though over rated. Table Mountain is a huge attraction in Cape Town. All tourists will visit this mountain. It is beautiful if you are looking at Table Mountain, and it is also beautiful when you are on the summit, overlooking Cape Town.We took the cable car, and it is a lovely ride up to the summit. As we know why it is called Table Mountain, once you reach the summit, it is like a plateau. So, you quite a lot of walking to do if you want to view 360 degrees of Cape Town. It was a very hot day when we visited in early December and there is no shades or trees , ensure you have your sunglasses and sunblock. We enjoyed this place in Cape Town, though I personally felt Lion's head, Signal hill is a more beautiful, less touristic, and the most beautiful scenery you are enjoy in Cape Town.
Amazing views and long times. Table Mountain is a must-visit. It is stunning and a really unique view of Cape Town. Be prepared for long lines and weather that quickly changes.

Platteklip Gorge Hike a winner -- go early. Table Mountain is the one necessary day trip while in Cape Town. It is madly busy during holiday season so get yourself out of bed and get up there by 8 am -- you beat the heat and the crowds. If you are reasonably fit, hike up Platteklip Gorge and take the cable car down. We hiked up in less than an hour and were back at our rental house by ten for a late breakfast. If that is too much, cable car it up for the amazing views (although Lion's Head offers more compact 360 degree views).

Beautiful views and a nice hike. Definitely worth the visit; however, absolutely buy your ticket offsite at either a local store or online. It will cut your wait time dramatically! Also recommend going in mid-morning after the fog rises for the best view.

Views are amazing. A fantastic place to visit on a clear sunny day. I'd advise going as early in the day as possible (by 9am if possible) to beat the crowds at the top, and long queues at the bottom for the cable car. The views of Cape Town city, down the Cape peninsula and towards False Bay are outstanding!

One of the things you must see in Cape Town. If you're young and strong: start walking (2,5-3 hours)... Otherwise take the 360 degrees turning elevator and go to the top. When the weather is fine you have the best panaroma you will probably ever see.

An amazing world on "first floor!". This is so much more than just another cable car visit to a mountain: the views are great but the thousands of miles of trekking paths in the natural park is truly amazing at the level of fairy tale ambience.
It's a true 7 wonder visit! But get there very early and stay the day trekking to capture it.
Table mountain is a must. Enjoyed trip to Table Mountain.If going there,go early to avoid the queus.Also check weather before going out there as it is sometimes closed due to fog.

Incredible views, beware of the wind/cold!. A must visit, and better booking in advance to avoid endless queues. Worth keeping a close eye on the website as it is regularly updated in terms of when the cable car closures.
Important lesson learnt: it will be COLD up there! Seems obvious, but it's easy to forget when you are chilling around Cape Town in your shorts...
Once in a lifetime experience. We were lucky to get the last sunset trip in December - SPECTACULAR! Not to be missed! make sure to walk around as the view changes at all levels and from all sides....

Breath Taking Views. Table Mountain offers something for every one, either trek up the side of the mountain or get in a rotating cable car. Either way once you get up there you will not be disappointed. We took a walk out to Mclears Beacon, it's about a hours walk, make sure you dose up on suncream, you have a hat and also some water, atleast a 1 litre per person. You will not be disappointed by the views. The restaurant is a little dis oragnised but you can get a good meal in there. There is just about enough seating, becareful of the birds and any baboons that you might come across, they'll pretend they want to be your friend but actually they want your food. Don't be fooled. All in all a great walk and experience. Definitely recommend a visit.
Must do in Cape Town. It's spectacular. The key is to be spontaneous in going when the weather is good - otherwise the views won't be nearly as good.

Hike up Table Tountain. We hiked up the table mountain with Brenhan from Cape Adventure Zone. We hiked up the Platteklip route which is an easier route but don't underestimate the steepness. The route was steep and took about 2 hours but I was carrying a heavy backpack. It was sunny and hot so take water, hat, good shoes, shorts and perhaps a long sleeve shirt as it can be cooler at the top. Definitely this was a fun trip.

What a view on Cape Town!. If you are staying in Cape Town, you cannot not visit the Table Mountain National Park. Views of the town from the top of the Mountain are absolutely breathtaking! If I could, I would have stayed there for hours just staring at the landscape. We went there around 4 pm in order to avoid too many people and to see the sunset. Make sure the day is clear and with no clouds, you won't be disappointed!

Amazing Walk. We walked up the table mountain which took about 1 and 1/2 hours. Was a really nice walk but remember to bring water! Lots of it because it is quite tough. A lot of people forgot to take water. Once at the top the views are incredible. Definitely worth walking up and taking the cable car down if you're up for some exercise.
Hiking and cycling. If you love nature, beautiful views and a true Cape Town experience it is a must visit at all costs! Walking, picknic or cycle there is so much to experience.

Amazing views!. Get there early and buy tickets ahead if you can - the lines were ridiculous! But they move fast and the tramway ride up is a great experience. Nice cars that rotate so you get to see everything. The views from the top are incredible. Well worth spending a few hours walking around seeing the entire cape peninsula.

the place to be - fantastic view. I think every cape town visit needs to go along with the table mountain tour. Just figure out if the top is not cloudy or misty otherwise or too windy otherwise don't go. Preorder the tickets by a concierge as it reduces waiting times. Take advice from locals in the waiting times. What you get is a great view of the cape town and false bay area. You better have hiking shoes and a jumper with you, as you can walk quite a lot and the location can be a little chilly.
Stop of the mountain. Don't go in the mornings on peak holiday times, 2 hour wait. Go after 4 pm no queues going up....after a walk right around the top, about 30mins wait to get down.

Fantastic/book your tickets ahead of time. And your wait time will be much shorter. Decided not to hike up as weather was quite warm. Parked at the lower lot and grabbed the free shuttle to the tramway. Cable car was wonderful; it rotates so that everyone gets views. Once at the top, we set out for Mcclarens beacon, a lovely long walk along the plateau. Views were wonderful the entire way. Had to queue for about 30 minutes going down ( umbrellas for shade might be nice). The cableway operators were lovely as was the entire experience. If you are in Capetown, Table Mountain is a must

far exceeds expectations. People say Capetown is a wonderful city, and they are right. We drove 15 minutes from City Centre, and we are at Cable Car for Table Mountain. Not cheap even by South African standards, 25 ZAR each, but the cable car rotates. as it travels the 3000 feet up to mountain top, fabulous, and great views. At the top we were all impressed by how well the park is laid out and managed. Paths to different areas, views, explanatory notes,many flowers, birds, "badgers" and sunshine (must be cold in winter).

Amazing views - worth the long queues. December is peak time, so expect to wait in queues - but - it's worth it. Unfortunately not all people respect the queues at the cable car and you get a number of people trying to push in - I think the management could do more to manage this better. You can also walk up/down the mountain - took me about 2.5 hours up, and I took the cable car down. Take plenty of water and use sun protection.
Table mountain surprises me every time. It was my second time visiting table mountain, every time the weather conditions allowed me to take beautiful photos. Stay till sunset , maybe even a bit more

Great view. Definitely worth visiting. And also a nice day to spend 'in the country side'. on top of the mountain one can stroll around and enjoy the plants and the view. Its also possible to just sit down on a rock and be.
Flora and Fauna. It was a surreal experience even for a Kenyan like me who has access to a plethora of flora and fauna
One of the new seven wonders of the world. Always magical. A serene experience where you feel like you are on top of the world with the most amazing views over a beautiful city

Amazing on a cloudy day. Part of me wished I were there on a clear day, but the excitement would not have matched the visit on a cloudy day, when the clouds and the mountain formed an intricate relationship, providing so many "Wow" moments...

Table Mountain HAS to be climbed!. I've climbed Table Mountain three times and all three times were different. This is definitely a must for your bucket list, no doubt about it. And it is a must to CLIMB Table Mountain, and not take the easy way and use the cable car.There are quite a few trails to climb Table Mountain. The most well-known route is Plattekloof Gorge, which is basically just a huge amount of huge steps going zig-zag up the mountain, very steep! It is really taxing on your body and you keep wishing it to be over, but when you reach the top, you feel quite proud of yourself for making it. This route is free. It will take you about an hour to reach the top, or a bit more if you're not too fit.The other route I've used is Kasteelspoort trail. It is free, but very long. It's not as steep a climb as Plattekloof, actually, it's quite gradual. It's a great walk if you have the whole day, and you have amazing views over the Twelve Apostles. This is not too taxing on your body, but you have to have some endurance!The other route I've used is Skeleton Gorge. It sounds daunting, but it's not! (No one really knows where it gets its name!) This route starts in Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens (therefore you have to pay the entrance fee) and goes up a steep gorge to the back of Table Mountain. The climb is quite steep, but it is in a forest and therefore you're in the shade the whole time. You also go up next to a small river, and you can drink the clear water, which is great when you're tired! The climb is about 1 hour long, but if you want to get to the cableway station, you still need about 2 to 3 hours to cross the top of the mountain. But definitely worth it!Have a drink at the restaurant to reward yourself!
Hike table mountain. We hiked from the top of the mountain to the bottom. Great experience and would highly recommend hiking up and using the cable car to go down.
Amazing experience. One of the best places I've visited, I'm scared of heights but the cable car journey and being on top of Table Mountain is something that shouldn't be missed.
Bit of a wait. If you have the time and it's a calm and sunny day , yes the views are great. You can eat and drink up there and take lots of photos.
Great views!!!!!. When visiting this place the outstanding views is tops and the best in Cape Town.It is very prone to the weather but if all is clear no other view can beat it.

Beautiful.. YAAAS. It's just amazing!! GO GO GO right now!!! It could be cheaper but every penny is worth it. Very well kept. VERY amazing hot chocolate. And well...it"s just absolutely gorgeous up there. You haven't lived till you see the view.

Be sure to do this!. The cable car ride up is a wonderful experience, but not a patch on the views from the top! Whilst we were up there the clouds started to roll in and it is truly amazing to be standing above the clouds! Book on the day as they close down the cable car if the winds pick up (not sure what the cancellation policy would be for that), but a must do in Cape Town

An international treasure, a natural wonder, it is spectacular. We managed to see so little of the reserve due to time constraints but were nonetheless blown away by the splecracular landscape. My niece who has just completed her BSc in environmental sciences (and has done some research in the Silvermine area post-fires) gave us a mini tour which opened my eyes to more than what you see superficially. It is worth finding a guide or a student who is knowledgeable in your field of interest to have a really three-dimensional experience.

Visited Twice. One of my activities was cancelled due to weather so I went twice. Great time spending the afternoon on Table Mountain, used the cable cars to go up both times and hiked down once. Breathtaking views and lots to see walking around up top.
Amazing View!!!. Due to sudden change in weather had to visit twice. Worth It!!! Best time to go in noon and stay for sunset. Its beautiful!!!
Spectacular views all around. Easy to get up if tickets reserved. Spectacular view all around but very very windy! Must see while in Cape town!
Loved it. You cannot beat the views from Table Mountain. Just go on a sunny not foggy day otherwise it is not worth it.

Hiking up Tablemountain. When going up Table Mountain I'd advise to go hiking. When I went there my friends and I hiked up there and used the gondola to come back down.The view you get from up there is amazing! Although it can get all of a sudden cold once you're up the mountain due to fog,it is an awesome hike!

View fantastic but disappointing dining/drinking facilities at the top!. We expected a nice restaurant, not self service with long queues. Amazing that there is nothing better in place with all the tourists that visit all year round. The cable car trip up and the view was spectacular and worth doing but I wouldn't do it again!
Nice place. We enjoyed our trip to Cape of Good Hope. 125 rand entry per adult. The visitor centre was interesting and toilets are clean

Fabulous!. As other reviewers have said, the cable car ride is excellent as the floor rotates so you get an all - round view on the way up. We had bought our tickets in advance, so had no queue. It was an extremely hot day and we were lucky to have a clear view & wow, what a view!If you're in Cape Town, it's a must do!

Amazing view and tough walk!. Climbing up is a nice experience. It's quite safe, although it can be tough. We (around 30's, in good shape) got on top in 1:15h. It is so impressive to be up on the table mountain!! Wear running shoes or sneakers and comfortable clothes.

Cable car to top of mountain. We made an afternoon visit to the top of Table Mountain by cable car.
The wait on way up was about 30 minutes and about 1 hour on the way down.
The views are magnificent and well worth the wait. The staff were all friendly and tried there best to handle the crowds of people.

Absolutely beautiful. Went to Table Mountain at the end of November and was blown away by the beauty of the 360 degree view. Line for the cable car was not bad and the top of the mountain was so large, it didn't feel overly crowded. Parking is sparse - park on the side of the winding road that leads to the mountain and walk to the entrance. Definitely worth the time.
Lovely Views, Amazing Experience. I completely recommend visiting Table Mountain while in Cape Town. The views over the blue ocean and Cape Town are to die for.

STUNNING. I am afraid of heights, BUT I am SO glad I took the cable car to the top. The floor of the cable car rotates as the cable car goes up the mountain (I just left my camera rolling and turned my head the other way!). The views of the city below, and of mountains and clouds all around, were absolutely stunning. We went on the sunset tour, and we were able to get a bottle of wine and watch the sun set. Truly magical. Must do.

Killer hikes. Recommend getting off the front side and check out some of the hiking trails on the backside. Mostly shaded in the early morning and very few people. Serene. Check out Porcupine ridge on the 12 apostles. Some scrambling so you may want to hire a guide to find the handholds and get some good info on the flora and fauna. AWESOME

Walk up or take the cableway?. You have to be in good physical shape to walk up the Platteklip Gorge - it's like climbing stairs (with steps of 50cm height) for over an hour! But it's worthwhile! And consider that - when it's very windy - you'll have to walk down again!

Absolutely breathtaking. Words fail to express the beauty of the mountain, the beautiful views of Cape Town from up the mountain. The whole experience was just wonderful and I felt truly blessed. I used the Red Bus to get up the mountain and as usual the commentary was on point and very interesting. The cable car ride went smoothly without a hitch. It was an awesome experience

The long wait was worth it. We were lucky regarding the weather - a brilliant, blue sky day with a perfect view. The ideal day for a visit is when no strong winds are blowing and no clouds, " the tablecloth" is hiding the mountain. The day before we went, the cable car got closed down so our Sunday visit involved long waiting times, even though we already had tickets. One hour wait to go up, one hour wait to go down - but the view from the top was certainly worth it.

A must-vist place. take a cable car to top or hike to the top of table mountain. take you best camera with, prepare your best mode when you on top of the mountain. you will see the most beautiful city called Cape Town.
Breathtaking. fabulous nature-wildlife experience: awesome views, lovely encounter with flora and fauna! we did the 3-h hike instead of the cable car...hard but amazing (avoid it on hot days)...

Must do whilst in Cape Town. After a few days of the cable car being shut (due to high winds) we got to the cable car station early (830) to join the queue. It took about 30 mins to get into the cable car and take the interesting 5 min journey up the side of the mountain. The cable car turns around on its journey so everyone gets a good view. We would recommend you buy tickets beforehand as it saves time queuing. Great walks and views from the top over Cape Town, Camps Bay and the surrounding area. Facilities including a cafe and toilets at the top as well. Must do.
Beautiful. Beautiful view from the top and amazing hike up experiencing its indigenous flora and fauna! Amazing experience!
Great views. Incredible views, will definitely be one to do again during sunset. Wildlife is gorgeous, and tours are provided every hour for free. This is very informative and staff are great.

Beautiful views, but a bit of a zoo. While it is crowded with tourists on a nice day, the good news is it's possible to walk to more remote areas of Table Mountain to get away from the noise. If I recall correctly, the quieter area (and much bigger area) is called "Western Table" ... you have to cross a minor dip near the gorge, and then there's a path going all the way around with great views. It's amazing when you get away from the crowds and can't hear anyone else talking!
Beatiful mountain. We went hiking up the mountain an early morning, and it was great! They are so many more routes to take than just the main one. Amazing view, and a nice coffe on top.

An Amazing Experience. Table Mountain is an amazing experience. During my week long stay, I could manage to visit it twice.Getting There: Very Easy, cabs all around the sity take you the the Cableway station. It will be a 100-150 RAND ride. Return cabs are easily available as they keep dropping people.Going Up the Mountain: Cableway tickets can be bought online (very easy) or from a queue. Cost 240R per head and the rate is halved if you go after 6 PM (check the timing for your season, its no always applicable). Timing and Up there on the Mountain: Its worthwhile to take the evening ticket as the best views are Sun Set views, however if you want to trek around, better go early (budget 2-3 hours minimum)Facilities on top: Restaurant, Souvenir Shop and Rest Rooms. All clean and very nice.And the great bonus - super photo views. Carry enough data cards/battery backups. Wear appropriate footwear as the trek terrain is wobbly. And it can get chilly in the evening so appropriate gear is advised. Enjoy TM.

Amazing Views. Table Mountain is an absolutely amazing place to visit. The sights are fantastic from altitude and makes for quite a romantic get-away from busy Cape Town. We went around sunset, but we imagine that other times of the day would be equally great.

A MUST-DO while visiting Cape Town. One MUST experience Table Mountain starting with the fabulous cable car ride to the top -- "step back from the sides because the floor rotates." This gives everyone the chance to take photos at the open windows and get a panorama view. Read the back of the bathroom stalls about how the park gets water and remove refuse water from the top of the mountain. Quite interesting.

A must see in cape town. No doubt this is one of the seven modern wonders of the world, a must see for ever visitor to Cape Town. Go as soon as you arrive as the top is covered in clouds many days a year.
Fantastic view. If you are in cape town you should not miss out the table mountain np. You have a perfect view on the city - if there are no clouds. Take a jacket it can be a bit chilli up there.
Tiptop attraction.. Not to be missed. Superb views from the top. Fun cable car ride to the top. Free guided tours of area. Good cafeteria and gift shop.

Breath-taking experience. The best experience of my life so far. Words cannot even begin to put together the feeling(s) one gets from being on top of the Table Mountain. Simply inspiring. I'll go there over and over again

Iconic. Table Mountain offers dozens of awesome hikes. There are many ways to get onto the mountain, some a lot more dangerous than other. If you are a novice walker, take the cable car - there are nice walks on the mountain with the best views in the world on top. If you have a little experience, walk up Platteklip Gorge left of the Cable Car and the take the Cable Car down. There is a nice Restaurant on the top. Remember good shoes, water and a jacket. Temperatures can be 20 deg C lower on the top.If you are a good hiker, get a professional guide, or walk with a club. There are mind blowing hikes with awesome scrambles on this mountain.

An absolute wonder. We hiked up Table Mountain following the Platteklip Gorge path, which is arguably the most direct route up to the top and were treated to incredible views. The path is steep and exposed to sun so make sure to take a lot of water and sunscreen but it's really worth the effort. The average time to complete the path is about 2hrs 30', depending on your fitness, but it can easily be done in 1h 30'.

"Must See Attraction". Table Mountain National Park deserves a not-to-be missed tour when you visit Cape Town, South Africa.The views of the South African coast are breathtaking.I was very fortunate to have perfect weather when I reached the top of Table Mountain, Now, there are several ways to get there: if you are on an escorted tour, your time on the top is controlled to meet their schedule. You can take the city tour and be dropped off at the entrance and you can stay on top as long as you want; then hop on the next city bus to continue your visiting. Some of my friends opted to take a taxi directly from the hotel. I believed it costed 200 Rands each way. If you are energetic, you can climb to the top, which will take anywhere from 1 to 4 hours depending on the trail you select and your physical fitness. Make sure you buy a ticket to get back down the mountain. There are several ways to get a ticket for the Table Mountain Cableway .I recommend buying your ticket online because you get a better exchange rate in the US. Next the hotel concierge will help you to get a ticket the day before you want to go. Please check the weather forecast before you buy. If it is windy, it is too dangerous to be hanging in a cable car that rotates 360 degrees. I don't recommend standing inline at the cableway ticket office. If you are going to Robben Island, buy your ticket online.

Great view from the top. Just a short 5 minutes ride up with the cable car. Great view from the top if the "table cloth" is not obscuring the view. There are 3 or 4 marked trails that you can walk on to explore (ranging from 15-45 minutes).Restaurant, gift shop and bathroom facilities are decent...

An Amazing Experience. We decided to hire a guide to take us up Table Mountain which was in the end the perfect thing to do. He took us on this relatively hard trail (India Venster) but had the best views of Robben Island, Lions Head and the flora was out of this world. I advise to only go up when the weather is good and if your willing to climb some ladders and walk along cliff edges.

What a view. Thankfully we had a clear day to go up the cable cars. This is a pure must if you've never been there. The view is unbelievable! A bit scary as the cable car rotates 360 degrees while going up and down. But it's WOW! We went in before sunset, enjoyed sunset from the top looking down onto the ocean and city of Cape Town as the lights turned on. Had a quick coffee in the restaurant which was fast and efficient. At then you can collect and pay R200 for pictures that they took of you at the start, but superimposed onto views from the cable cars and mountain top. We bought it! Parking could be problem. We walked quite a distance. Wear comfortable shoes!

Must visit location ! stunning view. Its amazing location.. Stunning View ..You must take the cable car as early as possible to avoid long queue, watch the weather : if its cloudy,choose another day. Early morning gives you the best chance to enjoy the location. If the weather is really bad or poor, the cable car does not operate so it would always better to check weather condition before visiting
Fantastic Views of Cape Town!. We are so happy we decided to take the cablecar to the top - a world class view around all of Cape Town. Definitely worth the trip!
Table Mountain. What a view, especially on a clear day, you can see for miles. I went years ago, but now I don't think it's as safe as it use to be.

Tabletop do's. It was a great weather .... Breezy windy lil sunny...just perfect holiday weather...remeber if u are travelling late noon put up sunscreen wear hat..nd wear shoes...try to by 9ish as its less busy and great weather...click loads of pictures
On the way down u see all the hills table mountain lions head hill signal hill devils hill..!
Its worth going

A Must Do for a Cape Town Visit. We were told by friends that Table Mountain is a must visit. They were absolutely correct! We took the cable car (the easy way up). Not too much of a wait and a great ride up. You can hike up but be prepared for a climb. I was very concerned because I have a fear of heights but tolerated the ride well. Once on top the views are spectacular. The top is large with hiking trails so you can spend a lot of time there. Just make sure you watch the weather before going. The site is shut down often because of winds and clouds. There is a small restaurant and gift shop on top. If you are in Cape Town just do it!

What A Wonder. You'd be shocked at the amazing views of Capetown when you at the top. God must enjoy these views best. I would wanna go back and thats a lot coming from a man who loses interest after a first

HAPPY BIRTHDAY TO ME ON TOP OF GLORIOUS TABLE MOUNTAIN!. I've been told by many that the cable car ride up to the top of Table Mountain is one of the most amazing views...now I agree! Go to the TOP of Table Mountain! The view is spectacular! I was also warned to bring long pants and a jacket due to the altitude & wind, well I must have ordered it special for my birthday but it was STILL as could be and about 79-80 degrees...PERFECT WEATHER CONDITIONS! By the way they have the MOST amazing coffee & ice cream in South Africa, it must mean that the cows are happy to live there too! But I had the most delicious cup of coffee with cream & brown sugar and just watched another unforgettable sunset...Do this, even if you're a little afraid of heights, it isn't bad and once you're up at the top of the mountain, not bad at all. It's SO worth it! 'Top of the World Ma!'
Must do!. This was one of the highlights of my time in Cape Town! The view from the top is spectacular! Photos don't do it justice!
Back to Nature!. So unusual to have a Park of this size in the middle of the city. Has the most incredible vegetation only found here. Excellent walks/hiking of all levels.
A must see. You did not visit Capetown not seeing it from the mountainTake care to do it at the right time because if it is cloudy you see anythin

spectacular. the views are spectacular. we were nervous because we saw a ton of cars parked thinking this was a huge line waiting for the cable car. we were wrong. but your tickets on-line and go right to the front! The line was all waiting to buy tickets. no need to print then either. simply download to your smart phone and you're good to go!keep an eye on the cloud cover before you go. if the peaks are in the clouds, wait. as soon as you see a large, clear sky..... hurry!you'll love the views!
Top of the end of the world. Beautiful views of the two oceans and the city. The weather is VERY changeable, though--take a warm coat or sweater no matter what the temperature below.
South African roadtrip . Stunning with great views and well worked hikes across the park. Park anywhere and wonder. The bird watching is really good.

Breath taking experiece. The place to visit and not to be missed.Go there early.
Astonishing view and service very professional and safe.
Raymond & Nadine from Mauritius

Amazing views. Catch the cable car as early as possible, because the queues build up. In addition check the local forecasts, because low cloud often sits on the mountain spoiling the occasion, so if there is any chance of cloud, don't go.
Great. Loved the view and the animals that were around. Nice restaurant and great souvenir shop. Take a tour if you don't want to hike.
Excellent!. The weather and visibility was great when we went there! It was so amazing to be on top of the mountain. It was so windy and the mountain was so amazing!
The View!. Must place to visit - great view of city and surrounding high landscapes - clouds - short walking trail but very windy!

Beautiful spot overlooking Cape Town and vicinity. We had a great time visiting Table Mountain. We took the tram up the hill and then walked around the site. Most enjoyable. The day was lovely and our views were clear.

Great day out. This was a great day out, shame about the wait for the cable car (1.5 hours in our case) but still worth it. I was very worried as I have a fear of heights but it was not too bad at all. No good trying to look away tough as the cable car turns a full 360 degrees on the journey. Once up there the views are fantastic we were lucky it was very clear and we could easily see right down to the Cape. There is a restaurant but like most our motorway eateries the food was cold by the time you have queued and paid for it. The beer is good though.

A must visit to all who live and visit Cape Town. You might have to queue a while to catch the cablecar up to the top, but the waiting is worth it. The views are spectacular and you can see the whole of Cape Town. If you are lucky you might even see the local animals that live on Table Mountain, the Dassies. Remember to wear comfortable shoes, take sunscreen and water. Enjoy!

the most famous place in South Africa. the most famous place in South Africa, must to visit! You need to be patient ... a lot of people like to do so, many times are the tail in order to go up on, but the view end the panorama will revard YOU!

Worth the trip. The first time we tried to take the cable car up it was closed due to low cloud over the mountain. The next day we took the cable car and it was a wonderful experience and great views when you get up there. Bit of advice - book the cable car in advance online and arrive early, before 9 if possible. It's worth getting up early to beat the queues.

Amazing views. Didn't hike, took the easy route, cable car, why not, you're on vacation after all! The views are fantastic definitely a must-do whilst in Cape Town! Have a glass of table wine and relax before your savage decent on the cable car... x

amaaaaaazing view. Please go to the Table Mountain when in Cape Town. It has the most amazing view and the flora and fauna on the mountain are really diverse. Can be very warm up there.Please take the cable cart up and walk down if you're adventurous. For us, it was one of the nicest experiences in South-Africa.

Must see when in Cape Town. You wil have to queue to get your cable car ticket but it moves fairly quickly, but when you get up there it is well worth the wait.... Amazing views of the Cape town coast. As the opening depends daily on the weather, & can close within an hour of a cloud coming down over the mountain,don't leave this too late on your list of things to do. Also get there early as it gets busy. There is a cafe & gift shop on top of the mountain so you will be able to get refreshments, go to toilet & get a few souvenirs...

"An enormous wall reaching into the clouds". Like Charles Darwin once said, Table Mountain is "an enormous wall, which reaches into the clouds, and makes a most imposing barrier".
