It is THE most popular sight of Cape Town, creating a quite dramatic, yet beautiful natural setting, together with the clouds forming the so-called "table cloth". On top of the Table Mountain visitors may enjoy stunning views of Lion's Head, Signal Hill, Robben Island and Waterfront on a clear, sunny day.
Awesome, literally.. If you enjoy photography and nature, expect to spend at least half a day here, it is a wonderland of flora and vistas.

A night on the mountain at the Overseer's cottage.... Check out the arrangements whereby you get to spend a night on the mountain in a cottage. There's only 1 and it can sleep 16 so it's a great place for a big group.Your luggage and food (you take your own food and drink and cook it yourself) is collected down below and taken up for you. It's then up to you to schlep it up to the cottage...around 2ish hours. Once there you can enjoy the views and have a great braai. The rooms are clean and tidy and bed linen is provided. I guess it is a bit spartan but that's it's charm.If you're a visitor to Cape Town check this out. We live there and hadn't been there before but we're already planning a return trip.

on top of CapeTown. I would really really recommend to hike up. There are serveral routes available and along the ways up are themost amazing views.On the way down take the 360 degree cable car and you'll have the full view from the top of Table Mountain down.

Beautiful Mountain - well deserving to be one of the wonders of the world. Yes, i voted this as one of the wonders of the World. A must go during the day and you will see interesting plants and creatures there.Beautiful view from the mountain too..

Amazing. First visit to Table Mountain and it was far more beautiful than I could have imagined. The cable car was fun with a driver with a sense of humour. I can't imagine anybody going to Cape Town and not coming here. Toilets was clean and the weather was perfect.

Table mountain. There are a couple of hikes to try! One of my favourites is a hike from Cecelia forest near Constantia. Awesome views as well as streams with a couple of dams at the top. A nice day hike!
Wow Breath Taking. Table Mountain is a must do! So full of amazing flora, birds, rocks capes and breath taking views. Take yoiur time here to explore it.

So worth it!. Whether you make the effort to hike up (like we did) or take the cable car, Table Mountain is a must see attraction in Cape Town. There is a great cafe up the top with both indoor and outdoor seating (food was decent, beer and cider was a nice touch!) plus a souvenir shop. Make sure you check the weather in advance as you obviously want a clear day to visit to take in the views.

Wow! If you want to enjoy, trek. I was lucky to have a great day when I trekked up. The views were amazing from all direction with cloud coming in and creating a carpet on top of this and also on signal hill. Beautiful place to enjoy and get away from the madding crowd.

Views to die for. If the weather permits, take the cable car up the mountain, then take the circular walk across the mountain top. Fantastic views of Cape Town and its hinterland. Finish off with a snack at the Café then go back down by cable car, on foot (steep & rocky trails or by abseil (but then you have to walk back up again to return the gear!

Table Mountain National Park. The Table Mountain National Park is a conserved open area atop the Table Mountain, accessible by cable ropeway. The place can be extremely windy and quite chilly even during summer. However, the views are breathtaking, of the city, of the bay on the Atlantic and the flora and fauna.

Awesome serene . South Africans have a world wonder to be proud of and we are blessed with many amazing nature gems. Table mountain being one of those gems that places anyone in awe and brings a fondness in the heart for 'mothercity' .We need to expose our citizens and inspire people to experience the wonder of the our gems.Well done CT your tourism efforts are noted and appreciated.

Just go up and enjoy the views. It is a must go when visiting Capetown. The cable way up or you can walk up ( it will take some time) and enjoy the beautifull nature and the nice views of Capetown. It can be chilli up there so take an extra coat with you.
Good view of the city and sea. A nice place to visit, but frankly not worth too much time. The cable car ride is fun. Take a coat in winter because the weather can change quickly.
Awesome. You can hike it, or ride up on the cable car but this popular spot is best if you can get there early (at opening), the lines after that can be daunting!

Don't miss it!. We climbed up the mountain on a really sunny day- we were lucky to see such a great view. though is was too hot to start climbing at 11 in the morning (it was really hot). we took the cable car all the way down but the climbing was the best experience! just come by earlier in the spring/ summer because the sun is really warm and it makes the climbing harder.

Great park and fun ride to get there!. We were lucky to have a beautiful day when we visited Table mountain. The park has incredible views, nice hiking trails and interesting plants. And the trip up in the rotating tram is fun! This is a must do when in Cape Town
Stunning Views!!. Try to go at sunset. The view of Cape Town is stunning! There's a great cafe at the top where you can get snacks and a bottle of wine or beer. Sit back, relax and enjoy the view.

Wonderful. Magic and not to be missed - the scenery will take your breath away. You truly experience the size of Cape Town and its beauty. Table Mountain has its own micro climate and birds and animals

Great hike and what amazing views. We did the fairly strenuous hike up (about 2 hours from the lower cable station with minimal stops). Amazing views along the way and the summit was amazing. Go early in the morning -- plan to be at the Lower Cable Car station by 7am to avoid crowds and get the best weather.

Make Table Mountain a priority to visit when in Cape Town. As you may know, getting to the top of Table Mountain is not always possible. The cable car is often closed down due to high winds. As a result you need to check the Table Mountain website frequently to see when you can get up to the top. I was lucky and was able to visit the site and was overwhelmed by the amazing views from the top of the mountain. There are also some interesting wild life creatures that roam about and beautiful flowers and plants to discover. It can be very windy up top so bring a jacket and hang onto your hat and eye glasses - many people have lost both!
Amazing view. That is a great workout! The hike was beautiful! I would recommend sport shoes or hiking boots ! the usual is fantastic !

Untouched nature. I visited the place in December. First you are impressed by the gorgeous view - all the city at your feet. then walk around - and you can see the untouched nature with the over 1500 plant species living and blossoming here. Unfortunately the mountain rats were hiding... I missed them a lot.
A must see when you're in Capetown.. A must see but go 1/2 hour before the first trip up in the morning to avoid 2 hour waits in line. The views are spectacular.
Wonderful! A must visit!. Fantastic! Remember to wear good shoes since there are several paths up there that you can walk and you need good shoes. Not flip flops!

Stunning wonder of mother nature - but come prepared. Easiest way up is with the cable car. If you want to hike, come prepared with hiking gear/shoes, lots of drinking water, sun screen and a light wind/rain jacket. Apparently, there are also a few muggings during peak seasons.Also bring a light wind/rain jacket for the top - no matter how the weather might look/be - weather can change in the blink of an eye here and can be hazardous. Otherwise, enjoy the great views and nature (especially close to sunsets)...
A must do. Reserve a ticket in advance.. We had a very sunny day which made it perfect. You have some wait time. So next time we would definitely buy a ticket online.

Strong winds, excellent view. I visited Capetown in winter (southern hemisphere), along with my family. It was quite windy early in the morning, but we were lucky to get in the ropeway and arrive at the top. The view is spectacular, and it has so much history. Strong winds continued for the next two days and the place remained closed.
One of the coolest places on Earth. Overlooking Cape Town, the Table Mountain National Park is a must for anyone visiting this city in South Africa.

Mesmerizing. The views are breath taking, the free guide tour, great info, do the tour and Tip your guide! Wear sunblock and a hat, bring a longsleeve just in case. They have a tweet account, let you know if the gondolas are running, it can get very windy up there. The Cantine has alright breakfast food. I regret not hiking some of hte paths but i could not acclimatize fast enough.

Just awesome. What can you say just a truly magnificent place. We were on a tight schedule due to catching a plane that afternoon. This has been on my bucket list since I was a kid a.d boy is it worth it. It was a bit busy if I was going again I would have chosen a quieter time. Had lunch outside Ostrich curry which was great apart from the birds that kept flying onto our plate to eat our food. It was chilly up there so a jacket or jersey is required and that comes from a Scotsman! Give yourselves plenty of time up there to enjoy the many walks. Great views. Downside was the aggressive sales people in the shop right in your face very intimidating so much so we did not browse but just got the hell out spoilt things a bit.
amazing. i liked the cable car. i wish they had some dedicated staff or guides to provide some explanation about the different places/view oon Table Mountain

Magnificant view. The view from the park is magnificent. While at the top of Table Mountain, a heavy bank of clouds rolled in and the view changed from unbelievable to nothing in a matter of minutes. It was a great experience.

Stunning views. This is a must to get the full 360 degree views. The paths at the top are well laid out and well marked however the cloud can quickly descend without warning so take a warm fleece whatever the weather when you start you ascent! Walking through mist and cloud is a very disorientating and surreal experience ! This should be on everyone's to do list if visiting Cape Town

A view from the top.. We went up the mountain on a lovely day, the wind, that can be howling at times, was a gentle, refreshing breeze. The views over Table bay and Cape Town was brilliant, the Camps Bay side were shielded by some clouds/ mist. There are demarcated walkways that can be used to either explore quickly or for longer walks. A few wild flowers and some lizards and hyrax (dassies) were on show as well. Table mountain is also one of the new seven wonders of the world.
Worth the queue. Must be one of the best views in the world. The walk to MacLear's Beacon is worth the effort if it is a clear day.

Do it on a clear day!. The cable car is an experience in itself as it rotates to give everyone a view. The 360 degree panorama from the top is dramatic. The vegetation up there is unusual, including wild lilies. Look out for the hyraxes (dassies)There are a number of signposted walks on the top.

Our beautiful new 7th Wonder of Nature.... I live in the City at the base of Table Mountain and don't often go up the mountain, I am truly astounded by its beauty everytime I do. Free guided plateau walks available or walk/stroll alone on the various well marked routes. The fauna & flora on the mountain is currently spectacular. .... Pics taken between 18h30 & 19h30 yesterday evening.

Beautiful, beautiful ! - one of the "must do's" in Cape Town. Certainly one of the things visitors to Cape Town must do.- watch the weather : cloudy means visibility poor (and that's a large part of why you go there)- watch the weather : the "table cloth" of cloud pouring over the mountain top means wind, so choose another day. Early morning gives you the best chance to beat the wind. Ask a local, they know the weather. Equally, if the weather is really bad, the cable car does not operate.- take a sun hat, sun screen and a warm top (just in case). All can be purchased at the top but the prices are a bit steep.- You can buy tickets on-line so as to cut down on queuing. Queuing up there is not too bad as the cable car runs quickly.- parking can be a challenge, so be prepared for a short walk.- if you only want a gentle stroll at the top, it is well laid out and even wheel-chair friendly. for a more challenging outing, Take your walking shoes and water, and strike out on one of the longer paths.- food and drink can be purchased at the top. The restaurant is well stocked.- be mindful of opening and closing times. You do not want to be stranded up there.- a night trip is special- ZAR 240 return or ZAR 100 for pensioners on a Friday ( as at 04 Dec 2015)- cameras and binoculars of course ! - the views are spectacularThis is only referring to the Table Mountain portion of the Park - there is lots more for the nature-hungry.I'm a Cape Townian and am certainly biased, but whatever........

Spectacular hike up into the "tablecloth" clouds!. What a great way to spend our first day in Cape Town. We hired a guide for our 5 hour hike. Highly recommend getting a guide, as there are accidents and deaths every year on this mountain. The trails aren't as well marked as they are in in US National Parks, and it would have been quite easy to get lost at the summit. The flatness and the vegetation at the summit adds to the confusion. The fog and the wind doesn't help either, in that regard. Get a great guide, wear layers and enjoy!

Well worth a visit . A wonderful iconic visit. Slight 'tablecloth' present which was interesting - great to experience the phenomena in action. The views were amazing. This is a 'must do' experience if visiting CapeTown. Remember to choose a clear, less windy day. The cable car element was quick, efficient and I liked the rotation of the cab to give everyone the all round views. We visited at 1pm on a Wednesday and there were no queues. The taxi from town was reasonable. The hop on hop off bus includes this attraction. The cost of the bus is 180 Rand per person for the day.

Highlight of Cape Town. Whether you hike or take the ride up, this is a MUST for all foreign visitors... Active locals will agree that nothing beats a cold beer when you reach the top! Service is quick and friendly... Prices are completely reasonable!
Amazing views!. We took the tram both ways as we needed to be mindful of our time. We had the most perfect weather. Not windy at all. Worth the trip to the top!
Extraordinary experience , almost 360 view of capetown. 1# place you should visit ! We went on a really nice sunny day , it was amazing , def recommend it to anyone !

Must do. When you're in Cape Town, you will see Table Mountain from pretty much anywhere and want to go to the top. The views are fabulous, even if the clouds are rolling in. The experience is well worth it. The red, hop on-hop off tourist bus takes you directly to the cable car for the journey up which makes for a very easy visit. There is a restaurant at the top and a gift shop, of course. The cable car runs continuously so there is no real time constraint when you are looking to fit in a visit.

Absolutely Beautiful trek and views. Started at Platteklip Gorge and trekked to the top. Quite a challenge but the reward of the views was well worth it!! Got the cable car down after. Would wholly recommend doing the trek, if not fit enough just take the cable car but this is a must!!
Stunning views. A definite must to do. I caught the red bus up to the chair lift, and had heaps of time to look around.

Top views. A must visit if you are in Cape Town, with amazing views over the city. It's easily accessible by the tourist bus which stops at the cable car station or by taxi from the city. Keep an eye on the weather as the sun doesn't always shine and when it does the winds can pick up closing the cable car, so if the weather is good go for it and find something else to do when the clouds descend. I would also recommend getting your cable car tickets at the tourist bus stops (either by the V & A or on Long Street) as this will stop you having to cue up twice (once to by the tickets, once to ride the cable car) you'll still have to do it once though!Once at the top there are a number of self guided routes that will take you around the top from a short 10 mins to about an hour long route. There is also a restaurant and reasonably priced bar at the top to enjoy a beer while taking in the views.
Beautiful Landmark. Stunning views from the top, and great service . This is a definite must for all travelers to Cape Town.

Amazing views from in the clouds!. Absolutely gorgeous views of Cape Town from up here. Once you're up top there are some nice plants and even some furry creatures! There's a cafe where a cloud literally swept over us, it was awesome! A bit crowded, but an amazing experience. You have nearly 360 views... just have to walk around a bit. One of the best views I've seen anywhere in the world.

Must see. The walk up Platteklip Gorge to the top to Table Mountain is well-marked and well-maintained. Tiring, but not technically difficult. It is listed as 2.5h, but if you are in a reasonable state of fitness, you could manage it in 60 to 80 min. Gorgeous views across the city. Start your climb in the early morning (7 or 8 a.m.) because by the afternoon, the clouds descend and your view is obscured.

A must visit in Cape Town. Great views, awesome hike up the gorge... a real must do attraction when in Cape Town. Make sure you take some water with you on the hike, and go early so you can find parking. Then you can either hike back down or take the cable car!

Breath Taking View. If you are in Cape and the weather permits, please visit Table Mountain. Ensure you reach there early in the day as the queue can be long. If you love hiking, this places offers the same.
Heaven on earth. Excellent view with some fresh air.The ropeway entry is well maintained.The cafeteria is awesome.Please spend some time enjoying the 4 side view of this lovely location

Spectacular National Park. This mountain is gorgeous, and there is so much to explore. I went up the cable car route- Platteklip Gorge which is super steep. I climb 100 flights of stairs on a biweekly basis, and this had me taking frequent breaks. However, it was super hot that day. So probably less strenuous in fall/spring/winter weather. Took the Cable car down. I also hiked up from the other side through Kirstenbosch and up skeleton gorge. That hike is shorter, but harder to follow as you are scaling a waterfall. If I had to pick one I would go up Skeleton Gorge again, but this is a MUST do for any hiker in Cape Town!

Took the cable car and did a Free 30-min guided tour. We took the cable car (purchase your tickets online to avoid extra wait time!) We went on a Monday and the wait for the cable car was still about 30+ minutes, but it was bearable. We arrived on time for one of the free 30-minute guided tours that happen on the hour, departing from the Twelve Apostles Terrace (below the Café). It was a nice EASY tour with some history of how the mountain was created, some flora and fauna information, and other geography of the area. Great views of the cape!!
Nice Drive. Its a beautiful drive. Enjoy the views as it just beautiful. Don't miss the ever lasting White flowers on the way. you will see loads of them.

This is a must see while in Cape Town. If the top of the mountain is clear, this place will be quite busy so be sure to go early. The views from the top are breath taking. You can see in all directions. If you are adventurous, you can hike on one of the many trails on the mountain. There is food and drink at the top too.

best view. never seen so nice view, maybe in Rio :o The city is close, but far.... big scenery ocean and coasts. I ws there summer time, but i forgot more clothes. Very windy and quiet cold. But must see!
Must Visit.... Must Visit, spend 2-3 hours , wear good shoes & walk around and after wards have a coffee & something to eat at their café..
Worth it. We almost didn't take the time to visit Table Mountain. That would have been a mistake. It's like being on the top of the world with the clouds rolling in sometimes. Not to be missed.

View Cape Town from above the clouds. Table Mountain is a must see. No words can describe the beauty and splendor. You don't have to be a nature buff to appreciate this experience. It gets cold and windy up there so bring a jacket if you are prone to getting cold! Buy your tickets online or through your hotel if possible. If you wait to buy your ticket on site, then you will have to wait on a long line because they gave entrance priority to folks that pre-ordered their tickets vs. people that buy their tickets at the park.

A must see when in Cape Town!. This is a super trip. Take your smart phone, and wait to see how long the lines are (for pre-purchased tickets or buying on site) - you could have a shorter line in either, depending on the day. We arrived, looked at the lines, then bought tickets online, went straight into the online ticket line and avoided a long wait. Tip for the "parking attendants" was 5 rand when we were there. We drove past the lower tram station and found parking much closer than what was available below it...

Best picnic place for sunset!. Pack the wine and cheese and make your way tot he top for sunset, especially on a Friday or Saturday eve when the locals are out. NIce people, 360 degree views, easy to get to and from. A must for any visit to Capetown and I would do it at the very beginning of any trip to Capetown nstead of at the end.

A very beautiful view. You can pre purchase the tickets for the cable car. You get a 360 degree view from the cable car. Once you reach the top, the view is brilliant. specially on a clear sunny day. The hot sun and the cold breeze makes the view even more beautiful.

Breathtaking. Certainly the prettiest place I've visited so far in my life! You can't miss Table Mountain from almost any part of central Cape Town, driving around the city or taking a hike. The drive around the whole Table Mountain including the hike to the Cape of Good Hope & lighthouse, and the cable car up to the top of Table Mountain was breathtaking. It may be a touristy thing to do - but it should definitely still be on your checklist if you visit this lovely place.
Amazing view. Hiked up Table Mountain and went down with the cable car. If you are going to Cape Town, I would recommend to do this!

Bit of a workout, but worth it.. I found someone in my hostel to tackle this with as the hostel advised not to do it alone - good advice. Although we didn't come across any thieves, it made me feel safer with the physical climb up the mountain. TAKE WATER!
what a view. Cape town is a gorgeous city, the view given from the top of table mountain is like no other. highly recommend the visit and the cable cart ride.
Pick your day. During 10 days in Cape Town due to winds there were only a couple of days when chairlift was operating. Go when weather is good, in case you miss out.

Great view. I hiked from my hostel to the table mountain 2 and half hours and the view on top it's specutalur if you are in Cape Town you must visit this attraction and you will take great picturs from there ,if you going to hiking take some water with you or if you don't you can take a taxi or public bus to cable car station then you can take to on top with cable car so after 6 pm cable car is half price when you get on top you can walking it's it's almost 1 mile on top you can walking on top of table mountain don't worry there is a cafe ,shop on top of table mountain,if you stay in Cape Town backpackers it's only takes hiking from there to table mountain of top 2 and half hours so you will definetly love a lot
Amazing views. I have visited table mountain. I went up and down through Cable Car. You can´t miss it if you are in Cape Town.

Platteklip Gorge Hike - Challenging!. I chose to do the Platteklip Gorge hike due to reviews that seemed like it was the quickest (2hours) and best signed route that one could do without a guide. And it was all those things. But I underestimated the physicality of the hike. We started out later than I would have liked so the sun was already blazing directly. There is limited shade on this route. The entrance to the hike is about 15 min walk from the cable car. From the base, it's up up up up. There are big rocks and so while it is not scary or too steep, it's a mostly vertical climb, and your thighs start to feel it in 10 mins or less. I consider myself to be in decent physical shape and it was tough. I saw plenty young men and women taking breaks and moving slowly through the hike. That said, even with feeling like I was moving like a tortoise, we got to the top in 1hr 45min, so it's definitely doable. The sense of achievement is great, and I felt like I earned my ride down the cable car (R125 one way). Plus the line to use the cableway at the base was ridiculously long, so I would like to think as people stood in line, I got acquainted with Table Mountains. I even have a scar from tripping on a rock to show for it :) also don't forget to admire the fyn bos (bushes) with protea and other types of plants. The view was worth the physical hike for sure! Tips:- a hat or visor is needed. The sun beats down like no mans business on a hot summer day. Water too obviously. I sweated so much that I got through my 700 ml in no time. Double that amount is recommended. There are restaurants at the top with water too. -Pace yourself and take breaks in the few shaded areas you find. - build in time to hang out at the top. The scenery is breathtaking, and there are so many view points. There are washrooms, restaurants, curio shops etc. Going up was worth it. Don't think I would put coming down in the same category. Plus the cableway deserved a visit to marvel at the engineering.

A must visit in Cape Town. You cannot visit Cape Town without going to Table Mountain. It's a highlight. A tip- check if it's open before you buy your tickets as winds cause it to be closed. The cable car ride with rotating cabin is terrific. But once you're there it's just wow factor. It was a hot afternoon when we got there but we did the suggested mid range walk of 45 mins around the top. Quite easy. Breathtaking views. Saw turkey buzzards soaring above us. There were great photo ops at every turn. Saw some selfies bring taken on rocky tops close to edge that looked scary- but a great pic no doubt if no tumbles! We finished the walk with a little wine at one of the bars near the entrance. Beautiful experience.

Nice views must visit. This a must visit when in cape town. Offers great views of the city. Tickets for cable car can be a bit expensive for budget travelers, but you can always hike your way up. Tickets are half rate after 6:00 pm.

wow!. This was one of the highlights of a fabulous week in Cape town.We had considered walking up the mountain but as time became an issue and we chose to travel on the Cable car. What a good choice this was as it meant we were able to spend more time at the top on the many paths exploring the top of a fantastic area. It is one of the seven natural wonders of the world and it was easy to see why. There are several paths you can take at the top of various lengths and you can achieve an all round view. Lots of viewing platforms. Look out for Dassies, ( small rodent like animals) and we were even fortunate enough to see an eagle soaring on the thermals

Go up with the cable car and enjoy!. Its a must do at your visit at Capetown! Go with the hop on hop of bus, get out at the Table mounten and take the cable car up. It is a beautifull view on Capetown but also the top area is beautifull to walk arround. It can be coulder up there so take a coat or sweater!

Wow!!. The first time we went it was too windy and the cable car was closed. We nearly didn't go back but I'm so glad we did. The views are simply stunning! I would definitely recommend a trip up, it was fab.
Wonderful Place to Spend a Few Hours. You can spend hours at the top of Table Mountain there are paths leading everywhere and the views over the surrounding area are fantastic.

Breathtaking!!. I had limited time to view the top of Table Mountain, so I took the cable car, as opposed to hiking. It was absolutely beautiful. The way the clouds roll off the top was so cool and the views were just stunning. I would love to have had the time to hike some trails but glad there was a quick option to get to the top.

Amazing Views and fun staff and travelers!!!!. This is a must on a trip to Cape Town. Although I am scared of heights, I had to overcome it and take the most amazing trip to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car provides a 365 degree view of the entire city and the rigid structure of the mountain as the floor turns in a complete circle, which allows the passengers to remain standing in one spot and view everything!!! The staff were awesome as the cable driver was very humorous and made everyone feel safe and welcoming. The views are amazing and the gift shop has everything you need and will mail your post cards for you. This is a must see and I was fortunate to take the evening journey and last trip back down on the cable car, which allows you to see and feel the clouds and vibrant lights of Cape Town.
amazing. amazing site - great views - well worth the two (!) hour wait. recomendation - get a ticket on line - will saave you at least 45 minutes.

Great Views from Iconic Monument. Whilst you get a better view of the mountain from the bottom, it is so worth taking the cable car to the top to view the sheltered coves.We bought our tickets prior to arriving (as part of the red bus tour), but on the day found the queue for buying at the mountain was moving quicker because they have two queues one for those who have pre-booked and one for those just on the day at the monument as most people appeared to have pre-booked this queue was much longer and slower (might just have been he day we visited) Go early or late as when we came down at lunch time queue was about 2hrs
Not to be missed. Pleasant, easy walks and wonderful views. Cable car access is efficient and fun. Take a good hat and plenty of sunscreen.

Amazing views. Enjoy the 360 degree views of one of the most beautiful city in the world! If you haven't purchased the tickets online (as we didn't - we decided to play it by the ear), get there early. We were at the ticket office at 9:40AM and there were no lines. When we descended at around 11:30AM, there were huge lines, so it is definitely worth to get up a bit early if you plan to visit. A morning, in my opinion, is better as the sea, Camps Bay, and the city are not directly in the sun so the pictures would be better in the morning.

Epic Table Mountain. You won't regret this trip, stunned nag views, and you can get a beer.
If your in Cape Town just go for it, expect to queue, but you can pre book online.
Simply stunning.
Table Mountain. It was a windy day and the cable car to the top was closed. However, our drive to the base of the mountain gave us outstanding views of Cape Town.

Spend a day here. Numerous trails on top give many kilometers of hikes. Take water with you, as well as sunblock and a hat. Weather can change rapidly.
Worthy of its worldwide fame.

Boyhood dream. It took a few years but finally got to the top of Table mountain. The experience was all that I thought it would be thanks to the way acces is organised. The view is amazing and surprisingly there is some wild life to look out for.

Pre book your tickets before arrival. Buy your tickets online to save a bit of queuing. We queued for around 30 minutes and it was really worth it. I have been to Cape Town a couple of times but had never managed to take the cable car up to Table mountain. We had a perfect day, no wind and could see for absolutely miles. Brilliant few hours up there !

A beautiful Balance. This attraction, with its great cable cars, Cafe, shop, etc, still has preserved the natural environment in a splendid manner. Superb lookouts, great walking paths, informative signage,etc, while resisting the temptation to be tacky purveyors to tourists ! Well done.

Stunning view of the whole Cape area. This is a must-see if you are visiting Cape Town. Access can be done by foot (it's a 3-hour walk to the top) or by cable car. For the cable car make sure to check the Park's website, as it is often closed due to strong winds. Once up, you can have a nice walk (1,5 - 2 hours) around the National Park in order to hace a 365 degree view of the whole area. If you go up there for sunset, make sure to take a pullover with you even if in summer, as it can get quite chilly in the evening.

Don't leave Cape Town without hiking Table Mountain. Table Mountain is one of the 7 Wonders of the New World and the iconic image of Cape Town for a good reason. Locals worship the mountain. A trip to Cape Town is not complete if you do not visit the top of this mountain. You will not regret it.

Wonderful Experience. I have been to the Grand Canyon but I have to say this trumps it for views and experience. Wonderful views of Cape Town and miles around. It was quite busy getting up and coming down but the lines moved very quickly, a credit to the staff. Definitely recommend a visit if in Cape Town.

Top of the mountain was great. Enjoyed the view. I rated it a four due to the fact that we were caught on top of the mountain when they were having a problem with the cable car. We were stuck on the mountain for 2 extra hours which delayed our tour.
A must. You have to go up to have this wonderfull view on cape town and all surroundings. Wel organized and very clean environment on the top with good hiking trails
MUST DO. ride the cable car, hike a trail, take a tour, just make sure you get to the top, because rain or shine, the view is beautiful

What a view wow fantastic. We had great weather a wonder to see and be there fantastic clean world class facility well organized safe walkways and outlooks the fact that there were so many visitors at the same time made it even a greater experience thumbs up to the management team that controls a job well done.
Chilly Table Top. Wow - what views and beautiful walks, but we were freezing! Be prepared with warm fleeces to hand in case required. We were there mid November

Buy your ticket online!. A must do and see in your life! We bought the tickets online and could skip the HUGE qeue. And once your are up in the sky it is the best feeling ever! You know when you are up on the mountain that you will be back in Capetown on a next visit.

Fabulous View. Watch weather carefully as once it socks in the view disappears
Very busy tourist spot so plan accordingly
A view from Above. If you get to Cape Town go up the gondola to table Mt. you can see all of Cape Town as ell as Robin Island from the top.

Great views of Capetown. We bought tickets for 8AM on Monday. There were only 4 people in line before us. When we came down at 12PM there were over 100 people in line. So it paid to go early. Take a jacket, its windy.
Incredible scenery. Climb Table Mountain or take the cable car but don't miss out on this chance to see amazing scenery from one of the world's wondera
Absolutely breathtaking. The views from the top are just amazing. You are basically above the clouds :) It's worth the money.
revolving cable car. nice hikes on table mountain - check the weather, if its very windy, they shut down the service and if there are clouds, you'll see nothing up there.

Trip to the Table Top. Table mountain has very interesting features, the most obvious being fairly flat. Great 360 degree views ( you must walk a bit ) and definitely worth the time. The tram is fast and reliable. A must see world Heritage site.

Breathtaking!. The day we went up it was cloudy at first and we were not sure it it was a good idea. The locals told us the weather can change very quickly, so we decided to take a chance.
Shortly after we got to the top the clouds cleared revealing beautiful views in every direction. This is a must do!

What a VIEW. This is a great way to spend 3hrs - get your ticket ahead of time to avoid the lines! Was impressed by how fast everything moved along. The 360 degree rotating tram was cool and not a bad seat in there! Great feeling once you get up there and the views are insane!! Very picturesque and people willing to share snapshots if you don't have a selfie stick etc.
Best views but rather cold. If you go to Cape Town it is a must but you must go well prepared with good layers of clothes because it can get cold on top.

Dont miss this. This is one site you dont want to miss. Take the cable car to the top and plan to spend several hours walking around and looking for dassies. If you stay till closing there is a long line to get on the cable cars but who cares?

Get there if you can. I went on the second day of my holiday but weather was not good and cable car closed. I decided to go two days later and it was amazing. The queue moves at a reasonable speed. Worth the wait!

Amazing natural wonder with fantastic views. If you visit Cape Town, this is an essential excursion. We took the cable car up and wandered for hours. There is a good restaurant and facilities on the top. Breathtaking views for miles in all directions.

Before sunset. We went on the top close before sunset and could watch the big cloud growing up and cully cover the mountain; This was the greatest experience we had in ZA. In you've time to climb it's even better. Don't miss it

Must do. We had so little time on our return to Cape Town, that I doubted it would be worth queuing. We did book on line but it still took an hour to arrive at the top. I am so glad that we went. The views are absolutely spectacular.

Beautiful views. We were very lucky to go up on a gorgeous clear day. After a bit of of a wait to get on the cable car we got to see awesome views of Capetown, Robben Island, Camps Bay. Truly amazing natural wonder of the world. Pleased to say it's my second only 5 more to go!

More than a cable car trip!. The top of Table Mountain is such an iconic site. Make sure you bring plenty of sunscreen and warm clothing...sensible shoes/ trainers are a must if you want to get the most out of the trip...and leave yourself plenty of time to enjoy the views by taking to the paths all around the summit...it's worth the effort. Book your tickets on line!!!!

Wonderful Adventure! Exquisite views!. We chose to hike up on a more challenging route (India Venster) which included some scrambling with minor staples and chains. You can check this out on YouTube. We chose to go with a local guide which we arranged through Kingdom Tours. There were only 3 of us which made it very fun. I would recommend using a guide as the route is not always clear. The day we went was perfect, sunny with no wind and temperature in the high teens when we started. By the way the guide picked us up at 6am. I know it sounds early but go with it as the climb is fairly strenuous and in the sun. The day heats up fairly quickly. It took us about 3 hours to get to the top and then we rode the cable car down. If you are up for a longer adventure (4.5 to 5 hours) you can also go up from Kirstenbosch Gardens. Check with a guide on this option.

Beautiful view. The views from this mountain are wonderful. You can see all of Cape Town. You can see the east and west coast of Africa. There are many pathways to follow, both paved and foot worn. There are out crops that provide great viewing stations. There are stones to sit upon and be alone. Although a busy place it does not feel crowded at the top because it is so vast. There is wildlife. The Rock hyrax and a large number of lizards (?) are easy to spot. There is a store at the top. There are bathrooms at the top. There are railings around a lot of the viewing areas. Care still needs to be taken when viewing from this location.

Be prepared for great views, crowds and a great walk down. Arrive early to avoid queues. If you decide to walk down, it's a mountain path with some big steps in places, so good shoes and poles will help. Expect to take 2 hours.
Absolutely stunning. Went up by cable, had lunch( not spectacular at all) Climbed down the mountain by foot. Bring enough water and food. No handbags (;) ) and good shoes. Excepect muscle aches
must do!. it takes time, go there after 3:00 p.m. to avoid long waiting! sun protection is recommended and helpful :-)
top of the world. Must do, next time I will go prepared and walk up instead of cable car. Brilliant for young and old, a must!

Fantastic views. I took the cable car up Table Mountain and then did the intermediate 'trail' on top of the mountain. Fantastic views all around and beautiful natural environment. There were lots of people but everything was clean and quiet. Good facilities.

Simply awesome. Fabulous views- after checking out the dassies near the cableway station get away from the crowds and head off on a walk. Great views in all directions and the chance to see some of the unique plant and wildlife on the mountain top. Doesn't take long to get away from the spots where most tourists hang out. On busy days you might have a long wait to get back down, so don't attempt to do it in a hurry. Book tickets online and print them out before you go to avoid the queues.
Amazing views!. Purchase your tickets prior to going up the mountain! Views are amazing, wild life is fabulous and you have the opportunity to climb down a side of the mountain if you would like.

A must do. We had to wait 2 days to be able to use the cable car as it was closed due to high winds. Then on our 3rd day we had to queue for over an hour to get to the cable car because everyone had been waiting to visit the top. But it was worth the wait as the views are spectacular.

for an incredible view of town. the cable car trip to this mountain with its coffee and curio shop is worth a visit. the incredible view, its small wildlife inhabitants the table mountain offers is amazing to say the least...overall a beautiful experience one can have at this popular destination...
Stunning. Great views, but make sure to take a jacket. Can recommend the restaurant up at the top. World class and reasonable. Book the cable car in advance to avoid long lines.
Sunshine not mist. It can change 'fast'. Make sure you go as soon as see it cloudless. The mist or cloud came in as I was going up and so the top was a mystery but still worth the atmosphere.

Incredible views, book your tickets before you go though!. Table Mountain is a must visit! Just make sure to book your tickets online before you go as the lines can be long. Don't hesitate to go on a clear day, because the weather is really unpredictable so you don't want to leave it to your last day and then the mountain is covered in clouds!
Amazing experience. You can't visit Cape Town without going to Table Mountain. It's the most fascinating mountain i've ever seen. It's worth the trip to go to the top when it's nice and not windy.
Hike up there . Hiking up the table mountain is a must do. On top you get stunning views of Cape Town and surrounding areas. The top is filled with tourists tho

Sublime experience. Views are great from the top. Go early in the morning to avoid clouds. Buy tickets online in advance, to avoid rush. Do NOT buy return tickets on cableway (as you will be limited to either morning or afternoon). Buy one way ticket for going up and going down, to avoid any time restriction (costs very marginally more). Tickets valid for 7 days.

A must!. We took the Hop on, Hop off Bus on our own up to Table Mountain knowing that the cable car was not running that day. We were so disappointed but went anyway. Worth it. What incredible views for such a worldly landmark. Exhilerating ideed! Windy indeed. Only wish was that we could have taken the cable car - well can dream to come back and do it again! A must do and see when in Capetown (one of the loveliest cities in the world!.

spectacular vista. One of the highlights of Cape Town. Table Mountain frames and (with the Ocean) defines the City. Wonderful views of the City and surrounding area. Good view of Robbin Island where Nelson Mandela was jailed for so many years. Definately recommend that when you go, go early to avoid the crowds as you need to line up to take the cable car up to the top. We arrived fairly early and within our 30 minute wait to go up, the line grew enormously. Also, be very aware of the weather. If it is cloud covered they shut down the cable car.

Amazing views!. When you're in Cape Town you have to go too the Table Mountain. On top there are great trails you can walk whit beautiful views! It is easy to reach also, we did it by are own car. At the parking there are some guys looking out for your car. Just give them a tip when you leave.
Stunning. So spectacular, beautiful walks that can go on forever. Even managed to see a rock hyrax within a few feet that just magnified the sheer pleasure of being in such an iconic spot.
Amazing. A must see when traveling to Cape Town. "Need to"" advice. to avoid ques make sure you book your tickets before you go up to the mountain as you can Fast Track.
Great views. This has to be a must for everyone when visiting Cape town. The mountain just dominates the views where ever you are in Cape Town and the views from the top are fantastic.
Landmark. A tourist must stop and visit. See all of Cape Town from high above. Take the On/Off bus to make it easier to visit. You can take the cable or walk.

A view not to forget.. We got there by the cable car.Glad we did this trip. It was a wonderful experience to soak in and feel nature again.We stayed there for more than 6 hours and wished for more.If wasn't for the early last timing for cable car down, we really like to stay there even longer.Do bring really warm clothes as it really high up there.Where the cloud are !!! Bear in mind the timing for getting down via the cable car as we waited more than 45mins in the queue and was freezing around 7pm standing still.Be adventurous and explore further. The rocky grounds would make u wish u had your trekking shoes on. Do check the weather as the cloud might 'cloud' your vision for the great urban view.Saw some really cute dassie and small reptiles sharing the nature with us.Do visit the Table Mountain in the earlier part of your travel, as it will give u much memory / thoughts every where else u go in CPT. Cuz it can be seen wherever u are!!!

Breathe Taking! Lots to admire.. What an amazing experience of 6 hours of admiring the nature and urbanization from the top.Constant feeling of life is beautiful because of such experience.Saw cute dassies and small reptiles. Stayed for at least 6 hours, but wish for more. Just so much to admire and great small-retreat experience.Want to return someday soon.

NOT TO BE MISSED ONE OF HIGHLIGHTS OF CAPE TOWN. There is a lot to do on table mountain but difficult to predict the weather. We set off on the cable car, views were great UNTIL we got to the top then thick mist descended. There are animals to see up here and lots of walks to do. Interesting boards with snippets of information. Go the café and sample the milk tart (custard pie to us) the best I have tasted in my life. Staff all over the park are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable.

Top of the Mountain , Top of the Bucket List.. Table Mountain is referred to by the locals as ; The Mountain . They will ask "have you hiked The Mountain or did you climb The Mountain ." To them there is only one mountain , and they do not need to name it . We all know The Mountain.If you are fit and experienced hiker you will enjoy the many hikes available to summit or circumnavigate The Mountain . If you are adventurous , take a map of the difficult routes or better still engage a guide with knowledge of The Mountain.You will experience one of the magic climbs and views in the world.

Breathtaking!. Must do once you are in Cape Town!
Fantastic view from the top, dominates the entire city and the bay, truly a unique experience.

Breathtaking views. From the moment we parked the car the view are sensational. We arrived early around 08:30 and only had a short wait in the queue, (there was a 90 minute wait when we came down at 12:30 to buy tickets then a queue for the cable car) don't worry about were you stand in the cable car has it revolves giving everyone great views during our all to quick climb to the summit. At the top Cape Town is laid out before you, and as you walk around on flat walkways, the views just get more awesome of the mountains and the coastline and you loss all track of time. Take lunch with you, cafe not great. Buy tickets online to avoid queuing to much.
Stunning view, go for it!. Just beautiful!! You get to see the mountains and the sea. A must do when in Cape Town. I would recommend going in the late afternoon as the scenery is purely magical!

Hike Up, Cable Car Down!. It's a steep but straightforward hike up the Platteklip Gorge - the guide book says allow 1-2 hours. We go pretty briskly, and did it in 1 hr 20 mins.Some great views back over Cape Town on the way up, but the real spectacular sights were from the plateaued summit. In addition to the views in all directions, the vegetation was amazing - very wet on the top and the whole surface is populated with beautiful flowering plants.It takes about another 15 mins from the top of the gully to follow the Smuts trail to the beacon & the highest point on the top; then it's about another 25 mins back to the Cable Car for the descent. Some of the best views are here, down on to Camps Bay and out to Signal Hill & the Lions Head. A great trip.

Table Mountain = MUST for ervery visitor. At our first stay in Cape Town we wanted to be on top of the Table Mountain and it was an unforgettable experience. The 360 degree view from the top of Table Mountain is one of those things you will always remember. Take your time and enjoy the Table Mountain and its nature, the wind and the wildlife. Next time we will try to be on top near sunset.

Wonder of the world. The most iconic site of Cape Town. As a regular traveller, there is nothing better than the view of Table Mountain from my airplane seat, reminding me that I am coming home. Table Mountain offers the best view of Cape Town and the Atlantic Seaboard, the best hiking trails as well as overnight mountain accommodation for the longer hiking trails. On the top of the mountain you will find a fully licenced restaurant but you can also pack a picnic basket on a summers night to enjoy the sunset, definitely a must do.
Excellent. One amazing view on a excellent day, we have been very lucky to get one excellent day to have a wonderful panorama.

A great trek up and a gripping abeil down.. We went with Abseil Africa on a trek up Table Mountain with a guide. It's not for the faint hearted (take the cable car if worried) but we made it in 90 minutes. We abseiled down a 112 metre cliff (half suspended in mid air). It was exhilarating but not for anyone worried by heights. We took the cable car down and it made the half day out memorable.

Amazing Views of Cape Town. Once you start to travel to the top of Table Mountain by cable car the amazing views begin. When you get to the top on a clear day you can see as far as the eye can see. The views of Cape Town and the area are spectacular
Simply must see!. The best view of Cape Peninsula! Do yourself a favor and hike it, rather than take the cable car. Also, make sure you check the weather before ascending!

family fun. My family and I went up the mountain.What a great experience.Jerome from Cmore Tours and Transfers brought us on the perfect day and there was not much of a queue. He advised us of walks to do on the top and also to enjoy lunch from the restaurant.Once we came down before sunset JErome sent one of his drivers to fecth me, my family and our friends. There were 9 of us including kids and the driver was waiting for us as soon as we had come off the cable car. What a smooth exit from Cmore Tours and Transfer and he ensured we enjoyed a great day on Table mountain.We all had a great time and was stress free thanks to JErome and his team and their efficient planning and communicating.
THE attraction in Cape Town. The view from table mountain is one of those stunning things that stays with you for years to come. A must see.

Make It Your Top Priority. Allow enough time to experience all that Table Mountain has to offer. The great 360 degree views, the hiking trails, the guided tour on top, and the exciting ride on the cableway. We spent just under 3 hours on top and had to leave to stay on schedule. If you have the flexibility, go early as the crowds pick up during the day. Great place for a picnic. The temperature will be lower and the wind stronger on top.
Good for short hikes and breathtaking views. This is a must-do in Cape Town! Check when it's open since weather conditions may interfere with the schedule.
Table Mountain. Unreal views from the top, cable cart is also a good experience, wear warm clothes for sunset - Must do while in Cape Town
Awesome site. We went up the mountain in the morning when it was clear blue skies, and waited till the clouds rolled in in the afternoon. It was like we were at the top of the world.

Worth the effort!. My Husband and I walked the Platteklip Gorge route to the top of table mountain from the Lower Cable Car Station. It is a tough route in terms of steepness but easy to navigate and and the views you get are super. Once you have sweated and puffed your way to the top the routes up there are also well signposted and you can get great all round views of the Cape Town and coastal areas whilst feeling smug that you walked up rather than took the cable car! There is also a large, well stocked restaurant with reasonably priced food and drinks and a gift shop too.

Table Mountain Cape Town. The view is breath taking and you can wander around and see various parts of Cape town and surrounds from different angles. The trip in the cable car was fantastic. The car actually revolved so it didnt matter where you were in the car , you got to see the entire trip up & back from 360 degrees. The only disappointing thing was it went to fast. One minute you started up, enjoying the climb and the view and suddenly your there. Its a must see tour when visiting Cape Town.

Iconic Table Mountain. When you think Cape Town, you think Table Mountain. It's as iconic as the city itself and is not to be missed. Unfortunately the cable car was down for scheduled maintenance during my visit, but the drive up Signal Hill was a good substitute. Views from the top are stunning, and there's plenty of walking trails to explore. Hang out and watch the hang-gliders or simply sit back, relax, and enjoy the scenery.

Well worth it. We hiked up and took the cable car down, R100 one way, R190 return.The views from the top are magnificent. It doesn't even feel like you are on top of a mountain because of how flat it is.The only negative is the queue to go up is very long. We hiked but our friends took the cable car up and we arrived at the same time, the hike took us 2.5 hours.

Remarkable views from this landmark! . If you come to Cape Town, you must visit Table Mountain. It's part of the city. And it's quite surprising how enormous it is.
Allocate a couple of hours to wander around and take it all in.
The views are truly unforgettable.
Five star experience!

Best views of Cape Town. The National park is massive but like most tourists I stuck to the easy stuff & didn't hike up the mountain. Table mountain has the most breathtaking views of Cape Town seeing past Robben Island & the wine lands.Experiencing the cloud settling on top of the mountain was like being in another world ....I loved it The air was crisp sun was shinning & I felt alive & fresh. Just note the weather was a bit cold but not too bad, you will need a jumper light jacket coat or warm scarf. For the dare Devils you can abseil for a fee and there are enough platforms for you to take floating infinity pics. And if you aren't afraid of heights u can sit at the edge of a rock. My health & safety eyes went nuts when I saw all these crazy people stepping off the path to take pictures....there aren't any guides policing people & you have to be extremely careful if you step off the laid out paths.note that you can go around by yourselves or wait for the free hourly guided tours .... A MUST VISIT IF U IN CAPE TOWN
Stunning views. Stunning views over 360 degrees. Be sure to visit as soon as you have a sunny calm day. Wander around for several hours and check out the wild flowers and animals.

Great views, easy walks. Very easy to get around. Make sure to keep your eyes peeled for the dassies. The "long" circle is easy and takes about 25 min of walking. When enjoying the views it can be easily extended to 60 min. Went there for the sunset and it was breathtaking.

Don't visit if it is clouded over. - my own fault. Decided to risk the clouds and see if it would clear over.3m of visibility, I knew it would be bad but then it started to rain this is no fault but my own.The facilities and walking tracks are well maintained and in clear conditions would have been great.

A must-do in Cape Town. Obviously, this is the number one attraction in Cape Town and we waited until the last day to go, and we are so glad we did.We were extremely lucky in our timing. In the morning, there was so much fog, you couldn't even see the mountain. By the time we went at 2pm, we knew it would be a risk being peak time. However, I think we waited all of 15 minutes for the gondola. Quick trip to the top and all the fog had burned off and the views from all sides was breathtaking. As a bonus, the crowds were sparse and there was little if no wind. Just a subtle breeze.And, a nice surprise, there is a café and bar at the top. Nothing better than overlooking that scenery, in the afternoon sun with a glass of wine. It was tremendous and we felt we saved the best for last.Enjoy
Stunning views. The views from the top of Table Mountain were amazing. Better than I could have ever expected. Would recommend going up earlier in the morning to avoid the long lines

So cool!. The views are unbelievable from table mountain. We went for the sunset and were very impressed. It is closed often when it is windy and can get cloudy so go whenever the conditions are good and don't leave it to your last day in Cape Town.

Just got to do it. If you have a clear day, clear your diary & go up. It's stunning.Make sure you have got your tickets beforehand as non ticket queue horrendous. When we came down at lunchtime there was no queue so maybe leave it till the afternoon.

Truly Amazing. Highly recommend Table Mountain. Really advisable to pre book your tickets online the day before. The line to go up the mountain can be long you will move quicker if you already have a ticket. Even the wait was worth it once you get to the top you can spend as much time as you want and taking your time to walk around is a must. This is a good trip to take highly recommended.

Just do it !. Now, if you have a problem with heights, then I suggest you stay on the ground. Catching the cable car up Table mountain is really something else...but the views are awesome, Cape Town's Table Mountain is a must for any visitor and provides breathtaking views over the city and its beaches. The panorama stretches from Table Bay to False Bay and around the mountain to the Hout Bay Valley and Kommetjie. On a clear day one has a magnificent view across the Cape Flats to the Hottentots Holland Mountains...be brave and just do it.
On top of the World!. If weather permits, drop everything and GO!.. Spectacularly , enlighteningly, phenomenally awesome.....Views and history...Mother Nature Rules!!!!

Lovely and romantic view. Table Mountain is one of the wonder of the world ( new 7 wonder of the world ) good cable car, those who donot want to take cable car they can tracking, but I advise to take a cable car, once you reach you are getting 360 degree view of cape town city, when I was there it was foggy in one side one side it was sunny, have enjoyed most romantic view of 360 degree of cape town, it's worth and I like it very much
Simply stunning. Beautiful park at the top of Table Mountain with stunning views of the Cape. Make sure you have your camera with you!

Can't miss - worth it even if it's cloudy. It was quite cloudy during my trip, but the clouds cleared enough times to appreciate the breath-taking views.Definitely worth setting aside a morning/afternoon for this. There wasn't a queue for tickets/the cable car, but I gather that's quite unusual (maybe because it was a bit cloudy...)

Great hike! Be aware of the weather!. We made a great choice to take the cable car up Table Mountain and hike down Platteklip Gorge. It is still a rigorous hike and very windy at times. Be aware that the cable car will close if the winds are too high. We started in the early afternoon and realized the winds were going to pickup at any time and made the choice to hike down instead of up. This way we knew we didn't have to hike up to a closed cable car and have to hike down anyways. The scenery was stunning! There are amazing views from the top and along the hike down. The trail is well marked once you find it, so if you park near the entrance to the cable car, you can take this trail all the way back to the entrance.
Enjoy the view. Super view. Good climb. And what a rewarding view ..... The Climate is totalitaire different from the surrounding area

Truly spectacular!. If you get a clear day this is a must visit location. The views from the top are absolutely spectacular.We bought our tickets on the hop on hop off red route tour and were expecting a line up but thankfully that Thursday afternoon there was no line. We were able to enter the cableway right away. That is an interesting experience as the floor rotates as you're going up, making it easy to see all angles and take photos as your going up. It is a really short ride up some of you're scared of heights, not much time to panic.Once up there you experience phenomenal views. There is a walking path which goes all around the nearly flat top and that makes it really great to be able to see various points of interest from the top. Seeing the sky gliders in the sunset was an added bonus for us.

Lovely View. Could have stayed there all day. My wife and I loved table mountain - though we were a little lazy and got the cable car up (which I would recommend booking in advance, unless you may be waiting while in the queue). We spent a few hours at the top of the mountain which was a bit cloudy, but luckily there were a few opportunities for us to see through the clouds and the view was amazing.There are a few walking trails at the top in addition to a small cafe - so nice to have a quick drink if the weather closes in a little bit.FYI : When we were done we got the City Sightseeing bus back down to the V&A Waterfront which we found pretty good too.

Beautiful views and energising fresh air!. I hiked up the gorge route, which was a fantastic way to climb up with outstanding views and not too crowded. I came down by cable car, which was also good to experience and very quick.

Great Day at Table Mountain. Arrive early! If you do not arrive approximately 45-60 minutes before the mountain opens then you will have a 2-3 hour wait in que.
The line moves quickly and efficiently. There is a charming little store at the top as well as a nice snack bar for a light lunch

Up in the clouds.... What an amazing day! We got the cable car up, and as we ascended - we were suddenly amongst the clouds!The view from the top was completely blocked by the clouds - but I didn't mind one bit! It felt so magical being up in the clouds!On the way down, the city slowly came into view and it felt like we were descending from the heavens...An amazing experience - made even more special when Mother Nature put on a cloud spectacular!

Crikey! Beautiful!. Beautiful views, and on a clear day a hike up is definitely worth it, the easy path takes 2-3hrs, but it's worth it when you reach the top. Or take the cable car up, there is also the chance to abseil part the way down, which was amazing... A little surprise halfway down the abseil too! Totally recommend a trip up there and to book the abseil if you can as it gets busy!

Everything they say it is. What can I add to the title of this comment? It is well organized, the cable lift is much less frightening than one would imagine (in fact, not frightening at all), and the amenities up the mountain are just perfect. It IS possible to go up/down on foot, but it takes a much braver (or foolish) man than yours truly to do so.A thee star in Michelin which means "Vaut le voyage!"

A MUST SEE IN CAPETOWN. Take one of the free ranger lead walks while up there, so you get to know a little of what you're looking at, especially to learn about the plants and views. Spend a couple of hours walking around, sitting down to relax and enjoy the views, have lunch, etc. Watch the weather, as it can close because of high winds or clouds, so if the weather is good, go then, while you can. It's worth the trip. But get there early in the morning, as the lines can be very long. Buses start coming in at 8:30, so you want to be in front of them in the line. It all opens up at 8:30, so if you get there by 8:00, you'll be one of the first to get up there, which is a MAJOR plus. The view and the experience are well worth your time.

A must do, but buy tickets on line, and get there early!. Seeing the city from the top of table mountain and taking the drive out to Cape of Good Hope took all day, but was well worth it! We hired a cab for the day, which made it very efficient. You need to get tickets for the tram on line through your hotel to avoid an additional line. Also if you go early(before 9), you will l avoid a one hour line for people with tickets! Also, the tram is less likely to be closed because of winds. Bring a jacket, as it can be windy and cold at the top.
Go!. Great views and a must if you are in Cape Town. If there's no cloud cancel everything and get up there quick, the cloud normally wins!

Not worth the time or cost. We queued for an hour to get up, and then for nearly two hours to get down, in order to get views of Cape Town that were marginally better, when the cloud cleared, than from the bottom of the lift to the cable car. No warning of waiting times was posted.

just stunning. This is everything you hope for. The Mountain is accessed by cable car which is fun in itself. Spend time to stroll around the park on top and look out for wild life. And the view .... just stunning!
awesome. Nature at its best. Undulating landscape. Fierce Craggy rocks. Views of deep blue sea. Wow.A place a must see.

Fantastic View. There is only one problem with this attraction the weather, it is impossible to pre plan, if the weather changes there is no access to the top, so be cautious about pre paying for tickets before travel. The view from the top is fantastic and it could be the only time you could say you stood on top of a mountain. Well worth the trip.

Magnificent views, but think carefully about walking up.. My wife and I had been told by several people that if we wanted to walk one way it is best to walk up Table Mountain and get the views from the cable car on the way down. This was probably very good advice but, both aged 61 and in reasonably good health, and even though we are both good walkers, we found the 800 metre climb very strenuous, taking us 2 hours 40 minutes, even with several stops along the way to rest and admire the views.We were advised that one of the easiest walks was up Platteklip gorge, which is situated about 1.5 kms beyond the cable car. If this was the easiest I wouldn't have liked to have tackled the more difficult ones!Once at the top the views are, quite literally, out of this world. An amazing panorama of Signal Hill, Robben Island, Cape Town and the coastline for miles around. Don't forget to wear something warm though, as it is surprisingly chilly at the top.The trip back down in the revolving cable car took us 4 minutes and again afforded great views.

Wonderful place, be prepared to be flexible regarding the date of your visit!. This is a very reasonably priced experience! The cable cars are great but are quite often unable to function because of the high winds in that area, so be prepared and go with the flow. I was very surprised to learn of the many guided Nature Walks etc at the 'top', which is itself a National Park. Wish I'd had more time to take advantage of these offerings. Enjoy S.Africa, it's wonderful and I felt very safe.

Heavenly views. One of the new wonders of the world, this park is home to the beautiful Table Mountain and various fauna and indigenous flora. To get a birds view of the beautiful city of Cape Town, the Indian and Atlantic Oceans, park is easily accessed through modern cable cars or medium to advanced hiking trails. No trip to Cape Town is complete without visiting this park.

Not the Best Weather but what an amazing mountain. Booked our tickets via the Table bay Hotel and went off to see the Mountain visibility was good when we headed out but one thing you learn about Cape Town is the weather changes very frequentlyWent up via Cable Car which rotates and gives a 360 view - again this was simply amazing - it was a shame that a mist came over the mountain so we could not see out apart from glimpses but if you are in Cape Town this place is a must!!!

Who knew such a marvel of nature existed in Africa?. I didnt really understand Capetown at all until I took the gondola up to the top of Table Mountain and viewed the breathtaking harrowing cliffs covered with fynbos, dassies and protea. The edifice was huge and hulking and we could have spent many more hours exploring if the fog hadnt rolled in and we were walking in a heavenly mist. The tram turned as it ascended providing great views for all who were lucky enough to get a great day...as if there is too much wind or clouds the tram doesnt operate. It was a five minute drive from our hotel to the parking lot and we purchased our tickets online which saved a lot of waiting time. It feels like no place else on earth because the vegetation is so different as is the formation of the mountain itself.

Amazing. So high! And what a crazy walk/climb up there. It was so hard to do.But i did it and i am so happy i did cause it made me feel amazing and oh the view is absolutely stunning! I can't describe it!!You just have to see it for yourself!!!

Amazing. Amazing ... Hiking up will take 1 your if you're fit ... 2 if you're not. Wonderful trails, views ... Scenario is incredible. Make no mistake ... If you're not use to hike, it will be a little hard, but its worth every second.Once you get to the top, the views are breathtaking.Take a little rest, drink a coffee, eat some delicious food at the restaurant and enjoy your time up there. Spectacular !!
Fantastic. Very modern set up and the views were amazing. When we went, it looked cloudy at first so the crowds were minimal. Luckily it cleared however and we had a great day

lucky to get a ticket!. during our stay of 5 days in town, wind caused the closing of the cable car, so we were very lucky to get a ticket very early in the morning of the only day open! recommend to purchase tickets online and be at the cable car departure as early as possible, in order to avoid endless queue!

Beautiful. This is a highlight of Cape Town - you can see it from everywhere, and watch the clouds dipping and hovering over it.We had clear blue skies and no wind.I didn't know there was a national park on top.We walked around for an hour and a half - amongst the various plants and foliage - all the while exclaiming over the views.Much better than I was expecting - I thought it would just be a buzz to go in the cable car.

You can only visit on a clear day but its worth it. We went up on the clearest day possible (we were lucky the weather was good). We had a very nice young man give us a (free) walking tour and then strolled by ourselves. A must for anyone visiting Cape Town

Brilliant staff! Beautiful venue!. Massively worth a visit!!!!! Stunning views and really friendly staff! Hilarious! We were lucky to have great weather so that's the only thing to keep in mind. Go go go!!

A must. The views from the top are spectacular giving a good overview of the setting of the city and a view over to Robben island.Organised, well signed walks are available at the top as is a nice cafe and gift shop. If the weather isn't in your favour the view from the base station is still impressive.

Table Mountain. From the Table Mountain there is a gorgeous view of the city and of the neighboring mountains, like the Lion Head. The Table Mountain is very interesting also from the Naturalist's point of view.

Worth the climb. The chance to climb presented itself one morning and we went. That's the way to approach the mountain, which is almost all up and not much shade. Bring lots of water and wear sunblock and a hat. It also gets very windy. But the views all the way up make pausing enjoyable as well as necessary. It is hard work but anyone with good shoes should be able to do it.

So glad I went. The weather was perfect and the cable ride was crowded but easy. We bought tickets online which was a great idea to miss the lines. Its touristy but really gives you a good perspective of the city.

On a Clear Day..... Got to the mountain and purchased tickets before 9am and beat the crowds. We still had to wait for the tram. Highly encourage if you visit to go very early to avoid long lines and waits.Views were outrageous and loved the entire walk. Allow at least one hour plus tram time up and down, but could stay longer on the mountain itself. Great photography especially for those with interest. Get here while you can or before the clouds become a table cloth to table mountain.
A must-see!. This is a gorgeous natural setting to explore - a must see! Panoramic views of the Cape, and an extended area with wildlife - a once in a lifetime experience!
A dusk vist gives another view all together. It is quieter in the early evening and much easier to get to. The price is the same but the cafe is also better as you can get a seat.

Amazing views. Excellent trip in the cable car to the top of table mountain so high unbelievable. On,y criticism is we had to queue over an hour to get cable car down. Need to look at this and try to come up with a solution. Perhaps more capable cars would be an idea
Stunning views!. A must-go if you visit Cape Town. Absolutely stunning views! Cable car is a bit expensive but the hike is worth not taking the cable car.
Worth every penny. Go to Cape Point and then walk to Cape of good hope! really beautiful, take one day to see every viewpoint

Great view of the city from the mountain. A great climb and a must for those photographers who wants to capture the entire city from the top, Didnt do the climb as there was poor visibility so ensure to check the weather forecast before you visit.

Beautiful landscape and view of the city. If you're visiting Cape Town, one of the things you absolutely MUST do is visit Table Mountain. I would recommend hiking up, as it's fairly easy for those that regularly hike and exercise...and slightly more of a workout for those who don't. But either way, it's definitely worth doing! It's a bit touristy, but there's a reason for that. It's beautiful on the way up to the top and just as stunning at the top! Once you reach the top of table mountain, head to the far left, where there will be slightly less people and if you're lucky, have some peace and quiet to really take in the view. You can either hike back down, though I would recommend taking the gondola...it's a great way to take beautiful pictures on the way down!

Sunset at half price!. We went up the mountain at 630pm and paid half the normal price!Its very cold on top of the mountain as a cloud covered it as we arrived to the top.we had tea at the coffee shop and returned the the beautiful sight of the lights of Capetown as the sun was setting!Great experience!

The Far Queue. Never made it to the top, there are long queues for both purchases of tix then another longer Q to ascend to the summit. After a late night before I was not prepared to stand in the hot African sun for hours to catch a gondela. Do Lions Head for free
Amazing experience. One of the most amazing breath-taking experiences. Take the cable car (brave it, like I did) - it is absolutely worth it!!
Iconic park. This park offer a lot of different views. From the mountains to the sea.Cover a very large area and different habitats

The Top of the World. Though a bit windy, on a clear day you can see the whole city, harbor, beaches and some vineyards. Its inexpensive and worth an afternoon. Just take the bus or a red bus ( on and off self tour bus ...good to buy a 2 day pass )
wonderful.. Get there early. Lines are long but 45 minute wait went by quickly. Beautiful views on a clear day, varied flora. Recommend

So beautiful. We went up through skeletton gorge at the botanical garden, it was tough but gorgeous and rewarding because the view at the top and the variety of habitats are incredible! So out your shoes on an try!

Sensational Views, Unique. Now rated as one of the 7 modern Wonders of the World, the views from the Table Mountain are unsurpassed. From the cable car ride up to the top station, which includes a rotation of the car's base giving 360 degree views, to the extensive tracks at the top, one couldn't expect any better. Pre-booking will save you time lining up and getting tickets (in our case one hour), but I understand it can be far longer.Obviously, you can not visit Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain.There are shops, toilets etc at the top.

An absolute must do. Buy your tickets in advance to minimise queuing the cable car is smooth and the view from the top is amazing however we only really understood the bowl Cape Town is in after we had been on a boat trip to Robben Island there are some nice gentle walks at the top allowing you to truly appreciate the mountain

Spectacular views. Be sure to go, and go whenever the weather is clear (don't delay). The tram did not involve a long wait, so long as you buy a ticket in advance (online or even on the hop-on hop-off bus, the best way to get there). The views are truly spectacular, including all of Cape Town and down the peninsula toward the Cape of Good Hope.

Great Experience!. We road the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The cable car rotated so you got to see various views of the area as you went up the mountain. Once we got to the top, the view was breathetaking. From the top you are able to see the entire city of Cape Town in all its splendor. You most go to the top of Table Mountain if you visit this city.

Amazing views. I took the Rotair up the mountain, and was pleasantly surprised by the small rodent like animals called "dassies". You can see Robbin Island from there, and I recommend you come with a guide who can point out all the interesting places of interest.

Stunning views and a little bit of wildlife.
