By the time you have taken in the amazing views of Cape Town and the cape peninsula, and cooed at the gorgeous dassies and ghekos, there isn't that much else to do with a six year old in tow. Without one, you could take in a range of hikes and more scenery.

Awesome area to explore while in Cape Town. You can't go wrong with Table Mountain National Park. Something for all - old or young and it is massive including beaches, mountains and loads of activities. You can spend weeks exploring the large are by surfing, mountain biking, running, hiking, etc. Just a beautiful place.
Table Mountain. Awesome although it was rather cloudy when we arrived. However the restaurant offered very nice food.
Spectacular views. This is a must see attraction in Cape Town. The Hop On Hop Off bus stops there. The views are incredible. The funicular rotates so everyone gets a fantastic view going up and down.
Do the walk if you are fit. We did the hike up which was actually harder than expected. Remember to bring enough water and perhaps something to eat. The feeling of doing the hike was so rewarding

A must see when in Cape town!. Whether you decide to climb the table mountain through the Kirstenbosch botanical garden or through the shorter and steeper way or just take the cable car up & down, this national park is a must see. Once you are up there the view is fantastic. Some days it may be cloudy and you might not see much, but if you hang around on the top doing a little hike you may see the clouds clear in some areas to give you at least a partial view. It has been my experience. I have been to the mountain many time through all different routes and it never ceases to amaze me how beautiful this mountain environment is. Flora & fauna are unique and taking time to look into details helps a lot. Don't miss it!

A must see. Table mountain is a must but you need be careful regarding the weather as the cloud rolls in over the mountain fairly quickly and the cable cars close so if the weather is clear take advantage and do it first as you never know

Fun ride up, great view at top!. We were lucky and had a nice day with great visibility! The cable ride up and back was fun! And the views from the top were spectacular. Although the lines can be long, it is well worth the wait!

What a view....... Buy tickets online before you get there it will save a lot of time in the long queues. Well worth the morning out though the views are spectacular, you can stay as long as you want up there, the cable car takes about 5 minutes to get to the top. You have to do Table Mountain when in Cape Town.
Great vistas. We were lucky to get to Table Mountain. It gets closed if there's a lot of wind. Check to see if it's open as soon as you arrive.
Amazing view from the top :). Beautiful tour. Great views, nice experience. We went late, so we got to see an amazing sunset, but also we were the lasts to come down, and it`s was preety cold.

Spectacular views. We took the cable car up to the top and decided to hike the mountain down. Many of the locals didn't believe our intention and were trying to put us off our plan - apparently it's more difficult to hike down the Table Mountain than to hike up. We did it anyway and it was great decision. It's not for all as the steps are really steep but we were aiming to get different experience, which turn to be amazing but little bit painfull afterwards :-) It usually take approx 2.5 hours but we needed more time because of taking loads of pictures and singing along the way :-) On top of the mountain we enjoyed spectacular views, photoshooting and hot chocolate from the cafe.

Hike up, it's rewarding!. Like many others, who decide to hike up to Table Mountain, we were rewarded by a good workout and fantastic views! We parked our car just before the last hairpin curve when you come up Tafelberg Road (or park just after). In this curve, called Kloof Corner, is a start (there are various options) for the hike. When taking this track, you walk steep uphill to the Contour Track, then turn left and walk more or less even (pass under the cable car) until you see the sign "Platteklip Gorge". Can't miss it as many others are coming up there. The first part on Contour Track we were by ourselves. It is pretty steep all the way with many big steps and requires a bit of fitness and determination...but it is rewarding! Take your time, breathe and enjoy the view. It took from Kloof Corner to the top of Platteklip Gorge 2 hours, slowly but continuously without stopping. Felt very satisfied once top! It is an icon and rightly so!
Mandatory. Don't miss the mountain, I think is mandatory for any traveller to cape town that can hike. Be prepared, is not a walk.
Beeeeautiful!!!!!. Breathtaking! Amazing! Loved it!!! The ride up was a bit crowded and a little annoying, but was definitely worth it!

Extraordinary Views. Nothing screams Cape Town more than Table Mountain. Even while still on the airplane before landing at Cape Town International Airport, I was already craning my neck to catch a glimpse of this South African icon. And boy, did it live up to its' hype once we set foot on its flat top.As a cautionary word to would be explorers of this attraction, this is by far the most weather dependent venue that you would visit in Cape Town. When the winds pick up, the cable car shuts down, effectively preventing one from going to the top unless you want to hike, which is an exercise of fitness and endurance considering the altitude and terrain. At over 3,000 feet above sea level, it offers views that are only paralleled by a helicopter tour of the area. We were very lucky that it was open on our very first try. By the way, I strongly advise purchasing your tickets online way ahead of time as it is valid to be used anytime within a 7 day period from your chosen date. The lines were very long but it was moving at a moderate speed. The cable car ride to the top was swift and offered a 360 degree view on the way up as the floor was revolving.Once on top, the views were nothing short of spectacular. We kept finding angles to take pictures that offered views that were better than the one before. There are multiple hiking paths to take that gives one an opportunity to gasp at the sheer panoramic beauty and unnerving cliff drops (just be careful as there are no guardrails on the edges to stop you from falling should you slip). After spending close to two hours exploring, we decided to slip into the restaurant for lunch. Unless you bring your own lunch, you have no option but to eat at the restaurant which serves pretty decent food.Lastly, DO NOT forget to lather on the sunscreen. I made the mistake of enjoying the cool breeze up there (bring a sweater as it can get rather cold) the entire time and I paid the price after. So go ahead, snap a gazillion pictures and enjoy it. You'll remember the scenery in your head for a long long time. It's absolutely worth flying such a long distance for.

Hike to the top!. After walking about 20 minutes from the bus stop to the start of this hike, it took us 2 hours to reach the top, and then we spent about an hour exploring and taking photos. We are a senior couple. The walk isn't easy, as it is a steep climb, but if you are in reasonable shape, take lots of water, and make frequent stops to catch your breath, think about doing it,
Incredibly diverse. Next time I will choose to hike up to the top of the mountain but besides that the range and scope of the national park is immense and exciting!

Fantastic view (with all the other tourists). We hiked up to the mountain. This I can recommend strongly! You get a totally different experience than when you do the cable car. At the plateu there are lots of tracks to take where you can see all of CT and its surroundings. There is also a gift shop and restaurant = tourist trap :)

I have lived in this city for nearly a quarter of a century and only recently discovered some of its treasures!. It was during the preparation training for a Kilimanjaro summit attempt, which I am pleased to advise to have since achieved, that we created a small support group (it is safer to go in groups) with whom I now regularly trek up to the top of Table Mountain, via the various trails the TMNP has to offer.The degrees of difficulty vary from one to another, but all have one common denominator...the stunning views and scenery!Whether it be Skeleton Gorge, Platteklip Gorge or the Pipe Track (and then using the Diagonal, which is not for the faint hearted !!), the experience is guaranteed to be awesome and memorable. Be sure to check the weather forecast beforehand and ensure favourable conditions, dress accordingly (appropriate layers of proper hiking gear, sunglasses and sunblock) and don't forget to bring enough water and some energy bars in your backpack.Lastly...a good camera or action camera to witness the event is highly recommended!

Best view of Cape Town. You can go to the top via the cable-car but if you like hiking, you should definitely climb this huge mountain (different possible paths, available on the internet but the most beautiful is the one from Kirstembosch Botanical Garden).
Spectacular Views. Choose a day with slight wind and sunshine and you will be blown away by the views of Cape Town from the top. There are some nice walks down as well.
Breathtaking. One of our favorite experiences on our trip. I can't recommend hiking the mountain enough. Challenging, but such a rewarding experience.
Good view.. Beware that the wait for the cable car up and back can be extremely long especially if the weather has been bad and the mountain was closed.

Fantastic view . After a long queue 40 minutes we were on our way up the mountain. Buy tickets in advance to jump the queue. Rotating cable car was great to see views on the way up. Weather at the top changes by the minute so go prepared with clothes. Terrific views over Cape Town a great way to spend a few hours.
Cablecar upTable Mountain. The lines are a little long but the wait is word it. The view from the top cannot be beat. Watch ships dock to unload cargo with a birdseye view.

Loved the sunset special. We decided to go for the sunset special which is half price (R120 per person return) Absolutely beautiful! We preferred the sunset trip to the day trip we have done in the past!

Highly recommend . If you are lucky to catch the cable way when its operating I highly recommend doing this trip. It is so beautiful up there and the cable car is so well organized. If you have a clear day Jump at the opportunity to go up

Beautiful view of Cape Town from lower station. You do not need to go with the cable car in order to see the beautiful views of Cape Town. So please go to the lower cable car station even when the weather at the top of Table Mountain is overcast. You can easily see all of Cape Town for free and without going to the top.

Yuo must go there!. Unique experience, to start the elevator that rises high, with incredible slope and at a good speed, the landscapes to cut the breath, the small animals that inhabit the mountain and several trails to know and see everything.

Wonderful view of Cape Town and Robben Island. When going to Cape Town, this is a must see. You could either walk all the way from the car park to the top (take your time, at least 1.5 hour single way, in parts really steep and rocky) or you could take the cable car. I did both to get the full experience. The cable car will rotate when going up, giving everybody awesome sights over Cape Town and beyond.When arriving at the top there is a nice restaurant, which serves some delicious Bobotie and one could do a couple of walks. Since it is easy to get lost once you wander off away from the restaurant, be sure to take some map with you and off course plenty of water.

Wonderful!. Best to join a tour to get here as there is no public transport. Food outlets are good. The Flying Dutchman Funicular railway (R55) to the lighthouse is a must do - if you're bad at heights just sit with your back to the view but it's a shame to waste such a marvellous opportunity to see the panorama. Hang on to your hats if there's a strong wind!

A must see, but be early there!!. Whenever you are in Capetown, you have to go there!!! But be early there, the queues are eternally long. The better way is to purchase the tickets before, then it is a lot faster!!! Also, it might be closed due to the wind in the afternoon. So the early bird is the best option!

Hike, don't ride!. A really good hike up. Flowers are beautiful. Lots of people on the trail so you can go yourself. Guides are available and have lots of fun stories. Ride the cable back down for another view of the beautiful area.

Stunning views - but give yourself plenty of time!. Of course, it's a Cape Town 'must', and the views from the top (and from the rotating cable car on the way up) are just as stunning as you'd expect. Pick your day carefully - check the weather forecast, and unless a clear day is in prospect, try another day, as you won't see a thing if the famous 'tablecloth' cloud is rolling over the summit. Also be aware that the queues can be enormous, and if you haven't pre-booked tickets, be prepared for a long wait in hot sunshine. It's worth it, though!

A Beauty in SA. Table Mountain has been on my bucket list for a while and I am really glad that I finally managed to make the trip to the top of the mountain. I love the cable car experience and I love the Dassies and the view even more. I'll be back next time I'm in CT.
stunning!. amazing view!! it seems like clouds are falling from the tablemountain like a waterfall. sunset was amazing too!
:o) Amazing ride up there!. The cable car ride up was phenomenal! Great photo opportunities, with VISA branding.The views were so picturesque. Never before have I seen such a naturally green city.

The Guardian of the mother city!!. Superb attraction. Please dont book any tours for this. Just book tickets online. The tickets are valid for one use through a week. This is important as the cable way can be closed anytime due to windy or cloudy conditions. Do this the moment u see a clear day. Carry a good camera and a jacket as the weather at the top can be very different as compared to the bottom of the cable way.

Table mountain visit. Visited Table mountain on a short break to Cape Town, attempted to visit a few times but due to the weather it wasn't worth travelling up but when we did it was definitely worth the visit as the views are stunning, a nice way to spend an hour or so. The only negative I would say was the price seemed a little expensive.
Loved it. Stopped off on the 'hop on hop off' bus that goes on circular tour.Luckily it wasn't covered in cloud & we had superb views from the top

Great Walk. . We took a cab up to the cable car but since the queue up was too long, we bought bottles of water and walked through the park and down to the city. Its a lovely walk in well prepared walking and biking tracks. A good variety of vegetation, birds and insects. Lovely wild pelargonias along the way. There are Park benches where one can take breaks and enjoy the view. A highly recommended walk or bike trip.
Overall its the view. it is a must if you got the chance .i must wait 3 Days.But also if you take the Hop on Hop Off Bus it is a good look from the Station.
Beautiful 360 views. Lots of great picture opportunities, perfect day to visit would be on a still calm day when there is little or no wind.
great view. great view, bit of a queue , book your tickets on line and go when its clear -dont wait you may not get another chance.

Blue sky views. This is worth the hike up - get the heart rate going and pause any time to just enjoy the view. There are multiple hiking routes so I'd suggest getting a map and stopping in at a tourist office before setting off. Also make sure that you get dropped off at the right spot before letting your taxi drive off! Best view in Cape Town.

An amazing experience.. This was my second visit to Table Mountain, last time it was nice and clear, this time the "tablecloth" was on! Nevertheless still wonderful. Get there early to beat the crowds.

Good View but Expensive for South Africans. The vie is very nice but the price for South African people need to be reviewed if you want to encourage tourism. The fee of R240 is expensive if you are paying in rands for a family of 4
Excellent Views!. EXCELLENT views of the mother City! A 360 view on top of the mountain gives a great perspective of the mother city.
Visit to the top. Great views once we got there. We had a nearly 1 1/2 queue for the gondola going up, then the mountain closed in the PM due o high winds.

On top of the world. Amazing views! I totally recommend this trip, I felt like I was on top of the world, Cape Town is beautiful and it was amazing to experience its beauty on table mountain. I went to the mountain around 3 p.m, it was a good day so skies were clear and the queue was not to long because it was now later in the day. I saw the sun set when I was up there too which an amazing experience and I saw Cape Town at night which was very pretty (all lit up).

Beautiful Views. We visited on a very busy day but discovered that this was due to the clear weather. If you see that it is a clear day go up because you may miss out on the great views if you go up on a cloudy day (all of the days following the day we went up were very cloudy). Be prepared to queue: would advise booking tickets online and arriving early.
A Must See. This is such a beautiful place. We took the cable car up and had a glass of champagne overlooking Cape Town. Make sure you keep your ticket. You have to have it to exit.

Flying visit.. My wife and i paid a quick visit to Cape Town for one night. We made a priority of takng the Cableway to the top of the Mountain. On reaching the top the Mountain was shrouded in cloud which is not uncommon. Within ten minutes the clouds parted and the views of Cape town and Robben Island were absolutely stunning. A visit to Cape Town simply must include a trip to the top of Table Mountain.
Amazing. One of the seven natural wonders of the world.. It is a must for anyone visiting Cape Town.... Buy your ticket before you get there as ticket queue is long....

Worth visiting. It was an awesome experience. I am writing to let the people know about the free guided tours they have on top of table mountain, the guides were informative but would have loved a longer tour.

What a View.. If you are visiting Cape Town you MUST visit Table Mountain. The view of the top is enchanting. You can see for miles all the surrounding sights in the distance. You can hike several trails on the top looking at several blooming flowers, small creatures lurking in the grasses or bushes. Remember to bring your camera and a hat because it may be windy on top of the. "Table" .
awe inspiring view. Table Mountain is incredible and awe inspiring! Fantastic vistas and watch and feel the clouds and fog roll in and out!
Stunning views!. Worth the hike! Beautiful views at the top and great to have the option to take the cable car down (just make sure it is running before you go).
World class. World class staff and facilities, staff at store and gift shop extremely professional and friendly. I would definitely rate this as a must see.

Stunning views on a clear day. Hiking up is one serious workout!. Like everyone else has said, if it's clear head up the cable car because it might not last long! My husband and I hiked from our hotel up to the top (6+miles and 2 hours). This hike is not for the faint of heart. We were the only ones going up. Many people passed us going down, but honestly that would have scared me more. Most of the hike is on rocks crawling up or down them. I was happy to go up so I didn't see how far I could fall. We arrived to the top just in time for the last ride down at 6pm. It was beautiful to see the sun setting and the lights coming on in the city below. Over 4,000ft of elevation gain so bring a jacket because it will be chilly at the top! Such a gorgeous view and a must do if it's clear. If you're looking for a great workout hike up to the top. It feels pretty rewarding to look up and know you conquered that mountain on your own two feet.

One of the 7 New Wonders of the World! . A must do and see! Very surprised just how magnificent it was when we got up there and we had already had 3 weeks of outstanding views throughout South Africa.

Beautiful views, fantastic hikes!. We planned initially for a morning (half day) visit but enjoyed the variety of walks and hikes so much we stayed the whole day! Such fantastic walks and trails- some challenging. Bring plenty of water and I would recommend a stop at the cafe (for excellent wraps and cakes).

Tiring but more than worth it!. We came here on a trip to Cape Town. The trek is tough and took us a couple of hours (needed breaks!) but the views are more than worth it! Incredible sites of the city and surrounding areas. We went in August which is their winter - cold in the shade but hot in the sun! Take layers, water and snacks!
Stunning. Most amazing view surrounded with so much beauty, blue water and the beautiful city and surroundings. A must see and highly recommended
A must. Such an iconic location, looking up at Table Mountain is mesmerising but once on top the views are breath taking. If you are in Cape Town this is a must.
Spectacular. After travelling up in the cableway car I was astounded at the amazing view overlooking Cape Town. Here we watched the sunset, truely magical.
Wow. What a view. What a view. Wow. Superlatives don't do this justice. Just be sure to book a clear day and the cloud can rather impact on the experience.

Not to be missed!. Great view over Cape Town and the Cape of Good Hope - not to be missed whilst in Cape Town! However don't miss your opportunity of a clear day: it can get overcast or the weather can change quickly in October.The cable car is great, we had a 10 min queue or so, not too bad.

A Must see for Cape Town. If you are visiting Cape Town for the first time, you must take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. It provides a fantastic view of the whole city. The cable car looks like it goes straight up when you see it from the base of the mountain, but the trip up was fast and smooth. The gondola rotates 360 degrees as it moves which gives you a view of everything without having to move. At the top they have a pretty good restaurant where you can get a hot meal or a snack, as well as a gift shop. Just two tips I would give: Leave early to avoid having to wait in line. Sometimes the wait can be up to two hours once the tour busses show up. Check the weather as the cable car will not run if the top of the mountain is fogged in or it is very windy.
spectacular view. A Must visit... Awesome breath taking view... Look out for a sunny day as weather changes in no time...

Well worth visiting, stunning views!. We walked along the path and took advantage of the many photographic opportunities. We went up in the cable car and were fortunate to spend a couple of hours before we had to leave due to clouds descending.

Fantastic views. You cannot come to Cape Town and not go up Table Mountain! Beautiful views/vistas and nice walking paths. We had the concierge at our hotel book our tickets and grabbed a cab to the cable car. Very little wait.

Must see! Outstanding beautiful.. No wonder it was declared as one of the seven nature wonders. There are well maintained paths, those on the plateau can be a bit crowded, especially when the weather is nice. Take one of the walks that go down and in a short while you are alone with nature. There are some difficult hikes down the mountain, do find out about it first. I would only go up when the weather is really good - ask the locals.
Wrong not to. Got to do this in CT. Cafe at the top not too bad if you are hungry either. Prepare to queue and maybe better to book tickets in advance online. Good walks at the top.
Breathtaking view !. Be ready for cool and cloudy, lines can be long in season but worth the wait. The views on the drive up are as spectacular as the views from the top.
Stunning views. This is well worth a visit and any queues. When you reach the top,you can explore all around with spectacular scenery . A really good time and a chance for some super pics

Exciting ride with acable car!. It's exciting to ride up to the table Mountain with a cable car which is spinning inside. You have to watch out for the good weather to go up there. Table Mountain National Park is huge: it extends until the Cape of Good Hope.

Longest queue I've ever been in!. Don't be fooled by buying your tickets on line to save queuing you still have to join huge queue to get on cable car! We stood from 9.30am to 11.20am before getting up the mountain. Website said queuing time 5 minutes! Awesome once you're up there though.
it's BIG oh so BIG.. Great for to see the view's, you can hike or just walk if you wantshops, toilets , frequent buses, take a coat ,cheap as chip's for what you get.....

Fantastic views (weather permitting). Nice walking trails. Cable car access.. Beautiful views. You can walk up (if you have the time / energy) or take the cable car which rotates. This cable car provides all riders with the opportunity to see different views. The windows rotate as well providing riders with unobstructed views without windows for photos as you ride up / down the mountain. Make sure the sun is shining! Otherwise, the ride to the top, view at the top, and walking trails are not worth the time or money. Hint: Plan enough time as there can be long lines to access the cable car going up as well as the return trip.
Fabulous views. Outstanding views at the top on a clear day. Try to set aside at least 2 days in case the first day has cloud cover.

A Beautiful Sight and Experience. Table Mountain was easy to get to, the cable car ride short and exciting, and the various paths and walkways revealed beautiful views at every turn. We stayed for about 2 hours and wished we had longer but were leaving Cape Town that day. Going early is a good idea as it gets very crowded, especially on a beautiful weekend day which is what we were lucky enough to experience.

An absolute must. It's no the No1 Cape Town attraction for no reason, but being so makes it very busy. We had a hire car for our CT holiday and the first time we went to the cable car we literally could not get a parking place on the mountain. The following day we took a taxi, easy to organise, drops you off outside the front door and there are plenty more waiting when you return. Cheap and efficient it's well worth it

Must visit!!. Listed in 7 wonders of nature, the nature reserve is a mandate to visit.The panaromic view of cape town from the top of the mountain is pure bliss. Advice for visitors is to check on weather prior to visiting the reserve. Weekday late afternoon is a perfect time to skip the queue and relish the beauty of the mountain and cableway ride.

Great walks. If you are in Cape Town, this cannot be missed. Get up early and start walking around Lion's head. Take in the breathtaking views and wonder at the range of flowers and changes in vegetation.See 12 apostles .

Table top.. Did the hop on hop off bus, then cable car up to the peak. The views are well worth the visit. It is very easy to get to and once on the top you can do walks. Also there are souvenir shops and coffee shops.
a beautiful landmark. This is one trip worth making especially if you are a Capetonian.Everything is well maintained and in working order with breathtaking scenery.Definitely well worth a trip

Fabulous virws. Cable car very busy and bit of a wait in long queues but well worth it once your on top of Table Mountain, fantastic 360 degree views, great for photographs, there is the facility for abseiling down for the brave also. We loved the few hours we were up there and would have stayed longer had we not been on a tight schedule. Shop and restaurant at the top, unsure of what they were like as we did not try them.

Panoramic View. One can choose to walk up or take the cable car. The cable car has a rotating floor offering everyone 360 degree view. On the days with a clear sky, it’s a must visit place. Wear comfortable shoes so that you can walk around for long comfortably. You can see lion’s head and devil’s head (names of different sights) on the two sides, signal hill, robben island and the Cape Town stadium along with long stretches of beautiful landscapes. The coffee shop at the top is a good option to refresh at. The earlier you reach, shorter the queue and crowd. Spend couple of hours to soak in the beauty of Cape Town. We loved the complimentary photo frames as souvenirs!

Excellent Views and Must See. A visit to Cape Town would not be complete without a trip to the top of Table Mountain. The easy way to do so is to use the cable car to the top. There are a range of walking trails and it is a popular spot for rock climbing. The views from the top of the mountain are sensational, and worth the effort. We were in Cape Town for four days and had two clear days with the mountain in full view. If you are limited for time, try to keep a flexible schedule so that you can climb the mountain.Thanks for your vote if you found this review helpful.
Fantastic Views. This was a great day for my wife and I. Get their early in the day to avoid lines. Plan to wear comfortable shoes so you can walk around
You must go here. How much can you say about Table Mountain that hasn't already been said? Walk up or take the table car, either way you must visit.
Very interesting park to walk!. The park was very nice at Capepoint but also at Cheapman's Peak! We walked a long time to the 2 lighthouses and the view was Great!
Got to go. A must see if you r in Cape Town. Fantastic views over Cape Town. You can walk all around the national park. Cafe close to cable car that sells coffee etc.

Long lines but worth the visit. The day we went to Table Mountain, it was a school holiday, perfect weather in days and children were free! Need-less-to-say, the lines were over 2 hours long. We decided to try back later in the day and as we were leaving, I noticed a sign for on-line ticket holders. The line was super short (like 10 people) and they by passed the long 2 hour line! We left the a area, found Wi-Fi, logged onto the Table Mountain website, bought our tickets and went to a Pick and Pay to get them printed out as there is no option to send them to your phone. Super easy. We went back after lunch and the regular line was still a 2 hour wait. With our on-line tickets in hand, we by passed the line to purchase tickets and immediately got in line for the tram. We still waited for the tram for about 20 minutes but that was nothing compared to what we were facing otherwise. Great views and worth the trip but purchase your tickets in advance!

great views. amazing views. only the short guided tour was available which was a little disappointing and they could do with few more signs for self guided walks. The disabled assistance was great. The staff were extremely helpful. This is weather dependant so check the weather and plan according.
top table great view. a must for a visit to Cape Town and bigger than you might expect at the top awesome views saw some people climbing up looked to scary for me

A must do!. We purchased our tickets on the internet and chose a good day with A clear sky. Fyi, the tickets purchased over the internet are refunded in case they aren't used, so it is always worth buying them in advance. The tickets prices are 240 Rands, so about 20 USD. We took the cablecar to the top and enjoyed there the breathtaking view of capetown. An amazing variety of plants can be found there on the top and we also had the opportunity to see the dassies lyimg on the rocks , watching the visitors passing. Allow yourself two hours to walk and benefit from different sides views. Wonderful pictures can be made up there!!!! A nice self service is available at the top for those whom the mountain air made feel hungry. Unfortunately the shop at the top was already closed when we left (they should consider extending their opening times to 19:00, the hour at which the last cablecar leaves as most of visitors will be leaving then). The cablecar ride is amazing and fast. We get tonthe top in a couple of minutes and the view is fantastic. A must do!

A must see. Great view of the area and even Robben Island. There is a cue to getup, however getting tickets before was a faster way of getting on the cable car. All views in the cable car are great. The floor rotates so you see what everyone else sees. Also wait till the fog lifts so the view is clear. You can take as much time as you would like, on the top so read the interesting notes of the views. Seeing the Indian ocean meet up with the Atlantic was real cool.
Unforgettable trip. Scenic viewWell managed tripPoints for improvementsNo enough safety barricating on top.Parking issue...space available but not clearly marked.

Well worth getting there early. The earlier you go, the shorter the queues and fewer people on the trails. Outstanding views going up and when on top. Beware that the floor of the cable car rotates - giving everyone on board a full view.

Amazing cable car ride to the top of the bottom of the world.. Another must see in Cape Town. Try for a clear day for the best views. Absolutely breathtakeing. Great pathways and the plants and animals are amazing. 360 degree view of Cape Town and area.
Spectacular. A must see! Tours are available for the waterfront near Victoria Plaza. Spend at least a couple of hours to enjoy the breathtaking scenery.

Awesome. An absolute must do.We were lucky to have a crystal clear day and spent a few hours exploring the mountain top & enjoying some chilled rose over the city views.Definitely buy tickets online first - this saved waiting in a huge queue. Definitely take sunblock if it's sunny - we underestimated how long we'd spend up the top & how hot it was... both got sunburnt.

Great funicular ride and the greatest views!. Do not miss this Unesco heritage site. It is spectacular both in the views, the settings and information provided along the walking path. It is well maintained and totally clean without any traces of a million visitors a year.

Must Do CapeTown. This is an absolute must as the views from the top are spectacular!!! Make sure to go on a day when the wind is low and there isn't a lot of cloud and don't leave it until the end of the trip as the weather in Cape Town can change in a second!
Not to be missed!. Stunning view over Cape Town. Take the red tourist bus to the station, and then the rotating cable car up to the summit (you can buy the cable car ticket at the tourist bus stop).

vantage point. nice place to visit, you can go by cable car and foot down(2.5 hours) on your way back. Wear sports or hiking shoes, if you have plans to hike, take along sufficient drinking water, a hat and a sun block
amazing. unbelievable views and blue ocean as far as the eye can see. the cableway is a pleasure to use with the priority queueing system

Breathtaking Beauty, and incredible views of the coast and Cape Town city centre.. The wait for tickets may have been a problem but we were advised to purchase the ticket on the tour bus, so that avoided a considerable wait in the queue. Once in the cable car the panoramic views of the city unfolds, and you are left in wonder of the beauty of this magnificent city, surely the most beautiful in all the world. There is a very adequate restaurant on the top of Table Mountain and good facilities and a shop that provides good quality souvenirs and African art.

Must see experience.. Table Mountain is a must see experience. It provides 360 degree views of Cape Town and the surrounding areas and the views are fabulous, as is the vegetation, flowers and landscape on top of the mountain. Two recommendations for visiting: 1) Take the walk to Maclear's Beacon; it is about 45 minutes each way that gets you away from the crowds and provides wonderful views, landscape, etc.2) Buy tickets online for the first day that you are in Cape Town; the tickets are good for 7-14 days, allows you to avoid some lines, and provides some assurances that you will actually be able to go up the mountain as it closes on windy days.

One of the best things we have done as a couple!. After our South African tour guide told us that many people do this in 2 hours, we went for it. I am a marathoner and knew I should be able to do this with ease.....not so! We took the "shortest" path and it was not too crowded. However, it was quite steep! I am only 5/1" and found that in some sections, each step was quite high. We had to stop several times to catch our breath and by the end, we were both drenched with sweat. But being that we love outdoor activity, we found it fun, exhilerating, and were actually quite glad it was challenging....and when you reach the summit, the most amazing 360 degree views of Cape Town. Hands down worth a strip....and go up the hard way....come down on the Gondola!
Amazing view. We hiked the mountain at 4:30 and then watched the sunset up there and took the cable back down - amazing!!!

Great morning out . When you come to Cape Town this is a must. Never book your tickets before you get here as its best to check the weather on the day. First thing in the morning is going to be best. Booked out tickets with the red bus tours and it's faster. Totally beautiful up there and free wifi to Twitter or Facebook while your there. Have fun and enjoy like we did.

A great place to get a magnificent view of CapeTown. We were lucky that the weather was perfect to be at the top of the mountain. It was pretty cold up there but bearable and not too windy. Awesome buffet lunch and love the ostrich meat and sausage. Wines selection were really good too. Everyone visiting Cape Town has to go up here!

you have to be weather lucky. Make sure you check the forecast, it can be hit and miss to find the cable car working, and also I would highly recommend using the open top bus for transport as parking is an issue

Don't delay going if weather clear. We chose to have a later arrival at our hotel to go up Table Mountain as the weather was clear.This was a good decision as we never saw the mountain again as it was covered in clouds/mist.At the top there were paths marked with the different time it took to walk each one.Plenty of excellent views were to be had from many positions around the mountain top.There is a restaurant and toilets up the top.There are many large boulders lying around,I expected a grassy flat top.It was nice watching the clouds roll in around the mountain lower down.

If the weather is good/clear. Big mountain in cape town, very famous, several walks to the top, at least 3 hours walk, or take the cable car to the top, just a few minutes, at the top there several walks , if you can do the plattekop walk to the top, very nice views.

Truly amazing.....a must in Cape Town ! . It's not number 1 for no reason. Completely outstanding and I had not looked into what was at the top of the cable car, I was overwhelmed! Spent a good couple hours up there, take a picnic on an good day and you can spend hours and hours! Word of warning though, the first day you're in Cape Town and weather is suited, get up it as you may miss the opportunity if the weather (especially wind, cloud and rain) rolls in.

Fantastic. Check the weather before you go up the fabulous Table mountain either by cable car or hiking . The view is stunning and the walk on the top give you wonderful view of the city and surrounding. We did not hike up because of some negative warnings from forum but should have done it ! At the top we met a lot of people hiking up from the gorge ( the trail starts a few kilometer further from the base where you take the cable car ) . The hike takes about 1h1/2 and there is no security issue as long as you start in the morning to be up by noon and in a beautiful day there are always a lot of people. The cable car is also very nice with stunning views . Give yourself a lot of time because the line might be long for the cable car .Definitely one must do when visiting Capetown !

dominates all of cape town. The park is enormous and extends all the way down to the Cape of Good Hope. It is magnificent and very varied - ocean, beach, penguin colony, mountain top and all in between
Beautiful views over the bay and whole of Cape Town. A must for any traveller. Took the cable car up to the mountain. Spent a few hours up there. Free guides available once you are on the top.

Excellent views to the city and the whole cape area. Try visiting on a sunny/clear day, the mountain top provides 360 views to the amazing and mesmerizing city,near by beaches and if you are lucky you can spot Cape Point.
You can spend an hour or a day.
For me, this is a place I would definitely want to visit again someday.

You can't change the weather !. We had planned to go up the mountain one day, but didn't get round to it until the next day - by which time it was cloudy and we couldn't see anything when we got up there !

SA Wonder of the World - Table Mountain. A trip to Cape Town is not complete without a visit up Table Mountain. Very efficient ticket sales counter. Staff are polite and friendly and interact pleasantly with patrons. Excellent views whilst going up in the cable car. The mountain itself is well signposted and walking far distances is pleasant and not uncomfortable. The views are breath-taking.
Lovely trip by cable car up the mountain. The top thing to do in the Cape. Fun trip up. Great hiking options, amazing views. A nice couple of hours or full day.

Nice View, Nothing More!. Going up Mountain Table sure offers a nice view, but nothing more. In case you are a person who has traveled, you will not find it very spectacular, especially with the over-priced cable car ride.
worth a trip. get there early. buy tickets online. take warm clothes for the winds.dont worry where you stand on the cable car- it rotates
Stunning views. Do not miss this trip. enjoy the trail walk on top and read all the very interesting signs. very hard to spot the wild life but give it a go.
Beautiful views. Plenty to do and see wild life views of the area lots of walks available in the area. I would imagine good for back packing

Fab views and a lovely natural feature. We enjoyed Table Mountain, the views are stunning but you don't need too long unless you plan to hike up instead of using the cable car. We got online tickets which were valid for several days which is just as well as the weather dictates whether it will be open to visitors or not. So you have to be flexible with your plans a little. There is a shop, cafe and toilets at the top. We got a cab there but the Hop On/Off bus back down which was great. We found the shop a little limiting and the staff a little distracted but otherwise it's nice. There wasn't an awful lot of information on the mountain itself - we wondered if there was some reason that it was so flat but couldn't find out!
awesome. book online if you want to go during day. No line just before closing so take a bottle of wine and watch sunset

Fantastic Views. We literally shot up here as we arrived in Cape Town as the weather was so nice. The queue wasn't too bad, although I think we were lucky as when there are a couple of bad weather days and then a good clear day the queues can be terrible. Please bear in mind that if you queue for a couple of hours to get up there you'll be queuing for a couple of hours to get back down as well. Some people choose to do the 3 hour walk up to the top, we had a friend that did the intermediate climb but that did involve some rock climbing so if you want an easier walk go for the beginners. The views up top are outstanding and I would say this is a must do if you visit cape town.

Best Views of Capetown!. This was by far one of my favorite things to do in South Africa. The views from up there are just spectacular and there's so many great vintage points. A must do while in Capetown!

BREATHTAKING!. Buy your ticket before you go or order online and show your email confirmation on entry. The top clouds over fairly regularly so don't attempt to visit if not a really clear day. We had to go up twice as a result but well worth it especially at sunset.

A place you must visit. If you have the chance to go to Cape Town, please head to the Table Mountain National Park. You will not regret it.You can join the place by cable car, or on foot (steep hike, but worth it). On top, you will have one of the best view of the world. The park is very close to the city, and can be done in a half day.

Unbelievable views of Cape Town!. Was lucky enough to visit Table Mountain on a beautiful sunny day so could appreciate the stunning views of Cape Town! In order to avoid the queues on a beautiful sunny day it is better to book online!
Views to dye for. If you don't have vertigo I recommend to take the bus tour and then the cable car, the views from up there are amazing.

A hike on Table Mountain. It was a beautiful sunny day when we hiked Table Mountain. It is an amazing place you feel like you are on top of the world. The scenery is unbelievable and it is a wonderful way to see Capetown

Everywhere you look, a breathtaking view.. Spend a few hours here exploring the site. Watch out for loose rocks and scurrying furry friends in the rocks in the more remote locations. Look high and low and venture in all directions because the panorama is so varied.

Stunning!. We were in Cape Town at the beginning of September. As we were there at the start of spring it was touch and go whether we would be able to even get to experience Table Mountain - the first day it was too windy to go up, and days 2 and 3 it was too cloudy. Luckily on our last day in Cape Town the cloud lifted and we were able to go up. We got on a City Sightseeing bus which, as well as giving us a good little tour of the Cape, took us right up to the entrance. As we were there out of season we were lucky in that we didn't have to queue for the cable car and within 5 minutes of arriving we were travelling up to the top! It's hard to put into words just how amazing this experience was - the views are spectacular. Once you are at the top you can go wandering off and you are able to take some magnificent photos. I can imagine in high season this could get very busy but when we were there we were able to experience all the views with very little interruption. Words can't do Table Mountain justice, you really do have to experience it yourself.

pre book and then wait for right weather. I would suggest buying tics online they are valid for a number of days and refundable in case of a no show. Then keep checking for weather to see when you can plan this visit
Spectacular. We experienced the top of the mountain at sunset, the colours, views and ambience were nothing short of spectacular
Wonderful Experience. Lovely exciting place to visit. Excellent views of Cape Town and scenery and environs of the two oceans.

Up, Up and Away. We were so lucky to strike a clear, still day. Wonderful to wander up top enjoying the view and the wildlife - lots of birds, lizards and relaxed dashi(?) - a bit like large guinea pigs!
awesome view. One of the best places to be in the world. A stunning view makes this place the top 5 places to visit in the world before you die!

Great trip . We took a cable car to the top of table mountain a must if you are visiting Cape Town , on top are the best views of the city , there is a old building on the top it is beautiful , the cloud on top forms a table cloth look on the flat surface of the mountain so try to go on a clear day , a lovey day out don't miss it
wonderfull view. its a best place for making photos, you can see all Cape Town city down... and also a train is fine :)

Amazing Views. If you are in Cape Town, you definitely have to check out the views from the top of Table Mountain. They are amazing. There is also a little hiking you can do up at the top, even if you are not hiking up Table Mountain, so wear shoes that can handle it, if that is something that you would like to do.

Perfect on a sunny day. When we arrived in Cape town the sun was shining and we followed the advice to go to Table Mountain immediately, glad we did because the next 2 days clouds were obscuring the mountain. The cable car wasn't too busy, only 5 minutes wait for a ticket plus another 30-40 minutes in the cable car queue . Views were very nice. We did part of the walk to the highest point.The self-service restaurant had a good buffet with tasty dishes, something that rare to find at tourist hot-spots. It was a reasonable 20 zar / 100 gr.

Walk up, cable down!. Take the opportunity to walk up one of the paths to the top of table mountain. To strive for a goal and then reach it gives a much more rewarding experience than to just take the cable car and watch the view for half an hour and then go down again. You can still take the cable car down once you're up there.

Incredible views!. Table mountain is a must see if you are in Cape Town. Amazing views, so calmed, so much silence and good air o breath.In mid September we didnt have a great weather though.We were lucky cause all the clouds were gone once we were on the top.

A must see if in Cape Town. Staying at a hotel right at the base of Table Mountain National Park, we watched to cable cars travel up and down the face of this enormous mountain side. Our last day of visit, we took in the Aerial cableway and traveled to the top. The views are spectacular from the top. Quite windy so a jacket will be needed.

Absolute knockout !!!. Following a brilliant cable ride up onto Table Mountain we were treated to the most breathtaking views over Cape Town. We were extremely lucky weatherwise with clear blue skies so that we could see for miles. A truly memorable experience !!!
Impressive Iconic Views. Sadly the weather was not great, extremely windy, poor visibility,however it was magical to be in such an iconic venue with breathtaking views across the city.

Great attraction. Must do Capetown attraction. We bought tickets on line - highly recommended as it cuts down on the lines. Was a busy day we were there as the previous days had been cloudy. Got a lucky crystal clear day. Cable Car ride is quick but fun....and rotating floor guarantees great vistas for all
Must visit on a clear day!. Stunning views of Cape Town . I visit CT on an annual basis and feel this is worth a visit once a year. Love the new cable car which adds to the spectacular views.

Well-organized despite the crowds. Arrived at cable-car at lunch-time on a beautiful wind-free Cape Town day to find long queues to get onto the cableway. Our initial concern at this was soon allayed as the lines moved swiftly and the crowds well-organized by helpful staff. The trip up in the cable car was excellent as despite the crowds the cable car was nut unduly overloaded. The restaurant on the mountain was overcrowded and we abandoned any thought of getting refreshments. However, the views of Cape Town from the top of the mountain were breath-taking. This is a MUST for anyone visiting Cape Town for the first time.
Must see for the spectacular views.. Very efficient cable car system whisks you to the top and a spectacular view in minutes. You can see the whole cape from the top and it is a photo must.

Tough hike up for the best views! . We hiked up Platteklip Gorge which was a more difficult hike than expected, it took us just under 2 hours and was very steep in some sections. The path is well marked and whilst difficult, there's plenty of places to stop, cheery fellow hikers also struggling on and the most beautiful views over Cape Town. It's an experience I'm very pleased I've had.The views from the top are incredible. We picked the day the weather forecast as clearest and we got it right. We could see all down the Cape as well as over Cape Town and north/inland. Just beautiful. There's a restaurant and gift shop at the top. Decent food, definitely needed and deserved after the climb. We bought our cable car tickets down in the gift shop avoiding the long queues at the bottom. A great morning trip!We got a taxi from our Cape Town hotel having dropped our hire car off when arriving in the capital and I'm glad we did. Cars were parked all up the road to the lower cable car stop and we'd have added a good 30 mins onto the hike if we'd driven. The taxi cost around 100 Rand each way and dropped us right at the start of the Gorge track. The queue for tickets was long when we got back down around 1pm. Definitely recommend buying on line!

Sunset of all sunsets!. We arrived about 5:30 in the afternoon and didn't have to wait in line because of the lateness of the day. The view at the top was phenomenal. We stayed long enough to watch the gorgeous sunset and the lights of Cape Town. The weather was perfect with no wind. It was a wonderful last evening in Cape Town.

A MUST. We drove there went on a relatively quiet day but still had to park a 15 minutes walk to the entrance.For people with walking difficulties a taxi would be advisable. Our journey to the top was quick as there was only a small queue.There are fantastic views from the top.If you just stay near the gondola station a couple of hours are enough to explore the area on good paths.
Photo Shoot Opportunity. Make sure that it is a clear day and go early in the morning to avoid long ticket lines. Pre buy your ticket to the cable car online to avoid super long lines.
Fabulous. A must do in Cape Town, sometimes there's a queue but its worth waiting for the Cable Car. Views are just wonderful East, West, North and South.

On a clear day you can see forever!. What awonderful place to visit, just make sure it is not cloudy. I loved the view of the ocean and the water crashing on the rocks. The ride in and around the park was spectacular and well worth the time'
nice spend of half a day. it's nice. amazing view, we took the cabel up and join the free tour, it was nice to walk around and see landscape view of beautiful Capetown

Nice hike with great views (depending on the weather). Weather plays a big part of whether or not this hike will be worth it. The weather changes so quickly in Cape Town, that it can be sunny one minute, and completely cloudy the next. It would be a shame to hike it and meet clouds at the top. But if you're lucky, you'll be greeted by great views.We went in blindly, and didn't realize there were so many ways to the top. It wasn't always clear where we were going when the trail forked, but luckily a few walkers guided us back in the right direction. We ended up on the path with stone steps. It can be quite steep at times, and it is NOT an easy hike. I'm not saying it's an all day hike. But some sections can be pretty vertical. It was much more difficult than we anticipated. But even still, I think it only took us 90 minutes. The views at the top are very nice. We had a mix of clouds/sun, so it was a mixed bag for us. I can imagine it's quite stunning on a sunny day. We elected to take the cable car down. Going down those steep steps would have been rough on the knees. If you're in shape and want a nice workout, I'd recommend hiking it. If you're not up for a good hike, take the cable car.

Absolute Must Do!. As other reviews attest... this is a must do. The cable car ride up is worth the price, and if at all possible pick your day for perfect weather as the views are wonderful. Wandering the paths at the top is easy and relaxed, and enjoying a bite to eat or a beverage is delightful in the sunshine, or if you are lucky as the clouds roll in and the breeze drifts the mist over the edge of the table! A wonderful way to spend a good part of a day.

must see. This is a must see! Unfortunately we had to stay in queue for almost 1.5 hours to get up by cable car. Avoid the queues, make sure you book your tickets ONLINE. Also keep in mind that parking spaces are limited.

The beauty that is Cape Town . Beautiful views from this side of Cape Town. Table Mountain clearly visible on the background. Visitors have an option to use the cable car or hike up /down the mountain. A must do!!

A must to visit when in Cape Town.. Table Mountain is one of the most spectacular places in Cape Town- I do recommend hiking up mountain and taking cable car down. Please don't walk on your own rather stick to groups of 3 of hike a guide to accompany you. Also on decend take cable car down for more beautiful views of the city of Cape Town.

Breath taking as usual. Been up Table Mountain over 4 times, it never failed to take my breath away.Be sure to go up on a sunny day if you can, the view are that much more amazing, also plan to be there for sunset, its absolutely breath taking.You can get tickets before, but if you have a data plan, just get the ticket as you get there on your mobile phone and you can bypass a large part of the line.

Amazing view of Cape Town. The view is very good, you will be able to view most of Cape Town's landmarks.
Use the Hop on Hop off bus ticket, you can combine the city sightsseing with the Table Mountain ticket.

Thrilling ride in the cable car. Fantastic views and good facilities at the top. Well worth the effort and the queues for tickets.
We did not do the absailing but several younger people were keen to try it.
Impressive View. Took the cable car to the top of the mountain. Incredible view of Cape Town and the shoreline. Lines can be very long, but with a tour you by-pass the long wait.

to redo this year as last visit was not the best. Do not blame it on the mountain but on the bad weather ...we went up, it was cold, very cloudy and foggy that we could not see more then a meter ahead and after ten minutes in the freezing wind we decided to give it another try on our next trip (turned out to be more windy) so the plan is that this year we will give it a third go!

Easy hike with great views. Definitely worth a trip but bring layers as it gets cold on top! The hardest "hike" doesn't take more than an hour and is mainly flat. The only downside is that it's a highly touristy place.

A must See and Visit. What an experience, you have to visit this Historical place when in Cape Town. The views are simply breath-taking and should you arrive at sunset all the better!! Simply amazing and one needs to experience it for themselves to truly appreciate the beauty of this Landmark, completely worth the money!

Table Mountain views. Cable lift (4 mins) is superb, it rotates 360 deg whilst in motion, book your tickets in advance, queues are long. Views are excellent, dependant on weather naturally. Has to be on anyones list of things to visit.

Go when the sky is clear. This is a must see and do experience - either by hiking or by cable car. The views from above and the walk around the top are amazing. Watch the abseiling guests who will blow your socks off! The shop at the top is reasonably priced and has some treasures. There are great photo opportunities all around. Go explore on a clear day and you will love it.

Must see if you are in Cape Town. Every time I am in Cape town, I climb the Table Mountain for its view and its beauty. I do it as a trail runner on foot but you can get there by the cable car, unfortunately ques might be a few hours long.

unbelievable. What a fantastic vista to one of the new wonders of the world. Fantastic views from the top, great walks perfectly laid out and explained, with plenty rest stops. Make sure you take a jacket or cover, as the mist rolls in very quick and sudden. Coffee shop was chaos with lack of thought into layout but still good value. Going up the chairlift was fun as it goes round through 360%. Book this part online as saves the 2 hour queuing. If brave you can apsail down part of the way. Just stunning and a must see and tick the box.

Breathtaking. Capetown is Table Mountain.
If you don't see this then you have wasted your trip!!!!
The free guided walks are in formative, but make sure you do not go up when cloudy

On a clear day - DO IT. We tried two years ago at Christmas, and the line was too long. We tried our first day back in Cape Town and it was foggy.When it was clear, we raced up there. There was a line, but it was worth the wait. GORGEOUS. You can't believe how big the area is once you get up there. You can do as little or as much as you want. And the ride up is spectacular.

Breathtaking and not to be missed!!. We finished a 2 1/2 week safari trip with a visit to Cape Town. Impressive Table Mountain is the first thing you see as you approach from the air. An affordable funicular is available to take you to the top if you don't care to make the climb yourself. Above the clouds , the views are breathtaking and not to be missed!!! One caveat...be sure to go on a clear day.

An arduous climb with maximum rewards!. Having climbed the mountain years ago, my husband and I wanted to share the experience and thrill with eight of our closest friends, all of whom are in their 50s and very fit. With the help of good friends who live in Cape Town, we selected the fastest, 2-hour route, Plettenberg Gorge, a 4.3 mile climb (as in a steep, stair-like climb) and 2,348 foot ascent. It was grueling in spots and required a razor-like focus. Turning around made some dizzy. I'm truly thankful that we took what was touted as the "easy route" because anything else would have required skills we did not possess, even if we had had a guide. If you plan to go, the Plettenberg Gorge is a great and safe route. Hiking up from Kirstenbosch Gardens is also safe, far less arduous although the trail to the top takes five hours and includes rope ladders and a few steep runs. Anything else on Table Mountain requires a guide!
Wonderful view! Excellent ride!. The Table Mountain is the most interesting place to visit around Cape Town. From his top you can have excellent views from Cape Town City and surrounding.
amazing. this is one of 7 amazing place in the world, and must see ! will enjoy the bird's eye view of cape town and surroundings

4 hour visit. We drove down from Cape Town - fantastic via Chapmans Peak - we should have spent longer here - there are superb walks - we went to the Point and Cape of Good Hope - wonderful - Will definitely return and spend more time - invigorating!
the ride up by cable car.. Cable car services are provided to go up to the top of table mountain.the ride is fantastic and you feel as if you are hanging in the air!
Awesome. Wonderful experience at the top of the mountain.Good walks and super views. We ere lucky to be there on a clear sunny day

Breathtaking View. We stayed at Cape Town for two weeks. Therefore we were able to wait for the perfect wheather to visit the table mountain. It should be less wind, otherwise the cableway will not be in operation. I advise to enter table mountain in the morning, because as longer you wait, the cableway becomes more crowded. At the top you can walk some trails, enjoy great views in all directions. Visiting the table mountain is an absolute must.

Spectacular scenery!. We had a wonderful time visiting Table Mountain, particularly wandering around up top, as well as the views of Cape Town and beyond. Go on a clear day, but be forewarned that everyone else will be doing the same, and get your ticket for the cable car on-line, as it saves at least 30 minutes of waiting on line.

Super Awesome Table Mountain. Table Mountain is great. After the cable car up you have a chance to hike around on top of the Mountain. Easy to walk sidewalk trails for the non adventurous and areas to hike for the more outdoorsy. There are unlimited stunning views in all directions when walking around. Plus keep an eye out for the wildlife it is abundant if you look closely. The cafe on the top is very nice with surprisingly good prices. I highly recommend the carrot cake...totally delicious.
A must see - stunning views on all sides. Take the time to do this. Waited in line but very efficient, and the wait was worth it. The view is stunningly beautiful.
A Must-See. Amazing wonder of nature...so majestic! Loved the Dassies. Make sure you pre-book on line as the line-up was ridiculous!
Tops!!!. The weather was perfect so made for a perfect afternoon walking around and watching two gals repel off the side of the mountain

Check the forecast before you go. When we climbed Table Mountain, the fog was so dense that we could barely see our hands. We thought it would clear up, but instead, it got worse as the hike progressed. It was a fun adventure, but not worth the money for the cable car down. (The fog was so thick that we couldn't even tell that the cable car was moving!)

Take the Blue Line & Call It a Day. Depending on what list you want to read, Table Mountain is truly a natural wonder. The only problem is that everyone who comes to Cape Town wants to see it. Best bet: Take the Blue line bus tour which takes you to the top of Table Mountain. Here you can get out and wait up to 3 hours to take the 5 minute cable car to the very top. But why? Plenty of time for photo opps and the bus tour is fab. Allow 2 hours and you can get off as you please. If you take a car, beware of a long climb up by foot and not advised.
Best of Western Cape. One of the best parks in the world! Relatively cheap to enter and go hiking. Beautiful mountains on one end and seaside on the other!
a must. on a sunny day you must visit and explore it, it has many views of the cape horn and nice walkways with panoramic views, it might take 4-7 hours depending of your activity,

Love my Mountain!!. I was long last up the mountain as I have lived overseas many years. Back now and had a friend visiting and took him up the mountain. OMG still breathtaking and the set up is very well done! Highly recommend this attraction.

Close encounter with Nature. Nice scenic views enjoyed it on a warm sunny day. The included free tour was also interesting. Don't touch the foliage because there is a plant out there worse than any poison ivy you ever encountered.

Great for hiking, but come prepared!. If you're hiking up table mountain, I recommend being fairly fit. Start early, bring water, and WEAR HIKING SHOES. If you like hiking though, it's definitely a fantastic experiece! I started in the botanical gardens, and climbed up Skeleton Gorge. Lovely hike, quite steep at times. And the view from the top is definitely worth it!
A must in Cape Town. Amazing view of the city and the bay... unfortunately we find some clouds... and wind... and cold.... suggested at sunset for pictures

Astonishing. I was prejudiced as I have been in many such places before. But this place worths to visit. Spare at least a half day as you may want to walk on the mountain which I strongly suggest. You may also climb the mountain instead of having the cable car. There are three different paths to climb. The duration of climbing differs from 3 and a half hours to two and a half hours depending on the path you choose. You can reach the cable car point with hop on hop out buses, if you by the cable car ticket with the bus ticket you will not need to wait the ticket line. There is always a line infant of the cable car.
One of the finest views in the world. Breathtaking in every respect this really is one of the planets most important places - literally at the end of the world!

Views are magnificent. Table Mountain on a clear day is one of the highlights of Cape Town and one of the natural wonders of the world. You can see all the way to Cape Point and across the bay on both sides. The cableway up and down makes it easy to access. There are paths of differing difficulty up and down the mountain, but do not undertake that trek lightly. Up is said to be easier than down. You need to take water and a jacket because the weather can change rapidly even on a bright sunny day. The paths on the back side from the Botanical Gardens are said to have a gentler slope so checking out all options is advisable before heading out.

Such a beautiful place. We visited several times during our visit to Cape Town and it was just as beautiful as the first. There's so much to see and it covers such a huge area. The phenomenal views it allows you to get of not only the national park but the surrounding area of Cape Town too will leave lasting memories. I definitely want to come back when it's summer time so the clouds aren't out and the temperatures are a bit higher
Table Mountain Experience. If the weather allows it you get the most spectacular views. The cable car ride is fascinating with it's revolving platform. The walks are easy and enjoyable.
Definitely worth visitng Table mountain on a clear day. Wonderful views of Cape Town from top of Table Mountain, and lovely walks with easy paths and interesting flora and fauna
Top of the World!. Fantastic views! Try to time you visit well as the mountain is sometimes closed if it's foggy and then when re-opened there can be queues for 2 hours or more!

Stunning!. Table mountain is truely stunning and the hike was a bit tough (try to avoid to walk at midday as I did), but the reward of the view from the top (and the SHORT cable car ride down had been really worth it!!!!
Great views. If there's a long line for the gondola, walk up! There are 3 different walks and there is one that is not terribly difficult.

A place you have to visit, fantastic views on top of Table Mountain. Chose a fantastic clear day to visit Table Mountain. We drove from the V&A waterfront Whickham took around 15mins and the views on the road up to the cable car were also fantastic. Queue was around 40minutes for cable car. We went up about 2pm in afternoon. The cable car has 360 degree revolving floor so you get all the views going up. It was breathtaking up the top. There are quite a few walks you can do all around the top of the mountain. You can even climb up & down it or get the cable car one way and climb the other. There was even abseiling! There is a cafe on top which does a mix of everything for lunch including wine & beer. We had a great time. There was quite a long queue coming down but it was worth it!
Great Views!. Make sure you go on a clear day. Purchase your tram ticket before you go - it is good for 7 days and will save you time.
Memorable experience. Worth the trip up there, eat before going up there, food choices are beyond limited! Prepare yourself to walk and enjoy the quick free guided tour

Table Mt Platteklip Gorge hike. Definitely do the Platteklip Gorge hike if you have time, but you have to walk or drive past the long lines for the cable car and then another km or so you will see a small building and signage (and plenty of parking spots). We parked 1km before the cable car entrance which was fine because at the end it was an easy downhill to leave. It took my husband and I 75 min to walk while paces varied from a couple of runners to 70 year old couples leisurely walking. It was a hard uphill hike with well placed, secure rock steps. 1L of water pp was just enough. Don't be like us and leave at mid day....very hot sun in October! We happily took the cable car down!
Simply an awesome and breathetaking experience. A very scenic view and enjoyable experience. Took some German friends along and they enjoyed it too!

Exciting views!. The visit was exciting, the ascent is via a cable car that has a steep incline. There are two cars that move quite quickly and rotate as they ascend allowing for great views to be had by all. Definitely recommend booking your ticket online in advance, I believe you book either a morning or afternoon session and the ticket is valid for 7 days. This is useful as on days when there is poor weather or visibility the cable car may close, I believe you are free to walk up and down on any day but looks like a demanding ascent that I wouldn't attempt. We went about 9:30am and there were already long queues forming to purchase tickets which we could skip. We were actually above the light clouds on the day we visited which added to the brilliant views. It is well worth a trip up!

straight off the plane and up to table mountain. Brilliant,a dream come true for me, the views were awe inspiring. The initial queue was about 30mins but this was helped by buying our tickets from the hop on hop off red bus which drops you right outside the mountain so no queuing to but tickets which can add another hour of waiting. Have a glass of cold white wine at the top from the café and you will think you are in Heaven

A View not to be Missed. Either a tough hike or a long wait for the Cable Way, the only ways up, no road goes anywhere near the top. However, once you get there, the views are spectacular, and you should do all in your power to get there. Do not attempt it if the weather is bad (Cable Way will be closed anyway), as not only a waste of time but also extremely dangerous.

Sun on our final day!. Table Mountain when the skies are clear gives one an entirely new perspective on Cape Town. One can literally see 360 degrees around the mountain, with views of both the city and the coast on the opposite side. The wait is long for the cable car, so if possible book ahead. Weather is the most important factor. If it is a clear day, change your plans immediately to go up the mountain. It may be your only chance.

Table top stuff. On arriving by car we were waved at by men at side of road wanting us to use their places we presumed for some can of tip if it is still there when we came back but we continued and found a spot much nearer. The queue was very long but we went online using the free wifi and bought tickets which enabled us to go right to the front of the queue, jumping past a good 500 people. Then a bit more queuing for the cable car itself but not too long as the 2 cars can carry 800 people per hour. Nice touch that the cars revolve whilst in motion so that everyone gets a good view up and down the mountain. Stunning views from the top and good facilities, the cafe was certainly not overpriced. On arriving back at the bottom the photo that was taken of you on the way up has been processed into a very slick package and again not overpriced. It would have been interesting to find out what the entry money is being spent on as they will have very low outlay. It is just a mountain, but certainly one to say you've been to the top off.

Fantastic experience. I caught the cable car up and down (buy your ticket on the Red Open Top Bus to avoid queues), and I had a lovely 3 hour hike on the mountain. There are lizards, ponds, sundews (carnivorous plants) and lots of other wildlife. There are well made paths, and little tracks. And, of course, the views are stupendous!!I had a wonderful afternoon and highly recommend the experience.PS. bring suncream!

Superb view 360!!. We were here while weather was really good. So great views all around on the city, the oceans and the peninsula! Must visit offcourse while beying in Capetown! (but do watch weather forecasts!!!)

Natural formation mountain. Good mountain for hiking or practising your endurance. Top of the mountain gives you a good city view of Cape Town. Table Top mountain is not my first choice to visit in the world, but it is in Cape Town.

Amazing views. If in Cape Town then this is a must do. The views from the top of the mountain are just amazing not only of Cape Town itself but the surrounding areas and other mountain ranges. Check the weather forecast before you go as low cloud will ruin your view. We were warned of long queues but when we went in September mid morning there was no queue at all. Also in high season I would guess parking could be a problem so be prepared for a bit of a walk up hill to get to the cable car which takes you to the top of the mountain.

Look down from the table!. Look down rather than up - the view is spectacular. Well worth visiting the top of the mountain assuming the tablecloth isn't on! - Quite rough terrain at the top so recommend a good pair of shoes or boots.
Great views of the city. Get up here and walk around for great view of the city and cape. If the weather isn't on your side you may want to look elsewhere and get back another day.

Expect to queue. My wife and I visited table mountain (via the cable car) and in general we enjoyed the experience and views. I would recommend that you buy your tickets in advance to save one of the three queues we endured. There are two cars and each take about 20 people; so a big school group here and there means you could be waiting. You also queue going down so take that into account if you have an another appointment. The views are spectacular and it was nice to walk around. Just be conscious that the weather can change in an instant. My only issue was other tourists who had forgotten it was a national park and were happy shouting at each other and smoking everywhere (clearly sign posted - no smoking).

PIECE OF HEAVEN!!!!!!!!BREATHTAKING*********************. Simplr Place..Seek peace of mind and gratitude..This is the place..Welcome to the world of natural wonders...Bring a picnic basket and some wine..You wont want to leave this place..one of the best things to visit in Cape Town..Much of downtown looks like Chicago-so citified..All the good stuff is out of town.

Brilliant, but choose a cloudless day and get there early. Fantastic experience with great views but choose a cloudless day. Even if you book on-line you will probably have to queue for a good while; turning up mid-morning without having booked, we had to queue for over 90 minutes. Take a walking stick if you are a bit unsteady on your feet. You can't go to Capetown and not do this.
Good day, sunshine!. Sometimes Table Mountain is covered in clouds (and crowds), but we got there early and had a wonderful view. Bring your camera and look for the daisies.

Worth the views!!. Highly recommend the views from the top of table mountain. I would recommend to book online as this skips the lines and will give you more time at the top! check the weather on there website to find out if it will be open! This will save you time and the cost of a taxi!!
Not worth it. Nice view but not worth the long long long lines up and down. Bad food and smelly toilets. And all so expensive. Waste of time for me.

Pristine, views, well maintained paths and un-crowded. Pristine park with well maintained walking paths with 360 deg views all over the peninsula. The walk up from Constantia Nek is a good work-out. Take the route going left with view over Orange Kloof. The dams on the top make a good resting place for lunch once you at the top. There are at least 15 options to get down from the top down the many gorges and ravines. Great for dogs as well and never is it crowded.

A Cape Town must. Great views.... a Cape town must. Try going in the morning when its not so hot. A strong suggestion is to buy the tickets though the hop on hop off bus as the lines can get pretty long at the ticket counter.
Cable car. as always, the view and the facilities are great. every time I go up there, usually to take a family member, I am awestuck.

Do not miss this!. One of the most spectacular sights in the world, bar none! I've been to a lot of natural wonders, and Table Mountain is in the top 10. The cable car ride to the top is a worthwhile trip on its own, but the views from the top are breathtaking.
