great view. The view from the top is amazing.you get to enjoy captetown and the ocean.Luckily we went in the evening so got to see the sunset.Very beautiful.We took the cable car up the mountain but i think a hike would also be nice.Will try that next time.
a view to behold. breathtaking views, truly the work of God!! picture a mountain, an ocean and a city in between. you have to see it to believe!

Table Mountain a natural beauty and a must see. It is just awesome, there is no other description. If you are ever in Cape Town, you have to go up the mountain, whether you hike it, use the cable way or what ever, this is a must. The most beautiful views and trails to follow

Platteklip Gorge hike. We did the Platteklip Gorge hike up Table Mountain yesterday. It was amazing!!! A tough trek, straight up the mountain, but definitely do-able for relatively fit people. One word of warning - do not underestimate this hike! Wear proper trainers/hiking boots, long pants (lots of shrubbery along the way), and bring water/snacks. We saw so many people who were doing the hike in crappy shoes, that's just making it so much harder on yourselves.... We are 2 relatively fit 21 year olds and we made it up in 1h30. The views from the top are simply phenomenal - if you can't manage the hike definitely take the cable car. If you can do the hike - it's worth the hard slog for the views trust me! Do it early in the morning to avoid the hot sun on your back, and only do it on a clear day.

A must do !!. The iconic place to visit when in Cape Town. Get your hotel to check with cable car station that it is working as weather determines if cable cars operate.Fantastic views, trails to esplore, restaurant for snacks and gift shop.
Great View. A fantastic view of the area and a great walk around at the top of the mountain. Our concierge arranged tickets in advance which meant we avoided the long queue.

Table Mountain. Table Mountain is an awesome landmark in Cape Town,South Africa. We have been there 3 times. The weather can prevent you from taking the Cable Cars at times to get to the top. If the weather is clear,you are in for some amazing views.

Not to be Missed. We were fortunate to visit table mountain on a clear day on the first day of our South African adventure. The ride up and down is a minor thrill and the views from the top are spectacular. We liked the small affordable gift shop, and some rodents provided a first opportunity to experience African wildlife.

Breathtaking views - unbeatable!. Breathtaking views - unbeatable! Take the cable car up (we bought tickets about an hour in advance online and printed them -- but there would not have been a line)... this was off-season (July 2015). Be sure to dress warm as it is windy at the top. There are so many trails and walking paths made of natural matter which does not take away from the epic beauty of this landmark. We loved the total freedom to explore and take photos right at the edge of the cliffs (at your own risk!) What an amazing place.. give yourself at least 2 hours for the total journey (up/down ride, exploration).

Great views!. Once you (finally) get up, it's no too terribly crowded other than by the restaurant/toilets - which happens to be the best spot to see the dassies, small mammals which look like large guinea pigs and are the elephants closest relative. Easy paths to walk all around for views not only of Cape Town/Robben Island, but also as far south as Cape Point. One of the 7 natural wonders and a Floral zone unto itself. Not to be missed,

Worth a visit and views. Fantastic views of all CPT, city as well as coast. Good to go up Signal Hill to see the Midday gun fired. Can be busy to get the cable car, however, an early start pays off, weather permitting, of course

Table Mountain National Park - one of the best in the World!. One of the World's most amazing National Parks - anyone coming to Cape Town should use the numerous facilities offered by the Park. Its a jewel!

Breathtaking views (but only on clear days!) . One needs to be really lucky to witness the fabulous views of the ocean and the city which can be viewed from the Table mountain. The wind plays a pivotal role in the operation of the cable car that takes people up the mountain. So although it may be bright and sunny in the city, one cannot be assured of travel up the mountain if it is too windy! Similarly, there needs to be some good, non-foggy weather all the way up 3500 ft, to get some beautiful, clear views of the Atlantic coast and Cape Town!So pray really hard, look up the weather and make that trip to the Table mountain! Beware of queues which may be the result of the mountain being closed on a previous day! And yes, certainly do not miss the beautiful flowers on your way up and on this majestic UNESCO world heritage site!
Fantastic views. It is a "must" experience. The views from the top are stunning. A word of advice - get there early due to the crowds.

Phenomenal view of the entire Cape!. Crowd and traffic control were superlative, the entire experience was awesome. The view from the revolving cable car up the mountain was almost enough for me. A couple of members of our party were disabled and they were extremely accommodating. Can't say enough good things about the staff!

Hike up for the best experience. hiked up - routes can be confusing so perhaps ask before taking off from one of the rangers in green. Hike only took 1h15m - so don't be put off by people saying it takes 5 hours !
BEAUTIFUL VIEW. What a beautiful view of Cape Town. Good to purchase a ticket before you go to take the cable car up the mountain as there are long lines once you get to the cable car.

Cannot be Missed on a Vacation in Cape Town. Bought our tickets in advance, but while we could not go on the day we intended, the tickets are actually good for another 14 days. The staff are all very friendly and we were lucky not to encounter long lines. The ride up and down is a thrill in itself and just know that the floor in the cab rotates 360 degrees as you ride, enabling everyone a decent view and all sights during some point of the ride. Allow enough time during your stay, the top is quite large and the views are stunning in all directions.

awesome views. This was our first stop in Cape Town. The views were amazing and we were able to get an arial view of the towns we would drive through in the next few days. The cable car was fun. Worth a visit on a clear day. If it is too windy, then the cable car is closed down

Stunning!. We were able to get to the top on a beautiiful, clear and not terrible windy day. A must do, weather permitting, if you go to Cape Town. Pre-order your tickets so you don't have to wait in line. Our hotel made the arrangments the day of for us. Take warm clothing (layers) as it is chilly in places. We took a taxi rather than driving based on recommendations due to limited parking. Glad we did.

Stunning. What an unbeleivable view and such openness everywhere. Our second attempt to ascend was successfull. You have to accept that the turbulent wind can only too often close the cable car. Even if you do get to the top, low clouds can obscure completely any views. We were very fortunate and it was really good. You must try anyway, truly a wonder of the natural world.
An essential in Cape Town. Book tickets in advance as the queues are long first thing or try later in the day, wrap up warm as it gets cold up on the mountain.

Must return. I didn't realise the trails available at the top! For an adventure seeker I'd recommend hiking up then hiking across the plateau n then absailing down. I missed absailing coz I was late (after 5p.m.) but that is why I must return. Loved it!

Unique place. The views are quite incredible if you pick the right time. You must go when the sky clears, but the weather can be deceptive. During our visit in September, the clouds seemed to go away in the early to mid-afternoon. Be prepared to park and walk to get to the funicular. The top was not as windy or cold as we had expected.
Breathtaking views!. A must to see and do when in Cape Town - beautiful sites across the city, it makes you feel your on top of the world!

We caught the mountain at its finest. Table mountain is magnificent but like all Cape Town outdoor attractions the key its all about timing.if the sky is clear and the wind drops go while you have the chance as the weather can chance in just a few hours.It had been windy that morning so the cable car was not running but the wind died down and not a cloud in the sky so we made dash for the mountain.Perfect view from the top of the peninsula and we managed to get stunning photos.The cable car is well managed and run and the cafeteria at the top serves reasonable meals and drinks.

A great experience . The queues may have resulted in a bit of a wait but it's worth it. It's a popular destination, even if the weather isn't ideal. The lower station is a little crowded as a result of a lot of people waiting to get on the cableway to enjoy a phenomenal ride up to marvel the mountains attractions , but once on the majestic tabletop, the space is fantastic. Whether a person is in a group or solo, it's a great experience! The staff are excellent and incredibly friendly. The restaurant at the top may seem a little pricey for the locals, but the food is fresh and very tasty. I think it's good value.
Highlight of Capetown. Awesome experience. Get there early or late. We had to queue for 2 hours. Do the hikes on top even if you aren't able to do the hikes up.

Table Mountain is a Cape Town MUST see. My 6-year old good daughter and her family were visiting recently. As a resident I don't often go up the mountain, but they wanted to hike and so we did. We started early up Platteklip Gorge (about 1.5km past the lower cable station) and it was a steep but easy path to climb to the top. It took us about 1h40m with a six year old, so we weren't going very fast. And it's a magical way to experience the mountain. Always take something warm as the wind can be cold on top and weather changes fast, this applies whether you climb of cable car up!There's lots of space to explore on top, you could take a picnic and make a day of it, or plan a 3hour round trip if your time is limited.There were no queues for the quick cable car ride down which was well earned.
Don't miss it!!!. Keep your eye on the weather because you don't want to miss this view. It can be closed for weather several days in a row so pay attention to the weather.

Wow. Magnificent view . Be sure to watch the weather if you consider doing this tour. Wind will make the cable ca ride in the cable car a frightening experience , it is extremely steep climb, not for the faint hearted. Fog can roll in with out warning and shroud the mountain thus obscuring the view. Great little restaurant at the top for a snack/coffee. Don't forget to take a jacket . There's a lot to see once up top if you have the time

Amazing Views and Important Tips. Amazing views not to be missed! Here are a few tips to help you with your plans. Get your ticket online to avoid long ques. Go when it first opens to avoid long ques. Go as soon as you can because if the winds are high the cable car ride will be closed. Tours at the top are 1 hour and guides are available. There are also a cafe and shop at the top. Allow 1-2 hours when at the top. Wear tennis shoes or hiking boots and dress warm with layers since it is cool especially i the morning. There are many taxis in the que so it is easy to get a return ride when you are ready to leave. I took the City Sightseeing Bus (aka hop on and off) to return to the V&A Waterfront when done. Enjoy!

Stunning views of Capetown. We went up on a cloudy day but weren't disappointed when the clouds cleared and had stunning views over Capetown. We went during the winter season and would highly recommend warm clothing as it was freezing

Scary and fantastic. Both my wife and I are not comfortable with cable cars, but trust me - it is worth every drop of sweat.
Once up on Table Mountain there are many walking trails that give you the spectaculay views on both sides of the Cape Penninsular

Excellent view. I visited Table Mountain for the first time about 15 years ago. What a lot have changed! I was so surprised. They are well organised and the staff are very friendly and professional. I would definitely recommend a visit up Table Mountain. We had a pic nick up the mountain and the views were amazing.

Great views from here - be prepared for a wait to go up the cable car. Views are nice - its on the Hop On Hop off route and has heaps of walking tracks and other things to do. An iconic place to Visit.
Suggest that if you wish to go up the cable car pre-buy your ticket on the bus then you won't have to queue to buy a ticket.

Not worth the trip.. Big queues. Tried early morning came back afternoon but still a slight queue. Made worse with parties of school trips fast forwarded. All a bit sterile and a manufactured tourist attraction. Suggest Signal hill for similar views and less crowds. Queued for over an hour to get down at 6pm. Badly managed with people cutting into the queue unmarshalled.
Different ways to get there. Unique expérience. Try climb Table Mountain 300 m further than cable car...once on top walk to cable car station and go down with it.

On a clear day..... The cable car trip up was exciting. The floor rotates as you rise, so you can take in the full panorama. The views spectacular. The wild life cute! It was my favourite day in Cape Town.
Book your tickets on line to avoid queue on busy days. You could (if you are fit) walk up.
Got to do it... a MUST!. Just loved going up here. Can get very windy but its a must do. Cable car was a little scary in the wind as well.
A must see. What an amazing place. You need to go when it is not windy because it closes rather frequently because of high winds. The view on the top are nothing less than spectacular

Easy treck at the top, around 2-3 hours in total. TREKKING: At the Western Table you find a very easy 40 min route. You should also continue over the chain handrails to the central table. There you have an easy 1.5 hour route to Maclear's Beacon. Many seemed to walk the Platteklip Gorge, it seemed to be a bit steap so some condition required. Most people were with no guides. The Sceleton Gorge starts with well built wooden steps from the National Botanical Garden. Lovely views, don't know how the route ends as we didn't have time to walk up all the way.TIP: Buy the tickets in advance from internet. There may be a long queue for tickets at the station. The ticket is valid 7 days from the day you take. You need to select if you wish to go before or after 13.00.TIP: Check from Windguru if there is over 20 knots wind in Cape, the cable car often shuts down on heavier wind. (you can see the status on the cable car web page)
Well worth a wait. Incredible. We had to wait a few days because of the weather but would recommend anyone to do it, it's spectacular.

Table Mountain - A View with Room.. An excellent half or full day outing. Beware, lines may be long for the cable care but once at the top, the views of the city bowl, Twelve Apostles and Robben Island will have been well worth the wait. Early start or advance booking is highly recommended.

Table Mountain Hike up and Cable car down. Hiked up Platteklip Gorge to the top which took me and my international collection of Hostellers 1 hour 50 minutes. It was very steep and hard going for me who is not used to hiking mountains. I took it slowly and kept stopping for breaks.It was very beautiful and a real sense of achievement to get to the top. I have to say I may not have done it if I had Known it was so tough but am glad I didn't know and am very grateful to my fellow hikers for their support and patience. Well worth the effort to get to the top. Do Not do this on your own and take plenty of water. At the top it is very cold and windy so take something warm. My reward at the top was hot coffee and lunch in the cafe where the food was a reasonable price and great quality.
The View. the view from up there is spectacular, you can see the whole city and the ocean, its a must to visit that place when you are in Cape town

What I'll do next time I go. Breath taking, absolute beauty! Before you go check the weather and go in the middle of the week out of peak season to avoid the crowds. of course summer is best!What I will do when I go again is have a picnic up there!

Amazing views!. I took the cable car up and did the longer of 3 walks (45 min). On arrival the Atlantic side was covered in fog, but this lifted at the end of my walk. The views of Cape Town are amazing. You can go almost to the edge and look down...far, far below. Cape Town and the bay, including Robben Island are in front of you. On another view, you can see the hiking trails, meandering up the mountain. Get tickets in advance on line, and avoid the wait at the bottom.

One of the best ways of experiencing Cape Town. There are a number of hikes up the mountain e.g. up Platteklip Gorge and you can catch the cable car down (2-3 hour like - medium difficulty ito exertion, though my 7 year old daughter makes it easily).Newland Forrest is also a great hike up to the contour path - lots of routes - all pretty good. Vary from jeep tracks to single tracks that require more exertion - overall very well marked out.Alternately cycle up past Rhodes Memorial to the Kings Block House (medium ride ito fitness - technically easy). I live in Cape Town and these are some of my

Fantastic Views!. This was not our first time in Cape Town and to be honest, climbing or ridding to the top of Table Mountain had never been on the top of our to-do list when we came there. But this time we had nothing else planned and the Table Mountain was clear open, no clouds, just blue sky.. We loved it! It's stunning up there and I'm sure we'll do it again when we go to Cape Town next time.
Amazing. Fabulous views from the top, but can be extremely busy!! Not always open if the weather is poor. Cable cars can be slow making for long queues!!
Spectacular View. Well, this is Cape Town's icon as everybody knows where Table Mountain is and even if you don't know, you will see it as quite visible.
View view view!!. Outstanding natural attraction with views as far as the eye could see. Took the cable car to the mountain top, wow!! Would recommend this activity to anyone who visits Cape Town.

Beautiful. It was a lovely experience, very nice staff, and worth waiting 3 days for the cable way to be open. Check their website to be sure it's working before you head there. Online tickets usually have a faster track, so better do that.

Stunning. Such a beautiful day on top of a stunning mountain. Lovely patio to savour the views. Lovely little hikes. Make sure to go when you get a chance because weather can change suddenly and the lift up will close. You will not regret taking the time to reach the top.

Get up early and go when the table is not wearing its cloth!. A pleasant experience, though few reviews have advised of the queuing, we found that given the niceness if the day, that it was extremely busy even though we were there early mid morning. The wait was worth it, with views across the city.

A little piece of Heaven. Don't go on a cloudy or rainy day. Book open tickets online so that you can be flexible about which day to go. Sometimes in the morning, the queue is unbelieveably long so make sure you go early. You can buy tickets there on the day you go but this queue is even longer!! Once you get up to the top, it's like being on another planet....except for all the other tourists. Unfortunately, it is a very popular attraction so I think it will always be very busy. But it's worth it!!! The views are exquisite. There are paths everywhere and it's quite easy to walk around. I think if you have small children (ot teens!), I'd keep them on a very short, tight reign as safety is your own responsibility. There is a shop there but it was closed when we were there. There's also a restaurant/fast food place to get refreshments but we didn't eat there so I can't comment. The toilets were a bit yuk but guess that's to be expected. The views are simply magical. Dispite the crowds and yuk toilets, it's essential to do Table Mountain. Do not leave this city until you've done it!!
fantastic views. Fantastic views of the city and surrounding areas.Highly recommended for anyone visiting cape town :)

Spectacular View. The cable car going up to top of mountain rotates 360 degrees so you get a full view of the area. I went in the evening and was able to watch the sun set, beautiful during the day or night. Leaving the top of the moutain only after seeing the full range of views from the different perspectives. Stay long enough to view the city night lights from the base of the mountain.

spectacular view of the area. This is a must see for those visiting Capetown. The view is spectacular. Plan on spending 1-2 hours on top walking around on the paths. You wont regret it. Just make sure that it is not cloudy!

You have to do it.. We bought our tickets on line at the discounted rate. They were valid for 14 days and you could get a refund if you wanted it. Choose your time wisely. We went at 10.00am. The cable car queue was 2 hours long and it was cloudy on top. We did some thing else for the day. At 4.00pm we noticed the cloud had gone, so we went back. The queue for the cable car was 5 minutes. The ride up is amazing, especially with the rotating floor. The top provided spectacular views. Allow yourself an hour on the top. That's all it takes to walk around the perimeter. Make sure you take some warm clothing.Thoroughly worth the money.

Must Do in Cape Town. We were lucky to be able to take the cable car up the mountain (weather in the preceding days had prevented the car from running and we were afraid we wouldn't make it to the top during our stay). The cable car has a rotating floor which gave everyone views going up to the top. Once up there, you can hike all around in varying directions which was a great way to see all of the views. We saw several Hyrax while up there which was fun, as well as a lizard and several bird species.. the plant life is pretty awesome as well. The views are incredible - this is a must do for Cape Town.

Awesome!. The most beatiful view I've ever seen. But you have to visit when the day is completly clean!The tip is, if you're visiting Cape Town and the day cleans, even if it's in the middle of the day, just stop everything you are doing and go to Table Mountain, because you might not get a clean day on the other days.

Table Mountain Experience.. What an amazing tourist facility.You don't need to position yourself in the cable car as it rotates on both the up and down trips.The views around the mountain top are enormous and gives you a great perspective of Cape Town and its surrounds.An absolute must do if visiting the City.

Amazing. Must do on a clear day. cable car ride is worth the price. Park at the bottom as you turn to go up the road of the mountain and take the free shuttle up so as not to fight for parking. Take a walk around the top, it's incredible. Bathrooms up top were very clean

The most beautifull place on earth!. Safe and very nice cable-cab to get up Table Mountain,. The views are amazing if the weather is fine. To get to Table Mountain, take the Hop-on-hop-off bus, thats ideal, because parking there is very busy!

Flat as a pancake. After an arduous climb of two and a half hours in the baking sunshine, you get to the top and it's fla as a pancake so that you can go for hours for a walk at the top without much climbing or clambering. This is why it's called Table Mountain I guess! Take water, sunglasses, sun screen and hat at a minimum. We took the cable car back down.

Amazing place!. Excellent and a must do on your Bucket ListThe view is unmatched and absolutely beautiful!!take a warm jacket with as the weather can turn on you, we were luck enough to have clear skies - what a view!!

Table mountain. What to say beyond BEAUTIFUL, the view, the tour, the location, one of the africa natural treasures, no words to describe the magnificence of this mountain, and the view provided on its top, all Cape town, in all its beauty.

Wonderful review. Beautiful view of the city from the top. Must visit place. You can see it from every palce you go in capetown so its best you see capetown as well from the top. Cable car was the best way up.

Spectaculor View on top of a cloud!. We were lucky that the top of the mountain was not windy, and the cable was running. Spectacular views of Cape-town from atop. Restaurant on the top is perfect for a coffee or a hot soup. Pre book tickets at Big Bus Tour company or other, to avoid standing in a line.

Stunning view of Cape Town atop Table Mountain. Beautiful and scenic and a must do for every tourist visiting Cape Town and South Africa. We were lucky to get clear skies and so took the Cable Car up, after the Hop On Hop Off Bus Tour dropped us to the base point. There were some travellers who even hiked up!
Table Mountain. We were lucky it was open when we went. The views were great, but the shop at the top was very over priced- that was to be expected though.

A must in Cape Town. First I was a bit reluctant to go up because I am afraid of heights, however the place is perfectly organised and I was surprised that there is quite a lot to explore up there. Breathtaking views and the fast chnge of weather makes it even more interesting.
Ms Sihlangu . It is always pleasure to visit table mountain, it has a magnificent views of cape Town and water front. let never get tired to be on the mountain every time I visit cape Town,

Definitely did not disappoint!. A visit to Table Mountain was one of the 'must do' things we set up as part of our South Africa trip,and we were not disappointed. We took the cable car up and down due to time constraints but spent a good couple of hours on the summit walking along marked paths, the view in all directions being superb but the best being the panoramic view of Cape Town.Fortuitously, we were lucky enough to have picked a beautiful day where the clarity in all directions was more than we had anticipated.We also took in one of the short free guided tours giving some of the history behind he formation of the mountain and its surrounding which helped to enrich the visit even more.A must do visit for anyone visiting Cape Town.

Worth the trip. Great views from up here. Just make sure to check the weather before you go up. Even though there are lots of tourists who go here, once you up at the top, it's easy to find yourself walking alone and taking in the views by yourself. It's very impressive up there

Amazing View and Breathtaking landscapes. Wonderful views and amazing landscape!! We went on a sunny Saturday afternoon and the wait time was an hour and a half to get to the mountain. It was worth the wait. There was fantastic views of the city and ocean. It was amazing. There was a small restaurant that served wine and beer. The wait time was 15 minutes because the crowd was large. You can venture around the table mountain and feel so secluded. Its an amazing experience that makes you feel like you are alone with your thoughts.
A Must . Fun times riding in cable car and the sites are breathtaking !!! Plan on arriving before 9 as the lines will be long . Number one site in capetown
Excellent views and great weather. I had booked a guide to walk up, my wife caught the cable car. Beautiful views of Cape Town. The cable car was great on the way down!

A view from the top. Missing table mountain would be a shame! Be prepared for a hike (or else there is a option of taking the cable cars), but in the end completing the hike is a success especially when you see amazing Cape Town from the top!

Love everything about it.... If you like hiking and breathtaking sights and cable cars and a good cafe to go along with it, you are in the right place... I loved everything about this place... There aren't many places around the world that provide you with that many different sights... This place is amazing and I hope I get to go back there again... I think we were there for a couple of hours but I can see how it could take much more than that...

A real Landscaping Adventure!. The park is huge, it encompasses several iconic sites. We visited Cape Point and Cape of good hope, both are worth the trip. The views are impressive, and it has pathways to go up the cape's mountains and walk around the area. The landscapes you can observe there, are just beyond amazing. I will strongly suggest to dedicate at least 4 hours to this visit, to fully enjoy it.

A Must-See in Cape Town!. We took the cable-car up to the Park; I can't recommend a hike up for any but the most fit mountaineers among you! The two gym-rats of our group tried it and were beaten back by heat and the distance between footholds. The views are amazing, of course, and there are some nice walks, so wear your best walking shoes. Bring binoculars if you wish, but just OBSERVE. Be on the lookout for small animals, like rock hyraxes, lizards, and colorful birds. There are refreshments, souvenirs (nice-quality ones) and restrooms at the top. Best time to go: early in the day, when it's less crowded, and less hot.

Best views in Cape Town. Be sure to check the weather! Fabulous views of Cape Town and toward the Cape of Good Hope. Cable car is great and there are a number of walks on the mountain with varying views.

Amazing views. A must do while in Cape Town. The cable car does not always run do to weather conditions (mainly heavy winds). The website is updated daily on if it is open and would recommend going first thing in the morning.

Excellent views over Cape Town. Excellent views from top of Table Mountain and the cable car ride is very good. Check both weather conditions and length of queues for the cable car. We were told by a guide that one of the best and easiest walks up Table Mountain starts near to Kirstenbosch Gardens enabling you to cover both in one day.

Very cool. We hicked Table Mountain via the Platte Clip Gorge hicking trail and enjoyed every moment of it. It took us about four hours to go up and back down. The trail is ok to walk but be sure you know your way arround on a bit more difficult hicking trails. Sometimes it can be steep and the path is uneven as you walk on big and small rocks. The view from the top is breathtaking. Make sure to bring enough water as it can be hot during the day. Start hicking early and descent before the sun is at it's hottest. We visited on a weekend and the waiting line to get into areal tram was very long. We found a parking spot a bit further then the trailhead as the road towards it was very crowded and packed with cars and busses. If you are fit and like to hike on moutain paths, this is the place to be.
Breathtaking. Gorgeous views! We rode the gondola up then walked down...sore legs for 3days, but well worth it! A must do if you're in Cape Town

Go big or go home !. Certainly the most recognisable global icon and deservedly a new world wonder, TM offers a variety of trails for all levels of experience. My fav was India Venster which cuts across the face of TM, comes up almost able to touch the cable car overhead and finishes around the back of TM. The exertion is rewarded with unparalleled panoramic views of the City Bowl. Truly awesome.
A must on a clear day . Been Cape Town a few times and never managed to get up table mountain due to weather issues, however yesterday was perfect. So pleased I waited in the queue. Spectacular!!!

Great views. we happened to get on the cable car on our first day with limited tourists - you have to check the weather before going to this site as you may be disappointed if you can not get to see the top of table mountain.

A fantastic view point of Cape Town. I checked forecast for Cape Town, but Table Mountain is another story. Expect more, much more wind and cold than in the city. They were so strong that the cable car was closed, I hiked to the top but couldn't stay long - almost could not stand up; I had to lean on something to not fall. Restaurant and shops were all closed. Take water and food with you for this situation.Even though, the view was worth it all

Tantalising Table Mountain. WORTH IT!!! I got here via the HOP ON HOP OFF bus company and then the cable car. There was not much of a queue and it moved quickly. The ride up was fun and at the top the view is spectacular. I went on a warm still day and the weather was great. This came after three days of massive cloud cover and high winds so I was very keen to finally get there! It can blow with gale force winds though so make sure you bring adequate, warm or windproof gear. Three easy walks are possible and the free guide map makes it easy. I went by myself but had lots of people willing to take a few pics of me with that fabulous view! Lots of cute little creatures that look like giant fat hamsters and lots of proteas and other wildflowers. Everywhere you look there arte fabulous views.
View from the top. Table top is hit or miss.If you are in town and look up,no clouds go.On a clear day the view is great.Tough to make reservations as the clouds move in without much warning.
Do not miss!. An absolute must-do attraction. No visit to cape town is complete without this. Spend at least half a day.

Definitely a must in Cape Town!. We felt very lucky to be able to visit the top of Table Mountain since the weather was blustery and "the tablecloth" (as locals call the cloudcover) was covering the mountain. Fortunately, the weather broke and the cable car operations opened. The views are spectacular and it is easy to spend as little or as much time exploring as one prefers. It is definitely beneficial to have your ticket purchased in advance to save long waits in the queue.
beautiful. Although couldn't go up table mountain - the cable car was closed for high winds. Hiked up half way had great views. Can't wait to go back

Well worth the long queue. The mountain had been closed for 2 days due to high winds, so was extremely busy when it opened. We had to queue for 1 hr 30 mins to reach the cable car. The revolving floor made sure everyone had a good view. Great views from the top. Nice restaurant and surprisingly not too busy. Lots of folk had taken picnics. One group were celebrating a 40th birthday complete with balloons.

Dependent on the weather but worth it!. Obviously you have to get up the mountain first but it is quite a unique and special place to go in the world. You need to leave at least half a day for this excursion as the crowds can be enormous, especially if the weather has been no good. However at the top you are able to have room to yourself and the views are amazing.

Great view, Nice hike.. Cable car that spins, beautiful views from the top, great hike across the plateau.Have the place you are staying buy the ticket in advance for you, and take a cab to the top; there is a local bus as well if you are more adventurous.

Excellent!. Table Mountain is spectacular. The views are stunning on a clear day, and the fauna and flora on the top of the mountain are a must see. The range of fynbos species to be found here is mind boggling. Great spot to see herps and the ever present dassies! You need to check if the cable car is running and keep an eye on the weather when planning a visit.
Amazing at sunset. We took a sunset cable car trip and the view was amazing! Definitely something everyone should experience. Just very chilly, even in summer. Remember a jacket!

Amazing view from Table Top in Cape Town. This is an experience that must be done while in Cape Town. had the extra special option to stay in one of the huts on the top and spend the night at camp fire with friend and wine.
Amazing views of Cape Town.
Big thanks to the staff of Once in Cape Town Hostel !!

Beautiful views once you get up there. I tried for three days to get up but due to uncertain weather the cable car wasn't running so please, please don't leave this until the last day of your trip because the view is absolutely worth it.
Oh and take a jacket, it gets cold up top
Fantastic every time.. I try and go up every year on my bday if weather allows it. Free for all South Africans on your bday. Take ID and champagne with you. Great breakfast at restaurant!
Breathtaking views. Breathtaking views. First world amenities and facilities on top of the mountain. We will take our 4 kids again
Table mountain - go early. Fabulous views from the top, sadly the trip back down entailed a wait of an hour, the sun was starting to go down and without a jacket got quite cold.

Long lines . We went there at our final day as it was closed for the previous two days due to the windy weather. There were long cue for getting there and we could not get the cable car. However, the trip to it and the view from there is great even if you could not go up more by the cable car.
cable car. buy the tickets online for the cable car to get great discounts and skip the queues. its super windy up there! take a jacket

nice but windy. We went early in the morning (first ride up). The view is spectacular, no doubt. You will see the city side and the mountain side of cape town. The only thing was it was too windy I couldnt concenrate on what I was looking at. After a few pictures, I wanted to go back to the car. There are 3 loops of walkways there. two of them are fairly short and could be done in 30 mins. I recommend just that. Do not do the third walk (all the way around the mountain, 1hr) because the.view is the same.
Spectacular. The place to visit but be warned a clear view is not guaranteed , we visited in May and in was touch and go , fortunately we made it to the top.
Best time to go from 3pm!. We were glad to heed our tour guide's tip to head up from 3pm and explore to catch the sunset, breathtaking view which makes for wonderful postcard photos!
Breathtaking views!. Went in the cable car up Table Mountain. Ate at the restaurant at the top, stunning views. A breathtaking experience!

Wow!!!. I went here for a wedding 8 years ago and it was a beautiful sunny day. We went up in the rotating cable car and it stopped around about 30m from the top and it was swinging pretty heavily. I like most of the wedding party were in our suits and sweating from the alcohol consumption the night before and it made us all sweat just that little bit more. Thankfully everything was fine and the service was held on the east side out of the wind and in the sun. Stunning views. Worth getting married here!

Outstanding feature of nature with wonderful perspective of the Cape and Cape Town!. Climbing or taking the cable to the top of Table Mountain on a clear sunny day--outstanding! One piece of advice, the mountain is often covered with clouds and mist--don't put off your visit to another day if the day is one of sunshine. Go to the mountain!

Don't miss it. We were prepared for the queue waiting for the cable car so no problem - we had hats and water to keep us cool and you do end up parking quite a way from the cable station but it's all worth it. The views from the top of the mountain are spectacular!If you are planning a trip to Cape Town you need to have flexibility about the day to go on this trip since there are quite a few days when you can't go up due to the weather - wind or cloud. In the hotel where we were staying quite a few guests never made it up the mountain because the day they had picked wasn't suitable.It is such an iconic mountain to look at and the views from the top are amazing.There are lots of walks on the top so make sure you have time to do some of them.

A must visit place. Our daughter was married on the mountain. the staff were very attentive towards her and they could not have done more to make it a special day. To top it all the views where fantastic and we had great weather on the day. If you are going to Cape Town it's a must to go up Table Mountain

Excellent views from the top, rotating cable car is great experience. Excellent views from the table mountain, take the cable car up and walk down, what an amazing experience we had. The most beautiful views from the top and even better when walking down.

Awsome. I did this trip via helicopter due to Table Mountain cable car being closed for works. This is rather expensive due to being a solo traveller but worth every penny. It was a great way to see not just Table Mountain but the whole city

Wow! . For those interested the cable car up the mountain is actually quite underwhelming - it's very busy and very cramped. HOWEVER, once you get to the top of the mountain the views of Cape Town and the Western Cape are absolutely phenomenal! Moreover you can easily walk around the top of the mountain, which is interesting in itself and away to get away from the crowds.
Loved it!. Friendly staff, Spectacular views, a huge variety of fauna and flora, great for bird watchers and history buffs, convenient for everybody and its extremely disable and kids friendly :)

Must do!. Our plans to take the cable car up then abseil / walk down were undermined by Cape Town's famous wind....which also threw most of our 2-day Cape Town plans into disarray - in the end, all we could fit in was a quick ride up - 15 mins at the top - then cable car back down. But what an amazing view and definitely worth it.If you have the time and fitness, I would absolutely recommend walking up and taking the cable car down (or vice versa) ...everyone we spoke with that did this said it was the only way to do the mountain.

Must see in Cape Town. You can't visit Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain. Although you can see the mountain from almost everywhere in the city, either hike to the top or take the aerial tram. The views from the top are unbelievable In addition, take some time to explore the area on top with the beautiful flora.

Great for kids to have climb around. Brilliant for a run around - the paths are great if you want an easy route and if you fancy going "off road" you can hop across the rocks for what feels like a real adventure (but is actually pretty easy going and feels safe) - perfect for kids in need of a good stretch of the legs.The views are beautiful and vast - worth the walk/cable car up alone however a thorough walk and explore is really rewarding
A wonder of the world. Wonderful way to see the views below of marvelous Cape Town and Robbin Island. Don't miss this if the weather is goodd!

A must. We went up Table Mountain by cable car. Fortunately we were there in early spring and the queues were not long. I suspect that when the weather gets warmer the queues will be quite long. The trip is well worth it and you could spend a long time walking the park. If I were younger and fitter, I would have liked to walk up, several people did and found it not too difficult. For this type of place the restaurant at the top was OK and the food quite good. Was very interesting watching the paragliders soaring only metres away from the cliff face.
spent a whole day. Spent a whole day walking around at the Table Mountain. Needless to say, you need perfect weather to be there. We had a great time!

Hike up and ride down!. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a trip up Table Mountain. Walk up the Platteklip trail with a guide and take the cable car down. The Platteklip trail is the easiest but still has great views. A good guide will explain the flora and fauna as well as the geological facets of this amazing place. Be prepared to walk both ways as the cable car shuts down in adverse conditions such as wind. A guide is strongly recommended as many people are stranded each year due to lack of knowledge and quickly changing conditions.
Take the Cable car up. Stunning views from the top of the mountain. Get there early so you don't have to wait in line...and buy tickets for the cable car online.

Excellent views!. The cable car is fun. It can rotate and so you just need to stand at one location without moving around but getting to see 360 views. Once on top, you can get a bird's eye view of capetown...

great view, no to be missed!. one of of the most spectacular sites I have seen. Amazing views, breath taking! We bought tickets on line although next am the venue was closed due to winds. The ticket is good for 14 days. The weather forcast said it would be clear between 12-1:00 so we set out later than expected and got up there right when it was perfectly clear. Amazing. Also the restaurant at the top was excellent! Pizza was fantastic and the candied pop corn!

A sight for fore eyes. With my time constraint, I was only able to take the Cable Car up and down. However, the view at the top is not one to miss. One day I shall return to hike it and it's beautiful surroundings.

It's the heart of Cape Town.. Great place to visit.
We hiked up and took the aerial cable back down.
Wonderful view of the whole town.
Hiking is best way to experience Table Mountain!. Table Mountain was excellent, the weather could change suddenly, but on a clear day is definitely a good picture day.

There is more to the park than Table Mountain. Everyone knows and loves Table Mountain, but the Table Mountain National Park stretches for kilometres from mountain to sea right up to Cape Point. There are plenty of hiking trails and places to visit where you can take the family for a picnic. The views are spectacular.

Stunning Table Mountain. Wonderful location with spectacular views at the top and the cable car system taking you to the summit is excellent. The car is cleverly designed to rotate so that you don't miss a thing. Weather can close it down at anytime so just go when it's open and enjoy. A must do in Cape Town.
A must see in Cape Town (from the top!). Don't miss it! Try for a sunny day - which can be a bit hard, with the weather being so inter-changeable.

Must see as soon as possible. The most important advice I can give is to visit Table Mountain as soon as conditions are favourable. During my week in Cape Town, the cable car was closed because of windy conditions on two days, and the notorious ‘tablecloth’ cloud blanketed the mountain top for another two, On another day, a wildfire broke out on the northern slopes affecting the views. I had been aware of the first two risks so when I saw the clear conditions with little wind on my first day, I was at the top of Table Mountain within a few hours of touching down. Table Mountain had been on my bucket list for too long and it is everything I had hoped and much more. I spent several hours at the top walking round and enjoying the panoramic views. Just before going down in the cable car, I went to the café and sat down with a beer when the tablecloth started to form and the air turned decidedly cooler and damper. Luckily I had been aware of this risk as well and had a warm jacket, scarf and gloves with me. There is generally no need to book in advance and the cable car is easily reached by the hop-on-hop-off buses with a stop right at the cable car entry.

Sightseeing in Cape Town. Excellent day out, stunning views. Cable car return trip to the top only 225 Rand,(£10.00).Cafe at the summit for food and drinks, prices very reasonable indeed.Highly recommended.
Do not miss the Botanic gardens either.. this is a reason to go, so do not miss the cable car, the views are stunning out to Robben Is and down the harbour. No need for helicopter hire.

On Top of the World. Breathtaking views, but take the opportunity on the first clear day you get because you may not get another chance. Definitely worth it. Take lots of water, although there is a cafeteria. Be prepared to spend quite a bit of time at the top of the mountain for views in every direction.

Need to be sure you have a beautiful Day. We got a good tip from our Driver. Go today. The forecast is not good the rest of the week. I can see why. The park is well maintained and has lots of walking paths and views from all sides. The cable car closes in high winds or bad weather. If you have a beautiful day while in Capetown, drop whatever you have planned and go to Table Mountain. We had planned to lunch up there but long lines and the food looked terrible.
Must see. You have to go to table mountain! I am still amazed at the view. It was a fabulous experience where you were also able to meet people from all over the world. Go early!
Worth it. We hit this site on an incredibly clear day. We had a 30 minute wait to ride up. Go early!!! The views are worht it!!

Wonderful day out. This was a brilliant day out, easy to get to with friendly staff to make the visit more special. Walking around table moutain can be a bit difficult for those with mobility issues but for those without ensure that you have enough time to wander for a while as this views are amazing.

A visit to Cape Town is not complete without a visit up Table mountain.. Well organised, well maintained, well worth the sightseeing experience. Watch the que it can be quite a wait on a clear day but well worth a few hours for the visit

The highlight of Cape Town - awesome!!. Excellent views of Cape Town & surrounding areas - feel like on top of the world! You can take the hop on/off bus to the "Table Mtn" cable car stop and buy your tickets from the bus to avoid the line up. Alternately there are many routes to hike up. But to see it the best, see it from Signal Hill!

Amazing views at the top, difficult climb however!. The walk up the mountain is not to be taken lightly! Walked up and down the Platteklip gorge route which can be found about a 1km walk from the cable car station. Completed the walk in about 1.5 hours up and then an hour or so to get down. The views at the top and all the way up are utterly breathtaking and make the physical exertion of the trip worth it! Don't take this mountain lightly by any means and bring ample amounts of water. Far, far better to do the walk on a clear day as when there are clouds resting on the top of the mountain the views are severely limited. Cafe at the top wasn't open when I climbed it, so be prepared for that!

Breathtaking View. Outstanding and breathtaking view of the area. The cable car ride up is fun and fast. We were there on a clear day and we loved it. The restaurant is one of the best in the area. Very beautiful and a MUST do.

Lovely Place to visit.. Within the city's municipal limit, looks awesome from down below. And the view from top is also amazing! When we went, the weather was really cold! One has to check weather condition for going up.
You can spend a Whole Day!. Amazing experience. Good views of the natural surroundings and also the city. The cable car itself was a different experience.

Explore the real Cape Town. If you are in Cape Town, this is one of the most important sites to visit. You can always use the Cable Cars "Book online to escape the long traffic" and you can climb the mountain in 3 hours. Enjoy the amazing view from top, spare some time to have a hot cup of coffee, and enjoy a long walk. It can take you 1 hour to walk the roof top and enjoy different angels of view. Don't forget to do the abseiling which I believe one of the most amazing parts. Always call before starting your trip, the Table Mountain is closed if the weather is not good.
What views. This is totally worth the wait in line. We went in August so getting a clear day is not always guarantee. Get there first thing in the morning. The later the day the longer the line.
Must See. A must see if you are in Cape Town. The tram ride up is very efficient. Don't forget to take lots of water, its hot on the mountain. There is a restaurant but it is very busy.

general comments.. Cape town is bit backward with poor quality footpaths and bad streets ,the resteurants are mostly ok a lot not very hygienic but having said that the food is excellent and good value for money .I f you like fish then you will love it here. The street beggers are most annoying but once to tell them to F... Off the usually go away.
Spectacular!. Impressive to go up the mountain, but the weather can be changeable so its best to make the trip at the first opportunity. Best to book online to avoid a wait.

Safe hiking on Table Mountain.. The most popular hike is up Kasteelspoort and back down by cable car . My young grandchildren have tackled this route. The most difficult route is straight up from the lower cable car station via India Venster. This is a challenging route with sections of exposure and should be led by an experienced hiker.There are several scenic hikes from various starting points namely; Constantia Nek , Nursry Ravine , Skeleton gorge , Kasteelspoort , Cecelia Buttress and combinations thereof. These routes all came up The Back Table .I would advise hiking with someone who knows the routes. Alternatively use a Slingsby map.

Breath taking .. in every way. What a wonderful morning walk . took far longer than expected, but with the kids finally on the right path we ventured to the top ..breath taking view and a wonderful way to get some exercise and taking in the true beauty of the mountains

360 degree view. Went up the cable car and just loved it! Seeing the whole of Cape Town from up there is amazing. Lovely seeing the plants and wildlife and a nice cafe at the top too. Good first thing in the morning before the cloud rolls in.

Fantastic views, breathtaking experience.. Get the red ,open top bus up to here for beautiful views and a great afternoon out.Come prepared with warm clothes,raincoat, suntan lotion and hiking boots as weather can change from one extreme to another and cable car may close meaning a walk down the mountain
Incredible views and a great natural resource. Don't miss a trip up Table Mountain, either hiking or on the cable car. Dramatic views of all of Cape Town, really a must do activity!
Nice view. Very nice view, but cable car was closed because of strong winds. Always check before going and don't buy combo ticket before that.

Amazing. Cape Town is full of lots of different things to do, on our trip we went cage shark diving we also went inverdoorn game reserve for safari, it was our 25 wedding anniversary and I couldn't think of a better place to have spent it.

If you go to Cape Town do not miss a visit to Table Mountain.. I went up 3 times by cable car during the week I was in Cape Town - just couldn't get enough of it - it is simply STUNNING. The cable car itself, with its rotating floor, is fantastic but just wait till you get to the top.... Every time there were different views according to how much cloud was around and I was lucky enough to see a Brocken Spectre above Platteklip Gorge on one occasion - a very spooky experience! The views are unparalleled anywhere else in the world and there are even cute little dassies (rock hyraxes) by the top cable station. The cable car doesn't run when there are high winds and the mountain often has a covering of cloud so grab your chance when you can see it's clear - just don't miss the opportunity as it is truly magnificent.
Cable Car. One of the Seven Wonders of the World. Excellent view of the city. Nice trails to hike. The cable car is amazing to ride. Great for both adults and children.
Great Plac. Best ever as one of the 7 Wonders of the world!!! Spectacular view from high up overlooking the famous Camps Bay
Views!. What a view. We took the cable car up, quick ride and worth every penny. My girlfriend was not a fan of the height, but I didn't mind!

India Venster - Unforgettable climb and experience. We spent 4 days in Cape Town as part of our honeymoon and Table Mountain was an absolute must, and then learned that the cable car was off for annual maintenance so the only way up was to walk. We had booked the Platteklips Gorge route up, however when we were picked up our guide asked if we wanted to go a different route, he said that it would involve 'scrambling over some rocks'..... didn't sound too difficult at the time. I'm not sure whether scrambling is a hiking term but it sure didn't end up being what I thought it was. We ended up going up a route called India Venster, which at certain points had metal bars sticking out the mountain face to use like ladders with metal chains attached at the top of ledges for you to pull yourself up on, some parts didn't even have these metal supports and found ourselves rock climbing using crevices to pull ourselves up. I've never done any form of rock climbing or hiking so there were certainly some pretty hair raising moments, its quite easy to become scared of heights when you're hanging onto a ledge with no supports or helmets etc looking down to the city, and although it was difficult I'm so happy we did it this way. Me and the wife both had a great sense of achievement after getting to the top, and although I wouldn’t have done this route as a choice if I originally knew what it would entail, I know wouldn’t have had it any other way. We only saw 6 other people on this route up, when we went down the Platteklips Gorge way we saw hundreds. Not for the faint hearted but a great feeling afterwards and unforgettable views along the way.
Table Top Mountain. Some very nice view of Cape Town and the harbour. The Cable car ride up was also memorable. When in Cape Town you should definitely see this site.

You cant avoid this landmark. You haven't really done CPT if you haven't gone up Table Mountain - hiking (2-3hrs) or the cable car. The cable car is a very quick journey that offers fantastic views over the entire city. The cable car also takes around 60 ppl at a time so we waited in the queue for about 10 mins before it was our turn to go up. Walking around the top of Table Mountain is truly breath-taking and being able to see the City, the 12 Apostles and all the way out to Cape of Good Hope is great. There are very friendly rock dussies at the top too, which is a cool little attraction in itself. Stuff is pretty expensive up there, so Id recommend going up there for a drink/snacks rather than a full lunch.

A must see. Much bigger than I expected at the top. Cafe seemed chaotic, caused by 'the system' and the layout, so my wait for a piece of cake meant I burned off several calories meaning I could enjoy it when it arrived if only to beat off starvation. The cable car trip was good, though on return I would plan to walk it for the experience. The mist rolls in very quickly so however nice the weather may seem, do take warm wear too. It was wonderful.
Stunning trek. An absolute must when in cape town - just make sure you keep an eye on the clouds or you may get to the top and not be able to see anything!
Beautiful views. Took cable car to top and enjoyed walks around the top. Restaurant food not very good. Some paths are paved but others are a bit more uneven.

Absolutely fantastic!. Blessed with a fine day, little wind, this is one of the worlds great lookouts! The car park can be a bit crowded, and the queue for the cable car a bit long. But a quick ascent, and the view is amazing. Pleasant walkways with views over the city of Cape Town, but also south towards the Cape itself, and over Robben Island, complete a great experience. Limited but adequate facilities for food and drinks available at the cable car station. Highly recommended.

The View. This is an absolute must if visiting the Cape Town area. On a clear day you can see for tens of miles and the cable car trip up the mountain is a very cool experience in itself. Say hi to the dassies for us!
Brilliant views. Need clear day so when see it go for it (we went up at 4.30pm). Views are brilliant and worth it. Do it!
Panoramic views. Loved the scenery and vegetation on top of the table mountain. And ofcourse the panoramic views. Our guide was wonderful and gave us a great feel of the place.
Table Mountain must do. An essential part of any Cape Town visit. We hiked up Constantia Corner and the flora & fauna was wonderful!

A MUST DO in Cape Town. You must see table mountain while in Cape Town. We decided that we would take the tram up to the top and walk around for a while and hike down. This was not the hike I was expecting. It was actually pretty difficult. We thought hiking down would be much easier but we were wrong. It was actually pretty steep most of the way down and had to watch yourself. It took us about 3 hours to hike down but was a great experience. A must do in Cape Town!
Views to die for . Very well laid out up on top. Very good pathways make it easy to stroll around. Good viewing locations. Spectacular views in all directions.

Breathtaking!. After spending the morning at the Victoria & Alfred waterfront, we went up to the top of Table Mountain by cable car. The ride, with the ever changing views provided by a revolving car, was spectacular. Once on top the walkways give you a near 360 degree view of the Cape Peninsula. We decided to have a late lunch at the cafe. The sun was setting by the time we took the ride down. Unforgettable and a must-do while in Cape Town.

Amazing place to visit. Great Veiws from the Mountain and the ride up is great because the floor rotates as it goes up.Lovely walking paths when you get up the Mountain .
Wonderful Veiws of Cape Town and wild flowers up on the top.
Don't miss this!. An absolute must when in Cape Town. We took the cable car both up and down, although people do recommend at least walking down Which aparantly takes about an hour.
Cold and Windy. So much fun to travel up to Table Mountain but it was so cold and windy, I couldn't stay outside too long.

Highlight of Cape Town. Excellent views of Cape Town.
Grab a beer & chill at the top of the mountain with fantastic views of the city, sea

The pinnacle of Cape Town. Wherever you are in Cape Town you see the mountain.
When you travel outside Cape Town (whether in a car, plane or boat) and on your return when you see Table Mountain your heart immediately lifts at the sight of the mountain and you know you are home ! !

Spectacular views. The queues for the cable cars can be long but the trip to the top will reward you with stunning views. The cable cars hold about 60 people each and revolve, so you will have great views all the way up. A tip for those with a flexible itinerary - if you can see the top of the mountain, head straight there - don't delay until tomorrow or even later that day - because once the 'tablecloth' arrives, it could be days before the cloudy cover disappears and you will have missed your opportunity altogether. Keep an eye out for a cute little dassie (rock hyrax) in the rocky outcrops.

Excellent Climb. This is definitely something to consider doing. I normally climb up the mountain in order to feel more connected to nature but you could also take the cable car up. If the weather is nice climb it. That is if you are physically capable of climbing up stairs. There is different routes that can be taken. The skeleton gorge is really nice and takes about 3 hours to climb to the very top of the mountain.You can buy a one way ticket for the cable car at the top if you don't feel like walking all the way down. The average time for climbing down is about 1h30. It puts quite a lot of strain on you knees though. Make sure you wear proper trainers as sneakers will cause problems for your feet afterwards.

Great View if You Catch it on a Clear Day. We were fortunate to visit Table Mountain on the first day that the tram was open in five days. As a result, it was very crowded, but that did not detract from the view from the top. Well worth the trip.

Amazing. I hiked Table Mountain myself and it was totally worth it. The hike was challenging but not impossible. It took just over 2 hours. The views at the top are amazing and feel even better after you have hiked it rather than taking the cable car

Awesome views and great hikes. There were beautiful views of all around Cape Town as well as the Cape Peninsula. There are lots of walks/hikes to do once you are up there! This is a must do if you are in Cape Town.

Can't miss it!. Table Mountain is cool to see from the ground, but nothing can beat the views from the top! We did a hike (India Venster route with Hike Table Mountain) which was tougher than we expected, but so rewarding when we got to the top. Cape Town is rolled out below you and you can really appreciate the layout of the city around the bay in a manner than you just can't get from a map or on the ground. Bring a camera - you won't believe the views.

Brilliant Views of Cape Town & The Cape Peninsula. We got the opportunity of visiting Table Mountain as part of a city tour that we did of Cape Town, and the experience was breathtaking.The mountain provides a dramatic backdrop to the cityscape, and invites you in with its unusual form (being flat at the top - hence its name) ... providing Cape Town with a degree of protection from the elements means that different rainfall amounts are dumped on either side of the mountain, creating different habitats. All of this is visible from the top of the mountain.The national park has very thoughtfully built many viewing platforms that really allow you to take in the various views of the dramatic landscape - I found it to be incredibly beautiful. And in addition to the views, there is a quite a bit of local fauna to view when you're at the peak ... plenty of birds about, and the charming Dassie is always easily found.We spent about an hour at the peak and really loved it - for any visitor to Cape Town, a visit to the peak (or rather top) of Table Mountain is something that gives a wonderful introduction to the city of Cape Town and its surrounds.Note, while there was no fee for this attraction (or we didn't pay one), unless you are very fit and are prepared to spend a couple of hours climbing and descending, you'll need to catch the cable car ... and for that there is a fee.

The must-see in Cape Town!. Some friends and got the last cable car up to Table Mountain (around 5pm) and we were totally blown away at the view. The blanket cloud formations was absolutely stunning!! The clouds just rolled off the massive mountains on both sides and I have never seen anything like it. The last cablecar down is 6pm in the winter which is about 30 minutes before sunset but the light was so beautiful. We only had 1 hour at the top which was fine but I could have stayed up there and just watched the blanket clouds forever. There is a nice cafe at the top with million dollar views! There is also a lot of room for the hundred or so tourists walking around. Table Mountain is the must-do attraction in Cape Town.

A Must Do!!!. We were in Cape Town for three days and Table Mountain had been closed due to weather. Luckily on our last day, we had a late flight out and at 10 a.m. the Mountain opened. We took a Uber up to the bottom to catch a cable car. On our drive up, we got online from our phone and purchased tickets. Good thing because when we got there the ticket line was huge. Cable car ride was very nice with spectacular views. Once on top, it was breathtaking. Easy to walk around and see all of the different views being on top has to offer.
Breathtaking just Breathtaking. If anyone told me before hand that going up a mountain would leave me spellbound I would have laughed but it happened. Truly amazing Experience

God's dinner table!. No wonder it is a natural wonder! What a spot! It's the table God entertains dinner guests around! The views are magnificent. The view points are well marked and easy to get to. The mountain top was spacious, safe and uncrowded. Even the cafe and rest rooms were great!

Top of the world. Very nice views. Quick ride to the top in the cable car. Try to get a clear day if you can. The fog and cloud came in on our visit and the view then becomes non existent. Good coffee and cake at the top.
Nature at its best. The sun-lit sky and sea blend perfectly into each other...The breeze that touches softly on the cheeks feels awesome .Nature at its best.Just loved the place ..

Great experience. A must do when in Capetown. Great views and good fun going up in the cable car. We had a bit of a wait so I'd suggest buying your tickets on line before you arrive so you can avoid the queue.

A must on a visit to Cape Town. How can you goto Cape Town and not visit Table Mountain. It's a must-see and the views of the city on a clear day are incredible. You can walk around and get a 360-degree view of the city with info boards and pay-binoculars to see the sights in detail. They have a nice cafe at the top which affords you really nice views while enjoying a good snack.
Best views and a must for every tourist!. Who would not want to go to the top of Table Mountain. Iconic views and and the Tick Box of "Ive been there" - one of the New World Wonders!

Go for the Hike, not for the ride. Great views and lots of good trails to hike. There is a small cafe at the base of the tram up the maintain and a sitting area looking straight down on the whole city of Cape Town. However, the tram hardly ever seems to run due to "wind gusts"

Cape town main attraction. The main attraction in Cape town. Book your tickets online to avoid long queues. Also check whether it is open as the place may close when there are strong winds. The cable bar rotates during the trip so there is not need to rush in to get the best spot. Choose a nice sunny day to visit. There is a nice cafe at the top.

Must Do Even When The Clouds Are Coming & Going. On the last full day of our holiday we had to change plans as our 3-bays helicopter flight was cancelled due to high winds. We'd only been in Cape Town for a day and a half and were not due to visit Table Mountain until the following day before we departed for the airport at 16:00. With the sun shining and clouds gradually clearing we raced to Signal Hill to get some photo shots of both Table Mountain and the Twelve Apostles. Interestingly, no one we'd come across during our holiday, including the tour guide that took us on the Cape of Good Hope Tour and surrounding area, told us about Signal Hill which we found by pure chance whilst trying to navigate to the highest unobstructed view point in Cape Town, which was great for photo shots - well worth a 15 minute hike up the path to see some great views across Cape Town and Camps Bay. We realized at this point that the clouds had cleared sufficiently to attempt Table Mountain so we raced over to the Cable Car Station which took us less than 10 minutes. I'd previously booked tickets on-line in the UK for the following day (AM) but customer services were more than happy to refund my online ticket (via my original credit card) and let me re-book replacement tickets for that afternoon (BTW, my refund appeared on my credit card 3-4 days later virtually alongside the subsequent charge). I even got a better deal where my daughter traveled for free with a paying adult saving me over 100 Rand - now that's service with a smile! Once on top of Table Mountain I have to say that the experience of some clouds interspersed with bouts of sunshine was fantastic. The experience was awesome with the temperature dropping about 12 degrees, the wind howling and the clouds intermittently coming and going making for a real eerie experience. In between, I got some great shots of Cape Town and the Twelve Apostles/ Camps Bay. Everyone suggests going to Table Mountain when the sun is shining brightly and the sky cloudless however I think the experience we had was much more dramatic - my wife was scared to go near the edge for fear of being blown over but my daughter and I thought it was a right thrill! As we'd visited late in the afternoon on a mixed day during the last week of SA's winter tourists were minimal with zero waiting time and very few tourists on top of the Mountain allowing for an almost exclusive experience. My advice would be `don't necessarily plan for a perfect day, be flexibility, and let luck take its course' - you might have a ball! By the time we got to the bottom the horn was blowing instructing to leave the Mountain which only added to the experience in that we'd just managed to slot in this experience by the skin of our teeth; the following day was overcast and raining so we'd have lost out entirely had a bit of luck and ambition not been on our side :-)

Breathtaking views. Table Mountain is a must see when visiting Cape Town, and is an incredibly breathtaking set of views. The rock formation itself with its unique flora and fauna makes for an interesting walk/hike. But the real deal is the ability to take in a 360 degree view from what truly feels like the top of the world. Make sure you have plenty of film in your camera. The rotating floor on the gondola gives everyone a great opportunity to see all angles as you head up the mountain. As one of the most popular tourist stops, make sure to go early. We arrived 15 minutes after it opened and still had to wait 40 minutes to get on the gondola. (By the time we came down the line was 3 times as long as when we had arrived.) Also, if you are visiting for several days, try to pick a day that is clear and not windy. We were lucky and had a spectacular cloudless and still morning, but we heard many stories of high winds making it less comfortable on other days.
Must do In South Africa. Well set up so queuing kept to a minimum. Fantastic views from the top of all relevant land marks 12 apostles lions head etc. plenty of walks to complete all well laid out
Must do on a clear day!!. the views are beautiful you can see everything coast line Capetown. one item off the bucket list. Once in a lifetime for me and worth it stunning.

Must visit .,. We lived this table mountain we went by car . Very beautiful from the top you could get the picture of the whole city . I loved it also fIf you are wanting it view the city by cable car then you must go there as early as possible as it quiet a big que there for getting the ticket .

Amazing views, Amazing hike, STUNNING. Me and a friend travelled to cape town for 6 weeks and we ascended table mountian on 3 occasions as well as lions head, signal hill and devils peak, the scenery is stunning and a must see for everyone! a enjoyable and nice hike for all ages! ..We were talking to 3 men from Holland all over 85 climbing up the mountain to get the cable car down!! A truly magical place!
Great view on a clear day. I was very fortunate to have a still clear day to experience the magnificent views of Cape Town. Do not miss this attraction.

Hike it!. If you're physically able to walk up to the top instead of taking the cable car then you definitely should! It's a bit steep but the feeling of coming to the top and seeing the panorama view of the city and the ocean below makes it worth it. No picture can do this place any justice, it's a must see if you're in Cape Town.
Must see!!. Absolutely amazing!! No.1 place to visit in Cape Town! The views are incredible and the cafe at the top is great.

Unbelievable views!. Reserve in advance online and hope for good weather--you can always reschedule if weather dictates. Just walking around the top is impressive--the cable car saves a great deal of energy.

Mother city love. Of course as a born and bred Capetonian, my review will be biased... But don't take my word for it- to really see Cape Town, one HAS to venture to the top of the mountain. Table Mountain offers the most breath-taking 360 degree views of the city, unbelievably good coffee and the dassies, birdlife and flora will ensure you quickly run out of space on your camera. Be warned, the weather is as fickle as the city itself so pack a light windbreaker.

Definitely worth a visit. We had a lovely trip to Table Mountain. Blue skies overlooking Cape Town. Gorgeous. There are a variety of different wild flowers, birds and strange looking Dassies which were sunning themselves on some of the rocks. There is a restaurant which looked good. We didn't eat there as we were heading off before lunch. There is also a souvenir shop which had the usual tourist items for sale. I would recommend going early before the crowds. It is certainly worth going on a sunny day. You can see for miles around!

Get the "Point". Quite an amazing experience. We rented a car from Cape Town and had the freedom to see the highlights and some "off the beaten path" things too. BE VERY CAREFUL OF THE BABOONS - DO NOT TAKE FOOD OUT OF THE CAR AND KEEP ON YOUR PERSON, THEY WILL WANT IT!We hiked up to the lighthouse and enjoyed the views of the Indian & Atlantic oceans.On the way out of the park we drove to the Vasco Da Gama monument and some other roads less travelled. On one of these roads we had the good fortune to see an Ostritch.....A beautiful landscape everywhere you look

Awesome views, and surprising peace and tranquility. Wow! Grab the chance while the top was clear to take the cable car to the top. Views were amazing.The thing that really struck me was how easy it was to get away from the crowds and how quiet and serenade the mountain was - great place for a bit of quiet contemplation of this amazing natural site.

Magnificent views! A must do!. What a beautiful place. If you have a clear or relatively clear day (the clouds come and go and change quite rapidly), you must go to Table Mountain. Go early because the lines get very long. We had our concierge at the hotel arrange tickets for us ahead of time so we could bypass the ticket line at the Park and get right on line for the cable car. The cable car also rotates so everyone can get an unobstructed view of the mountain - pretty neat! Once on top, you can walk around through pathways and if you're very adventurous, you can even walk up the mountain or down - it's pretty steep and I was told it takes about 2 - 2 1/2 hours! We declined that option and just walked around on top - it was so beautiful with breathtaking views, several flowers were in bloom, really lovely. Wear good walking shoes as the walkways are rocks and there are several steps up and down! A must do!!
Must do in Capetown. the ability to walk around the park and see the beauty of the city and the area is amazing. Get there early to avoid long queues on nice days.

Not to be missed - for the amazing scenery. Spectacular views from the top of this amazing mountain - you can wander around happily for an hour or so looking down on Capetown or over the hills or into the oceans - an amazing place to visit (and an interesting cable car journey up to the top - it was way too hot to do a 2 hour + walk when we were there
great view. One of the world best city and surrounds view. can be crowded so book the cable ride to top in advance

Iconic. Must do. Cable car up and allot a couple of hours to walk around, enjoy the views and have hot drinks on a chilly day/ice cream on a hot day! Facilities are well-organised. Abseiling is possible for the more adventurous.

Buy your ticket before you go. . . but definitely go!. Can't visit Cape Town without making a trip to Table mountain. Be sure to buy your entrance ticket prior to gong to the site or your wait will be longer. It's definitely worth the wait but there's so much to see in Cape Town you don't really want to spend all of your time in a queue.

Outstanding views of Cape Town! A must do!. We were in Cape Town 5 days and each day it was either too cloudy or too windy! On our last day (hours before our flight) we made it up to Table Mountain! So worth the trip!

Wonderful visit on a beautiful day!.
