This was our fourth attempt to get to the top of the mountain as, on previous visits, it had either been closed for maintenance or covered in fog.This time we made it on a perfect day and it was worth it!It as very busy but the staff were very efficient and kept things moving along.This mountain is such an important part of Capetown it was wonderful to get up there!
Table Mountain is clearly one of the wonders of the natural world!. A visit of a lifetime exploring Table Mountain from the top after enjoying the view from down below!

Must visit it when in Cape Town...but have not to return. When visiting Cape Town you have to take cable-car to the Table Mountain. But I do not think it worth being there more than one hour - just enough to visit observation points

Hike up and Cable Car down.. A fun way to do this is to hike up and get a cable car down. It's easier on your knees and you save the cost of one of the cable car rides. You get to hike too. There is a restaurant on top so you can refuel once you're there.If you park your car a little further along past the cable car, you'll be able to hike the Plattekloof gorge to the top (steeper but faster) that way you can walk back to your car from the cable-car afterwards.
Good views from Cape Towns Table Mountain. Great views from up here, the terrain is quite rugged so wear stout shoes or trainersBest to go late morning after the mist has lifted

spectacular mountain scenery. a group of severely unfit students and i hauled ourselves up skeleton gorge!though i was not physically prepared for what was ahead of me i had an amazing hike,every twist and turn of the hike brought a new view i never knew table mountain so personally until this hike!!I IMPLORE everyone to do this hike at least once
Table top Cable Car. Great trip to the top of table mountain can recommend purchasing tickets prior to arrival to save time in waiting in the queues

Gorgeous Views of Cape Town from Table Mountain. I really enjoyed the ride up and the views from Table Mountain. Our day started off with the potential of not being able to go to the top due to the weather/clouds, but it luckily cleared up and we were allowed to go up. We had gorgeous views at the top and it wasn't too crowded to take pictures and enjoy where we were. This is considered a new wonder of the world and I think it's definitely a site worth seeing. It's best to buy a ticket in advance (make sure that you have a window to use it in case the day you want does not allow trips to the top). Otherwise you may be waiting in line for a while.
Just wonderful. Very long walk to reach the top, but it is worth it for the wonderful views you are blessed with. There are also various starting point which are all lovely.

The second best attraction in Cape Town region. Of course the best is the drive through Chapman to Good Hope but this is amazing smooth ride to the top with scenic views of the beautiful city. We had a disappointment initially as the cable cars were shut off due to winds but we got lucky the next day. A must visit

Walk to the top of Table top Mountain and Cape of good hope. Enjoyable treck to the top from the cable way car park. And a great day tour to the Cape of Good Hope. The national park is very large and parts cover Cape Town and further down to the Coast. These trips were done on different days. The treck up to the top of table top mountain took just under 3 hrs. You need sturdy footwear sun screen & warm kit weather dependand. We had a great day climbing it if your reasonably fit. We jumped on the cable car for the return trip down.Our trip to the Cape by car from Cape Town. A nice day trip with some of wildlife to see namely Osttridges and Baboons. We climbed up to the lighthouse but the weather closed in.

The view heavenly !. The lovely experience starts with the cable car ride up. The views are breathtaking. We had the opportunity of seeing some guys doing absailing. They called it " Dope on a rope ! " This is a landmark in Cape Town which can be ees from miles away. The view of Table mountain from The V&A wharf is beautiful and vice versa. If you have gone on a whale watching trip in the Harbour and sometimes thick clouds descend on the Table Mountain , this phenomena is called the tablecloth on the table ! It is a nice walk on the top and the views from all sides are to die for. This place is a must go !

Thrills or hills....you decide. From rock face climbing to tough hikes or moderate walks, majestic Table Mountain offers it all. If weather-timed well, you are able to experience the southern awesome views over the Cape Flats or change course over the Atlantic side and you have the breath-taking view of the Twelve Apostles.

Mountain trail, restaurant and views. Fabulous fabulous fabulous! There is such a gorgeous view of Cape Town and further on from the top!Do pack a jersey...whats warm at the bottom is certainly not the same for the top! and purchasing jackets from curio shops at the top can be pricey.

Table Mountain walk. Wonderful views on a clear day! Would not recommend walking down the mountain without a reasonable level of fitness and adequate footwear. There is no warning signs or detail of how difficult it can be.

Smooth Cable Car Ride to the top and Amazing, breath taking Views. If you are going to Cape Town, this is a MUST!! I begged my boyfriend, who is quite afraid of heights, to go to the top with me and now four months later he is still thanking me for taking him. It was so beautiful and peaceful at the top and I will definitely go up again if I have the chance.

Wow, the views are gorgeous!. The cable car ride up provides gorgeous views and once atop you can hike a bit or even more and enjoy breathtaking vistas of the city and sea. There is a place for found which we found reasonable and just fine. Do not miss this adventure, it is like no other. You can drive up and there is help parking aside the road. Go enjoy!
Cable car ride/views. Well worth the cable car ride to the top, just for the great views. Ensure you take a camera and a light jacket, it can get cold with the breeze on top.

Compulsory visit. It is one of the things a visitor to cape Town simply must do. Either ride up the aerial cableway or hike up Plattekloof Gorge (free of charge).I recommend that one hike up, spend some time exploring the top, and taking the rotating car back down.There is a restaurant and souvenir shop on top of the mountain but you can expect to be exploited.Disabled persons and their minders may jump the long queue outside of the cable station.
Smooth ride and awesome view. What a smooth ride in the cable car and an awesome view from the top of Table Mountain. The pathways were wheelchair friendly.
Table Mountain National Park. The easy way to reach the top is by cable car and the views are outstanding. Cape Town is laid out before you ... it is a spectacular city.

The last Mountain before the deep Atlantic swell!. Table Mountain is not just another tourist attraction in Cape Town, it forms the fabric of Capetonians lives. So many residents enjoy the mountain every day, hiking, trail running, mountain biking, bird-watching, exploring the botanical splendour and more. It really is a worthwhile trip providing views of not only Robben Island, the City Bowl but an endless horizon to Fasle Bay as well as the distant Paarlberg and more. A truly exceptional panoramic perspective, that is evocative and well-worth the Cable car trip, or a decent hike up the mountain trails. The Mountain is also covered in unique Fynbos and a myriad of interesting flowering plants that are representative of the biodiversity of the region. Lots of endemic birds occur at the top, from Cape Sugarbird, through to Orange-breasted Sunbirds, Cape Siskin and in terms of mammals the ever ubiquitous Rock Hyrax. An incredible trip that I undertake several times a year, in all seasons.There are multiple entry points and activity areas, from the Table Mountain Cable Way, through to the Silvermine Nature Reserve, Tokai State Forest, Newlands State Forest, Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden and much more. All dependent on the activities you would like to undertake.Its worth walking along some of the top paths and trails, which will lead you to other view points that are also just as truly majestic as the main city view.

Table Mountain. A wonderful and must see attraction. Make sure to get tickets online before going there. With tickets we waited for one hour to get up there. Closed when the weather is not good and cloudy.

Iconic views of gorgeous Cape Town -- and more!. Simply gorgeous -- take some time to walk around and bring a picnic. The paths are easy to follow and you can find your own spot even when it is crowded.

A vista to die for. The site is very weather dependent so if you see its going to be a great day get there early. Book tickets online also helps with queuing. Take you camera and binocs and something warm to wear.

Active in Cape Town. Walking to the top of this park can be as strenuous or lazy as you want. We chose the strenuous steep path-cum-stairway, which took us around 3 hours. The walk up is worth every bead of sweat. Of course if you're not in shape, you should probably choose a more level, zigzaggy walk to the top. Or you can stand in the very long queue and take the lift to the top.
A view from the clouds. This is a once in a life time experience to enjoy one of the wonders of the world. It will not disappoint.
Must see when in Cape Town. If Table Mountain is clear - Go! Clouds can roll in quickly so make sure you get up there to see the wonderful views.

Don't book too far in advance. We booked the gondola the night before based on the forecast, and that worked well for us. Sunshine is a necessity! The views are spectacular and it was lovely to be out of the city and in nature -- you can spend an hour or two walking around at the top, and could definitely consider bringing a picnic on a sunny day.

Excellent visit. Definitely worth the hype. Fantastic experience and the cable car goes a lot faster than you'd expect. One little tip - there are two queues - one for those with tickets and one for those without. The latter is invariably longer by a magnitude of 10. Use the wifi to book tickets on your phone when you arrive and then you can just go straight into the much shorter queue. I love the future.
This icon makes Cape Town the most interesting city in the world to visit. This iconic mountain is superb you cannot miss this sensational mountain , you cab go by funicular or climbing is perfect

Great to experience the nature and the beatiful views of Cape Town. I hiked up this twice and absolutely loved it! Starting off at Kirstenbosch I travelled up Skeleton gorge. This was so much fun but not to be taken lightly as you have to have safety sense and a good level of fitness.
World Class . This is a must do, must see.One never gets board Breath taking views. Stunning hikes,walks. A photographers dream. Cape Town landmark.

Wear Sunscreen!. can't beat the views! I highly recommend doing this just so you can see all of cape town. We got up the mountain quickly, but I do recommend that you spend time up there and really look around, but wear sunscreen! I got nicely burned up there!

breezing athmosphere. In October the temperature was low and dry. It sometimes rainy at the park. A coat and an umbrella are must-be-brought items. But the view is adorable. The beach and the city are beautiful of height.

An amazing experience. An absolute must if you are in Cape Town.The funicular is one of only two in the world that rotates as you ascend and descend. The views are breathtaking and it is an almost spiritual experience. Looking out to Robben Island so close to the mainland really makes you think of Mandela. Just go and experience it.

What a View!. Afford you 4-5 hours on top of Table Mountain to be able to hike around its mesa, well worth it but be aware of the last tram (6 pm for us) as it would be a long long way down by foot otherwise.

Great views. The views are what this is all about. The view of Table mountain from below and the views of the Atlantic coast and towards Robben Island are worth the trip.
Long queues to get on cable car and very long queues for restaurant.
View the Town from above. Nice view with clear weather and Nice walking opportunities. Up to Mac...... View Point is a Nice walk, do-able for everyone with a basic condition
Great View of City. Cable was closed when we got there so we hiked up 1/2 of the mountain. Still gave us amazing views of the city.

Amazing!! and Breathtaking !!!!!!!. Amazing!! and Breathtaking !!!!!!!
Even though the waiting line was too long, it is a Must do.
Worth being one of the 7 wonders of the world.
Natural beauty at its best. Beautiful surroundings. Large vistas all around. A definite must see and experience! Enjoyable for the whole family.
Breathtaking views. Breath taking views! Should not miss if you are in cape town. Book the tickets online as some days there is a huge queue

Cloud 9. Okay Tabel Mountain was UNBELIVABLE! However it is a weather permitting site. So if you are visiting South Africa on low season meaning the winter there are possibilities that you wont make it to the top! That is a HORRIBLE experience because it almost happened to me! However i was blessed and Highly favored that the weather changed later on in the day! There are long line so buy your tickets before hand! THE VIEW WAS WORTH EVERYTHING
Great view from the top of the mountain. Loved the view. Go online and buy lift tickets early if possible. Have to be sure to go up when there isn't fog on the mountain.
wow. buy cable car tickets ahead of time and go on a clear day. it was beautiful, we enjoyed exploring and looking at the amazing views.

Beautiful but.... Beautiful scenery, but with the mountain being so weather dependant, it was closed for 5 days before our visit, so on the day, the crowds were horrendous, it took an hour and a half to get into the cable car, so when we were at the top of the mountain we only had about 20 minutes before the last cable car down; although this is not the operators fault I think we should have been advised on the time. But beautiful views from the top.

Fantastic views on a clear day. Its a must for all tourists to Cape Town.The wait can be long, so please buy your ticket in advance, Its not cheap if you are a large family,For adults ir=ts R200+ for the return cablecar.You can walk up, but you need a lot of time .

An unparalleled view. Table Mountain is as spectacular as all those pics online providing you with unparalleled views of Capetown and surrounds. It is one of those experiences that cannot be described but best discovered for oneself.
What a view!!!. Unfortunately due to the weather, I was not able to ride the cable car but was taken to the mountain. The view is spectacular!

One of the 7 wonders of the world, why would you not want to visit . Being a South African, Table Mountain is probably the nr 1 recreational activity that makes us the proudest. Table Mountain is definitely a wonder of this world.  Table Mountain is looked after with utmost importance and care. You will find no litter at all on table mountain and it is truly an unforgettable experience to climb up till the top just to enjoy a refreshing beer :) I see table mountain everyday, and each day the mountain looks differently every day. A must
World class set up. Try to book your ticket online (reference code can be scanned at entrance) to avoid the long ticket queue
Amazing views. We were lucky enough to visit Table Mountain during our recent visit to Cape Town. The views were breath taking. It was amazing!

Great views hiking via India Venster. Great views over Cape Town and the Ocean. We walked up via the India Venster route, which covers also quite some scrambling, using some short sections with chains and ladders. Make sure to go with someone who knows the track or at least at time slots when locals are hiking there, since some parts are not well indicated and you risk getting on dangerous tracks if you get lost (just surf the internet to read the stories).Yet if you have some hiking experience, you use your common sense and you keep well on the track, it is really a marvelous climb!

Phenomenal views and fauna. We hired a private guide to take us on a hike up the mountain. While the route was not treacherous, it was not a easy hike. We crossed small streams and had to manage around many rocks and boulders. The fauna was breathtaking along with the views. Ideally hike up the mountain and take the cable car down. For us, the cable car was not operating due to high winds. The hike down was much more difficult than going up. Table Mountain is an exceptional experience. I recommend visiting the botanical gardens at the end of your visit.

Walk it!. You could just look at it. if you go to CT it's hard not to. You should do the cable car if you can't walk it. But if you can walk it, do. If you're fit and experienced you'll do it much faster than the routes say. pick a cool time of day.

A natural and iconic monument and timeless wonder of Cape Town. Iconic and panoramic views of the Cape Peninsula.
Fantastic and wonderful vistas from the cable car
Cape flora and fauna at close proximity , busy Restuarant with friendly staff

Purchase your tickets on line and go as soon as the weather is good. We almost didn't go up to the mountain when we saw the line-up. Although we had bought tickets on-line there was a wait to go on the cable car because the cable car had been on service for a week. The cable car itself is really neat as it does a 360 while you are in it so you can see all views. The top of the mountain has great views and interesting plants and wildlife. It doesn't take very long to get down. Our hotel had got us the tickets on line which made a big difference. You should wait until there is a clear day before you go up. The hikes up the mountain looked good but you need enough time to do them.

Most Amazing view of Cape Town. When in Cape Town a visit to Table Mountain, when weather is clear, is a MUST. The view from the top is just heavenly. Only advice is to buy tickets on line as otherwise you may have to queue up for a long time.
Great views. Food was ok,not great but fine after a walk.Setting is magnificent. Service was also ok. Watch for the dassies.(rock hyraxes) on the outside patio.

Top of the World. I mean this is the highlight of a trip to Cape town ! wow! the weather was a little bad on the day but suddenly Cape Town cleared and we rushed up and boy was it worth it it is just spectacular up there. take some cash but they take card and chill up there! make sure you plan nothing else and really take it in.
Awesome views. Although the chair lift was closed due to high winds, we took the sightseeing bus up the mountain. Well worth the trip, outstanding views from there.

Explore the natural beauty of the Cape. Great place to explore the natural beauty of Cape Town. Take the cable way up and walk across the Table to Maclears Beacon. From there you can make your way one of three paths to the back table.
Beautiful hike!. Absolute must do in Cape Town! Definitely check the weather first and make sure to bring water it is a very steep hike and not for people who are scared of heights!

Majestic!. Dear Tourists. The Table Mountain National Park is much more than a Mountain with a flat top; it stretches all the way from Table Mountain in the city center, to Cape Point at the tip of Africa. In between all sorts of amazing discoveries await: waterfalls, caves, forests, easy walks, more challenging walks, difficult climbs, reservoirs, botanical gardens, BBQ (braai!) facilities, cable cars, funiculars, light houses, flora and fauna. I regularly hike different parts of the mountain with a friend. It's a magical place and no two days are ever alike. Tips - this is a real, unpredictable mountain, so be sensible - warm jacket, water, map, cell phone, etc. Remember to tell someone where you'll be walking.

Definite must see. Definitely a must see attraction in cape town. Everyone will enjoy the cable ride up and the view of this beautiful city. The queues are long especially in peak summer when the weather is perfect. It is cheaper to go up in the evening to watch the sunset and see the lights of the city at night but it can get very cold when the sun sets. Also they will not allow cable rides if the weather does not look good for safety reasons.
World Wonder. Beautiful forever views of Cape Town & its surrounding areas. The India Venster hiking route is recommended for fit hikers.

Much More Than I Thought. This was our second trip to Cape Town, and either schedule or weather had always kept us from exploring it. Finally, on our last full day, the weather cooperated. My wife and I chose to climb up the Platteklip George, probably the most popular route to the top. It was much steeper and more difficult that I had thought, but that is my fault: There is plenty of literature available that I did not consult. However, it was truly beautiful and eventually satisfying to look down from the top.
Just Do It. Beautiful views and great place to simply wait out the sunset. A must do thing when in Cape Town. Gives you a better understanding of the area. Nothing more to say, just do it.
Exquisite view. Need I say much more?The view was superb and was great viewing on the sunny day. The walk around the mountain was worth it to get all the angles.

Jawdropping View of the Mother City. A must do tourist attraction in when in Cape Town. This amazing place offers stunning views of Cape Town on a clear sunny day. The weather can play a spoil sport but other wise its mostly pleasant and windy.A couple of hours will be enough to visit this wonderful place.
Yeah.. What can I say, REALLY? Coming to Cape Town and not going up the mountain is a bit of a silly move. Just go up. It's beautiful. You'll love it. (Good luck with the weather!)
On top of the world. Its stunning- take time to go up and see it, I promise you its something you never will forget. The cable tour is amazing, but the view is stunning.
Gorgeous views of the Cape. The views are absolutely stunning, an attraction that every visitor will love. Having said that, it is perhaps a bit too commercialized and "touristy" for my tastes.
Amazing place to be. It is so Beautiful,nature at its best.From there one can see the beaches and Robben Island.A great fun way to relax and enjoy the scenery from so many angles.
Like an Eagle. Wonderful point of view, great the rotating lift to the peak; i suggest to make this trip after the visit of the city

Worth the money and the wait.. Great view, easy to spend half a day walking around on the top. If you are uncomfortable in the cable car, there are a couple of static seats with the operator. Take at least the short tour for free, but use the toilets before you go off anywhere.Go when it's open, do not wait for the next day, check the weather and website before you go up there. Buy your tickets on line to avoid one of the queues.

Amazing, must do!!. Table Mountain is a must, it is just stunning!! And hopefully you will be lucky enough to go on a clear day as the weather can be iffy there. We didnt have time to do the hike but I hear that is totally doable, we took the cable car up in the afternoon and walked around, just taking it all in. We stayed until sunset and watching the sun set over the Atlantic Ocean was amazing!
On. Clear day you can see forever. This is a must see visit. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes and try to arrive early to avoid long lines for the tram ride to the top. Don't forget your camera.

Table Mountain View 2011. Table Mountain was a wonderful sight to see. The cable ride up to the top was fantastic. We all enjoyed the ride and then the view, 360 degree around the mountain. You must go up if you are in Cape town.
Views to behold. Awespiring with views to match pleasant walks with views round every bend, wildlife and birds easily seen.the cableway journey and views incredible a must attraction.
Sadly we were not able to ride the cable car due to maintenance.. Be sure to check if cable car maintenance is being conducted during your visit, which will make access to the mountaintop impossible.
Great place to visit on a sunny day.. We made sure we took advantage of a clear day for our visit and it was well worth the planning. Fantastic views, a nice trail and some nice nature to go with it.

Touristy- yes, must do - absolutely.. As the number one rated attraction in Cape Town, you know going in that it will be crazy busy and crowded. That being said, it is well worth navigating the crowds. We had a limited amount of time so we rode the cable car to the top, otherwise we would have endeavored the steep hike up to the top. The views from the top are breathtaking and inspiring.Even with busloads of tourists being dropped off, the cable car system is very well organized so that you can get to the top relatively painlessly. There are two cars that hold about 50 people each so they are able to move the line along fairly well but also limit the crowd at the top.A couple of tips to make the experience easier:1. Buy your tickets in advance.2. Monitor the website, updated at 8 am.3. Get there early to lessen the crowds.4. Have breakfast up top. Great cafe.5. Enjoy the incredible scenery.
Magnificent. Magnificent. Mind Blowing, one of best place I have ever seen in my life. I have promised myself to go there again and again and again.

Keine Hektik!. We visited table mountain on a bright sunny day. We arrived there at 2 p.m.. Many tourist were leaving at that time and we parked our car very close to the entrance.We liked the views too. Next year we will come back!

Beautiful Nature. There's alot that I liked about Table Mountain. It's a view that I never seen in my life. When I was up that Mountain I thought of Leon Schuster( Schucks) how did he heat himself up from the mountain down to the station? The view that I saw it was beautiful and overwhelming.
Mighty Table. The Might Table Mountains is a beautiful plave to visit and have a look over Cape Town from the top!
Our first love. Stunning, everyone visiting Cape Town book the table mountain activity and see cape town from the view up there, it is incredible

Table Mountain, almost reached the sun.. I took the sightseeing red tour bus from the Aquarium up to Cableway and took the cable car up Table Mountain. You get an excellent view of the CBD and surrounding suburbs from the top. Make sure to go on the Table Mountain website for weather conditions up there and if the Cableway is open. Take sunscreen, hat and water with.

Amazing place. For sure is the best place to visit. On the top of mountain the view is wonderful. You have to go up when the weather is clear to make safe and have good view. You can go hiking or cabe car if is open. Enjoy!

Magnificent Views from the Top. This is one of the most memorable and spectacular views one will ever see. Once at the top one has a surround view of Cape Town. There are restrooms and a restaurant at the top. One of South Africa's biggest tourist attractions and I can see why. So worth it.

Absolutely stunning scenery. One of the best places I have ever visited. you can walk up the mountain or take the cable car. Either way the National Park is awesome and on the right day offers fantastic views out over Cape Town. Many happy visits and would rate this as the best outdoors experience in the Cape region.

Breathtaking. Table Mountain National Park spans Table Mountain itself, several mini mountains and trails, and several beaches. Like most of the sites in Cape Town, the park is well preserved and beautiful. There are several signs that state not to feed the baboons, please take them seriously.
A Cape Town must. Fabulous excursion on a fine day. A must when you visit Cape Town. Great views all round and a pleasant stroll along the top of the mountain.
top 5 of cape town attractions. this is must do /see of cape town,, u can hike up for around 2 hours hike or take the famous lift up the mountain, the view up there is wonderful and breathtaking
Table Mountain. Amazing hike! Felt totally safe with a big group of people who know the trails. Very beautiful, if you go to Capt Town, then you must go up Table Mountain!

See Capetown in all it's glory!!!. Must be on everyone's Bucket List to go here, it is spectacular and so worth a visit - getting to the top is fun whether walking or riding the cable car - I recommend trying both

What an Amazing Place. What a fantastic experience. Cable car ride to the top is very good and well organised. I would recommend pre booking your tickets. Make sure you go when table mountain isn't covered with it's table cloth (low level cloud). The views from the top are incredible and make sure you walk round as much of the top as your are capable of doing.

Perfect to see all of Cape Town!. The ABSOLUTE BEST mountain to see entire Cape Town....AMAZING! We took the cable car up and down but you can also hike up and take cable car down.It is bit colder at the top of the mountain so always bring a cardi or shawl.

After 10 years still stunningly beautiful. Been there ten years ago and returned again to show our now grown up daughter. Was again stunned with it's beauty and views. A must see when visiting the Cape area.You won't be the only one so be prepared for a long wait to go up. Once above you will not notice the abundance of people that much.You can try the abseiling as well. Expensive but fun.
Breathtaking. Absolutely breathtaking. You will need at least 2-3 hours to take in the whole thing. Plan ahead and buy tickets online. Waiting in the line takes over an hour or more if they are busy.

Up for sunset.... We visited on a glorious evening in February on the last night of our visit to SA. If you go late afternoon/early evening it is cheaper to take the cable car (which moves in a circular motion so everyone gets a 360 view) up to the top. Also although the queue looked quite long it is a very efficient system and we got to the ticket office close to a walking pace. No cloud (sometimes called a 'tablecloth') on our visit and the views are just stunning. Loved it.

The best tour of my life!. Cape Town is one of the best places in the world. Offering amazing and unforgettable scenarios, Table Mountain is definitely one of the places you have to see if you visit the city, the cable car experience, the views and nature make it one of the best viewpoints in the world, more than highly recommend!

Must go. A must see on the Cape. Simply stunning scenery, give yourself enough time to drive around the whole park, there are lots of tucked away places, little beaches etc, though it is too cold to swim.

A Cape Town must do. What a view and despite the cloud cover rolling down the mountain it appears to just stop like a table cloth and goes no further. If you're in the heart of town and look up and see no cloud cover, get your ticket and head up the mountain. If there's too much cloud cover, wait until another day. The view from the top is like no other.

Must visit Landmark in Cape town. Must visit place when in SA. MAke sure to book your tickets online to avoid the queue. dont worry about the morning and afternoon slots. you can change them when you get to the spot. the staff there are friendly and very helpful.
Book the ticket online. I highly recommend this place, BUT you have to book the ticket online to escape the line. Check the weather before you go it's colder than Cape Town.

Cape Point. If you are local and haven't visited Cape Point, do it.. Get a Wild Card or Green Card and make it a regular outing. Stunning views. Take the Flying Dutchman funicular up to the lighthouse, or take a slow walk and enjoy the sights as you go along. Be prepared for the steps up to the lighthouse - the view from the top should not be missed! Lovely walks and a number of shorter drivers through the park which lead to hidden sites of interest.

Easy hike, tremendous view. There is a cable car taking people to the top, even though some people chose to climb. I think it is well worth it if you have both the time and energy. The top of the mountain is quite flat which makes walking or hiking quite easy. There you can have a 360 view of Cape Town and surroundings. There is also a restaurant severing buffet type of food. There was a wine yard doing promotion at the time of our visit. You can enjoy the view with a small bottle of local wine.

Don't miss it, especially on a sunny day. Best views of the city bowl and Atlantic Ocean and Robben Island. Wonderful flora along well-kept paths. Efficient service to the top of the mountain and back!

Take My Breathe Away. It's a must if you're in Cape Town. Take the cable car ride (or add it the Hop On/Hop Off Bus Tour--they drop you off right at the base and pick you up). If you're a hiker then plan for additional time--you can spend hours wandering around on the trails or hike up or down.

Spectacular Views!. A must-do while in Cape Town. The views are spectacular! You can hike up and down or take the cable car for one or both trips. We chose to take the cable car up after arriving that morning from the US, but saw plenty of people hiking it.
Great views. Excellent views from the top. Must do attraction. We stayed about 4 hours and enjoyed every bit of the trip
spectacular view. Despite there was maintenance work was going on. Still the view is just breath taking. Its truly a worth while experience to see it.

Shut!. The mountain was stunning when we could see it above the clouds. Unfortunately the lift was closed so we couldn't visit the top although the weather wasn't great soni don't think that mattered. Anyway avoid last week in July and start of august as this appears to be when the lift is serviced!

A must see on a clear day. On a clear day, this is A MUST DO in Cape Town. The 360 degree view is awesome and the cable car ride is great. Being able to walk around on the summit and have a cup of tea is great

Great Views. A must do in Cape town, go in the mid afternoon as all the biggest crowds have come and gone we found.
The views are awesome on a clear day.
The cable car floor rotates so you all get a good look round, no one hoggs the best viewing window.
Stunning Views. Stunning Views await you so plan to spend some time here to take it all in and to realize the beauty of the location of Cape Town.

Must do! . Cape Town unfortunately has been a bit of a disappointment for my partner and I due to weather conditions; everything has been cancelled due to the constant rain. However on our very last day, the sun came out and we could finally get up to Table Mountain. What a beautiful sight! The views are phenomenal, the grounds are clean and well cared for and the wait time for us was only 5 minutes. I definitely would not miss this off your list. TIP - best to book your tickets in advance, the lines are ridiculously long, to avoid this buy online.

Exhausting, yes, but 100% worth the hike. Despite hiking Table Mountain in the middle of winter, it was very hot and tiering. The way up is pretty rocky with an hour and a half unrelenting climb but worth it for the stunning views of cape town you get both on the way up and at the top. The top of the mountain is incredible: loads of dassies scurrying around, beautiful birds and the best view of cape town you can get. I would throughly recommend the hike to anyone despite the fact that the way down hurts a little on the knees...

One of the Wonders of the world. If you feel energetic do yourself a favour and walk up Platteklip Gorge to the top of table mountain. The walk is quite strenuous so take your time and savour the wonderful view of Cape Town, Robben Island and Table Bay. If you want you can catch a ride down on the cable way or walk down. Be warned it can be slippery after rain and wind. Be prepared with proper walking shoes, water and a warm jacket. The temp can drop quite dramatically at the top. There is no fee to walk. there is a charge for the ride down in the cable car.

Breathtaking!. One of the most spectacular sights I´ve ever visited. Can´t even put it into words...Cape Town landmark nr 1! One can even see Mandela´s prison island (Robben) from the top. Excellent restaurant with lovely terraces & views and on the foot paths - those beaver-like creatures running around...unbelievable.
View from the top. This is Cape Towns most amazing Landmark. To climb it or take a cable up to the top holds breathtaking views and is sure to give you an experience you will never forget.

Always awesome!!. On a clear,windfree day friends and I went up the mountain with the cable car.The view of the city,sea and mountain is always stunning,no matter how often you take this trip.SA pensioners note,reduced fare on Fridays,take your I.D/book.Free on your birthday! We then hiked to Mclears Beacon and along the Smuts treck.An easy walk for all ages,fantastic scenery.peace and quiet.A picnic on top of the mountain rounded off this perfect day.How blessed are we capetonians to have this at our doorstep.Hats off to the National Parks staff for keeping it pristine.

Trip to Table Mountain. Easy to get to the Table mountain - need to check weather constantly if the top of the Mountain is opened. Often is cloudy or windy therefore when you are in Cape Town rather count with 2 days. Very nice view from the top.

Don't take the cable car hike up instead!. We hiked up with Rhiaan from Hike Table Mountain scrambling up the India Venster route - it was an amazing day with great physical and mental challenges. Scrambling up and over rocks and around tight corners certainly made my heart beat faster and brought an adrenalin rush. Rhiaan was truly amazing - so calm and I think he could get anyone up that mountain. It was a fantastic day! The Mountain itself is mother nature at her best and is a beautiful national park which is a must see whilst in CT. Enjoy!
Beautiful. The view from the top is just amazing. The staff is wonderful and make the experience worthwhile. Great for the whole family.
Lion's Head. Climbed Lion's Head. Took us 1:45 to walk up and the views were stunning all the way up. One should be in reasonable physical shape and should be able to climb ladders.

Stunning views - a must see in Cape Town.. When the weather opens up - go immediately as that may be your only opportunity. Buy your tickets online before you go to avoid the long line for tickets. The rest is stunning as usual.

Excellent view. If you are really lucky to go to South Africa and be lucky to have a clear day you will be rewarded with an incredible view. Not only you see the city below but you also see interesting (small) animals and also climbers. Really an enjoyable trip.

A View from the Top. 360 degree views of around Cape Town a must do! Go by the red bus to the area where you catch the gondola to the top. The gondola has a rotating floor so no one can hog the best view!

Great cable car ride to fabulous views.. Fabulous. A must for your visit to Capetown if it's clear. We were there in winter so not really very crowded in the morning. Our hotel arranged for tickets the night before once we saw the weather would be good. Spent about an hour on the top of Table Mountain.
Stunning outlook. We visited on a crystal clear day. One of the world's great views. Best to visit early as the weather can close in quickly.

With family or friends. Be in Capt Town, and not a sin to be here. Great place, beautiful view, walk for a few hours and lunch, which is a long time to remember. With family or friends, certainly much better than yourself. I would recommend highly!

Room at the top. My wife and I were fortunate to visit on an really clear day. The views were absolutely fantastic!! On the ride up, the cable car rotates so that everyone gets a view and at the top you have a beautiful panorama of Cape Town, the surrounding mountains and Robben Island. There are several walking routes around the summit but we did not take them

Don't Miss. Have you ever been in a cable car that rotates as it climbs? Well, that is just one of the treats you will encounter visiting this mountain! On a clear day, which we had, the views were spectacular. Once on the top, you are able to easily walk around to get the full effect and view of Capetown. Souvenirs were easily obtInable on the top too! Just a hint, make sure to buy tickets online first as that line can be very long, and then you have an entrance line! This is one experience you don't want to miss!

Great trip but expect long queue if Load shedding. The lift had been closed for a few days due to weather and was due to be closed for a further 2 weeks for maintenance so everyone was trying to get up the mountain. We had great views throughout with the rotating cable car and one of our group ran down and met a scared porcupine in the dusk. We were ill advised by staff that it was a 40 min queue to get up which turned out to be 2.5 hrs and the queue back down was the same! It was very cold at the top as queue was not sheltered. Small children and older people looked really uncomfortable. Cafe looked good though but had closed even though they were still letting people go up after 6pm. Take this into account when planning your day.

Table Mountain National Park ~ A walk in natural beauty. Table Mountain National Park; when you at the top of Table Mountain, take time to walk and explore the natural beauty of the forna and flora. South Afric ~ Cape Town is renowned to have the most species of plants than anywere elese in the world. So if your into your wild flowers this is a great place to visit and enjoy the experience.
The big table. From a south African truelly a must see go up to the mountain to watch the beautiful sun sets that Cape Town has to offer

Breath-taking Views. One of the must-sees in Cape Town. We took the cable way up to the summit. You can also hike to the top if the weather permits.Views of the city and the ocean from the top are splendid. Make sure you take a jacket as it can be chilly up there.
Beautiful Views. If you are in Cape Town, this is a must, Either via hiking or cable way. The view from Top is amazing.

Oh, the views!. If you get to Cape town and miss to visit the Table Mountain, then you've missed one of the best experiences in the country. The views are breathtaking, I heard a couple behind me exclaim that it was better than the Grand Canyon! You need to make sure you are in town on a warm day for a chance to get up there as there are no visits allowed on extremely cold days.

WOW WOW WOW. didnt manage the climb as the temperature was so high, but all the same when at the top! stunning views 360 degrees. the wait for the cable car was awhile, but well worth it as even whilst ascending, one can take in the views.

Birthday Bliss!. On your birthday, any South African citizen can travel up the Table Mountain Cable Car free of charge. Just show your green ID book.I took them up on this offer and was pleasantly surprised with fantastic wind still warm weather on top of the mountain ... with a view stretching forever. Words cannot describe. This is a tick all South Africans must tick off the list.
Breathtaking. What can you say about this park except that it is one of the most beautiful places on the planet. Fantastic views of the Cape Town bowl, the sea and the sunset.
Table Top Mountain. Beautiful must see view of Cape Town! Took about a hundred pictures or more alone just for this venue; truly scenic and memorable.

Magnificent vistas of a beautiful city. This is one of the most iconic symbols of Cape Town, and is visible from miles away. Both from the top, or from the city, it defines the city and it's weather. If the cloud isn't covering the mountain, don't pass up the opportunity to take a ride in the cable car to the top.

Technical climb but worth it if you like to hike. Climbing Table Mountain was one of the things I wanted to do in Cape Town and it is well worth it. But if you plan on hiking the mountain, be warned that it is a technical climb that will take most people around 2 hours to make one direction. About 4,000 feet up what amounts to stairs. Platteklip Gorge is the main hike up and there are a lot of people on the trail. All total I spend 5-1/2 hours hiking up and down the trail.Wear sturdy hiking boots if you decide to go. I saw lots of people in running shoes (a few actually running the trail) some in flip flops and at least one guy bare foot. But I was very happy to have worn sturdy hiking boots, especially on the climb down. Also bring a minimal of 2 liters of water, more if hot.There is a cable car that can take you one way if you only want to hike part but be warned, it can stop running with no warning so if you go to the top, even in the cable car, you need to be prepared to hike down. Or at least make sure you go on a day the weather is stable. Something I don't think happens much during the winter in Cape Town. The cable cars were not running for annual maintenance the day I was there. The cable cars I believe cost something but since they were not running I don't know how much.Views from the top are awesome and make sure you leave yourself at least one hour. You can seen in all directions and there are trails at the top that you can check out. Sunset would also be fantastic from here but make sure the cars are running as you don't want to hike down in the dark, it is hard enough in the light.There are cabs usually parked at the bottom of the hiking trail and cable car lodge so if you need a ride back into the city it should not be difficult to get one.

Incredible views! . Pre buy a ticket before you arrive in Cape Town to avoid long queues. The cable car is excellent with a revolving floor to ensure everyone gets a chance to see the views. When you reach the top you are greeted with the incredible views across Cape Town taking in views of Camps Bay, Robben Island, Lions Head and the harbour as well as the mountains in the distance. Good restaurant at the top with a lot of choice. Recommend a visit to the top!

Worth the hype. Must see but be sure to go in the morning as the winds in the arvo often mean the lifts will shut. In the morning the cloud may be covering the summit but once you get up there it's still amazing and the clouds will pass :)

One of the most amazing places on earth. Cape town just blew me away. I have ever seen a place more beautiful than this. The amazing scenary offerred by Table Mountain national park, with clouds on the beach at one side of the road and the mountain range at the other, is simply is a sight to behold. Table Mountain, Lion's head, Signal Hill, Chapman's peak, Table Mountain National Park has way too much to offer.
Amazing. Amazing view going though the clouds the view where do good as a person scared of heights not the best place to go but I loved it

World Heritage Sight No 1. A must see in the world of nature. Take a bottle of bubbly and a packet of crisps to the top, sit on an extended rock, look out over the city of Cape Town and appreciate the beauty of Africa. Walk the mountain top, hike the path up and down and feel the beauty of real, unspoiled nature feeding your soul.

Romantic Sunset's from Table Mountain. From the initial stunning cable ride up the side of the mountain to the absolutely breath taking sunsets Table Mountain was a spectacular treat not to be missed .For the first time in my life I understood how our ancestors felt while watching the sunset into the ocean, I believed if I followed it I would drop off the end of the earth..A bottle of good wine some glasses and a loved one to share the sunset with are the right ingredients for a romantic evening ..

Check the weather. Definitely worth a visit but don't bother if it's foggy! Having said that, the weather is sporadic in the winter (i.e. June) so a terrible fog is often cleared in 30 mins (and the fog can return again). It's probably best to visit in the spring/ summer when all the plants bloom. They were mostly dead in the winter.

Platteklip Gorge Trail. We really enjoyed our hiking up to the top of Table Mountain and likely we found a great sunny day to do it. This trail is leading you up through a really steep path and if you are not enough fit, like us, you need indeed some more stop just to recover your breath, which on the other side gives you some more chance to take a nice shot of the amazing panorama which surrounds you all way long. Once you finally get the top, you can enjoy the breathtaking view over Cape Town, obviously if is not cloudy! Highly recommended.....

Wow!. My two roommates and I were recently in Cape Town for a week, but we knew that Table Mountain was a must. We decided to make the trek up and take the cable car down as we were short for time.. this hike KICKED MY BUTT! and the scenery at the top made it so worth it. Not for the faint of heart or those remotely afraid of heights, but if you're thinking about doing it, bring some water, a good pair of runners and positive attitude!
Special experience!. Going to Tafelberg was a great experience! When we went there it was a clear sky so we could see for miles away. Definitely recommended!

Trip on to the Table. We had to wait more than an hour to buy tickets. We could buy on line, but not if you have children. If just adults, this is the way to go. Once we had tickets we had to the que for another hour. Once on top it was amazing.
Alain and again. Everytime we're in Cape Town this is our Must Do. Love the view on the City and the surrounding area. Have a Walk, have a coffee, simple enoy
lovely towarda sunset. Spectacular views from top of the city.Cable car is great access but if you're up for the challenge apparently the walks are fun!

Breathtaking. We were so eager to climb to the Mountain and after 2 days of cloudy and heavy cloudy weather, we were able to go up and enjoy the experience. We took a short "u" tour of the plateau and we photographed these amazing landscapes you would only see in the magazines. Not much to do on the mountain, if you are a fan of diversity. You can choose different treks, each more difficult or easier than other. I recommend to climb the mountain with the Table Mountain Cable and go down by foot if you want to enjoy the site seeing. Expect a bit of extreme.

Experience nature.. This is one of the most amazing places to visit when you are in Cape Town....the view is absolutly beautiful and you can spend many hours walking....then have a light lunch or sundowner at the restaurant.

Awesome views of Cape Town!. Awesome views from the top of Table Mountain. Definitely an experience not to miss. If you want a workout, do the hike up but be prepared. I say it's like being on the stairmaster for 1.5 hours...depending on your pace. We really didn't stop except for a few seconds here and there. But it was well worth it. Took the cable car down. Can take it up as well. Wind will close the cable car so be aware and check before you go. The cable car is also closed for a period every winter to do maintenance so check for operating times. Other than that...GO!
The Beautiful National Park . It was my first time to visit a national park in Africa , there we find lots of kinds of species living in the top of Table Mountain .
GREAT!!!. GREAT!!! Worth to spend the whole day there! Beautiful nature, unbelievable landscapes, nice café. You can access the top of the Table Mountain by foot or using cableway.

South African Adventure. Amazing experience & views! We went up via the cable car and walked down (not necessarily our best idea!) Bought tickets online before we travelled which avoided any queues. The floor of the cable car revolves so everyone gets a great view on the way up or down. The Dassies (little creatures) were a joy to see. If you have a good clear day, go for it - dont wait!

Very nice promenade. At the beginning you have to wait a lot because it is crowded with tourists like you wanting to climb with the aerial cable car. But once on top you can wander around and it is very nice. Some nice spots, beautiful nature...
Gorgeous Views. Gorgeous views! You are truly up in the clouds looking down onto the city. If you're only in town a few days, make sure you pick a good weather day for this attraction.

Very good and must do. Cable car ride up is great and the top itself is fabulous. Plan for atleast 3 - 4 hours as there is a lot of walking and seeing to do. Key to making it a great outing is a sunny cloudless day of course. Also, if you are planning on going, to avoid crows, book in advance online - go to the Table Mountain website and fairly easy to do. Will help considerably in avoiding long queues once you get there - waiting time can be as long as an hour and you will avoid this through the online booking.

Don't forget a visit to Table Mountain. Any first-time visitor to Cape Town must include a visit to the top of Table Mountain. There is a beautiful nature reserve, walking paths and, of course the views of the Mother City are unmatched.

The cable car running just in sunny day. Its quiet difficult to get the sunny day in Cape Town, don't hesitate to get it when you're on sunny day, maybe tomorrow will be cloudy so the cable car do not run. The scenery just epic!

Check the weather. Amazing views but we couldn't go all the way to the top as it was too windy.. We did the citibus tour and that brought us quite high up and you can get off the bus for a while and catch the next one every 15 minutes

Absolutely stunning views! One of our favorite things in Cape Town.. We loved the views from Table Mountain. The trails are well laid out and the views are stunning. The best advice I can give is to do this trip as soon as you possibly can when arriving into the city. The cable car closes frequently and many people miss out. There was a great app (put out by the park, I believe) that gives up-to-the-minute weather conditions and advises whether the cable car is open or closed. Don't miss this in Cape Town!
Fabulous views. Stunning views of CapeTown and mountain top. A great way to see this beautiful city. Definitely a plus if you are in Cape Town and the weather is good.
Stunning. Im terrifed of heights but when in Cape Town......... Amazing views for miles around, so well worth facing your fears.

Ticket Desk Scam?. Excellent site but be careful of the friendly ticket office staff. Ours used the smokescreen of getting into a friendly discussion to put us off as she massively short-changed us. This was not a mistake - the money was handed back to us in a very deliberate way.

fabulous views. We tried to go up to the top the first day but a wind came up and the ariel car was closed. We decided to try again another day and are glad we did. The view was breathtaking. There were really interesting plants to look at and we had a "table cloth" come over the top. That's when a cloud comes over the top of the flat mountain and looks like a tablecloth. It was really neat.

South African Pilgrimage. Every visit to Cape Town should include it, although I haven't been up in many years, due to weather conditions etc.The views from the top are spectacular, and the cable car ride itself is an experience.Although, if you have allot of time and energy, hike it, it will be worth it.
A must do. One of my favorite hikes! And fantastic views! Table Mountain is loved by all in Cape Town. So it's a must see to climb it.
On a clear day you can see forever. The views from Table Mountain are magnificent! It's an awe inspiring visit! Gorgeous! It's windy, so dress for the chilly weather.
See CT by night if you take the sunset cable ride!. The most amazing views in CT to be found on the tippy top of this table-top! Freezing during winter!
Breathtaking !. had the most perfect day on Table Mountain. The cableway wasn't as scary as it looked either. We were just astounded at the breathtaking views.
Amazing experience. Make sure the visibility is very good before you venture up. Unfortunately, even with poor visibility, the cable car still runs so you must use your initiative!!

Iconic mountain with awesome views. I took the cable car both ways, and managed to not have to queue too long. The views from the top are amazing on a clear day, and the walks along the top are excellent if you like walking. Next time I come back I’ll walk up and down.

On the top of the world. Difficult hiking trail, but the view from the top makes it all worth.
Make sure you have appropriate shoes and cloths for all weather.
Plan enough time for the visit, as, especially on verry good weather, can be incredibly crowded.

Table Mountain. We were lucky to be able to ride the cable car to the top of Table Mountain on the last day before they began their yearly cable car maintenance. The weather was perfect; clear blue skies and no wind. If it is windy and foggy, the cable cars do not operate. Because it was the final day, the crowds were everywhere. The lines, however, move quickly, and you're at the top before you know it. What a view from up there! You can walk around the top of the mountain and see all sides, north, south, east, west. One more breathtaking than the next. Worth every penny and every minute.

Amazing!!. Great view, great experience! Definitely something every traveller to Cape Town must do! July 2015 weather was a bit rainy, but otherwise it was great. Always go on a sunny day (ensure there is no cloud cover on top of the mountain)
Amazing. Second time on table mountain and I enjoyed it just as much the second time as I did the first. highly recommended, great views of cape town and we enjoyed the trials on the mountain.
Must see. A must see. One of the best natural reserves you can ever see in your life. It's a breath taking place.

Top notch cheesecake at the top of Table Mountain. I don't know if it was the altitude but the cheesecake and coffee I had at the top of Table Mountain was the best I've eaten in a long time. The selecting of food and payment by taking your tray to the cash register is a bit awkward but there is enough space to find a table and it is quite child friendly.

Breathtaking views!. You cannot say you have seen Cape Town without a visit to the famous Table Mountain which towers over the very beautiful city of Cape Town. I stayed in a suburb very near the base of the mountain and had the option of taking the cable car, which most tourists seem to opt for, or walking to the mountain via the winding road which leads to the top. Feeling energetic that day I decided on the latter and although it was quite a hike it was well worth the effort. Breathtaking views await you and I was so lucky to experience the well known phenomenon of the rolling mist/cloud which obliterates the view of the top of the mountain quite regularly.
Most beautiful view. Most beautiful view ever , worth going to the top :) felt out of this world. Nice breeze and nice view so serene and amazing nature . Dreaming of visiting that place again soon
Great hike, better views. Awesome hike and the most beautiful views in the world! Totally worth it to hike up to the top and have a beer before taking the tram down.
Worth every Rand to get to the top on a clear day!. We went to the top of Table Mountain and the view was nothing less than spectacular! The rock hyrax were cute.

Just absolutely breathtaking. A once in a lifetime must do I would say!. Just one of the most stunning places in the entire world. Right up there with the Grand Canyon and Sydney Harbour, an absolute must for anyone!

A must do!. There are some different hikes upnto table mountain. We did the skeleton gorge, which starts at kirstenbosch botanical gardens. It took us about 3 hours to reach the cable car station. Unfortunatelly, we couldn't enjoy the view because it was goo foggy. But the hike was pretty cool.

Beautiful spot, well worth a visit.. Taking the cable car up to the top of the mountain provides the first amazing views. After you arrive on the top of the mountain, the sights just get better. There are well maintained paths in all directions, and it's easy to spend an hour or more just strolling and looking at the beautiful scenery. There's a little restaurant, but we didn't visit it.I went with a Cape Town native who lamented that she didn't visit the site more often. We had a beautiful day, and a great time.
It gets cold up there!. One of the modern seven wonders of the world. Need I say more? Breathtaking views of Cape Town and special place to grab some lunch

Adrenaline rush extended. Not for the faint hearted, hike up Table Mountain via India Venster and come down via the cable car to experience the best of the views that the Table Mountain National Park has to offer

Exhilarating cable car ride up to Table Mountain. Fabulous 180 degree views of the beautiful city of Cape town and surrounding areas. Good parking available. Cable car tours up the mountain are very well-organized. Highly recommended. Check website for the dates when cable car is shut down for annual repairs.

Early morning climb. We took on Platteklip gorge at 6 on a Saturday morning. It was much tougher than we thought, but we made it in under two and half hours and took the cable car down. It's a really great experience and a must do if you live in Cape Town. Get out there.

When in Cape Town.... If you come to South Africa you have to go to Table Mountain. The view is wonderful, it is a natural wonder and has a range of activities for the very active or the passive tourist.

table top mountain cape town. in capetown, table mountain was the best part of my visit. the cable ride is going up and down the mountain is very enjoyable. there is restaurant on top of the mountain which serves good food. it almost took the whole day to explore the mountain, the veiw from the mountain is amazing. it is usually a bit colder on the mountain top.

Up the mountain. The cause of Cape Town's traffic problems is that there is a massive mountain in the way. Every day thousands of Capetonians have to navigate their way around it on their way to work or to arrive at their destinations. Yet so few of them ever experience the awesome wonder of the mountain and its national park.The National Park is vast and stretches across many Cape Town suburbs. The main focal points are the 3 summits of Table Mountain, Devil's Peak and Lions Head. There are many gentle walks around the foothills of the mountain on all sides of it. Newlands forest is popular for dog walkers and evening strolls.If, like me, you would like to attain a summit when setting out to walk on the mountain, the easiest of these is Lion's Head. Fit people can get from the car park to the top in 45mins to an hour. Unfit: 2hrs max. The final push is quite a rigorous step for step climb up table-height rocks.Devil's Peak is more challenging. The simplest way is from near the end of Tafelberg Road (the one with the cable station), up the Saddle and then onto the peak. Stick to the paths. It's steep. Allow 2 and a half hours. To summit Table Mountain, it can be approached from any and every side and with huge ranges in difficulty. The simplest way up is Platteklip Gorge which is the big dividing line on the front of Table mountain. Steep. Usually 2 to 3 hours. (Fit people can summit quicker than those in the cable car queue during tourist season!) You'll see the starting point on Tafelberg Road just beyond the cable station. Also very popular is Skeleton Gorge which starts at KIrstenbosch Botanical Garden (you will have to pay entry to the gardens if you start there (but can enter the gardens freely if you descend there from the mountain)).My favourite is to start right at the back of the mountain at Constantia Nek. From the car park there you can effectively be on top of the mountain (but the back end of it - not the popular part) in well under an hour. How far you want to explore on top of the mountain is up to you. It's vast. You can visit the 5 dams, look down on Kirstenbosch, follow the circular route on top, there's even a museum up there or you can cover the whole top plateau by walking across to the cable station at the opposite end of the mountain from Constantia (that would take about 5 hours). I also like this particular area because it is free from crowds and is often populated with friendly local hikers who love the mountain and will chat about interesting things they have seen or warn about impending weather etc. It's quite clever the way the cable car operates on a tiny edge of a massive national park - so as to leave vast areas of beauty completely untouched.After about 20 minutes of walking the views in all directions are spectacular. At the top there are places where the traffic noise disappears and it is difficult to believe one is still in a metropolitan area. WARNINGS: You'll need to have a good idea of direction and where you are going. Look at and take a map.  You'll need to take warm clothes and be ready for sudden weather changes. The weather on the mountain is not the same as in the city below and can change quickly. The Cable Station closes when they are unhappy about weather or wind speed. A hooter blows, but I have only ever heard it from the tourist area near the station, so always be ready to have to walk down if you plan to explore the National Park beyond the Table. Take water and something to eat. Know who you will phone if you get into trouble. Don't go alone. There is some crime on the Devil's Peak slopes. The mountain claims lives each year. It looks easier than it is.
Must See. The views are spectacular and although quite small it never seemed crowded. A must see if in Cape Town

hiking. One of the 7 new wonders of the world. table mountain is a must for anybody who comes pass the mother city by cable car or by foot on one of the 7 hiking trails around this incredible beautiful mountain. We went with friends and love it.💛

Literally okay. I feel bad for not being blown away by it. I admit we arrived latish on a Saturday. The cable car was like a scrum for the window places. It is special at the top, saw sunset and then clouds rolled in. Then alarms it was to windy so we had to go. Plenty of beauty everywhere in Cape Town I prefer it from the bottom. Also it does not look like a table on top much to my absolute horror. Might try quite day in winter.

Breathtaking Views. absolutely breathtaking ! so long as weather good and wind low. Don't let the steepness of the cable ride deter you, its perfectly safe and holds up to 60 people, plus the floor rotates to give everyone the view ! Do It
Beautiful views. A must see if you're in Cape Town, beautiful views and well worth it. Take a jacket for the top as can get a bit chilly if its windy.

Breath taking views. After flying up the mountain in the 360 degree revolving cable car the views over the Cape, 12 Apostles etc are truly breathtaking even if a little cold in winter tiime (wrap up well as at this height it gets damn cold) we stayed for around 15 mins before descending but in summer you can wander round till the last car down@6pm.

Must go when in Cape Tow. Table Mountain is indeed a marvel. It is a mandatory ride when you are in Cape Town. Besides the natural beauty, everything works great. At Table Mountain we spent very pleasant and unforgettable hours.
Well worth a visit on a clear day. Booked ticket via Hop on and Hop off bus and avoided queues! Beautiful natural scenery and clear refreshing air
Simply one of the best views around.... If you are lucky, you will pick a day when the crowds and clouds are minimal. Seen a lot of vistas in my time but this is one of the best...

India Venster Climb. If you dont do heights be mentally prepared. There are some parts where you need to climb up ladders and use chains that have been installed. The reward for doing the climb is spectacular views. When you go back down in the cable car you get to be reminded how far you climbed!!

Beautiful views. An amazing experience! With stunning views and good walks.Go as early as possible, we parked and had started walking up by 7:30am, by the time we came down at 11am and midday the car queue was down to the bottom of the hill and the queue wait was probably about 3-4 hours. Check the cable car status online before leaving home because the wind affects whether it is on or not

It's no surprise Table Mountain is a natural wonder!!. As an adventure photographer, I am in the mountains all the time, especially around the Table Mountain National Park!! This is a MUST see for all tourists and adventurers alike!
Tale Mountain Trip. A fantastic trip to the top of table mountain. Breathtaking views of Cape Town and Robben Island. A must do whilst in Cape Town.

One place you shouldn't Miss.. The Scenery is breath taking. I enjoyed every angle. It gives a panaromic look of the entire Cape Town . Nice place to take photos. Book online of you wish to jump the Q.

Excellent!!. Visited the Table Mountain and the view is truly magnificent! The only problem is that when it is foggy the cable cars have to stop operating so this can cause delays! However, when I went I had no such problem so I consider my self lucky!

Indispensable. The trip to visit table mountain is a must on Cape town. Despite I am afraid of hight (the cableway was the worst moment), the views are unforgettable. Purchase the tickect by the official webpage to avoid eternal lines (there is wifi next to the tickect office to do that). Be care not to go on cloudy or windy days, because it could be closed.

The view from the top is priceless. The table mountain is probably the one thing you should do if you are in Cape Town and short on time. The cable car up to the top of the mountain is marvelous. And the views just keep on getting better and better. The mountain is close to the city, so just a 2 hour time slot can help you get this thing done. If you have more time, you can explore more of the area at the top. The view of the bay & the city from the top are great. You also get a good view of the Lion's Head & Signal Hill.

Views forever. We took a cable car up early in the morning. It is also possible to walk up as the many cars parked around the lower cable station indicated. The views from the top were fantastic. It was a fine, clear, sunny day. There were not too many people this early in the morning and we could walk around without any crowds. Cape Town from up there was great and it was easy to orientate oneself. We could see Robben Island quite easily and then way down the coast toward (but not quite seeing) the Cape. A bit cool in the early morning so take a jacket.
Tour. Would recommend taking free walking tour on Table Mountain. Explained lots of what we could see. Some amazing facts and tour wasn't too long. Cafe was rubbish.

Clear day required for this. The cable car up to the top provides spectacular views but you need to have a clear day to get the benefitLok out for the daisies in the bushes (furry little creatures about the size of a fat Guinea pig)
Beautiful!. It was a cloudy day down in Cape Town and we were pleasantly surprised to rise up above the clouds when on Table Mountain - it was clear as a bell up there!

Spectacular views! Bring a jacket.. As far as tourist attractions go, Table Mountain is run very smoothly and lines go quick. Once you are at the top you can stay all day if you wish. The views from the top give you a full panorama of Cape Town. You'll be able to take some wonderful photographs. If you visit in September, like I did, you will want to take a jacket. It gets fairly chilly at the top.

STUNNING!. We were a group of four people, and we got our tickets ahead of time because we were worried about the long lines. It was a beautiful experience, we walked around enjoying the out of the this world views!There is a cablecar that took us up and down; so going up and down is quite easy.
visiting cape town. Everything from food to exploring the city! Friendly people and nice eating places, great for shopping!
spectacular view. It is a great way to see Cape Town from above.The views are gorgeous. The cable car is good but here are quite a few people so there is a wait.

New 7th Wonder of the World. Stunning stunning stunning - for all ages. Current price up and down the cable way is R225. If you are local, buy the all year round ticket for R535. Beautiful walks - for the both the hiker and the casual stroller. This new Wonder of the World is well awarded.
Excellent view!!. The table mountain is unbelievable. It's an awesome experience. The view was clear and there was not much windy. The staffs were friendly. Will visit again soon.
Lovely. Awesome views. Cableway up and down was very convenient. The mountain top was spectacular, with brilliant views on all sides!
A stunning wiew. Be sure to order ticket ahead. In good weather it is a great wiew in all dirctions. Exciting to look at the mountainclimbers and all the birds.

Quintisential South Africa!. Table Mountain NP covers lots of area. We drove south from Cape Town & made several stops along the way. Every stop was amazing. Spend lots of time on this amazing peninsula. From Cable Car to Penguins. Don't miss anything included in this National Park.

Hike with the world. Table Mountain, of course, is a globally-recognized destination. If you're like me, you'll enjoy listening for different languages, accents, dialects, or all the other marks we carry with us as we travel. If you're extra lucky, you'll randomly run into folks from your own small hometown on the opposite side of the world. The views are breathtaking, and you can choose to hike up or take the tramway and have an easy walkabout on top. There's absolutely no reason not to go if the sky is clear!
Worth the time.. Great views. Make sure that the tram is running before you drive up. If weather gets too windy, you can be stranded on top and have to walk down.

360 degree capetown :). Stone age mountain is what can be described as.huge in its size, has a good connectivity by ropeway.its little riskier owing to no guards / associates when kids hang / run loose.there is no fencing either on each side., one should be careful with kids.a good restaurant makes sure u have pleasurable time on such height.good view all around of cape town overall :)

Spectacular views from table Mountain!. Loved the quick trip up in the cable car. Spent about an hour walking all over once on top. The views were breathtaking. So many great photo opportunities. Met people from all over the world while walking around. A "can't miss" when in Capetown.

Beauty Above. Beautiful scenic shots, unusual plants, and lots of walking on this mountain, very windy, so watch your hat. I'd tried several times to go, but cable cars were not running due to the wind. I finally got to go and had a wonderful walk in the National Park. I had no idea was there, I thought it was going to be just a mountain, but it was a beautiful garden of nature. I loved it.

Beautiful flowers and birds. Platteklip Gorge is a medium difficulty walk. My friend and I still walked it with a cold and stiff from planting trees. We usually have a good level of fitness. You could probably walk Platteklip by yourself, if you make sure that you pay attention to the signs. We didn't see many birds at this time of year, but they were all still quite pretty
On a clear day, you can see forever!. We visited on a beautifully clear day. Take lots of pictures even if they don't do the views justice.

Breathtaking views!. I travelled to Cape Town last year and one my highlights was the table mountain national park on the top of table mountain. At first you fail to notice the enormity of the park as you feel it would just be a few hundred meters. But as you motor on the trek reaches out for miles in every direction.As a word of caution, do bring an extra jacket, as it tends to get a but chilly. But the breathtaking views of cape town in all directions makes numb hands worth it!
Views & animals, but beware the Muggers. Wonderful experience as regards birds, flowers & view. Pity about the possibility of being mugged and robbed.

Beautiful mountain with amazing walks and views. The view from the top of Table Mountain is spectacular with the city bowl on one side and the 12 Apostles stretching down the back on the other. The information boards around the peak give a good detail of the Mountain's formation and the history of it which is extremely interesting. It is lovely to sit in the sun and enjoy the stunning views. I have been up the mountain twice in recent years and would definitely go up again.

Table Mountain. Brilliant and breath taking view.
Just make sure that you go up when weather is clear in order to capture the scenery. If there is a cloud cap above then scenery cannot be viewed properly but still an experience to be up so high.

Don't even think about not going.. You know what you're getting before you get there - great views, elevation, flat top mountain, cloud, a bit of wind, plenty of unique plants - but the experience is so much better than the idea. We were blown away by the views. You really have to see it to believe it. Someone who looked like a professional photographer walked past us at one stage and remarked to his friend that its one of those rare places where every view is a good view.Just go!

Amazing Views. I loved the cable car ride to the top. I also loved the café coffee. We decided to go to the top, even with a few clouds rolling in. While we could not see much from the top, we were still able to get some amazing pictures from the cable car and the entry point. It's worth the trip.

loved the hike up Table Mountain. Loved hiking boots up Table Mountain!!!The pathways was clean and clear. We saw very little litter and there was no alien species like Port Jackson or Watel to be seen. The views were spectacular!
What A View!. The cable car up to the top rotates so on the way up you get a view.Then you can walk even higher. Beautiful.Small shop and place to eat as you exit the cable car.

Atop the table. The views from atop the mountain and the cable car ride getting there. One was able to see the whole city from the top of table mountain. The ride by car to the location was pretty windy road but at the same time , absolutely amazing.

i literally felt I am in heaven. This place is just wonderful, a true nature wonder. The views are outstanding and the path around the national park is well kept and takes you to as many panoramatic viewpoonts as possible. A real heaven on Earth and one of my top favorites of all times!

Spectacular Views. Walking up Table Mountain up the Platteklip Gorge is strenuous but worthwhile. The views over Table Bay is spectacular. A word of warning to the trekker - it is a steep climb and you need to have a certain level of fitness.

Big but BEAUTIFUL. This beautiful place is one of my most favourite places to visit. I wouldn't trade anything for every time I visit this totally breath-taking place. Its not just huge in structure but some of my best conversations have happened here.
Worth the visit!. Wait for a clear day and the views on Table Mountain are unbelievable! The cable car ride is fantastic for the kids provides some really great photo oppurtunities.

Amazing. This park is not just table mountain itself but a lot of the surrounding area it is fantastic and has lots of wonderful scenery and wildlife that really show the best that South Africa has to offer!

Breath taking views. If you have only a short time in Cape Town the mountain and it's warm embrace will lure you to the top.
