For the energetic , clime up one of the wonderful walks or take a trip in the Cable car . Jackets always necessary as it can get cold. Comfortable shoes as you will want to walk on the top. Oh and make sure your camera is loaded as you will take some of the most senational shots ever.

close to heaven. This is the most wonderful place on earth - I recommend walking up the mountain and then catching the cable way down. Te restaurant at the top is not that great though so maybe pack a picnic and then have a coffee at the top/

Absolutely amazing. We loved the view, the cable car ride up was 'cosy' but the cable car operator had a great sense of humour that made all of us forget how 'squashy' we were. On arrival we were all stunned immediately. Very lucky to have a perfect morning - very clear - we were there around 9, the clouds arrived aroun 11 and that was the end of the view. Lots to see and do up there, a lovely coffee shop and we enjoyed the gift shop and got some nice momento's. The lady who served me was friendly and again a lovely sense of humour. A great day for people of any age.
Worth a visit. This is definitely worth a visit. The cable car is quick and efficient, nice cafe at the top, the the views are stunning..
Amazing Trip. We only had a few days in Cape Town. We decided to take the trip up to the mountain on the first clear day. I'm glad we did as the following days were cloudy!

Top Notch. Despite it being foggy for most of the days in Cape Town, when we made it up to the top of Table Mountain, the fog cleared off enough to take pictures and look at the beautiful city of Cape Town.

Better than the top of the world - a view!. You run out of superlatives when you get to the top of this amazing view. Easily one of the top 5 greatest views in the world. If you wait to end your trip here like we did, you can see all the places you visited in this great city and area. Look off to see the tip and soak in the view of two oceans. A great place to sip a whiskey and enjoy.

One of the icons of the world and well looked after. Staff helpful and knowledgable ..always helpful to advise on walking routes. I enjoyed my many days on the mountain, with up to date weather reports

Wow what views!. Had an opportunity to take a few international visitors up the cable car to Table mountain national park. It was an awesome experience for all. You cant visit Cape Town and not take a trip up the mountain it is so beautiful no wonder it is one of the 7 wonders of the World:):)

Table Mountain. Spectacular visit.
Views to die for.
Interesting walks along the foot paths.
On a clear day you can see forever.
Good restaurant at the top.
Smallish souvenir shop - for obligatory souvenirs.
Cable car ride revolves which is amazing
Not to be Missed!. A fabulous view of Capetown and the cape. Be sure to pick a clear day to take the cable car up. Rock hyrax live at the top and are not intimidated by visitors.

On top of the world. A must see! You can't visit Cape Town without seeing this land mark. Catch the gondola up, or raise your fitness levels and walk up. The views are worth the effort once you get to the top - magnificent!

Table Mountain hike is the only way to go!. Table Mountain is a beautiful spot for a day's adventure!Overlooking Cape Town and with a 360° view of the area this is an experience to behold! I climbed up... twice! The views are breath taking! It's challenging and can be hard if you are not naturally active day to day. If I can give you any advice for the hike...leave early morning and take plenty of water!!! Drink it when you need it! You can buy more at the cafe/restaurant at the Cable Car Station at the top.Take your time, when you're struggling take time to stop, drink water, look around and absorb the views! Take photos and enjoy it! My first attempt took me 1hr 45mins (hungover) but my second took me 1hr 20 mins (bare-footed).And the reason I did it barefoot...I decided I'd take the Gondola up the mountain the second time and wore my Flip-flops....the queue was horrendous ( two hours for tickets alone). So I decided it was quicker climbing up :)

Amazing views and a cool way to spend a couple of hours on a clear day.. Amazing views and a fun revolving cable car ride to the top. There is a walking trail at the top of the mountain and a café, shop and toilets.We booked tickets online through our hotel and as such we received a small discount. Worth a couple of hours on a clear day.

Amazing. You guys. Cape town is amazing. The whole town is a breath taking exprience Table mountain is beautiful. I went hiking i was tired my legs didnt forgive me either but the exprience was a life tine memory

Beautiful boulders and fog, a bit cold and noisy (lots of people). We went early (about 9am) but there were still a lot of noisy people. The actual view across the top was beautiful and cable car ride well worth the trip. Key recommendation wear layers and bring a big coat (I was cold most of the time but I live somewhere warm so I have forgotten not everywhere is)

Table Mountain Rocks!! Get it?? Lol. Ive hiked this treachourous mountain a few times, it was exhausting but the views are SPECTACULAR! Please go in a group and take care as there have been mugging incidents on the mountain. Also watch the weather report as this mountain has claimed a few lives as when it becomes overcast and Table mountain puts on her table cloth, visibility is very very poor

A national icon. Everyone who visits Cape Town should take time to explore the beautiful scenery with panoramic views of the city. The only drawback is the number of other tourists one has to share it with.
Go there at least once a week. Lovely place to go for an awesome view. Ques are a bit long in the tourist season. Staff very friendly and help full.

Birthday drinks, Sunset. Took the free Table Mountain cable car up and down the mountain. Found a great spot on the mountain and shared a bottle of Champagne, while watching the Sunset over the City of Cape Town. It was during the week so it wasn't too busy and even though we didn't have a car, there is a mycity from the city to Table Mountain and back (regular).

The obvious choice. An obvious choice for any traveler to Cape Town, overall upkeep is excellent as with most things in Cape Town. We booked online, on my phone when we got there, and saved about 30 min in the queue, definitely book online.

On a clear day, you can see all around you.. The 360 degree view was truly outstanding and well worth the wait. It took us 3 days before we could enjoy the view. Table Mountain is literally that; a huge-flat topped mountain ranging behind the City of Cape Town. The reason it could take so long is the fact that due to an air inversion, clouds coming off of the ocean can obscure the mountain top like a "table cloth." In addition, it can get quite windy in which case, the cable cars needed for assent do not run. If you have the opportunity however, do not miss it. You can see all the way to Cape Point to the West, Robben Island (where Mandela was held prisoner for 27 years) and the towns across False Bay to the South and the mountain range as it heads in an Easterly direction. This is an attraction tha cannot be missed.
A stunning and unique place. One of the best wild places I've visited. Amazing views, great walks, interesting wildlife. No-where else quite like it!
top view of the world. is the place to visit if you stop in Cape Town.cannot miss it.. if there is a line just wait.. is worth it

Every tourist must DO!!!!!. Good day travelers!!!I would like to share with you my Table Mountain experience.It was awesome!!!Doesn't matter that it was a bit cloudy and foggy day, I really enjoy myself on top of Table Mountaine. Obviously - incredible view of Cape town and harbor, fresh air, breathtaking panaramic view from cable car.Nice and cosy cafe.I and my husband had a really good time there by sipping bubbly and get warmed up by gas heater, which was great!!!Definitly will go up to Table Moutaine again.
Breathtaking.... This is by far THE most incredible view of CapeTown, be sure to walk across part of the mountain toward the other side for even more amazing views just be careful of snakes!
A must see.. If you go to Cape Town, you really need to make it to the top of Table Mountain. One caution, if you are not a good hiker, take the cable car.
best park ever. flaura and fauna, unlimited hikes and views. concentrate your holiday around the mountain and you will be very happy
Go ahead -- book the trip. This has to be one of the most beautiful places on earth. The roads are good, it is close to accommodation, the restaurants are out of this world.

Fantastic views but crime is bad. This is a fabulous natural beauty spot. The restaurant is typically touristy with below average food. Whoever has the license to operate it needs to be replaced. The views are spectacular. The cable car is brilliant and efficient. Just do not walk on the mountain unless you are in a large group because criminals roam the area armed with knives etc. Pity but that is South Africa.

Take a Few Hours and Climb or Ride to Table Top!. The hike up is beautiful and well worth the hour and a half! Not too strenuous and comes with a big reward at the top :) Take a taxi to the trail head, then take the tram down. Restaurant at the top and plenty of space to walk around, enjoy the view and take some amazing photos. You can also take the tram up :)
Beautiful Views. If I only had time to do one thing in Cape Town - this is it. The sights are incredible, it is worth the semi-scary cable car trip to the top (which is very safe by the way).

Deserving of the Title.... Table Mountain is the most iconic landmark of South Africa with unparalleled views and deserving to be named a Wonder of the Natural world. I suggest the cable cars if you aren't the fit type. But what an experience when you reach the top!
Perfect view and amazing memories. It was absolutly perfect. Ive spent the afternoon there with a beautiful blue sky of summer. The view was fantastic. Everyone has to see it once in life!

Top of the world. Went twice to the cable acre station but closed due to high winds. Booked with the tour bus at waterfront, great because you purchase ticket there so missed the queues at the cable car station. Still had to queue for cable car but not so long. Well worth the visit but need a clear day for the views.

Number 1 on your list for Cape Town. Table Mountain is set in a National Park which is most accessible since its' location adjacent to the city of Cape Town. It offers a plethora of hikes - which should rather not be attempted by oneself. Contact a hiking club or network like the Mountain Club of South Africa or the Christian Hiking Network for a guided hike. Or make use of the cable car. Famous for it's fine examples of fynbos. Always pack a warm top for the top of Table Mountain. There is a restaurant and environmentally friendly toilets on top of the mountain. Phone the hotline number in advance to hear if the cable car is operating. Always go as early as possible before the wind starts.

Local Sanpark.....up with the lark !. I am by default a big fan of Sanparks.....this time we visited our local park Table Mountain National Park. We spent two nights at the Eland cottage. The grading says two star, but that must have been an old grading, The facility is definitely at least 3 star. The staff was friendly and efficient,I making the stay worth our while. Good value for money. It was cold at times , but the fireplace took care of that.The cottage itself is spacious and is fully equipped.You only have to bring your food and drinks. It has of course an outside braai making the features complete.We drove around on the Sunday exploring the Park further. The views are stunning and it will offer the photographer something to take home.It was overall a great outing offer something special to the locals as a weekend breakaway, but also to our overseas visitors with specific reference to Cape Point.Have fun !!!

Great views. The tram ride up to the top was awesome as the fog had lifted.We walked around table mountain for a hour taking photos and then went in line for the tram ride down.After waiting in line for 20 minutes we were informed that the cable car is being repaired at the bottom of the mountain.It did take 11/2 hours to repair and do a dry run before we got down.But all was good

Stunning nature in the heart of the city. We climbed table mountain using the India Venster route - pretty challenging but totally manageable with a reasonable level of fitness, using a couple of sets of chains and ladders. Take layers as the weather can change quickly and it can be windy at the top.We took the cable car down, which was comfortable and efficient.The cafe on the top of Table Mountain has a great hot and cold buffet and good cake as a reward after the climb! Overall one of the highlights of Cape Town.
stunning views. Another must do the views from here on a sunny day are amazing and its great to go at your own pace don't forget your camera

Mesmerizing !. no words to describe the beauty of this place. I visited Cape Town in July 2014 for couple of days. It is not enough to visit this place once. You would love to be here multiple times. Windy chilly mesmerizing view vivid vegetation lots to explore and much more in store. SIp a cup of hot coffee on hill top cafe.
best thing ever!. a must do especially if you are a local...our own beautiful mountain which is world reknowned...new7wonder
great hike. Hiked up table mountain on platteklip gorge then took the cable car down. Takes around 2 hrs if moderately fit. Lovely walk

Extream touristy and a bit expensive, and the hike is definitly climbing and dangerous!!!. A visit is a must wehen you are in Capetown! But take care, there is just one day wehen they offer studend discount. And try to be as early as possible there becaous of the mass of tourists. They try to sell you unbelivible lot of touristy plastic things for extream prices. So take a camara with you and a snack!!! Enjoy the holerious view!!!1

Outstanding! Must-do in Cape Town. This is the probably the no. 1 spot that tourists must do in CapeTown. The view from the top is amazing. Please plan to spend atleast 2 hours to do justice to the spot (more if you want to walk to the inner parts of the park). Do note that the cable car to the top of the mountain is suspended during bad weather, especially when its windy. Do check before you make the trip. You can also trek up the mountain, but it looks like a tough climb and definitely not for a novice
Beatiful sceneries. We were lucky on our weather. We had these rare sunny, clear and warm winterdays on. On our tour we saw amazing beatches, wildlife, and the beautiful rough peninsula

A Must. The views are amazing! This is a Cape Town must. Not too far from the city center and there is a cable car to the top. The views are amazing, but be sure to go when the tablecloth (clouds) is off. Clouds come and go quickly so be sure to check the weather. The views are just stunning.

Easy attraction to see with huge views. We were lucky because we had great weather-no wind and it was warm considering June is the middle of winter in capetown. The cable car is easy and the views are incredible. It doesn't take long so you can fit more in the day.

A Toast at Sunset. No trip to Cape Town is compete without a trip to the top of Table Mountain. I would suggest purchasing your cable car ticket from the Red Bus Hop On Hop Of and then just taking the bus up to the front entrance of the park. The view from the top is spectacular on a clear day. You literally can see forever. If you are lucky you will be able to get shots of rock climbers as they descend the wall. WOW! A friend of mine hiked up with her picnic backpack one afternoon and toasted to a beautiful sunset! Just Do It!
Beautiful place. I enjoyed walking around and learning about the flora and fauna. It was breath taking from the top. A must go place in Cape Town.

Natural wonder. Of course, you have to go there on a sunny day. The view is simply spectacular from up there. Take the time to walk around, relax and take nice pictures. Access is easy if you take the city sightseeing tour bus. Also easy by car but you might have to walk a bit uphill depending where you park. Give a tip to the guy who watched your car while you visited the park. I was told to give 7 Rands per hour by a local. Plan this visit for half a day.

When Sunny - Amazing!. Easy and convenient. Try to get a ticket for the cable car before you get up there to avoid an additional line/queue. Once up on the top - just explore at your own pace, you can walk for what seems like an endless amount and all the sights are breathtaking. At some point, i felt like I got the most out of it and turned back around to head down. Wear comfortable walking shoes/sneakers as the terrain can get rough, it's sometimes cold and windy so dress accordingly and try to be patient and go up when it is clear and sunny as you will not have the amazing all encompassing views if it's cloudy.

Awesome views. We were lucky enough to be on top of Table Mountain on a beautiful sunny day and no wind, it was very special. The views were spectacular. It was a shame that we only had a short time up there, allow yourself a couple of hours if you have time.
On top of the world. What a privilege to visit one of the wonders of the world... You have a birds eye view around Cape Town... The restaurant served good food and the curios shop is worth a visit...
Great view. i still regret not doing the up-sailing :) My brothers enjoyed it. But anyhow the view was great. Took the cable car up and down. A hike is also possible
Top Table Mountain. A must to see. One of the Top 7 world wonder. Fantastic view of Cape Town, the Mother City, the Bay, the Cape Flats,...

One of the most beautiful places I ever been. One of the most beautiful places I ever been! The view from the top is amazing. If really worth just walk the whole montain and see the local fauna and flora. Mind the wind though. Very strong

Just do it!. Known as a must see and for good reason. Table mountain is a playground for those who enjoy breathtaking scenery and/or amazing hiking. Just go! The cable car is additionally a fun way to get up to start the journey.
Great view, great at sundown!. I was lucky enough to view the place at best sunlight and have see one of the best sundowns in my life!
On top of the world. Most amazing views of mountains and coast high above Cape Town. Hikers can do walks both up and down. Even the perimeter walk at the top is spectacular.

Amazing views!. Loved the history, geology lesson. Nice trails to walk, some more challenging than others. Don't feed the dassies even if they beg, they are fat enough! Critters, birds, flowers, history and even food to go with the stunning views 360.

Gorgeous View!. We went early in the morning and our guide had pre-purchased our tickets. We had no line to wait in to go up or come backdown. The views are stunning as we got a clear day. This is a must do! Take your camera and make sure to schedule enough time to wonder around and see all the views.
Interesting. It's worth going up table mountain just for the cable car ride. It's very pleasant to walk around reading the various information boards. There is a decent café and other facilities.
Great View. We were lucky as there was no mist which is usual at that time of the year. We had clear views going up & even from top.

Not to be missed!. Not to be missed! The views are absolutely stunning, and there are some short, easy (read: flat) hikes on the top. There are several different routes you can take to hike up Table Mountain. My first time up Table Mountain, I took the Platteklip Gorge route, which is the quickest, most direct route. It's basically a giant stone staircase that starts to feel endless! It was quite challenging but definitely worth it when I got to the top! If you are a fit person, taking a trail up the mountain is rewarding, but be prepared - it is very steep, even on Skeleton Gorge or one of the alternate routes. My second time, I took the cable car up, and that was much more pleasant. The cable car can close with little warning, so be prepared to hike down if you have to. The first time I hiked up, we met people returning who told us the car was closed for technical issues. Luckily by the time we made it, they had fixed it. But don't be the foolish visitor in flip flops and jeans!

Exquisite. Do yourself a favour and don't miss the cable car ride... the beautiful views... the tourist trap and prices... it's all worth the experience!Remember that on your birthday you can go up the cable car free of charge.

Always splendid. If you are fit and up for it - walk the mountain. On the same side as the cable car - carry on with the road until you see another group of cars parked / see the sign for Platteklip Gorge. Walk the mountain ou (and back or back if you want). On the top it is a short walk to the cable car to get down again. Just do it EARLY or the sun will be your biggest enemy.Alternative routes are found from the other side of the mountain. A polular and nice one is the Skeleton Gorge which starts in Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. Skeleton is not as easy as Platteklip.

great workout. A great workout if you're hiking - just don't make the same mistakes i did---take a lot of water with you. best hiking times are early morning in summer, before the heat gets too much. while this option is free, it does cost more time.you can also opt to take the cable car, which is very nice, and allows for breathtaking views of cape town. there is a fee for use the cable car. you can also choose to take the cable car one direction - hike up, cable car down.either way, it's worth it!

Beautiful and gorgeous- highlight of my time in Cape Town. Apparently only 25% of the tourists in Cape Town are able to make it to Table Mountain due to the wind/ weather factors, but if you can definitely try! It's beautiful, and there are stunning and picturesque viewpoints.

A must do in Cape Town. Brilliant and must see part of your adventures in Cape Town!
The views are spectacular, even from the car park - but amazing from the top after the cable car ride. Definitely worth a visit - but do rug up - it can get cold on top!

Still not tired of visiting after 5 years. I spent 4 years living in Tamboerskloof, just below Lions Head and would frequently drive to Table Mountain just for the city views. Every time I climbed out of my car and simply listened to the peace and looked at the views, it was truly a happy experience. It is always quiet and rewarding and looking up the craggy peaks that have watched and guarded the city for millions of years make me appreciate this 7th wonder of the world!
Great view - big crowds. Apparently a must see in Cape Town. Breathtaking view, but by far too overcrowded. Sunset view is stunning but be prepared to wait in a long line to get down afterwards.

Don't Miss this!. I climbed up instead of taking the cable car. The climb took about 3 1/2 hours and was strenuous but I loved it. The view at the top is incredible! And the restaurants had good food which was appreciated after the hike. The gift shop had unique items reasonably priced. But I spend most of the time just walking around the top and enjoying the views from many angles. Plan on spending a couple hours at the top and getting fabulous photos.

A World Class experience ... but No Pain, No Gain!. Table Mountain National Park is 'up on top', which means going up ... but Oh! it is so worth the effort. The views from up on high are really splendid. Cape Town is blessed with so much mountain, and so many ways up and across this the backbone of the Peninsula, and all in such easy reach of the city and suburbia. Walks up are of varying degrees of easy to challenging : the tourist advertised routes are always safe, but any mountain experience takes effort and some hard graft. The splendid cableway will always take those who really are not fit enough to walk up.The best time to go walking/climbing is early, before the heat (preferably first light, to beat the traffic and the heat); but on a cool day, that's less important. Must haves:are strong shoes, a hat, water and extra warmth - the weather on Table Mountain can be quickly changeable. Stay on marked routes - and if you're not sure, ask.Capetonians are friendly and easy to chat to! But, if you're visiting Cape Town, and have time and energy - DO make time for our Table Mountain, with its unique floral eco systems. Best known tourist routes up are Skeleton Gorge (from Kirstenbosch), Platteklip (from the Cable Station), Constantia Nek and Kasteels Poort, from Camps Bay. Alao great walks in the Cape Point Reserve.

Lovely. We enjoyed seeing Table Mountain. It is quite lovely even with all of the cloud cover. We loved how the clouds would roll in and cover the top of the mountain. It looked like someone was slowly pulling a tablecloth over a table! Then it would start to move off just like a tablecloth coming off. It was very interesting. We will be back in October so I am hoping we have a day without cloud cover. It was very enjoyable to see. The cable car was closed due to the fog so I am hoping we can do that next time we visit.

Cape Point Splender. Table Mountain National Park consists of various different areas, the area I would like to highlight is Cape Point on the Peninsula. If you drive along the coast, it is a scenic drive with its own beauty and when you get to the park, you get to experience wild life like Eland. the largest antelope in the world. You also find load of baboons that have perfected the art of stealing out of unlocked vehicles or out of your hand, be careful. Enjoy nature at it's best. Cape Point was previously believed to be where the Indian and Atlantic Oceans meet, but this is not true, they meet further east at Cape Aghulas. Walk up to the new lighthouse and look down on the old lighthouse that was built too low and did not serve to warn any ships and had to be rebuilt higher up on the peninsula. Enjoy breathtaking scenery all the way around. There is an entrance fee and if I remember correctly, foreigners pay more as locals. Check the SANPARK website for more details.

Summit views are awe inspiring. We opted to take the cable car to the summit of the mountain. You can also hike up and down. It was a fantastic clear day that allowed us to appreciate the vast beautiful sights that just leave you in awe. For the amount of tourist visiting the mountain it is a very clean and well managed operation.

A must see attraction. Table Mountain is a must see for everyone. Take the Cable Car up the Mountain and if you feel fit, walk down Platteklip Gorge. If you have small children or elderly folk with you, take the Cable Car up and down. Please watch your bags as my sister had her cellphone stolen out of her backpack whilst waiting in the Cable Car queue.
Be prepared for some mind-blowing scenery!. Great intro into the flora and fauna of South Africa. Beautiful views! A Must! A guide helps you get through the lines to get onto the lifts.
Awesome scenery and great cable car ride. Loved the all around view from the top and the cable car ride was a bit scary, car rotated, but the views were unbelievable.
Stunning. We had a amazing day fab food great views sparkling wine. stunning weather what more could you ask for... just make sure you pre book tickets before to save long wait

Fantastic Mountain, with lovely small Rock Dassies. Friendly small animals. Maybe yhe oldest mountain in the world.. A bit scary with the cable car, but didn't feel unsecure.
Very clean and many viewpoints, and small paths to walk around safely.

Dissapointing. I have visited the park a number of times over the last 20 years and our last visit was disappointing . It's all there but not maintained .The facilities were dirty and grubby.IT seems as if the funds generated from visitors are not going in to the pot to maintain the park but squandered elsewhere...with good management this could be a premier tourist attraction once again.

A Cable Car to Hike. This is a definite MUST for anyone visiting Capt Town. Take the Cable Car up Table Mountain and take in the most amazing sights of the Cape Peninsular before you enjoy a wonderful breakfast at the restaurant situated right at the top. From there you can choose one of the trails that run from there. The one we last chose in November was across Table Mountain to Breakfast Rock and down Nursery Ravine into Kirstenbosch Gardens. We went via the dam to get there.This is an amazing time of the year in Cape Town as it's well into late Spring/early Summer and most of the Flora is either blooming or about to. There's also the Cape Dassies and mountain lizards as well as other small creatures that are permanent inhabitants of this mountain.The kaleidoscope of vibrant colors is breathtaking and not to be missed and this is just on the mountain and not into Kirstenbosch Gardens yet.The Gardens when you get there has such a lot to offer and after a lovely lunch you can spend the rest of the afternoon exploring this amazing, international landmark.So if you've heard of Table Mountain, The Cable Car and Kirstenbosch and seen pics and travel brochures of them then you have to experience them because the pics and right-ups don't do them real justice as they are way better than anyone can describe.Who knows...... We might even bump into each other on your visit to them because I'm definitely going back and have been doing so since I was a Youngster.
An amazing day out. remember to charge your camera or phone, plenty of photos to take when at the top. Restaurant at the top is a little overpriced.

Excellent!. From the ticket office to the top, again Table Mountain impresses.I took a friend up there on the Cable Car, his first visit to Cape Town. The service from Lemeul at the ticket office was oh so friendly, he lit up the office with his genuine enthusiasm.The "drivers" of the cable car both up and down were entertaining and informative while maintaining an air of professionalism. Well done!And of course that view! As always, THE best views of any city anywhere!Remember, the Cable Car is but one route up. There are many different walks that lead to the top, and these offer spectacular vistas of urban, mountain, and ocean!Definitely recommended if you visit Cape Town! If you want to venture away from the top reaches, best walk with someone who knows the paths and is willing to lead you. Wear comfortable sturdy footwear and take water and warm clothing. Oh, and some snacks and of course a camera!Obviously for the Cable Car there is a fee, but it's completely free to walk!Recommended duration of visit? Well, for the area just around the cable station, maybe an hour or two. But if you plan to hike, that depends on where exactly, anything from 3 hours to a full day.

Main attraction. Beautiful mtn. A must see for any person visiting South Africa for the first time. I am a little skittish of heights but the cable car ride was amazing I kept this little old lady company as she could not look and neither could I.

Spectacular views. A must see for everyone - one of the best feelings to take in the view on top of the mountain.There is no wonder as to why this has been added as one of the seven natural wonders of the world!

Peaceful and beautiful. This is a little peaceful place to stroll around and take in nature just a stone through from the hustle and bustle of Cape town. The mountain views are amazing and nature makes you feels restful.
The most breathtaking views. Great experience! going up on the cable car , the views above are magnificent. Wear something warm as it is windy up there and comfy shoes.

oh that view.... as though approaching the park by cable car isn't thrilling enough, you disembark and the views will take your breath away... and no on a clear day you cannot see Antarctica!!, but close... take your time and walk all around: city, harbor, coastline and robbin island: sensational -- a do not miss!!

A must in every sense. Take the Cable car or walk up the view and the feeling at the top is worth the effort. Disappointment = impossible. But plan enough time to enjoy all Table Mountain has to offer.

Visit to Table Mountain. Must visit, simply stunning. Wonderful views. We went first thing in the morning on a lovely day and the view was amazing. Nice cafe for a cup of tea at the to
!

great for tourists and locals. luckily it wasn't busy when we went up, only a 5 minute wait to get up and down. the cafe was self service so it was a bit unorganised and was completely mobbed. the views and experience was a once in a lifetime chance. an amazing place to visit.
Beautiful View. I loved the view at the top of table mountain. The hikes were amazing and it was cool to ride the car up to the top. You can do bungee jumping at the top also.
Table Mountain. Stunning views from all vantage points. Best on a clear day with no wind. Walking shoes and water a good idea.

Fun, safe hike with excellent view!. Went up Table Mountain via the Platteklip Gorge in June 2015. My wife and I are in decent shape and it took us about 2 hours from trail head to summit. It's a beautiful hike with quite a number of steps but very safe. Make sure to brink lots of water if it's a warm day, as even though it was winter my wife and I went through 3L on the hike up! The summit is absolutely gorgeous with excellent view of Capetown and was certainly one of the highlights of our Capetown visit. Make sure to plan enough time to hike down or to take the last cable car which is around 6 PM!

theSouthAfricanreview. You can see Robbin Island on a clear day from this vatage point. This mountain was magnificent on the day. We really enjoyed the cable car ride up and back down and wr even bought a hearty lunch on top. Great for bringing kids, just please keep your eyes peeled as the sheer cliffs will make any parent on high alert

Camera overdrive 👀 👍. Lucky for us we choose a clear day to visit Table Moutain. We enjoy the cable car up to the very top and enjoy the fantastic views. The ocean views and of course signal hill.We could not stop clicking the camera. Lots of little shops and a restaurant , which we enjoyed a beautiful coffee . It's worth remembering that you will be walking a fair bit so wear comfy shoes etc. we loved every minute here.

Table Mountain. The most beautiful site in the world take cable car up the view top are amazing. go with a guide and take the path to nursery gorge. Kirstenboch gardens are close, one the most beautiful indigenous garden on the side of table mountain in summer mouth classical music played at weekend. Restaurant a lovely experience, don't forget it has be clear day because of Blanket cloud.
Best photo session. with view of the ocean and signal hill it's the best place to take your best photos ever but take care of sun burns.

AMAZING!. Love every minute of the trip up the mountain. Do take warm cloths even in summer. Coffee shop, easy restaurant, shops, ATM at the top. Make sure you know when power cuts will be so that you need to wait in long lines when you want to come back down. Walking shoes......not a fashion statement.

ONCE IN A LIFETIME DEAL. A world wonder. i wouldn't go that far but i will say it is a must see. the views are spectacular but thats about it. in other words you wont be visiting table mountain every time you visit cape town. One important TIP, time your trip to table mountain around sunset time...it adds to the experience.

beautiful views - highliy recommended. take a cable car up to the top of the mountain.. up here you can get a bite to eat.. get some great views and pics and stroll around the beautiful natural gardens. on a clear day you can see for miles..!
awesome memories. The most amazing views of Cape Town. Many different paths to hike or trail run. Its a most in South Africa
Platteklip route for Table Mountain. Always a pleasant and fairly safe walk up Platteklip route for Table Mountain. Good scenic views of the Cape Town on a clear day.

Well worth the visit. Amazing views and well groomed areas to walk on for he tame. Even better views and trails for the more adventuresome. A surprisingly good cafe that is pleasant and well served. Well worth the trip.

Beautiful!. Breathtaking views. Lovely cable car ride to the top at a good price. There are a couple of souvenir shops which are quite nice. The cable car is smooth and efficient. The views from the top are marvellous. There are plenty of walkways to see different views and so that it doesn't feel crowded. Fantastic view of Cape Town and the coast. A definite must see!
Cant miss it. Of course had to go there after hearing so much about it. It is all that, and more. Unfortunately could not go up on the cable car because of strong winds. Gives a reason to come back.

adventurous track + marvelous view of the city. We took the India Venster route! It is highly advised to be athletic and of adventurous personality to take this route! Rock climbing and steep track! Make sure that you are not afraid of the emptiness (the valley) behind yourself!
Otherwise take the other path for your own safety!
Breathtaking. This is a must see for all visitors of Cape Town. Just know that if the winds kick up the cable car does get shut down.

Amazing views from the top!. One of the best experiences i had in cape town. We hiked up and came down by cable car and recommend that if you have 2-3 hours. Hike will take close to an hour and then another hour upstairs to enjoy the breathtaking views!
View from the top. What a view, 360 degree view of one of the best sites in South Africa. No wonder this is a Natural World Wonder

Majestic Platteklip Gorge. Platteklip Gorge is quite a steep (almost vertical looking) hiking trail up to Table Mountain. Facing the Table Bay Harbour and City Bowl - this is a popular trail that presents an awesome view whilst hiking up. Besides the view, the fauna and flora is absolutely pristine and fresh. Proteas' (South Africa's national flower) is in great abundance - with it's raw beauty and species of plant that is only indigenous to the Table Mountain environment. Then there's the mountain goat, perched up on ledges that are impossible to get to - but these animals found their way up there - fascinating! I was fortunate to see a pair of Dassie's on the mountain - but these are quite prolific - and have become used to humans entering into their environment. The trick is to take it slow and stop every 20 minutes to take in the scenery and surroundings. Don't just scoot to the top. There's no race :)In the summer months, the sun can get quite strong on your back whilst hiking up. I normally start the hike at 5am to beat the rays of the sun.Winter, is quite cool to cold. The hiking trail is quite slippery, hence be very cautious. The cool weather is the best time to hike up.Normal hike would take about 2hours - with stopping.Carry sufficient water and a power snack. . Wear clothing that you can take off and easily carry up.I hiked up alone, but I did see other groups/families enjoying the trip up.

Where Two Oceans Meet. During various entries i have seen different types of wildlife, including buck, birds and reptiles. Every visit i had a different experience as the weather pattern is influenced by the mountain range seperating the Atlantic and Indian oceans at Cape Point.

Marvellous views. Check the whether and go on a clear, sunny day for a great hike. Take the cable car but hike on the mountain. Lovely!Cafe is expensive, pack your own beverage and snacks and go on a full stomach:)

Feel on top of the world. Love going up Table Mountain - it's a view that never gets old. Just remember it can be deceptively chilly up there so be prepared so that you don't get sucked into paying inflated tourist prices for something warm from the gift shop when you get to the top. Enjoy!
Best view of the cape!. Please if you are in cape town or plan to visit .. Do not miss Table Mountain is has the best view ever of the cape and the beaches and coast ! It is simpley breathtaking!!
Brilliant. If the weather's good go for it, don't wait! The views are worth it and you'll be disappointed if the visibility is poor.

Be Prepared for Some Serious Hiking. We never found any description of the trail to the top of table mountain. So we assumed it was nothing special. Wrong !! The 2+ mile hike up was one of the toughest we have ever done, and that includes the Grand Canyon. Almost the entire hike was climbing large stone steps, in full sun. Of course, the views were wonderful on the way up. At the top we found hundred of people that had taken the cable car. There was a full service restaurant, and the views were 360 degrees. Magnificent. So, take your choice; foot or cable. But you must make the trip, when the clouds do not obstruct your view.

Miles of Mountain. After the recent fires and the rain we should have the most awesome display of new life. Whether you enter the Park at Signal Hill or Cape Point you can walk for kilometers. Looking for spectacular views of the City and Ocean, clean fresh air and quiet? This is where you will find it.
Great food for friends and family.. What a blast ! Will recommend a trip up Table Mountain to anyone who has the opportunity to go up. The food is wonderful and caters for all tastes.
Gorgeous 360 degree views!. The most majestic and beautiful scenery you will ever see in all of South Africa. We really enjoyed our time here and hope to come back again to visit soon.

Wow What a view!. The walk up the mountain is fantastic! It took 1.5 hours but plan on at least 2 hours. The view from the top was fantastic and there are lots of explanatory signage. Watch out for load shedding though as I got stuck up there standing in a line in the hot sun for 1 hour waiting to go down on the cable car.

Beautiful feeling of being at the top of the world. What a beautiful wonder of the world it is. Have to make sure you take a jacket if you are going to the top because it gets extremely cold. The view from the top is priceless. you get to see the entire camps bay, the ocean and all the surroundings. It's an amazing attraction and I highly recommend to visit once you are in Cape Town
First day in Capetown. The views are fantastic. It was beautiful clear day and Capetown looked fabulous. No queue in June. Warm and sunny

Crazy if you go to Cape Town and not go on Table Mountain. The best way I can describe this is imagine if you were standing on the wings of a plane flying in mid air. You literally get washed over by clouds, you can touch them, you can eat them! I have never seen anything like it. I'd highly recommend this to anyone.

Go up to the clouds! Best view of Cape Town and surrounding area.. Awesome!!! Go up early in the day as it was clear and as the day went on the clouds rolled in. It changed the views. There are fabulous views of the Cape Town area. Look closely at the rocks as there are rock dassies- little animals just clinging to the rock with their fur blowing. Bring a jacket as it is very windy up there!

Hey, saw a herd of Rock hyrax (dassie's)! First time we had ever seen one! so cool wish we could take a few home!. Table Mountain National Park was our first stop in South Africa! After an amazing cable car ride to the top we hiked away the entire afternoon. This is a must see stop in SA and it will remind you how beautiful this world can be sometimes! Also, everyone we met was extremely kind and friendly, staff and fellow tourists as well!

Table Mountain trek. A must do if you visit Cape Town. Whilst you get some great views as the cable car rotates 360 degrees during the journey up and down, consider walking up the 'back' of the hill starting at the botanical gardens - if you do take plenty of water!

Exercising in nature. If you want to climb Table Mountain you need to start early in the morning while it is still cool. You need to take water and something warm to wear. The weather in Cape Town can change quickly. Looking at the mountain we walked up the left front side of it. It was like climbing a big staircase so it was not difficult to do. I cannot remember how long it took us. Once on top it was rather windy so we went to have a hot chocolate in the restaurant at the top and then we took the cable car down. It is free to climb the mountain but there is a fee to take a ride in the cable car.
Beautiful landscape. The landscape is marked by beatiful flowers and wild live. The views from the top are also magnificent and worth a visit just for that.

Plan your route and be prepared for all kinds of weather. You can hike to the top and come down the Cable Car or reverse. One of the most beautiful and rewarding hike , whether you go to the top or hike around the many paths on The Mountain.The flora and Fauna change all year round so one hike is not enough ! Aim to do several hikes and better still come back in a different season to hike again.All facilities aare at the top Cable Car station.

Simply stunning. Fantastic mountain with wonderful views. We climbed up Plattekloof Gorge which was tough going but so worth it, and then after visiting the restaurant for lunch, returned via the Cable Car. Highly recommended if you are in Cape Town, not to be missed at any cost.

360º View. If you visit Cape Town and don't go to the top of Table Mountain, then you haven't been to Cape Town. Take a trip to the top of the Mountain and take a slow walk around, you will not be disappointed.

Revisiting our favourite places.. Having lived in Cape Town for most of my life, I simply cannot get enough of the beauty and serenity of the TMNP. We escape from the bustling city, to experience, again and again, the spectacular vistas.

Cycling & Hiking in the Table Mountain National Park. For the past few years I have spent many early Saturday mornings cycle up and around the TMNP previously mostly in Tokia but now after the fires on the actual front face of Table Mountain Where in the world can one leave your home in a City and within 20 minutes be up in the wild expierecing unbelievable single tracks and jeep tracks with the most amazing views of the city, the ocean and other mountain ranges. In addition many a Sunday my whole family head off the one of the hundreds of walking trails for a short one or two hour walk. The trails are clearly marked and well kept. But moo important antsy the expierence unbelievable and right in the middle of a city and on our door step
At Table Mountain National Park. A must visit in Capetown, Table Mountain National Park provides you with breaktaking views of the city below and allows you make nice walks on its top.

Breathtaking Table Mountain. If the weather is permitting the trip up Table Mountain is spectacular. The cable car runs steeply up affording 360` views due to the revolving floor. Once on top there are walking tracks circling the mountain and native animals to share the views with.
Surely one of the WONDERS of the World. One of A KIND .. if you have not done this and gone up the Mountain .. you a'int seen nothing .. SUNSET is a must with spectacular view over Cape TOWN.

The Table cloth. This is the most amazing place on earth. This must be on your top 10 thing to do. When in Cape Town book early, during the summer month. also check the weather if it is to windy then the cable car is closed and you will have to come back another day or if the wind stops.
.

Spectacular views, lovely walks/hikes, and wonderful plants to admire. Table Mountain is the attraction to experience, the views and the feeling of freedom are unequalled. If one choose a perfect day to catch the “Cable Car” ride up Table Mountain you will not be sorry, in fact you will not want to leave by the time the sun sets and the last call for the ride down is announced.One is absolutely mesmerized by the spectacular view that Table Mountain offers. The 12 Apostles can be seen stretching towards Cape Point as you look south east down to Clifton beach and Camps Bay beach. A most amazing view of Robin Island can be seen as you look towards Bloubergstrand beach and Cape Town’s harbour along the west coast. Looking northerly one might be able to spot a plane coming into Cape Town International on short finals, which might be from False Bay/Muizenberg side or it might be turning in from Bloubergstrand and flying past Tygerburg Nature Reserve which is in-line with one of the runways. Looking in a northerly direction one would see the mountain range out at Stellenbosch, Franschhoek, and Paarl; if you take some time and look through one of the many viewers that surround the Cable car building you would see the vineyards that scour the base of the Hottentos-Holland Mountain range.
Incredible views. Absolutely breathtaking! A must for all visitors! We were very fortunate to arrive on a sunny winter afternoon. The ride up on the cable car was a very nice experience on it's own!

Table Mountain National Park a must see when visiting Cape Town!. Table Mountain National Park is one of the must sees when you are visiting Cape Town. You could either hike up or take the Cable car at a cost. There are several walking trails and you need to use a map for some of them if you are not familiar with the terrain. The view is spectacular. The fora and flora is very interesting and some of the flora is is only found on this Mountain range. It can get quite windy on top and cloud cover comes over quickly. There are notifications in place for this. Enjoy!

Sun, Mountain, Beautiful Lady = Best ever day. Date with with an amazing woman to hike the glorious Table Mountain- adventure, yes, but it turned out way better... not only is it medicine for the soul, mind and body and the best stress relief ever. You are immediately awestruck with the majesty, presence of the mountain and it's beauty, and the splendor of the city and views of Atlantic Ocean. You are greeted with friendly smiles of people from all over the world, who are just to eager to inspire and motivate you, wonderful. And the bonus: what a great way to get to know someone, memories, experience- she was so much fun, so many laughs and conversation, thank you beautiful Table Mountain.
Excellent. Much more than I expected! Amazing views of the breathtaking beauty of Cape Town, do not miss this! Lovely walking trails and great places to take pictures
Great day. One of the best things to do whilst in Cape Town. The views are spectacular and the clouds as they float over the mountain give some great effects.

Never thought I'd do it- Climb Table Mountain. Oh my goodness.... It was so exhausting at some points but the views make it worth while. It was stunning. I climbed up places I never thought I'd climb. We went up indian Venster I think it's called but came down the easy way. It was spectacular.
Stunning view. The views are stunning. This is a must do trip in Cape Town. Pick your day if you can, the blanket of cloud rolls in fast. Nice restaurant and bar up top and a nice walks.

A mountain like no other. I love this mountain. It forms the backdrop to my city Caoe Town, one of the most beautiful in the world. I went up early a few weeks ago with a group of Instagrammers, caught the sun coming up and watched the city below and the mountain on top come to life. The views are of course incredible (It's a photographer's paradise), stretching as far as the eye can see, my favorite being the view Lions Head, Sinal Hill & Robben Island. The mountain is a bio diversity hot spot - loads of plant, small animal and bird species. After walking along the paths, head for the restaurant for hot chocolate & thaw out... it's really cold up there in winter so nb the hat, scarf & gloves. If you're a local or tourist, don't miss a trip up, via a hike or the cable car.
Brother's visit. awesome experience. prebooked our tickets made it a lot easier did not have to stand in long queues. Amazing views.

Worth the trip even inns cloudy day. Was in Cape Town for Four days, all were overcast as dead of winter, but we still took the gondola up the mountain and very glad we did. The gondola rotates as it ascends and descends so the view is constantly changing and everyone gets great views of the city below . Cloudy on top but hauntingly beautiful just the same. The clouds can shift so quickly and I would Encourage everyone to at least give it a chance.

Wonderful Views of Cape Town and More. The National Park actually encompasses much of Cape Point. It is great for hiking but also a place to sightseeing. We saw baboons and ostriches as well as Cape of Good Hope and Signal Hill. It really requires a day to see it all and requires a tour or car.

It's all about the view. The wait for the cable car can be long, but once atop Table Mountain, you'll see why it was worth standing in line. Terrific 360º views, with a great vantage point of the harbor.

Make this one of your first stops in Cape Town.. If you make it to Cape Town - and I highly recommend you do if you visit S. Africa - you need to hit Table Mountain on your first days. From the top you can see all the surrounding beaches and towns near Cape Town that you can not see from the city. And there are many! Cape Town is great for shopping, restaurants, the aquarium, etc. - but not for beaches. You need to go outside the downtown for that, and Table Mountain will give you the visual on where to go! And a great store, restaurant, hiking and more up top. Plan on spending half a day.

Beautiful!. Enjoyed spending time atop the mountain. Views are breathtaking! There are several paths to follow and plaques to learn more about the history of the mountain, animals inhabiting it, etc. There are also lots of places for excellent photographs. Definitely worth the trip!

Fun and very windy and cold. The title says it all, this place is a great place to visit but it gets windy later in the day so go first thing in the morning. We used the HO-HO bus to get here. Bring warm clothing, even in summer it is freezing up there especially if its windy. the ride up is fun, the tram turns as it goes up so there are no bad seats, but it is quite crowded. Once at the top the views are excellent, and there are several stores and restaurants to stop in as well. Definitely a nice place to visit, if the wind gets to bad you have to walk down so mind that wind in case walking is not your favorite thing! Lots of folks walk up and down the route is rocky so wear good shoes!

Breathtaking!. The cable car ride to the top of the iconic Table Mountain was very exciting and perfectly executed. We have been intrigued by this natural wonder for a very long time. Our first awareness of Table Mountain was the image on a Chinese Export plate executed in the 18th century.
Beautifull. Excellent place to experience beauty and tranquil environment. Lovely coffee shops. Wonderful garden experience.
A must-see. Great place up here. The cable-car worked fine, but the next time I will walk for having a greater nature experience.

Always a great visit . Table Mountain National Park is Table Mountain but is a lot more besides. There are "pockets" of TMNP dotted all over the Cape Peninsula & all are unique in their own way. Table Mountain is a land mark in every sense of the word offering amazing views over the city, the beaches of Camps Bay & Clifton as well as views all the way to Cape Point in the southern tip of Africa. You can walk in TMNP; hike; take a 3 day escorted hike to or from Cape Point or you can ride the Cable Car to the top of Table Mountain. Other parts of TMNP include the Tokai Forrest, the walks above Boyes Drive, Muizenberg; Newlands Forrest & many others. The latter are all free of charge to enter. To be surrounded by a well maintained National Park. in a modern & vibrant city is indeed a great joy

Breathtaking views. Spectacular views over Cape Town and surrounding areas. Very pleasant walks around well-made paths and viewpoints. Weather very variable and the cloud and mist can quickly roll in causing poor visibility and a considerable lowering of the temperature. Make sure you have warm clothing even when it's in the high 20s in Cape Town below.
For a Fabulous View. This is a must do experience in Capetown. The gondola ride is fantastic in itself. Then the geology of the terrain and the flora, plus the views, are spectacular.
Unbeatable views over gorgeous Cape Town. Gorgeous NP with awesome views all around Cape Town, well-managed plant and animal life, challenging but neat tracks :)

Its a beauty !!!. Cape town itself is a beautiful city and the Table mountain adds up to its beauty. The journey thru the cable car is amazing. The view from the top is wonderful and on a clear sky day, its a "love at first sight".

Best view in Town.. I love to visit Table Mountain when I'm in Cape Town. The view from there and unbelievable. Its a stunning get a way from the real world. Its a nice outing for the hole family. You can by food and stacks also there. Prices a bit high but worth it.

Why are you in Cape town and don't go here?. This is a must. Table mountain is so famous why would you not visit? The views are spectacular. Just make sure you go on a clear day so you get the best views. Awesome

Doesn't get any better!. If the weather is cooperating, the tram ride up to the top of Table Mountain and the hikes you can do are all amazing. There is lots of wildlife (like the hyraxes) and birds to see PLUS all the views of the surrounding area.We did a 6 mile hike and parts were a little strenuous but it is all clearly marked and really fun to do. They offer rappelling down a part of it and for the intrepid hikers, you can hike both up and down the mountain. It is not for the feint of heart. The weather is variable so keep that in mind. You do not want to get stuck hiking down if the fog rolls in.
Great view - nice at sunset. Stunning views! Take the time to walk along the boardwalk around the top of the mountain. Bring a jacket - it can get chilly

beautiful view from the top. The Table Mountain offers some lovely views of the city of cape town and the Atlantic ocean. One can go for a long walk, weather permitting and take some memorable snaps of the place.

Hiking down in the night. what an adventure we used the cable car to get up the mountain then after sunset we started our way down in moon light and mobiles light. we finished the way in about 90 min, it was hard way and the steps are high, but who loves adventure try it at night.

Awesome views of Cape Town. It's one of the new seven natural wonders of the world. This national park is very well maintained and the restaurant on top is quite up to the mark. Must see attraction of Cape Town.

A must see destination. If you are in Cape Town and a nice day presents itself make Table Mountain your first stop. A spectacular site but best in good weather which we were fortunate to have. The vistas,vegetation amazing. Did a free guided walk and learned a lot about the landscape.

Great tour. Cable ride was fantastic, walking and hiking was an adventure for me. the staff is friendly. the road has markings so you know where you are. nice to watch the town and the sea view from the mountain.

spectacular!. We had a lovely clear day to go up in the cable car and it was so much more than I ever expected. Such a vast area on top of Table Mountain, great to walk around and see Cape Town from this perspective. Allow plenty of time to spend walking around and not be rushed, great gift store for typical tourist souvenirs. My husband is scared of heights but was easily able to manage in the cable car, it was smooth and fast, great that it turns so everyone on board gets a great view on the way up/down

Magnificant. National Parks have perfected this experience.Every detail is thought of, to make this a wonderful and exciting experience.Magnificent views from the look -out spots, everything well signposted.Recommend warm clothing as there is a wind at 1,000 meters.Go as early as possible on your holiday when a good day js forecast, as the weather can change.
Excellent Drive to Cape of Good Hope. Fantastic drive to Cape of Good Hope with an excellent restaurant overlooking the tow oceans .... a must visit at least once

Beautiful hike. Nice hour hike up the mountain. I'm going to share the directions to the main trail cause its hard to find. When you get to the cable cars, continue on the road up. You will come across a building on your right in the bush, keep going. Then you will come across a wooden cabin. The start of the trail is at the cab right behind it. Not anywhere before it, don't get lost. Perfect day trip. Awesome views of the town and the cape behind it. Bring water and something warm to put on when you get to the top.

Mind blowing. The place is simply stunning with some stunning views. The top is huge and it is terrific windy. Advise you to definitely cary adequate clothing. The best part is the bar situated on the top where you can chill with stunning views at some real high altitude.Must visit location in capetown.

Beautiful. I think this should be one of the natural wonder of the earth. For believing you have to visit amazing place. Vast plane land on the top of the mountain & what a view of Cape Town from the top. And top of it they have very good restaurant on the top.

MUST DO even in 'no visibility/cold'. The day that I had planned to do Table Mountain was the last day of my trip but the conditions were 'no visibility and cold.' Determined me and my friends decided to make our way up anyway and see how things were when we got there. Went to buy our tickets and the guy at the window told us the same conditions, but we decided to go up anyway because if you're in Cape Town you can't not go up Table Mountain. Got up and it was covered in cloud, no visibility (but actually not cold, then again we're Canadian) and I swear 7 people in the entire place. We walked around for a while and it was magically quiet, the loudest, heaviest silence I have ever experiences it almost made me cry. Anyway all of a sudden the clouds parted and the view of Cape Town that everyone looks for on Table Mountain appeared, and not a soul was around to see it. Despite the 'bad' conditions we had a fantastic time, and I would advise people not to be discouraged- the clouds do move and you will be rewarded!! Absolutely must see and a fantastic place to be, nothing beats sitting on a mountain that's 155 million years old and connecting with the surroundings in the clouds.
Check it out!. Beautiful views, unique location, get ready to get high in the sky and chilly! Call before your visit to check visibility and if transport open

Best sunset. The mountain is a fantastic experience. The sandstone is a visual pleasure and is a great texture to expeirence and photograph. There are walking trails at the top and the walking is easy and one can choose how far one wants to walk. The view is incredible and one can see Cape Town city from a great perspective. We did the sunset trip and it is highly recommended. It was 9 degrees cooler at the top than below as we experienced a winter chill so have a warm jacket on hand in case.
Iconic view. If you visit Cape Town this is one of the priority sites, ascend by cable car or on foot the views are spectacular. Walk around the top of Table Mountain and find flora and fauna.

Absolutely stunning!!. We came here for a family outing and although a bit expensive, it was worth every penny. The views from up there is breathtaking and you can basically get a 360 degree view of the whole Cape Town. The hiking paths is nice to do or just sitting and enjoying the view. Information boards all around keep you informed which I liked. Take a cardigan as it can get a bit chilly up there. Would definitely do it again.

Must visit when you are in Cape Town. Cape Town is a lovely coast city, friendly weather and beautiful scene. Table Mountain is definitely the symbol of Cape Town. Take the cable car to visit the top part which is the national park. The view is spectacular. Not only getting panorama view of the whole Cape Town, but also the border line between Indian and Atlantic.

Rewarding. One of the most beautiful laces I've ever been to. Table Mountain is a must whenever is SA. You have to be careful with the weather in Cape Town, as it can be tricky with the fog. It is always recommended to go up as soon as there is a clear day because you never know when it's going to get foggy, and once foggy you can get up there but you won't be able to see anything. You can hike up, which was done by a few tourists, but mostly locals do that. You can drive or take the bus all the way to the base, and from there hop into the cable car up. It can take a while to make the line, as everybody wants to go up whenever the day is clear. The cable car is great because it's gyratory, so you can appreciate the complete view on the way up. Once you are in the to the view is amazing! Great photo opportunities. There is a restaurant on site and bathrooms available. It can be pretty windy, so prepare accordingly. Also try to go in comfortable shoes if you plan to walk around the area, it is a little rocky.

So good we did it twice. The drive is lovely if you take your time. The views are amazing, and if you're lucky enough you'll see plenty of wildlife. You can drive down to Cape Point which is the most southerly point in Southern Africa.
Not amazing.... Its a mountain, the same rocks and plants are everywhere.It looks grander from the bottom.The restaurant is really good.Cable car ride up is impressive.

Amazing views. the cable car ride itself was an attraction. The views going up and on the mountain is amazing. Be prepared to hike on the mountain. You could be walking for hours. So comfy shoes and water!
Cape Town must. Must do when in Cape Town. Go early to avoid traffic and parking issues. The MyCiti bus goes from town to practically the front door.
Truly a wonder of the world!. What's not to like? Unparalleled views across vast tracts of the Cape, the lighthouse, Dessies, cable car, nature trails ....where to stop?

The Table handed to you on a plate.. Wow, it has been 18 months since we visited this magnificent Park and I did not realise I hadn't completed my review; the WiFi connection in our apartment was hit and miss so perhaps this is why. (we actually visited in January 2914). This was, without doubt, one of THE best experiences I have ever had. As you ascended to the top of the mountain, you were able to get a 360 degree view as the cable car slowly rotates ensuring everyone gets the best view as one ascends & descends. As a wheelchair user, I would advise you take it steady and have a good cushion with you but the view is spectacular and the history is dotted around as you traverse the table top. Wonderful nature, flora and fauna abound and a great cafeteria and gift shop with it's own post box are there too. You CANNOT visit Cape Town without going here! Further advise: if you are a wheelchair user, be sure to check all your nuts and bolts after this trip for almost all mine had shaken loose. Thanks to a garage with a motorcycle shop attached in Cape Town, we were able to borrow the necessary spammers to tighten everything back up again.

Nothing like it. Beautiful views of Cape Town and amazing scenery. I accessed Table Mountain via the Red City Hop On/Hop Off bus tour. The bus stops for about 15 mins and allows you to take photos, buy souvenirs and use the restroom before moving on. Great value if you don't want to go to the summit, but that's also an option as the bus let's you off right at the entrance for the cableway. One of the highlights of my trip and highly recommend.

A Cape Town Must See. Table Mountain is an iconic Cape Town tourist attraction that the locals love as well. We had a very nice day that started off foggy but cleared up quickly and left us with amazing views. The fog hung over central Cape Town so it seemed like the city was cut off from the mountain. The mountain was fabulous and offers several nice hiking options. We felt safe on the mountain at all times. There is a little café and gift shop at the top too. You have the option to either hike up or take the gondola up. If you are in Cape Town you must visit this site!

Skeleton Gorge Hike, best hike I ever did! Will do it again!. I told myself before I leave cape Town I have to hike up table mountain! Please make sure (because it's winter at the moment) that before you hike up it was not raining for 1 or 2 days, otherwise it's too slippery. We started at Kirstenbosch Garden, bought a map (R 5) and asked at the information to highlight the trail. Take enough water with you (2 litre or more), snacks, jacket, sport/hiking shoes, camera and sun protection. The first part is with steps trough the forest, then 3 ladders and after a part with rocks trough a stream. After that is passed, the last section is completly in the sun. Really amazing hike! Beautiful view and a variety of nature. Not that dangerous and hard than I thought before (heard a lot). Just make sure that you take your time and do breaks in between. Takes about 4-5 h to the cable car with small breaks and not running up. You should be a little sporty, but you don't need to be athlete :-)

Tops in Cape Town. Outstanding views of Cape Town and the Atlantic from the flat top of Table Mountain. Spring and summer are the best times to see protea and other flowers in bloom. Great, easy walking trails; lots of lizards and dassies.

Great in any weather. Other than impaired views, visiting Table Mountain is quite a wonderful treat. Even if you don't do the cable cars--it is wonderful to see this park and mountain right in the city. And the views of the ocean and town are great from there
Hang on to your hat!. Fabulous views in all directions. Strong winds. Get to the tram station as early as possible to avoid the long lines.
up the mountain. You must do this whilst in Cape Town as absolutely beautiful and views from the top are awesome. Best part of the visit to Cape Town
Incredible View!. Can't go to Cape Town without taking time for this beautiful park! If I hadn't been there for business I would have gone up the mountain every day.

Cloudy but amazing . We went to the top on a cloudy day. It would have been better if there was a clear sky but it was still amazing to see the view and walk on the top. But it was freezing so don't forget your jacket or your sweater

On a Clear Day You Can See Forever. We were fortunate that on our fourth day in Cape Town, the weather was clear so Table Mountain was not in fog. You're able to get to and from Table Mountain by the City Sightseeing Bus, a taxi or car. There is also City Bus service from Table Mountain that takes you to Downtown Central.The Table Mountain cable car spins as it ascends and descends. The view is fantastic. Once you're on top of the mountain, the views are breathtaking. There was a free guided tour the afternoon we visited. I would strongly recommended this tour. The tour guide knew a great deal about Table Mountain, its history and flora.We stayed ~2.5hours. One could spend more time if they wished. The cable car ride costs a modest fee.

Just an Awesome place. Brilliant to look at from a distance, awesome to hike on and up and just brilliant from the top.Went up and down on the cable car and hiked up and down - it is not an easy walk by any means (we are reasonably fit 50 odds!), but we made it - there were a number of people much younger than us who were struggling though so don't underestimate it. Take water, check the weather forcast and I would not recommend it in flip flops.

The Famous Mountain. this is by far one of the most amazing things to see with spectacular views. I have been on the Mountain more the 5 times and have walked up and down this is the only place in the wold where you can get this amazing views and good food as well i know coming to cape town and not seeing the mountain is like going to paris and not seeint the ival tower i have traveled alot and love my city
Amazing Views. This place is incredible and extremely easy to access. Try hiking up the mountain if you are in decent shape, it took a little over two hours.

Can't beat the view. We ordered a taxi to pick us up around 10:00am from Downtown Cape Town to take us to the Plattesklip Trailhead. The taxi cost only 80R each way. The hike is fairly steep and the trail was a bit crowded, but people the other hikers were friendly and very encouraging of the people who were struggling on the hike. The hike to the top took a little over 2 hours (which I've heard is the average time). We spent about three more hours at the summit, eating lunch and taking in the views. The beer from the Table Mountain Cafe was the reward after a very challenging hike. Most of our group decided to take the Tram down the mountain, while three of us decided to hike down. The hike down took about 1 hour. I can't see how anyone could visit Cape Town without taking a trip up Table Mountain. Hiking was a challenge (I was sore for the next three days), but I'm happy we didn't pay for the Tram and we got in a little exercise.
Amazing. The experience from the drive up to the cable car. The view from the cable car as it rotates, the cloud cover that comes and goes so quickly and changes the experience every second.Fab

Sweeping views and photographing opportunities.. Once you enter this park, you won't believe you are actually in a city like Cape Town. It offers amazing views and you can walk to the light house. There is a lot of steps and with our visit the little train to the top didn't work. The restaurant has good views but are way over priced and expensive. Be aware of monkeys and baboons in the park and surroundings as they steal food where they can.

Cape Towns Panorama. Table Mountain so called because it has flat top unlike peaks of a mountain. It gives fabulous views from the top and gives breezy experience during the cable car ride. If you have enough lesiure, one can idle around on the table top and enjoy taking panoramic snaps.Except for photography there is not much to do on Table Mountain. On the other hand if you schedule is tight then I would suggest that you can probably just do cable ride and come back.......instead allocate more time for the enthralling drive to the Cape Point and many things to do on way to Cape Point

Breathtaking views and wind!. Heading up, the gondola is unusual in that it turns, allowing everyone to have that coveted downhill view. Be prepared when you get off: the wind is so strong it made us stagger and so cold our fleece jackets weren't nearly warm enough. At least that's the way it was in May. A half-hour after we departed the gondola was shut down due to high winds. Weather aside, the view is spectacular and gift shops and a restaurant offer respite from the elements. Watch for climbers on the sheer rock face heading down. A must-do in Cape Town!
Jewel. Do you really want me to say anything. Its fabulous - put on your walking boots & go & enjoy. Is that 100 words or whatever ?
Awesome and very exhalirating. Fauna and wild very exciting to behold. The view from the differentsections in the park is breath taking.Enjoyed the park tremendously
Table Mountain: The only one in the world. A new wonder of the world and it certainly is a wonder. The views on a clear day are outstanding but it can be chilly so take a jacket with you

Table mountain adventure. I love walking up Table Mountain- it takes two or three hours and there is a real sense of fulfillment and awesome views of Cape Town. I like to go up Devils Peak, which in spite of its name, is a fairly manageable walk for those strong in the leg and with a respect for heights.The flowers and birds are beautiful and the city and seascapes once you are up there, are truly amazing. One can spend an hour whilst eating your lunch sandwich and soaking up the sunlight gazing at the kaleidoscope of mountain urban and seascapes. Just stunning! The steps going down again take a toll on the knees but take it slow and you will be well satisfied with a good day out on the most unique mountain in the world!

Amazing view, worth to travel to be there. This natural attraction is what makes the majority of people traveling to South Africa the reason for doing it. It is really worth it to travel for so long to be there
Top of the World!!. Cool crisp air in the warm sunshine with unbelievable views!! A fantastic relaxing way to spend some time walking the trails. Would loved to have spent more time there!!
Table Mountain in two hours. The walks around the top and time to explore and take photos. The trip up with its 360 view was stunning. There was an eatery at the top for beverages and snacks.

Extraordinary Vistas. One of the top sites in South Africa,,,,a must!! You can take a gondola up the side of the mountain or you can hike. Our son hiked and loved the challenge; we took the gondola, a breathtaking albeit short ride. I don't think you can go to Cape Town and not experience Table Mountain.
Fantastic. If the weather is good - run to view the city and area! My favorite place in Cape Town. Try to time with sunset was extra special

Table mountain when the sun shines. Table mountain dominated the skyline around Cape town and be aware inclemant weather can soon shut the cable cars, so if your visiting and its fine go to the mountain. We had a great sunny day when we visited, being Winter there were no queues for the cars and at the top it was relatively quiet. The views are stunning and the walks around the top are very good with paths laid out, although they are uneven in places. There are designated walks at the top although we found following them was not straightforward , but that may just be us as we do like to wander. We were given a map of the walks and this gave us a good idea of which path to follow. There did seem to be more paths than those shown on the map.There were a lot of information boards around the walls and on the walks which gave some very interesting information and history. I would say the trip was worthwhile , the views were worth it alone.

Top of the World - Cape Town, SA. This was one of the most beautiful hikes my daughter and I have ever done. It took about 2 1/2 hours to get to the top of Table Mountain. The views are spectacular. It overlooks all of Cape Town and out to Robin Island, where Nelson Mandela was held. There is a nice little cafe at the top and a gift shop. Then you board a cable car for a scenic view to the bottom. Oh, the cable car is open and it rotate clockwise to get a 360 view.Stunning! Just a few dollars to ride down.

A Must When in Cape Town. Three things to consider before you go up to the top on the cable car: 1) Buy your ticket online and save time not having to wait in line, 2) Consider taking the Hop On-Hop Off bus to get to the cable car and not worry about parking your car a long way up the road, 3) Check the weather before you go. If it's clear and there are only a few clouds-GO. The weather can change very quickly and you could end up in the clouds with no view. The trails at the top are worth exploring and can take an hour + to experience.

With A View. We couldn't believe just how long we spent on top of the mountain. There is just so much to see and take in with all the flora and fauna, and not forgetting the magnificent and spectacular views. Sadly our time was limited, but definatley returning and next time we're going to hike it.

We never tire of this wonderful experience!.
