The best part of going to Table Mountain with 3 children and a teenager was being able to book online in advance which ensured that we avoided the queues on the day. We went up at 8:30am which was also another great way to ensure that we had no more than a 5 minute wait to board the cable car.It is a slick tourist operation with a great and very comfortable ride up in a rotating cable car which ensures that everyone gets a great view.Once up the mountain, there are lots of good signs to ensure that people may move about and get to see the views of Cape Town, Robben Island etc.We ate at the Restaurant on top which is a self service typical tourist type restaurant. There was a good selection but it does feel like a diner type experience. I miss the old restaurant on top, which has now been turned into the main tourist shop selling the usual t-shirts, postcards, soft toys etc.The kids loved running around and all of us really enjoyed the experience. I "must do" when visiting Cape Town.

A walk through the clouds. Table mountain is one amazing place. The beautifully kept park atop one of Africa's tallest natural stone structures and its facilities are neat, well maintained and visitor friendly. Cordoned off areas to keep visitors safe are stable and solid. For those planning the long 2 hour walk upmountain or downwards are also kept safe with well maintained foot paths/walkways that have in many places handrails/cables to help support you on your trek. For those who are pressed for time, they can ascend and descend with the cable cars. But for those who have enough time, it is suggested that they make one of the trips on foot and one with the cable car. The walk although long is one amazing trek.

Book a tour. What views it was on my things to do in south africa ,but why did we only book 3 days ,crazy would love to have seen more what views you need to just stand back a few seconds bring lots of drink loved it

Only in Cape Town. We took the Red Hop on/off tour bus to get there. It is the best deal in terms of cost and you do not have to worry about parking which is scarce. Going up the cable car is a thrill already. Make sure the mountain is clear before you go up, otherwise you will not have any views of the city down below. There are plenty of paved and unpaved trails where you can hike for hours if you like. We took a 2 hour hike to a Beacon on the other side of the mountain. The views are phenomenal.

Absolute must - no exception. So, I thought I wanted to hike up. I ended up using the cable car, which was nice. People tell you the hike u takes 1 hour but that is just for super speedy and trained people. You might up taking 3 hours instead. There are several hikes around it, too and you can hike down. In any case, you MUST go up and see the city from above. There is no better view than this one! It's best to go on a clear day and wait until sunset (the last cable car goes down at 6pm). Up on top you can walk the 1h walk along the flat or take a bit longer and hike up and down after it. Both walks are stunning! Make sure you get a map from the tourist information at the intersection in Kloof Nek (you can take the bus here). If you want to just enjoy a coffee and cake on top, there is a small cafe.
Very windy and expensive, breathtaking view. I was surprised by how expensive the cable car was, but the view was amazing. We got to see a bunch of animals up there too.

Stunning views. We went to Table Mountain and the weather was absolutely amazing! Even though the wind was cold, the sky was clear and we got great photo's. We also got to walk around the top of the mountain. The restaurant is beautiful and well-layed out, just very pricey. It is also expensive to go up and down in the cable car.
Great Views of the City. This place offers awesome views of the city, plus there are funny looking animals called Daisies. The cable car ride to the top is well worth the price.

It truly deserves the reputation of one of the Seven modern wonders!. Breathtaking views! Must go to the Table Mountain cafe.Hiking is an option that many people take. We used the cable car. If you are a big Avatar fan, you will really love the ride in and out of the mystical cloud cover. Beautiful views of the Cape Town city and Lions head.

Incredible views but be patient. The cable car ride up and back are spectacular as are the views from Table Mountain. Food and drinks are available for reasonable prices at the top. The only downside was the two-hour wait for the cable car: because of "load shedding" electrical outages they were using their own generator which only provides enough electricity to run half loads. At least most of the wait was under shade from the sun. This was our third try at seeing Table Mountain and the first successful with previous clouds and winds making it impossible. If you are in Cape Town, do this on the first good weather day you have--it may be your only chance.
Amazing views. Misty day in Cape Town but we risked a trip up the mountain. It was well worth it! watched Cape Town appear from the mist as it cleared, amazing views.

The Park that will make you fall in love with Cape Town. Table Mountain National Park sports a multitude of hikes for every type of hiker, enthusiast or beginner. Living at the base of Table Mountain for 2 years we were fortunate enough to explore this beautiful mountain and park extensively. To plan a day trip through the park I would suggest looking at a map and choosing one of the 4 "sides" to start from. The hikes and walks from the front (the city side) are pretty strenuous but one that stands out is the hike up to Devil's Peal, a really extraordinary exploration with breathtaking views of the city, the bay and Table Mountain. The Camps Bay side, has a handful of steep hikes with India Venster being the most popular, but also the most challenging. The hikes from Hout Bay are more gradual but just as beautiful, the Constantia neck hike is one that stands out with the Elephant's Eye cave being the highlight, a hidden gem. Last but not last, the Kirstenbosch/Claremont side of the mountain boasts the infamous skeleton gorge hike starting in Kirstenbosch Gardens. A truly spectacular hike that will allow you to take in the beautiful flora of the Gardens and enjoy the most amazing sunrise Cape Town has to offer.

An iconic view. The city sits in one of the most beautiful natural situations in the world, overlooked by the iconic Table Mountain. The mountain itself has remained eternally impressive through the years, but the number of people heading up it has certainly changed in the past 20 years. The rotating cable car that takes you to the top is ten times the size it was - once it would take 15 people, now it’s more like 100 each trip. The five-minute ride to the top should be on every Cape Town itinerary, rewarding you with wonderful views of Cape Town, Robben Island and the Peninsula from the top. Picnic or visit the restaurant, while you watch the wildlife in the National Park - you’ve got plenty of time as the cable cars are every 10-15 minutes and finish at 9.30pm in the summer. Or if you’re really daring you can even abseil off the top of the mountain when you’re ready to get down.

Awesome Table Mountain. Table Mountain is simply breathtaking - took the cablecar ride up , but noticed lots of trails for those who like to hike - understandably there may be a bit of a wait for the cablecar because of the scores of visitors, but because its well-organised and staff are pleasant , this isnt too bad... and ofcourse the marvellous views from the top are not-to -be-missed! Access via cablecar depends on weather though- a friend of mine missed the experience bc she planned the visit for the last day of her trip ,and then couldnt go bc of high winds on that day...so i think if anyone is on a short trip to Cape Town , make sure you do this as soon as you can

A Hearty Hike. I enjoyed my hike up to the summit of Table Mountain. It was tougher than I thought it would be, but not because of terrain, just lots of repetitive steps up, up, up! Of course I started at sea level and hiked up past Lion's Head as well, which made for a very full day. Next time I'm bringing something to eat on the way up!

7 natural wonders of the world list. TABLE MOUNTAIN IN THE 7 natural wonders of the world list
Must see and cable car up to table mountain is fantastic with beautiful view

Will visit again!. I know it has a really good view, but the weather was really cloudy when I got there. could not see anything :( I will visit again! Anyway, the cable car was so awesome!! clean, comfortable, kind staff, and quick!

a must for every visitor to the mother city. this is the heart of Cape Town, .....I have been living here for 34 years and never tire of this natural beauty, feel privelidged to be able to visit it whenever I want to.... incredible walks, some strenuous and others easy, visiting Table Mountain is a great way to admire the beautiful indigenous flora (fynbos) of the Cape. Beware though....it can be very dangerous and visitors to the city must do their homework thoroughly before embarking on hikes !
Amazing!!!. What an amazing place no one visiting Cape Town should miss a this. We visited early evening with a beautifully clear sky, the views were unbelievable.

Definitely a must see in Cape Town!. I had these huge plans of hiking the trail, which faded soon after I saw how enormous they were. Like any other tourist we went ahead and took the cable car which is a lovely experience in itself as you get to see some lovely views on the way up. The cable car’s floor rotates a full 360 degrees to let you see the entire span. I of course, went crazy clicking pictures.On top of the mountain is the preserved Mountain National Park, which is home to over 1500 species of fynbos( rock rabbits). It’s been a protected area for over a 100 years. Interestingly, the table mountain was formed about 600 million years ago under the sea. Yes, this entire area was under the sea! The movement of glaciers produced the flat table top. Infact, the whole city of Cape town is reclaimed land.Once on top of the table mountain you can do self or guided walks, click pictures or just soak in the breathtaking views. There is also a small open restobar for people to grab a quick beer and soak in the atmosphere, if they so please to do. We were lucky to get a beautiful, clear day at the mountain, otherwise if it’s cloudy the whole trip can go for a toss.
Go when it's clear. The views are spectacular in clear weather. The wildlife (dossier, baboon and bird life interesting. The gondola ride a treat.
The Most Amazing Place. The mountain is kept clean and the staff are friendly and well trained. You honestly feel as if you are touching the sky.

Amazing views. Absolutely wonderful attraction to visit if you are staying in Cape Town. The sites and experience was amazing. The cable car was an added feature that rotates as it takes you to the top of the Mountain.

Unspoilt beauty with spectacular views. We went up to Table Mountain after 25 years. It still remains the unspoilt beauty of Cape Town! Because of limited time in Cape Town, we reached the top at 17:00 and did not waste time getting onto the trails. Since it was a clear day with lovely weather, we watched the sun set from the top of the Mountain - spectacular and breathtaking are understatements in describing nature's beauty in all its glory!!!

Incredible views!!. A unique national park on the top of a mountain, reached by cable car (although we did see many people hiking up). We were with a tour group so only had a short time but certainly enjoyed the incredible views in all directions. A must visit while in Capetown.

Day up the mountain. Went up here by car then cable car. It was just fantastic and the views from the top were stunning.
We had a snack up there and a drink.
Then we went for a walk round
The Dassie's were curious creatures in between the rocks, seemingly not scared of humans. (They are a mountain rodents or rats)

Panoramic view of Cape Town harbor and Cape Town worth the drive up Table Mountain. It took a second day try to be able to go up on Table Mountain, but the view was worth the wait. There was a long line waiting to go up the lift, but the wait was not too long. The view from the parking lot area is great with a sweeping view of Cape Town.
WOW. I liked the view, the breathed air, the greatness and the uniqueness. Didnt like the price to visit.

Might be one of the best public views in the world.... Have gone up Table Mountain in thick clouds and brilliant sunshine. We always manage to get a view of Cape Town, Robben Island, and the bay, no matter what. It's a thrill to go shooting up the cable car to the top of this famous mountain, and then to stroll around looking on all sides at the stunning views. A must-see.

I love to go a wandering.... One of the greatest natural wonders of the world, I never tire of walking on the mountain paths of the Table Mountain National Park. The views are amazing, with the indigenous fynbos vegetation adding to the unique experience that is Table Mountain.

Stunning views. . Friendly staff and a really funny woman working in the shop at the top. Had a fantastic visit to Table Mountain and the weather 23*C (in winter) could not have been better. Took the cable car up and climbed back down. The climb down was a great option although we heard it was easier to climb up.

perfect place to view the city and beyond. this was my second time to table mountain and it was with great pride I was able to show it off to my family.We got there late afternoon no queues.The view is magnificent. We beat the fog before it slowly moved in shroud the city

Fantastic! But.. Get there early.... You need to arrive early (as soon as it opens) as the queues can get horrendous and it was very hot the day we went! Pre booked tickets are an idea too.Amazing views at the top after a surprising cable car ride!I wouldn't miss this!

Highlight of the Cape Town trip.. Its a must for anyone touring Cape. The cable car ride is short but you must get a window view to admire the stunning beauty.Table mountain is amazing and you feel like you are in the clouds. The weather is unpredictable so be prepared. There is a restaurant so food and drinks can be purchased. Not to be missed when in Cape.
Table mountain. One of the Seven Wonders of the World…say no more. A superb natural playground – trail run, mountain bike, or hike.

A Must Do. If you go to Cape Town it's the number One thing to do. Amazing views and great trails. It can get cold in May and always seemed to be clouds around it,so if it's a clear day get updates there

Well....it was voted as one of the seven world wonders!!!. Comment is difficult. A place one should visit whilst being in Cape Town.
As the saying goes " if you haven't visit Table Mountain, You haven't been in Cape Town"

A must-do, but get the weather right. The views atop Table Top Mountain are gorgeous and the walk around the top is fun. The little dassie animals scurrying about are also a sight to see. Make sure to find a clear day to enjoy the full view. Luckily, we had a window to enjoy it before the clouds raced in and obstructed it. Before getting on the cable car, the ticket-seller will inform you of the views, so you can de-risk your investment.

Well maintained and awesome. If you get the weather right then you will be blessed with some amazing views , fresh air and informative walk around the top of table mountain, there are several paths to take so read the info which tells you just how strenuous they can be , be alert and if you hear the fog horn then get back asap !!!!you will not believe how quickly the weather can change until you have seen it , bright day to total fog in minutes.

Outstanding views of Cape Town. This is not to be missed. We went up on a warm, sunny day - but there were nice breezes to stay cool. Many people - but you never felt crowded. Spent several hours walking around looking at the different view points. They also have a good restaurant and shops. All and all a great way to get a great view of the area and enjoy the fresh air and sunshine. Plus you find many interesting folks to talk with - meet several from England and Canada.
Table Top Delight. Gondola was closed during morning due to high winds so we went back about midday. Great views and walks. A must do if you visit Cape Town.

Truly one of the wonders of the world. I have traveled quite a bit all over the world. Every continent but Antartica. What makes Table Mountain incredible is you see it daily as you navigate and peruse throughout Cape Town, but then when you ascend the mountain itself, you get a completely new experience. The queues were long but we were up the mountain in about 20 minutes from when we first queued. We did the hop on and off tour bus which was a great value. The views of Cape Town from Table Mountain are just incredible. Words won't do it justice. Go and enjoy it

Great Views Must see for Cape Town. Weather will always be a factor when visiting table mountain but dont be put off if it looks cloudy ...the clouds/mist can be blown away in 5 mins depending on time it may be cool so take a jumper There is often a wait for tickets so if you can pre book I would suggest you do so the view of the city is great ..take binoc;s if you have them you can also do an abseil while up there so if you like that look into it Never saw any native wildlife while we were there but there is supposed to be someDont lose your return ticket stub or you will be paying double to get back down..this is because you can hike up so there are people who try to ride down for free

Nice view of Capetown in peaceful setting. Enjoyed visit to Table Top Mountain. one has to go via cable car which has a rotating platform. Hence one get a 360 degree view. Place is peaceful at top and serene experience.Must visit in Capetown

Pick a sunny day, lots of FPS 30 & water and... Walk and climb it !. Certain things must be done by ourselves and hiking the Table Mountain to the peak, it takes up to three hours, better done going up than coming down, is just one of those activities that make an experience of a journey. The alternative would be joining a huge queue that takes up to one hour to clear and go up by Cablecar.On the way up, walking, there are tracks, more or less evident, and the views that come up while going up are breath taking. Nature unfolds and presents itself more beautifully as one hikes up and up, going for paths and corners. To fully experience the journey use hat, protect your body with FPS 30 and take 2 litres of water per person for this 3 hour walking up. through the small sized bushes and deserted areas of the mountain. If tired, drink water as dehydration makes one feel tired, dizzy and usually does not present itself as being thirsty. If alone, make sure you have local sim card on your mobile to easily call emergency if need arises. Bring a blouse to protect from wind if weather changes.In 2,5 hour weather may change... if you sense it either spring it up or down - You do not want to be caught in the middle of the mountain and having to climb under rain or strong wind.Lots of opportunities on the way up to sit, rest, and shoot photos from magnificent angles.Once up there, from one of two obvious paths, take time to walk on the surface of the Table Mountain, probably another 1-hour activity to sense it all in the silence of being all over the world, with views for all sides of Cape Town and the Reservoir.Suggest coming down using the Cableway as a)no queues b)protects your knees from efforts on the way down, and you will need them to walk on the days after.

Great views of Cape Town and the surrounding area. When we arrived in Cape Town our guide suggested we go straight to Table Mountain as the wind wasn't too bad and the visibility was excellent with no cloud. (Apparently the previous day you couldn't see a thing). We went up via the aerial cableway (excellent) and the views on the way up were great. When we got out at the top the wind nearly took your head off and it was very chilly. You had to be very careful of your footing. Having said that the views in every direction (Cape Town, Robben Island etc) were stunning and we wouldn't have missed them despite the wind and cold. The café was incredibly popular as people tried to get/keep warm. We were actually very lucky as visitors were prohibited from coming up the mountain (due to the wind) well before we came safely down again.

Beautiful. Great food and snacks up at the top, the few was phenomenal, cable cars gave fun transportation, abseiling down the top of Table Mountain with "Cape Town Abseiling" is a must do, even if you are a bit fearful of heights. Very professional, very safe.
Table Mountain. Beautiful view, ride up in tram so scenic not scary. You need to get there early as it gets crowded quickly

Lunch on top of Table Mountain. It is an experience one would cherish. Led a small corporate group for lunch on a friday afternoon. Cont remember the food, but being there after a hectic week was an amazing start for a great weekend in Cape Town.

Good luck with weather. We have been twice in Cape and this time the weather was looking good enough to visit Table Mountain. The clouds seem to be there most of the time. I think this is a "must see" place in Cape, we really enjoyed the view to different sides of the mountain. We didnt have too long waiting time and we also found a safe parking place pretty easily.Absoloutely one of the nicest place in the earth! If there are not too many people up there...

Glad it happened...sort of. It was iffy if we were going to be able to go up to Table Mountain because of the weather. At the last minute, the cable car reopened, and up we went. The highlight was the Cable Car that rotated 360 degrees as you ascended. Fun. The view from the top was fine. I've seen better. I would recommend that you go if possible, but don't get bumbed out if you can't.

Beautiful Even When Cloudy. We went on a cloudy morning, and although it was a bit disappointing at first, we realized it was still a treat. Being that high, we were actually above the clouds, which made for some amazing photos. Additionally, the walking paths at the top were an unexpected treat. We spent close to an hour walking around and taking pics, and we probably could have spent an additional half hour doing so. The cable car ride to the top was fast, comfortable, and safe. I love the fact that it rotated so each person can experience all the views. A trip to Cape Town must include a stop here.
First morning in SA. Woke up, saw it was a clear day and taxied over right away. No line, so lovely! Took the tram both ways. Spent about 90 minutes, a great first view of lovely Capetown.

Must see monument to natural Cape Town. Beautiful views earned after a moderate hike up Table Mountain-a must do activity in Cape Town, though you can take the cable car up. Loved the vistas and pops for photos.

Freedom on your doorstep. im a local and I love just going to get some fresh air on the mountain. To tourists, don't be scared just to wonder up the mountain. It's so easy and if you follow the big paths you can't get lost. Be prepared though with food and something warm just in case. Enjoy.

Great views !. Been here about 4 times. One restaurant at the top. Plenty of visitors from around the world. Not much to do top of he mountain unfortunately except walk ,with a few gift shops to boot. Views great though. Recommend !
Table Mountain. Beautiful with panoramic views of the surrounding area. We went up on a clear day our first afternoon in Africa. While tired from traveling for 35 hours it was great.
Awesome views. One of things that you just can't miss if you are traveling to Cape Town. Give yourself plenty of time to wander around and see the views from every side of the park.

Stunning Views of a gorgeous city. We took the tram to the top of this gorgeous mountain with stunning views of cape town. Be sure to check weather so you have time to hike out to,the farthest point. The weather turned on us as it often does, but we enjoyed it thoroughly even though we got wet. Bring a backpack with a rain jacket!

Table Mountain. This is a 'must do' experience while visiting Cape Town. The views from the top are just incredible and the cable car journey is fun, but you may have to wait a good while to get on so go early.
Table Mountain. amazing, thoroughly recommend it. Sean from Trek Direct took us to there and we absolutely loved it. We got amazing photos and the view unbelievable

Breaktaking Table Mountain and surrounds. A full day's adventurous outing can be experienced on table mountain but be sure to arrive early due to Traffic conjestion and limited parking facilities.My family hiked up the mountain on a very good pathway which took a couple of hours, followed by abseiling approximately 120ft of sheer rock face. The mountain was covered with beautiful flora such as proteas and amazing views in all directions including Lions Head

well, its a view, so if you have travelled a lot, you have seen many lovely views.. well, its a view, so if you have travelled a lot, you have seen many lovely views. If you have time, do go. If its on your way en route to a tour, even better.
Awe-inspiring. Awe-inspiring. I have visited this place so many times and each time I get a thrill and find something new.
Plan Your Visit. Some days are just too windy or foggy to make it worth your while. Great view of this beautiful land.
BEST HIKE EVER.. Get your hiking shoes on and get ready for the hike of your life. Amazing views and a journey you will NEVER forget.

Excellent view - if the weather holds. One of the must-do in Cape Town. Fantastic bird's eye view of Cape Town and surrounding areas. The views on the west side overlooking the 12 Apostles and Camp's bay is particularly stunning. Weather might change any time (fog rolls in quickly - like SF), so snap away while the weather holds. Good idea to go late afternoon and catch the sunset. Also good for avoid the morning crowds. There was no line when we went 1.5 hours before closing. The inside of the cable car rotates while on the way up, so you will get a view no matter where you stand, as long as it's by the window

a must do in Cape Town. You can't go to Cape Town and not visit table mountain. It's a wonderful experience not to be missed. Suitable for all age groups. We took our elderly mother up there who was born in Cape Town and went up as a young girl with her father. So to revisit in her 80's was amazing

Must go Place!!. Considered on of the seven natural wonderful of the world, the mountain is really beautiful. After take a cable car to get up at the mountain you will find a amazing view. You will be able to see all city, the coast and if it’s in a good day, maybe you can stay to see the sunset.

On top of the world, at the end of the world!. Lucky enough to be there in a clear day (the following day there was the "table cloth"...) the view is super, and the pics are amazing. I wonder if people hurt themselves, no safety barriers, falling down the rocks IS possible. Be careful, but enjoy!

Dramatic and often moody. The mountain has many moods - go with an open mind. We went on a couple different days in the same week - one day was bright and sunny, great visibility. The other day was windy and cloudy - enjoyed both.

Nothing like you imagined. Table Mountain is a worthwhile stop over. Whether you choose to hike up or use the cable car, you'll love reaching the top and admiring the amazing views of the Mother City! We've hiked up and loved the journey. Do ensure you get expert info on hiking because there are various trails and one has to be cautious of weather changes because clouds do conceal the trails. Have taken several friends up on the cable car and it's really pleasant.Do take along a drymac or long sleeve top since the weather is unpredictable. Extremely hot in summer but tends to be chilly in the later part of the day. There's a restaurant at the top and other amenities so apart from carrying water no need to carry too much.

Must not be missed!. Definitely deserves its place as a Natural Wonder of the World. A MUST DO experience for anyone lucky enough to travel to Cape Town. For anyone scared of heights or cable cars, its well worth it!
Beautiful. A must see on a clear day. Don't wait until the next day, it might not be open due to wind or clouds

Don't do this if you're rushed for time.. The trip up to the top of Table Mountain is via a lovely revolving cable car, offering a view over the whole area...however fog often and repeatedly covers all the views. If you love plants it's a good way to spend an hour or so...but personally I've seen better views in other places and didn't find this all that spectacular.

Excelent Experience. We were really lucky to travel on a mist free day.
Guided tours are really helpful to get more details.
Excellent.
Worth the money only if visibility is good. ( No mist day)
Amazing. Truly deserves the title of one of new Wonders of the Worlds. The spinning cable car is great and everyone has a momen to appreciate the view.

Want to visit Table Mountain. If you get up in the morning and there is no mist covering the mountain, go immediately.
Don't preplan this trip. Just go as soon as it's clear.

Breathtaking Views. The weather is critical to going up and enjoying Table Mountain. Be sure to check the weather before going. The ride on the cablecar is expensive, but it beats walking up and down. I would suggest bringing a fleece, jacket and wool hat, as it could get very windy and sometimes cold on top. There is a very short walk, which most people take. This is about 15 minutes roundtrip. There is a clean washroom on route. You could take a free guided walk, however i don't feel this is necessary. There are several longer walks and even lengthy hikes over rough terrain. The map in the Information guide is not a very good one. My wife and I are hikers, so we took approximately 3 hours to do a roundtrip hike to Beacon (get directions, as this could be confusing). At the very least do the Agama walk, which should take 30 - 45 minutes roundtrip (not counting stops to the photos).

SAN Parks has really improved this site.. DO NOT MISS IT!. We tell anyone who is visiting Cape Town that if you wake up in the morning and the sun is shining and there is no wind... change any plans that you have and get yourself up to Table Mountain. It is so much more than just a ride in the tram and a quick look from the top. People don't realize that you could easily spend a half a day or more just walking around and on a really clear day you can almost see forever...I think the caveat about the weather is really true... we have met people who have been to Cape Town multiple times and never made it to the top. Clouds or wind close it down and the weather up there can change quickly. On a warm day there are lots of birds and small creatures to see as well and more opportunities to take stunning photographs than you can imagine. If you have a Wild Card... use it!

The Table Mountain is amazing.To use the cable car to go up and down.There is a nice restraunt up in the mountains.. I like the peace and quiteness up on the mountain.You can spend hours up there.The cable car ride is amazing.The flowers and fona is too beautiful.

Setting the Table. I joined 30 cruise ship passengers on a morning trip up Table Mountain. We were fortunate, as access to the top was closed in the afternoon due to high winds. We took the 4-minute cable car ride up the mountain, an experience in itself. Once on top, we had time to explore. It was cold and windy at 3,500 feet/1,100 meters, but the view was incredible. There is plenty of hiking to be had, and interesting flora, a nice restaurant and good gift shop. It would be a shame for anyone to miss this iconic landmark. I recommend the cable car and the mountain top. Great!
god"s natural. very beautiful, its seventh wounder of natural. taking allmost 2 hours to visit .cable car is wounder full moving 360*. we can see all beauties of cape town.

Awesome. If you like hiking and trail running look no further. There are a million trails up and down the face and over on the back, leading all the way to Hout bay and beyond - OK so not technically TM but it all has to start somewhere. It's absolutely beautiful up on top and if you don't like it steep or are scared of heights then there are dozens of flat tracks with the most amazing flora and fauna. A complete MUST for anyone visiting Cape Town.

Loved it so much we went back a second time. We had no idea how much walking could be done on top of Table Mountain. Nor that there would be a cafe with probably the worlds best view, serving meals and wine. Nor that there would be Dassies (the world's most charismatic rodent. I am still trying to work out how I can get one back to Australia for a pet). We didn't allow enough time on our first visit, so went back for a second day. Wear your walking shoes, and leave yourself plenty of time to enjoy this spectacular spot!

Beautiful views all over !. The views all around are beautiful. The walking trails are not difficult either. We went with a 4 year old and he could walk. Carry warm jackets as it gets pretty cool on the top. The food in the café is nice.. the tables ouside the café have some very nice views.
Amazing. Loved it! What a view! The cable car is so quick and not being good with heights the trip was really quick.
unique world wonder. Lucky to get a clear day and enjoy the views. the $20 ride is a bit pricey but worth the views from the top.

An experience not to be missed. A well organised cable car service to the top of Table Mountain, revolving floor ensures 360 degree views during the 5 minute trip. At the top, a wonderland of flowers, rocks and birds, with breathtaking views in all directions. Easy pathways and walkways. My husband hiked up Platteklip Gorge, 1.5 hours of hard going, but he loved it. Some people saw whales from the top of the mountain, swimming in the bays below. I couldn't pick them out even with binoculars. Need to keep an eye on the weather which can be unpredictable, and In strong winds the cable car doesn't run. But wonderfully calm and sunny when we were there, altogether an unforgettable experience, highly recommended.
awesome!. Waiting time much too long ! Organisation needs improvement. The cableway trip is awesome. Fantastic view on Table Mt!

A Must Visit Site. Breathtaking. This was simply breathtaking. I was so happy that the weather was beautiful because during my last visit; the tram was going to close any minute, so we opted to wait until our next visit. It was so worth the waitAnd take the pictures prior to going up on the tram. They are well worth the cost.Enjoy.
stunning. view was amazing great place to visit also cable car was fun! did the abseil too which was great walk back up was tough though
Touristie But You Have To Do It. This is classic point for Cape Town. It may sound corny but don't miss it. How often are you going to be in Cape Town?
Great Hiking trail. Amazing views, great hiking trail, a little long to do the trail but its worth it, great views of the mountains and the sea in the background

Spectacular! A must see when in CT.. An amazing park, the views are just awe inspiring. Took the cable car to the top, which is fast and efficient. Decent food topside. Excellent hiking trails. Secure parking. A must see when in CT. Clean bathrooms, troo!

Fantabulous views. Lots of tourist - great. You need to get there very early else you wait for a very long time. Some of the people got very impatient. Parking was also a problem, but other than that an absolutely fabulous experience. Views from the top is breathtaking. Planning to go again to watch the sunset
On top of Table Mountain. Awesome place to visit. Must see when you visit Cape Town. One of my fav place. Will definitely visti Cape Town again with the girls.
Spectacular views. A must do attraction in Cape town with fantastic views as long as the cloud is not down. Easy walks around the top
Great view. It is a must to visit the table mountain on a clear day. Great view over cape town and a nice national parc for hiking.
Great views. A must do great trip up the cable car and excellent views of the area. Need to allow a bit of extra time to explore and walk around some of the trails

Arduous though satisfying. We climbed the mountain with a local guide - Martin Chesno - highly recommended. It took us four hours via the route we took (and we are quite fit) - amazing when you get to the top and are above the clouds!

Beautiful view. a must see to take the cable car up and take a hike. the view of the table cloth is breath taking. Make sure that before you go that load shredding is not happing. The foliage is not to be seen anywhere else in the world.
A "must" attraction. Views were incredible, the ecosystem on top is very different from Cape Town, 3,300 feet below and the cable car ride alone is worth the fare.

Wow! A Cape Town must do. Beautiful panoramic views it was one of the highlights of the trip. We ate breakfast up on the top looking over the Atlantic soaking up some sun shine. Make sure you check to see if the sky tram is working because it will shut down if it is to windy.
Awesome. Excellent views of an excellent country. Go early queues build fast. Hated the spinning floor of the cable car..!

Beautiful Views!. A must visit for your trip to Cape Town, South Africa. The gondola ride was a thrill and the views were amazing. Visit when it's sunny and be sure to bring a light jacket or sweater incase the fog rolls in or the weather changes as it can get chilly.

Amazing. Table Mountain is one of these must do's ...in a way that I actually felt that I did not need to do it because "everybody else" was alrrady going there. Nevertheless I ended up there and the views are absolutely breatktaking. I had the luck of being there on a very clear day with blue skies and sun and the views were endless.
Beautiful. I only made it up half way! I ate some bad food that morning and was extremely sick- nonetheless, it was beautiful!

Great for sunset!. Table Mountain is a must go in Cape Town!You can get up walking or by the cable car.Different ways to hike up and they all look interesting.Better take half day to go there, there is some hiking to do up their too!Stay up till the last cable car goes down and you will see the entire sunset and even see the city by night while going down!

Stunning views. Enjoyed a couple hours on the mountain, walking over the summit, taking pictures and enjoyed a nice afternoon tea. Views from the top are just stunning - would like to be there when flowers are in bloom.
Outstanding view of Cape Town. The ride up, on a rotating platform was exhilarating. The view on top are outstanding. Gives you a great view of Pigeons Island, where Nelson Mandela was imprisoned.

Spectacular. Loved the journey up and down by cable car are the floor rotates so everyone gets to see all aspects. The view from the top is definitely spectacular and we were lucky to have great weather. The option to abseil at the top looked very interesting but is not for the faint hearted.
windy!. Bring a sweater! Views are great but it is way colder up here than it is on the ground! very interesting view of Cape Town

Table Top. Come on, do yourself a favour and go up, if you haven't yet. If you live in the Cape Town areas and have never been up, why not?The first time that I went up I was a teenager and the cable car had no windows or as I would imagine any of the extra safety features that it has now. So go and have an experience that I'm sure you will enjoy. I'm afraid of heights and have been up more than once, so what's your excuse? Did you know that if you are a SA citizen you can go up and down, free of your birthday, just produce your SA ID. So go have a great day on the top.
Best views in Cape Town. Make this stop your first on the list!Amazing views of the city and the sea. You can either drive or hike - definitely check out Lion's Head too.

Breathtaking . Table mountain is quite rightfully one of the natural wonders of the world and one of Cape Town's premier attractions. The mountain top can be reached either by cable car or for the more adventurous, a three hour hike up the mountain. Once at the top, the walks along the top are wonderful and the views over the city and beyond are breathtaking.Hint - regardless of the weather below carry a warm jacket as the wind can be ferocious and close in quickly.
Weather depending. Was an enjoyable experience but very weather dependant. Very difficult to see anything unless it's a clear day

Three hundred and sixty degree view. With a clear day on hand - Table Mountain is an absolute must adventure. The various outlook points were easily accessible with great views from Robin Island, Cape Town city center, "The Castle", the Cape Flats, Muizenberg on the Indian Ocean and Camps Bay/Clifton on the Atlantic Ocean.We enjoyed a light lunch, which was good value for money - some rock rabbits were running around our feet, expecting morsals, however not being allowed to feed them we just enjoyed watching them.The curio store, had a resident jewelry artist. He produces some uniquely beautiful pieces. Absolutely worth a purchase.Ready to return - rather sooner than later.
Hiked Table Moutain. We are active 50 somethings and choose to hike Table Mountain instead of ride the cable car. It took us 4 hours on a sunny cool day. Very exciting.
Gotta do. Yep, ya gotta do this. The views are phenomenal as expected, but the landscape at the top is also interesting with lots of great trails. Nice cafe up there too. Just dress plenty warm.
Misty but amazing. The new cable cars are great. The weather was overcast but not too cold and the views were awesome. Smooth ride up and down.

Go when sunset. A bit too crowded .... an incredible View.An incredible view over Cape Town and Cape of Good Hope.If you want silence and less crowd better go before sunset.Sunset from Table Mountain is a uforgettable memory...

Must See/Visit in Cape Town. The scenery and variety of wildlife, flora and fauna in this area makes it a spot that cannot be missed during your time in Cape Town. The only sad part is having to leave it! Going on a good day with clear weather means you can see quite far (even as far as Cape Peninsula)Be sure to bring an extra sweater (even if the weather forecast says it's going to be warm) because it's always much colder at the top and often much windier!

Does what it says on the tin. Having never been to SA before this was on our must do list, just had to wait for a day when there was no cloud and towards the end of our trip we had a great day and had some outstanding views. I would recommend doing this towards the start of any trip to CT as it really allows you to get your bearings with a 360 view of the area on clear days. I would suggest booking tickets on line and printing them out to save two separate queues on the day.Well worth it and lived up to the hype which isn't always the case for well know world class tourist attractions.Would probably say once would be enough though.

Much more than just the cable car. The park boasts a wide variety of hiking trails and overnight accommodation. One of the most beautiful places in the world. Be sure to always take a jacket, even in the middle of summer.
Best views of the city. A must do if you get a clear day in Cape Town. If there are no clouds go now. Easy walking on the top great views of the entire cape region.

Amazing view: on a clear day, you can see forever. My wife has a bit of acrophobia, and the fear of the cable car was far greater than the actual ride. By the time we were half-way up the mountain, she was "ooing" and "awing" the scenery as much as the rest of us. Once we got to the stop, all we could do was stare: it was beautiful, so clear, with perfect weather. It seemed that we could see forever, as well as the entire cape district of South Africa.We really enjoyed the quiet of the magnificence of various outlook points -- it seemed almost church-like. The worst part of the experience was having to leave it.Strongly recommend a good binoculars; but a modern "point and shot" digital camera produced pictures of amazing quality. Take the time to explore the trails at the top, especially if this is a once-in-a-lifetime visit.
Great day out!. Brilliantly organised, good value for money and spectacular views. Go when the clouds are cleared!! Lovely cafe and bar at the top with friendly service

Take something warm and LOTS of money. Stunning! Stunning! Stunning! but it gets seriously cold, so even if it's a very hot day, do take a jersey or jacket with you and remember the sun block, chap stick and moisturizer!

Table Mountain National Park. Best to check the weather forecast before leaving to get the cablecar. Its often cancelled at short notice due to the weather. If it gets too windy they sound an air raid siren to evacuate the mountain and you are advised to return to the cable car station immediately. Its very windy on top of Table Mountain and you should take clothing in case it rains and decent walking footwear for the often uneven paths that lead away to the walking routes.If you decide you are superfit there are over 300 walking routes off the mountain that do not need you to take the cablecar.
Breathtaking views of cape. It's an amazing experience and great spots for some nice pics of aerial views of Cape Town and selfies. Good value for money.

Wish we had a mountain in PE. Had a great time with my friends in Cape Town and the highlight for sure was Table Mountain. Although the restaurant is pricey - the coffee was great. I wonder how many days Madiba sat and watched Table Mountain as it towers over the ocean and Robbin Island... and how many tourists realised that below them was a future leader planning a new future for South Africa whilst in prison.
Beautiful. Great look out point and walk. Weather was fantastic with the clouds coming through the mountains. The only must see in Cape Town.

Breakfast with an amazing view. One of the best tip I have been told was to book the ticket in advance (online). We did that and go there super early which meant we did not queue and was on the first cabin up. We took our breakfast with us and had breakfast up there. It was amazing! These are the two tips I’d like to pass on now too: book your ticket and go early to avoid the queue. After nearly two hours very quiet, the place started to be packed and we went back down. It was now so busy down there and the queue so long…definitely worth getting up very early!

Honeymoon. Neat area way above everyday life. You can sip wine and have a small snack, enjoy an good strong cup of coffee and even add a shot of Amarula if your so inclined! Dessert and souvenirs were also available, but the view enhanced anything you decided to do. All around there is a feeling of peace. Even some of the over indulged high volume folks seemed to blend with the light breeze. recommend to visit if you are anywhere near Cape Town!
Best view around. Go early to catch a ride to the top via tramway. Solid walking paths on top offers views of Robbins island, Cape Town and as far as Cape of Good Hope.

Wow what a sight. Incredible views. The gondola turns 360 degrees as you go up and down. That is very cool. The restaurant is clean and the food and service are good. But the view is really why you go up.
View from the top. Just go and do it. You will find it amazing. It is a very popular tourist and local attraction so book your tickets in advance. It can be done on the internet.

Beatuiful views. The cable Car rotates while taking you up and the views of Cape Town and the surrounding areas are breathtaking. The city with Mountains and the ocean makes Cape Town views one of the most beautiful city in the world

Too much fog & mist. Although Table Mountain should be a wonderful excursion, it is almost always covered in mist. After two hours on the top, we had seen nothing of the view down. Additionally we were all wet, as if we had been out in a summer rain. If you go, make sure to take a raincoat and hat.
Table Mountain. Table mountain is my back garden. I walk on and up it twice a week and never tire of its wonders.The climbs are on excellent rock, the walking paths well maintained and I love it.
One of seven wonders of the world. Brilliant views and nature. Rotating platform cable ride to top and nice friendly stand for a coffee at the top.

Awesome views of Cape Town. Must visit if you are in Cape Town. The views are amazing. The cable car ride up is fast and enjoyable. You can spend the day at the top hiking around. Walking up and/or down is also an option.

What a view. Table Mountain was calling to me the moment we arrived in SA. So prominent and magnificent a view on the skyline I can't see how you wouldn't want to go climb it every week. The ascent is not too tough dependent upon the weather and much like many of the walks in the area, the people are always friendly.I took the cable car down to the bottom with the family which was a little disappointing by comparison but that may have been the endorphins talking.Overall I would most definitely recommend it and I advise to get there early! As traffic and parking is a nightmare around the entrance but to be fair parking is a bit of a nightmare all over Cape Town.

Good when clouds lifted. Very efficient cable car service. Clouds came and went, so it was misty at the top at first. There are several trails on the top, so you could spend a whole day there. Souvenir shop was a bit crowded, but had a number of interesting things to buy. Most people go first thing in the morning, so go later to avoid queues

Breathtaking views of Cape Town and beyond. We were lucky to have a clear day, slightly out of season for our trip up Table Mountain. The views from the top are amazing and from the top there are extensive trails and walking paths.

The Greatest view in the world. At any point in Cape Town, you this beautiful sight of the Table Mountain, on a very clear day you can see the restaurants, etc, however on a cloudy day, this beautiful white blanket covers the mountain, Amazing!!!

Living National Park. A month ago we climbed the mountain from the Constantia Nek side - a hike that is vey popular with the locals - old and young alike . The hikes can bea gentle for the elderly walking their dogs and as tough for trail runners . 3 Weeks ago I ran an 8.4 km trail on the same side of the Table Mountain with my son - we ended up in Kirstenbosch Gardens - the aromas was amazing. So it's a living National Park enjoyed by many everyday.

Great Views. I know it sounds silly saying this is a tourist trap, but it is! I mean the views are absolutely stunning, but there were kids running around all over the place and was very noisy when I visited.

Going up. The cable car is really lovely as the floor turns 360 degrees while you going up which means everybody gets a chance to take photo's.The view is spectacular. Worth the money. If you have a return ticket don't throw it away as then you will have to walk down.

Bucket List Item. I know others have said it but this is one of the best views ever. When it is clear the view goes for miles but even with some cloud cover draping across part of the mountain, it is spectacular. Go up late in the afternoon to get fabulous sunset views.

So amazing, my heart is here. I love Table Mountain, you don't realise how high you are until your up there. Makes you love Cape Town even more - took the cable car up there but I am hiking up next time (October) I love this damn country

Bloody cold. The cable car up is brilliant. It turns 360 degrees as you are going up which is brilliant for photos. There is a good restaurant at the top - bit pricey - but I cant say more than that as I was in a great big bloody cloud when I was up there.

World class in all respects. Great cable car takes you up to a huge flat mountain top. There is a very long walk around mostly level (some poor footing). The views are amazing. But be warned. There can be huge crowds. The cable car closes if there is a heavy wind, and the mountain is probably totally covered in clouds most days, with clouds coming up quickly, in which case no view. If you want some really challenging hiking or fairly challenging technical climbing, skip the cable car.

Don't miss it. Table Mountain ! The nice hike to discover the landscape around Capetown. There is a path which start under the cablecar. u'll need one and half hour hiking....but only 5mn by cablecar !

ON Top of the Earth. What can you say, Views to die for, unless you are abseilling
Fantastic service, minimal waiting. Truly a New Wonder of the World
A must!. Amazing place to spend few hours. If you have time and are fit enough, climb it (around 3 hours) and come back down thru cable way. Feels really good and the view is stunning!

Truly world class. We were unable to visit for the first two days due to bad weather - a risk at this time of year. The third day was superb, little wind, "unlimited" visibility and just right temparature.!
Amazing views. the views are amazing especially at night. well worth a visit. There is a cable car which can take you up and down. we drove and really enjoyed it.
Beautiful views, obviously. Beware of load shedding because if that's going on, you are stuck on that mountain for hours before you will be able to come back down (with the cablecar)!

A must do. If the weather is perfect just drop all your stuff and grab a taxi and GO asap, you will never forget this view and feeling,
Book a ticket from your hotel to the fast track and save time
Best day ever

Up there with the best of them.... Like Yellowstone, Yosemite... Table Mountain often draws the masses, but it is so stunningly beautiful, that it really does not matter. Amazing views, great hikes, and one of my favorite NP's in the world. I've been to several dozen across the globe & Table Mountain is right at the top.
It's a no brainer if you are in Cape Town.
A must when you're in Cape Town.. Fantastic view! Even before you get to the very top. The restaurant there is so-so, nothing wrong with it but nothing special either.

Platteklip Gorge. Hike up Platteklip Gorge. The steep steps give you a good workout for about 2 hours, but the view was breath-taking. Be sure to have shoes with lots of grip, walking stick and take plenty water and maybe a sweet thing or 2...bananas help you for energy. It is something every person needs to try :) Walk up and take Cable way down...much easier! Have fun.

Wild life at its best. Enjoy the scenery and wild life at Table Mountain national park. However you are strongly advised not to feed nor touch the animals but watch and enjoy their company. The animals seem to be used seeing people and have adjusted to the presence of humans.
Amazing Sights. Impressive views, take the cable car to the top and walk the perimeter. The Mountain turns the most amazing colors during dusk and dawn.
spectacular, must do. This is one of those things you have to do. The ride up in the cable car is amazing, the views breathtaking. Make sure you go on a clear day otherwise don't bother.

Amazing Views!. It was an amazing way to spend a gloomy day in Cape Town. We were above the clouds and it was a breath taking view. We were up there for about 3 hours the first hour was cloud at the bottom and then once the clouds burnt off we could see everything, the v&A waterfront, seafront, the harbour, as well as the entire coast line. It was really sunny up there, warm enough to walk around in our t-shirts. there is a restaurant up there with great food. Fantastic afternoon.

Table mountain views are incredible. This is a must do in Cape Town. We took the tram up, but two of our friends who hiked up the gorge said it was a fun hike as well. Once up top, it is so peaceful, and there are paths that you can take to walk around the top. The views are breathtaking. There is also a restaurant where you can grab a bite to eat while enjoying the views.

Table Mountain is a must if you visit the Cap!. Well organised tourist attraction.. Orderly queues and quick...well quick when you see the length of the queues anyway. The cable car itself is huge and the view all the way up as the car itself turns..slowly I might add..At the top it is a huge area to walk and to view across many many miles. Great café/restaurant, busy.. but that is because the attraction is so popular.. If in Cape Town again, I would go again..

Great views. Great place to overlook Cape Town. We did not go up the mountain this time and had done so in the past. Great views when looking back up to the mountain form town, especially when the clouds are between it and Lions Head.

Walking on the Table Top-Table Mountain.. One cannot visit Cape Town and not visit Table Mountain as it is what defines Cape Town. It's dominating presence is felt throughout the city and it seems that everything happens around this mountain that appears to be flat on the top resembling a table. If you are a tourist then I would suggest The Hop on/Hop off bus tour which goes directly to the mountain from the city and they are quite excellent. There are 2 ways to go up: Either walk the mountain trail or go up the revolving Cable Car (which is also wheelchair friendly). I would not suggest purchasing tickets in advance as the mountain is sometimes closed due to poor weather that is often unpredictable. I would also suggest taking a jacket, gloves and a scarf as it can sometimes be freezing on the mountain. There is a take away/restaurant on the mountain that has good and affordable breakfasts which is real value for money. You definitely need your camera when on top of the mountain as the views are breathtaking and spectacular. Enjoy Table Mountain.

Nature on Cape Towns doorstep. I am a capetonian, and was sick of the city that day, so i decided to hike up Platteklip Gorge. The steep steps give you a good workout for about 1.5 hours, but the view was breathtaking. Be sure to have shoes with lots of grip and take plenty water. It is something every person needs to try :)

Spectacular must see attraction. So worth it. You cannot visit Cape Town without venturing to the top of Table Mountain. The views and the overall experience further confirmed my belief that there is a GOD. It is that spectacular. I visited South Africa using Gate 1 travel and Table Mountain was included. I wasn't excited about visiting the attraction at first but I am so glad it was included or I really would have missed out on an awesome experience.

Fantastic views!. The rotating cable car that takes visitors up to the top of Table Mountain already provides good views, turning to give everyone a chance to see the different perspectives over the city and of the steep mountain side. From the summit itself, views depend very much on the weather. With clear skies, one can see incredibly far; yet even clouds swirling in provide a sense of drama and, on the day I visited, at one point one could look out over the fluffy white clouds below as if in an aeroplane. There are paved pathways meandering across the mountain top and viewing points at various place along the way. There is both a website and an app with regular updates on meteorological conditions to make it easier not to miss visiting this iconic landmark and UNESCO World Heritage Site.

By Cable Car or On Foot, Your Chioce. Tale Mountain National Park can be accessed by foot or easily by Cable car. The views from the top are spectacular. Cape Town is at your feet, Robben Island is in the distance and the world is spread before you! Park access can close at any time because of clouds, wind or wild weather, so plan an alternate outing, just in case. The cable cars rotate during ascent so everyone's view is good. Walking is for the very fit. It can take 3 or more hours to hike up. The Mountain Park can be hiked in about 3 to 4 days. Day trippers can access trails to view points and will probably spend an hour or two at the top. Restrooms are available. There is a snack shop and shopping, or course!

A must do in Cape Town. There are lots of ways to explore Table mountain. I like to hike up and then take the tram down. There are a few routes, some are a bit tougher than others that require some steep terrain navigation and ropes and chains to pull you up. My favourite route is about a km past the lower tram station. It takes about an hour and a bit to hike up with some amazing views. Once you get to the top there are lots of amazing view points and an opportunity to get some water.
Amazing view. If the weather is clear you will have an amazing view of Cape Town, Signal Hill, Lions head and the V&A waterfront. Definitely worth queing at the cable way!

Cable car to the top of Table Mountain. t is popular to walk all the way to the top, but we preferred the cableway.One thing that is good to have in mind is that you might have to walk down if they have to close the cableway immediately because of the weather. Strong winds and poor visibility on top of the mountain will result in a suspension of services or closing of the cableway. When we got there we want to figure out if it was possible to use the print screen instead of the paper tickets (it’s good to know, since not everyone has a printer available), and it was!The ride from the lover cable station and up to the plateau at the top of the mountain takes a few minutes, and you will be standing on a rotating floor that gives everyone a great view of the city.Arriving at the top at 1.067m above sea level you can check out the different viewpoints, visit curio shops or the restaurant, you can also walk around on walking trails of various lengths.We think the cable car was a bit pricey.

Top Views. Having first taken in the breathtaking views from Table Mountain 6 years ago, I wasn't sure they would have the same impact when we visited in April this year. But I couldn't have been more wrong.We were lucky enough to have 5 gloriously sunny days in Cape Town and arrived around 10am at the pay station. We didn't have to queue for long - maybe 15mins - before we were whisked up in the fabulous rotating cable car. And when we got to the top, we were once again taken aback at how stunning the views Table Mountain provides are. For the less adventurous (me), there are easy walks and wooden platforms jutting out to give views over Newlands and the docks to the left of the cable car exit.To the right, the views over Camps Bay and the rich blue sea beyond show the city in its full glory. There is flora and fauna to look at if you can take your eyes off the views - stunning butterflies and cute lizards and dassies.There is also a more difficult walk which we didn't attempt as I was in flip flops.We allowed about 2hours at the top of the mountain - including having a quick drink in the restaurant - as it was starting to get busy (the sky was clear so the perfect mountain view day) and made our way down again via the cable car. It is possible to walk up and down the mountain, but the cable car is quick, easy and good value. We parked on the lower slopes - there's quite a bit of parking, though from memory, it can be a struggle to find a space later in the day - and easily drove away without queues or fuss.Make Table Mountain an early start to your day and enjoy it without having to wait for a space on the viewing decks

Great for a different view of Cape Town and peninsula. The cable car is cool. It rotates as it rises so you get all the views, but try to get on when the car is not already full and take up a position on the outside. Those stuck in the middle do miss out on the best photo ops.A docent took us on a brief tour of the summit, then left us to explore on our own. Saw several interesting endemic plants and a dassie (mole-like creature related to elephants). Wonderful views, lots of easy-walking paths. Excellent spot for photos of city in one direction and landscape in the other.
Punishing walk (thats good), Great views. The walk was great,, a good challenge.... a bit cold and getting to a clear view at the top seemed hit n miss
Tops. The cable car ride gets you up to the majestic view. We were there when it was cloudy, yet still spectacular views.

A true must-do experience. Very little needs to be said to sell the wonder that is Table Mountain. If this isn't in your itinerary then you have a lot of thinking to do about your life choices. Simply put, this is one of the world's most unbelievable natural icons, both to look at in its towering presence cradling the City below, and to look out from on top. Spectacular views are witnessed in both instances.There are varying ways to get to the top - quickest and most popular being the cable car, which is a joy in itself with its fully rotating cars. You can also hike or drive up with each method offering a different experience of the mountain. However you decide to get there just make sure you do!
"Close to Heaven". Table Mountain is a must.....I have been up three times, and never get tired of the beauty of God's creation.

Beware of the clouds. Every tourist visiting Cape Town hikes or drives up Table Mountain. And so did we. But beware of one thing - the clouds. Nearly every day, Table Mountain is covered in clouds for some time or even the whole day. We started at 8.30am and when we stood in the cable car, still everything was clear. 5min later when reaching the top, it was suddenly covered. And it remained like that for 4h! Thus our recommendation, go very early in the morning with the very first cable car! This improves your chances by a lot (this is also in accordance with the opinion of locals we talked to - unfortunately after our visit;)).
Go early or late to avoid crowds. Although weather will determine when you go - if its been cloudy there will be crowds, as everyone watches when the cable car is open.

If you don't do Table Mountain, you haven't been to Cape Town. We got up Table Mountain on the last morning of our visit to Cape Town. It was too windy for the cable car to operate on the other 2 days. If the weather is good go for it, you may not get another opportunity. Well worth it. We were at the cable car just after 8am when it opens, so avoided the queues that can build up later in the day.
Awsume. After a weather scare we finally made it to the top and it was beautiful. Too many people around but nice place to spend some alone time

a must visit in Cape Town!. Table Mountain is an amazing place to visit especially if the weather is on your side! We had a great walking on top and ended our nice evening with a glass of wine while enjoying the view from this amazing spot. Cableways are very reliable and run on time. They are not overcrowded and provide a good view of Cape Town and surroundings on the way up and down the mountain. Watching the sunset on this spot is a memory you will carry on for life.
An absolute Wonder. Well worth it, best time to go is an hour or two before sunset. Sunset specials in the summer and South Africans get to go for free in their birthday month.
A must see !. The view over Cape Town and its surroundings is amazing: is the weather is good, you can see up to Cape of Good Hope.

Cable Car to heaven. Well not quite perhaps but Table Mountain is very high as everyone knows. Also you hope that the table cloth (clouds) is not on when you visit - and for our time there it wasn't. The views across Cape Town and way beyond are breathtaking.If the cable car Q's are too long (late morning or early afternoon) return at around 4.30pm as we did and you will still be in time to take the last rides. Although we got up quickly (30mins?) it took much longer to get thr cable car back down with so many leaving at dusk. Take very warm clothing with you - when the sun sets it get's very cold indeed.
Beautiful!. Table mountain is a wonder of nature and one of the most beautiful things I've ever seen. Loved walking around there and enjoy all the views.

Beautiful. I absolutely loved going up to Table Mountain, I used the Citysightseeing bus tour and got off at the Table Mountain Cableway. I got up super early, and got the 0820 bus from the V&A Waterfront. There were no queues an hour later when we arrived at the cableway so within a few minutes i was at the top. Wow, the view is breathtaking.

Hike up Platteklip with kids. We did the platte klip hike up with our two kids of 5 and 7. They loved it. One of the highlights of our stay in South Africa.
We did it in less than 2 hours. Also for the little one it was really doable.

Cablecar At Sunset Is The Experience Of A Lifetime. Take the cable-car at Sunset to the mountain summit. You will not believe the landscape, from ocean to cityscape laid out before you, it is an experience you will likely never forget. At the top I recommend enjoying a coffee and sandwich in the warmth of cafe after seeing the many views from the sides of the mountain top.*The summit is always much colder than ground level so wear warm clothes even if it is a sunny day*

A must do. Such an amazing view from the top. Plan to spend sometime exploring at the top. If taking the cable car, check online before arriving for conditions at the top. It can get a bit windy which can stop the cable car. Parking can be a challenge so if your driving come prepared to walk up a bit to the cable car.

Brilliant. Likes - View, walk to Maclear beacon,Cable car ride.Dislikes - absolutey nothingTip- buy tickets online and avoid the queues oh and hike up via platteklip gorge, take cable car down = great day out

Must see destination. Amazing views. It can be a little chilly up on the mountain so take something to cover up with. We could have gone up on any day but we were warned that that is not always the case so if clear go straight up .

Breathtaking. Amazing! An 8th wonder of the world! Easy access to the cable car. A true adventure. Can also take hikes up trails but go with a guide and never alone. The views are unbelievable! A MUST GO
Breath taking. A must for anyone who doesn't have a fear of heights. Brilliant views of the whole Cape. Safe. Fun. Beautiful

Hike the back route if you have time. Always have a guide, here! Ours gave us options, and we chose to start at the gardens, go up Skeleton Gorge, and then across the top to the cable car. a 6 hour trek, with many stops for photos, lunch, and drinks of water.

Warm at ground level but cold at the top. Great views at the top but be aware that high winds (very common) can halt the cable car. Book tickets in advance (even the same day) and try to arrive early to beat the crowds. If you have a return taxi it may be very late due to traffic congestion on the approach to the cable car. This trip is a must.
good day. Really enjoyed table mountain, even though it was very hot in the queue. Stayed there most of the day, plenty to do and see. Good value for money.

Not To Be Missed!. We've hiked in many spots around the world and Table Mountain has been one of the prettiest. Once you've reached the top either by hiking or cable car, the views are unbelievable. Be aware though that if it's a windy day they will sound an alarm for the last cable car down. If you miss it you need to hike down and it takes around 2 hours. The top is a great place to have a picnic lunch or eat at their cafe. The whole tourist area on the top is very clean and well maintained.

Breathtaking. The view once you get to the top of the mountain is absolutely breathtaking. You can see the whole of Cape Town. You need to spend a few hours up there. Great walks, look out for the wildlife. Loved it.
Interesting Mountain Shape. It's not every day that you get to see and go on top of a mountain whose top looks like a table, this place is special and a must-see if you go to South Africa.

The summit of your life. Finishing the day at the top of the mountain was an interesting experience for me and my family. It is definitely recommended for travellers in Cape town and exploring the depths of the vast city. Beautiful structures and lightings of the city can be seen at night where it provides a spectacular view of the city. I definitely recommend during the summer where it has much more to do.

Great hike!. Hard hike but well worth it. The trail has been wonderfully maintained and is in great shape. Plan on 1.5-2.0 hours hiking time. It is about 3,000 feet of vertical. If time is limited, hike up and take the cable car down.

Amazing! Even in the clouds. This was an amazing climb. Due to timings a group of us went up even though it was cloudy, it was still amazing. In fact I'd suggest it. As the mountain takes on an almost mystical fantasy vibe in the thick fog, it's very surreal. If you want a view of CT I'd suggest Lions Head as it only looks like CT when you can see Table Mountain.

Must be done whilst in Cape Town. We walked from the Cable Car to the McClears beacon, it's about a 45 minute walk but well worth doing provided that the skies are blue... Saw some people wearing very unsuitable shoes, would advise are minimum a flat soled basic walking shoe, definately not a place for high heels.....
Of course. a must for everyone visiting Cape Town. I don't know when to og to avoid standing in line for the cableway. We stoon for an hour, but it was well worth it!

Wow. Picked a great day with no clouds and little wind. Enjoyed the walk out to MacLear's Beacon. Saw a puff adder along the way and several Blister Bushes so watch your step! Cable care ride was wonderful, too. Easy to get to using the city bus system.

Table Mountain. Excellent. We purchased tickets in advance in the UK and you get to avoid the queues. If Table Mountain is closed for any reason, i.e. the weather, you can go another day with your ticket or get a refund. Highly recommend.
Just stunning. You must make the journey to the top of the mountain. Try to go on a clear day. The cable car isn't expensive and takes about 5 mins. Watch out for the inquisitive dessi's on the top!

Worth the trip. Table Mt. was well worth the trip. There are panoramic views of the city and water front. The cable ride up provides 360 degree views of the mountain with it's revolving floor. Bring a lunch and enjoy eating above the clouds. Dress warm as it gets quite cold at the top. Breathtaking!!

Table mountain is a must. If you don't visit table mountain you are missing out.The top if the mountain is a beautiful national park not to mention the amazing views!There is a cafe at the top but I would suggest taking a picnic, maybe a bottle of local wine, walk away from the main tourist bit and find a peaceful spot with an amazing view.I definitely recommend buying tickets in advance if you are going up by cable car.We got the cable car up bit decided to hike back down because the queue was ridiculous.We're not avid hikers ourselves but enjoy a challenge. The more experienced will fly down it like it's a nice flat terrain. It's not though, it's rocky and steep and some of the granite is slippy so be careful if you aren't used to it.I was aching like mad the next few days!I would recommend the hike though, it's a beautiful national park and you get a real sense of achievement at the end.

The Heart of the Mother City. Really amazing hiking on Table Mountain National Park....routes ranging (for the moderately fit) from 2 hours (Platteklip), to the whole day - try Nursery Ravine starting in Kirstenbosch Gardens (small entry fee - take student card) and up to the reservoirs, McClear's Beacon (highest point) and down Skeleton Gorge or the contour path - worth ,making your way past the cable car station (particularly if you come up India Venster way) to impress the tourists who took the cable car up ;) Or if you need to replenish food and water supplies as there is nothing else on the park. If you only fancy go one way you can easily buy a single on the cable car - spectacular views over the city,the Atlantic, Hout Bay etc etc etc etc!!!Warning though - always be mindful of your surroundings, stay on the paths as some loose rock areas could give way....sunscreen, hats, food and water....and also check that you don't have an opportunistic fellow following you up or down the routes looking to enhance his fortune!
Table Mountain. Beautiful view and great ride to the top and down again. Great place for photos and seeing Cape Town and Robben Island from up high.

Wonderful Day. Had a wonderful day touring the Cape Peninsular and surrounding areas. We visited the Bolder Penguins and enjoyed a great fish lunch at a beachside restaurant. The scenery is totally breathtaking throughout the area. We will definitely visit again.
Our first visit. We loved the views and interesting landmarks ,I did not like the cable car,but you are up in a flash

When the mist clears. Catch the cable car up and enjoy the views of the city and the lions head. Cafe and shop at the top. Can also walk up if you're relatively fit. When you descend, walk over to Signal Point for spectacular views of Tabke Mountain and the city

Iconic Table Mountain. Fabulous views. We went very early in the morning, in fact we were the first in line. This was great because we avoided a wait. It is a must when visiting Capetown. The gondola is new and very spacious.

Windy but beautiful!. incredible views from the top, super windy and chilly in autumn but so worth a visit! We took the cable car, walking takes about 2 hours one way. You can walk quite far on top of the mountain over the rocks and grass, you can see dassies and birds and, if lucky, the tiny antelopes. The sunset was amazing... Prepare for the cold though!
Lovely Experience. We took the first tram up the Mountain to avoid the queques I would definitely recommend this. The view from the top is amazing definitely worth the trip.
Gorgeous View. A short ride to the top of the Mountain. The view is outstanding. Do it on a clear day .. it's a must !!

Fun / Scary Cable Car ride. Brilliant tour, great scenery from above. Bring snacks with you and plenty of liquids and lots of camera space. A great way to enjoy the peace and quiet. Very romantic up in the mountains.
You have to go,if in Cape Town!. Fortunately got there before other buses,and no wind,but this meant reduced visibility.Some people never get up due to winds

great view of Cape town. Once you have reached the top, by cable car or by foot, the view from there is worth spending a few hours if the weather is clear. Buy the tickets in advance online in order to avoid long lines for the cable car.The whole visit, by cable car, can take about 3 hours if you take the time to walk around on the top of the mountain.The food of the restaurant is not very good.

A must to visit while in Cape Town. Table mounbtain is a great place to visit even if you would have only few hours to spend there. The access to the top is easy and fast. Would suggest buy tickets in advance on the web so to avoid waiting lines. The view from the top is beatifull, and there is a lot of walking trails.

Table Mountain accessibility. My name is Nick Westermeyer. I am a quadriplegic from a gymnastics injury sustained at Michigan State University in April 1991 who is interested in global travel and participating in activities not normally associated with disabled people. I’m currently on an adventure that will explore worldwide handicapped accessibility.
