Many people have travel blogs, but there are none that I know of that come from the vantage point of a wheelchair user going off the accessible path.The mountain is only open when there’s good visibility and light winds. Check the Table Mountain website to see if the cableway is open before going. It’s a 15 minute cab ride from the waterfront to the base of Table Mountain. It’s a short wheel from the ticket booth to the elevator with a slight uphill grade. The elevator takes us to the loading area of the cableway. I’m able to wheel directly from the loading area to the cable car, the surface is flat. During the 5 minute ride the cable car rotates 360 degrees for a view of the mountain, Cape Town and Table Bay. Table Mountain is 3,563 feet above sea level. The exit of the cable car surface is flat. There are several steep hills once at the top. The pavement is very rocky and uneven. There are two hills I need pushed up by my friend Alejandro. Most people in manual wheelchairs would need help up these hills. The area a top the mountain is much bigger than I thought, approximately 2 miles from side to side.It would be difficult to visit Table Mountain in a manual wheelchair by yourself. The most difficult part will be wheeling around the top of the mountain. Of the 2 miles, I was able to wheel 50 yards by myself, with Alejandro’s help I was able to wheel 100 yards. There are also some steps in places making that area not accessible for wheelchairs. There is a restaurant that is accessible but the ramp to the eating area is a little steep. The accessible bathroom is located by the return cable car. The view is spectacular and well worth the trip up. There's not much, if anything to do to make this more accessible having to deal with the natural contour of the mountain. It would be nice if wheelchair users would get a discount since the terrain is difficult to wheel around with areas needing help from an able body person.Photos of Table Mountain can be viewed at http://offtheaccessiblepath.smugmug.com/Africa/South-Africa/Table-Mountain/Table-Mountain/Accessibility wise Table Mountain would receive a 2.5/5 rating.

Spectacular views. Wow what a wonderful exsperience. Th ecable car ride up to teh top of Table Mountain is great and when you get to teh top the views of Cape Town are spectacular. Spent teh whole day there walking and enjoying the views

Table Mountain is a must. Love Table mountain and the view from the top is stunning.The pathways are very interesting as they take you to different areas of the mountain with variation of views and sites.i just think like most things in Cape Town at the moment it is getting too pricey to enjoy these must see places.Even dining out in Cape Town I find the prices in most places are out of hand.If you can afford it, it's a great place to visit.

Best view in town. The cost of the cable car was surprisingly reasonable considering most tourist attractions. Watching the sunset from the summit was incredible but I recommend you allow yourself a minimum of 2 hours to utilise the nature trails to the full extent
BREATHTAKING. The views from the revolving cable car were something else.From the top the views were outstanding..Visit on the first clear day in case it is closed on a windy day later.

can't be missed. absolutely worth it! You can't visit Cape Town without looking at it from Table MOuntain. A bit challenging with small kids...needs to supervise them. Buy tickets online to skip the queue and check their facebook page for opening (it is often closed due to poor whether conditions). Amazing!!
Worth it.... Great view and something to do once for sure. Well worth it. View, nature, rocks and a cold beer at the top....
A Must Do in This Wonderful Country. As a tourist you must do and frankly cannot miss out if you're staying in Cape Town. Book in advance on the internet to beat any queues.
Beautiful views. Beautiful views over Cape Town and down the cape. Easy walks on the top. Make sure it is a clear day.

A must to see, the view is spectacular and the ride to the top is amazing. The gondola rotates 360 degrees both going up and down and once you get to the top it's heaven.The wait for the ride is too long.

A lifetime dream come true. What a place. Totally unique, if in the summer beware of lengthy queues (I queued for 1.15mins). Get their early.Bit of course, its worth it, especially on a day like mine, no a cloud in the sky, roasting hot, perfect conditions to go up, not perfect for waiting, its kinda a hot and not a lot of shade. Also beware of inconsiderate queue jumpers, those I saw were Russian and knew exactly what they were doing, shame on them.The views are everywhere on the net, but NOTHING can replace being there. Its magic, don't miss it.
Fantastic view when weather permits. good hiking on top of the mountain, going in the morning is the best, booking over internet avoid long queues

An awesome experience. We spent the day on Table Mountain in February 2014. During our return visit to South Africa another visit to the top of Table Mountain was a must for us. Both trips we had brilliant sunshine with no wind - perfect. Please don't rush this visit, spend the day there and potter because there is so much to see and do. The views are awesome and you certainly feel you are on top of the world. A wonderful place to visit and with a cafe there you are never short of something to eat, drink and relax when you want to. A third trip to South Africa - yes, Table Mountain will be on the list again. It's a must.

Must see in Cape Town. Beautiful views of Cape Town and surrounding area from Table Mountain. You can walk on the top for short or long walks and there are guided tours as well. Great photo opportunities from the mountain. Ride up in cable car is also exciting. Get there as early as possible in am as lines get very long as the day goes on. Hop on, Hop off city bus tour is good way to get there. From Aquarium starting point, it's the 7th stop and you get there just after 9am if you take the first bus.

Views were great when we weren't in clouds. Nice ride up and interesting on top...the views were wonderful when the clouds had a break.
The tram operators really fill the cars. People weren't used to the floor of the tram car rotating and it made for some crowding.

Great experience and breathtaking view. A must when visiting Cape Town. The views are spectacular.
Make sure to go early or the lines can be very long.

must see and hike the top. this is one of the things you need to do if you visit cape town. also i recommend you take half a day for it also to have time to walk around and hike on the top. what we did is a small picking at the top with nice view and nice weather.

Spectacular View. Hike up to the base of the mountain and take the suspended cable tram up to the top of the mountain. Spend the day hiking around and enjoying the views of Cape Town, Robben Island and the coast. Have lunch and try the ostrich stew, it's very good.

The best location for some breathtaking views of Capetown!. You have two options, walking to the top, or choosing the cable car, we went for the second option, although we were temped to try the challenging route. Get tickets before you go, ques are extreme, and by that I mean you could be hours lining up. Make sure to chose a clear day if possible, wouldn't want to Ruin the view from the top!

Breathtaking views of Cape of Good Hope. About an hour drive past Simons Town is the national park entrance. We saw our first baboons here! One sat on the roof of the car and watched us through the sun roof! What an experience. It just sat there looking around. Next were our first ostriches. They are huge. Then, the Cape!! You catch the fenicular rail up the hill, to the fabulous views. Walk up to the top it is well worth it. We then had lunch at the Two Oceans Restaurant, next to the car park.There is a take away cafe, but we sat outside, with brilliant view again . The meal was absolutely first class. Pea risotto was delicious as was the bridled hake. Yummy yummy.
Table Top Views. After getting the cableway t the top of Table Mountain and the National Park the views on a clear day a simply jaw dropping. Well worth any queuing.

Breathtaking Views!. On our first day in Cape Town, we decided to take advantage of the clear day and go up to Table Mountain. We’re glad we did because for the rest of our trip, the mountain was covered in clouds! The cable car going up to the top was inexpensive and the floor rotated so everyone was able to have a chance to see all the views. The views from the top were breathtaking. We spent a couple hours up there just walking around and taking in the sights. While we were up there, we saw some dassis (large but cute rodents) running around.This is a must-see if you’re in Cape Town!

Table Mountain - get tickets before you go!. Beautiful and a great way to see Cape Town. Loved the 360 cable car. Although, I wish there were more cable cars because we spent more time waiting in line to get down than actually walking around at the top. Also, experienced load shedding while waiting in line to go up, but not much you can do about that. Definitely buy tickets online before going because the line to buy tickets there can get pretty long.

Gorgeous views and a must see attraction.. As with all such attractions, the weather dictates your experience. Went on a sunny clear day and the views across the sea and Robben island were fantastic. Went up by cable but came down hiking.

Best views in the world?. On our tour was a coupled who owned a tour company in the USA and told us that Table Mountain had the best views in the world.... they were correct! Depending on the weather the views are spectacular, bring a light jacket no matter the weather because it can change quickly on top. The walking is easy and many 80 year olds in our group had no problems.

Just impressive. We spent 5hrs walking this amazing site, The views are just amazing.Make sure you get to the departure terminal very early and buy your tickets on line.All the tour buses turn up about 9-10 and you can get stuck in line for hours.
Not bad, but just not 'great'. Very weather dependent, and I chose badly, going at the start of the austral winter. Not the attractions fault, but do not book ahead unless you have a crystal ball.

heavenly views. Having tried to visit twice in the past, but the mountains was in cloud. It was a joy to see the sunshine and a blue sky, After the ride up it was wonderful to see the views out to sea, including Robbin Island.

Just used the cable car. We didn't have time to hike up so we just used the cable car, which was remarkably fast once we were on-board, but there was a bizarre queuing system that featured lifts, waiting pens and ticket checks.Obviously the view from Table Mountain is spectacular on a clear day, but remember that it can be a lot colder than the temperature at sea level. I would like to have attempted the hike but it did look quite taxing so allow yourself plenty of time and bring lots of water!

Don't miss this.. We rode the cable car - breathtaking. We arrived to a cloud covered mountain view, but as the clouds cleared, we were treated to a beautiful view of the Cape Town landscape and the coast. Don't miss this!
Must do it. It's a short ride up but with a rotating floor you have fantastic views and it's a must whilst in Cape Town - lovely walks and views from the top.

Deserves all the compliments!. What can I say that hasn't been said before?Just visit it. After all - its is one of the new 7 world's wonders, and when you will be there, you will understand why.We went on a weekday, later afternoon, and it wasn't busy at all. We saw the amazing sunset, and took the last cable car down. Perfect!

Postcard beauty. On a perfect sunny day, you can't beat the beauty and serenity of the site. Great rotating cable car ride to the top with unbelievable views in every corner! Truly a majestic site, not to be missed. Easy to see why Capetonians are so proud of their Table Top Mountain!

Views!!!. Cable care was not that busy but once you leave the station the journey was nice with a revolving floor so everyone got to see the amazing views. It was just amazing at the top as the view was stunning.

Breathtaking sight, best place to be literally "Blown away". Only deducting a star because the cable car stopped working and we had to climb all the way down. Please be careful in case you are traveling with an elderly or a physically unfit person as I hear the cable car shuts quite frequently because of strong winds.

Magnificent sunset!. Our third trip up table mountain in 10 years, and it's still amazing! This time we decided to make the trip in the afternoon, having pre-booked the tickets so we didn't have to queue for them. In fact there was no queueing at all. We arrived just before 4 pm, had a good walk/scramble right around the top of the mountain, then sat and watched as the sun sunk below the horizon over the sea. It was a lovely sunny clear day, and still quite warm when we got up the mountain, but cool/cold by the time the sun sank. Remember to take warm sweaters and/or coat. A truly magnificent sight. Even if you've been up before would recommend a sunset trip.

top of the world. a great day on the table top (need to be a good clear day)... the mountain top provides excellent views and its also provide the thrill seekers to repel from the side of the mountain to experience a different angle. those who want to take it easy, a leisurely walk a stop at the coffee shop will is more than enough to spend few hours in this one of the natural wounder of the world

fantastic views. As the name tells, it is just like a table on the top of the hill.Very vast with clean loos, nu\ce restaurant,curio shop and we could see a few exotic small animals.The weather keeps on changing very quickly..The view of the Atlantic ocean and city of Cape Town is simply mind blowing.

breathtaking. Definitely do this while you are in Cape Town - the views are incredible! There are also many hiking trails of various difficulty levels. You could easily spend 1-2 hours at the top of the mountain.

Amazing views. Travelled by cable car to the top to see the most amazing views.Well worth the 45 minute queue for tickets. There is shelter from the sun with a fine mist of water every so often which had a tremendous cooling effect.
absolute nature. take a drive past the busy cable station of Table Mountain to see the flora and fauna and fabulous views of Cape Town
Must Do!. What a view! I couldn't believe how high up we were and the amazing panorama view. I would've liked a bit more time to explore some of the longer trail walks.
Must Go. Perfect view, amazing sightseeing while family, couple or friends. Its an expensive experience, but worth what you are paying for.

a must do!. a land mark and a must do, the best view EVER!! If you have a few hours spare, walk around , have a picknic, but just go! even if you just have an hour to relax in the fresh air and appreciate nature, do it!

Absolute must in Cape Town!. An icon of South Africa! Fantastic views, great for walking. The weather can be a bit of a worry. If it's windy, foggy, cloudy (low cloud)...the cable car to take you up and down...will be closed.There are many walking trails to hike up the mountain however locals suggested not doing this alone due to security concerns. I didn't risk it. It's a fantastic place...quite exposed at the top and weather conditions can be different from sea level in the city. It can much cooler and windy.The cafe up there is good. The surface is mostly rocky and uneven..if you plan to explore. I love the place!
need to be seen. Need to be seen. Go on a clear day. we were lucky as we could go on top of the mountain and see the clouds coming in over the bay. what an experience.
Interesting experience. nice place and one of the most visited places in Cape Town . A high place with the clouds under it depends on the wind . A bit cold but in general nice

AMAZING. after the wait at the funicular you will be AMAZED of the views there up on the "peak". WONDERFUL!! it is indeed one of the new natural wonders of the world.i had a better feeling then at the grand canyon!!! too bad that the restaurants there do not have good views...you may feel there the KING OF CAPETOWN / AFRICA / PLANET!!!!AMAZING!!! a thing not to be missed. yet returning we had a poor experience with a taxi driver that cheated us but...this is as extra. over all...PERFECT!!!
Corny but GO !. Breathtaking and could have stayed all day ... so much bigger and space to wander and get some quiet spots to enjoy countless stunning views

Beautiful view of the entire area. The tram ride was lovely and the view from the top of Table Mountain is spectacular. If you are willing to take a 30 minute circular walk, you get a 360 degree view of the entire area.

Don't miss it!. If you book the open top bus tour - this will take you up to the base of Table Mountain, where you can get the cable car to the top. You can book your tickets on line and have the open for up to two weeks (as the weather is sometimes unpredictable and access isn't always available). Most people's advice is - if its a clear day, then don't waste time and make sure you get up there! The views are amazing and its so easy to walk around the top. Our only moan was that we had to queue for an hour for the cable car!

Incredible experience. Not something you can easily describe but a definite must do. Not overly commercialized.. The views were breathtakingly beautiful. No noisy groups just a peaceful afternoon soaking up the beauty of the cape town "mother"

Watch the cloud level before setting out if you can. Well worth it, take the free tour around the top, interesting.Views good if you catch inbetween the cloud on a cloudy day. Pre buying tickets will save queing time.We got a taxi as parking seemed all along the road so could be a fair walk up hill if hot. Taxis available on leaving.
Not to be missed. Such a fun adventure to ride a cable car up the mountainside and arrive to see the incredible views and all the people enjoying this natural wonder.

Stunning views, breath-taking. We caught the cable car up which is a different car to the previous one. It felt safer but there is no way to sit down and when the car moves the floor rotates so you cannot hold on which is a little un-nerving when you have balance problems. It doesnt take long however about 5 minutes and when you step out of the cable car the views are breath-taking. There are plenty of walking paths signposted so you can have a little trek and see different views. You can also abseil down if you like. There are refreshments available at the top which are very good and you can even have a cold beer whilst looking at the view. I would highly recommend spending 2-3 hours there, its so lovely.

Come on, it's Table Mountain, you don't need a review you need an excuse NOT to go. On bustled track,to metal cage, the locals up,to pay homageto dassee watch, and cracker chew,they brought a friendto see the viewon coffee bought,did they debate,the mother city's coming fatebut leaving thenthey bid fair-well,and later to their friends did tellthat what they fealt,and what they sawwas less of sight,and more of aweAnd so they left with a new yearn,that one day soonthey would return.

Breathtaking Scenery. To get up to the Table Mountain on a wonderful sunny day is an experience not to miss. You can see different species on top. The scenery is wonderful and breathtaking. Sometimes the clouds can heap together at the top blocking the vision. It is a must see experience for the travellers visiting Cape Town & Area.

Great, but very crowded so best to go early!. My experience with Table Mountain was a little mixed; we decided to hike up but got a late start, began to climb Plattekip Gorge (what we understood to be the shortest trail) around noon, and finally turned around due to a lack of time and the broiling heat. That could have been avoided if we had: 1) gone earlier when it was cooler; 2) known where to go; we were dropped off via taxi where the cable cars board, but had to walk on the street for another 20 mins to reach the mouth of the trail. After the abortive hike, my husband and daughter returned and took the cable cars up, avoiding the long lines by getting there around 8:30. They had a glorious time and reported that there was plenty of opportunity for walking at the top. (I was working and could not accompany them.) BUt if I had it to do over, I would have either prepared for a proper hike, or planned to summit via cable car and get my exercise at the summit. Definitely an amazing destination!

Great walk up. We walked up table mountain, via the Platteklip Gorge, it takes about an hour and half. The walk is not particularly difficult, although the day we went up it was very hot and the first thirty minutes was hard work as it was so hot. The route starts out about a mile after the cablecar. Make sure you take enough water with you for the walk. We came back via the cablecar, which was extremely busy.

Gorgeous Day. I wasn't excited for this. I had a preconceived notion that it would just be another long line to see things from up high like the space needle in Seattle, the Sears Tower in Chicago, or Burj Khalifa in Dubai. I was wrong. The day was exceptional and there was a lot more space to walk around than i expected. Tip: buy your ticket online so you only have to que once for the cable car and then take the hop on/hop off bus up there for easy transit.
Take to the walking tracks. A wonderful morning can be spent walking the trails on the top of the mountain.Breathtaking views and you get the chance to stop and take it all in at your leisure.

Worth the wait!. Although there was a huge line for the cable car, due to perfect weather (sunny, warm and no wind!) it was definitely worth the wait. The view was spectacular, lots to see and do, good facilities at the national park. This includes a beautiful rangers cottage where we stayed overnight called the 'Overseers Cottage'. We hiked 2.5 hours from the cable car to the cottage and spent the night under the stars. Just perfect.

What a hike !. We went to Table Mountain on a really clear day, which is necessary for the amazing view. We went up with the cable way, and we hiked down again. This was difficult, but we had a lot of fun :)

Experience is weather dependent. We were in cape town in the fall and quickly discovered that your experience is completely dependent on the quickly changing weather. We visited Table Mountain the first day that we arrived because we called and heard that the cable car that transports you to the top was open (as it is closed when it is too windy). The price for the cable car is a bit steep but if you have student ids you can get a discount. Once we reached the top we had good visibility for about 10 minutes and then the rain clouds set in and it got very wet and cold (very quickly). We planned to return another day for better views but didn't have a chance as the cable car was closed for the next couple of days of our trip (due to bad weather).
Hiked up the gorge. Very difficult, but worth it at the top! Bring more water than you think you'll need and try to go early before the sun starts beating down.
Great!. If you are looking for the best views of the city and landscape, best to get into the cable car and head up :)
Table Mountain is tops. Awesome view as far as the eye can see. Amazing and breathtaking! Had my wedding reception there. So picture perfect
BEST!. I dont know if it was our lucky day, but we had the most amazing day, no ques, no wind, no cold.. just an excellent trip to table mountain!

Awesome View. I am not a fan of heights and had no trouble at all riding the cable car up to the top of Table Mountain. It is a really quick ride up and down the mountain. Be prepared and dress warmly. It was a warm day but at the top of the mountain it was very windy and cold. Plan for the beginning of your vacation because it was closed often due to high winds while we were there.
A must do. Breathtaking views, gondola ride - and long waits (try to get there early AM on a clear day....our wait was about an hour). A must do when in Cape Town.

A must do. Iconic land mark of Cape Town and a must do. Long queues standing in the sun, so get there early and take water and sun tan lotion. If you know you are doing it during your stay, book on line as you well be in a shorter faster separate queue. Also check the website daily to see if it is open and at what time. If you see clouds on it (known as the table clothe) or it is windy, it will be closed. Kids loved exploring on top (aged 9 & 6) with plenty of good paths for them to explore safely. Stunning views of the city and surrounding areas can be had.

A Natural Wonder. Quite simply a stunning place to visit with breathtaking views.Arrive early for the cable car to avoid long queues and spend a couple of hours at the top by taking one of the longer walks around the summit.

..the iconic place in Cape Town... ..as long as you can endure a cable car that takes you right to the top of the mountain you will not be disappointed..the park has been very well laid out for the thousands of visitors..food outlets and shopping are available - at reasonable costs..the views are stunning..plenty of wildlife to spot and photograph..there was nothing to dislike!..

What an experience!. We decided to hike Table Mountain rather than take the cable car and I am so glad that we did. The hike took us [four adults and three children aged 7, 7, 9] two hours including a couple of breaks to catch our breath and sip water. We started out early to avoid the most intense heat and made it to cloud level before the sun was at its hottest.Felt like a major achievement when we reached the top and views en route and at top made the whole thing very worthwhile.We took the cable car back down although you can walk it.

AMAZING views and a wonderful experiance. A must do!. We hiked up from Plateklip gorge. While the temperature was a bit too hot out, it was well worth the effort put in. (we did take the tram down)Once on top the views are fantastic, you can see for miles.there are many different trail to choose from to suit your needs, all of which are well marked.If you want a bite to eat there is a great little food place with places to sit plus a view.

Was hesitant at first, but loved every moment. Has to be on top of your to do list when visiting Cape Town.Table Mountain's views are amazing - you have a option of hiking up about an hour and a half or the rotating cable car.a shop and a restaurant selling some goodies up top.
Fabulous. Liked everything, mainly the marvelous view over Cape and the coast and above all on sunset seeing the town getting lighted.

Must do! If you visit Kaapstad then you cannot miss table mountain. If you visit Kaapstad then you cannot miss Table mountain.It is magnificent and astonishing. Even on a Cloudy day it is mystic!The cable that takes you to the top is safe, fast and beautiful
Must do. Even though it is not cheap, it is a must see, you have a great view al around Cape Town. Just remember to take a jacket, it's much colder up there then on sea level!

tabale mountain. very beutiful and can be seen from city and beach is belownice experience to be with clouds and passing clouds,walking on pathway on hills is nice.many photo points lift is nice to reach top of mountain

A Must See. Go early to avoid the Gondola lines, as this is the most visited park and attraction in Cape Town. From the top of Table Mountain one can see for miles around and have the very best view of Cape Town city. One can spend hours taking the many hiking trails and enjoying the 360 degree vistas . A great place for photos.

Outstanding. My son and I went up and down with the cable car, we spent a good couple hours on the mountain walking around and doing a short hike there are so many different views and they are all magnificent. Do not miss going up the mountain if you are in Cape Town.
fantastic view!!. you need to go to table mountain when it is a clear day and not too windy! we had to be patient to get back on the cable car, we had to wait on the queue for about 1 hour
An amazing experience. This was certainly an experience to remember. The views were incredible......but you really must walk up!

Amazing experience. The day was great and clear, we enjoyed it a lot.
Great ice cream on the top, friendly staff and helpful.
Superb Views. Table Mountain defines Cape Town and a visit to the top is a must. The views are simply breathtaking!

Stunning but get there early!. The queues for the cable cars can build very quickly and whilst they were already 45 minutes when we arrived at 9.00, by 10am they were over 3 hours!
Pre-purchase your ticket to save some time and take sun cream.

Stellar views. Views and the cable car operator were phenomenal.
Book on line - preferably on the day to avoid queues and cancellation
Beautiful coastline, stunning scenery. We knew the scenery was going to be good, but this exceeded expectations. Lots of birds, some animals. Amazing beaches.

Windy!!. Amazing views Table Mountain, however I didn't consider the wind. I wore shorts and a tank top and froze!! (during their summer on a hot hot day). So layer up, or bring layers, even if its hot at the bottom of the mountain.
Great views from Table Mountain. I would not miss the trip up to Table Mountain if you are in Cape Town. On a clear day the view are spectacular.

Great for walking or cycling. Our VBT bike tour group cycled on the trails and it was great. Others walking dogs or jogging. Some of the park had been burned from a recent forrest fire, very sad. Very scenic and entrance is free.

Early winter jewel. I suspect that in the summer this would be pretty grim with high queues, a packed cable car and fights to get to the best photo opportunity points up top. However we were there in April and suffered none of these problems as we went up at midday. There is the opportunity to walk a long way on the summit and you could in this way escape the crowds even in the summer. The views are stupendous and if cloud drifts in and out you get varied aspects. The cafe up there is very ordinary but you're not up there to eat. It can be cold even when it is hot in the City.

Hike is totally worth it. The hike up Table Mountain is totally worth it, so if you're capable enough to avoid taking the cable car up, you should absolutely hike it up. It's kind of a grinding hike - really just straight uphill for 2 hours or 2 and a half hours depending on how fast you can move, but I would imagine that if you're physically capable of climbing you'd do yourself a disservice by copping out and taking the cable car up. Views from the top were amazing and it was a really, really great day spent hiking up and taking in the views from the top. Highly, highly recommend it...for bragging rights more than anything!

a world landmark. One of the most beautiful spots in the world. Every part of the mountain is beautiful. The slopes and its suburbs, the road skirting the base, with its proteas and stunning views, as well as the cable car and the national park on top of the mountain.

Make sure you book in advance!. We had 3 full days staying at the Waterfront and were very keen to go to Robben Island. On arriving at the ticketing office we were told they were booked out on every trip for 3 days, so we missed out. The only reason we rate it poor, was because it was lack of availability, and no knowledge that to book in advance was wisest, otherwise I'm sure we would have been delighted to go.

Beautful. Wonderful scenery, lots of animals to see . Best time to visit is early morning To avoid the coaches, My tour of the cape peninsula was amazing and the company tour driver (Ilios) was very informtive and entertaining.

A great place to walk but big!. When you get to the top of the cable car there are lots of walks but if you are going far you must be prepared. You can walk to Kirstenbosch or to Constantia Nek or down table mountain [or up if you wish!] The most unusual thing on the top is the waterworks railway museum!

Beautiful views! A definate Must!. The birds eye view over Cape Town is breath taking! Beautiful walks. For the more sporty you can hike to the top but do this only in groups, you could easily get mugged if alone.
Family views. The tour was amazing I didn't want it to end! Yet it was An amazing site seeing for adults, yet lots of queuing for children

Well Worth A Visit, Spectacular Views. Probably a must for most visitors to Cape Town and well worth it for on a sunny day you can see for miles with the Atlantic to one side, the Cape to the south and False Bay to the East. The views of the city give you an idea of how well situated this place is in the natural landscape and you can see well beyond into the near winelands towards Stellenbosch. The top is of course fairly flat but wear walking shoes and don't linger too long in the afternoon or you will queue to get down. If you are not happy in a cable car, don't go unless you want to walk it which is only for the young and the very fit!
Great in many ways. Went three times and all were different due to time of day,clouds etc...great experience and staff .
Great view. Pick your day/time to avoid the cloud.Consider early morning -just look up the hill to check! nice restaurant at the top. .
Beautiful view of a beautiful city. I have traveled in about 20 different countries in the last 4 years and Table Mountain is in the top 5 of things that I have seen that I think are very special.

What a view. The local vegetation called fynbos is a very sensitive echo system and is very unique.
From table mountain to signal hill and lions head you will have breathtaking views of the city the coast, Robin island and the mountain.
Wonderful!!. A well looked after and well planned reserve. Lydia and I were fortunate enough to spend the day there and if we are ever in Capetown again, would do it all over.

A view to make you think..... The view both of and from Table mountain is undoubtedly breath-taking! It never seizes to spark an excitement. Naturally beautiful, it provides the opportunity to reflect on the world below you. As a south African you spot historical landmarks, such as the Robin Island, district 6, and the Harbour. All historical in there own way. As a local it is a little pricy, but as a tourist from UK, USA, EU the exchange rate makes it well both the few pounds/dollars/Euros. It is very different to the rest of SA so well worth a visit!

View of a lifetime !!. The whole trip to Cape town was worth this one view. Memorable place. had a nice little cafe on top of the mountain and also all required services. I would advise anyone capable to hike the mountain as the experience was unreal.
Not so much interesting.... ... I was expecting more from Table Mountain.Ok it's a good point of view on the city of Cape Town. No more.

Take the hike or take the tram, but go. We took the tram to the top of Table Mountain and spent about 2 hours hiking along the top. While up there, the clouds would "spill" over the mountain, then clear up. Beautiful...it looked like a waterfalls of clouds spilling over the top! Best to get there 1st thing in the morning. Check to make sure tram is running as wind will halt it from ascending to the top...even on a clear day.

Incredible Views. I'm one that loves breathtaking views, and the top of Table Mountain does not disappoint. As others have mentioned, Platteklip Gorge is a great way to go up. You should be in decent condition. You will get winded going up this way. It's not an easy, relaxing hike up a mountain. I play hockey a couple times a week and feel that I am in decent shape but had to rest every 10 minutes. However, the challenging trip to the top is eclipsed by the most amazing views of the mother city. If you decide to hike up, bring plenty of water. My wife and I each went through 2 bottles during the climb. And if you don't feel like climbing back down, you can purchase the ticket on the cable car at the top of the mountain, so that way you can gauge how you feel when you get up there.

Needs to be seen to be believed.. You have to get up early to beat the crowds, but it's definitely worth it. The views of Cape Town and the surrounding landscape from that altitude are stunning. Take binoculars, food and a good camera and make sure that you're wearing comfortable shoes.

Amazing. It's a WOW thing!!!! It's WOW to get to the Top! It's WOW when you get there! And it's WOW to come down again! The cable cart journey is only 3-4 minutes time but it's something you won't forget in you entire life. That journey is amazing when you come over to the top and also when you come down to the base. Do not stress yourself looking for the best place in the cart to see the views - the cart floor turns along the way, so you can see 360º. The views from the top of the Table Mountain are also magnificient! You will see Cape Town from a different perspective.This is one of the 7 Wonders of the World - so, do not miss it!!!

Definitely A Do NOT Miss Attraction. We came with a tour guide, who pre-purchased our tickets and dropped us off at the entrance, which meant we literally walked straight to the gondola, which was just arriving. Had we driven up we would have parked on the street about 1 mile from the entrance and if we didn't have pre-paid tickets we would have stood in the queue at the ticket office.Therefore, we highly recommend purchasing tickets online and do not drive - if not on a tour, take the HoHo bus, which has a stop at the entrance.The gondolas are amazing and the floor actually turns so you see in every direction going up and coming down. They also have some seats for those unsteady on their feet. The view from up top is amazing, but ensure you check the weather to ensure it is clear. We adjusted our tour sequence to let the AM fog burn off before heading up.They also have a restaurant, however we did not sample or even check out the menu, so unable to comment. Way too busy walking along the top. Around the cable car station the paths are level and well maintained, being easy for everyone to walk on. Their are a few stairs as well. Further away from the station the path becomes a walkway on rocks, which is rather uneven, but still easy to walk on.We spent an excellent hour up top and could easily have stayed for at least double that time.

The view of a lifetime. The view from table mountain is unlike anything I have seen before. It is beautiful. I would recommend that people hike up the mountain. It might not be easy, but it is well worth it!
great to visit. Brilliant definitely memorable be prepared for the queue for the cable car we waited 2 hours but worth the wait if you can book online your tickets will save you time.

Stunning! Must see!. By far my favorite place in Cape Town. I would highly recommend hiking up to maximize your experience. A friend and I did the Platteklip Gorge hike to the summit, which was challenging but doable (start early!) The views from the summit are unbelievable. Total bucket list moment!

Spectacular. If you are in Cape Town, you must go to the top. The views are spectacular! We chose to hike up to the top. We took the most difficult route. The hike time was about two and one half hours, but well worth it. If you are not into hiking, you can take the cable car to the top. I think it was maybe $5 or $10. When you are at the top, they have a pretty nice play to eat and grab a drink. I guess I never really realized how beautiful the beaches in Cape Town were. When at the top, you can see how pretty the water is. The colors are amazing. We were able to take some wonderful pictures that we will always treasure.
Must do in Cape town. Although it was foggy the day we visited , it was amazing. Fantastic view and pleasant weather. If the weather is cloudy don't go there early in the morning...

Plants, views, little dassie critters. More than we expected. Nice views of the city, of course. But the unusual plant life on the top is remarkable and you feel like you've discovered a lost world. Little groundhog-like mammals dashing about, cute.
Table Mountain. Worth the trip for the views, but book your tickets before you go to avoid being swamped in the rush for the cable cars.

Cable Car to Table Mountain. The views from the top of the mountain are fantastic. The one drawback is that it's very crowded. We tried to take the cable car in the morning but there was a 45 minute wait. We came back in the afternoon and the wait was about 25 minutes.
Must do in Cape Town. Just make sure the weather is good. And if you're scared of heights, sit in the mdidle of the cable car otherwise it gets a bit scary :)
Beautiful. A mustang your bucket list , spend a fluke if days enjoying this beautiful garden that goes forever with more surprises than you could imagine
Amazing natural wonder. Fantastic place to visit. Could see all of Cape Town and even managed see wildlife - a very tame Dassie. Brilliant being in the clouds one minute and then brilliant sunshine.
Wonderfull views and hiking. It really is spectacular. Impressive from the ground and more so from the top. There are trails all over the top as well as several popular trails that lead to the top.
A great & Clean view. Blue sky, 360 degree view of all around the city, fresh air.. a stunning place to enjoy nature and walking around.
beautiful. Must see, didn't do cable car, but I think most would enjoy fabulous view. Park extends from Table Mountain to the tip of Cape of Good Hope… very large park.
A week in Cape Town. By 12.30 there was an hour and half queue to the cable car, we had booked our tickets on line, which saved an even longer queue
Table Mountain. Well worth a visit, spectacular views. Make sure you go up on a clear and free windy day. Can get very cold on top.

great scenery.. Like the views of the ocean and the organizers do a great job.
you have to see this place at-least once.

A true natural wonder. Great views of Cape Town and a nice place to explore.If it is a good day you need to go up as soon as you can, just in case it is covered in cloud later.Take the opportunity to do table mountain at sunset. Take a picnic and a bottle of fizz and enjoy the views.The cafe & bar at the top are very good, well organised and not to expensive.Cable car is slick and efficient. We got our tickets on line in advance of our trip and it makes things so smooth.
Facinating!. I've been on the cable car and I've climbed up the mountain on the southern front. A great experience all round. The climb can be faster than the wait at the car!
Superb views. Spectacular views. Plenty of photo opportunities to wow. Toilets, cafes etc and numerous walks around this area. Saw some Dassies running around and lots of birds.

Simply absolutely stunning. Having waited for the 50Km plus winds to subside which meant Table Mountain had been closed for 3 days, the wait was worth every minute. From the minute we arrived at 8-30am on a beautiful still Cape Town morning it was so beautiful. The cable car ride was quite exhilarating with the views overlooking cape Town breathtaking. No need to push or rush as the floor revolves meaning everyone gets a great view. Once on the mountain top,it is surprisingly large with plenty of walks of around 45 minutes or so. Again the views from all sides are quite stupendous. We saw some people doing the 2 hour walk and at least one climber plus some abseilers. Remember to take a hat and water as it can get very hot up there. During the day my daughter lost her iphone. Not sure where, we backtracked and decided to call Table Mountain reception the following morning on the off chance. To our daughter's delight, one of the staff on the top of the mountain had found it and handed it in! In a city which has a reputation for crime, this restored our faith in humanity and a big thank you to whoever it was who handed it in. It was a brilliant morning. Recommendation is to book your ticket online and go early morning as the mountain gets extremely busy and waiting time can be 2 hours plus especially if you have to queue to buy a ticket. Also it gets hotter as the day goes by and parking becomes more difficult. If you do one thing in Cape Town, Table Mountain is it.
Colourful.. A great place to spend a Day, lots of walking, interesting vegetation ETC.--------------------------------------------------------------------

Do not miss. Pre-book and go early to avoid the queue or at least minimise it. Very smooth ride to the top and what an experience once you are there. Good way to get there is on the open top bus which is also a must-do.

Get there before 8am. Cape Town has unfortunately become a victim of its own success. A few years ago CT was a pleasurable place to stay, it has now become too popular, with a huge increase in tourists, meaning large crowds wherever you go, including table mountain. Leave it after 8 and expect atleast 2 hours wait, even when getting online tickets
Free guided walks super informative. Definitely well worth embarking on the free guided walks the park offers! Make the time for yourself and then allow time to explore more of the area on your own.
Amazing views. Amazing views over Cape Town an the atlantic ocean. Difficult to park the car, It is recomendable to go by bus.

Worth the wait......when you FINALLY get there. The view from the mountain is simply unreal. You have to go up there at some point in your life. However the organisation by the staff is incredibly frustrating. We waited for two hours (having bought tickets in advance) while we watched the non ticket holding queue move faster and go up ahead of us. There was no one marshalling the queue which meant no one really knew where to wait. Also people frequently pushed into the queue. Let's just hope those queue jumpers fell off the mountain.

Absolutely Incredible. Afraid of heights, I wasn't too happy about the cable car. However, once in the car itself, I forgot all about my fear and was in awe of the views as the car ascended. Once on the mountain, it was astounding. We walk a way around the paths and I can't find words to describe the views. You have to go yourself, you won't regret it. Buy your ticket online to avoid the lengthy queues and choose a day with a light wind and no cloud.

Amazing Treks within the Table Mountain National Park. Our 5 days 4 night Trek was an amazing experience will always remember. highly recommend it, go with guides and you will learn a lot and enjoy the sights.

Moutain views. Good walking with fabulous views. The queues for the cable car can be long, but moved quickly when we were there. You can book in advance, but the cable car is often closed when the mountain is covered in cloud or there are high winds.

You Simply Must!. Most beautiful amazing views I ever have seen! Que was a tad long but went quick and then the cable car was fairly quick too! Shame the group I was with were on a time limit otherwise would have spend all afternoon up there taking pictures!
Lucky to have lovely weather too!

Fantastic views. A breath taking experience travelling in the cable car up to the top of Table Mountain, made even better by the humorous entertainment provided by the car operator. We enjoyed the fantastic views from the top of the mountain, thanks to the well placed viewing positions located all around the summit.We went to the souvenir stall to pick up some mementos of a once in a lifetime experience & we were surprised at how fairly priced everything was, unlike so many other similar locations we know of.Basically an all round great experience that anyone visiting the wonder city of Cape Town should build into their plans.
Free birthday entrance. It was my birthday little did I know I would gain free entrance. Free entrance though is only for South Africans and if you have your ID with you on your birthday
Capetown at your feet!. Great hikings, great views and nature. Please take note that you wear good shoes, take enough food and water en some weather protection!

Very nice views!. From Cape Town, easy walk with great views of the whole bay. Car access, aerial cable or public transport. Though I visited in several parts and the Simon's Town Area is the one I most liked of the National Park (Boulders) as the environment feels wilder than the areas closer to Cape Town. Get always info from the South African national parks before going for a long walk...

amazing views!. beautiful scenery.. even in the clouds! totally recommend going at 8am to avoid the large crowds, we were the first trip up and felt that we had ample space at the top to explore without feeling overwhelmed. grounds up top are clean and really give a beautiful 360 view of the city

If it's running do not miss it!. We were disappointed that the cable car was not running on the day we were originally scheduled to go. A couple of days later on the way back from another tour we talked our guide into dropping us at the mountain. The clouds were swirling around and he thought it wouldn't be worthwhile but we are so glad we went. The clouds moved in and out from different sides at different times so we were able to see the views from every angle. The sun came out, we walked around the trails and were completely impressed.

Disappointed. What we didnt realise was when they say the cable car doesnt run when windy, literally meant any wind and thats it shut down. Do make sure you check the weather forecast as for the three days we were in Cape Town it didnt run at all. That said, the views of the Mountain and the 'table cloth' were impressive, and we did get up to the base station of course...shame not to see it from the top though
Must do in Cape Town. Fantastic views to the city. Quite difficult to know when to go because the wind and the fog is very unpredictable but you should do it.
Challenging but worth it!. A very challenging climb but the view was just incredible! Free guided tour on top of TableTop was great. Restaurant on top was amazing!

Very breathtaking. Went up when it was cloudy. Walked into the clouds. Wind would blow them away for a bit so the view was beautiful. Heard if going when it was nice, one gets sunburned and there is a long line. Our trip was perfect.

The highlight of our trip to Cape Town. A must for anyone visiting cape town. We took the cable car up and walked around the top of the mountain. We had a nice clear day and the panoramic views are incredible. We stopped to have a glass of wine at the restaurant and admire the view. We went up late afternoon and the queue for the cable car was much quieter. We had initially planned to go up for the sunset but were advised to go earlier as they stop the cable cars if the wind picks up. I would recommend pre-booking tickets for the cable car to save time when you get there - we brought ours from the city tour bus company.
Must see. Take the gondola up to the top and spend some time enjoying the beautiful views of Cape Town or walk around and admire the wildlife!

wooow. amazingly beautiful view from the top , its a must , you must definitely pay a visit !! especially the life happening up there , and the restaurant serves a good local beers its best when it is hot up there :)

Beeeee-a-utiful mountain. Walk down if you can!. We had a clear day, and the views were spectacular, but I've heard cloudy days are so-so. Highly recommend taking the cable car up the mountain (unless you're a seasoned hiker) but walking down offered great views !! (I would still recommend a good level of fitness to walk down, and allow 1.5-2 hours :)

Not Much Can TOP this!!. Heaven in the Sky! Wow! This place is just breathtaking...awe-inspiring...beautiful...and the list continues. It truly deserves to be considered and named one of the "new" WONDERS of the world. It's one of those places that you can certainly see the splendor of God and his Creations! I could not stop taking snap shots as I was trying to capture enough shots from different angles that would allow me review before my next visit. I wanted to abseil but maybe next time...needed a tad bit more motivation (LOL). Took pics on the edge of the cliff, that was a great experience (and not recommended for everyone...LOL). But really, great place!

Spectacular views. Well worth the effort (2 hours in line - feel it could be managed better) once up. If visiting during hot months, bring lots of water and a parasol - there is no escape from the burning sun.
Beautiful. Really nice area, take some time to visit. If you want to go up the mountain, do so when you have the change, because the cableway is not always open due to weather conditions.

Stunning views. Easy access via cable car, plenty of good information, really wonderful views and very good cafe at top. We went quite late in the afternoon and were there for sunset. We didn't find any queues but apparently they can get quite bad at other times of the day.
Stunning Views. Loved everything, even though I'm afraid of heights!! The view from the top is spectacular. We had no problems with tickets or bad weather, so we were blessed on the day we went.
Lovely. Lots of trails to follow, nice walking, great scenery. Crowded, tour busses etc but it was Easter! Don't miss
Worth the effort. Climbed up and took the easy way down by cable car; long wait for cable car and if reasonably fit the hike up is worth it.

Wonderful. What can you describe about this unique mountain? You have to see it to believe it. If your planning to visit it, go up the mountain the first opportunity you have when the weather is clear. The cloud can come over very quickly so don't delay! We bought tickets before going up & this saved time waiting in queues (which at this time of year is minimal). We got there & back by taxi but the red route of the hop on/hop off bus also goes there. Cable car was good, it moves you around whilst in the cab so that you get the opportunity of seeing it 360 degrees. You can spend as much or as little time as you personally want at the top. Views are fantastic everywhere. There is a cafe/restaurant at the top. It can get quite cool at the top so take a jumper/top just in case. It may seem sunny with no cloud when you are at the bottom but as I said at the beginning things can change quite quickly. We had to queue for quite a while to get back down in the cable car & I did get cold - so beware! You can't visit Cape Town without visiting Table Mountain. Highly recommended.

Visit early morning for the best experience. It took us several days for the weather to clear up enough for us to be able to visit first thing in the morning and we were rewarded with stunning views and plenty of room to move around but it was already getting very busy at 9.30. A must see when in Cape Town.
Not cloud in the sky!!. A must visit!! Had a great time walking around and admiring the fantastic views of Cape Town and afar

Fantastic views, maybe not worth all the hype. It was a bit of a hassle to get to the top of the mountain - the cable car only runs under good weather and the lines are long. That said, the views are tremendous once you get to the top. Next time I will try hiking up instead.

It's A Must!. It is absolutely beautiful atop this mountain. You can see down both sides. We watched the sun set over the ocean and then took some photos of the city lights before leaving. Just stunning.

Cape Town holiday. Wonderful experience. long queues but definately worth it :o)The view from the top of Table mountain was superb as was the sight of seeing the birds and wildlife which were relatively tame.

A must. Can't come to CT without going up Table Mountain. We took the cable car as we weren't equipped for hiking. My only advice is go early and book your tickets in advance. There are always big queues mid-late morning. they also close the cable car if there are high winds so be aware that you may need to fit this in around other activities depending on weather.

Breathtaking Views!. Loved Table Mountain! The price up the cable car is very reasonable and you can spend all day immersed in the beauty of Table Mountain overlooking Cape Town and The Sea. A Must See for everyone travelling to Cape Town.
A unique experience. We were very lucky to visit Cape Town on a day when Table Mountain wasn't covered in cloud or the cable car suspended due to high winds. It was a unique experience.

Amazing views of the city. This is a must see destination if you visit Cape Town. The views are breathtaking. Unfortunately the wind often shuts down the cable car but on a clear day, you're almost guaranteed a trip to the top. Tip: if the weather does not cooperate for 3 days or if you have to return home before you can use your ticket, just contact customer service and they are very nice about refunding you. I recommend reserving the first time slot in the AM before the wind has a chance to shut down the mountain.

Worth the visit even in cloud. Trying to choose the perfect time to visit is pretty impossible. When we left from our hotel to make the 30 min drive there as not a cloud in the sky. By the time the cable car had reached the top half the mountain was covered in cloud. But still the trip was worthwhile and the walk round the various trails and the views around Cape Town were great. If you are travelling by car and there is a lack of parking on the way up, drive past the cable car station and there are more parking spaces available.

ABSOLUTE MUST ON ANY BUCKET LIST. Definitely something everyone needs to experience - absolutely beautiful. The Kirstenbosch gardens an absolute must and the cable car the first place to stop on any visit to Cape TownMake sure you go out of season - queues can be very long for the cable car when its high season
do not miss this....... This is a MUST DO for anyone visiting Cape Town. The views are truly iconic. For safety reasons the cable car operation can be restricted due to weather conditions.

Make this a priority!. You've gotta go! Whether you hike the strenuous trail to the top or take the revolving gondola, make sure you get to the top to see the beautiful views. When we reached the top, the clouds were pouring over the mountain, which is interesting in and of itself, but intermittently, we got coastal views on three sides of the mountain. If you're timeing is right, you'll have a 360° view. There is a restaurant, gift shop and toilet at the top. But no shirts that say "I climbed Table Mountain!".
STUNNING VIEWS. Good weather made it possible for us to enjoy this attraction.The place is clean and well maintained.Definitely worth a visit when you are in Capetown

Not just views of Cape town. We expected to be a little bored of looking down on Cape Town but where surprised to find stunning mountain views in every direction we looked. This is definitely an unforgettable experience not to be missed

Always brilliant. Went there to take a visitor there and it was as good as it ever is. Some thoughtsTake the red hop on hop off bus. That takes you right up to the base of the cable-car. Also book online will stop you from queuing which is a very long queue at time. The restaurant at the top is overprices and expensiveTake proper walking shoes as the far side of the upper part of the mountain are very rough. phone before going up there as the cableway is often closed as a result of high winids. You need to make sure it is open before going up. Also there are good websites looking at the weather up on the mountain.

A must DO in South Africa!. Be cautious when planning your visit to Table Mountain- because the cable cars will not operate in very windy conditions. This happened for 2 days during our stay. If you get a nice day on your trip- head to Table Mountain! The cable car takes only 5 or so minutes, but in the mornings the queue can be very long- so be prepared for that. There are car parks all along the road leading up to the cablecar entrance, but it can be a 5-10minute walk depending on if you get a good spot or not. Plan on spending at minimum 2-3 hours exploring the different viewpoints here. We also did abseiling which we signed up for in advance and takes about 1 hour total. If you are adventurous, I would highly recommend looking into abseiling, or doing a guided hike instead of taking the cable car. There is a huge cafe in the middle which offers a ton of food options and drinks. It is quite pricey. You can bring your own food and drinks, however. You will likely be walking up and down many stairs so wear good shoes! There are some spots where you can hike out a bit (10 minutes or so) to explore. Highly recommend stopping at Table Mountain during your stay in Capetown as it provides AMAZING views of the city and Lion's head. I won't forget it!

Top of the world. The experience was unlike any other for a mountain. The dry, arid and windy atmosphere is responsible was a very unusual vegetation not seen elsewhere. The view of city and ocean was wonderful. The rotating gondola was something which I have not experienced elsewhere.
MUST VISIT ATTRACTION. You need to there to admire this. You click the best pics of this amazing city from here. Even the restaurant at the table top is amazing in quality of the food.

As far as the eye can see. On a clear day there were stunning views all round capetown ,weather plays a huge part in this attraction make sure you pick a good day ,if afraid of heights dont take the cable car ( walking track - 3 hours)

Fabulous views. We were lucky to arrive before the crowd (by about 8 am). The weather was perfect - hot and totally clear. We had our photos done (which weren't bad at all, for a change) and had plenty of time to wander around once we got to the top, taking loads of pics from all angles. Definitely a 'must' if visiting Cape Town, but all depends on the weather, as if it's cloudy or too windy, you can't go up.

On a Clear Day, You Can See Forever. The day we arrived in Cape Town there was a very clear view of the mountain, and not a cloud in the sky. Unfortunately, it was too late in the day to visit Table Mountain. For the next five days, there was a haze or cloud around the mountain. On the first morning with no clouds, we hastily headed towards TM. We had not purchased tickets ahead of time (bad move on our part,) so we had to wait for thirty minutes in line to buy tickets. The cableway had only opened about twenty minutes prior. And the line behind us grew very quickly. We then had to wait another twenty minutes in the cableway line. But the view from the top was amazing!! Well worth the time spent parking and in line. A tip: if you take the HOHO bus you will be able to get off right at the entrance. However, if, like us, you drive, you will find yourself without a parking space if you wait much after 10:00 am. There is no real parking lot. Parking is along the drive up to the cableway. So if you are driving, pick the first available spot you see. The bonus for us was that a group of firefighters, probably 80 of them, were getting in line as we were coming down the stairs. They all started singing and dancing. It was the perfect ending to an amazing day!

This place has something for EVERYBODY!. Hiking trails. Cable car to the top. Breathtaking Vistas. A night excursion to see the sunset, where people bring their picnics add if at a drove in movie; except these crowds are gaping about the sunset, moonrise, and city view on the way down. And more. ...
Stunning views across Cape Town to the sea. Really is one of the modern 7 wonders of the world. Sipping a glass of wine on the terrace watching the sunset over the sea - just brilliant!
Awesome Views!. Short ride to the summit by cable car, stunning views! We were above the clouds!! There are bars and restaurants there too if you get thirsty or peckish

Amazing stop on the hop on hop off bus. Even if they claim poor visibility, take the cable car ride up. The clouds move in and out, and you're sure to get a great view. It's very relaxing walking around and taking pictures, and you can eat lunch, drink beer, and buy souvenirs at the same time. But bring a jacket - it's a bit nippy. And buy a round trip ticket before you go up!! My husband swears he overheard someone saying there were no more adult tickets down, so he had to hike. I didn't hear it, but there's no discount at the top, so just buy both.
take the cable car up and you will love the trip. beautiful views and great location to visit especially if on a short trip. ensure that you call ahead to check whether the cable cars are working.

Quite the hike up. We decided to be adventurous and take the hike up; well, since there is no signage, we got lost. 3 and a half hours later, we made it up the mountain. It was tiring, and hot, but we had amazing views the entire time. Make sure to pack lots of water!
worth a visit. Picked a day with no quese and they can be an hour long clouds on top rolled in so view was not great but worth the experience

Best thing for Cape Town. This has to be the best thing to do in Cape Town. On a nice sunny day, one can spend the whole day trekking, hiking and exploring this natural beauty. The View from the top is breath taking and something that HAS to be seen if you are in Cape Town.

worth the visit. You should consider walking on the top for a longer time than 30 minutes. The vegetation is surprising even when it is the end of Summer and most flowers are out. We can't imagine what it would be in the Spring!
Great Views. Stunning 360 degree views of the Cape Town environs. Nice walk. Pictures don't do justice to the view. It has to be seen to be appreciated.

Amazing. Beautiful views and a wonderful experience. Gets quite cold up the mountain though.
I would definitely visit again.

Weather is a threat. It often gets cloudy over Table Mountain, take a sweater even if it is hot. Sometimes, visitors are requested to leave early if they want to use the cable car because of wind. You can always climb and descend by hiking Table Mountain.
Super!. The tablecloth came in just a little before we were done looking but we still saw great views and cute little animals.

THE FIRES. Despite the fires all over the Cape peninsula, staff at the TMNP offices responded quickly and courteously to our questions regarding the availability of walks and accommodation. They could not have been more helpful.

Cable ride to the top of Table Mountain. It was a fantastic experience. The wait area had pictures and descriptions of other wonders of the world. Very interesting read while you wait for the cable ride. The cable ride to the top was fun as it turned and gave a panoramic view as you reach the top of the mountain. Once at the top, it was breath taking. I was hungry, so I stopped right away at the restaurant for a bite and then hiked around the massive mountain. A must do.
Great place to visit.. I loved the ride to the top of the Table Mountain and enjoyed the views from there. The information provided is quite useful.

Beautiful Views. Our last full day in Cape Town we took the lift to the top of Table Mountain. There are mini trails on top, a nice restaurant and an excellent view of the city. Our only regret was not having enough time during our trip to hike up.
A lovely day. This is a great place to visit. Table mountain can get busy so recommend early morning visit. Marked walks around the top. Cafe, shop and toilets.

Great sight. One of the worlds most recognisable sights. It was truly an amazing experience. My wife and I, like most people, had seen it on travel or documentaries but to reach the top and see Cape Town below was wonderful. It's a must if you visit Cape Town.

More up there than you would imagine. At the end of the day - at over 1,000 meteres - you get to be on top of Table Mountain - that as a kid I had seen and never dreampt I would see - let alone ascend! An amazing experience. Shops and restaurant and you can even sip on a glass of champagne brought to you by one of the very good waiting staff. You could if you fancied wander about on top for several hours. And I love the fact that the cable car gondola rotates as it ascends and descends - so everyone gets a great view. You just have to do it, Better on a very hot, cloudless day.
Table Mountain Trip. Wonderful panoramic views from about 3000 feet up.The air is noticably cooler up there.No fun if it is covered in cloud. If it is clear drop other plans and go !
Beautiful views. First, it is large as they have combined several parks. It now extends from Table Mountain to Cape Point. It includes Boulders where the penguins are, and the Cape of Good Hope.
Amazing views of cape town. When we went up in the cable car I thought it was great how the floor revolves and everyone get and open ended view
Great Hikes. The recommended trail, Platteklip Gorge, is a congested way up; however, there are plenty of other ways up.

Our Glorious mountain. As a native Cape Town-ian and University of Cape Town Alumnus, I have an unreasonable (and probably annoying to outsiders) amount of awe and reverence for the mountain, its eco-systems, hidden secrets and views. Maintaining a little objectivity for now however, Table Mountain National Park is an excellently managed nature reserve, paths are always well marked and maintained, cleanliness and conservation are prioritized and service is good. I pay an annual membership fee to the National Parks and take my foreign visitors to visit the pay points of the park, while there are many free entry points of equivalent quality, the service does great work with those funds, so should be supported.

Stunning views, easy access.. We could not have enjoyed our trip up Table Mountain more. The sun shone, the winds were light, the mist on the sea in Cape Town Harbour and Camps Bay gave an ethereal quality to the scene. The Dacies (rock hyraxes) were completely untroubled by human presence, basking on the rocks next to the footpath for photos. There were also lizards and sun birds posing for pictures. We took the cable car up and walked the short route round the top which took 15 minutes, although there were 30 minute and 45 minute options too. Moving off the paths was strongly discouraged, but the paths were organised in such a way as to give great views of the whole Cape. The summit smelled good, the shrubs clinging on to a windswept summit that had once been a seabed. 260 million years old rocks (the Himalayas are something like 30 million), on one of the oldest mountains in the world - I love it! There were cafe, shops and toilets at the summit, so all was provided for. Wait times in the queue for the cable cars was also pretty reasonable.
On top of the world. Must see. Go early as afternoon winds can close down the cable car. Gorgeous views of Cape Town and surrounding area.

Wow. A must if you visit Cape Town, the views are amazing and the whole experience was positive. If you like walking put some trainers on and you can walk across the length of table mountain When you get back an ice cold beer with the most amazing views s a great way to finish off
National Treasure. We loved everything about it from the sky high tram ride to the top to the hiking trails and looking down on the clouds.

The centre of Cape Town. Wow, how great it is to have such a beautiful mountain as the centre of such a magnificent city. There are so many walks and climbs, just make sure that you do one of them while you are visiting. Unforgettable!
Flat top. It is a must do.Only one problem WEATHER if misty or windy the Cable Car does not go.Lots of frustration!!

Breakfast with a view. A Capetown must do! Thoroughly enjoyable and over far too soon. The car rotates so there is no need to 'bag' the best spot on entering. Great fun watching them that don't know that though! Car attendants always polite. We generally go early, head straight to the cafe and have breakfast with a view!

Amazing Experience. Not to be missed, excellent trip, buy your tickets prior to avoid the ques, also check website before visiting as they close the cable cars subject to weather! Great views from the Cable car and great views from the top. Nice little Cafe on the top as well. Don't miss the experience
Must See. One of the seve natural wonders of the world. A must see, but be prepared for a wait to board the cable car.
Windy Table Rock. Good experience, but keep an eye on the weather. They close the tram if too windy, and if not alert to the announcement, you end up having to walk down.

A must do. The Table Mountain cable car is a must do in Cape Town. We were lucky not to have long queues on the day we went. There were fantastic views from the top but there was some mist hanging around - take a cardigan or jumper, it was surprisingly cold
Worth the trip!. The view from the top of the mountain is unbeatable! There are signs all over the top to show you what you're looking at, which is nice. No complaints here.

A DEFINITE 'BUCKET-LIST' CHOICE!. This is well worth the visit, which can be reached by either walking up the mountain (you'd need to be fit!), or cablecar. Do check on the day, as high winds will cause the cablecar to be cancelled. A fantastic viewing spot and a choice of a few walks, short or long. Wear sensible walking shoes. A wonderful experience-THANK YOU!
beautiful. The most beautiful scenery. The views are breathtaking and it was a splendid day with gorgeous weather.

After lions head. I visited table mountain after lions head and it was a very nice view. The altitude is higher but the views in lions head were much nicer. There is a place to eat and buy a beer so that's something lions head doesn't have. It is definately more touristy. The lift makes it easy. Buy your tickets online for the lift so that you don't need to wait in line while there. Always a twenty minute line.Bring sun lotion. Very strong sun.
A great view over cape town. We really enjoyed the cable lift ride and the walk on the top of the table mountain and national park.A must for those visiting cape town
Must see. Recommend this be your first stop when visiting Cape Town, as it gives you great perspective on the entire area.

Table Mountain is BEAUTIFUL!. We attempted to hike all the way to the top, but decided part way up we didn't have enough food/water to make it, so we hiked back down and took the cable cars. Man. Once we got to the top, the views were some of the best I've ever seen. We hiked around up top for AT LEAST three hours, but easily could have spent all day up there! I just can't even describe it!

Wow. Myself and my Hubby visited Table Mountain on our Honeymoon in April/May 2010 it was absolutely spectacular. This is definitely one of the most do tourist attractions in the city of Cape Town. We loved it and would love to return again sometime in the future.

Stunning veiw. Loved the cable car and the stunning views. There are also several paths to walk up the mountain if you are fit enough. I would advise that you book online first to avoid the queue for the cable car tickets. You also need to check that the cable car is open as the weather can change very quickly. There is a restaurant on the top of the mountain.
Always a lovely visit. It was a lovely day. Thousands of people visited the park. But in spite of that, we could experience the beauty and the vistas while also feel quiet and peaceful.
Mountain serenity.. Amazing hike, exquisite exercise. Communing with nature and the spheres. Great breakfast at the cafe - charged by weight...

Table Mountain on a very bad weather day !. On our first visit to Cape Town in December 2014 - Table Mountain was HIGH up there on our list of places to visit :-)It was the 26th December and we made our way up to the cable way. The weather was starting to turn sour (clouds rolling in) but the staff were still selling tickets and letting people pay good money and line up to wait for the cable car... I do not agree with this at all. We were a little naive to think that the weather would be clear up on the mountain but we had no idea just how foggy / windy / rainy / COLD it would be once we got up there. I feel that the staff should really make you aware of the weather conditions and advise people that the visibility is poor (at the time of purchasing tickets / ticket sales counter). This was people can make an informed decision as to whether or not to pay the money and go up or perhaps skip it for that day and come back when the weather is better.We shall return one day on a nice and sunny day and I am sure (as we have seen photos from fellow travellers) that the view is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING once u there on a née clear day !

True natural wonder!. You cannot afford to be in Cape Town and miss the Table Mountain. It pushes you to think how nature created forces and compelled things to make way for such a spectacular natural wonder ... its connected from almost every corner of the city and believe me .. you wont regret visiting the site.

A natural world wonder. Astonishing setting and views - visit Table Mountain as soon as the top is clear: you may not have long and there are ample sea level attractions in and near Cape Town in the rain and mist. As we reached the top, the "table cloth", a blanket of low rolling cloud was forming and cascading from the surrounding hills. Surprising to see a large family of Cape hyrax perched at the edge of shear cliffs near the cable car station.

The Top of the World. To be at the top of Tabletop Mountain was an experience of a lifetime. Our first trip was cancelled due to high winds. We were able to go the next day and words cannot express the feeling of riding a cable car that has a rotating floor to the top of the mountain. It was a clear and beautiful day and the sights were spectacular. We even had a chance to talk to three young men who were preparing to repel down the side of the mountain. Tabletop Mountain is a must see and must do.

Spectacular View. You cannot visit Capetown without taking a trip to the top of Table Mountain but do get advice on when to go from a local who knows the weather signs. A cloud free time is important as there is little to view when the 'tablecloth' of cloud covers it. Don't forget your camera and maybe a jacket - depending on the time of day.The journey up and down by cable car is an experience in itself, particularly now the new Swiss rotating cable car takes 65 standing!.There are several viewing points, an eatery and toilets.
Wow. One of the most beautiful mountains of the world. Trail highly recommended, but the cablecar is an option.
Mustsee. A must to do in Cape Town. I had a clear day and great views. The ride up and the walk around the mountain was worth it

Breathtaking View!. Table Top Mountain was such a great experience! Not only were we on top of a mountain, we were also at the bottom of Africa! The plant life is very interesting and the flowers are delicate in their nature. The mountain is also one of the new 7 wonders of nature.When you look down to the houses below, they appear to be brightly colored pebbles hugging the shores of the ocean. The walk about can be long or short depending how adventures you are. You can also hike up to the top on the pathways and down, or take the cable car. We chose the cable car which was also quite an experience. The window rotates so that when the open part comes, you can take unobstructed photos while proceeding up to the top. It was well worth going early, because when we left, there was a huge line up to get in!
