Climb Table Mountain. A good heart-pumping 1.5 hours to the top, where you get amazing views of city and bays. Ride the cable car back down, unless too windy.
Table Mountain. Absolutletly thrilling time at the Table Mountain park, make sure you get on the Cape Town tour guide bus...I provides a good view into the entire city

Fabulous views, shame about the food. Stunning views from this iconic tourist attraction. BUT do not plan to eat here. The service area is chaotic and the food we got was undercooked and cold - there was a lot of wasted food on the tables around us. Such a pity they do not use the location to provide a decent restaurant

Well worth the hike up and Cable Car down.. Found walk up tough but rewarding views.if walking up take at least 2 litres of water and high energy snacks. We left early morning ,7am, which was just as well as the top temperature for the day was 44 deg.
Tonie's review. The cable way was really something great. It is too expensive for what you get overall. Windy and cold in on that summer day

Wonderfully uplifting. Nothing beats a walk on the mountains around Cape Town early morning or late afternoon! We are fortunate to live in Cape Town and go for regular walks or runs in Table Mountain National Park.

Top on Table Mountain. Definitely one of the beautiful picturesque view from the top loved the experience. Loved the cable way and we did not have to wait to long in line for our chance to go up the mountain. Kids enjoyed it thoroughly.

Go early, buy tickets online. It is worth it!. My first two days in Cape Town were overcast and the mountain was covered in the "tablecloth" as the low clouds are called. My 3rd and last day started with a brilliant blue, cloudless sky. This was my only chance to get up the mountain and off I went...early enough I thought. But there were a lot of other people with the same idea. So yes, it was very busy. I had to park on the road at least 3/4 of a mile from the ticket line. Fortunately, I chatted with folks in line who decided to order tickets on line. This easily cut an hour off our wait time. The cable cars are smooth and fast and rotate 360 on each trip so you get to see pretty much everything. Once on top, the views are excellent...stay as long as you like. The reviews that complain about "too many people" and "long waits" are a little ironic but it is true that you could lose a lot of time here. So keep on eye on the weather, plan ahead, go early (or late) and buy tickets on line. You'll be glad you did.

Off the plane to Table Mountain. The one problem with taking the cable car to the top of Table Mountain is it can be closed due to weather and/or wind. So we immediately took advantage of the hot clear evening and took a cab over. Fantastic views, some interesting wildlife, and that evening we saw a huge wildfire. Don't book in advance but also don't miss it. Easy to take a cab over and plenty of cabs available when it shuts down.
Stunning views. One of the best views in the world and if you are prepared to walk a few meters you can find some quiet corners.

What more can be said. Pure awesomeness.. There is nothing quite like Table Mountain anywhere else in the world..
Simply the best reason to go to Cape Town..
Great views and scenery. Table Mountain is a great place to see Capetown and miles of surrounding area. There are so many trails to hike and the animals and flowers were fantastic.

Reaching the heights!. The trip up by rotating cable car is exciting but when you get to the top and see the 360degree views of Capetown and area you will be stunned! Take binoculars!! This is where the selfie really comes into its own! It's really like being in top of the world, and the very adventurous can do an abseil if they dare! The mountain can be closed fairly frequently due to wind and cloud, so take the opportunity when it arises, don't plan too strictly as you may be disappointed.

Great if the weather is perfect. This is weather dependant as Table Mountain is subject to cloud coverage and high winds. We had a very clear day with very light winds which was great. There are numerous walk ways on the mountain and a free guided tour, but get there early as the last guided tour finishes around 2pm.
hike. away from the crowds of people very quiet and some great views of cape town and a bit of wildlife around but do wear a hat
Top of Table Mountain. A must tour to the top of this mountain for the view alone one of the best views of Cape Town you can see for miles. A breath taking view.

On top of the world in Capetown. Definitely worth coming up today despite slight drizzle. The cable car ride was lovely. Today rainbow was over the horizon when we were on top of Table mountain. You can see the whole coast line from Camp Bay, Clifton to Seapoint. You can overlook the city and Cape flat. The lionhead and the tail and Robben island completed an amazing view. Definitely worth the title of 1 of the 7th wonders of the world!
AMAZING VIEW....DIDNT WANT TO COME DOWN!. The view from the top of the mountain really cannot be described via words....Table Mountain is PROOF that God is indeed AWESOME!!

Unbelievable!. If you do one thing in South Africa go to Table Mountain. The views are amazing, the natural beauty so stunning, the walks at the top breathtaking. You will see Camps Bay, Robin Island the 12 Apostles, and Cape Town itself. Not to be missed.

Take the time to check it out. Just a beautiful National Park, it is fairly large.So it is perfect for a day trip or a few days camping.Lots of wildlife,great road tracks and good for driving around.Strongly recommended.

Above the clouds. This is a worthwhile attraction on a fairly clear day. Get there early or maybe late as the line for the cable car was about 2 hours on a clear Saturday morning so we chose to come back. Sunday late afternoon there was no wait. At the top we were above the clouds on one side but had a clear beautiful view of Robbins Island and the harbor. Nice walk at the top.

The Tops. I've spent time in and around mountains in the past but nothing quite prepares you for Table Mountain. The ascent in the cable car, which rotates through 360degs as it climbs, is breathtaking. It takes less than ten minutes to get to the cable head and you're quickly out and on the plateau itself. I'd no idea as to what I should expect to see, but nothing that I did disappointed. Of course there's a gift shop and place to get some good coffee and food (but be prepared for an ordering/collection experience - if in doubt ask staff for advice). However, nuff zed of mundane things. The views, because this is what you come for, are fantastic. the air is so clear you can almost see the spindrift on the waves thousands of meters away. You can see Robben Island sitting low and squat out in Table Bay, so reflect on how the top of Table Mountain, a signifier of freedom, must have appeared to the poor souls incarcerated there. The views of Cape Town itself are equally stunning whilst watching the cable cars ascend and descend can be quite giddying.Go prepared, btw, and take a warm sweater or similar with you because the breeze can be a bit cool up there and in summer the sun can be deceptively strong. The trip back down can be a tad tedious with lots of queuing and shuffling along to the cars. Tip is to buy your tickets for the trip in advance; the queues can be epic.

Best part of Cape Town. Amazing panoramic views of Camps Bay, Cape Town and I would also recommend walking to the highest point which is approx 1 hour away by foot.Get there early if you need fo purchase a ticket same day.

A Must see in Cape Town. i am sad to say that this was my first visit to Table Mountain on the cable car. Every time in the part the queues were too long. Luckily this time we were more fortunate and I am so grateful as this was an experience worth waiting for. Would recommend it to all South Africans and definitely to tourists.

OH MY GOSH!. GO! GO! GO! It was the highlight of our trip. I can't wait to go back. Be sure to schedule more time than you thought. So much to see. Stop and have a glass of wonderful SA wine at the summit!

Take my Breathe away. Table Mountain National Park covers a large area and of course table mountain is the focal point. You have a choice of either hiking up the mountain or taking the cable car which i chose the latter. However i did some hiking westwards towards macon beacon, the highest peak of the mountain and got quite scary on my way back as it got really misty and windy, epecially on the route close to the mountain's edge. Overall, it took me about 2 hours with spectacular views along the way.
Table Mountain. Seeing the mountain up close and personal is definitely worth it ! Make a trip there during your stay.

You haven't travelled if you didn't visit Table Mountain! . I have been to 30 countries and all mega cities and I have not came across an attraction like Table Mountain. I simply love this mountain. Its magical, its amazing and its just amazing! Get your cable car tickets before hand. Go there sometime 10 am where there will be some clouds. If you want clear go after mid day. Spent your time there n don't rush.Sit on a rock and just enjoy the view.I will go back and this time hike up.
Wow. Buy your ticket with the Red Bus Tour and get to the cable car that way with less queuing. Fabulous views and you can, by prior arrangement, absail back down (we didn't!).

Scenic Table Mountain. Well worth it. If you have a Wild Card you get 20% discount.We picked a perfect day and were able to walk a lot at the top and see the sights from all angles. It was great. Finished off with coffee at the restaurant before going down. The restaurant was busy and still had their breakfast buffet out. I felt the should have had more sandwiches as there were only 3 on the fridge shelf at the time we were there around 11.30 am.

Stunning scenery. Spent a half day driving and walking in the park, stopped to photograph zebra, never having seen them in the wild before this was a stunning site! The coast line is amazing, has to be seen to be believed.
Nice views. We went via the last cablecar and it was fun but wished we had hiked up. At the top it was so incredibly windy but the views were beautiful and we got to see the sunset.

Fabulous !! Don't miss this. Short cable car ride to the top and when you get there , wow !!! The view over Cape Town, the ocean and surrounding area is spectacular. Take your camera !!! Refreshments available up there too. Unforgettable experience.
Must view. You really can't come to Cape Town and not ascend to the flattop peak of Table Mountain for views of the city and harbour.
Table Mountain Views. Fabulous views from the top, interesting revolving cable car offers views for everyone on the way up.

Awesome views. This is my fourth trip up to table mountain and each time i discover new views. This is a must for everyone to see and discover. Beautiful views of the city and the atlantic ocean. On the other side are beautiful and breathtaking views of the 12 apostles and other mountains as well as camps bay. The cable car ride is amazimg Amazing views!!!
A must. Do not miss the opportunity to visit the Table Mountain National Park when in Cape Town. I wish I had more time to explore the park.

Absolutely Brilliant!. Any visitor to Capetown must take in this attraction. The views are stunning, the park is well looked after and no matter how many times we have visited Capetown, we always take this day out! Jordyn was fascinated with the Dassies and other wildlife. Ensure you spend the whole day there and see it properly. You will want to go back!

What a ride. Went up to the top of Table Top Mountain beautiful at the top and beautiful views but the ride up is better than any fair ground ride if you are scared of heights it's not for you well worth a look

Must see, but be prepared for queues. Table Mountain is one of those natural wonders one must see. The cable car ride to the top gives a great panorama and the trails on-top were well marked and easy to navigate. Given the queue to purchase tickets, it is best to buy one's tickets online and have them in hand when arriving -- can save considerable time standing around if one's visit is at a busy time (the concierge at our hotel did this for us, without charge).
Amazing. Such a great experience. The views were breathtaking and the whole trip was one to remember. Definitely recommend it to everyone.

Well worth a visit. Post Cape Cycle Tour visit. Was so worthwhile and enjoyable. Absolutely breathtaking views and each visit presents something new. The park is very well maintained and professionally run.

Awesome. It is a really nice day trip. Make sure you take the time to do this properly. It is very beautiful when you are up there and you want to stay up there forever. The walk looks incredible but a lot of the people that had walked up there looked very flustered. Either way it is so nice to go up and see Capetown from such a lovley vantage point.
great once you get to the top. Hairy ride in the cable car but when at the summit nice places to eat & drink whilst looking at the sights

If you can see the top, go up; if not, wait. Table mountain is a fantastic back drop to Cape Town and is a must do thing to do in CT. However, it is also famed for having it's table cloth on of cloud cover. If t has then you won't see a thing when you get to the top. So, just wait until it's clear, then go up/We went on a tour to Robben Island and on the way back we would see that the mountain was clearing, so as soon as we returned we went up. Go as soon as you see if it is clear. If you wait too long there crowds will be long and you'll have to wait in line for ages.The cafe at the top is very good.

Do not miss this. If you have a car of your own, you can drive up the mountain. Not all the way, but enough to enjoy fantastic views. You can also park the car at a lower level, taka a bus and cable car to the top.

Great view from the bottom. Great view from the bottom of the chairlift. We tried to go everyday for 5 days and it was closed every day so we weren't very lucky, Still, the big bus stopped there so we got off and got some pics of Cape Town so can't complain

A true wonder of the world. I liked the cable car ride. It saved us hours that we did not have as opposed to hiking. The view from the top is breath taking. If you're a photographer Table mountain is must see. There is an awesome view of the city as well as the mountain range.Just remember to dress warm as it gets very cold and windy up there. Sometimes the cable car is grounded due to bad weather but you can check the status online.

Any weather it is open!. Views spectacular. If you are on the mountain and cannot see anything....wait a few minutes. It seems the view magically appears again! OF course everything depends on nature but you should not be discouraged by a few clouds... it changes quickly.

Breathtaking. Definitely a must see if you are in Cape Town. The views are amazing! The cable car was huge so you don't have to worry about being packed in! We didn't get to eat dinner at the restaurant but hopefully we will make it back one day

Cut the long line by paying a bit more!. It was one of the highlights in Cape Town. The 360 degree view from the mountain top is breathtakingly beautiful. We purchased an early ticket to by-pass the long line and it's highly recommended. We also appreciated receiving a prompt refund of one unused ticket. We didn't care for the restaurant on the top as the food was mediocre at the best with incredibly long line and disorganized system. Pack a picnic food if you could and enjoy the view while eating outdoors.

Stunning view - was a bit skeptical prior. No way to explain it. I usually avoid touristy spots but we went spur of the moment on a really nice day. The view is indescribable. Absolutely worth the trip up.

Beautiful enviroment. an experience to enjoy. beautiful flat but full of life enviroment which call you back to ancestrals.Hot and dry in summer, humid and cold in winter.. extreme condition always whisplashed by wind.love it...and then the wild protea (local national flower).

Amazing views. What more can you say other than breath taking views! We also did a tour by one of the park rangers while on top which was informative and enjoyableRecommend buying tickets online before arriving

Go the first chance weather allows!. Had a long and vigorous hike all the way around the top of Table Mountain. Wrapped up just before the "tablecloth" rolled in and the winds started howling for days. Really enjoyed it, but glad we did it early in our trip or the weather wouldn't have allowed another chance since the wind shuts down the tram.
Awesome. simply awesome, the experience up the mountain was spellbound, make sure u come to party with a selfie stick for aerial shots..
A must do if the tablecloth is not on. We liked the whole experience from the revolving floor in the car to the views from the top. As I say don't go up if it's cloudy.
Incredible. Words ,pictures cannot do justice of how beautiful it is up on the mountain.If in Cape Town Table Mountain is a must

Everything I expected and more. We spent a whole morning exploring the mountain, admiring the views, and looking down from the top! Simply the best views of Cape Town! The whole area has been carefully managed to ensure safety and provision of information without encroaching on the overall experience of being at one of the natural wonders of the world.
Great National park, amazing landscape and views. Great National park, amazing landscape. Awesome views of the Cape Town shoreline and the beautiful Atlantic ocean
Fantastic. One of the best mountains I have visited. The views from the top are breathtaking. Highly recommended

Walking up is not for the faint hearted. The best way to experience Table Mountain is to hike up it. It truly is a fantastic experience, with a real camaraderie with fellow hikers on the mountain. The euphoria experienced when you finally reach the top is well worth the exertion & the views go without saying
Beautiful Sunset. Make sure you stay and watch the sunset, gorgeous! Cable cars tickets were easy to purchase in the afternoon and we got right on and off

Awesome. A walk on top of Table Mountain is a must when visiting Cape Town. We went up using the cable car. I would recommend going first thing I the morning before it gets too crowded. Walking away from the visitor centre it gets quieter and is a pleasant, tranquil walk. There is a cafe at the top for those who don't want to walk. The scenery is truly awesome, it must be one of the most beautiful places in the world.
Great hike up!!!. This is truly worth a go!!! It is the most spectacular views of Cape Town!!!If you decide to walk up get the cable back down.
Beautiful views!. Take the first opportunity to go when weather permits. You can't predict South African weather and you may miss out. Well worth the visit!
If you have a view, you have a view. The view is indiscribeble it feels like looking to the end of the World. The paths are very save and clear. Young could have a guided tour too.

Plenty of options. Families will love this place as there is something for everyone. There is a buffet which is priced by weight, although we had sliced pizza which went down well with a beer. There is also a selection of wines and desserts so I would say that for lunch or light meals, this place pretty much has you covered.

Best views!. A must do activity in Cape Town. I went up in a cable car and felt like I went up all the way to the clouds. It felt like I was in a dream because it was so beautiful, I have never felt more free
Glad we have been. Amazing views bit disappointed too commercialised did not expect to see a café and restaurant and gift shop up there.

Thrilling ride. If you're taking the cable car, book online to afford flexibility in case of cloud/smoke/rain
Go early to avoid the queues

Outstanding!. I expected outstanding views but they truly take your breath away. Very well organised, from the foot to the summit. Exceptionally clean. Restaurant/Cafe at the top was very reasonably priced serving fantastic selection of food and drink. A must see visit during anyone's trip to Cape Town.

One of the most spectacular places on Earth. I was here some time ago, but spend quite a bit of time at the top of this mountain it really is a wonderful natural feature and the views are amazing and the Dassys are cute too!

Must place to visit. Great place for 360 degree view of cape town and oceans.
Watch our for high winds- preferable do it in the mornings and buy your ticket in advance for the cable car ride

up the Table!. book tickets on line if you can-saves you queuing, also, if they are still there at the bottom, and you want a photo, altho it looks tacky with the green cloth-have one done-they digitally fix it when you come down.

Stunning and beautiful. This is our 4th visit to the Table Mountain and it is only the first time the weather was kind to us. The view from the top was breathtaking and beautiful and clear.The cafe at the top was very chaotic , but the staff were very helpful

Spectacular views. The ride up the mountain in a cable car looks scary but isn't. It is lovely at the top. We bought our tickets on the Hop on Hop off bus which saves the wait in a long line at the base of the mountain. The ride up is only 4 minutes and the car holds around 20 people. The floor of the car rotates so all have a good view. At the top is a gift shop and a restaurant. Do not miss this trip.

A must on your visit to Cape Town. We climbed table mountain and came down by cable car. It was a wonderful experience!Important tips, don't climb in the heat of the day (which we did) and take plenty of water, ask a local about the visability before you go, wear walking shoes or comfortable trainers, we saw people in flip flops, and you are climbing rocks some of the time!Enjoy the view! Wonderful!
A must visit you cannot imagine the beauty.. What a wonderful experience, views all around that cannot be beaten. It takes your breath away. You will never forget it.
Awesome place. We hiked up Skeleton gorge - very hard, requires a level of fitness. But on top the mountain is beautiful, if you can get away from the cable car crowds!
nice, even if you're scared of heights!. I'm just proud of myself for making it up there...Glad I did it, but don't need to do it again! Get your tickets online in advance.
Unstopable views...they go forever...except when foggy!. From the turning floor of the modern gondola to the views, this is a must when visiting Cape Town!! The history is reach...
Beautiful!. The view of the of sunset and the sunrise is worth the wait! Although it was a bit misty and cold after 5 PM, the mystical fog with the breathtaking view over Cape Town was worth it!

Unmissable. We were lucky when we visited Cape Town as the cloud lifted from table mountain and we enjoyed an unforgettable experience going up in the cable car which is modern and air conditioned. The walk on the top was wonderful, with great views.

Amazing views. It is very well worth going to the top of Table Mountain and DO not be put off if you cannot see the top - i.e. if the Table has a full "table cloth". The weather changes so quickly as do the clouds and on the day we went up, we could barely see in front of ourselves. By the time we got to the top it was completely clear! There is so much to see from the top that it is very well worth taking the trip and either take the Cable car or drive, but go early to avoid the crowds.

King of the world. The hikes are very nice and you can view the city at the top of the mountain. Once you start the hike you will feel connected to with the nature and the amazing view will make you forget about your struggle to get to the top!

Can't Come to Cape Town Without taking the Cable Car or Walking up Table Mountain. As I have issue with vertigo, I opted to ride the tram up to Table Mountain, which provides a spectacular views of the city riding up. Once on top, the view is breathtaking. Don't forget to hold on to your ticket as you will need it to ride back down.

Must Visit. I would have liked to have walked up the mountain but we were with a large group and many didn't want to hike up so we went in the lift. Absolutely loved it, just make sure you take a hat unless you want a burnt head, as it can be really hot at the top with no shade!

Very peaceful, lovely views. Despite the hundreds of people around it was a very quiet peaceful experience, lovely way to spend an hour or 2. The café was a bit disappointing in that it had a bit of a grubby feel about it. Shop was very busy. Enjoyable morning.

Simply breathtaking !. Simply breathtaking !! Provides a full view of the city. One of the most beautiful places I have ever visited, is not for nothing that is one of the 7 natural wonders of the world. Walk as much as you can, each point of the mountain is a diferente surprise. Must see in Cape Town!!

Spectacular View. Even though i am afraid of Heights, this was the most beautiful view.
#Tip : remember to go up late afternoon or stay until sunset, you wont be disappointed !

Incredible weather that day. Better than the Grand Canyon. Lots to see. Paths easy.
Get there early as there are queues for the cablecar.
The mountain may be closed if there are high winds or too much cloud - it's very much a matter of luck.
Beautiful Park. The Park, The Cape, The Baboons, The Penguins, the list goes on. The Beaches, the Beauty, the Wild Animals. This is a beautiful park. A must do if you are in the Cape Town Area.

Fantastic. A shame about the weather! Would have been fantastic views on a sunny day! No other day to visit!
Should have taken advice from our hotel to buy ticket there instead of queuing at the top.

Amazing scenery. Clear clouds, terrain and vegetation. Very windy. We didn't see any animal except for a baboon. There are signs everywhere that they can be vicious. We found out first hand when my daughter tried to get some baby food in the trunk of the car. She saw the baboon staring at the food. She got scared so she threw it in the open trunk. The baboon jumped in and stole the baby food. It disappeared very fast. We were worried that it might run away with my daughter's handbag. Luckily, it was only after the food.

always a pleasure!. The whole experience is awesome other than the long queue for the sunset special we had hoped to catch but after we decided we would not be scotched alive it was all bliss.We loved the short 'story' given by the cable car gentleman,the great photo moments at all sorts of angles up there ; the amazing restaurant with food that did not look all that good to the eye but was very tasty we wanted more! the wine selection to go with was most welcome. we experienced our sunset in the cable car going down vs waiting for the crowds to go down post-sunset experience up on the mountain. it was still very nice in there. The fotos were great too...this is truly one more very well managed area in the Western Cape & as a seasoned international traveller way up there with the best!
great views. a must for everyone visiting cape town - the views are to die for. We spent the whole morning exploring and just taking in the views.

Fantastic Views. For a start Table Mountain was much larger in area than I had expected. Good walking paths to stick to if you are not very adventurous, but hardly any restrictions on wandering around the huge area.Certainly worth doing when in Cape Town if you enjoy fantastic views and walking.

Book tickets in advance; amazing!. Highlight of our trip to Cape Town! If you're short on time, like we were, take the table car and book your ticket in advance. Don't be fooled by the weather either - it changes constantly. We left our hotel and it was so cloudy you couldn't see across the street. Literally ten minutes later when we arrived by cab at Table Mountain, it was bright and sunny. We almost stayed back at our hotel because we thought the cable cars would be canceled; thankfully we didn't do that!We had breakfast at the cafe at the top and the coffee was excellent. The little dassies run around everywhere and are incredibly cute. The views on top of the mountain are the best in Cape Town. The best part of Table Mountain is being in the clouds. They literally swirl all around you and you can smell them! It's unbelievable. Highly recommend going here.
Always amazing!. Had cascading clouds down the side of the mountain right next to us - incredible! Spectacuar vistas of majestic Cape Town.

Incredible!. No visit to Cape Town is complete without a visit to Table Mountain National Park. Definitely purchase your tickets online to skip long lines. Also, very important, check online for the ever-changing open-closed status. Once the winds kick up it closes. Tickets are good for one week. In our case it took two days to have the right weather and then as soon as we got up top the winds kicked up and they closed. We were able to enjoy the walks and views but the winds could get quite blustery/gusty. Beware of taxi scams. Taxi driver first tried to convince us that there was a set rate to Camps Bay where we were staying. The hotel had said that it shouldn't be more than 70 Rand. It ended up costing 100 Rand due to our driver's attempts to keep taking "scenic" routes. (We knew our way back and attempted to direct him.)

stunning but crowded. Get there early, the cable car ride up and down are breathtaking...the views stunning...but the crowds can be a little overwhelming...be aware that wind shifts can cause an immediate evacuation of the top

Amazing views at any level. You have to do this if you visit Cape Town. The photo opportunities are amazing no matter what level you are at and the views spectacular. We climbed up two thirds of the way up due to cloud at the top but this did not take anything away from this experience. We then hiked around to Devils Creek which was also very impressive.

A "must see". We took the hop-on-hop-off Red bus to the cable-car station. The queues looked really long, but moved quickly. It helped that we had purchased our tickets in advance from the Rest Bus office.It was a perfect day to visit Table Mountain. Clear sky and no wind. We loved the rotating cable car, by the time you reach the summit, you have had a 360 degree view.We spent about 2 hours at the top, some of the time watching people prepping to abseil off the mountain!  There is also quite a bit of animal and bird life to watch on Table Mountain. We didn't eat or drink at the restaurant so I can't comment on it.Table Mountain is beautiful and you mustn't pass up the opportunity to go up it if you are in Cape Town.

Book Tickets in Advance to Avoid Queues. Used the Red Bus but didnt realise ticket couls be purchased on bus PRIOR to arrival - then faced 45min queue for a ticket at Table Mountain - Buy prior to arrival or online. Fantastic Views
Go but make sure there is no cloud first. Great views, wildlife to see, a better than average restaurant and a reasonable cost. Well worth the trip up and a must do in CT. Go now!
view from the top. Panoramic views of Cape Town, and a unique diversity of plants and animals on the top of the mountain. A little expensive but a worth the trip.
A must see. You just have to do this - hopefully the weather is kind to you as it can shut down if the cloud cover is too bad. A fantastic experience

Don't miss the view of Cape Town Region from Table Mountain!. Yes, it's touristy. Yes, you must wait and stand in line. NO....you must not miss visiting! The views and walking paths are amazing and the ride in the revolving gondola is one of a kind.
Incredible. this is the most incredible experience, my advice would be to go late and watch the sunset when it seems less busy.

a Must. Buy your tickets Online...the quees can be huge. Also the waiting time to get the cable car is long, because there are only 2 and they are slow. Consider at least one hour to get in.
On top the views are amazing but it can get really cold so take a coat.

Continents End. A cut above mere Lands End in Cornwall - this is the tip of the whole continent of Africa although a pedant did tell me that it is not actually the most southerly point. Whatever. It is certainly a lot more impressive than Lands End and the view from the old lighthouse, once you've got your breath back, is amazing. Definitely no disabled access! Shop, cafe etc all very tasteful and you can even stay there in a tented camp. Lovely.

A must do in Cape Town. If you are in Cape Town, please do yourself a favour and visit Table Mountain! Check regularily with your hotel or the website to see if it is open. Often closed because of wind, fog. We went in the morning after being close pretty much all week it was packed. The queue to get up took over 2 hours. When we came down that afternoon, there were no queues, and people just going straight up. So please go in the afternoon if the mountain has been close for a few days. The views above are spectacular! A real highlight and something to see. I will never forget
Must visit. Well, this is the place that you have to visit if you are in Cape Town. And the views from the top are just spectacular. If you have a clear sky that day, then the views are even better.

WOW. This location probably doesn't need a review because it is a national treasure. If you can you must visit this attraction. The cable car taking you there is a great experience. Once on top take your time to walk around and take in the magnificent views. An absolute must to visit. Wait for the guided tour. Very interesting.
Awesome. A very nice hiking. Enjoy the morning for hike up the mountain and have the amazing view. Bring some water and a jacket, because sometime is cold there.

beautiful, scenic, a must if in Cape town. Good guide leaflet, well signed, natural beauty to explore by foot, car or bike. Easy upward climb to Cape point or by rail. lovely walk over to Cape of good Hope, again easy path to follow with fantastic beach en route (if you can do steps) wild ostiches and a fresh breeze from the seas
Well worth a visit. check the weather first and don't go if it's cloudy. Wonderful views from the top of table mountain particularly at sunset.

Gorgeous!. What should I say about one of 7 wonders of nature? It's just amazing. The cable car is very nice too. The climb is very fast and panoramic.The only suggestion is choose a clear and cloudless day, to enjoy all the angles!! Have great pictures!!!

Worth going to. The cable was fun to take and once we were away from the crowds it was very enjoyable to do some hiking on the mountain. Nice view of Cape Town and surrounding capes. Nice nature. Staff was very friendly.
Loved it!!!. Do a hike up the mountain, you won't regret it!!! But we took the cable car down ;) There is a café at the top but do bring your own water anyway.
Brilliant.. Safe and enjoyable. Fun and excellent for the family. Enjoyed the cable car to the top. Lots of foreigners.
Fantastic view from the top. The view from the Table Mountain is simply breathtaking. But be sure you constantly check with the cable way open or closed especially on windy days.
Spectacular. A natural wonder of the world with breath taking views. Not to be missed. Easy access via cable car.

Beautiful views. Super place a must when you visit cape town. The views from the top are amazing and the cafe on top is good as well. Wear warm clothing when you go up the top it was really cold up there.

Speechless. Travel up Via Cable Car and view the city - you cannot be disappointed!
Lots of wildlife and views that will take your breath away - if you get a sunny clear day its priceless!

Excellent life time achievement. Bit of a dull trek, not nearly has fun as Lion's Head. But a thoroughly fulfilling climb and summit experience.
Hated the cafe at the top, overpriced, unfriendly... but any food after that climb would be appreciated - shame.

An amazing surprise in the middle of the city. The whole thing was worth it from the beginning. From the drive up to the cable car to the walk around it and even the food at the restaurant up there was good. IS A MUST SEE for anyone travelling to cape town. But do book your tickets online before and even if its sunny take a jacket with you because it can get very windy.

Awe inspiring. Fantasic, wonderful views, cafe at the top, toilet facilities, could have stayed longer, get your tickets for the cable way ahead of time, can be brought on the hop on hop off tour buses to save time, queue can be long at times, cable car to the top.. would visit again note can close if high winds are present, check before traveling there, hop on hop off bus staff know if its open or not, as do most of the hotels reps. Dont forget your camera..
Spectacular Views. Great views from the main entrance area. Crowded parking area, though so you may be in for a hike to get to the cable car area.

A beautiful place to visit. Expect high, cool winds! Dress appropriately.. This park encompasses an impressive rock formation jutting through Cape Town. It's iconic. Bring a camera! It's just a wonderful place to visit.

Don't go first thing in the morning. This was absolutely breath taking. I loved every thing except the line. Everyone told us to go early so we did and we stood in line for at least and hour. When we came out at around 2:30pm there was no line and people were strolling in. You must go its stunning!!!!

Worth the drive to Cape Point. If you go to Cape Point go early, it gets crowded in the afternoon, Cape Point surprised me, the area is very rocky and a lot higher than I though it would be, we also drove out to Cape of Good Hope, the most southern tip of Africa, It is a great drive along the coast, lots of coastal towns and the penguins to see along the drive
Peak experience. Obviously the premier attraction of the city well worth thee rater long wait for the cable car for the spectacular view
Hard walk up, but worth it. Walked up, cable car down. 1hr 20 mins of fairly hard graft ti get top the top. Amazing views, Cafe was heaving with a 20min wait for coffee ! A must do

There at last!. The views are so magnificent if you are lucky with the weather and the 'tablecloth' had lifted. The cable car rotates so all can get good pictures. We recommend getting there when the park opens at 8.00 am as queues build up. There are good walks all around the top and several lookout points. Well worth the wait!

Must Do in Cape Town. The iconic Cape Town attraction.It can be cold / windy / very hot - so be prepared!Go in the afternoon, the queues are far longer in the morning when the coach parties arrive. About 13.00 / 13.30 is quite a good time as the morning tourists are leaving. Buy your tickets on the internet to avoid the queue for the ticket purchase, the tickets have extended validity, not just for a specific day.If you are driving note that there are parking spaces further up the road past the entrance to the cablecar.The platform inside the cablecar rotates so if you are on the outer edge you will get a good view of everything. Once on the top do join the guided tour as you will learn so much about Table Mountain, otherwise you are just wandering about looking at the view.You can stay up there as long as you like but listen out for the warning siren if they are about to close the mountain. A couple of years ago some friends ignored it and had to walk down the mountain - not to be recommended unless you are fully equipped!
Don't Miss It.. Beautiful x 10! A must see for any Cape Town traveler. Be sure to go up at your first opportunity because the weather can close it down very quickly.

Obviously a must!. The Cable ride experience and the mountains picturesque view is a not miss if you are in Capetown. For adventure lover, you also have options for few activity like rappelling , rock climbing.The weather in Capetown is completely unpredictable so you can expect the cable rides to be open only on a less cloudy and windy day. Cable way tickets can be booked online , but you will still end up standing in queue for your turn into the Cable way. There are good food , water and souvenir available at Table cafe . I must say, it is one of the most beautiful places I have visited till date.

No brainer - must do - clear day only if possible!. Revolving cable car, stunning, breathtaking views (on a clear day!!!) The walks all around the top are amazing, be sure to observe the flora and fauna also. Its a selfie heaven!

fantastic but take care when going down. We took cable car up and hiked around towards maclear's beacon before taking Platteklip George down. Do note that this walk down is very streneous and takes a very long time. Use good shoes and do not attempt it if you are not in good physical condition or don't have enough water with you !

Do not miss it!. A must when you are in Cape Town! Can be closed some days because of the wind, so if it is open when you are there go! Amazing views of Cape Town. We took the cable car up, which has a fee, but otherwise the park is free. I would recommend taking some of the paths around the mountain, but make sure to bring water and comfortable walking shoes.

Simply Fantastic. The best advice I can give; If it's a clear, cloud free day at the top, do it.If you planned something else that day, And haven't done this yet and are due to do this later in the week; Change your plans - Seriously. Don't hesitate, grab the nearest cab and go.It might be the only time it's clear while you are there. This is not to be missed.I speak from experience; the first time I went to Cape town, we had a pre-booked trip the only day the mountain was cloud free, and didn't make it up there. the 2nd trip we made it. It's a must do.

Birthday freebie. A lot of South Africans are not aware that on your birthday, if you produce your SA ID book, you get free access to the mountain. My twin sister and I have had "double the fun" every year, since we re-located to Cape Town in 2001. You produce your ID at the ticket office - the attendant sings you a Happy Birthday (over the loudspeaker - for everyone to hear......Lol!). You proceed along the line, and honestly, at every stop, the next attendant wishes you a Happy Birthday. It's amazing.♫♫ Although our birthday is not in the most favourable month, we have never not had a wonderful experience.

On top of the world..... .....or at least that's what it feels like.A must-do for any visitor to Cape Town.Here are som tips to enable you to make the most of your visit:1) Book your ickets online and avoid the queues at the ticket office. Your ticket is valid for a two week period of your choicw2) Remeber that the conditions (wind or cloud) can close the cableway so be prepared to be flexible over yor visit date. My motto is if you see the cable car running , go for it, because tomorrow it may not be3) If arriving by taxi or the hop on hop off bus, you'll be dropped off right by the ticket office. If you're travelling by car, be prepared to walk to the cableway station4) There is plenty of parking available on the road to the cableway station. My advice is to avoid parking on the roadway leading up to the cableway as this can mean a 30 minute walk at busy periods. Instead, drive right up to the cableway station and then carry on past the bus turning point. There is plenty of parking on the roadside beyond and it will probably mean a shorter walk5) Most people head for the open sides of the cable car - but it rotates as it moves up the mountain, so wherever you are you will get a great view6) Wear the tight footwear for your visit - flip flops are not ideal!7) It is 6 or 7 degrees cooler at the summit than the bottom - You may need a sweater or jacket8) I suspect many people never venture more than 400m from the upper cableway station. Take the opportinity to see some fabulous views and fill your lungs with fresh air by following one of the many well-marked trailsEnjoy your trip - we did!

Great views. A must visit location in Cape Tow. We were told to prebook our tickets months and days ahead of our visit, we didn't, but on arrival at about 10am on a Monday morning on the Hop on Hop off bus, the ticket office was empty!! Nice cafe on the summit, try the chocolate cake :)
Don´t miss it. Up here in the national park you´re gonna love it. They have made so perfectly and you take good time to just go around.This is also a thing you have to do when you are in Cape Town

Spectacular! 3,500ft above sea level.. A bit cloudy that day but great views once the clouds passed over. Ride up was great. Opportunity hike a few routes but did not take up. Already afraid of heights but could not let this opportunity pass me by. Please note the cable car does rotate as it goes up and down to ensure everyone has a view!!
On top of the world. Amazing experience and a must for all Cape Town visitors. So much to see and experience with stunning views of the City and Robben Island.

Stunning Views, Unique - a must see!. Amazing views! This is the "must do " in Cape Town. spectacular journey up in the Cable Car. Having taken in the spectacular views when you get to the top you then have all the time in the world to wander along the top of the mountain. You can never tire of the views and it is so peaceful once you are away from the cable car entrance.Some tips: pick a good day, beware it can be cool on top, the queues move quicker than you expect and picking the right day ( for the weather) beats a pre-booked ticket I suggest. Eat before or after the visit - the cafe is not worth the hassle.Overall spectacular and good, helpful staff.

An experience of a Life Time !. We ( my wife and I) turned 50 in feb ! Decided to do something crazy and climb the Table Mountain. We got in touch with Lauren Medcalf of Mothercity Hikers - she is a DEAT certified mountain guide and her contact number is + 27 72 5303464 or lauren@mothercityhikers.co.za....and from day 1, she has been ever so patient with us, having answered over 2 dozen various queries of ours. Remember, we never exercise, trek or have ever climbed a mountain before. Lauren assured us - nothing to worry, and we trusted her words. We decided to do the woody ravine route. On the day of our climb, she picked us up promptly at 6am, and brouth with her, napsacks, hiking poles, hats, jackets and we started climbing at approximated 6.30... took out 6 tedious hours, but it was worth every effort climbing the oldest mountain in the world ! What superb views, vegetation, scenery and flowers.... We huffed and puffed and panted right to the very top and though at some points my leg cramped up, lauren was prompt to stop, give me something to drink, an energiser and I was back to walking.... At the end of It, I got a certificate saying - Congrats ! you climbed the table mountain !This is Capetowns No 1 attraction, and I am grateful to Lauren for helping me achieve my dream of climbing the Table Mountain. The route is rough, and a bit tedious, but with the right guide to push you onwards, youre in safe hands ! At the end of it, we climbed 1200 metres and walked 9.8 kms ! Thank god the weather was superb. Thank you Lauren once again, and for those reading - if youre young, fit, and want to do something different, perhaps a once in a life time experience, get in touch with Lauren and Climb to Table Mountain, its truly worth it ! We came down by cable Car - Ooh what a steep decline ( R 115 per person)....thank god for the cable way!
Must see. Not much to say except that if you come to Cape Town and you have not been up the mountain then just come back and do it again
Magnificent!. How can you visit Cape Town and not make the trip via cable cars to Tabe Mountain.Views are absolutely stunning!CANNOT be missed

Truly Fabulous!. What an amazing place to visit. To walk along the top of Table Mountain on a crisp clear day is to experience one of the wonders of the World! Absolutely fabulous and one not to miss!!
Tram up mountain. Tram ride is amazing but scary. We sent the kids up and waited at the bottom. Parking easy and available.

See it to believe it!. Yes, this is the premier thing to do in Cape Town and for good reason. The views from both below and on the mountain are spectacular! Definitely purchase tickets online prior to arriving to save both time and money. The cable car ride up is unique with it's rotating floor to allow everyone a good view on the way up and back down. Be sure to take a sweater or jacket, it was a sunny, warm 26C in Cape Town but very windy and a cool 17C on top of the mountain. The vinbos flora is unique to the area and amazing to see. There is an easily accessible pathway to follow but do venture off onto the more rustic pathways (need decent hiking shoes for the rocks) for a better sense of the size and topography of the mountain.

A big wow every time I go up the Mountain. I took a client up the other day and was as awe-struck as he was. The views over the Atlantic seaboard, the city and out towards Cape point were truly magnificent. A definite must when in Cape Town if the weather allows.

Has to be done.... I am terrified of heights but was determined to do this. I didn't manage to walk up it as I had no clue how this worked so I took the cable car up and down. The staff were really friendly answering all my stupid questions about how long it takes etc. and the cable car driver could tell I was anxious so he sat me down on the one sat there is (you stand in the rotating car so you get a 360 degree view). I'm glad I did it as it was fantastic. And when you get to the top it's amazing as there is a cafe, a shop and spectacular views from what is a much bigger area than you'd imagine. I'd recommend buying your cable car pass in advance as the ticket que is big and then you have to que again to get into the car. Make sure you do it on a clear day and remember the weather in Capetown can change very quickly so do it as soon as the weather is fine!
Stunning View. This is an absolute must do in Cape Town. I loved the ride on the cable car and the view of the city below was breathtaking.
Incredible perspective. Amazing views and gives you an understanding of the geography where Atlantic and Indian oceans meet.

Cape Point / Cape of Good Hope .. amazing views. Cape of Good HOPE is another point on top of my list .. driven to the National Park , up on the funicular to the top , amazing views .. and to reach Cape of Good Hope was the highlight on my trip.The entrance fee R 125 which is great value, we seen ostrich , baboons , impala which were great highlights to the trip.

You must visit this stunning Hotel and Restaurant. We have dined here on various occasions. Both in the Leopard bar/room and in the Azure Restaurant. Quality and perfection spring to mind. And yet you still receive that homely friendly feeling. The one were you feel the comfort of receiving both personal and homely attention. You are relaxed from the moment you enter the establishment. You can chill out on the veranda or in the Leopard lounge and enjoy the views. You can sit at the bar and chat to the friendly barman. You can go into the Azure Restaurant and be really pampered at the same time, as not being overwhelmed.. Do not let this slip by your Cape Town experience.. We highly recommend a visit..Oh by the way..The bathrooms are to die for. We have never unfortunately had the need for accommodation.. Maybe one day we can also experience the pleasure of a stop over or short stay.

Must-Do In Cape Town. Table Mountain, the home of the best views in Cape Town! You can either hike the mountain or take a cable car. The hike isn't that enjoyable and there are better hikes to do in Cape Town (Lions head is my favorite) so I would recommend that you take the cable car. The weather is very important for this activity so don't plan around it. If it is a little cloudy or windy, they will close the cable car. This happens a lot! I would recommend that you go in the morning around 8am when they open to avoid long queues in peak season (December - February). Be sure to check their website to see if the cable car is open.
A fantastic scenary. A fantastic scenary, we saw far distance of both the Atlantic ocean and The Indian ocean. The city was right below us.You could also walk up, but it seems dangerous!
How high can you go. It started out as a foggy morning. Then the sky cleared and the 360' view was awesome. At the top of table mountain you see it all.
<3. If you want to avoid crowds, don't travel during holiday season in December. But despite the crowds, things move and you will see what you want to see.

More Than Just a Table. Table Mountain is just the northern tip of a national park that stretches from Table Bay all the way to Cape Point about 80 km (50 mi) to the south, taking in just about all of what people normally think of as "Cape Town".There are places of free access, as well as places where you have to pay (Kirstenbosch Gardens, Aerial Cableway, Cape Point Reserve). It is a great mountain to walk on, inlcuding a five-day hutted hiking trail. You can mountain bike, horse ride or paraglide on (or off) the mountain. However, if you do just one thing in Cape Town, take the cableway to the summit and spend some time up there; it's breathtaking.
Good trip. Go for sunset. Glass of wine on bar terrace a view to remember, we liked it very much, sun protection is a must.
fantastic view. Do not miss the cable car ride and spend a lot of time there.Beautiful view.Lot of souvenir shops. There is a ticket for the cable car ride which you can also save as a souvenir.

Everything and More. Of course we've all seen Table Mountain in photos, but to experience it is something else. The views are stupendous, but the microclimate and plant species on top were really amazing. it's a harsh and beautiful place all at once. If you only have one full day in Cape Town, I can't imagine not doing this and only this.

Amazing Views. You may wait in line a bit to get into the cable car, but it is worth the wait. Buy your ticket from your hotel or online BEFORE you go, to save yourself hours of possibly waiting. Views are spectacular! Bring lots of memory cards!

amazing. no matter how many times I go, it is always a real blessing. very organised, well done ! Was dreading a long que to get in, but lucky we got in quite quickly. Long que moved quickly, so don't be overwhelmed. you can book online in advance, that que is MUCH SHORTER, highly recommened.

Bucketlist thing. Just do it ! The nature on and around the table mountain is wonderfull. Dont take the cableway and walk up ( if you are able).
The view that you have is wonderfull.
Fabulous. We missed the 2.5 hour queue to get up on the cable car, but it would have been worth waiting. Unforgettable, and justifiably one of the seven natural wonders of the world
Brilliant... just the most amazing views, over Cape Town but you do have to pick your time,wind and cloud closes it down quickly..

Pure splendour. A gorgeous young dassie, unfazed by the giant tourists looming over it, decided at lunch time to venture onto the path to dine on five dandelions in full bloom. The tourist gathered and were mesmerized by the sheer verve of this miniature relative of the elephant became the best advocate of tourism in the Western Cape.

Fresh Air. We actually hiked Table Mountain, so it was quite an experience! When we got to the top we felt like we had a reward for all that effort. Amazing view from cape town. Clean and fresh air! Nice spot for great photos!!!
have to!!
hike up if you can. Simplystunning up there. Thehike seems impossible, but it isn't. Sure beats standing in line for hours for the cable car

Tabling it... Loved it! I do advice paying attention to the minimal signs that direct you to the top. The first day I tried walking up, I was looking down at my feet most of the time (as you are climbing very steep rocks, it makes sense ;-)). So, since I was looking down, I didn't notice the sign that told me to go left. I went right and didn't make it to the top before it got dark. Second day, paid attention and made it up in about an hour and a half and had breakfast at the top. Road the cable car back down. Great time!

Amazing. Well organised and breath taking. Loved the whole experience. The views are of course second to none. We were lucky it was a clear day. Do not park miles away , drive up to the ticket area and then past there. You can find parking nearer .

beautifull scenery. Quiet and lot's to see and do.You do need a car. Can be crowded in the high season. Best to leave your hotel early in the morning and make a small ' list of things you want to do' .
Just magnificant, great experience. I loved all, the cableway, the view, the all in all experience. You cannot visit Cape Town without going there!

Amazing. Absolutely stunning views that go on and fantastic on a clear day.i have been up when it's cloudy and you really feel like you are on top of the world.lovely to walk around and you can sit and have a drink and something to eat.i don't like cable cars but was ok in this one which rotates as it goes up. A must visit if you are in cape town

Awesome Views!. We had one of those extremely clear, blue sky days and had a 360-degree view from the top. After taking the gondola to the top, it was awesome! We went early in the morning, perhaps the second large group to get there, so we had a minimal wait for the ride up. Then the views from the top were spectacular. A must do for any visitor! and locals, too, if they haven't done so!

Wow!. Caught the cable car up. Spectacular views from the top.Walking on the footpaths at the summit was a delight. It's like a rock garden and could have wandered the paths all day so allow at least a couple of hours to enjoy it. There is a nice little cafe at the top too.

If No Wind & No Cloud a Fantastic place to Visit. A must for Cape town great the views with interesting Flora & Fauna , the queues can be long getting up, go early to miss the coach tours. cable car expensive R225 (£22.50p) return but you have to do it

On top of the world. I've seen many national parks but I truly believe that Table Mountain is one of the most beautiful ones. Either hike up (careful, it's not an easy stroll) or take the cable car to the top of the mountain to get the awe-inspiring view down on Cape Town, Robben Island and the Atlantic Ocean.
Breathtaking. Simple, if you have not seen this you have to go!! The views are spectacular. Go at 5pm, so you can have a snack and witness a beautiful sunset.

On a clear day you can see for miles. The view from the top is stunning, and also the flora on top of Table Mountain is a surprise to many. The cable car is a modern, rotating car so everyone can see.

Breath taking. This is an absolute must, we had a early tour and it wasn't to busy, recommend taking a jacket as it was quite cold at the top. We really enjoyed the whole experience and just going on the cable car is an experience in its self. When we got to the top we were lucky enough to see little bush rabbits, I cannot remember the correct name sorry. Well worth doing.

Wonderful...bring your sun screen. We spent four hours walking the trails, marveling at the 360 degree views, taking pictures and just climbing around. We had a perfect day weather wise and took full advantage of it. We did not purchase our passes on-line which I would suggest. You can skip the line this way and while we had about a 25 minute wait, I could see where there might be days the wait is much longer. I'm not sure what we were thinking.This is just one of those natural sites you don't want to miss. For squeamish height people, you can ride up in the middle of the large gondola and never have to look down. For the people who have to charge to the front and push to the "best" view, don't waste your time...the floor rotates 360 degrees on the quick ride up and down so while you start at the front looking up the mountain, before you know it you are turned around looking at the ocean. The cost was reasonable as is everything in South Africa. The Rand was about 10:1 to the dollar (I always get this wrong so to be clear, for every dollar you get ten Rand so ten dollars=one hundred Rand).For accessibility, there are areas close to the gondola that are pathways and there are some close, short trails which are wheelchair accessible but the entire mountain area doesn't have a path. There is a restaurant that was accessible too and the gondola wouldn't be a problem at all.Don't miss this if you are in town.
Awesome!. Purchase your tickets online to avoid the long queue. It took us like 30 minutes just to get the tickets. Other than that, great time spent there!

fantastic view. cape town is known for table mountain which is the main icon.there is a cable car which takes one to the top.The view from the top is absolutely enchanting.Vegetation consists of small bushes which are endemic.we had booked online but there was not much crowd anyway when we visited.however,advice is to book in advance as it can be crowded at times.There is a restaurant and shop also on the top.

Wonderful landscapes and views. Really enjoyed hiking some of the scenic trails up on and alongside the mountain over several days and at different times of day. Experienced early morning calm as well as high noon or tranquility of sunsets.

It's been a while.... I havent been up Table Mountain in nearly 12 years. I had haunting memories of queuing for hours in the blazing sun on the the annual december family holiday. I have been to CPT multiple times since but never ever considered going back up.On a recent personal/business trip in Feb it was decided that we will go up to see it again. With bad childhood memories rushing back, we approached the cablecars. I was blown away by how much more professional it effcient it was.The cable cars are bigger and now rotate. All in took about 15 minutes and I was soaking in potentially the best view in the world.The weather was warm but not hot, a light breeze and just enough cloud cover to make for the most spectacular views.The whole experienced changed my view on Table Mountain.Now I know why it is one of the top tourist attractions in the world.
Awsome. I have heard and read about Table Top Mountain since I was a small boy and I was not disappointed when I got to the top. The views are breath taking.

Must seen in Cape Town. A must seen place if you ever come to Cape Town. Either you walk up the mountain or you take the (safe) cable car. The cable car itself is produced in Switzerland, what let me feel very safe (I mean the Swiss know how to built cable cars up to high mountains, no?). The cable car itself is rotating and you already have in there a spectacular view over Cape Town. But not comparable to the "real" view from the mountain itself. It's just undescribable, just go up there and enjoy that breathtaking view by yourself. Have fun! :)

Magnificent Table Mountain. Lots of tourists which makes it a bit crowded, but once away from the masses, the walks and the views of Cape Town and the ravines are spectacular. Stunning walks. Restaurants a bit over priced, but a great experience.
Top of the world. Great view, fast trip, well laid out paths. some mistakes in the bronze map, like refering to the Indian Ocean as the Atlantic

Great 360 views. On a clear day, you really can see forever. This is way better than the 108th floor Ozone bar in Hong Kong! Or the CN Tower in Toronto. You're a 1 km height above the city and the ocean(s) and you can really get a great impression of Cape Town and surroundings.The Cable Car is a bit pricey, but one can walk if one is deterred by this. It's like the Grouse Grind in Vancouver in terms of the walk, except not much tree cover.
Fast, clean and very good. It was fast, friendly, clean and the food was very good, big portion. There were also a lot of different options, so it looks like it caters for a wide variety of people.

Best viwes on earth!. Love this place, the wise says it all. Take your own bottle of bubbly, and it will be a sunset that you will never forget (on a good day of course)! A must to visit if you're in Cape Town or surrounds during your travels!

A Must See in Capetown. Hint:First look on the homepage how the view and how windy it is.At the right time you will make an unforgettable experience.Since 1997 the new cabins of the aerial cableway allow you to have a surrounding look while ascending.Easy to walk,no ascending slopes,interesting vegetation and small animals like the "Dassie", some birds and lizards you will find on top of the mountain.

That view!. Not really sure how anyone could come on here and say they disliked this experience, the view was breathtaking and the cable car up was comfortable and spacious enough for the amount of people up there. It's a once in a lifetime experience and definitely worth the cost of the cable car if you're as lazy as my friends and I ;)
Amazing experience. Just amazing. Breath taking views. Amazing restaurant. Very nice cable car ride. A must do in Capetown

A must stop if you are in Capetown even a little while .... I've been on higher mountains all of the world, but there is a unique beauty about Table Mountain. The rock formations are unique, and their rugged angularity makes fabulous viewing juxtaposed against the ocean and the city below. Even if it were less extraordinary, the proximity of Table Mountain to a major city make it a remarkable place.
Wow, breath taking. You've got to see the view, you get a great view of Robien island from the Top. Its a little chilly up there even when the sun is out as you would expect but worth it.

Views To Die For. Any visit to Cape Town requires that you take the ride up to the top and wear your hiking shoes or a good pair of sneakers. Don't forget your camera: the 360 degree views are extraordinary and breathtaking. We ate in the restaurant at the top after a lengthy walk: the ostrich pie was excellent.

Amazing. The views are totally awesome, and if you get the chance to go to the top of the mountain you must not miss it. We could have spent all day up there. Be aware it gets very hot, so water and sunscreen are a must.
Great hiking. There are several hikes to go up the mountain. I did Kasteelpoort, which is a great hike with wonderful views

If you're up for a challenge and weather is good - GO!. My sister had recommended me to climb up the Table Mountain via Platteklip Gorge after her own families experience a week before us. She didn’t tell me how tough it was though, but just from the sight from the start we had two persons in our family who bailed out. They would have made it, but if you’re not up for a challenge it wouldn’t have been a nice experience. The rest of us took our backpacks with 2 water bottles each and snacks like fruit, water melon and cookies. Since it was a very warm day we skipped the sweaters we were recommended to bring. The climb, it is a climb even if you don’t have to use your hands, takes nearly 2 hours. To manage you will have to be in a pretty good shape. When entering the gorge you realize that during not so hot days it can be quite chilly and that you might need a sweater or jacket since you walk in the shadow and the wind can be quite rough. The weather can change quickly too, so it is better to be safe than sorry. After the great work out you are rewarded with fantastic sights. There are easier walks on the top for the people choose to go up by cable car and of course you get stunning sights too. But you feel a lot better having climbed all the way up yourself! Some people choose to trek the way down instead, but I’m not sure that is a lot easier. Knees and legs will be quite sore after that too.Mind that there can be a very long car queue both up or down to the cable car station. It took us 35 minutes to get down. It would have been quicker to walk down to the crossing or the parking places closer to it. Don’t trek in bad weather! Going through a cloud is both wet, cold and you’re not sure to get your reward.There is a fee for the cable car to get down. Unless you'd like to hike down.
Don't miss it. This is a can't miss attraction in Cape Town. Make sure to explore beyond the shop/restaurant and follow the trails for peace/quiet.Beautiful views.
Spectacular views!. Amazing views of Cape Town, good walking track, flowers and dassies - we were lucky to get a gorgeous day. Go when you can, it often closes for fog.

Misty View. We had only a few days in Cape Town and of course the day we decided to go up Table Mountain it was overcast. Once we were are the top we were pleased that we had decided to make the trip that day. We have been up Table Mountain a few years back but not in the mist. The mist cleared and cover up so quickly. It was wonderful to see the City between the clouds.
Hiking to top from Kirstenbosch. Very nice hiking route.Medium advanced, for normal to fit persons.Kept fairly good pace and only a few short stops and made it in 4 hours.

Fantastic views. Fab views from table mountain. Very quick ride on the cable car which I thought was going to be scary but it was lovely. Took a big fleece as though it may be cold but instead was really really hot and got sunburnt.

Just go!. Table mountain is really a "must see" when in Capetown. it's beautiful and on a clear day, you can see everything. You can see little dassies running around, and lots of birds. We took the gondola and I would do it again. Lovely café and at the top! Pricey giftshop- I recommend the locally run ones down below! Enjoy! http://www.sanparks.org/parks/table_mountain/
Great Experience. We went up at around 18:00 so we could experience the Sunset but we also found it was half price after 18:00 ---- Bonus

Table Mountain. Amazing views, well worth a couple of hours trip up to the top on the cable car, but don't go if you are afraid of heights!! Fantastic views on a clear day you can see all of Cape Town and the surrounding bay. Food good in the café and very reasonable
wow but climb it. skip the cablecar and climb it. Go to the Beacon. And most of all keep clear from the stinky lazy crowd that stays in a 500m radio from the cablecar station...
Visit to Table Mountain. Fantastic view of Cape Town and the surrounding landscape. The clouds look like waterfalls streaming down the mountain side.
Great Views Over CPT. Natural wonder of the world. get there early to avoid the queues. the walk up is worth it but take the cable car down
Stunning. The Cape Flora / Fynbos, Fauna, stunning views and walks are difficult to beat. Make sure you take extra water on a hot/sunny day.

Nature at its best. The Proteas grow wild, what a beautiful sight. Lots of different species fantastic if you are an outdoor person. Lots to see and do you could possible spend another hour just looking around the National Park

great view. I went there with my 3 kids, they where very excited to take the cable car up the mountain and I think also a little afraid....
on top of the mountain I was a little afraid that the kids could fall off, it is a little dangerous, but we enjoyed the trip and returned safely

The beacon of Cape Town. We were fortunate that our cable car tickets had been pre-booked (saves queue time) and the weather was fine ....cloud free. The free tour was informative and worth spending the hour with the guide to get an overview before setting off by ourselves to explore the top . Unfortunately, there were very few flowers on show ....next visit would have to be in Spring

WOW. I have a fear of heights but had to see the view. The cable car was smooth and fast, so much so I felt happy to stand on the outside. Once on the top its was amazing. The cloud was on one side but it was worth getting up early for.

Good day out. The Mountain is such an experience - the cable car can accommodate those with height fears - find the seat in the middle. The paths are well marked and easy to follow. Treat yourself to walking to Maclear Beacon to really experience the mountain and enjoy the space. The restaurant is ok - variety and good size portions - but you need to understand the queuing system which is over complicated and creates unnecessary queues - not happy to sit down to cold food.
Magical. Sun set on Table Top Mountain, what else can I say the whole experience was just magical, from beginning to end, need I say any more........
Did not disappoint. Great experience. Loved wandering around and seeing the different view points. The Cable car turns as it goes up. Thrilling

Is it one of the 7 wonders?. Feeling in a dream. It is so unreal. A paradise for those who like to hike in the mountains. Views and stuff... Good souvenir shop, found v.ery inexpensive and unique things there. The cafeteria is also very decent.

Well worth a visit. It was closed two days in a row due to heavy winds, but finally opened. We did not book online but that is advisable. We waited 45 min before we entered the cable car, unbooked. Ir booked you go straight in.
Don't miss it. Every part of it is thrilling, from the cable car ride to the paths around the top. Didn't walk up. Maybe next time.

Great view of Sunset. When visiting Cape Town a visit up Table Mountain should be one thing that you definitely do. We were lucky enough to get 1/2 price enter after 6pm (I Think they run a promotion mid Jan through to Feb). Definitely worth booking online tickets as queue was about 45 minutes and then we had to queue for cable car (I think out queuing time was very quick compared to how long it can be)I'm terrified of heights, so did have to stand away from windows on cable car! Once up the mountain, as long as you don't go near the edge, you should be fine. Views over city, camps bay etc are great and the sunset visit is magical.
Must do when here. Make sure it's a clear day. Fantastic views and landscape certainly well worth a visit but book ticket can be busy

Great view. We purchased our tickets online before we travelled as recommended by our travel agent and helpfully the tickets cover a 2 week period as the weather is very unpredictable and high winds close the cable car.

Go early in the day. This was my third trip up Table Mountain over a period of 23 years, and it was as exciting as the first visit. As described in other reviews the vista is stunning in several directions, and the top of the mountain has not been spoiled, despite the huge number of visitors that it accommodates. The pathways are easy to walk and the views are unspoiled by fences or safety rails; go as close to the edge as you dare!It is best not to pre-book the cable car since Cape Town is a windy city; the cable car may be closed and the mountain may be covered in cloud. You can ascend in cloud to see the mountain top, but the views will be sacrificed.Practical advice: * Take the first cable car of the day - 8am in the summer [December] to reduce time spent in the queue and to get away from crowds * There is no car park by the cable car so leave your car on the side of the approach road as soon as you see other cars parked * Wear comfortable shoes so that you can walk on rocks at the top * Allow twice the time indicated on the information boards for the walks, simply because you need to stop so often to enjoy the views* Binoculars are useful but not compulsory * Go looking for the Dassies close to the café; they hang out close by but are not necessarily easy to spot [look over the walls onto the rocks below] * There is no need to take up a certain position by the window in the cable car because it revolves on the way up * Don't forget sunscreen. And last but not least * Allow plenty of time because you will kick yourself if you don't!

Pick a quieter time of year!. I finally managed to get to the top on my 4th visit to Cape Town in nearly 50 years. We started out early and only had a 1-hour wait at the Cable Station. Outstanding views and an awesome experience. Should be on everyone's bucket list but do try to avoid the Christmas holiday crowds!

Visit. Wonderful attraction to do if weather permits. As you go up the mountain the views are amazing and it spins very slowly and gently so wherever you are on the lift you get an equal opportunity to sample the view. Amazing

Top of the Table. a wonderful way to see Cape Town from the top and experience this wonder of nature. 'We took a climb up which is a nice bit of exercise and being up there was literally up in the clouds.

Must go. Views from the cable car and the viewing points at the top are amazing. There are views off all sides of the mountain. Obviously try to go up the mountain on a clear day. November can be mixed visibility

Clear day essential. A lovely clear day so a great trip with good views plus fauna & flora. Cable car rotates as it ascends so everyone gets a view of everywhere during the journey. Top well laid out with multiple viewpoints. One can spend more time at the top and take a long walk. Some paths uneven, one member of our group was a bit unsteady so was not able to do the longer walk. The following day it was covered in heavy cloud but the cable cars still took people to the top, which will not have been much fun in the cloud!
No words. Awesome, you have to go to know what I mean. you cant miss this place especially if you are a traveler. Cape people are blessed to have access whole year.

Amazing experience. Awe-inspiring views. We arrived when it was bright and sunny and witnessed the "table cloth" come over the mountain. From bright sun to howling winds to rain, we saw the weather change in the short span of a few hours. Wear sensible shoes and a waterproof jacket, and you can spend the whole day walking around the tracks on the mountain.
head above the clouds. A fantastic experience, I was a bit short on time so had to et the cable car up and back, It was great but would have loved the hike!

A view to the Sea. Wonderful experience after initially feeling a bit nervous about the revolving cable car ride to the top. Got over that when we saw people rock climbing to the top in the mist and clouds. Yu need plenty of time to explore the table top & wear strong shoes as the surface is quite rocky in places. ven the view from above the clouds was wondrful. She shop is well worth a visit - find the guy making jewellery; he has some lovely things that he has made. I now have a totally unique ring for a very reasonable price. (get a VAT receipt and it will be even less).

An unique experience. Allthough everybody who is visting Cape Town goes there, you should go there too!The Table Mountain itself is a very speciel nature experience. The speciel animal life and vegetation is very unique.The view is fantastic, so be sure to go there on a sunny day.Best thing is to get up early, check the weather forecast, and get up there.It seems a bit odd, but there is also a very nice cafe on top of the Mountain, which is worth a try. Buy a bottle of something nice, sit down and enjoy the surroundings.
Fabulous ,. Allow yourself plenty of time to explore top, fabulous views , great shops , coffee shop a bit slow service. No guarantee the cable car will be open , hope you are lucky
Amazing views. The cable car revolves do everyone gets a 360 degree view. It's incredible when you get to the top and it's flat .......you can walk all the way across the table top

Challenging climb with breathtaking rewards. We trecked up Platteklip Gorge to the top of Table Mountain. It is a well marked but steep climb with many steps.
