We are 50 and the climb took 1 hr and 50 minutes. The views on the way up are lovely and the view from the top is breathtaking. This was a highlight from our visit to Cape Town. It is well worth doing if you are fit. We took the return trip by cable car.
Must do. Pick a nice day and have time to walk around the park , breath taking views . Watch the wind outlook so your not stuck walking down
A Must see. Although there is a big rush to the Table mountain, it is worth the wait. The view is fantastic. One must reacxh early and have the breakfast at the Table mountain top

amazing. the views were breath taking. I could not get enough. The facilities that are up there wer great shop and café. you could go on guided walks that were free and do walks on own there was a great choice. I loved it from start to finish and would do it again.

Climb It Yourself!. I don't care if it takes you 2 hours or 12, I recommend you hike up yourself! There is always the tram that can take you back down. It was one of the most amazing experiences of my life!

WARNING RE MAINTENANCE. I write this review because table mountain is spectacular and the tram unbelievably high, HOWEVER, IT IS CLOSED FOR 10 DAYS PER YEAR FOR MAINTENANCE so if this is at the top of your list for things to do in Cape Town by all means go but CHECK THE MAINTENANCE SCHEDULE. We were there in August for 5 days and the tram was closed the entire time. We were really disappointed that we didn't get to go up the tram. There is a way to hike up but it is a trek.

Stunning! . If the clouds are clear then go up at the first opportunity, the weather changes so quickly you may never get another chance! Fabulous views and amazing walks, you won't regret the cable car ride either fantastic!

Spinal extremity continental emblem. A synthesis comprising an assortment of 'topographically prominent' natural features of the Cape Peninsula (Lion;s Head, Table Mountain, Cape Point, Constantiaberg) retaining interesting flora. These features are not in a uniform setting (beware) - urban areas intervene. You have to devote at least a day to explore.
EXCELLENT. Loved the breath taking views, walks on the mountain. Take the guided tour as very informative but didn't like the long queues.
Amazing views.. You should go there. It has one of the most amazing views EVER. It is not very expensive, and I suggest to see the awesome sunset.
Stunning. I loved the stunning views of the city and the cape from the cablecar ride up the mountain. I also enjoyed just walking around the mountain once we'd arrived at the top of the mountain.
Views are amazing. Used the cable car to ascend the mountain, plenty of other people were also there but it didn't feel crowded. Amazing views down onto Camps Bay, the city itself and Robben Island.

Come to Table. Table mountain offers a panoramic view of the Cape city. Although very touristy it is a must see because you get the big picture. The cable cars offer a 360d swerve which is exhilarating and the Table mountain offers so many sights of the cape that you just go WOW! We took the ride post 6pm which was at half the rate - this is a good option because you also get the sunset - the city lights are ornamental and a sight that even pictures can't represent fully.

Table Mountian. The photos of this destination kind of are enough to make you want to go see it. The view is incredible even in the cable car on the way up. Food is good at the top and it makes for a good walk if you do the table.
Cable Car when in Cape is a Must.. I liked being on top of the mountain, u can see as fat as you like,cables cars gives a great view as well

You must see Cape Town from Table Mountain. The cable car can get busy, we went up at about 4pm and it was quiet, we went straight on - I guess the after lunch rush had finished and the sunset rush hadn't started... It is great views from the cable car, note that on the way up the inside of the cable car rotates to ensure everyone gets a panoramic view - really clever.We did the 45 minute walk on the top - plus went down into the small valley near it. It is a stunning walk, so many views, make sure your camera is well charged! There is a surprising amount of wildlife/fauna on the mountain too.We had and ice cream and a drink at the top - it seems there are good facilities.You must do this trip!

Brilliant. Hard to add anything to what other reviewers have said for such an iconic place and a 'must' for all visitors to Cape Town, with it's fabulous views over the city, coast and the Cape itself.I guess the key advice, seen in all the guide books and tourist guides, is to go as soon as you can - the weather on and around the mountain is very changeable and it can be shut for days. I believe that we went on the only full day it was open during our 5 day stay. It's not just the cloud that blankets the top (the 'tablecloth') but also the wind - there were days when the mountain was clear but the cable car closed because of the wind. Very much worth checking the online site for the latest position before you set off.If you use the hop-on/hop-off bus to get you there, they will know the current position - ask before you get on (it was on their notice board at the the V&A Marina). If you drive, as we did, parking can be difficult and you may have to go several hundred metres. If you park too early before the cable car it can be quite a hike uphill, so it's worth driving past the entrance and, if necessary, turning round (can be a bit awkward) as this part is fairly level.You can buy tickets online which are valid for one trip over a period you choose (2 weeks I think) - make sure you order both up and down tickets on the cable car, if that's what you want - they're done separately. This can save you quite a queue for tickets once there, but doesn't miss the queue for the cable car itself (in our case, luckily, almost non-existent around 3pm). If you want to walk, either up or down, be well prepared - see other reviews! Even going up on the cable car it's worth taking an extra layer of clothes, and even some sort of rain gear - the weather can change quite quickly (and if they feel the cable car may have to close they'll sound a siren to warn you).The cable car isn't scary (but then I ski), though it is very high above the ground nearer the top. It rotates to give everyone a good view - an excellent bit of technology. Near the top is a pretty good café/restaurant, and it's not badly priced either.The walk around all of the top is well marked and fairly easy, giving lots of different views and some changes in landscape. The top is not as flat as it looks from below! I guess all the way round might take a couple of hours, though we didn't do it all.Amazing place!
On the Top of CT. I think this is just a must for everybody that comes to Cape Town - best View and Fun - Dont miss it

Must See. The is the must see attraction of CPT. You cannot come to Cpt without going up the cable car or walking up (if you are keen and organised.) Pick your day just look up from anywhere in CPT and make sure you can see the top. The weather keeps changing so keep looking up, be warned that keys can be long. Book online beforehand, you still have to wait though.

Breath Taking Views!. We had planned to explore Table Mountain as a group of five, by the time we got to the base, two persons got cold feet! We ventured on, we took the sky left up, with about twenty other persons, which was absolutely unbelievable - as the left rose up the mountain, I literally held my breath, I was speechless as we went higher, higher, higher. While ascending the mountain, to my amazement, there were persons, scaling the mountain side, can you believe this? 4,000, plus feet...there they were, walking down the mountain! When we got to the top it was an AMAZING site! The views must be experienced, no words can paint an adequate description of the feeling one gets upon stepping out on to Table Mountain.... The restaurant/deli/ store was refreshing...it was filled with wonderful fresh produce, proteins and specialty foods. The pictures that one can take while there are mind-blowing ..ones that you will treasure for a life time.....
Must see!. Liked it very much. The cable car lift is a scary but still safe and likely the only way to get up. Read the hints from internet before heading there - to avoid queuing.

Beautiful panoramic view!. I went on the Table Mountain with my family by cable, and I was very impressed by two things:- The shape of the mountain, which really looks like the shape of a table due to its incredible flatness- The fantastic view we had on whole Cape Town from the Table Mountain.However, it's highly recommended to be warmly dressed to go there, due to the very cold and chilly weather when you retrieve yourself on top of it, because of the altitude.

Awesome time. We went up Table Mountain during our recent stay - the website is excellent offering up to date information, which enabled us to not have to queue when we arrived. We really enjoyed our time at the top as well. A must see for all tourists and people in CT really should purchase the all year pass.
Stunning view. So glad the clouds cleared to allow us up the mountain - but do take warm clothing even on a warm day.

Hot day for a walk. We chose to take the cable way up and to walk down. It was a hot day for hiking and we had not brought enough water. That made the hike an exhausting experience. The hike it self was scenic and beautiful. I would say you should be quite fit to do it. It seemed like most people chose to walk up and we saw several people who probably should have taken a cable in stead. A bit of advice, bring plenty of water and read up on how strenuous the walk is.

On A Clear Day!. We were so lucky to have been able to ride to the top of Table Top Mountain on a clear day. The views were stunning and we could see towns and the coast for miles. If you go to Table Top, be sure to go in the morning before the crowds start lining up to access the cable cars. Many days, the mountain is closed because of weather, so if there is a "clear day" be sure to go.

Amazing. We went up table mountain at 6pm for what the they call Sundowners. Its half price after 6pm.We took a picnic as did most people up there.Take a warm jumper or coat. It was cold and windy at the bottom but at the top it was calm and sunny.
Magnificent views of Cape town. We were lucky the weather was perfect and managed to be on the first cage up. We did the long walk which was beautiful and well marked and easy to walk.

Worth the price. The park is actually free, but the cable car (which is fun but not exceptional) is a bit pricey and is a cab ride from anywhere in town. Fortunately, taxis are relatively cheap in Cape Town. The views from the mountain top are striking, and the area is well laid out and well maintained. The signage is informative and in English. Food and facilities are available. The restaurant has nice views, but we were not there at meal time.

This Is A Don't Miss Excursion. I thought before I arrived in Cape Town that all Table Mountain provided was a fabulous view of the city. boy was I wrong. It actually takes a full day of sightseeing to circumnavigate the mountain range. Along the way you get to see up close and personal the only penguins living outside Antarctica, a mountain with a reclining lion atop it, Cape Point Park where the Atlantic and Indian Oceans meet, an island populated by seals, and a spectacular part of the Park that has 12 soaring peaks. I recommend a private guide so you can linger in locations that catch your fancy. Definitely fun for couples and families who have children who can sit for a day's drive.
Lions Head. Spectacular views, easy enough walk. Old and young will enjoy it, takes roughly 2 hours up and down and the views are insane

Must Do. During peak season i.e. December/early January ask for a priority ticket so you do not have to queue for the 0800am first lift. The priority ticket also means you can get down the mountain first as well.You can easily spend 2 hours up on the mountain as the views are outstanding. The best time to go is first or last thing in the day i.e. 0800 or sunset. Be prepared to queue if you are doing at sunset - but don't book until the actual day of travel as the weather and clouds can ruin the trip.
Fantastic views. We were so lucky to get up in the cable car as it had been windy and it was worth the wait as the views were brilliant.

Must do if in Cape Town. One of the 7 natural wondered of the world so shouldn't be missed if visiting Cape Town. Easiest way to get there and back is the hop on hop off sight seeing red bus (red route) other than that parking is difficult and taxis are a problem to find when you need to come back. Expect to que for about 40 min for the cable car which will take you to the top. It it is well worth it.Tip, if you are in Cape town for a few days, check the weather every day and if you wake up to s clear sky with little wind go that day, don't put it off till the next day a the weather can change quick and if cloudy or windy the cable car will be closed and there will be no visibility at the top
Table Mountain Hike. Beautiful views, great hike. We really enjoyed it. If you like climbing mountains, you know what you're in for. Not too difficult and a good trip.
Beautiful!. Pretty busy place at the top, and the lines for the Cableway were very very long. However, if you have the time to hike up, that is the best way to explore the mountain.

very crowded!. I like it, but it was very crowded when we visited this during our recent trip to Cape town! This Park Has its unique ruggedness stretching down to Cape Point. You have views over Clifton and Camps Bay below and across to Robben Island. the view was spectacular! Regardless of the crowd! it's worth visiting!
Spectacular views. People did the climb- I took the tram up the mountain and it was a dramatic and spectacular view- on a beautiful clear day you can see for miles- absolutely worth it.

A challenging climb up, but well worth it. Don't be fooled into thinking that the walk up this mountain will be along an easy path. The route can be very challenging at times (by no means mountaineering, but some serious terrain) - especially in the last 20 minutes before the summit. It should not be undertaken lightly, but when you have reached the top the sense of achievement is amazing - much like the view.Take the cable car down!!
Long wait... Waiting for hours in the heat is not ideal.. Was it worth it.. Dubious! The bus tour's do lots of trips up through so worth avoiding taxi fares.

Amazing Experince. Long weekend break to Cape Town with my sonfull on and flat out for 48 hoursa must place to visit absolutety wonderful experince the views are out of this would make sure you do this when there is no cloud cover as we had been warned not to go if it was covered, a must is a good camera and telephoto lens we got the 8am cable car up and stayed until 9-30 no queing but when we goit back to the bottom the que had alreay statred to form

Uniquely rugged and simply amazing. If you thought the views from the cable car were stunning, wait until you step out and walk onto the mountain. The Table Mountain National Park greets you with its unique ruggedness stretching down to Cape Point. You have views over Clifton and Camps Bay below and across to Robben Island.There are numerous paths that lead you in every direction to enjoy the various views along which you will see the unique flora or fynbos that grows only in this area, also look out for bird sightings from the tiny sunbirds to the majestic raptors soaring above. You may even get the opportunity to see the famous Dassies as the bound across the rocks. It is best to get up here early as it does tend to get over crowded, as the day goes on. It will also allow you time to see more. However even on a hot day it can still get chilly at the top. In winter make sure you have the proper clothing as it can get very cold with the "wind chill". There is a small shop and café at the top so hot drinks and food are available.

Stuck on the Mountain.. Too crowded. We went from fantastic organisation at the bottom of the mountain with shade and efficient queuing, to standing in the sun on the mountain. The electricity failed for over an hour and we were all stuck. The poor folk out in the sun would have baked! Noone explained anything to begin with.
Beautiful. Very long wait, but well worth it, the view was spectacular. The gondola was very stable. Best to book ahead of time.

Very unique, special experience. Table Mountain National Park was absolutely gorgeous and a wonderful experience. We took the cable car up, although we'd original planned to hike. The cable car is only open when the weather is good, so it's best to try to get up there in the early morning before the winds start and clouds move in.

Incredible. It's such a big part of Cape Town life and when you get up there the views are sensational. Make sure you take the time to walk to Maclear's point. Great walk on top of the mountain as long as the clouds stay away.

Amazing views and queues. oops should have come here first thing arrived about 11 and had to queue for over 2 hours despite having pre-booked tickets. For parking go past the cable car and see if you can find space there as we had to park at the bottom of the hill and it was a long hot walk up. Worth the wait when youg get up there.

''wonderful site''. We went to table mountain national park around 9 in the morning and it was a bit chilly, when we arrived we moved around the park in those beautiful flora and there are plenty of beautiful birds up there. The trip is worthwhile and one need to visit the place when in Cape town. When you are up there you will see the beauty of Mother city down. it is awesome'

great table mountain. a must see in cape town, please ensure to book on line especially in the busy season as lines can get long, it truly is a great trip with lots of walks to do on top of the mountain, bear in mind if the south west wind is blowing the mountain will be covered in clouds and you will not have great visibility from the top. the food is good on top of the mountain.
Fab. Well worth a visit , we took the cable car but it doesn't matter whether you walk up the views and scenery are fantastic.

Beautiful Park. I would recomend to go walk far past the crowds as the views will be well worth it as will the peace and quiet. take the time to do the big loop! When you get to cape town and the weather is great at table mountain, then go imidiately as you never know if the weather will hold or not and you may be here for a few days only and not get another chance with a clear view...
Must go. Best views in all the city and a beer at the top to top it off! This is a new 7 wonder of the natural world and you can see why.
"Must Do" in CPT. Without any doubt, certainly the best attraction in Cape Town...and one of the best views in the world.
Early morning. We were there 7.30am with pre booked tickets which was worth the money. Great views and not so many people yet.
Breathtaking. Do ensure you squeeze this trip into your schedule. We had to change our plans around as the morning we planned to go, as the table top had its "tablecloth" on. It's well worthwhile.
great walking. plenty of walks short and long, flora is outstanding, plenty of birds, take water with you , hat and sunscreen, watch the weather as the table cloth can come in quickly

Great Sunset. The sunset is fantastic up at the top of the table.
Take a cardi or something extra to put on as when the sun starts to drop the temperatures drop down very quickly.
The views are amazing!
The other point to note that after 6.30pm its half price.

sunny table mountain. The views were spectacular the wild life seen most unusual.
Liked it all
Loved the space and the fresh air also able to see the gliders.
Unbelievable!. The walk was intense but well worth the Views!! Take plenty of water and try not to do it with a hangover!! its insane that you can see all of Cape Town - Will be doing it again!!

A Dream Come True. A 2 hour wait in the queue, however, worth every second of it< awesome views, the cableway was awesome, it rotates so each person gets a chance to experience. The guide on the Mountain was great. I am generally afraid of heights, but the views were amazing

Amazing 360 views. Myself and three friends hiked Table Mountain on a recent visit to Cape Town. We started off in the Kirstenbosch Gardens, which are worth a look on their own, and took the Skeleton Gorge route. It took us about 4 hours to get up the mountain to the cable car and restaurant. However, we did make a pit stop at the lake on the top for a dip.A lot of the route up was under shade and it was an enjoyable hike with a nice mix of easy walking, ladders and use-your-hands hiking.You're at the top for just under an hour to walk to the cable car and the 360 degree views are spectacular. Well worth the effort.We had planned to take the cable car back down the mountain but the wait was close to two hours. We decided to hike down the more popular route. For me this was a big mistake! It was all in the sun and we all got scorched! It was also a steep climb down to the very end and we saw a lot of climbers fall and slip en route. It took us just under 2 hours to get back down.I would definitely recommend the hike but I would get a drink and wait for the cable car or take the same route (skeleton gorge) back down next time :)
Natural wonder. Literally breathtaking views of Cape Town. A must. Cafe on the mountain was okay-ish, though busy. Also the option to hike to the top, but the cable car is my choice.
Worth it!. We took the cable car, but if you are up for it, the climb looked like a better bargain! That said the trip was worth every minute!
Awesome view. What a beautiful view! If you have time to take this attraction in, do so it's beautiful! The surrounding area gives a breathtaking panoramic view

A Must do trip. We booked in advance on line from the UK. We got there at 0830 and managed to avoid queues even though it was a Saturday. Booking in advance avoids having to queue for a ticket - you just go straight to the cable car entrance. The cable car spins round slowly so everyone gets a good view.

scared stiff. Amazing views, but not for the faint hearted. However, the cable car operator was very considerate towards a particularly nervous lady. Tale the hop-on/off bus and pay in advance to avoid the queue.

Amazing Mountain. Great mountain to explore. Whether you take the cable car one way or both ways, there are some great views and hikes. You can do anything from a 2 hour hike to all day depending on how adventurous you are. Definite must if in Cape Town.

You MUST go!. No traveller should go to Cape Town and miss visiting Table Mountain, the views will stay with you forever! The cable car up is exhilarating and there is a delicious little cafe on top that does lots of delicious treats. After A very authentic Italian style pizza and a bottle of incredible South African wine, I felt it was only just to walk back down and I loved every minute!

Breathtaking. Table Mountain holds a very special place in my heart... it is just so majestic and beautiful, especially when the 'table cloth' is blowing over the top.A trip to Cape Town is simply not complete without a trip up the famous mountain. The views from the top is simply spectacular, you can spend hours wandering the various trails.Some advice: Pick a beautiful day, but check the cablecar's website first. It gives pretty accurate details of the wait time. Also, the cablecar is not open if the weather isn't good (sometimes it may seem ok in the city, but up the top can be too windy) so don't rush over there without checking it is open.Do not miss!

Stunning Views. Great views. The walk to the lighthouse was well worth it.Use the vennicular on the way up and take the walk down.There is a restaurant and a fast food take-away at Cape Point. The take away offers reasonable pizzas- but if you drive for 15 minutes or so you will come to a small town that offers a variety of small cafés.

best sunset ever. i have visited this place 3 times in last 3 years. at different time of the day with different people with me. I have found that this place has always something different to offer. my last visit was the best in the lot with evening pass ..which gave me opportunity to witness the best ever sun set in my life. please give ample time to this place if u are visiting for the first time. this place changes during different hours of the day with clouds passing by you , sometimes sunny sometime windy.

Very nice, once you get there.... The 1st time we wanted to go up (17-12) we drove up, but turned back when we saw 'mile long' queues, waiting to take the cable car.the 2nd time we waited one hour in the blazing sun on the Waterfront before we could board the bus to Table Mountain. that time it didn't take too long to get to the top. Well, it has been owrth it, its breathtakingly impressive.
breathtaking views. A must in Cape town you will have a panoramic view of the city and ellis island, if weather is fine you should approach the top

A TOUGH hike up but worth it.. Beautiful views! Take a picnic lunch and plan on hike to be about 2.5 hours. Hike early as high winds may shut down cable car. Hike up and cable car down. Book cable car early.

Hike the Gorge if you Can. We spent a morning hiking the gorge up to the top of Table Mountain. Waht a fabulous experience! Takes about 90-120 minutes and very steep but worth the trek if you are up to it. We then tok the cable car down but you could walk back down itoo. V

Worth every line. Be sure to pre-purchase your tickets to fast-pass some of the line. We went up around 3:30pm, hiked around the top, and then got a great seat for the sunset. Although the line down the mountain was epically long (1.5 hours), it was worth all the waiting. Bring a jacket - it gets chilly at night. By far the best attraction in Cape Town!
Birthday on the mountain. Stunning day as always. Beautiful views and weather. Even though it was busy, it was managed fantastically. Sprayers and umbrellas to keep cool.

Spectacular views on a clear day. This is a must if visiting Cape Town. Lucky we had a clear day, sunny and warm. Spectacular views of the coastline and city. Refreshments available if you have time to walk all over the mountain. Cable car rotates as it takes you up and down so unless you are in the middle, you get a good view. It was definitely "We are actually here" moment

Cafe chaos. We pre-booked early tickets for the 1st trip up the mountain so as to avoid any queue which worked very well and the wait for the cable car was well organised. Unfortunately it was a really foggy day and we could only see about 10 metres in front of us. We still went up but couldn't see any of the spectacular views promised. The cafe at the top opened early since it was cold and wet and all of us wanted to get inside since we couldn't see anything of table mountain itself. Unfortunately, the cafe clearly isn't set up for early morning business. The breakfast buffet wasn't open so we had to have sandwiches for breakfast and then we had to order coffees at the kiosk to collect after. The coffee, just a simple filter coffee, took over 20 minutes to be ready. This is simply unacceptable. How on earth can filter coffee take 20 minutes to make?!The problem with running the cable car in all weathers apart from extreme wind if problematic when very foggy. We booked tickets and missed out on all the sights after travelling all that way. Still, it's a natural wonder so I can't complain about nature taking control and doing what it does. Overall, we had back luck with the weather which can happen to anything & anyone at any time, but the cafe was a shambles.

Not to be missed!. We were so fortunate - no clouds, little wind and no lines. What a view and a chance to consider what the old time sailors without GPS, cell phones etc. must have thought when they saw this site.

Do not miss this. If you only do one thing in Cape Town make sure it's this. Go early. We were there at 8.40 on a beautifully clear morning and there were queues already. We had booked our tickets online and this puts you in a priority queue. Your online ticket gives you at least a week's window of opportunity and the moment it's a bright clear day, grab it. The views from every aspect are breath taking. We also spotted some gorgeous native birds and it's lovely how you can just wander off and find a quiet corner. Although watch out for the 'followers' - I don't mean for one moment anyone at all threatening - they are the camera toting, never quiet types who will literally follow you ANYWHERE! Like you are part of some obvious to none but them tour group following an umbrella. You will see what I mean when you are up there. The trick is to move fast or split up. Back to the mountain - wear sunscreen. There is no shade unless you go in the shop, loo or cafe. The cable car rotates and us great fun so try to get near the edge by the window if you can.

Awesome sight - terrible queues. Once you get up there it's amazing, but the faff was unbelievable - staff refused to let people buy tickets for up to 20 minutes at a time so the tellers were sitting around idle. People with online tickets also had a very long wait, and the orientation of the queues gave lots of confusion. You were actually better off buying your ticket online whilst in the queue on your phone than wait!

Unique and an absolute Must-see while in Cape Town. We went here to enjoy the fabulous vistas from the top during the holiday season. We went by the cable car in order to save time for other sights. If you plan to take the cable car as well, then it is absolutely recommendable that you book online in order to limit waiting time in the long queues.If you decide to queue up anyway be aware that there is free WIFI on site, so that you can make online reservations while waiting and thereby qualify for the priority queue and save some Rands and time as well.

marvelous experience.. watched the whole view of cape town and was exhausted.i was very excited to take pictures of cape town city .The view of the oceans very nice and remarkable.We came from bottom up by cable car to the top of table mountain,it was a nice experience so to speak and unforgettable.Table mountain it is really one of the seven wonders of the world,and i promise to all travelers of the world that cape town is one of the beautiful a place of the world.

Must do!. Loved the whole experience it is a must to do when in Cape Town. Everything well organised, cable car gives fabulous views going up to the top. Shop and restaurant all very good. The mountain itself well amazing.

Go in low season!. This refers specifically to Table mountain itself, when taking the cableway up. We did this right in the middle of the summer holidays, and unless you took a trail quite far out people were everywhere and it completely takes the charm out of the experience. I had done this excursion a few years ago in autumn, and we pretty much had the mountain to ourselves! In spite of the crowds the views are nonetheless stunning, and we were lucky enough to see large numbers or baby dassies frolicking around and basking in the afternoon sun.

Second time . I was here before and this time was taking my coworkers to this beautiful place.the nature and the view just super amazing.staff is very helpful.but they had power shut down and we had to wait 2 hrs on the sun to get down ok cable cars.just take snacks and water and stay there as much as u can especially for sunset it should be amazing!
Stunning views; long lines!. Well worth a visit, though I highly recommend you book tickets ahead of time online to avoid the long lines. Stunning views from the top.

Awesome views. We had wonderful weather which is a plus when you visit Table mountain. It is definitely worth your while to purchase tickets online. It makes the queing time much shorter. Walk on the paths and enjoy spectaculour South Africa.

Unmissable. Not what I expected at all! I expected there to be crowds but 5 minutes walk away from the landing, it was near deserted, calm and peaceful. The botany is fascinating too. The views are a delight at every turn.
Table Mountain visit. Terrible queues - don't go at the weekend. 90 minutes to get up and 45 minutes to come down and the restaurant was packed as well

Breath-taking views. The Table mountain is arguably one of the must see spots in Cape Town. The views of the city, harbour and the Lion's head are some of the most spectacular sights that I have seen in my years traveling. The only drawback of visiting Table Mountain is the never ending queue during the summer period. I waited 45 min in the blistering morning sun and found myself nowhere near the front of the line. We eventually left, but returned the same day in the evening when the queue was much shorter, and enjoyed the sights.

Tablemountain. We went to table mountain as recommended. Out taxi driver took us and came back an hour later to pick us up which was a really good move as there is not a great deal to do up there but enjoy the unbelievable view and take photos. An hour and a half might just give you that bit more time as you have to get a cable car up. It shows you the whole of Cape town and further afield. It was great A definate thing to do whilst you are in Cape Town
Good place to go. Loved the cable car route...the view from the top is amazing..will definitely go once again if i get a chance to.

A Must Visit!. This is the second time I have visted the Table Mountain and was still struck by the awesome views. Unfortunately, this time it was holiday period over New a Year and the queuing was horrendous. We could have saved a lot of time if purchased the tickets from the Tourist bus driver. Although, there was no way of shortening the waiting time in the queue to return from the mountain. It did take the shine off the visit a little. Advice is to get there early!

Worth the queues!. The cable car is great as it revolves gently so you see the full view on the way up and down. Queueing can take quite a while but was strictly managed so very efficient and the views are worth the wait!

An extraordinary place. Wow! What is there to say that hasn't already been said. Table Mountain really is an extraordinary place. OK, so we had to wait for 30 minutes to get a ride up - but it was primarily under shelter with little misters making the 31C much more bearable. And we had a similar wait to get back down again, with not so much shade this time - bring a little umbrella, you won't regret having to carry it around with you. However, these are tiny things in comparison to the overall experience. The cable car revolves as you rise, completing a full 360 degrees - so no rush and bustle to get the 'best' vantage points inside the carriage. Extraordinary views on the way up, both of the surrounding countryside and the brave people hiking up near precipitous paths to the top. There's loads of stuff to do once you get to the top, from short walks to proper hikes. Fantastic variety of flowers and plants to look at, finding the tiniest of spaces within which to thrive. We saw two hawks heckling each other - we weren't sure if they were indeed fighting or just putting on a show for us tourists. Huge yellow and black butterflies flitting from one place to another. Did I mention the ice cream? And cold (nearly freezing) bottled water for less than R20 (less than £1 in UK currency). A fantastic experience all round. We bought our tickets on the Red Bus where you get a R25 reduction in the price and a quicker queue that bypasses the ticket office. Who cares if everyone that goes to Cape Town goes up to Table Mountain - it's a must-see.
Visit to the Table Mountain National Park. Excellent visit and we managed to see the mountain totally clear with NO clouds!! Great journey by cable car to the mountain and enjoyed a lot the visit.

queue and more queues. The view from the top of Table Mountain is superb and very special. However you are not told about the overall queues. Make sure to book your ticket on line before you go or you will have to queue up for an hour before you even get near the cable car. Take your time on top and enjoy the views. However make sure that you have plenty of water with you for the whole time. The time waiting to go back down is awful and you are never told about this. I waited more than 1.5 hours to get back down. A nightmare. This spoiled a great attraction.

One of the 7 nature wonders of the world. The cable car ride is something so different - nearly vertical and the base turns around so you get 360 deg views. Cloud can come over quick and equally disappear to expose an amazing view of Cape Town
Nice view from the top. A unique mountain with such a flat top and from up there view of Cape Town and the oceans are very nice.
Wonderful!. I liked the view, which is unique. Also a penguin colony, very cute ones. The bad thing is that we had to cross a beach full of beggars

Go when the mountain is clear.. Someone recommended that when the mountain is clear -- GO. Because clouds can quickly consume the mountain top and the view which is the reason to go. You can hike up but we'd recommend buying a round-trip ticket on line good for a week's period. We went on a beautiful day and it was very crowded as it was the last day of a school holiday and many locals were heading up to the top too. It saved a lot of time standing in a very long line.
Do Not Miss This. We loved our trip to Table Mountain. An unforgettable experience, excellent grounds and amenities at the top add to that. This is a must see while in Cape Town!
Wow!!. The view is just spectacular, we visited while on the red hop on and off bus. We didn't have to queue too long and when we got up to the top, it's just beautiful.

Awesome place with an awesome view. It was very interesting to visit the Table Mountain national park, because of the incredible view. Make sure that you will go on a sunny day, because the clouds could take some of the great view away.

On Top. Within our short stay in Cape Town (basically just a weekend), we tried to do/see as many things as possible. Our 2 hours for Table Mountain was definitely too short as we would have loved to take a hike for which one should plan at least an additional 2 - 3 hours. For my next visit, I will spent a whole day on Table Mountain with the intent of hiking down.

Stunning!. The views and walks on top of the mountain are stunning. Little wonder that Table Mountain is ranked as one of the wonders of the world. A must see for visitors to the Mother City. Why not get yourself a guide, pack a bag of tea and biscuits and walk one way.?
Get to the top of the mountain while it is clear!. Some vantage points can very quickly become shrouded in mist/low level cloud. get to enjoy what's on offer when the conditions are right!

Amazing.... To go up you can take MyCiti bus (remember to buy the card before getting on the bus) from platform 5 at Civic Station, changing at the base for anothe small bus to take you to the cable car. If you can buy the tickets in advance is better as the queue is smaller.There is a small area were everyone concentrates but then you can walk the plain surface of the mountain, basically on your own, and see 360 views (we went to Maclear).Stunning views...There is also a queue to go down, bring a jacket and enjoy!

Tough climb. We walked up Table Mountain. This is a lot tougher than you would expect. Should be reasonably fit to do so, but is very worthwhile. We went up Skeleton gorge and down Platteklip. This way you avoid the wait and crowds at the cable car. Skeleton gorge is a fantastic walk starting in the shade of the forest, but Platteklip, though quicker is harsh, featureless and steep. Certain precautions must be followed: carry at least 1l of water and a waterproof jacket. Do not climb if clouds or mist are expected. The views are phenomenal, and well worth the visit. Walking around the mountain leads to the discovery of hidden treasures like rock archways and the resivoirs, as well as diverse flora and fauna. There is a cost to climbing via Skeleton gorge as you have to pay to get in via Kirstenbosch gardens. The only facilities once up the mountain are at the cable car station.
Fabulous but foggy.. Table Mt is wonderful. It is well organised to cope with big crowds. Views are spectacular and we loved it even though the weather was unkind to us.
Table Mountain. Excellent views of the Waterfront, Robben Island,World Cup Stadium and much more from the top of Table Mountain.

Great Climb Table Mountain.. Have done the climb twice and ten years apart. I hope to do this every ten years until I drop stone cold kaput. Amazing beauty and theatre. Can't believe we met a guy who was about to do the up and down three times on the same day.
Awesome view. Long queing time when no tablecloth. But worth the wait. Helpful parking guys. Rotating cablecars were great.

a must see awesome views. long ques for both entry and exitbook online to avoid ticket box queparking approx 700m awayclutch tends to burn out on most vehicles making the trek up in peak season , with bumper to bumper traffic and delaysaccess very wind dependant, and you may need to try a few times..so no fixed dayrestaurant on the top is well organised but very busy

Spectacular views - very crowded when sunny. The views are spectacular at the top of Table Mtn. One of the must-sees in Cape Town. The day we went was sunny after a rainy week and there were huge throngs of people waiting to get in - we had a 2 hour wait. The cable car ride is short but nice and since it rotates everyone can get nice photos. Even on a sunny day it was windy enough at the top to require a sweater or shawl.
Beautiful views of Cape Town. THE SPOT to go to for views of the city. A nice drive up and pleasant to look around on top for a bit.

Long queues. We love this but aborted our first visit as when we arrived at 8.45 the queue wait was 3 hours and we had already purchased our tickets. Returned the next day at 7 am hoping that the mountain would open and there were still 100 odd people before us. The first car was at 8 am we were on the mountain at 8.20am . The sun was shining and it was a hot morning but up on the mountain it was cold and windy - we loved it and spent 3 hours on the oaths and lookouts . When we returned to our cat at 11.30 the mountain was completely covered in its tablecloth . Tip go early-!

Tough hike but view from the top is worth it. Very challenging hike. Almost vertical climbing & scrambling near the top. Take plenty of water as it was extremely hot by 9am.Rewarding when you reach the top. Spectacular views!
What a view. You have to see the view up there! Just pay attention to the cloud cover and bring a jacket. It can be windy and certainly cooler than the city

Awesome View. If it a clear day forget your other plans and go up Table Mountain 360 degree cable car (80 people at a time). Views Spectacular.
Buy flexible ticket on line beforehand (valid for 0ne month from purchase). Still have to queue on busy days (c.1 hour over Xmas hols) but no e-ticket queue even longer!
Watch out for the weather. The revolving floor of the cable car was a surprise. Take the first opportunity you have on your trip to visit because it is often closed because of the weather.

Stunning views was worth it .must do. Some attractions in world can be really overrated but i find this park to be breathtaking beautiful with great views and trials along the mountain .There is queues to get to actual cableway so keep this in mind if you going in peak season

A must do!. Amazing amazing views from up the Mountain and information provided along the way. Restaurant could be cleaner although adequate for a quick refreshment and small snack. Photo product on green screen a bit disappointing compared to Ferris wheel photos. Factors aside a visit up the mountain is a must for the beauty of it.

Worth the hike. We climbed up skeleton gorge from the botanics. We took 3 bottles of water for two of us but should have taken more because of the heat. We were one hour in shade but then you are out in the sun for the remainder. Thank goodness there's a cafe at the top! Although it spoils it in some ways we enjoyed being able to get some drinks and then the cable car back down!

Must do when in Cape Town!. I was a little apprehensive about visiting Table Mountain before I stepped onto it. It felt a little like all the other sightseeing trips I'd been on before - taking a cable car up, walking around a minimal space crowded with tourists while snapping photos, blah blah and then coming down again. Boy was I wrong. Even in the summer, a chill wind blows atop the mountain, making hikes very enjoyable. Once you get up to the mountain, there is a small tourist spot and cafe where everyone takes their photos. Then you begin to stroll beyond that area and you're in for a treat. There are a few routes you can walk on the mountain, for quite a distance. There is even a route where you can hike down the mountain (at your own risk! And takes a few hours. If you so wish, you can enquire about the guided tours they have up /down the mountain from 09 00 hrs to 15 00 hrs). Another route takes you on the horizontal face of the mountain, amongst the indigenous flora of the region. It's very peaceful, very serene. The breathtaking view of the surrounding is the most rewarding. A most wonderful way to spend a few hours, even watch the sunset. Buy your tickets online to avoid a long Q when you're up at the mountain. Check online for the timing of the last cable down (around 21 30 hrs in Jan) so you can plan ahead if you want to do an evening trip. Driving to the cableway station is best as it would be terribly expensive getting a cab down. Alternatively, there are the MYCITI and CITY SIGHTSEEING’S HOP-ON, HOP-OFF BUS options.

Unique natural phenomenon.... I think this is a must visit attraction which you will realize once you get to the top. You go up expecting a small peak with a little room / one lookout post and thats it. What you end up with is an enormous area flat land spanning several football fields which is beautifully maintained with clear walking paths, great plants and wonderful views.We were lucky enough to also catch a glimpse of a "lassie"when were up there.Based on user reviews we bought the tickets online - but surprisingly the day we went - around 10:00 - 11:00 hrs there wasn't a soul in queue! definitely made it simpler to get to the top...

Gorgeous View. We took the cable car up to the top of Table Mtn. and walked around for about 2 hrs. The views were spectacular. Very worth it. Next time we will plan to be up there longer and do some of the hikes. Definitely a must do when visiting Cape Town!

Pre book a ticket and go late in the day. Table mountain is definitely worth a visit, but long lines and obnoxious tourists can make the experience exhausting. They do discounted tickets late in the day and it is way less crowded. The restaurant has great snacks and wine up on top and it is worth walking the trail and catching views from all sides. My husband hiked to the top and he says it was challenging, but not the life threatening experience the tour companies make it out to be. He recommends hiking Lion's Head first to gauge if you should attempt, as it is slightly easier.
Fantastic. What is fantastic about Table Mountain? Seriously? The VIEW. Awesome. Absolutely awesome. I must use at least 50 characters, so I'll say it again, the views are AWESOME.
Wonderful experience. visited on a beautiful day out of season so no queuing either to park or get the cable car. Wonderful views from the top.

Stunning World Heritage site. - during tourist peak season; waiting lines can be long, best perhaps to wait until about 16.00pm before going up.
- great views and a nice walk around the plateau.
- apparently it is a 1.5-2 hours walk up to the plateau from the lift area.

Beautiful!. Enjoyed visiting Table Rock Mtn. The morning queues were very long - about 90 min wait. We visited in afternoon at 15:00 and enjoyed a shorter 30 min wait for cablecar. Once we arrived at top, we were pleasantly surprised by the spectacular views and the warm weather - yes wind and much sunshine considering street level had been dreary! it was spectacular. We walked around enjoying the scenery, and took loads of photos. The terrain has stepping stones, but uneven surface. It was a wonderful afternoon - could have stayed and explored for hours.
Great views. Brilliant views from table mountain. Queues are long so it may be worthwhile to pre-book a ticket. Sunsets are awesome- take a picnic basket with.

Table Mountain. Loved the ride up to the top in the cable car. The floor actually turns 360 degrees so you can see all the views. Got to see rock climbers on the way up. The view from the top is spectacular. A must see for the price....well worth it.

Stunning!. We had the best time, we set off mid morning, around 10AM to climb, one that is supposed to take 2 hours to get up. It took me and some friends 55 minutes to get up, and an hour and 20 minutes to get back down, but it was well worth it! The views are spectacular. People say it's best to do it on a clear day, but we did it when it was quite cloudy (the first time) and the clouds were perfect for when it got too warm as by the top it was freezing, but very welcomed. We had a lot of fun being excited when the clouds shifted for a better view, though we also went up second time when it wasn't cloudy and if you don't mind the heat, I'd well advise it- just as spectacular essentially due to no clouds hiding away the view. Both were just as amazing though! If you come to Cape Town, you can't not visit!

Must visit attraction in Cape Town. Spectacular views and amazing experience. The visit to Table Mountain involves a ride in a modern and well designed cable car to the top of Table Mountain in Cape Town, offering an exciting day out and spectacular views of the Cape peninsula. The attraction is very safe and well run. A definite must see while in Cape Town.

Great views!. Due to high winds it took us 3 days before we could get up there, so you need to keep checking when it's open. Best thing to do is to include into the hop on hop off bus tour. Great views and great experience!!

on a clear day. Do not miss the view from the top Make time to walk around. This was day 20 of our 21 day tour with African Sky Tours and we had just come from the west coast near Langabaan.It was closed early in the morning due to high winds but our guide Amanda,kept checking and we were able to be one of the first up. Come early before the cruise ships arrive by 1100
magic place. Table Mountain is a magic place where we can do a lot: hike, rock climb, or just enjoy. One could be one mouth in Cape Town and have things to do every day in Table Mountain
HUGE PARK. It just goes on & on--every time you stop for vista pictures along the coast, you are still in the park. Grounds are well kept, clean & signage excellent.
Brilliant trip. It was great walking round no restiction on how long you stayed on top of mountain but make sure you take water,the only downside if you don't book you have to queue for about 45mins

Table Mountain not to be Missed. It is a 3 hour event or longer if you choose to stay on the top of the mountain longer. The view are so sensational of the city and the coastal areas that surround it. It is billed as the 7th new wonder of the world. Worth every penny you put out which for this side trip is minimal.

wildlife, scenery and drive. Excellent drive through, wonderful scenery, long trek to Cape Point (be warned, can be lengthy) but amazing views over the bay. Don't forget the Ostrich farm on the left side as you exit if you have time,

Foggy, but still worth while. . A nice visit, if very foggy.
It would be nice if the visitors would obey the rules and stay on the walkways. But that's not the national parks fault.
The revolving cable car is a nice extra.
Get there early and avoid the hoards.
WOW. Well worth a visit - be flexible on time and day to visit as the "table cloth" appears very often in the way of clouds. Spectacular views. The gondola is efficient.

Must do in Cape Town - watch out for windy days!. This is a duplicate of our review of the Aerial Cableway to Table Mountain because, in our minds, you can't separate one from the other. THE major attraction in Cape Town in our opinion, and the cable car is the easy way up to the top of Table Mountain, when the wind isn't too strong. Unfortunately for us, for the first 2 days we were in Cape Town the mountain was closed because the wind was too strong. Each morning we checked if it was open, and on the 3rd day - Success, the mountain was open and we immediately bought our tickets on-line and headed for the lower cable car station. Thank god we bought the tickets first because when you get to the station there is one queue for those with tickets, and a second enormously long queue for those who needed to buy tickets first. Tickets are valid for 14 days so buy one first so you're ready to go as soon as the mountain is open. The cable car takes many people at a time and does one complete rotation as you ascend or descend so everybody gets to see the views. On top there are shops, toilets, a restaurant, and a choice of 3 routes round huge top on clearly marked paths, ranging in time from 15 minutes too re an hour. We liked the views in all directions, and particularly the "Dassies", small approx 2 foot long animals native to the mountain and rumored to be related to the elephant!We chose the middle length route but unfortunately had to cut that short as the cloud came down and visibility reduced dramatically. Even so, it was a great excursion and well worth the wait and the visit despite the weather. When we got down, we found the mountain was closed again!

Beautiful views. We were lucky enough to have a beautiful day. The views from the top were exceptional. There are trails around the top. However, the full trail around the perimeter is rated as easy but was certainly not easy. The map they gave out was not accurate either. Check before you go as often the cable car is closed due to high winds.

Excellent views of everything. Enjoyed the 360 degree views that include Cape Town, Robben Island, beaches and mountains. You can also grab a beer, ice cream, or a full meal at the top.Wasn't a fan of waiting in line for the cable car, took about 25 minutes of waiting each way, but the weather was perfect so everyone was out.

Brilliant Day Out. It was a clear morning, so we shook off the jet lag and went for it! So glad we did. Views stunning, walks breathtaking, cable car trip entertaining, food good and loads of brilliant chance conversations. A brilliant introduction to the rainbow nation!

Skeleton Gorge and Smuts Track. We took the Skeleton Gorge track up the mountain starting from Kirstenbosch Botanical Gardens. This was a very fun route including steep steps, ladders, climbing boulders through waterfalls and finally coming out over the treetops to a spectacular view of the city between the sloping sides of the mountain. This trail continued onto Smuts Track which is mostly flat but with some steep climbs further on. Our map says Smuts Track is 'exhausting' but we didn't find it too hard. We are however both 22 years old and quite fit. Smuts Track is a scenic route along the side of the mountain which leads to Maclear's Beacon, the highest point of Table Mountain at 1085m. It was covered in clouds when we arrived but it was worth it! We got a few good glimpses of the city through the clouds. From here we continued across to the cable car area (mostly flat all the way across). The tabletop clouds are fast rolling across the mountain but waterfall over the edge and quickly vanish due to the altitude! It's very cool to watch. We got some amazing views of the sea, city, Lion's Head and Signal Hill. From the Botanical Gardens to the cable car it took us about 3.5 to 4 hours. Highly recommended route to climb and a must-do if you visit Cape Town.

Worth the wait. As the mountain was shrouded in clouds or rain for most of our visit, when it finally cleared up on the last day, there were huge crowds waiting to go up the funicular. We waited at least 90 minutes. But the view was worth the wait--spectacular!
Up and down. Hiking up is great. Hiking down .... not but it's possible and we had to do it because the cablecar was closed.

amazing. Fantastic experience, the view is great, but it's very cold on the top of montain, then bring a heavy coat. Buy the ticket before, because I didn't have a ticket, then I took a long time to get up there, it was faster to people who had a ticket.O lugar é fantástico, vale a pena a visita. A vista é espetacular. Mas cuidado porque é muito frio lá em cima, então leve casacos. Compre o bilhete com antecedência, você pode comprar no local mas demora muito mais.

Amazing views from the top!. We arrived to the top by the cable car and we just did the trails on the top of the mountain.We did it on our own but there is a meeting point when you leave the cable car where you can take a free guide tour, I think is departing every half an hour. The weather wasn't good at all, rainning a little bit and all misty but, even so, we could see the amazing views from the top and it's really amazing.
A great hike. I did the hike up and back down. It was a nice hike but make sure you bring water and warm clothes otherwise you'll freeze at the top. Stunning views of he surroundings.

On top of the world. I was very lucky to get a perfect day for our trip to the summit of Table Mountain. If it is views you want, then this is the place for you. It is simply stunning up on top. There are walks on the summit, a good, if little expensive, café and plenty of vistas to keep your cameras happy.This is a must for a visit to Cape Town but keep an eye on the weather as the clouds can roll in obliterating the view (the locals call this a table cloth)One of the best ways to get to Table Mountain is on the Red Route open top tour bus, Door to door service.

Best view in Cape Town. A must to do in Cape Town, really great view from the top, but the cue to come back down took an 1 hour and 30 minutes, so make sure you leave plenty of time to come back down.

Fantastic views. Fantastic place to walk, never get bored of it. Really rewarding views from all sides & clear paths to follow. Most enjoyable trips have been to walk up platterklip gorge or nursery ravine or kastelsport ravine, walk over the top, have pizza and drinks at the restaurant over sunset and catch the last cable car down.

Walking up gives you a sense of achievement and the stunning views for miles around. We walked up around 9am. Would recommend going earlier as there is little shade on the mountain. It is quite steep and takes about one and a half hours including a few stops to catch your breath. Temperature at the top is much cooler so take a jacket or jumper. The views to cape point are fabulous. The rotating cable car takes you back down in 5 minutes.
Fabulous scenery. The whole experience was enjoyable. The diverse flora and the views were amazing. Would definitely go back.

You can't miss this.. Absolutely spectacular. We took the cable car up and spent a couple hours wandering around the top. The views are amazing, especially with the fog rolling in as it so often does. And the dassies are so much fun to watch.

Enjoy the walks. I go once every few months, from the front there's a trail going up into the "V" called Plattekloof Gorge which all ages can enjoy. Just do take water and a warm sweater (even if it looks hot, the clouds can come over and make it chilly). It ends t the top right by the cable station, so you can also take a one way trip on the cable car if you wish.
Stunning scenery.. A must do visit if you like the outdoor life. Spectacular views at Cape Point for the photographers in your party and good walking for everyone else.
Stunning views. A time life experience. In the top of the worl watching the two oceans meeting. Do not loose. We likethe views. We didn'd like the crowd.

Fabulous visit!. We travelled to the top of Table Mountain using the cable car. It was brilliant. Once at the top, the views are simply stunning! The weather was just perfect. Sunny and calm with no wind. Very warm too! I have visited before and it has been freezing at the top of the mountain but not on this visit.

What a spectacular view. Well worth every penny (rand). Efficient operation, pleasant staff everywhere. The walk around the top is well signposted, and a great adventure. Good value at the Cafeteria, clean toilets. Then the views - WOW, made special as the cloud often drifted up, round and away as quickly as it arrived.The pictures they take as you enter are optional - R225. Mine were good, so I had them, as you also get a Disc included, telling you all about the Mountain.
Great trails. We could've spent all day here walking on the trails. The park was well maintained and there is so much to see in all directions. Definitely a must-do while in Cape Town!

Stunning Views. The views from here were absolutely amazing. We particularly loved that there was ready made walks of varying distances and ended up walking around for two hours. Sunset from here was beautiful and I'd highly recommend timing your visit for then.

Majestic. The view is majestic and beautiful from the top. On one side you see the Lion's Head and sea beyond and the famous football stadium built for the 2010 FIFA WC, on the other you get a magnificent view of the Camps Bay and if you visit in the evening you can see the beautiful sunset in the Sea. The walk on the mountain is full of views and a photographers paradise.You can also trek up the Table Mountain from the other side and it is another adventure. Difficulty - Medium.The small cafe on the top is sufficient for a quick snack and a coffee. Good place for couples to enjoy a cozy evening.I once visited when it was cloudy, though the views are very limited, i loved them. You get glimpses of the city below and the feeling is that of walking in the clouds.If you are a nature lover lot's of flora and fauna to see around. The signs say that you can see some small animals however they are a rare sight.Overall A-Class place to visit when you are in Cape Town.

7natural wonders. One of the top attractions in Cape Town. Try to avoid long lines on sundays! Also buy your ticket online to avoid the ticket Office line.
watch for little sneaks, do not touch mountain celeries and enjoy the view =)

Fantastic. The whole National Park system gives an amazing nature into the city. The Table Mountain plateau is amazing with views 360 degrees and when the clouds stream up and over the mountain it's great. Definitely worth a visit

Awesome view from up here!. I would love to have spent more time on Table Mountain. There are several pathways around the top to walk along. I saw several people making the climb up instead of using the cable car. The car ride was fun. I was surprised when the floor started turning! There are two large openings on the car so you have an unobstructed view. Saw a couple of critters including several Dassie. On my next visit, I plan to spend several hours!

Majestic. What an experience!! As soon as you step off the cable car you are met with the silence and peaceful tranquility of Table Mountain. The views are outstanding, there really isn't enough adjectives to describe it. 100% recommend to anyone travelling to Cape Town.

great hiking trails. for the family and light walkers the platekloof and the pipe track are recommended. For Skeleton Gorge one must be fit, lots of ladders, not recommended for wet rainy days, can get very slippery and dangerous.

Not to be missed!. A visit to Cape Town would not be complete without a trip up Table Mountain. We took the cable car up which was a great experience as the floor revolves round so you get the full 360 degree view. When we got to the top it was quite foggy so we went to the cafe for a coffee, when we came out the fog cleared and we saw the unbelievable views of Cape Town. It was truly breathtaking! Little tip- take a jacket or cardigan as it can be chilly at the top.
Great experience & views. A must do when you go to Cape Town - just breathtaking. Captured some photos of the children that will be on the wall for life when we get home.

spectacular. We took the Red Hop On Hop Off bus, City Sightseeing, to the cable car stop. We booked our tickets through the bus and saved money on the cable car cost $250 Rand round trip per person.There is handicap accessible via a lift to the car. I'm afraid of heights but enjoyed it. Worth the trip for the wonderful views from the top. Just do it!

Not worth the wait. The incredibly long wait, around 2 hours to get up and another couple to get down! Get ticket before to cut off an hour or so of wait time . It can also get very cold very quickly up there.

An iconic location with great views. We woke early and saw that Table Mountain was sunny and cloudless. We made our way there immediately in order to take advantage of the fantastic view and in case the weather changed - the cloud (or tablecloth) can appear very quickly and create poor visibility in a few minutes. Also, it gets very crowded after 0930hrs. The cable car ride was good and a walk around on top gave spectacular views of Cape Town and environs. You can get there on the Red Hop On Hop Off bus. Allow approx 60-90 minutes on the top.

Singing the praises of a cable car with fresh air. This is a well-maintained tourist attraction. Skip breakfast. Get in line early. Eat breakfast at the nice cafe on the top. Visit the gift shop. Explore the area.

Try it on your own from Skeleton Gorge. We were discouraged from hiking up Table Mt. on our own by the concierge of our hotel; and needless to say the companies that run walking tours discourage you from doing it on your own. But at least from 'Skeleton Gorge,' which begins from the marvellous Kirstenbosch Gardens, the sign-posting is perfectly clear all the way, and there have been no 'incidents' of the sort that you may fear for over five years now. It is perfectly safe, perfectly Doable.The Skeleton Gorge route is probably the nicest way up because you get to go through (or begin with a substantial visit to) the great Kirstenbosch Gardens, and then go up through Montagne forest. Once you're up, it's fairly gradual and thoroughly interesting to carry on (as you must, if you want to take the cable car down) to McClear's Beacon, the highest point. It's a great walk! It takes about an hour and a half to get well up. We spent six hours on the walk from start to finish (at the cable car), but one could do it in four.
stunning. absolute must see, stunning views and a lovely to walk around with multiple options depending on how far and long you want to walk. Easy to get to by cable car.

Fabulous hike. Decided to walk up Table Mountain via the main gorge. Took longer than we expected (3 hours+ instead of recommended 2.5 hours) but fabulous. But has to be a clear day. Take plenty of water and good shoes. Only criticism is that it was not sign-posted very well (we took a wrong turn and ended up going down again!).

Breathtaking. Stunning views from this landmark! Absolutely breathtaking to see a 360 degree view of the city and all it has to offer. Option to hike up or take the convenient and fun cable rail...can even repel off the side of it :)

Exceeded our expectations. This is the must see attraction of Cape Town, South Africa. The views are spectacular as is the cable car ride both up and back down the mountain. One unexpected attraction are the unusual plants and birds found in the park.

Great views. Great views over Cape Town up to Robben Island. Enjoy the beauty of the cape, spot a Dassie (lovely animal who lives here on top). Defenitly one of Cape Town's top ten attractions. Worth a visit. Go as soon as you can because weather permitted it might be open in the morning but closed due to weater conditions in the afternoon that same day.

Great views and an amazing experience.. Table mountain is definitely one of thr places to visit should you be in Cape Town. Great sightings and walks from the top, when you up there it feels as if you are on top of the world.

Oh my GOD. It one of the best place I have seen in my life ! if you are going to Cape Town, you should climb ! it's better I think, And you feel the nature, but sometimes it's difficult to climb, mainly if you are like us and you lose your way ... just take care to not start to climb at the end of the day, because with out the sun it's very complicate and difficult.But YOU SHOULD CLIMB :)
A must-do in Cape Town. Table Mountain is a must-do, and you have amazing views once you get to the top. The only thing is that it can get crowded with tourists.

Breath taking. It is obvious to me why this is one of the seven wonders of nature. A breath taking hike up and walk on top. Don't forget to bring a jacket or a sweater, it can be cold an windy on top (even when the weather is warm and sunny down).

Can't miss attraction in Cape Town. Get there early or buy your tickets from the Hop On Hop Off bus guys to avoid the line up. The cable ride is fast and smooth. Today was a beautiful clear day. There's a restaurant and wash rooms at the top.

Bad weather didn't ruin the hike. Whenever we are fortunate enough to make a trip to Cape Town, we make sure that we have time for a hike up Table Mountain via the Plattikip Gorge. We made the hike again this December and despite having clouds and very heavy winds moving in at the top, we again enjoyed the exhaustion that you earn on the hike.Prior to the walk, our hotel mentioned that there have been some robberies on the route. We have not experienced this fortunately, but there was a group of police officers doing some training hikes. I suppose it would be worth a check with your hotel if you are looking to do this incredible hike.A must do!

Amazing Views. We were very fortunate that there was no cloud on the day of our visit and the wind had dropped by the time we arrived at the cable car. The cable car ride was the start of our adventure. The paths at the top of the mountain were manageable, even for those with minimal fitness levels. The 360 degree views are amazing and I was thrilled to see a rock Hydrax, a very cute little animal. The vegetation was very hardy but some had lovely flowers. There is a well-stocked gift shop and cafe.

Great experience. I went up by Sightseeing bus and cable car. Great views and the cable car wasn't scary for one who is frightened of heights. Unfortunately, they had forecast of high winds so I was only on the top for 10 minutes before the siren went and we all had to come off. Had a very nice boerewors sandwich in the bar at the cable car base.

Great views, but weather can be unpredictable. Awesome views!! and the cable car ride up slowly spins so you can get the full 360 degree view. Once on top, the weather can change in an instant. In the 90 mins we spent there, it went from clear, to cloudy and misty, back to clear again. So dont be discouraged if it looks a little cloudy from the ground.

Great hike!. Dont take the cable cart! if you are in an acceptable fysical condition, consider the walk up (1 1/2 hrs steap climb up).Its worth the effort! the park on top is beautiful and the views spectacular. Very cool to see how the indian and atlantic oceans meet. (they have different colours)
A long hike. We hiked the diagonal trail to the top. The trail disappears at times. It took 4.5 hours. There are easier trails.

Cable Car to the clouds. We loved this attraction and the views were spectacular. Taking the cable car up to the summit was a fun ride and felt like we were rising into the clouds. The low hanging clouds drifted away before we got there and gave us a great view of Cape Town.
Amazing view. Cable car ride quick and fast clear 360 views easy access on the mountain for all abilities Young and old.

Amazing Experience. The Table Top Mountain is one of the Must-see destinations in Cape Town. Just a 15 minute taxi drive from the heart of the city, this is a prominent landmark in the entire South Africa. There is a cable car service from the base of the mountain to the top. The ride itself is a memorable experience, and the view from the top of the mountain is just awesome. Though it is a mountain, once we reach the top on the cable car, its almost like a flat land with large stones and plants where we can trek at our leisure. The view of the distant mountains, the oceans and the harbour is just amazing. There is a restaurant and a beautiful souvneir shop on top. Before planning a trip to the Table Top Mountain, check the local weather, since the cable car service will be shut down during windy and foggy climates.
a must see. you can take the hop on hop off bus *red line that will bring you to the cable car .AWESOME viewchoose a day with NO CLOUDS

NEEDS IMPROVEMENT. They should manage the crowd in a better manner. Queuing system is much confusing. Crew adds further to the confusion.Ride was comfortable, but pre & post ride inconvenience prevails

Walk up Table Mountain - but only if you are fit. This was my third walk up Table Mountain, via Platteklip Gorge. Trust me, it is hard work but incredibly rewarding. There is amazing camaraderie amongst the walkers, with everyone offering encouragement along the way, letting the faster walkers go ahead (this did not happen on Lions Head).Once at the top, the views are truly extraordinary, unless it is cloudy, then there are no views!!If you are able, you must do this walk. Breathtaking (in more ways than one).

Worth The Hype! Great Views!. With very good roads, where we cycled, a lot of look out points and finally the famed Cape Of Good Hope and Cape Point! The picnic areas and facilities are very good. There is a fair amount of walking to do at both places but Cape Point has a cable train that takes you uphill. Lovely views, a must visit when in Cape Town!

Bring warm coat !!. This is a must see of course: but beware !!Everything is well organised but don't forget : you are climbing up a mountain.Those nice white clouds you see rolling over the mountaintop are pretty (icy) cold once you are up there.So if you think it is nice weather down there (in town) , don't be surprised about a huge temperature drop once you get up there.And in that 'cold case' you don't get a lot of nice pictures because they can send you down back again and then you are really stuck if you did not prepare for the cold.But anyway ... if you can stand the cold ... go up there: because it is still ... Table Mountain and the sights are great !!
Gotta Go!. The views of the cape are astounding, we saw dassies (the indigenous mink-like creatures who live up there), took masses of photos.... it's a must-do.
new7wonder. fantastic views. have a drink at the bar right on the edge. good for abseiling too. queues are very long though.

Beer at 3k Feet. We took the cable car to the summit of Table Mountain and walked around, marveling at how quickly the clouds moved in. It's by far not the highest mountain summit I've visited, but it was beautiful, the weather was wonderful, and the views of Cape Town were amazing (when you could see through the clouds). Get there early before the "table cloth" goes on ;-) We didn't repel down the mountain, but apparently it's a fun option and takes only ten minutes to do. There's a little cafe at the top with food and drinks, including Castle beer on tap. We couldn't resist.
Great views!. not to be missed! great views and fantastic infrastructure. It is easy to get there, although parking is difficult. Everything else works perfectly.

Table Mountain is tops. i have been here a couple of times - but you never tire of the view - and most recently the authorities have increased seating and boardwalk areas so you can venture quite a distance from the cablestation at the top....improved cafe and comfort facilities make it a better place than ever - and fully deserves its 7th natural wonder of the world title
Great experience. Well worth the trip the cable car ride is a great experience the view is wonderful a bit chilly but warmer than the UK. Unusual animals to see go there.

Amazing. Very imprresing view a must see. They built an coffee and a gift shop at the very top which was reaosnably priced .The cable train is nice and safe . The area kept very well mainted and clean South Africans are so respectful to mothre nature both the plants and animals .
Mountains of heaven. Great view from the mountain top! People who were there really were very friendly and one of them sang me a Indian song which was fantastic

D Main attraction of Cape Town - Table Mountain National Park. Beautiful... Table Mountain National Park is a must-visit for anyone in Cape Town, local or international. This natural world heritage site, and Natural New 7 Wonder of the World, is a haven of magnificent mountains plunging into crystal seas fringed with bleached white sands of the Cape Peninsula. The mountain chain stretches from Signal Hill in the north, to Cape Point in the South.From open access hikes and beautiful forest walks to picnic and day-visit spots to secluded picturesque accommodation facilities throughout the park, there is plenty to do, see and experience.You should always take a map on any of the hikes in the park.There are designated areas for dog walking, mountain biking, rock climbing, hang-gliding and paragliding, picnicking and fishing.

Table Mountain at sunset. We took the cable car up after 6pm and my oh my, WHAT A VIEW!The part of the park we saw is amazingly beautiful! The panoramic views at sunset is something no words can describe! Looking forward to hiking up and spending some more time in the park!
don't miss this place during your vist!. go beyond the trails and find more amazing views and nature refresh your body fit by jumbing and walking between rocks
An Excellent Experience. One must not miss this if in Cape Town. It is an excellent experience. Restaurant is good , but choices are a bit restricted.

awesome view, and photo Op. The place is well put together as a tourist attraction, great services up there, I like the Dassies they are relayed to the elephants and are easy to spot, they are known as Rock Hyrax
Exciting. Great views,. Go early to avoid the queues and make sure the weather is such that you have clear views.

the must do in capetown. The weather needs to be good and clear but if it is any traveller to capetown should not miss this experience. Unfortunately we visited as part of a tour so had limited time on the mountain but you could easily spend the day there with a wide range of trails and walks on the top. Views are spectacular.

2+ hour hike. There are NO lions and it gets hotter as the morning progresses.
The trail head up is at the bottom lift station at the SOUTH end of the bus parking area.

Beautiful, Scenic and a MUST do in CT. We enjoyed our cable car ride up Table Mountain. It is quite a steep ride and will make those afraid of heights feel scared briefly on the way up and down.The lines can be very long, especially on weekends.
