The cable car opens at 8am and I would recommend trying to get there a bit before to avoid the lines. Also remember it can be extremely windy on the top and several degrees cooler than on the ground. I believe if you go up for sunset (after 5pm) you can get a 1/2 price ticket... we saw that advertised. The last car down departs at 7pm (I think), so it would give you plenty of time at the top.There are also free scheduled guide group tours at the top, we didnt do one but it is on offer.
Sunset Splendour. Watch the sunrise over Camps Bay - any day of the week - only pay 50% for the Cale Car trip - excellent value and unbeatable views!
Well worth the wait. The mountain had been closed for three days prior to our visit so we expected a wait.Really clean area and well worth the visit.
Amazing views. Luckily we had a guide who know the times and tricks to get up quickly. If you're not careful you may have to park at least a mile away and then wait in line for two hours!
Fantastic views!. The cable car which takes you up the mountain rotates 360 degrees so everyone gets lovely views. Sunset trips are nicer since the crowds are less and the tickets are 50% cheaper!

Beautiful View of Cape Town. The iconic Table Mountain tram was fun to ride. The floor of the tram rotates during transit to allow everyone window access for pictures. The views from the top were exceptional. Hiking trails are available. Please note: if the wind picks up the tram can be closed down and that would require a hike back down to the base

Great Views!. You need to be lucky with the weather and make sure that there are no clouds on the mountain before yo go up, but once you do, it is definitely worth the ride! AMAZING views towards beautiful Cape Town!

Spectacular. Incredible scenery if the weather plays its part. Worth a trip if you are in Cape Town as the views are unforgettable. Bring a warm jumper as it can get really cool. Good quality camera is a must!
Go up if you can. This is a highlight but when we went up it was foggy so that ruined our view but it was still okay. It was so cloudy that it rained but still we made it there

Spectacular spot, decent food too, good local choices. Lunch in the restaurant on Table Mountain - for a busy food outlet it is actually pretty good. The ostrich stew with curried rice made a very good lunch that has considerable local flavour. And for setting - even on a misty day - it takes some beating. Well done to them for not making it just another average meal like any other. Table Mountain is as amazing as it appears to be - great cable car ride up; fabulous flora and wildlife on the top. A must-see place if in SA. In addition the park is vast, and so much more to see around the Cape.

The reason why you need to visit Cape Town!. It's the best view over Cape Town. It's one of the new 7 natural wonders of the world, and when you are on top of the mountain you really get this wonderful feeling. You have a great view over Cape Town, but you also can see Robben Island, Camps Bay and much more. If you have the possibility try to go with one of the free guides, they can tell you so much more about the vegetation, the views, ...You can't visit Cape Town without going to the top of Table Mountain. If necessary reschedule all your plans and go to the mountain the moment it's possible because the weather changes quite often and quite fast!
Back to Front. Taking the backside route, starting at the botanical gardens and finishing at the cable car down, was a perfect way to explore the mountain. Highly recommend this route.

Great views. Took the cable car up to Table Mountain. Up there you have some great views over the city and the surrounding area. The walkways and view points are well maintained. A little cafe offers some good coffee. Only negative is that you are routed through a tourist shop after taking the cable car down again.

Gotta Do It.. Yes, it's classic touristy. But worth it. Spend 20 min or 2 hrs at the top. If your first day in CT shows clear skies over Table Mtn, GRAB THE CHANCE. Table has a tendency to close unpredictably due to fog which they call the "table cloth."

Take the first chance you have to go, it's often closed!. We arrived early in the morning on a perfect day, glorious weather and our hotel was very close to the mountain so we chose to go there in the afternoon, it was very lucky we did because the wind that Capetown is famous for got up later in the afternoon and the cable car was closed for new customers, we had a lovely couple of hours enjoying spectacular views go each side of the peninsula, plus watching clouds rolling in over the mountain top. Table Mountain is why Cape town was settled in the first place, it creates a microclimate and you can't go anywhere in the town without being aware of it. Every visitor must go, bit be warned, it closes frequently and that when it has been closed for a few days it means queues can be rather long, up to two hours Apparantly, we were lucky, we just walked straight on to the cable car. A must see destination for every visitor, the views are breathtaking.

Magnificent views.. Oh Table mountain, all I have is adoration for you. Hiking this was pure joy and no wonder CT is my fave place on earth. Having traveled to over 200 cities, none compares to you CT. This place is so amazing words cannot articulate, that is all I have to say!
Beautiful!. If u lucky to have a day with no fog, just go! U won´t regret the views... It´s just super beautiful! The only bad thing is the huge line... but it´s worth it! Go!
Amazing view in all directions. The cable car looks a bit scary, since the mountain is so high.But do not worry, the cable car brings you to the top smooth and safe!
Excellent. Just brilliant views are amazing go on a clear day don't rush spend time great location for photos see all over Cape Town
Great views of Cape Town. Excellent vista, but the restaurant is a little cramped. Make sure and bring a coat with you because it can get quite chilly!

Great views and nature-spotting. Great views of the city and around (when it was clear!). We stayed a few hours and were warm enough in November wearing light trousers and short-sleeve shirts (though it cooled significantly when the cloud rolled in).

beautiful view and great free guided tour at the top. It was a beautiful visit on a gorgeous day. One frustration is we seemed to have arrived at a just the peak queue time and waited quite a while in the hot sun until we got to the top of the mountain. Once there, we noticed there was almost no queue to get back down. But when we were ready to go back, once again there was a long queue though it went more quickly. Lesson go early or go late not around 10am. Also when there's a line to go up, it gets chaotic - they haven't figured out the logistics of timing the delivery of people in the lift so suddenly there are more people than can fit on the platform and the people coming out of the ariel cableway the same direction we were going in. It seemed unnecessarily chaotic. If you time it right, you'll avoid the transport chaos and just enjoy the view. I recommend the free tour at the top - start every 30 minutes and last about 20-30 minutes. Well informed and friendly guides with a sense of humor.

Between a rock and a hard place. Walk up (+\- 1.75 hrs) or take the cableway, it remains a top attraction, a must-do on any visitor's list. Go on the first available non-windy day and revel in the bird's eye view of Cape Town and surrounds. Read all the plaques around the walkway and you'll learn some history and geography too!
Awesome !!!. The views from the top of the mountain are absolutely breathtaking! This is an activity than must not be missed if you're in Cape Town. Stunning!!!
Windy.... Bring a jacket and hang on. The views from the top are spectacular. You need patience to wait for the cable car. Don't go on a weekend.

The view is awe inspiring!. This is a must see in SA. Nothing more to say..just go. The cable car is an experience and the table like mountain? The high winds can be a challenge cos it might be calm on the lowlands but as soon as you get to the base of the mountain and see the clouds hovering, it might mean no climb, which can be a bummer...

lovely. wawoooo i dont even know where to start to explain about the table mountain but i guess i'm gonna start from the beginning.table mountain is one of the seven wonders of the world and being one of it,yes it deserves it. you can go to the top using the cable car or walk

Sunsets are unbelievable. We went up on a clear evening to see the sunset. What a magnificent view of the city, mountain and sunset. The cable car ride up is very impressive. 4 minutes to the top and going up a sheer rock wall the view is awesome! Once at the top the pathways lead you across the top to have great views. This evening the view was very clear and fantastic. We were in total awe as the sun set. There is a restaurant at the top. We enjoyed the buffet and a slice of pizza. Chicken sausage and cheese. ( buffet had ostrich stew that was out of this world). This is a definitely a must see experience.

spectacular sunset!. It needs to be on everyones bucket list to look over the stone walls at the ocean and the city of Capetown--and you must go when the weather is right-drop everything and do it before the wind changes!!

fantastic 360 degree views. Rode the tram to the top and spent about 3 hours hiking the rim trails and taking pictures. Would have like to hike back down but didn't have enough time. Still had a great time.

A ROOM WITH A VIEW. What to say after at least 20 visits? Just go see its just like the books say. Only one thing though - expect it to be busy and don't get upset if the cloud is down. Tomorrow's another day.

The Place Where The Clouds Gather. This is truly a wonder of the world that has been preserved from the time of the Original Inhabitants, the KhoiSan, presence 2500 years ago to today. This location just begs for a digital camera. Roll film cameras would have to be refilled with fresh fil every few minutes. There is just too many things to photograph. The faun and flora as well as tHe vistas across Table Bay are beautiful. Coming up by cable car presents some pretty unique photo opportunities and is well worth the expense.The restaurant provides some light refreshments but if you wanted a substantial meal, rather go to one of the fifty odd great local restaurants (check your TripAdvisor for details).

A must. We went there in the morning, and the lines to the cable cars were quite long, so keep that in mind. However, it's worth the waiting and queuing, as it's an experience to have been there. The ride to the top, the views and nature walks are spectacular. On the top you can find a cafe/restaurant, shops etc. but above all a nature experience and fabulous views over Cape Town. There's also a free guided tour every hour, which is to recommend. Remember to tip your tour guide. Note: the cable cars can be closed, or be closed in the middle of the day, due to weather conditions such as wind or visibility (the "table cloth" of clouds) so check the status on their website before you go. They also have a half price special if you want to go up after 6 p.m. and view the sunset. You can walk up the hill as well but that's a real hike.
touch the sky. cablecar ride, walk down the mountain, the Dassie away from hustle and bustle of the city and meditate looking over cape town

Table Mountain. The ride up the mountain was breath taking especially the cable car doing the 360 degree view. You'd be amazed with how much walking you can cover up once on top of the mountain. Being peak period we bought our tickets on line so avoid the long queues in the sweltering heat

Cable Cart bday celebrations. They had a special on and we just had to make use of it. They have a tour guide on the cable cart, and the ride is just awesome, providing 360deg views as you approach the top of the mountain. Always well worth a visit!

A remarkable piece of nature. The Table mountain national park is a great piece of nature and a truly stunning place. Its definitely a place you have to visit in the morning in cape town because in the afternoon the table cloth gets over it and you dont have a good view anymore. I recommend walking up the mountain on the first path behind the table car as it only will take an hour to get up and it feels great

Stunning!. Bought our tickets online and went early to avoid the lines!! Caught the first cable car up the mountain and spent a couple of hours there taking in the beautiful scenery. Cute cafe for snacks/ refreshments at the top as well!

Super day out. If you are lucky you might spot baboons on your trip through the park down to the Cape. Just don't feed them! You may also spot zebras and eland. Take the opportunity to turn of onto the small roads that will take you down to some wonderful beaches and scenery. If the sun shines the sea colour is awesome.

Top of the World!. This was a lifetime experience, helped by the fact that the weather and visibility were excellent and we saved a lot of time by booking online, which allowed us to bypass the booking office queue.The cable car ride provided some breathtaking views. On the mountain the scenery, trails, plants and wildlife were all most interesting. Snacks and drink were fine and facilities clean.Watch out for the Redwing Starlings which will swoop from behind and snatch food from your hand or plate without warning.A great half day.

Marvelous views. Get there very early as the queues start early. Lift takes you up and returns you. Once on the top wonderful views and excellent place to take your photographs. All you need is a nice clear day.
eh. i didnt think it was worth the wait in line. we waited 2 hours to spend 15 minutes there. If you are gonna go, go early and in the morning

Stunning . You can take the Cable car or you can do as my crazy friends did and hike up the mountain(not advised). Once up on the top observable area, the fog is very amazing and when it lifts the view is remarkable! It is a must see for cape town visitors.
great Facility. I loved it all. The restaurant has great things too. I loved the shopping and curios available. It was so nice.I loved it so much. Everyone so nice and many cute guys.

Great Views!. Excellent views of Cape Town from Table Mountain. There are signposts so you won't get lost roaming around the park. They have a cafe with an extensive selection of food. If it's not too windy or cold you can eat outside. Going up to Table Mountain is a fun thing to do!

Super place to visit!. Really enjoyed our morning visit to table mountain! My daughters loved going up in the cable car and we loved the views on the way up and at the top! Got a view things from the shop at the top which was all well priced and a good selection and had a coffee in the cafe which had lots of choice! Very enjoyable!!

Pre - book your ticket.. You can book tickets online for am. or pm. visits but apparently use them whenever you like. As soon as the mountain clears a queue forms and you could wait ages. My advice is to go as soon as the weather allows because so many people wait only to find their trip is over and they have not made it up the mountain ( it does spend a lot of its time in cloud) The views are great, its a must do in Cape Town.

Must visit!. We were very lucky that we made to Table Mountain. It's strong wind and rainy day and the cable car been closed. We got there when the cable car just opened!!This place has amazing view. My girl was so excited to be up on the mountain gone through the mist/fog.Be there to see cute dassies and interesting plants!

Fab. Stunning views and the cable car operation is very well organised. Unfortunately weather had closed the mountain the previous day so it was very busy when we went and we had a 2 hour wait for the cable car but worth the wait. The paths on top are clear and easy to follow and the views are stunning!
beautiful. ufortunately the cable car was closed for maintenance but we still had a wonderful time. the view of the mountain was worth the trip down there.

Superb views. The must do when you are in Cape Town. The only thing to watch is the weather. If it is clear - don't delay get up there. If you are going in the morning, get there for 7.45, and book your tickets on line in advance.

Simply amazing. We cheated and got the cable car to the top.......blame the jet lag!
Table Mountain is a must do - even for my partner who is scared of heights!
Breathtaking scenery, a nice little café, obligatory gift shop and lovely short walks around the top.
Waw. This is a really special place in Cape Tow. Amazing view. You have to know if there is ok before going. There are many days you can't see because of the fog.

Breathtaking. Arrived here promptly at 8 AM on a Monday only to find out that the cableway was closed due to Gale Force winds. Not having any other plans that day, we decided to hike it up. The views at the top of the mountain are some of the best I've ever seen. And with the cableway not operating, we were virtually the only ones up there, which made it all the more special. My only critique would be that I wish they would put some vending machines up there, since the cafeteria closes with the cableway.

These boots are made for walking.... We loved hiking up and down Tablemountain. If you're there don't forget to take the walk. It's a great way to loose the weight you put on in all the fine restaurants in Cape Town

A true wonder. You think what can be so spectacular or wonderful but when you get on top it is just the most amazing experience. The views from up there. We were fortunate that it was a clear day with not much haze. You could actually see down to Cape Point. Highly recommend.

Amazing View!. What a view! You can truly see all of Capetown from up here. There are these adorable little animals at the top and you could walk around for hours and just take in everything around you. The coast and mountains are an amazing sight. This is a must see if you are in Capetown.

Cannot be missed.. Spectacular views. Cannot visit cape town without a visit to table mountain. Avoid 1st queue by prebooking tickets. And make sure you do a walk at the top. Devils peak worth the 1hr return trip.
Beautiful!. The park is mostly bushes and rocks, but the views are stunning! The Abseil Africa experience is also fantastic!
A Must See. The view from the top is amazing. No matter which side of the mountain you look down from you feel like you can see until the end of the earth. The ride up is also amazing.
Wonderful views. Rotating cable car is a new one for us! Wonderful views from the top and lovely birds. Look out for the small dassies (like giant guinea pigs)

We hiked (climbed?) to the top - difficult but worth it. We didn't take the cable car but hiked/trekked/climbed the Plattenklip Gorge to the top of the mountain. It was hot (22-25 C) with little winds. It took us 2.5 hours and it was quite an effort to get to the top. Do bring plenty of water, good shoes and a windbreaker as it gets REALLY windy at the top. Most of the time you'll be climbing the rocks that are in fact a very long series of stairs. You won't be doing at lot of actual walking.The view gets better as you get up and we also encountered a few springboks that were looking at us from the near vertical cliff sides. We took the cable car down.We were done for at the end but happy we did it, although we probably won't do it again ;)

Must do this if in cape town !. Its worth it just for the view, Try climb up it if you can it is hard so I suggest anyone with no fitness to just take the cart but it is totally worth it once you make it to the top either walking or the cable cart because the view is awesome !
This is fantastic. When you get to the top you can see all over Cape Town and for miles around. Wonderful. Don't go up there if you dislike heights.

Pick a good day. Unfortunately it was misty when we arrived at the summit so could not take full advantage of the area and facilities, We were fortunate to spot some "Dassies" which inhabit the rocky terrain and managed to explore part of the park which we can only assume would have been beautiful had we seen it in all its splendour. We were informed that the clouds could lift as the weather changes dramatically, but time was not on our side..

Worth the wait in the queue. Well worth the wait in the queue. Stunning. Wear something warm as it can be very cold. Watch out for the weather as it can change very quickly. We were all geared up for it I.e. Wet weather gear but it changed so quickly that we got soaked and it got pretty slippery under foot and visibility got very low so struggled to get back to the cable car. Views are out of this world

Fabulous view point of Capetown. Make sure you only go up in good weather when there is a claer view. Otherwise there is no pint in going up.The view is breathtaking and well worth the trip. I walked up the mountain and took the cable car down.

Everything the hype says it is and more. 360 views of mountain, sea and city, beautifiul fynboss (unique flowering plants of South Africa) everywhere, rugged landscape which is still very pretty and the cable ride up and the restaurant there all add to the amazing charm. Dont miss if you can, but make sure weather is right.
Must be preserved as it is. Covers a large area, not just the mountain itself. Try doing some of the walks around teh park and take in the wilder side of the area.

Table Mt.. The view was wonderful. In the evening it gets pretty cold and windy, take a heavy jacket. My family and took the evening trip, using the Big Red hop on and off bus. The guide was wonderful and we stop near the mountain top to take photos of the breath taking sunset along with a snack and restroom break.

Breathtaking. Absolutely breathtaking views. Especially of the Cape Point side. Gorgeous view of oceans and mountains. A must see. Shops & food & drinks on site. You can take the cable cars or hike it if you're in tip top shape. A must see.

Amazing views. It can be a bit of a wait to get to the top of this iconic mountain, and then you might get poor visibility but don't worry it is worth it and the clouds move on quickly. There is a good shop and cafe at the top, but the views are what you are there for and you will not be disappointed.

What a View!. Fantastic views, a must! If the Cable Car is open, go for it and go early as the queues can be large when the coach parties arrive. If you're only in Cape Town for a few days, be aware the that Cable Car service can close due to wind conditions on top (even on clear days). Recommend checking the web site before setting off. The walks on top offer a variety from 15mins duration to long hikes. Best footwear to use are trainers or hiking shoes. Always take a coat or fleece as the temperature can be very different from down below! The Cafe on top is excellent and very, very good value.
Great. No need to add much to the many good reviews. As long as the weather is ok it is must do when visiting cape town. Spectacular experience

Great if you are lucky with weather. Cape town is known for unpredictable rains. Table mountain could be covered with clouds any day so it is nice to be in the town for 3-4 days so you get at least one good day to visit this nice view point. You could take a red line hop on hop off bus to the base station and rope way to the top. There is a nice restaurant at the top. Give yourself a minimum 3-4 hours at the top to enjoy all the views.

Absolutely fantastic. We went up after 6pm to watch the sun rise, which also meant the fare was half price which was a bonus. The view is spectacular. We went in the evening as the view cannot be guaranteed in the mornings and we didn't want to miss it. Fortunately we did as the next morning was overcast. A definite must do in Cape Town.

DON'T FORGET YOUR HAT!. The cable car ride up to the top and down again is excellent. Once up there we took a short walk/scramble to various view points and saw a variety of shrubs, plants and wildlife. The visitor centre is good. We have been up to the top on two visits to Cape Town and would include this excursion again if we ever return.
Awesome mountain range. Try to visit on a day with less wind. The cable car to the top was closed on the say we visited due to high winds.

Table Mountain. Our Table mountain trip was brilliant. We queued for approx 30 mins for our tickets and the cable car. This can be much longer so book your tickets in advance if possible, weather permitting. The city hop on hop off bus stops at Table Mountain, so could be a useful means of getting there and back. We took a taxi from our hotel. The views are amazing and there are lots of information points. Make sure to take something warm to wear as it is very windy and can be very cold even when the weather is good in the bay. I would highly recommend visiting.

Try the pipeline walk!. My boyfriend and I did the 4.5 hour pipeline walk up to the top of the mountain. Quite easily one of the most beautiful experiences of my life so far! We were lucky as not many people were around that day, so it felt as if we had the entire mountain to ourselves (until we got to the top, of course). The scenery is out of this world, and you're sure to spot a few creatures (lizards etc) along the way. Make sure you take plenty of water with you. We took 4 litres which only just lasted us.Scenes from the top of the mountain (near the cableway) are also very beautiful, but nowhere near as amazing as those we saw along the walk.

Not surprised that it is a world wonder. From the top of the mountain you feel that you are on the top of the world. Then back to reality in minutes. Walked up the trail and came down in the cable car. The restaurant is nothing to write home about but for a cup of coffee it will have to do .

Some of the best hiking in the world. HIKE AGAIN: Yes! Table Mountain hikes rank up there with Yosemite, Dipsea and other trails on Mt. Tamalpais and Routeburn Track in New Zealand. Having the mountains and ocean together just can't be better. Go up Skelton Gorge and down Nursery Ravine - just wonderful! And, up Kasteelpoort to Echo Valley to Maclean's beacon and down the Cableway is equally wonderful.
Beautiful. Very well conserved and wonderful facilities. Being a historical site it is a must be seen by all visiting Cape Town

The Tamed and the Wild. When I heard, it's just a short hike to Table Top, I was confident of running it up and down, without any issues.But, it wasnt so. The short hike to table top does test you. And the weather change may get to you. Know about the weather prediction beforehand.The weather became extremely cold from pleasant on my first hike. And it was really friendly on my second time.

Stunning. Stunning views of the Cape Town and Peninsula. Would love to go back but since it was really windy then, will have to make sure next time, I take some warm clothes. But this didn't stop me from enjoying ourselves :))

What an amazing experience.. I was travelling with a friend who is South African and she took me up to Table Mountain. Wow what a view. It is amazing. Can see for miles. The Cable Car up is great too as it rotates so you get to see more. Totally loved it

A scenic must. This is no ordinary park. It is highly unusual starting with the cable ride necessary to get to the top of Table Mountain. A walk around the park area was enjoyed but cut short as the fog rolled in.

Great Views of Cape Town. The view from the top is very good. It is a must see if your visit Cape Town. From its summit you can see the harbor, Lion's head and Signal Hill. But, get there early. The lines for the cable car become longer and longer with each passing hour. We were told that at peak season, they can exceed 2 hours.

Don't go unless the weather is clear. The views from the top are breathtaking. Be prepared to walk all the walks as each has a different perspective on the Cape Town area below.
Go first thing in the morning - be there by 8 am as other wise the crowds are heavy and the wait for tickets long.
Breathtaking. Breathtaking views of Cape Town. My favorite pictures from the trip were taken here. Very beautiful, humbling and relaxing.
On clear day you see forever.. If the weather is good this is a must do. No visit to Cape Town should exclude this place. The views are MAGNIFICANT .

What a view!. The view is spectacular and shouldn't be missed! You may be above the clouds. You have a great view of the city and the ocean. We have many nice pictures of us. There are an abundance of plants and flowers, as well as birds.
Stunning. If you do nothing else in Cape Town, take the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The views are stunning with many paths to take around the top. A lovely way to spend a couple hours!!

Amazing is an understatement!. Compare this, the air I inhaled while I sky-dove was the same as I did inhale atop table mountains - it is breathtaking - and you'd be glad to see the table cloth (clouds) sitting atop one of the mountains around you - it gets very windy post 3pm so plan your day early. Must go!

Cable car ride and Ta le Mountain. Fantastic, amazing views. Restaurant at the top means your lunch break has the best view ever. Cable car ride is great, and has a 360 view as you go up or come down.
Lovely. A must visit while in Cape Town. Beautiful day spent out in nature with fantastic views. For the more adventurous, you can take a trek and hike to the peak. Wonderful experience.
Table Mountain. Would not miss the cable car ride and hiking around Table Mountain for anything. We have wonderful photos of Table Mountain from Victoria Wharf area.
Majestic and magical. The constant shifting of wind, cloud and sunlight on the water, on the rock, on your body... it was like having a glimpse at the creation of the planet.

Beautiful great place to hike.. Wish I had spend more time here. Beautiful trails atop Table Mountain. Bring a hiking stick and enjoy a three hour hike. Even if you only have an hour it is worth the views, interesting flora, and dashies. You can also use the cafe and gift shop but I didn't do those.

Climbing up all the way to Table mountain. We bought a ticket to take the cable car up , when we arrived there was a huge queue, so then decided to walk up! Not easy but very rewarding although not be done if you are not fit! They told us it was the easiest trail, but personally I thought it was pretty though...
A breathtaking experience. Loved the views from the top. Had a delicious meal in the little restaurant at the top. Got great photos. Cable car ride great. Staff great..

worth the trip. go there in a sunny day or at the sunset!
we wnet in july: put on some warm clothes, it is very cold up there :) if you want walk around for a little while!
great vew! enjoy
Not to miss!. Incredible experience. The views are unparalleled and the nature is fascinating. Worth every minute.
And Beautiful when the clouds create the. Table Cloth. That is the description when the clouds are laying on Table Mountain. Beautiful scenery.

the view!. Every time that I go up the mountain, I'm still impressed with the majestic view of Cape Town and the surrounding area.A visit to Cape Town and not going up Table mountain, is not a complete visit to Cape Town. Just a hint: if the weather's good, go up as you never know what the next day will bring...

Table Mtn Natl. Awesome, a must see in Cape Town. If you get a clear day you have a perfect vantage of the entire peninsula. Highly recommend. Be wary of bad weather, you do not want to be on the plateau if cold/raining. Bring layers.

Well worth the climb. We hiked up Table Mountain for sunset. It was an intense hike - stairs the whole way up - but it only took us 1hr 20 min (not the 2hrs on the sign) it was great to be there for sunset and we decided to take the cable car down. The cafe has to be one of the most affordable mountain top shops I've been to. Truly the highlight of my Cape Town trip!
Amazing views!. Definitely worth a trip up, the views are spectacular!! Bring some water though, it can be a bit hot up there and the bottles are pricey at the cafe on top of the mountain.

If the cable is closed, walk up. The cable car is closed quite often, even if it is slightly windy. If you can climb 200 stairs - we'd recommend walking up Table Mountain. Or even half way up. You MUST take a hat, some water and sun cream, as it does get hot.We are 43 & 55 years of age and it took us 2 hours to go half way up, traverse the bottom of the mountain and then walk back down to the cable car station. It is really well signed and has spectacular views. You'll also get to see the tame birds and the blue headed lizards.The walk up is a bit tough but people will just go past you, if you want to take it slowly. The pink & yellow flowers are gorgeous and we were really pleased that we did the walk.

A must see in Western Cape!. I enjoyed visiting the Table Mountain as well as all the other sites including Boulders Beach, Cape Point, etc.For Table Mountain, just think about being well equiped: hot cloths as weather changes fast, good shoes even if you have trails and a good camera to do great shoots. Landscape is amazing. I loved it. If not windy, it's easily accessible by cableway to enjoy breathtaking views.My only regret: I could not see the dassies when some of my fellow travelers saw them sunbathing. Next time I hope :)

A Capetown Landmark. An imposing mountain when seen from the city or from the ferry on the ocean on a clear day and an equally beautiful view of the city from its halfway point from where the aerial cable starts. Would not recommend to go to the top on a rainy or foggy day.

Wonderful experience. For those with families having toddlers and infants ... I was so worried about this experience .. But there is a walk way suitable for the strollers so no worries and stay safe away from the edges ... You will enjoy it .... Its an amazinng view

Amazing. If you are lucky enough to get a clear day the views from up here are going to really impress you at 360 degrees. The red city tour bus wil take you to the bottom of the cable car if you don't have transport and you can buy your ticket online or through the hotel to avoid the queue at the ticket office. It can be windy so adopt the onion clothing style so you can cater for all weathers and just enjoy the views.

A very enjoyable day in nature. Going up Table Mountain is always worth it no matter how many times you have done it before. The views are worth it on its own, but wear your hiking shoes and go for a walk, spectacular scenery and the Fynbos is a very unique experience. Do try and plan your visit along with the weather forecast though.

Worth the walk, or the wallet. I lucked out in mid October - reasonable winds, pleasant temperature and more importantly, no clouds. The walk/hike up is a great workout, but make sure you have good shoes, plenty of water, and pack light. The views are alone worth the trip, but there's the "I've been there" factor too.

Got to be done!. Got tickets on line through hotel and so therefore did not need to queue. Hotel organised car to take us there and so did not have to find a parking space!The views from the top are amazing and the cafe has a good selection of food and drink - something for everyone.The 20 minute walking tour is wonderful.

Great Views, worth the visit. A you would expect, the views were excellent (we had a really clear days and at one point could see Cape Point lighthouse... just). It has good paths, although to get to the furthest part from the cable car there is an interesting route which is not for the infirm of faint hearted). These is a reasonable café at the top as well.

Beautiful views of the city bowl of Cape Town. Table Mountain is a must-see while in Cape Town. The views of the city are unmatched as well as the views of the ocean and the miles of mountains. We only had an hour or so before the closing, but could have spent much more time exploring the trails. Different amazing views all along the way.
Table mountain great views. Easy to get up late afternoon without waiting and you can enjoy a stunning sunset and city views as its getting darker
Fantastic! Stunning views!. Nothing I didn't like, liked it all! Beautiful scenery, stunning views, you can see everywhere! Deeply moved to see everything from there.

More than one way up. We were hoping to hike up to the top, but the weather was not great two out of the four days we were on Cale Town. We took the gondola up, which is revolving allowing for a beautiful, unimpeded view of Cape Town. There is a wonderful, long path on top with identified flora and fauna. Definitely worth the trip!
a view from the sky. We went up on a windy day, sunny but windy. Beyond description for viewing, hiking, and enjoying nature. This is a definite must see when visiting Cape Town
Top of the world. What a view...............This is a must do for any one visiting Cape Town. Take your time pick a cloud free day, go early and have lunch on top.

top of the world. Forget about planning to the mountain. Just visit when the weather permitted. Wonderful walk and view from the top. The rotating cable car is kind of nice...enabling everyone to have different view. Bring sun block and comfortable walking shoes.

Breathtakingly beautiful. Buy tickets online a few days or a day before to avoid the long que to purchase tickets. If you do not want to spend too much on food on table mountain, rather purchase your snacks and take this with you.

Wow beautiful views. The cable car ride up was beautiful, traffic up to the cable cars was horrible. If you have an excursion with table mountain included it could limit the rest of your site seeing tour.

Magical & great views. Make sure you bring your walking shoes! Great views & lots of land to explore, just remember to get back down before the clouds roll in, so you can see the mountains famous table cloth, worth it indeed!
Views from the top are amazing. Skip the chairlift queue and climb up Platteklip gorge. Its a tough hike, but well worth it. The views from the top are some of the best in the world
Table mountain. I liked everything in table mountain, I can visit the place any time, and I can recommend people to visit the place.

Nice visit to Table Mountain. A must do in Capetown. Pick a clear day to get a good view of Capetown and V&A Waterfront. Liked the cable car ride up the mountain. It is easy to drive here from city centre Cape Town

breathtaking scenery. A little crowded getting up the mountain as it had been closed for 3 days before, but worth it as the views were extraordinary. Glad we did it as I was debating if it would be worth it.

Wonderful. Absolutely beautiful, take the lift and take a video camera, you will not regret this. You have great sights to see including Robin island. Best advice is take the bus tour from the clock tower in the water front or at a stop near your hotel and hop on and off at all the major landmarks. Well worth the cost and cheaper than a taxi taking you to table mountain. An open bus in beautiful weather.

The Hike was Amazing!. Table Mountain is beautiful and its prominence in Cape Town is just begging you to go up. The best part is that it's free if you hike!We hiked up Table Mountain via the Platteklip Gorge trail. This is a tough trail that goes straight up via the most direct route. It will take 3 hours if you are not in good shape, 2 hours if you are in ok shape, and a little more than an hour if you are in great shape and hike a lot. The views were stunning all the way up and at the top. We were lucky that it was a clear day with no fog. At the top you can do more hikes (we did the ~40 minute flat hike to Maclear's Beacon) and read several educational signs about the Mountain and its history. The trail is well marked and easy to follow. The trail head is well signed and at a small house about a 1-2 min drive beyond the lower cable car station. There is some parking at the trail head or you can park along side the road before it. You can also pay to take the cable car down if you don't feel like hiking back down (if it's open - closes sometimes due to wind).

Too busy. I arrived early morning during the week and it was packed! Like an invasion just happened. More than 10 buses parked as well as cars all the way down the road towards the main road for hundreds of meters. It was too busy to give it a decent visit so I left. So sad.
A must see.. It's iconic and the views on a clear day are outstanding. The cable car trip is wonderful and make sure you stand near the window.
Good views. It was okay.very windy..will come again...but not now..I prefer peters house..thank you. I love the chocolate at peters

Great Photo Stop. Unbelievable views from the cable car to the top of Table Mountain. The views from 360 degrees are spectacular from the city of Cape Town to the harbor to the mountains. Worth every minute on the mountain.

Stunning Views. We hiked up Platteklip Gorge, around a 2 hour hike if you are reasonably fit. Please be aware that this is more of a climb than hike so don't attempt if you are not very mobile. Please also make sure that the weather is good for that day, the weather comes in extremely fast which makes this climb very dangerous. Unfortunately this is reflected in the number of deaths of ill prepared tourists. Weather, water, sun protection, hat, wind breaker and proper hiking/walking boots. Highly recommend for the stunning views.
A must see. A place like no other, Table Mountain National Park cannot be missed when visiting beautiful Cape Town

A beautiful view - worth the long lines at the cable car. The view and the mountain are very nice.
The restaurant on the top of the mountain is one big tourist trip - to be avoided!

On Top of the World. Be sure to take the tram to the top of Table Mountain! You may want to watch the weather so that you go on a day that is clear. The views of the city and ocean are amazing! Keep in mind that it is very windy and often chilly on the top - dress accordingly!
Talk about a view!!!. Spend the day and enjoy the beauty this place has to offer. It's amazing to be so far up and you can see the beauty of Cape Town from this very spot.

Weather dependent. Check out the weather condition before you hit the ride up the acclaimed Table Mountain. The weather really change by the hour, and it can get chilly up there.
You can get tickets either online (prepaid, save a little), or on the spot. Overall a really nice place to visit in good weather.
More information can be found here: http://www.tablemountain.net/
Great experience. Loved the views... Disliked the waiting for cable car.. But worth it as the view at the top was incredible
Amazing, but expensive. An absolutely incredible place, but priced for tourists, rather than locals. Still, worth shelling out for just to experience it.

Tranquility. All the parks are quiet and tranquil. So if you need quiet time, visit one of them.
The Table Mountain National Park boasts a variety of fynbos species and the view is breath-taking!

Cape Town's favourite mountain. There are so many routes to climb Table Mountain. Platteklip, from Constantia Nek, Skeleton Gorge, from Therese Avenue in Camps Bay to only name a few. The views are fantastic.

Wow, what a beautiful place. I luckily scored a beautiful clear day for my visit with great views in every direction. The cable car ride was great and by getting there reasonably early (thanks to a knowledgeable guide) we only had to queue for about 10 minutes. The vegetation was very interesting and quite a few native species were in flower. There were also some cute furry animals I am yet to identify. I walked for over an hour and could have stayed longer, tour permitting, especially as food and drink is available at the top.
Wonderful Trip. Outstanding Views on a clear day, one of the highlights of my month in Africa. Get there early to beat the queues and to be able to spend more time at the top.

Spectacular Table Mountain. The Table Mountain is almost synonymous to Cape Town, and we had some high expectation about it when we visited this September. The cable car ride to the top of the Table Mountain was interesting with a circular viewing window that rotates as the cable car rises thereby giving a good view to everyone in the cable car. But unless one has been warned or made aware that one should not hold on to the side of the cable car, one could get pulled over as the circular window revolves. The view from the Table Mountain is certainly breathtaking overlooking the city of Cape Town, the Signal Hill, and the Devil's peak. The panoramic view is what one would expect from such a good vantage point. However, the other side of the mountain does not have much to show ro visitors doing the short tour on top of the Table Top Mountain. There is a nice restaurant on the top where one can sip coffee or tea and get some respite from the wind (which could be cold at times). Bring a jacket or a warm sweater.

Well worth a visit to one of the new '7 Wonders of Nature'. A really perfect place to walk and take photos. A lovely gift shop and restaurant. Great staff and very attentive. Check the weather before you head up there.

JUST DO IT!. I can't imagine coming to Cape Town and NOT going to Table Mountain. We took the Cable Car up. I booked the tickets on line prior to the trip just to save the time and hassle. The nice thing is if you book on line and end up not using the tickets (sometimes inclement weather closes the Cable Car), you can get a refund (there's a time line restriction on refunds so just check your travel dates). You also get a discount by booking on line. The views are amazing and the walking on top is easy. You can go around the entire top or just do a section. We were lucky when we went up as it was fairly clear but we also had the opportunity to see the clouds come over the mountain in the form of a "table cloth". We did this on our own - no tour - We took a cab to the site. There are free walking tours (we did not partake) given on top at certain times of the day also so if you're on a budget, you may want to do this tour on your own also and save the tour guides for a different excursion. Dress in layers and it the weather is clear, however you decide to do it - go! You will never forget that feeling of being on top of the world!

Table mountain. Beautiful view of Cape Town. Good food at the cafe. Nice cable ride up. Only down side was long, unorganized lines going to top of mountain. It appeared some people paid the workers/locals to cut the line.

table mountain. You must check the weather for mist and wind.Too misty you cant see anything,Too windy the cable car wont operate.Take advantage of any good weather,get the red hop on hop off bus to table mountain and then complete the tour on the bus.

Beautiful place. We rode the Funicular to the top and enjoyed the beautiful views of Cape Point. You will need a jacket -- it's very windy at the top. We saw baboons and wild ostrich. Be sure to have your picture taken at Cape of Good Hope!

May be good, if you're lucky. I can't say whether it's good, cause we've been waiting for couple days to go up, cause it's rain everyday, untill, one day we saw clear blue sky early in the morning. Nonetheless, once we're at the ticket office it's start cloudy and it was cloudy all the way to the top. When we're at the top. I would say I saw nothing, but fog. Another good thing is there's a free guide walk you around and explain you some info. A bit disspoint, but couldn't help, cause it's nature.

Breathtaking Views. We greatly enjoyed the entire experience at Table Mountain National Park. Unfortunately due to the weather we weren't able to walk up the mountain but were very impressed with the cable car ride to the top. The views were breath taking, the walk around very informative and the facilities very clean.

Take the hike if you can. This is a must do visit and if you have average fitness can do this, and then ride the cable car down. There are numerous routes to the top, and while we took the most direct one that goes straight up, we would definitely endorse doing the longer routes as well. The sights are spectacular. The top has a number of trails as well. You can take in the entire city against the ocean, and see far off to the Cape of Good Hope, North to the wine region, and Robbin Island in the distance as well. This is a popular area and if you do not do the walk, expect long lines starting mid morning for the cable car ride up. The direct route did not take long, even with a lot of sightseeing and snacks at the top--budget 3-4 hours, or more if you take the longer routes.

best thing we did!. The view at the top of the mountain was breathtaking! Try and hike up the mountain and ride the cable cars down. You must do this the first opportunity you get, the winds/weather shut down the cable cars at a moment's notice. Very much worth the hike up.

Great day. You can book and get trip free on your Birthday and partner pays full. Made it easier to afford. Greatest view on earth from luxurious Cable Car, and walk on top of the Mountain was invigorating. Will do it again as fresh air there is tops.
Beauty at its best. The best bird's eyeview of Cape Town you'll ever get. The view from up there is amazing. And you can choose to do the cable car or hike depending on your preference

Good views, but needs good weather (up there). The first thing you'll learn about Table Mountain is that the weather is very temperamental out there. It can be sunny down below, and cloudy up there. Its advisable to keep your plans flexible as to which day you should visit. That said, on a clear day, the views are gorgeous. If you like hiking, you can go up or come down via the hiking route (2-3 hours). Otherwise, you can always take the revolving cable car. Plan to stay up some 2-3 hours or more if you like walking around. Binoculars will help you see views far and near so keep one handy.Do see the map of table mountain before you visit as it will help you in identifying far off places.
Wonderful. A must see, this recent Natural Wonder of the World. You can't go to Cape Town without a visit to Table Mountain.

Great Day, Great View. As I'm sure you've read elsewhere, make sure to visit Table Mountain on a clear day and the top of the mountain isn't obscured in clouds. The day we visited was perfect. The winds at the top of the mountain were comfortable around the cable car station, but were much higher on the central/western table. That said, I would highly recommend getting away from the cable car station area and explore more of the table. There is a great circular walk around the central table as well as an extended walk to the western table. Make sure you leave yourself time to explore.
A must for your bucket list!. We had a lovely clear day which gave us one of the best views in the world! Only downside was the massive queues due to school holidays!

Breath-taking-ly BEAUTIFUL. Everything here is beautiful.... from the winding road to get the the carpark to the views at the top of the mountain. I would like to point out that if you are afraid of heights, you will deffinately not like the spinning cable cart to take you to the top, there is a path you can walk to get to the top which Im told takes a few hours. The views are stunnig! There is no fence ontop tho so remember your H&S and be careful! Its a lonnnnnng way daown! Very pictourest scenery ontop of this wonder of the world, deffinately a must see whilst in Capetown!
Great views. This is a wonderful walk overlooking Cape Town. Although from the bottom of the mountain it may look steep, it is actually very flat.
Little pricey but worth it. Little pricey but worth it, and bring sneakers if you like to hike. My flip flops didn't quite cut it
Such an amzing site. Book on the internet before you go to miss the queues, but worth the wait! Spectacular views, well preserved. The cable car is world class - such a cool feature.

Great vista points!. Great to do on a sunny day. Be aware that you may need to queue for lift tickets. On the day I visited, this did not take more than 20 minutes or so, but it is worth knowing. Once at the top, you may find yourself spending a surprising amount of time taking photos as there are so many great vista points. Best way to get an overview of Cape Town geography in a short time.
colours. Loved the colours of the sea, the fijnbos and the rocks!Nice hikes.Routes are very nice. Try to be early at Cape Point, it can be quite busy there.

Fantastic!. We were told to do this the very first time the mountain was not covered by fog and clouds, and that was brilliant advice. Of our four days in Cape Town, only the first afforded views of the city, beaches one seas below. We went early on a Monday and were also blessed with short lines for the cable car. We expected to spend 15 minutes looking around the top and then come back down, but were amazed to discover an expansive series of pathways offering spectacular views of the panorama surrounding Table Mountain, awe inspiring rock formations, and beautiful plants, mosses, and even wildlife. We happily stayed for well over an hour. One side note, it here is a cafe available but if you are vegan, don't plan to eat there.

Truly Stunning Place. We visited Table Mountain shortly after the cable car reopened in August (look up date of this on website). We had a car & parked on the road up to the cable car station: nb. you can drive up close to the cable car & drop family off to get in the queue - we would've done this had we known.The view from the cable car is stunning and don't bother rushing to grab a window looking away from the mountainside; the floor of the cable car revolves so that everyone gets the view. The park up top is vast, with plenty of places for great photos. The day we went up it was sunny; there was low cloud too but this cleared as the temperature increased. Allow a good couple of hours 'up top', to walk around and simply enjoy being up there & the stunning vistas. Cafe could do with more tills & staff but, you're on holiday, relax!Would just say that young children need to be watched up top. The health & safety is not at UK standards & you are able to wander off the footpaths to some pretty dangerous locations, so beware, but it is a fabulous experience.
Magnificent. Absolutely superb experience.The views were fantastic.Just need to check for the weather and ensure one visits on a nice sunny day to get full view.
Fantastic views. A place just not to be missed while in Cape Town. Watch out for the weather, including strong winds, as the cable car to the mountain might be closed on bad weather days.
Great views!. Loved the walk around the top. The tram was fun as it completely rotated. Beautiful city to see from the top.
Fantastic!. I would recommend a visit - the views are breathtaking.....we spent 5 hours on the Mountain. Only problem..........difficult to get up there due to high winds, weather, etc.

On top of the world. One off the bucket list and well worth the effort and wait to get on the cable car. Once on top the guided tour was informative and time spent exploring was great. Lunch in the cafe with such awesome views was great. Good selection of food and not expensive.
Fantastic. One of the 7 Wonders of the World, what more can one say, great walks, panoramic views of all of Cape Town, great food in their mountain top restaurant...

Spectacular!. A must see if you are visiting Capetown. Gorgeous views and you can get right on the edge of the mountain (for the thrill seekers out there). We saw some people abseiling too which would have been great to do but my boyfriend had just dislocated his shoulder :( another time maybe!
Take a walk to the highest point. Go on a clear day, the view is magnificent. We walked to the highest point, it takes about 45 minutes but it is a really nice trip.

Watch eternity?. amazing trip .The cable car ride just as impressive as the Table Mountain..well maintained ,everything as right as clock work.Great restaurant on top and killer climbs on top guaranteeded to spice up your quads and to give you reason not to walk again.The Wind Doctor was at his best and there were days when the Mountain was closed.A must see.The flora,the daissies. -amazing
The early bird catches the cable car. Great views from the cable car as well as at the top. Arrive early for less queuing. Park where you first see a space.

Must do. This is on the "must" list for any Cape Town traveler. We were part of a tour group so we took the cable car up and down. That was a fun experience particularly with how cloudy it was. Emerging from the clouds on either side to see the view was neat. Though I would have liked to get some hiking in here. Great views of the city from the top.
Long way up!!. Such views of Cape Town, can be cold but worth the trip and remember to take a camera!!The restaurant is good value as well but basic in terms of food

Heaven on Earth. No words can describe the feeling when you are on top. Climb up and feel it our self.They close the mountain if the weather goes a little bit bad, I am aware this is security measure, but this also means that in the unpredictable weather of Cape Town one need to wait for weekend after weekend to visit Table Mountain.

Breathtaking scenery. Loved the scenery and the breathtaking view. I heard you can prebook your tickets so try to do that to avoid the crazy queues. Be there early too to avoid disappointments. Highly recommended for nature lovers. :)
hard to miss. another not to miss and you really can't at least see the mt if you are even close to town. Just spectacular and with a cable car to the clouds.

Finally the conditions and our schedule came together!. Last morning of our week long trip the weather was perfect. Would recommend you book your tickets before you arrive up the mountain so you only have to queue for the cable car. Amazing views of the city and countryside. Fabulous. Well worth the wait.
Aerial cableway. Fantastic a definite must. If it's without clouds go immediately or you may not see it again. Go early or there are big crowds.

Fantastic. I went there by hop on-off bus in front of the CTICC. The price was 170 including the yellow and red line. It will take you to the Tablemountain tramway station. Please make sure to see the weather forecast as the tram may closed anytime during the bad condition.

Best Monday morning ever!. We visited table mountain in July and travelled up in one of the first cable cars around 9am. Travelling early would be recommended as we got a parking space really easily and there were no queues. Even the view from the parking lot is great! Cable car up is quick and feels really safe. Impressed with the moving floor which let's everyone get a great view when you are accenting the mountain. The views from the top are spectacular, easily the best thing I've ever done on a Monday morning! An absolute must do if you are in Cape Town.

Grand views. I love the fact that the floor in the cable car rotates on the way up. This is a great view from Table Mountain overlooking Cape Town and the whole tip of South Africa. The trails at the top are well constructed with good information. I disliked the fact that it was so crowded, but would definitely do it again. If you’re in Cape Town, this is a must-see.

Absolutely Worth Doing. Must go on the first sunny clear day. The clouds can roll in without notice, so whatever you do, cancel anything else and take a trip up to Table Mountain on your first good day. We only had one sunny day out of three....glad we got up there on that day.

Don't miss it!!!. The view from there is absolutely magical, it seems to be in a dream and the fog plays around and changes the view of the city so many times.. It was really cold up there tho so bring a jacket..

A stunning must-do!. The day we chose to go up the Table Mountain tramway was absolutely gorgeous and sunny. Although it was busy, they are very quick and efficient at handling crowds and within 15 minutes or so we were ascending the mountain. The views of Cape Town and the water are amazingly beautiful. We did a bit of geo-caching (like treasure hunting using GPS) and also enjoyed drinks and snacks in the very busy mountaintop cafe. Again, even though busy, they just are very organized in handling crowds. There is a well stocked souvenir/gift shop also if that's your thing and the bathrooms are immaculately kept. We took what seems like a gazillion photos and walked lots of the trails while the occasional fast moving misty fog swept over the mountain top. We saw what I believe to be marmots? and small Agama lizards too. In short, Table Mountain is well worth the visit, and to do it justice, you would want to give yourself several hours to explore there. Take a light coat or jacket even if it is nice down below. It is quite a bit cooler on top.

Spend some time trekking. I came up just for the fantastic views assuming there wouldn't be much to do at the top. I was pleasantly surprised that there's a network of footpaths that one can explore for many hours. It makes for an easy and very pleasant walk surrounded by extremely diverse nature and stunning views.

a Cape Town must. If you visit Cape Town you must include a trip up Table Mountain. Wait for a day with open skies (no clouds) and go early to cut down on some of the waiting time in the queue. You can check out the Table Mountain Facebook page on updates on if the cable cars is running on the day and how the weather conditions is up there prior to going.There is a lovely self service Restaurant on the mountain but be warned it can get very busy closer to lunch time. It also can get cold up there even in summer time so be prepared for rain/cold and also of course have your sun protection ready. All the facilities are clean and well kept.The walks is amazing and so is the fauna and flora. For the more adventurous there is a route up and down the mountain but definitely only for the more fit and experienced. These hikes can take several hours to complete with weather that can change within minutes.Hope you will enjoy it as much as we did!

We got lucky with the weather. The ONE perfect day on our trip we spent it at table mountain. The other days clouds were pouring over the peak. But it was wonderful! The view is absolutely amazing. Get advanced tickets online, get there early, and bring snacks that will hold you over enough until you can get a real meal. The restaurant at the top is horrible :( Plan for at least 25 minutes standing in line to get down, and don't lose your ticket, you'll have to buy another one for the return trip.

Stunning, as always. Our visit to Table Mountain was enhanced by a very knowledgeable guide who knows the flora, fauna and history very well. It was a superb, sunny day, unseasonably warm. The views were stunning.
A Must Activity. Although we had to wait until after lunch for the cloud to clear, when we went up the views were fantastic. Is on the Hop on Hop off bus route.
A Natural Wonder. The views of Cape Town are breathtaking. Take advantage of good weather since the cable car is often shut down due to wind or clouds.

Challenging hike, great view!. My husband and I decided to hike to the top of Table Mountain. The information that I had read beforehand said that it was a 2 hour, strenuous walk. Boy, was that accurate. It was an extremely strenuous walk as the hike is practically straight up the side of the mountain. Even though I thought I was going to die, the hike took us approximately 1 1/2 hours and I would do it again. It made the view from the top so much better. We spent about 30 minutes on top just walking around, taking pictures, and enjoying the scenery. We ended up taking the cable car down, but if you can handle it, I would certainly suggest walking down. Bring lots of water, plan on being hot on the hike up and cool once you reach the top. The nice thing is, if you hike, you get in for free!

Table mountain is Spectacular. Went to the Table Mountain in Dec 2013. I absolutely enjoyed, the view from the top of the mountain is gorgeous. There is a restaurant at the top of the mountain and it has a great menu with a variety of food to choose from. Had the time of my life UP there! Highly recommended.
